climate-change_NN (_( FCCC_NP usage_NN )_) 
A_DT change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN

climate-change_NN (_( IPCC_NP usage_NN )_) 
climate-change_NN as_RB referred_VVD to_TO in_IN the_DT observational_JJ record_NN of_IN climate_NN occurs_VVZ 
because_IN of_IN internal_JJ changes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT interaction_NN 
between_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, or_CC because_IN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN external_JJ forcing_VVG either_RB for_IN 
natural_JJ reasons_NNS or_CC because_IN of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ generally_RB not_RB possible_JJ clearly_RB 
to_TO make_VV attribution_NN between_IN these_DT causes_NNS ._SENT Projections_NNS of_IN future_JJ climate-change_NN 
reported_VVN by_IN I_NN P_NN C_NP C_NP generally_RB consider_VVP only_RB the_DT influence_NN on_IN climate_NN of_IN 
anthropogenic_JJ increases_NNS in_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC other_JJ human-related_JJ factors_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN

Equilibrium_NN climate_NN experiment_NN

and_CC the_DT model_NN is_VBZ then_RB allowed_VVN to_TO reach_VV a_DT new_JJ equilibrium_NN ._SENT Such_JJ experiments_NNS

model_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB on_IN the_DT time-dependent_JJ response_NN ._SENT

Greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
A_DT gas_NN that_WDT absorbs_VVZ radiation_NN at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN 
radiation_NN (_( infrared_JJ radiation_NN )_) emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth_NN 's_POS surface_NN and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
gas_NN in_IN turn_NN emits_VVZ infrared_JJ radiation_NN from_IN a_DT level_NN where_WRB the_DT temperature_NN is_VBZ colder_JJR 
than_IN the_DT surface_NN ._SENT The_DT net_JJ effect_NN is_VBZ a_DT local_JJ trapping_VVG of_IN part_NN of_IN the_DT absorbed_VVN energy_NN 
and_CC a_DT tendency_NN to_TO warm_VV the_DT planetary_JJ surface_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( HjO_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( COj_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N_NP 2_CD O_NN )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH^_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O_NP 3_CD )_) are_VBP the_DT 
primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth_NN 's_POS atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Ice-cap_NN A_DT dome-shaped_JJ glacier_NN usually_RB covering_VVG a_DT highland_NN near_IN a_DT water_NN divide_NN ._SENT

Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG A_DT simple_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT importance_NN of_IN a_DT potential_JJ climate-change_NN mechanism_NN ._SENT

atmosphere_NN system_NN (_( in_IN Wm^^_NP )_) following_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT 
concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN or_CC a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ;_: the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN responds_VVZ to_TO the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG so_RB as_RB to_TO re-establish_VV the_DT energy_NN balance_NN ._SENT 
A_DT positive_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_JJ tends_VVZ to_TO warm_VV the_DT surface_NN and_CC a_DT negative_JJ radiative_JJ 
forcing_JJ tends_VVZ to_TO cool_VV the_DT surface_NN ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ normally_RB quoted_VVN as_IN a_DT 
global_JJ and_CC annual_JJ mean_JJ value_NN ._SENT A_DT more_RBR precise_JJ definition_NN of_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, as_RB

global_JJ mean_JJ radiative_JJ equilibrium_NN (_( see_VV Chapter_NP 4_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 1994_CD )_) )_) ._SENT Sometimes_RB 
called_VVN "_`` climate_NN forcing_VVG "_'' ._SENT

Adaptation_NN 
Adjustment_NN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO actual_JJ 
or_CC expected_VVN climatic_JJ s_NN t_NN i_NP m_NN u_NN l_NN i_NP or_CC their_PP$ effects_NNS ,_, which_WDT moderates_NNS 
harm_NN or_CC exploits_VVZ beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN 
adaptation_NN can_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN ,_, including_VVG anticipatory_JJ and_NP 
reactive_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, private_JJ and_CC public_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, and_NP 
autonomous_JJ and_CC planned_JJ adaptation_NN :_: 
–_NP Anticipatory_NP Adaptation_NP —_NP Adaptation_NP that_WDT takes_VVZ 
place_NN before_IN impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN are_VBP observed_VVN ._SENT 
Also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB proactive_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
–_NP Autonomous_NP Adaptation_NP —_NP Adaptation_NP that_WDT does_VVZ not_RB 
constitute_VV a_DT conscious_JJ response_NN to_TO climatic_JJ stimuli_NNS 
but_CC is_VBZ triggered_VVN by_IN ecological_JJ changes_NNS in_IN natural_JJ 
s_NN y_NN stems_VVZ and_CC by_IN market_NN or_CC welfare_NN changes_NNS in_IN human_JJ 
systems_NNS ._SENT Also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB spontaneous_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
–_NP Planned_NP Adaptation_NP —_NP Adaptation_NP that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN 
a_DT deliberate_JJ policy_NN decision_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN an_DT awareness_NN 
that_DT conditions_NNS have_VHP changed_VVN or_CC are_VBP about_RB to_TO change_VV 
and_CC that_DT action_NN is_VBZ required_VVN to_TO return_VV to_TO ,_, maintain_VV ,_, or_CC 
achieve_VV a_DT desired_VVN state_NN ._SENT 
–_NP Private_NP Adaptation_NP —_NP Adaptation_NP that_WDT is_VBZ initiated_VVN and_CC 
implemented_VVN by_IN individuals_NNS ,_, households_NNS or_CC private_JJ 
companies_NNS ._SENT Private_JJ adaptation_NN is_VBZ usually_RB in_IN the_DT 
actor’s_NNS rational_JJ self-interest_NN ._SENT 
–_NP Public_NP Adaptation_NP —_NP Adaptation_NP that_WDT is_VBZ initiated_VVN and_CC 
implemented_VVN by_IN governments_NNS at_IN all_DT levels_NNS ._SENT Public_JJ 
adaptation_NN is_VBZ usually_RB directed_VVN at_IN collective_JJ needs_NNS ._SENT

after_IN impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN have_VHP been_VBN observed_VVN ._SENT

i_NP n_NN o_NN rganic_JJ material_NN ._SENT Plants_NNS are_VBP autotrophic_JJ (_( photoautotrophs_NNS )_)

Greenhouse_NN Effect_NNS

e_SYM m_NN i_NNS tted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP due_RB 
to_TO the_DT same_JJ gases_NNS ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ 
emitted_VVN to_TO all_DT sides_NNS ,_, including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP 
s_JJ u_NN rface_NNS ._SENT Thus_RB greenhouse_NN gases_NNS trap_NN heat_NN within_IN the_DT surfacetroposphere_NN 
system_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT “_JJ natural_JJ greenhouse_NN 
effect_NN ._SENT ”_JJ Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ strongly_RB coupled_VVN to_TO the_DT

troposphere_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN generally_RB decreases_VVZ with_IN height_NN ._SENT

from_IN an_DT altitude_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN on_IN average_JJ -19_CD °_SYM C_NP ,_,

the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN is_VBZ kept_VVN at_IN a_DT much_RB higher_JJR temperature_NN of_IN 
on_IN average_JJ 14_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN

the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB to_TO an_DT effective_JJ radiation_NN into_IN 
space_NN from_IN a_DT higher_JJR altitude_NN at_IN a_DT lower_JJR temperature_NN ._SENT This_DT 
causes_VVZ a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, an_DT imbalance_NN that_WDT can_MD only_RB be_VB

Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP

effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapor_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_NN

Unique_JJ and_CC Threatened_JJ Systems_NPS

range_NN but_CC can_MD affect_VV other_JJ ,_, often_RB larger_JJR entities_NNS beyond_IN their_PP$ 
range_NN ;_: narrow_JJ geographical_JJ range_NN points_NNS to_TO sensitivity_NN to_TO 
environmental_JJ variables_NNS ,_, including_VVG climate_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB 
attests_VVZ to_TO potential_JJ vulnerability_NN to_TO climate-change_NN ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP 
on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) 
The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD ,_, in_IN New_NP York_NP ,_, 
and_CC signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN 
more_JJR than_IN 150_CD countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ 
ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT “_JJ stabilization_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV 
dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN ._SENT ”_NN It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT 
Convention_NN ,_, Parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_PP aim_VVP to_TO return_VV 
g_NN r_SYM e_SYM e_NN nhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP 
Protocol_NN to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT Convention_NN 
entered_VVN in_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD See_VV also_RB Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT

Urbanization_NN

n_NN a_DT tural_JJ state_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN agriculture_NN )_) to_TO cities_NNS ;_: a_DT process_NN driven_VVN

Vulnerability_NN

a_DT system_NN is_VBZ exposed_VVN ,_, its_PP$ sensitivity_NN ,_, and_CC its_PP$ adaptive_JJ capacity_NN ._SENT 
Water_NP Consumption_NP

Water_NP Stress_NP

Annex_NP B_NP ._SENT Glossary_NN of_IN Terms_NNS

.2_CD (_( a_DT )_) of_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN

AIJ_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN to_TO allow_VV Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS

in_IN jointly_RB implemented_VVN project_NN activities_NNS ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ no_DT crediting_NN

be_VB taken_VVN on_IN the_DT future_NN of_IN AIJ_NP projects_NNS and_CC how_WRB they_PP may_MD relate_VV 
to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Mechanisms_NNS ._SENT As_IN a_DT simple_JJ form_NN of_IN tradable_JJ permits_NNS ,_,

Adaptation_NN 
Adjustment_NN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS to_TO a_DT new_JJ or_CC changing_VVG 
environment_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN to_TO climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO 
adjustment_NN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO actual_JJ 
or_CC expected_VVN climatic_JJ stimuli_NNS or_CC their_PP$ effects_NNS ,_, which_WDT moderates_NNS 
harm_NN or_CC exploits_VVZ beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN 
adaptation_NN can_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN ,_, including_VVG anticipatory_JJ and_NP 
reactive_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, private_JJ and_CC public_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, and_NP 
autonomous_JJ and_CC planned_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN assessment_NN

and_CC evaluating_VVG them_PP in_IN terms_NNS of_IN criteria_NNS such_JJ as_IN availability_NN ,_,

advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO cope_VV with_IN the_DT consequences_NNS ._SENT

of_IN a_DT Joint_NP Implementation_NP or_CC a_DT Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP 
project_NN activity_NN as_IN defined_VVN in_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP Articles_NPS on_IN Joint_NP

definition_NN may_MD be_VB further_RBR broadened_VVN to_TO include_VV financial_JJ ,_,

Aerosols_NNS 
A_DT collection_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT typical_JJ 
size_NN between_IN 0.01_CD and_CC 10_CD mm_NN that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC 
anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN two_CD 
ways_NNS :_: directly_RB through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG radiation_NN ,_, and_NP 
indirectly_RB through_IN acting_VVG as_IN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS for_IN cloud_NN 
formation_NN or_CC modifying_VVG the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN 
clouds_NNS ._SENT See_VV indirect_JJ aerosol_NN effect_NN ._SENT

IPCC_NP Third_NP Assessment_NP Report_NP

only_RB on_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS ,_, but_CC also_RB on_IN resource_NN use_NN

the_DT benefits_NNS may_MD be_VB negative_JJ ._SENT From_IN the_DT perspective_NN of_IN policies_NNS 
directed_VVN at_IN abating_VVG local_JJ air_NN pollution_NN ,_, greenhouse_NN gas_NN

these_DT relationships_NNS are_VBP not_RB considered_VVN in_IN this_DT assessment_NN ._SENT

Anthropogenic_JJ 
Resulting_VVG from_IN or_CC produced_VVN by_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ._SENT 
Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS

burning_VVG of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS for_IN energy_NN ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, and_CC land-use_NN 
changes_NNS that_WDT result_VVP in_IN net_JJ increase_NN in_IN emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Aquaculture_NN 
Breeding_VVG and_CC rearing_VVG fish_NN ,_, shellfish_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, or_CC growing_VVG plants_NNS 
for_IN food_NN in_IN special_JJ ponds_NNS ._SENT 
Aquifer_NN 
A_DT stratum_NN of_IN permeable_JJ rock_NN that_WDT bears_VVZ water_NN ._SENT An_DT unconfined_NN 
aquifer_NN is_VBZ recharged_VVN directly_RB by_IN local_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, rivers_NNS ,_, and_CC lakes_NNS ,_, 
and_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN recharge_NN will_MD be_VB influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT permeability_NN 
of_IN the_DT overlying_VVG rocks_NNS and_CC soils_NNS ._SENT A_DT confined_VVN aquifer_NN is_VBZ 
characterized_VVN by_IN an_DT overlying_VVG bed_NN that_WDT is_VBZ impermeable_JJ and_CC 
the_DT local_JJ rainfall_NN does_VVZ not_RB influence_VV the_DT aquifer_NN ._SENT 
Arid_JJ regions_NNS 
Ecosystems_NNS with_IN less_JJR than_IN 250_CD mm_NN precipitation_NN per_IN year_NN ._SENT 
Assigned_JJ amounts_NNS (_( AAs_NP )_) 
Under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN emissions_NNS that_IN/that each_DT Annex_NP B_NP country_NN has_VHZ agreed_VVN that_IN/that its_PP$ 
emissions_NNS will_MD not_RB exceed_VV in_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN (_( 2008_CD 
to_TO 2012_CD )_) is_VBZ the_DT assigned_JJ amount_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ calculated_VVN by_IN 
multiplying_VVG the_DT country’s_JJ total_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS in_IN 
by_IN five_CD (_( for_IN the_DT 5-year_JJ commitment_NN period_NN )_) and_CC then_RB by_IN 
the_DT percentage_NN it_PP agreed_VVD to_TO as_RB listed_VVN in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP (_( e.g._FW ,_, 92_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT European_NP Union_NP ,_, 93_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT USA_NP )_) ._SENT 

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS

Atmosphere_NN 
The_DT gaseous_JJ envelop_VV surrounding_VVG the_DT Earth_NN ._SENT The_DT dry_JJ atmosphere_NN 
consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG 
ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, together_RB with_IN 
a_DT number_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG 
ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN ,_, and_CC radiatively_RB active_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS such_JJ 
as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( 0.035_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC ozone_NN ._SENT 
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ water_NN vapor_NN ,_, whose_WP$ 
amount_NN is_VBZ highly_RB variable_JJ but_CC typically_RB 1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG 
ratio_NN ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN also_RB contains_VVZ clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ._SENT

Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB a_DT by-product_NN of_IN burning_NN

measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB has_VHZ a_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ of_IN 1._CD 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) fertilization_NN

atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN concentration_NN ._SENT Depending_VVG on_IN their_PP$ 
mechanism_NN of_IN photosynthesis_NN ,_, certain_JJ types_NNS of_IN plants_NNS are_VBP more_JJR 
sensitive_JJ to_TO changes_NNS in_IN atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN concentration_NN ._SENT 
In_IN particular_JJ ,_, plants_NNS that_WDT produce_VVP a_DT three-carbon_NN compound_NN (_( C3_NP )_) 
during_IN photosynthesis_NN —_NN including_VVG most_JJS trees_NNS and_CC agricultural_JJ 
crops_NNS such_JJ as_IN rice_NN ,_, wheat_NN ,_, soybeans_NNS ,_, potatoes_NNS ,_, and_CC vegetables_NNS —_NN 
generally_RB show_VV a_DT larger_JJR response_NN than_IN plants_NNS that_WDT produce_VVP a_DT 
four-carbon_NN compound_NN (_( C4_NP )_) during_IN photosynthesis_NN —_NN mainly_RB 
of_IN tropical_JJ origin_NN ,_, including_VVG grasses_NNS and_CC the_DT agriculturally_RB 
important_JJ crops_NNS maize_NN ,_, sugar_NN cane_NN ,_, millet_NN ,_, and_CC sorghum_NN ._SENT

Chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS covered_VVN under_IN the_DT 1987_CD Montreal_NP Protocol_NP 
and_CC used_VVN for_IN refrigeration_NN ,_, air_NN conditioning_NN ,_, packaging_NN ,_, 
insulation_NN ,_, solvents_NNS ,_, or_CC aerosol_NN propellants_NNS ._SENT Since_IN they_PP are_VBP not_RB 
destroyed_VVN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR atmosphere_NN ,_, CFCs_NNS drift_VVP into_IN the_DT upper_JJ 
atmosphere_NN where_WRB ,_, given_VVN suitable_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, they_PP break_VVP down_RB

including_VVG hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NNS and_CC hydrofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, 
which_WDT are_VBP greenhouse_NN gases_NNS covered_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT

in_IN Annex_NP I_NP in_IN achieving_VVG compliance_NN with_IN their_PP$ quantified_VVN

Climate_NN 
Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT “_JJ average_NN 
weather_NN ”_NN or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN 
terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT 
period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS 
of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT 
World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP (_( WMO_NP )_) ._SENT These_DT relevant_JJ 
quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, 
precipitation_NN ,_, and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, 
including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
climate-change_NN 
climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT statistically_RB significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN 
either_CC the_DT mean_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN or_CC in_IN its_PP$ variability_NN ,_, 
persisting_VVG for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN (_( typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR )_) ._SENT 
climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC 
external_JJ forcings_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN 
the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_RB 
the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN 
Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ “_JJ climate-change_NN ”_NN 
as_RB :_: “_NN a_DT change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC 
indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT 
global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN 
variability_NN observed_VVD over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ._SENT ”_NP The_NP 
UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN “_JJ climate-change_NN ”_NN 
attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
composition_NN ,_, and_CC “_JJ climate_NN variability_NN ”_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ 
causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate_NN variability_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN feedback_NN 
An_DT interaction_NN mechanism_NN between_IN processes_NNS in_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN is_VBZ called_VVN a_DT climate_NN feedback_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT initial_JJ 
process_NN triggers_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN a_DT second_JJ process_NN that_IN/that in_IN turn_NN 
influences_VVZ the_DT initial_JJ one_CD ._SENT A_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN intensifies_VVZ the_DT 
original_JJ process_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN reduces_VVZ it_PP ._SENT 

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS 
Climate_NN model_NN (_( hierarchy_NN )_) 
A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT 
physical_JJ ,_, chemical_NN ,_, and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, 
their_PP$ interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, and_CC accounting_VVG for_IN 
all_DT or_CC some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD be_VB 
represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN —_NN that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT 
one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT “_NN hierarchy_NN ”_NN 
of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT 
number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, 
chemical_NN or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, 
or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT 
Coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN /_SYM ocean_NN /_SYM sea-ice_JJ general_JJ circulation_NN models_NNS 
(_( AOGCMs_NNS )_) provide_VVP a_DT comprehensive_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT 
climate-system_NN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_NN 
models_NNS with_IN active_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS 
are_VBP applied_VVN ,_, as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN ,_, to_TO study_VV and_CC simulate_VV the_DT 
climate_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, 
seasonal_JJ ,_, and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN prediction_NN 
A_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC climate_NN forecast_NN is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT 
attempt_NN to_TO produce_VV a_DT most_RBS likely_JJ description_NN or_CC estimate_NN of_IN the_DT 
actual_JJ evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN in_IN the_DT future_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, at_IN seasonal_JJ ,_, 
interannual_JJ ,_, or_CC long-term_JJ time-scales_NNS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate_NN 
projection_NN and_CC climate_NN (_( change_NN )_) scenario_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN projection_NN 
A_DT projection_NN of_IN the_DT response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO emission_NN or_CC 
concentration_NN scenarios_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, or_CC 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenarios_NNS ,_, often_RB based_VVN upon_IN simulations_NNS by_IN 
climate_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN 
predictions_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO emphasize_VV that_IN/that climate_NN projections_NNS depend_VVP 
upon_IN the_DT emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, 
which_WDT are_VBP based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS ,_, concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_NN 
socio-economic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD 
not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ,_, and_CC are_VBP therefore_RB subject_JJ to_TO substantial_JJ uncertainty_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN scenario_NN 
A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_NN 
climate_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN an_DT internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN climatological_JJ 
relationships_NNS ,_, that_WDT has_VHZ been_VBN constructed_VVN for_IN explicit_JJ use_NN in_IN 
investigating_VVG the_DT potential_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN anthropogenic_JJ 
climate-change_NN ,_, often_RB serving_VVG as_IN input_NN to_TO impact_NN models_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN projections_NNS often_RB serve_VVP as_IN the_DT raw_JJ material_NN for_IN 
constructing_VVG climate_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, but_CC climate_NN scenarios_NNS usually_RB 
require_VV additional_JJ information_NN such_JJ as_IN about_IN the_DT observed_JJ 
current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT A_DT “_JJ climate-change_NN scenario_NN ”_NN is_VBZ the_DT difference_NN 
between_IN a_DT climate_NN scenario_NN and_CC the_DT current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
In_IN IPCC_NP assessments_NNS ,_, “_JJ equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN ”_NN refers_VVZ 
to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ (_( equivalent_NN )_) CO2_NP 
concentration_NN ._SENT More_RBR generally_RB ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN 
following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_JJ (_( °_SYM C_NP /_SYM Wm-2_NP )_) ._SENT In_RB 
practice_NN ,_, the_DT evaluation_NN of_IN the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
requires_VVZ very_RB long_JJ simulations_NNS with_IN coupled_VVN general_JJ circulation_NN 
models_NNS ._SENT The_DT “_JJ effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN ”_NN is_VBZ a_DT related_JJ measure_NN 
that_IN/that circumvents_VVZ this_DT requirement_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN 
output_NN for_IN evolving_VVG non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN 
of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD 
vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ._SENT See_VV climate_NN model_NN ._SENT 
climate-system_NN 
The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN consisting_VVG 
of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, 
the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT land_NN surface_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT 
interactions_NNS between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN 
under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN 
of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC human-induced_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN 
of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN variability_NN 
Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ 
statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, 
etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT temporal_JJ and_CC spatial_JJ scales_NNS beyond_RB 
that_DT of_IN individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO

Double_JJ dividend_NN

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS 
Drought_NN

significantly_RB below_IN normal_JJ recorded_JJ levels_NNS ,_, causing_VVG serious_JJ 
hydrological_JJ imbalances_NNS that_WDT adversely_RB affect_VVP land_NN resource_NN

Economic_JJ potential_NN

Ecosystem_NN 
A_DT system_NN of_IN interacting_VVG living_NN organisms_NNS together_RB with_IN their_PP$ 
physical_JJ environment_NN ._SENT The_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN what_WP could_MD be_VB called_VVN

of_IN interest_NN or_CC study_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, the_DT extent_NN of_IN an_DT ecosystem_NN may_MD range_VV 
from_IN very_RB small_JJ spatial_JJ scales_NNS to_TO ,_, ultimately_RB ,_, the_DT entire_JJ Earth_NN ._SENT

El_NP Niño_NP Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) 
El_NP Niño_NP ,_, in_IN its_PP$ original_JJ sense_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT warmwater_NN current_JJ that_IN/that periodically_RB 
flows_NNS along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ 
fishery_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN the_DT 
intertropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN and_CC circulation_NN in_IN the_DT Indian_NP 
and_CC Pacific_NP Oceans_NP ,_, called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN 
atmosphere-ocean_JJ phenomenon_NN is_VBZ collectively_RB known_VVN as_IN El_NP Niño_NP 
Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ,_, or_CC ENSO_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT El_NP Niño_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT 
prevailing_VVG trade_NN winds_NNS weaken_VVP and_CC the_DT equatorial_JJ countercurrent_NN 
strengthens_VVZ ,_, causing_VVG warm_JJ surface_NN waters_NNS in_IN the_DT Indonesian_JJ area_NN 
to_TO flow_VV eastward_RB to_TO overlie_VV the_DT cold_JJ waters_NNS of_IN the_DT Peru_NP current_NN ._SENT 
This_DT event_NN has_VHZ great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, 
and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ 
effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN 
the_DT world_NN ._SENT The_DT opposite_NN of_IN an_DT El_NP Niño_NP event_NN is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT 
Emissions_NNS

the_DT atmosphere_NN over_IN a_DT specified_JJ area_NN and_CC period_NN of_IN time_NN ._SENT

(_( intergovernmental_JJ organization_NN ,_, central_JJ or_CC local_JJ government_NN

individual_JJ firm_NN )_) entity_NN to_TO emit_VV a_DT specified_JJ amount_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN ._SENT

(_( defined_VVN in_IN Article_NP 6_CD of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP )_) project_NN calculated_VVN

Emissions_NNS tax_NN 
Levy_NP imposed_VVD by_IN a_DT government_NN on_IN each_DT unit_NN of_IN CO2-equivalent_NP 
emissions_NNS by_IN a_DT source_NN subject_NN to_TO the_DT tax_NN ._SENT Since_IN virtually_RB all_DT of_IN 
the_DT carbon_NN in_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS is_VBZ ultimately_RB emitted_VVN as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, 
a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT carbon_NN content_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS —_NN a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN —_NN is_VBZ 
equivalent_JJ to_TO an_DT emissions_NNS tax_NN for_IN emissions_NNS caused_VVN by_IN fossilfuel_NN 
combustion_NN ._SENT An_DT energy_NN tax_NN —_NN a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT energy_NN content_NN 
of_IN fuels_NNS —_NN reduces_VVZ demand_NN for_IN energy_NN and_CC so_RB reduces_VVZ carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN emissions_NNS from_IN fossil-fuel_NN use_NN ._SENT An_DT ecotax_NN is_VBZ designated_VVN 
for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN influencing_VVG human_JJ behavior_NN (_( specifically_RB 
economic_JJ behavior_NN )_) to_TO follow_VV an_DT ecologically_RB benign_JJ path_NN ._SENT

Emissions_NNS trading_NN

Endemic_JJ

prevalent_JJ in_IN a_DT population_NN or_CC geographical_JJ area_NN at_IN all_DT times_NNS ._SENT 
Energy_NN balance_NN 
Averaged_VVN over_IN the_DT globe_NN and_CC over_IN longer_JJR time_NN periods_NNS ,_, the_DT 
energy_NN budget_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN must_MD be_VB in_IN balance_NN ._SENT 
Because_IN the_DT climate-system_NN derives_VVZ all_PDT its_PP$ energy_NN from_IN the_DT 
Sun_NP ,_, this_DT balance_NN implies_VVZ that_IN/that ,_, globally_RB ,_, the_DT amount_NN of_IN incoming_NN 
solar_JJ radiation_NN must_MD on_IN average_NN be_VB equal_JJ to_TO the_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT 
outgoing_JJ reflected_VVD solar_JJ radiation_NN and_CC the_DT outgoing_JJ infrared_NN 
radiation_NN emitted_VVD by_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT A_DT perturbation_NN of_IN 
this_DT global_JJ radiation_NN balance_NN ,_, be_VB it_PP human-induced_VVD or_CC natural_JJ ,_, 
is_VBZ called_VVN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT 
Energy_NN conversion_NN

Energy_NN intensity_NN

ratio_NN of_IN total_JJ domestic_JJ primary_JJ energy_NN consumption_NN or_CC final_JJ energy_NN 
consumption_NN to_TO Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP or_CC physical_JJ output_NN ._SENT

Energy_NN transformation_NN

Environmentally_RB Sound_NP Technologies_NP (_( ESTs_NP )_) 
Technologies_NNS that_WDT protect_VVP the_DT environment_NN ,_, are_VBP less_RBR polluting_VVG ,_, 
use_VV all_DT resources_NNS in_IN a_DT more_RBR sustainable_JJ manner_NN ,_, recycle_VV more_JJR 
of_IN their_PP$ wastes_NNS and_CC products_NNS ,_, and_CC handle_VV residual_JJ wastes_NNS in_IN a_DT 
more_RBR acceptable_JJ manner_NN than_IN the_DT technologies_NNS for_IN which_WDT they_PP 
were_VBD substitutes_NNS and_CC are_VBP compatible_JJ with_IN nationally_RB determined_VVN 
socio-economic_JJ ,_, cultural_JJ ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ priorities_NNS ._SENT ESTs_NN 
in_IN this_DT report_NN imply_VVP mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN technologies_NNS ,_, hard_RB 
and_CC soft_JJ technologies_NNS ._SENT

Equilibrium_NN and_CC transient_JJ climate_NN experiment_NN 
An_DT “_JJ equilibrium_NN climate_NN experiment_NN ”_NN is_VBZ an_DT experiment_NN in_IN which_WDT

General_JJ circulation_NN

consequence_NN of_IN differential_JJ heating_NN on_IN a_DT rotating_VVG Earth_NN ,_, aiming_VVG 
to_TO restore_VV the_DT energy_NN balance_NN of_IN the_DT system_NN through_IN transport_NN 
of_IN heat_NN and_CC momentum_NN ._SENT

Glacier_NP 
A_DT mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN flowing_VVG downhill_JJ (_( by_IN internal_JJ deformation_NN 
and_CC sliding_VVG at_IN the_DT base_NN )_) and_CC constrained_VVN by_IN the_DT surrounding_VVG 
topography_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, the_DT sides_NNS of_IN a_DT valley_NN or_CC surrounding_VVG peaks_NNS )_) ;_: 
the_DT bedrock_NN topography_NN is_VBZ the_DT major_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT dynamics_NNS 
and_CC surface_NN slope_NN of_IN a_DT glacier_NN ._SENT A_DT glacier_NN is_VBZ maintained_VVN by_IN 
accumulation_NN of_IN snow_NN at_IN high_JJ altitudes_NNS ,_, balanced_VVN by_IN melting_NN 
at_IN low_JJ altitudes_NNS or_CC discharge_NN into_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT 
Global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
The_DT global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT area-weighted_JJ global_JJ

the_DT sub-surface_JJ bulk_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ meters_NNS of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN )_) ,_, and_CC (_( ii_NNS )_) the_DT surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN over_IN land_NN at_IN 1.5_CD m_NN 
above_IN the_DT ground_NN ._SENT 
Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) 
An_DT index_NN ,_, describing_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN well-mixed_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, that_WDT represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT 
differing_VVG times_NNS these_DT gases_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ 
relative_JJ effectiveness_NN in_IN absorbing_VVG outgoing_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN ._SENT 
This_DT index_NN approximates_VVZ the_DT time-integrated_JJ warming_NN effect_NN 
of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN greenhouse_NN gas_NN in_IN today’s_NN atmosphere_NN ,_, 
relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN effect_NN 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS effectively_RB absorb_VVP infrared_JJ radiation_NN ,_, emitted_VVN 
by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP due_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ 
gases_NNS ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ emitted_VVN to_TO all_DT sides_NNS ,_, 
including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT Thus_RB greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS trap_VVP heat_NN within_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ 
called_VVN the_DT “_JJ natural_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT ”_JJ Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN 
is_VBZ strongly_RB coupled_VVN to_TO the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT it_PP 
is_VBZ emitted_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN generally_RB decreases_VVZ 
with_IN height_NN ._SENT Effectively_RB ,_, infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN to_TO space_NN 
originates_VVZ from_IN an_DT altitude_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_IN average_JJ ,_, 
-19_CD °_SYM C_NP ,_, in_IN balance_NN with_IN the_DT net_JJ incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, whereas_IN 
the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN is_VBZ kept_VVN at_IN a_DT much_RB higher_JJR temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_RB 
average_NN ,_, +14_NN °_SYM C_NP ._SENT An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT increased_VVN infrared_JJ opacity_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
and_CC therefore_RB to_TO an_DT effective_JJ radiation_NN into_IN space_NN from_IN a_DT higher_JJR 
altitude_NN at_IN a_DT lower_JJR temperature_NN ._SENT This_DT causes_VVZ a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, 
an_DT imbalance_NN that_WDT can_MD only_RB be_VB compensated_VVN for_IN by_IN an_DT increase_NN 
of_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ 
the_DT “_JJ enhanced_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT ”_NN 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
both_DT natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN 
at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN infrared_JJ radiation_NN 
emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT 
property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapor_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, and_CC ozone_NN 
(_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Moreover_RB there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ 
chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN 
the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Besides_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP ,_, and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ sulfur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, 
hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT 
Groin_NN 
A_DT low_JJ ,_, narrow_JJ jetty_NN ,_, usually_RB extending_VVG roughly_RB perpendicular_JJ 
to_TO the_DT shoreline_NN ,_, designed_VVN to_TO protect_VV the_DT shore_NN from_IN erosion_NN by_IN 
currents_NNS ,_, tides_NNS ,_, or_CC waves_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO trap_VV sand_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN 
building_VVG up_RP or_CC making_VVG a_DT beach_NN ._SENT 
Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP (_( GDP_NP )_) 
The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, at_IN purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT 
resident_JJ and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT 
taxes_NNS and_CC minus_IN any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT 
products_NNS in_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC a_DT geographic_JJ region_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN 
of_IN time_NN ,_, normally_RB 1_CD year_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG for_IN 
depreciation_NN of_IN fabricated_VVN assets_NNS or_CC depletion_NN and_CC degradation_NN 
of_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT GDP_NP is_VBZ an_DT often_RB used_VVN but_CC incomplete_JJ 
measure_NN of_IN welfare_NN ._SENT

Halocarbons_NNS

or_CC fluorine_NN ._SENT Such_JJ compounds_NNS can_MD act_VV as_IN powerful_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN 
halocarbons_NNS are_VBP also_RB involved_VVN in_IN the_DT depletion_NN of_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT 

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS 
Harmonized_VVN emissions_NNS /_SYM carbon_NN /_SYM energy_NN tax_NN 
Commits_VVZ participating_VVG countries_NNS to_TO impose_VV a_DT tax_NN at_IN a_DT common_JJ 
rate_NN on_IN the_DT same_JJ sources_NNS ._SENT Each_DT country_NN can_MD retain_VV the_DT tax_NN 
revenue_NN it_PP collects_VVZ ._SENT A_DT harmonized_VVN tax_NN would_MD not_RB necessarily_RB 
require_VV countries_NNS to_TO impose_VV a_DT tax_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ rate_NN ,_, but_CC imposing_VVG 
different_JJ rates_NNS across_IN countries_NNS would_MD not_RB be_VB cost-effective_JJ ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB emissions_NNS tax_NN ._SENT 
Heat_NN island_NN

of_IN the_DT absorption_NN of_IN solar_JJ energy_NN by_IN materials_NNS like_IN asphalt_NN ._SENT

quickly_RB ,_, and_CC it_PP depends_VVZ on_IN society’s_NN attitude_NN towards_IN risks_NNS ._SENT

Often_RB ,_, but_CC not_RB always_RB ,_, the_DT term_NN is_VBZ synonymous_JJ with_IN “_JJ society_NN ”_NN 
or_CC “_JJ social_JJ system_NN ”_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, agricultural_JJ system_NN ,_, political_JJ system_NN ,_, 
technological_JJ system_NN ,_, economic_JJ system_NN )_) ._SENT 
Hydrofluorocarbons_NP (_( HFCs_NP )_) 
Among_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB curbed_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP ._SENT They_PP are_VBP produced_VVN commercially_RB as_IN a_DT substitute_NN for_IN 
chlorofluorocarbons_NNS ._SENT HFCs_NNS largely_RB are_VBP used_VVN in_IN refrigeration_NN 
and_CC semiconductor_NN manufacturing_NN ._SENT Their_PP$ Global_NP Warming_NP 
Potentials_NNS range_VVP from_IN 1_CD ,_, 300_CD to_TO 11_CD ,_, 700._CD 
Hydrosphere_NN 
The_DT component_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN composed_VVN of_IN liquid_NN

Ice_NN cap_NN 
A_DT dome_NN shaped_JJ ice_NN mass_NN covering_VVG a_DT highland_NN area_NN that_WDT is_VBZ 
considerably_RB smaller_JJR in_IN extent_NN than_IN an_DT ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT 
Ice_NN sheet_NN 
A_DT mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN that_WDT is_VBZ sufficiently_RB deep_JJ to_TO cover_VV most_JJS of_IN 
the_DT underlying_VVG bedrock_NN topography_NN ,_, so_RB that_IN/that its_PP$ shape_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB 
determined_VVN by_IN its_PP$ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS (_( the_DT flow_NN of_IN the_DT ice_NN as_IN it_PP 
deforms_VVZ internally_RB and_CC slides_VVZ at_IN its_PP$ base_NN )_) ._SENT An_DT ice_NN sheet_NN flows_NNS 
outward_RB from_IN a_DT high_JJ central_JJ plateau_NN with_IN a_DT small_JJ average_NN 
surface_NN slope_NN ._SENT The_DT margins_NNS slope_NN steeply_RB ,_, and_CC the_DT ice_NN is_VBZ 
discharged_VVN through_IN fast-flowing_VVG ice_NN streams_NNS or_CC outlet_NN glaciers_NNS ,_, 
in_IN some_DT cases_NNS into_IN the_DT sea_NN or_CC into_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS floating_VVG on_IN the_DT 
sea_NN ._SENT There_EX are_VBP only_RB two_CD large_JJ ice_NN sheets_NNS in_IN the_DT modern_JJ world_NN ,_, 
on_IN Greenland_NP and_CC Antarctica_NP ,_, the_DT Antarctic_JJ ice_NN sheet_NN being_VBG 
divided_VVN into_IN East_NP and_CC West_NP by_IN the_DT Transantarctic_NP Mountains_NP ;_: 
during_IN glacial_JJ periods_NNS there_EX were_VBD others_NNS ._SENT

(_( Climate_NN )_) Impacts_NP

systems_NNS ._SENT Depending_VVG on_IN the_DT consideration_NN of_IN adaptation_NN ,_, one_CD

Implementation_NN 
Implementation_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT actions_NNS (_( legislation_NN or_CC regulations_NNS ,_,

It_PP includes_VVZ those_DT events_NNS and_CC activities_NNS that_WDT occur_VVP after_IN the_DT

and_CC events_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ important_JJ to_TO distinguish_VV between_IN the_DT legal_JJ

the_DT provisions_NNS of_IN the_DT accord_NN ._SENT Compliance_NN focuses_VVZ on_IN not_RB only_RB

whether_IN there_EX is_VBZ compliance_NN with_IN the_DT implementing_VVG actions_NNS ._SENT

Indirect_JJ aerosol_NN effect_NN 
Aerosols_NNS may_MD lead_VV to_TO an_DT indirect_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG of_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN through_IN acting_VVG as_IN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS or_CC modifying_VVG 
the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Two_CD indirect_JJ 
effects_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN :_: 
First_JJ indirect_JJ effect_NN :_: A_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG induced_VVN by_IN an_DT increase_NN 
in_IN anthropogenic_JJ aerosols_NNS which_WDT cause_VVP an_DT initial_JJ increase_NN 
in_IN droplet_NN concentration_NN and_CC a_DT decrease_NN in_IN droplet_NN size_NN for_IN 
fixed_VVN liquid_JJ water_NN content_NN ,_, leading_VVG to_TO an_DT increase_NN of_IN cloud_NN 
albedo_NN ._SENT This_DT effect_NN is_VBZ also_RB known_VVN as_IN the_DT “_JJ Twomey_NP effect_NN ._SENT ”_NN 
This_DT is_VBZ sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT cloud_NN albedo_NN effect_NN ._SENT 
However_RB this_DT is_VBZ highly_RB misleading_VVG since_IN the_DT second_JJ indirect_JJ 
effect_NN also_RB alters_VVZ cloud_NN albedo_NN ._SENT 
Second_JJ indirect_JJ effect_NN :_: A_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG induced_VVN by_IN an_DT 
increase_NN in_IN anthropogenic_JJ aerosols_NNS which_WDT cause_VVP a_DT decrease_NN 
in_IN droplet_NN size_NN ,_, reducing_VVG the_DT precipitation_NN efficiency_NN ,_, thereby_RB 
modifying_VVG the_DT liquid_JJ water_NN content_NN ,_, cloud_NN thickness_NN ,_, and_NP 
cloud_NN lifetime_NN ._SENT This_DT effect_NN is_VBZ also_RB known_VVN as_IN the_DT “_JJ cloud_NN 
lifetime_NN effect_NN ”_NN or_CC “_JJ Albrecht_NP effect_NN ._SENT ”_NN 
Industrial_NP Revolution_NP 
A_DT period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ industrial_JJ growth_NN with_IN far-reaching_JJ social_JJ 
and_CC economic_JJ consequences_NNS ,_, beginning_VVG in_IN England_NP during_IN the_DT 
second_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT 18th_JJ century_NN and_CC spreading_VVG to_TO Europe_NP and_NP 
later_RBR to_TO other_JJ countries_NNS including_VVG the_DT United_NP States_NPS ._SENT The_DT 
invention_NN of_IN the_DT steam_NN engine_NN was_VBD an_DT important_JJ trigger_NN of_IN this_DT 
development_NN ._SENT The_DT Industrial_NP Revolution_NP marks_VVZ the_DT beginning_NN 
of_IN a_DT strong_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS and_CC emission_NN of_IN ,_, 
in_IN particular_JJ ,_, fossil_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT terms_NNS

the_DT cause_NN of_IN that_DT change_NN has_VHZ been_VBN removed_VVN ._SENT

Infrared_JJ radiation_NN has_VHZ a_DT distinctive_JJ range_NN of_IN wavelengths_NNS 
(_( “_JJ spectrum_NN ”_NN )_) longer_JJR than_IN the_DT wavelength_NN of_IN the_DT red_JJ color_NN in_IN

Interaction_NN effect_NN 
The_DT result_NN or_CC consequence_NN of_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN climate-change_NN 
policy_NN instruments_NNS with_IN existing_VVG domestic_JJ tax_NN systems_NNS ,_, including_VVG

gas_NN policies_NNS can_MD have_VH on_IN the_DT functioning_NN of_IN labor_NN and_CC capital_NN markets_NNS 
through_IN their_PP$ effects_NNS on_IN real_JJ wages_NNS and_CC the_DT real_JJ return_NN to_TO capital_NN ._SENT 
By_IN restricting_VVG the_DT allowable_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS ,_, permits_VVZ ,_,

prices_NNS of_IN output_NN ,_, thus_RB reducing_VVG the_DT real_JJ return_NN to_TO labor_NN and_CC capital_NN ._SENT

Joint_NP Implementation_NP (_( JI_NP )_)

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP 
on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) was_VBD adopted_VVN at_IN the_DT Third_NP Session_NP 
of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP in_IN 1997_CD in_RB 
Kyoto_NP ,_, Japan_NP ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN 
to_TO those_DT included_VVN in_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT Countries_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP 
B_NP of_IN the_DT Protocol_NP (_( most_JJS countries_NNS in_IN the_DT Organisation_NP for_IN 
Economic_NP Cooperation_NP and_CC Development_NP ,_, and_CC countries_NNS with_IN 
economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, methane_NN ,_, nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, perfluorocarbons_NNS ,_, and_CC sulfur_NN 
hexafluoride_NN )_) by_IN at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT 
commitment_NN period_NN 2008_CD to_TO 2012._CD The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP has_VHZ 
not_RB yet_RB entered_VVN into_IN force_NN (_( September_NP 2001_CD )_) ._SENT

and_CC economic_JJ purposes_NNS for_IN which_WDT land_NN is_VBZ managed_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, 
grazing_NN ,_, timber_NN extraction_NN ,_, and_CC conservation_NN )_) ._SENT 
Land-use_NN change_NN 
A_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN or_CC management_NN of_IN land_NN by_IN humans_NNS ,_, which_WDT 
may_MD lead_VV to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN land_NN cover_NN ._SENT Land_NN cover_NN and_CC land-use_NN

the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, and_CC may_MD thus_RB have_VH an_DT impact_NN on_IN climate_NN ,_, 
locally_RB or_CC globally_RB ._SENT See_VV also_RB the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ Report_NP on_IN Land_NP

Landslide_NN 
A_DT mass_NN of_IN material_NN that_WDT has_VHZ slipped_VVN downhill_RB by_IN gravity_NN ,_, often_RB 
assisted_VVN by_IN water_NN when_WRB the_DT material_NN is_VBZ saturated_VVN ;_: rapid_JJ 
movement_NN of_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN soil_NN ,_, rock_NN ,_, or_CC debris_NN down_IN a_DT slope_NN ._SENT 
Leakage_NN 
The_DT part_NN of_IN emissions_NNS reductions_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS that_RB 
may_MD be_VB offset_VVN by_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT emission_NN in_IN the_DT nonconstrained_JJ 
countries_NNS above_IN their_PP$ baseline_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT This_DT can_NN 
occur_VV through_IN (_( i_NP )_) relocation_NN of_IN energy-intensive_JJ production_NN in_IN 
non-constrained_JJ regions_NNS ;_: (_( ii_NP )_) increased_VVD consumption_NN of_IN fossil_NN 
fuels_NNS in_IN these_DT regions_NNS through_IN decline_NN in_IN the_DT international_JJ price_NN 
of_IN oil_NN and_CC gas_NN triggered_VVN by_IN lower_JJR demand_NN for_IN these_DT energies_NNS ;_: 
and_CC (_( iii_NN )_) changes_NNS in_IN incomes_NNS (_( thus_RB in_IN energy_NN demand_NN )_) because_IN 
of_IN better_JJR terms_NNS of_IN trade_NN ._SENT Leakage_NN also_RB refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT situation_NN in_IN 
which_WDT a_DT carbon_NN sequestration_NN activity_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, tree_NN planting_NN )_) on_IN 
one_CD piece_NN of_IN land_NN inadvertently_RB ,_, directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB ,_, triggers_VVZ 
an_DT activity_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN whole_NN or_CC part_NN ,_, counteracts_VVZ the_DT carbon_NN 
effects_NNS of_IN the_DT initial_JJ activity_NN ._SENT 
Lifetime_NN 
Lifetime_NN is_VBZ a_DT general_JJ term_NN used_VVN for_IN various_JJ time_NN scales_NNS 
characterizing_VVG the_DT rate_NN of_IN processes_NNS affecting_VVG the_DT concentration_NN 
of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ._SENT In_IN general_NN ,_, lifetime_NN denotes_VVZ the_DT average_JJ length_NN 
of_IN time_NN that_IN/that an_DT atom_NN or_CC molecule_NN spends_VVZ in_IN a_DT given_VVN reservoir_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC oceans_NNS ._SENT The_DT following_VVG lifetimes_NNS 
may_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN :_: 
“_JJ Turnover_NN time_NN ”_NN (_( T_NN )_) or_CC “_JJ atmospheric_JJ lifetime_NN ”_NN is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN 
of_IN the_DT mass_JJ M_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT gaseous_JJ compound_NN in_IN 
the_DT atmosphere_NN )_) and_CC the_DT total_JJ rate_NN of_IN removal_NN S_NN from_IN the_DT 
reservoir_NN :_: T_NN =_SYM M_NP /_SYM S_NP ._SENT For_IN each_DT removal_NN process_NN separate_JJ 
turnover_NN times_NNS can_MD be_VB defined_VVN ._SENT In_IN soil_NN carbon_NN biology_NN ,_, this_RB 
is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Mean_NP Residence_NP Time_NP ._SENT 
“_JJ Adjustment_NN time_NN ,_, ”_JJ “_JJ response_NN time_NN ,_, ”_NN or_CC “_NN perturbation_NN 
lifetime_NN ”_NN (_( Ta_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT time_NN scale_NN characterizing_VVG the_DT decay_NN of_IN 
an_DT instantaneous_JJ pulse_NN input_NN into_IN the_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN

of_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN following_VVG a_DT step_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT

The_DT term_NN “_NN lifetime_NN ”_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB used_VVN ,_, for_IN simplicity_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT 
surrogate_NN for_IN “_JJ adjustment_NN time_NN ._SENT ”_NN 
In_IN simple_JJ cases_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT global_JJ removal_NN of_IN the_DT compound_NN is_VBZ 
directly_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT total_JJ mass_NN of_IN the_DT reservoir_NN ,_, the_DT 
adjustment_NN time_NN equals_VVZ the_DT turnover_NN time_NN :_: T_NN =_SYM Ta_NP ._SENT An_DT example_NN 
is_VBZ CFC-11_JJ which_WDT is_VBZ removed_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN only_RB by_IN

is_VBZ not_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT total_JJ mass_NN ,_, the_DT equality_NN T_NN =_SYM Ta_NP no_RB 
longer_RBR holds_VVZ ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN is_VBZ an_DT extreme_JJ example_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ turnover_NN 
time_NN is_VBZ only_RB about_RB 4_CD years_NNS because_IN of_IN the_DT rapid_JJ exchange_NN between_IN 
atmosphere_NN and_CC the_DT ocean_NN and_CC terrestrial_JJ biota_NN ._SENT However_RB ,_, a_DT 
large_JJ part_NN of_IN that_WDT CO2_NP is_VBZ returned_VVN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN within_IN a_DT 
few_JJ years_NNS ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN of_IN CO2_NP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
is_VBZ actually_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN removal_NN of_IN carbon_NN from_IN 
the_DT surface_NN layer_NN of_IN the_DT oceans_NNS into_IN its_PP$ deeper_JJR layers_NNS ._SENT Although_IN 
an_DT approximate_JJ value_NN of_IN 100_CD years_NNS may_MD be_VB given_VVN for_IN the_DT 
adjustment_NN time_NN of_IN CO2_NP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT actual_JJ 
adjustment_NN is_VBZ faster_RBR initially_RB and_CC slower_JJR later_RBR on_RB ._SENT In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN 
methane_NN ,_, the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN the_DT turnover_NN 
time_NN ,_, because_IN the_DT removal_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB through_IN a_DT chemical_NN 
reaction_NN with_IN the_DT hydroxyl_NN radical_JJ OH_NN ,_, the_DT concentration_NN of_IN 
which_WDT itself_PP depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT CH4_NP concentration_NN ._SENT Therefore_RB the_DT 
CH4_NP removal_NN S_NP is_VBZ not_RB proportional_JJ to_TO its_PP$ total_JJ mass_NN M_NN ._SENT 
Lithosphere_NN 
The_DT upper_JJ layer_NN of_IN the_DT solid_JJ Earth_NN ,_, both_DT continental_JJ and_NP 
oceanic_JJ ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ composed_VVN of_IN all_DT crustal_JJ rocks_NNS and_CC the_DT cold_JJ ,_,

the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, but_CC acts_NNS as_IN an_DT external_JJ forcing_VVG factor_NN ._SENT 
Leapfrogging_VVG

Level_NN of_IN scientific_JJ understanding_NN 
This_DT is_VBZ an_DT index_NN on_IN a_DT 4-step_JJ scale_NN (_( High_NP ,_, Medium_NP ,_, Low_NP ,_, and_NP

Malaria_NN

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS

Methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) 
A_DT hydrocarbon_NN that_WDT is_VBZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN produced_VVN through_RP 
anaerobic_JJ (_( without_IN oxygen_NN )_) decomposition_NN of_IN waste_NN in_IN

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT

Mole_NN fraction_NN 
Mole_NN fraction_NN ,_, or_CC mixing_VVG ratio_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN 
moles_NNS of_IN a_DT constituent_NN in_IN a_DT given_VVN volume_NN to_TO the_DT total_JJ number_NN 
of_IN moles_NNS of_IN all_DT constituents_NNS in_IN that_DT volume_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ usually_RB reported_VVN 
for_IN dry_JJ air_NN ._SENT Typical_JJ values_NNS for_IN long-lived_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP 
in_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN mmol_NP /_SYM mol_NN (_( parts_NNS per_IN million_CD :_: ppm_NN )_) ,_, nmol_NN /_SYM mol_NN 
(_( parts_NNS per_IN billion_CD :_: ppb_NN )_) ,_, and_CC fmol_NNS /_SYM mol_NN (_( parts_NNS per_IN trillion_CD :_: ppt_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Mole_NN fraction_NN differs_VVZ from_IN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN ,_, often_RB expressed_VVN 
in_IN ppmv_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, by_IN the_DT corrections_NNS for_IN non-ideality_NN of_IN gases_NNS ._SENT This_DT 
correction_NN is_VBZ significant_JJ relative_NN to_TO measurement_NN precision_NN for_IN 
many_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( Schwartz_NP and_CC Warneck_NP ,_, 1995_CD )_) ._SENT

Montreal_NP Protocol_NP 
The_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP on_IN substances_NNS that_WDT deplete_VVP the_DT ozone_NN 
layer_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN Montreal_NP in_IN 1987_CD ,_, and_CC subsequently_RB 
adjusted_VVN and_CC amended_VVN in_IN London_NP (_( 1990_CD )_) ,_, Copenhagen_NP (_( 1992_CD )_) ,_,

controls_VVZ the_DT consumption_NN and_CC production_NN of_IN chlorine-_NN and_CC 
bromine-containing_NN chemicals_NNS that_WDT destroy_VVP stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) ,_, methyl_NN chloroform_NN ,_, 
carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN ,_, and_CC many_JJ others_NNS ._SENT

North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP (_( NAO_NP )_) 
The_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP consists_VVZ of_IN opposing_VVG variations_NNS 
of_IN barometric_JJ pressure_NN near_IN Iceland_NP and_CC near_IN the_DT Azores_NNS ._SENT On_RB 
average_NN ,_, a_DT westerly_JJ current_NN ,_, between_IN the_DT Icelandic_JJ low_JJ pressure_NN 
area_NN and_CC the_DT Azores_NP high_JJ pressure_NN area_NN ,_, carries_VVZ cyclones_NNS with_IN 
their_PP$ associated_VVN frontal_JJ systems_NNS towards_IN Europe_NP ._SENT However_RB ,_, 
the_DT pressure_NN difference_NN between_IN Iceland_NP and_CC the_DT Azores_NP fluctuates_VVZ 
on_IN time_NN scales_NNS of_IN days_NNS to_TO decades_NNS ,_, and_CC can_MD be_VB reversed_VVN at_IN times_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ the_DT dominant_JJ mode_NN of_IN winter_NN climate_NN variability_NN in_IN the_DT North_NP 
Atlantic_NP region_NN ,_, ranging_VVG from_IN central_JJ North_NP America_NP to_TO Europe_NP ._SENT

global_JJ ocean_NN ,_, driven_VVN by_IN wind_NN and_CC the_DT thermohaline_NN circulation_NN ._SENT

and_CC the_DT economic_JJ potential_NN ,_, socio-economic_JJ potential_NN ,_, or_CC

Annex_NP B_NP Glossary_NP of_IN Terms_NNS 
Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) 
Ozone_NN ,_, the_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ atmospheric_JJ 
constituent_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN both_CC naturally_RB and_CC by_IN 
photochemical_JJ reactions_NNS involving_VVG gases_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN human_JJ 
activities_NNS (_( photochemical_JJ “_NN smog_NN ”_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN high_JJ concentrations_NNS ,_, 
tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN can_MD be_VB harmful_JJ to_TO a_DT wide-range_NN of_IN living_NN 
organisms_NNS ._SENT Tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN acts_NNS as_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
stratosphere_NN ,_, ozone_NN is_VBZ created_VVN by_IN the_DT interaction_NN between_IN solar_JJ 
ultraviolet_JJ radiation_NN and_CC molecular_JJ oxygen_NN (_( O2_NP )_) ._SENT Stratospheric_JJ 
ozone_NN plays_VVZ a_DT decisive_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT stratospheric_JJ radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT 
Its_PP$ concentration_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS in_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT Depletion_NN of_IN 
stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO chemical_NN reactions_NNS that_WDT may_MD be_VB enhanced_VVN 
by_IN climate-change_NN ,_, results_NNS in_IN an_DT increased_VVN ground-level_NN flux_NN of_IN 
ultraviolet-B_NN radiation_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Montreal_NP Protocol_NP and_CC ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT 
Ozone_NN hole_NN

Ozone_NN layer_NN 
The_DT stratosphere_NN contains_VVZ a_DT layer_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT concentration_NN 
of_IN ozone_NN is_VBZ greatest_JJ ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT The_DT layer_NN 
extends_VVZ from_IN about_RB 12_CD to_TO 40_CD km_NN ._SENT The_DT ozone_NN concentration_NN 
reaches_VVZ a_DT maximum_NN between_IN about_RB 20_CD and_CC 25_CD km_NN ._SENT This_DT layer_NN 
is_VBZ being_VBG depleted_VVN by_IN human_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN chlorine_NN and_CC bromine_NN 
compounds_NNS ._SENT Every_DT year_NN ,_, during_IN the_DT Southern_NP Hemisphere_NP 
spring_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB strong_JJ depletion_NN of_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN takes_VVZ place_NN 
over_IN the_DT Antarctic_JJ region_NN ,_, also_RB caused_VVN by_IN human-made_JJ chlorine_NN 
and_CC bromine_NN compounds_NNS in_IN combination_NN with_IN the_DT specific_NN 
meteorological_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN that_DT region_NN ._SENT This_DT phenomenon_NN is_VBZ 
called_VVN the_DT ozone_NN hole_NN ._SENT

further_RBR improved_VVN without_IN making_VVG others_NNS in_IN the_DT society_NN worse_RBR off_RB ._SENT 
Perfluorocarbons_NP (_( PFCs_NP )_)

Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG

fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ._SENT

Reservoir_NN

precursor_NN )_) ._SENT Oceans_NNS ,_, soils_NNS ,_, and_CC forests_NNS are_VBP examples_NNS of_IN 
reservoirs_NNS of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT Pool_NN is_VBZ an_DT equivalent_JJ term_NN (_( note_NN that_IN/that the_DT 
definition_NN of_IN pool_NN often_RB includes_VVZ the_DT atmosphere_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT absolute_NN

specified_JJ time_NN ,_, is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT stock_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN also_RB means_VVZ an_DT 
artificial_JJ or_CC natural_JJ storage_NN place_NN for_IN water_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT lake_NN ,_,

Response_NN time_NN 
The_DT response_NN time_NN or_CC adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT time_NN needed_VVN for_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN or_CC its_PP$ components_NNS to_TO re-equilibrate_NNS to_TO a_DT new_JJ 
state_NN ,_, following_VVG a_DT forcing_VVG resulting_VVG from_IN external_JJ and_CC internal_JJ 
processes_NNS or_CC feedbacks_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ very_RB different_JJ for_IN various_JJ components_NNS 
of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT The_DT response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ 
relatively_RB short_RB ,_, from_IN days_NNS to_TO weeks_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN comes_VVZ 
into_IN equilibrium_NN on_IN a_DT time_NN scale_NN of_IN typically_RB a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ._SENT Due_JJ 
to_TO their_PP$ large_JJ heat_NN capacity_NN ,_, the_DT oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT much_RB longer_JJR response_NN 
time_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS ,_, but_CC up_RB to_TO centuries_NNS or_CC millennia_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT strongly_RB coupled_VVN surface-troposphere_NN system_NN 
is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, slow_RB compared_VVN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, and_NP 
mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ._SENT The_DT biosphere_NN may_MD respond_VV

to_TO be_VB achieved_VVN by_IN a_DT set_VVN date_NN or_CC time_NN table_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, 2008_CD to_TO 2012_CD )_) ._SENT 
For_IN example_NN ,_, under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol’s_NP formula_NN ,_, the_DT European_NP

Developing_VVG countries_NNS that_WDT are_VBP →Party_JJ to_TO the_DT →Montreal_NN 
Protocol_NP ._SENT These_DT countries_NNS are_VBP permitted_VVN a_DT ten-year_NN grace_NN period_NN 
in_IN the_DT phase-out_JJ schedule_NN in_IN the_DT →Montreal_NP Protocol_NP compared_VVD 
with_IN developed_JJ countries_NNS ._SENT 
Note_NN :_: The_DT definitions_NNS in_IN this_DT glossary_NN refer_VVP to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT terms_NNS in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT A_DT ‘→’_NN indicates_VVZ that_IN/that the_DT following_NN 
term_NN is_VBZ also_RB contained_VVN in_IN this_DT glossary_NN ._SENT The_DT glossary_NN provides_VVZ an_DT explanation_NN of_IN specific_JJ terms_NNS as_IN the_DT lead_JJ authors_NNS intend_VVP them_PP to_TO

Atmosphere_NN 
The_DT gaseous_JJ envelope_NN surrounding_VVG the_DT Earth_NN ._SENT The_DT dry_JJ atmosphere_NN 
consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( N2_NP )_) (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN 
→mixing_JJ ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( O2_NP )_) (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ._SENT 
The_DT remaining_VVG 1_CD %_NN consists_VVZ of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( Ar_NP )_) 
(_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN (_( He_PP )_) ,_, and_CC radiatively_RB 
active_JJ →greenhouse_NN gases_NNS such_JJ as_IN →carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
(_( 0.037_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN in_IN 2004_CD )_) and_CC →ozone_NP (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, 
the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ water_NN vapour_NN ,_, whose_WP$ amount_NN is_VBZ 
highly_RB variable_JJ ,_, clouds_NNS and_CC both_DT liquid_JJ and_CC particulate_JJ aerosols_NNS ._SENT 
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT matter_NN in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN occurs_VVZ in_IN the_DT →troposphere_NN 
immediately_RB above_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN and_CC the_DT overlying_VVG 
→stratosphere_NN ._SENT 
Atmospheric_JJ Lifetime_NP 
A_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT average_JJ time_NN that_IN/that a_DT molecule_NN remains_VVZ intact_JJ 
once_RB released_VVN into_IN the_DT →atmosphere_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB :_: →Lifetime_NN ._SENT 
Azeotrope_NN (_( Refrigeration_NP )_) 
A_DT →blend_NN consisting_VVG of_IN one_CD or_CC more_JJR →refrigerants_NNS of_IN different_JJ 
volatilities_NNS that_WDT does_VVZ not_RB appreciably_RB change_VV in_IN composition_NN or_CC 
temperature_NN as_IN it_PP evaporates_VVZ (_( boils_NNS )_) or_CC condenses_VVZ (_( liquefies_VVZ )_) under_IN 
constant_JJ pressure_NN ._SENT Refrigerant_JJ blends_NNS assigned_VVN an_DT R-500_NP series_NN 
number_NN designation_NN by_IN ANSI_NP /_SYM ASHRAE_NP 34_CD are_VBP azeotropes_NNS ._SENT

Best_JJS Practice_NN

proven_JJ technologies_NNS in_IN the_DT production_NN ,_, use_NN ,_, substitution_NN ,_,

Blends_NNS /_SYM Mixtures_NP (_( Refrigeration_NP )_)

Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP (_( CO2_NP )_) 
A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN which_WDT occurs_VVZ as_IN a_DT byproduct_NN of_IN burning_NN 
→fossil_NN fuels_NNS and_CC biomass_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN other_JJ industrial_JJ processes_NNS 
and_CC land-use_NN changes_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ →anthropogenic_NN 
→greenhouse_NN gas_NN that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN and_CC 
is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP

but_CC is_VBZ not_RB physically_RB changed_VVN or_CC used_VVN up_RP in_IN the_DT reaction_NN ._SENT

and_CC deposits_NNS it_PP into_IN another_DT (_( ambient_JJ air_NN or_CC water_NN )_) ._SENT

Climate_NN 
Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT ‘average_NN 
weather’_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN 
terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT 
period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS 
of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT →_NN 
World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP (_( WMO_NP )_) ._SENT These_DT quantities_NNS 
are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, 
and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT 
statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN Change_NP 
climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT statistically_RB significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN 
either_CC the_DT mean_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT →climate_NN or_CC in_IN its_PP$ variability_NN ,_, persisting_VVG 
for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN (_( typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR )_) ._SENT 
climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ 
forcings_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO persistent_JJ →anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT 
composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT 
Note_NN that_IN/that Article_NP 1_CD of_IN the_DT →Framework_NN Convention_NN on_IN 
Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) defines_VVZ ‘climate_JJ change’_NN as_IN ‘a_NN 
change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO 
human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN 
and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN ,_, 
observed_VVN over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods’_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NN thus_RB 
makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN ‘climate_NN change’_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ 
activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, and_CC ‘climate_NN 
variability’_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN Feedback_NN 
An_DT interaction_NN mechanism_NN between_IN processes_NNS in_IN the_DT →climate_NN 
system_NN occurring_VVG when_WRB the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT initial_JJ process_NN triggers_NNS 
changes_NNS in_IN a_DT second_JJ process_NN that_IN/that in_IN turn_NN influences_VVZ the_DT initial_JJ 
one_CD ._SENT A_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN intensifies_VVZ the_DT original_JJ process_NN ,_, whereas_IN 
a_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN weakens_VVZ it_PP ._SENT 
Climate_NN Scenario_NN 
A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_NN 
climate_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN 
driving_VVG forces_NNS and_CC key_JJ relations_NNS ,_, that_WDT has_VHZ been_VBN constructed_VVN for_IN 
use_NN in_IN investigating_VVG the_DT potential_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN →anthropogenic_JJ 
→climate_JJ change_NN ,_, and_CC often_RB serves_VVZ as_IN input_NN to_TO impact_NN 
models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN →projections_NNS often_RB serve_VVP as_IN the_DT raw_JJ material_NN 
for_IN constructing_VVG climate_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, but_CC climate_NN scenarios_NNS usually_RB 
require_VV additional_JJ information_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT baseline_JJ current_NN 
climate_NN ._SENT A_DT climate-change_NN scenario_NN is_VBZ the_DT difference_NN between_IN a_DT 
climate_NN scenario_NN and_CC the_DT current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN Sensitivity_NN 
In_IN IPCC_NP Reports_NP ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT 
equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_NN 
a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ (_( →equivalent_JJ )_) →carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentrations_NNS ._SENT More_RBR generally_RB ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN 
sensitivity_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN surface_NN air_NN 
temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN →radiative_NN forcing_VVG (_( in_IN 
units_NNS of_IN °_SYM C_NP per_FW (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) )_) ._SENT 
In_IN practice_NN ,_, the_DT evaluation_NN of_IN the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
requires_VVZ very_RB long_JJ simulations_NNS with_IN coupled_VVN general_NN 
circulation_NN models_NNS ._SENT The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ a_DT related_JJ 
measure_NN that_WDT circumvents_VVZ this_DT requirement_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN 
model_NN output_NN for_IN evolving_VVG non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT 
measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT →feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN 
and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ._SENT 
climate-system_NN 
The_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN that_WDT consists_VVZ of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: 
the_DT →atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT 
land_NN surface_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN of_IN the_DT interactions_NNS 
between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ over_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT 
influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ 
forcings_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS and_CC human-_NN 
induced_VVN forcings_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN )_) ._SENT 
Climate_NN Variability_NN

standard_JJ deviation_NN and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS )_) of_IN the_DT →_NN 
climate_NN on_IN all_DT temporal_JJ and_CC spatial_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_IN/that of_IN individual_NN 
weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN variability_NN may_MD be_VB caused_VVN by_IN 
natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS within_IN the_DT →climate_JJ system_NN (_( internal_JJ 
variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC by_IN variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ 
forcings_NNS (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB :_: →Climate_JJ change_NN ._SENT 
452_CD IPCC_NN /_SYM TEAP_NP Special_JJ Report_NN :_: Safeguarding_VVG the_DT Ozone_NN Layer_NP and_CC the_DT Global_JJ climate-system_NN 
CO2-Equivalent_NP 
The_DT amount_NN of_IN →carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT 
same_JJ amount_NN of_IN →radiative_NN forcing_VVG as_IN a_DT given_VVN amount_NN of_IN another_DT 
→greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT When_WRB used_VVN with_IN concentrations_NNS this_DT refers_VVZ 
to_TO the_DT instantaneous_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG caused_VVN by_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN or_CC the_DT equivalent_JJ amount_NN of_IN CO2_NP ._SENT When_WRB used_VVN with_IN emissions_NNS 
this_DT refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT time-integrated_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG over_IN a_DT 
specified_JJ time_NN horizon_NN caused_VVN by_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN concentration_NN 
produced_VVN by_IN the_DT emissions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB :_: →Global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN ._SENT 
Coefficient_NN of_IN Performance_NP (_( COP_NP )_) (_( Refrigeration_NP )_) 
A_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT energy_NN efficiency_NN of_IN a_DT refrigerating_VVG system_NN ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT ratio_NN between_IN the_DT refrigerating_VVG capacity_NN and_CC 
the_DT electric_JJ power_NN consumed_VVN by_IN the_DT system_NN ._SENT The_DT COP_NP is_VBZ primarily_RB 
dependant_JJ on_IN the_DT working_VVG cycle_NN and_CC the_DT temperature_NN levels_NNS 
(_( evaporating_VVG /_SYM condensing_VVG temperature_NN )_) as_IN well_RB as_RB on_IN the_DT properties_NNS 
of_IN the_DT →refrigerant_NN ,_, system_NN design_NN and_CC size_NN ._SENT

Compressor_NN Discharge_NP Temperature_NP (_( Refrigeration_NP )_)

temperature_NN ,_, →refrigerant_NN properties_NNS and_CC the_DT compressor_NN

of_IN the_DT →Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, but_CC only_RB Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
may_MD participate_VV in_IN deliberations_NNS and_CC make_VV decisions_NNS ._SENT 
Containment_NN (_( Refrigeration_NP )_)

to_TO preclude_VV or_CC reduce_VV loss_NN of_IN →refrigerant_NN from_IN equipment_NN 
during_IN installation_NN ,_, operation_NN ,_, service_NN or_CC disposal_NN of_IN refrigeration_NN 
and_CC air-conditioning_NN equipment_NN ._SENT 
Controlled_JJ Substance_NN

(_( ODS_NP )_) that_WDT is_VBZ subject_JJ to_TO control_VV measures_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT →_NN 
phase-out_JJ requirement_NN ._SENT 
Cost_NN Effective_NN 
A_DT criterion_NN that_WDT specifies_VVZ that_IN/that a_DT technology_NN or_CC measure_NN delivers_VVZ

A_DT unit_NN to_TO measure_VV total_JJ →column_NN ozone_NN ._SENT The_DT number_NN of_IN Dobson_NP

DU_NP is_VBZ a_DT typical_JJ value_NN ._SENT

Energy_NP Balance_NP 
Averaged_VVN over_IN the_DT globe_NN and_CC over_IN long_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ,_, the_DT energy_NN

climate-system_NN derives_VVZ all_PDT its_PP$ energy_NN from_IN the_DT Sun_NP ,_, this_DT balance_NN

External_JJ Costs_NNS

for_IN the_DT activity_NN does_VVZ not_RB take_VV full_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT negative_JJ 
impacts_NNS on_IN others_NNS of_IN his_PP$ or_CC her_PP$ actions_NNS ._SENT Similarly_RB ,_, when_WRB 
the_DT impacts_NNS are_VBP positive_JJ and_CC not_RB accounted_VVD for_IN in_IN the_DT actions_NNS of_IN 
the_DT agent_NN responsible_JJ ,_, they_PP are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN external_JJ benefits_NNS ._SENT

Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_)

→radiative_JJ forcing_VVG arising_VVG from_IN a_DT pulse_NN emission_NN of_IN

Greenhouse_NN Effect_NNS 
→Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT →atmosphere_NN effectively_RB absorb_VV the_DT 
→thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN that_WDT is_VBZ emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, 
by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN 
emits_VVZ radiation_NN in_IN all_DT directions_NNS ,_, including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT 
Earth’s_NNS surface_VVP ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS trap_NN heat_NN within_IN the_DT surfacetroposphere_NN 
system_NN and_CC raise_VV the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT 
This_DT is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT natural_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT 
An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS leads_VVZ to_TO 
increased_VVN absorption_NN of_IN infrared_JJ radiation_NN and_CC causes_VVZ a_DT →radiative_NN 
forcing_VVG ,_, or_CC energy_NN imbalance_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ compensated_VVN for_IN by_IN an_DT 
increase_NN in_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT 
This_DT is_VBZ the_DT enhanced_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT 
454_CD IPCC_NN /_SYM TEAP_NP Special_JJ Report_NN :_: Safeguarding_VVG the_DT Ozone_NN Layer_NP and_CC the_DT Global_JJ climate-system_NN 
Greenhouse_NN Gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) 
The_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT →atmosphere_NN ,_, both_DT natural_JJ and_NP 
→anthropogenic_NN ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN 
of_IN the_DT →thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN that_WDT is_VBZ emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT 
Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN 
causes_VVZ the_DT →greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT The_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS 
in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN are_VBP water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, →carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
(_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC →ozone_NN 
(_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB →anthropogenic_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT →halocarbons_NNS 
and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP 
covered_VVN by_IN the_DT →Montreal_JJ Protocol_NP ._SENT Some_DT other_JJ trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, 
and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ,_, are_VBP also_RB greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
Halocarbons_NNS 
Chemical_NN compounds_NNS containing_VVG carbon_NN atoms_NNS ,_, and_CC one_CD or_CC 
more_JJR atoms_NNS of_IN the_DT →halogens_NNS chlorine_NN (_( Cl_NP )_) ,_, fluorine_NN (_( F_NP )_) ,_, bromine_NN 
(_( Br_NN )_) or_CC iodine_NN (_( I_PP )_) ._SENT Fully_RB halogenated_VVN halocarbons_NNS contain_VVP 
only_JJ carbon_NN and_CC halogen_NN atoms_NNS ,_, whereas_IN partially_RB halogenated_VVN 
halocarbons_NNS also_RB contain_VVP hydrogen_NN (_( H_NP )_) atoms_NNS ._SENT Halocarbons_NNS 
that_DT release_NN chlorine_NN ,_, bromine_NN or_CC iodine_NN into_IN the_DT →stratosphere_NN 
cause_NN →ozone_NN depletion_NN ._SENT Halocarbons_NNS are_VBP also_RB →greenhouse_JJ 
gases_NNS ._SENT Halocarbons_NNS include_VVP →chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) ,_, 
→hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HCFCs_NP )_) ,_, →hydrofluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, →perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) and_CC →halons_NNS ._SENT

that_IN/that includes_VVZ fluorine_NN (_( F_NP )_) ,_, chlorine_NN (_( Cl_NP )_) ,_, bromine_NN (_( Br_NN )_) and_CC

Intergovernmental_JJ Panel_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( IPCC_NP )_)

(_( WMO_NP )_) and_CC the_DT →United_JJ Nations_NP Environment_NP Programme_NP 
(_( UNEP_NN )_) in_IN 1988_CD to_TO assess_VV scientific_JJ ,_, technical_JJ and_CC socio-economic_JJ

The_DT IPCC_NP provides_VVZ ,_, on_IN request_NN ,_, scientific_JJ ,_, technical_JJ and_CC socioeconomic_JJ

→United_JJ Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT IPCC_NP has_VHZ produced_VVN a_DT series_NN of_IN Assessment_NP
