Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT →United_JJ Nations_NPS Framework_NP 
Convention_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) was_VBD adopted_VVN at_IN the_DT 
Third_NP Session_NP of_IN the_DT →Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) to_TO the_DT 
UNFCCC_NN in_IN 1997_CD in_IN Kyoto_NP ,_, Japan_NP ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ 
commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO those_DT included_VVN in_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT 
Countries_NNS included_VVD in_IN →Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Protocol_NP (_( most_JJS OECD_NP 
countries_NNS and_CC →countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD 
to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ →anthropogenic_JJ →greenhouse-gas_NN emissions_NNS 
(_( specifically_RB →carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, →hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, →perfluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( PFCs_NP )_) and_CC sulfur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) )_) by_IN at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_RB 
1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT commitment_NN period_NN 2008_CD to_TO 2012._CD The_DT 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP entered_VVD into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005._CD

Life_NP Cycle_NP Climate_NN Performance_NP (_( LCCP_NP )_)

equivalent_JJ warming_NN impact_NN (_( TEWI_NP )_) ._SENT LCCP_NP also_RB takes_VVZ into_IN account_NN

Lifetime_NN 
Lifetime_NN is_VBZ a_DT general_JJ term_NN used_VVN for_IN various_JJ time_NN scales_NNS characterizing_VVG 
the_DT rates_NNS of_IN processes_NNS affecting_VVG the_DT concentration_NN of_IN 
trace_NN gases_NNS ._SENT The_DT following_VVG lifetimes_NNS may_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN :_: 
Turnover_NN time_NN (_( T_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT mass_NN (_( M_NP )_) of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT gaseous_JJ compound_NN in_IN the_DT →atmosphere_NN )_) and_CC the_DT total_NN 
rate_NN of_IN removal_NN (_( S_NP )_) from_IN the_DT reservoir_NN :_: T_NN =_SYM M_NP /_SYM S_NP ._SENT Separate_JJ turnover_NN 
times_NNS can_MD be_VB defined_VVN for_IN each_DT removal_NN process_NN ._SENT 
Adjustment_NN time_NN or_CC response_NN time_NN (_( Ta_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT time_NN scale_NN characterizing_VVG 
the_DT decay_NN of_IN an_DT instantaneous_JJ pulse_NN input_NN into_IN the_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT 
The_DT term_NN adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN to_TO characterize_VV the_DT 
adjustment_NN of_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN following_VVG a_DT step_NN change_NN in_IN 
the_DT source_NN strength_NN ._SENT Half-life_NN or_CC decay_NN constant_JJ is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO quantify_VV 
a_DT first-order_NN exponential_JJ decay_NN process_NN ._SENT See_VV :_: →Response_NN 
time_NN ,_, for_IN a_DT different_JJ definition_NN pertinent_JJ to_TO climate_NN variations_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT term_NN lifetime_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB used_VVN ,_, for_IN simplicity_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT surrogate_NN 
for_IN adjustment_NN time_NN ._SENT 
In_IN simple_JJ cases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN CFC-11_NP ,_, where_WRB the_DT global_JJ removal_NN

Ozone_NN Layer_NP

of_IN chlorine_NN and_CC bromine_NN compounds_NNS ._SENT Every_DT year_NN ,_, during_IN the_DT

as_IN refrigerators_NNS ,_, freezers_NNS and_CC air_NN conditioners_NNS ._SENT 
Relief_NP Valve_NP (_( Refrigeration_NP )_) 
A_DT device_NN that_WDT vents_VVZ refrigerant_JJ when_WRB the_DT pressure_NN in_IN a_DT →chiller_NN 
becomes_VVZ dangerously_RB high_JJ ._SENT Newer_JJR relief_NN valves_NNS have_VHP a_DT resealing_NN

Response_NP Time_NP (_( climate-system_NN )_) 
The_DT response_NN time_NN or_CC adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT time_NN needed_VVN for_IN 
the_DT →climate-system_NN or_CC its_PP$ components_NNS to_TO re-equilibrate_NNS to_TO a_DT 
new_JJ state_NN ,_, following_VVG a_DT forcing_VVG resulting_VVG from_IN external_JJ or_CC internal_JJ 
processes_NNS ._SENT Different_JJ components_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN can_MD 
have_VHP very_RB different_JJ response_NN times_NNS ._SENT The_DT response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT →_NN 
troposphere_NN is_VBZ relatively_RB short_JJ ,_, from_IN days_NNS to_TO weeks_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT 
response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT →stratosphere_NN is_VBZ typically_RB a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT oceans_NNS have_VHP much_RB longer_JJR response_NN times_NNS ,_, of_IN decades_NNS to_TO 
millennia_NNS ,_, because_IN of_IN their_PP$ large_JJ heat_NN capacity_NN ._SENT The_DT response_NN 
time_NN of_IN the_DT strongly_RB coupled_VVN surface-troposphere_NN system_NN is_VBZ 
mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, and_CC is_VBZ therefore_RB slow_RB compared_VVN 
with_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT biosphere_NN can_MD respond_VV 
quickly_RB ,_, for_IN example_NN to_TO droughts_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PP can_MD also_RB respond_VV very_RB 
slowly_RB to_TO other_JJ imposed_VVN changes_NNS ._SENT 
See_VV :_: →Lifetime_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT definition_NN of_IN response_NN time_NN in_IN relation_NN 
to_TO atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS ._SENT

Foraminifera_NP (_( planktonic_JJ )_)

Holocene_JJ

Holocene_JJ Climate_NN Optimum_NN 
The_DT Holocene_JJ Climate_NN Optimum_NN is_VBZ vague_JJ term_NN used_VVN to_TO denote_VV a_DT warm_JJ period_NN during_IN roughly_RB the_DT interval_NN 9_CD ,_, 000_CD to_TO 5_CD ,_, 000_CD years_NNS ago_RB ._SENT This_DT event_NN has_VHZ also_RB been_VBN known_VVN by_IN many_JJ other_JJ names_NNS ,_, including_VVG :_: Hypisthermal_NP ,_, Altithermal_NP ,_, Climatic_NP Optimum_NP ,_, Holocene_JJ Optimum_NP ,_, Holocene_JJ Thermal_NP Maximum_NP ,_, and_CC Holocene_JJ Megathermal_NP ._SENT In_IN reality_NN the_DT warming_NN was_VBD primarily_RB during_IN Northern_NP Hemisphere_NP summer_NN ,_, and_CC was_VBD not_RB synchronous_JJ across_IN the_DT hemisphere_NN ._SENT

Ice_NP Age_NP 
An_DT ice_NN age_NN or_CC glacial_JJ period_NN is_VBZ characterized_VVN by_IN a_DT long-term_JJ reduction_NN in_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN Earth’s_NP climate_NN ,_, resulting_VVG in_IN growth_NN of_IN continental_JJ ice_NN sheets_NNS and_CC mountain_NN glaciers_NNS (_( “_JJ glaciation_NN ”_NN )_) ._SENT 
Lake_NP Agassiz_NP 
Once_RB the_DT largest_JJS proglacial_JJ lake_NN in_IN North_NP America_NP ._SENT Evidence_NN of_IN glacial_JJ Lake_NP Agassiz_NP occurs_VVZ over_IN an_DT area_NN of_IN roughly_RB 365_CD ,_, 000_CD square_JJ miles_NNS ,_, an_DT area_NN five_CD times_NNS the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN North_NP Dakota_NP ,_, although_IN at_IN no_DT single_JJ time_NN did_VVD the_DT lake_NN ever_RB cover_VV this_DT entire_JJ area_NN ._SENT Ice_NN margin_NN positions_NNS and_CC lowering_VVG of_IN outlets_NNS by_IN erosion_NN combined_VVN to_TO limit_VV the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT lake_NN at_IN any_DT given_VVN time_NN ._SENT Glacial_JJ Lake_NP Agassiz_NP was_VBD the_DT latest_JJS in_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN proglacial_JJ lakes_NNS that_WDT must_MD have_VH formed_VVN in_IN the_DT Red_NP River_NP Valley_NP many_JJ times_NNS during_IN the_DT Ice_NP Age_NP ,_, each_DT time_NN north-draining_NN rivers_NNS were_VBD impounded_VVN by_IN ice_NN sheets_NNS spreading_VVG south_RB out_RB of_IN Canada_NP and_CC again_RB as_IN the_DT glaciers_NNS receded_VVD ._SENT

Megadrought_NNS

O-isotopes_NP [_SYM oxygen_NN isotope_NN ratio_NN ]_SYM 
Isotopes_NNS of_IN Oxygen_NP occur_VVP with_IN molecular_JJ weights_NNS of_IN 16_CD ,_, 17_CD and_CC 18_CD ,_, of_IN which_WDT 16_CD is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS abundant_JJ ,_, and_CC 18_CD the_DT next_JJ ._SENT Their_PP$ fractionation_NN during_IN phase_NN changes_NNS is_VBZ dependent_JJ on_IN temperature_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB the_DT ratio_NN of_IN oxygen-18_NN to_TO oxygen-16_NN in_IN forams_NNS ,_, coral_JJ skeletons_NNS ,_, ice_NN layers_NNS of_IN ice_NN sheets_NNS ,_, and_CC other_JJ types_NNS of_IN paleoclimatic_JJ samples_NNS can_MD be_VB related_VVN to_TO temperature_NN ._SENT

Radiometric_JJ dating_VVG 
A_DT technique_NN used_VVN to_TO determine_VV the_DT absolute_JJ age_NN of_IN materials_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN organic_JJ materials_NNS or_CC rocks_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT decay_NN rates_NNS of_IN naturally_RB occurring_VVG radioactive_JJ isotopes_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP the_DT decay_NN of_IN 14C_NP with_IN a_DT half-life_NN of_IN about_RB 5700_CD years_NNS ,_, or_CC the_DT decay_NN of_IN 231Pa_NP with_IN a_DT half-life_NN of_IN 32_CD ,_, 000_CD years_NNS ._SENT 
Sr_NP /_SYM Ca_JJ ratios_NNS

Activities_NNS Implemented_NP Jointly_NP (_( AIJ_NP )_) 
The_DT pilot_NN phase_NN for_IN Joint_NP Implementation_NP ,_, as_RB defined_VVN in_IN Article_NP 
.2_CD (_( a_DT )_) of_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ,_, which_WDT allows_VVZ for_IN project_NN activity_NN among_IN 
developed_JJ countries_NNS (_( and_CC their_PP$ companies_NNS )_) and_CC between_IN developed_VVN 
and_CC developing_VVG countries_NNS (_( and_CC their_PP$ companies_NNS )_) ._SENT AIJ_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN 
to_TO allow_VV parties_NNS to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP to_TO gain_VV experience_NN in_IN jointly_RB 
implemented_VVN projects_NNS ._SENT AIJ_NN under_IN the_DT pilot_NN phase_NN do_VVP not_RB lead_VV to_TO any_DT 
credits_NNS ._SENT Decisions_NNS remain_VVP about_IN the_DT future_NN of_IN AIJ_NP projects_NNS and_CC how_WRB 
they_PP may_MD relate_VV to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Mechanisms_NNS ._SENT As_IN a_DT simple_JJ form_NN of_IN 
tradable_JJ permits_NNS ,_, AIJ_NP and_CC other_JJ market-based_JJ schemes_NNS represent_VVP 
potential_JJ mechanisms_NNS for_IN stimulating_VVG additional_JJ resource_NN flows_VVZ for_IN 
reducing_VVG emissions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP ,_, and_NP 
Emissions_NNS Trading_NN ._SENT 
Actual_JJ net_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN removals_NNS by_IN sinks_NNS

implementation_NN of_IN the_DT project_NN activity_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN stems_VVZ from_IN the_DT Clean_NP 
Development_NP Mechanism_NP (_( CDM_NP )_) afforestation_NN and_CC reforestation_NN 
modalities_NNS and_CC procedures_NNS ._SENT

human_JJ systems_NNS against_IN actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate-change_NN effects_NNS ._SENT 
Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN adaptation_NN exist_VV ,_, e.g._FW anticipatory_JJ and_CC reactive_JJ ,_, 
private_JJ and_CC public_JJ ,_, and_CC autonomous_JJ and_CC planned_JJ ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP 
raising_VVG river_NN or_CC coastal_JJ dikes_NNS ,_, the_DT substitution_NN of_IN more_JJR temperatureshock_NN 
resistant_JJ plants_NNS for_IN sensitive_JJ ones_NNS ,_, etc._FW

Additionality_NN 
Reduction_NN in_IN emissions_NNS by_IN sources_NNS or_CC enhancement_NN of_IN removals_NNS by_IN 
sinks_NNS that_WDT is_VBZ additional_JJ to_TO any_DT that_WDT would_MD occur_VV in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN 
a_DT Joint_NP Implementation_NP (_( JI_NP )_) or_CC a_DT Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP 
(_( CDM_NP )_) project_NN activity_NN as_IN defined_VVN in_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP Articles_NPS on_RB 
JI_NP and_CC CDM_NP ._SENT This_DT definition_NN may_MD be_VB further_RBR broadened_VVN to_TO include_VV 
financial_JJ ,_, investment_NN ,_, technology_NN ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ additionality_NN ._SENT 
Under_IN financial_JJ additionality_NN ,_, the_DT project_NN activity_NN funding_NN is_VBZ 
additional_JJ to_TO existing_VVG Global_NP Environmental_NP Facility_NP ,_, other_JJ financial_JJ 
commitments_NNS of_IN parties_NNS included_VVN in_IN Annex_NP I_NP ,_, Official_NP Development_NP 
Assistance_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ systems_NNS of_IN cooperation_NN ._SENT Under_IN investment_NN 
additionality_NN ,_, the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT Emissions_NP Reduction_NP Unit_NP /_SYM Certified_NP 
Emission_NN Reduction_NP Unit_NP shall_MD significantly_RB improve_VV the_DT financial_JJ 
or_CC commercial_JJ viability_NN of_IN the_DT project_NN activity_NN ._SENT Under_IN technology_NN 
additionality_NN ,_, the_DT technology_NN used_VVN for_IN the_DT project_NN activity_NN shall_MD 
be_VB the_DT best_RBS available_JJ for_IN the_DT circumstances_NNS of_IN the_DT host_NN party_NN ._SENT 
Environmental_JJ additionality_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT environmental_JJ integrity_NN 
of_IN the_DT claimed_VVN amount_NN by_IN which_WDT greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS are_VBP 
reduced_VVN due_JJ to_TO a_DT project_NN relative_JJ to_TO its_PP$ baseline_NN ._SENT A_DT project_NN activity_NN 
is_VBZ further_RBR additional_JJ ,_, if_IN the_DT incentive_NN from_IN the_DT sale_NN of_IN emission_NN 
allowances_NNS helps_VVZ to_TO overcome_VV barriers_NNS to_TO its_PP$ implementation_NN ._SENT 
Aerosols_NNS 
A_DT collection_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, typically_RB between_IN 
.01_CD and_CC 10_CD μm_NN in_IN size_NN and_CC residing_VVG in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS 
several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ 
origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN several_JJ ways_NNS :_: directly_RB 
through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG radiation_NN ,_, and_CC indirectly_RB through_RB 
acting_VVG as_IN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS for_IN cloud_NN formation_NN or_CC modifying_VVG the_DT 
optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT

Ancillary_JJ benefits_NNS

be_VB paired_VVN with_IN positive_JJ side_NN effects_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN increased_VVN resource-use_NN

pollution_NN may_MD consider_VV greenhouse-gas_NN mitigation_NN an_DT ancillary_NN

Assigned_VVN Amount_NP (_( AA_NP )_) 
Under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, the_DT assigned_JJ amount_NN is_VBZ the_DT quantity_NN of_IN 
greenhouse-gas_NN emissions_NNS that_IN/that an_DT Annex_NP B_NP country_NN has_VHZ agreed_VVN to_TO 
as_IN its_PP$ ceiling_NN for_IN its_PP$ emissions_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN (_( 2008_CD 
to_TO 2012_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT AA_NP is_VBZ the_DT country’s_JJ total_JJ greenhouse-gas_NN emissions_NNS 
in_IN 1990_CD multiplied_VVN by_IN five_CD (_( for_IN the_DT five-year_JJ commitment_NN period_NN )_) 
and_CC by_IN the_DT percentage_NN it_PP agreed_VVD to_TO as_RB listed_VVN in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP (_( e.g._FW 92_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT EU_NP ;_: 93_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT USA_NP )_) ._SENT 
Assigned_VVN Amount_NP Unit_NP (_( AAU_NP )_)

calculated_VVN using_VVG the_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ ._SENT 
Backstop_NN technology_NN 
Models_NNS estimating_VVG mitigation_NN often_RB characterize_VV an_DT arbitrary_JJ carbonfree_NN 
technology_NN (_( often_RB for_IN power_NN generation_NN )_) that_WDT becomes_VVZ available_JJ 
in_IN the_DT future_NN in_IN unlimited_JJ supply_NN over_IN the_DT horizon_NN of_IN the_DT model_NN ._SENT This_DT 
allows_VVZ models_NNS to_TO explore_VV the_DT consequences_NNS and_CC importance_NN of_IN a_DT 
generic_JJ solution_NN technology_NN without_IN becoming_VVG enmeshed_VVN in_IN picking_VVG 
the_DT technology_NN ._SENT This_DT “_JJ backstop_NN ”_NN technology_NN might_MD be_VB a_DT nuclear_JJ 
technology_NN ,_, fossil_JJ technology_NN with_IN capture_NN and_CC sequestration_NN ,_, 
solar_JJ ,_, or_CC something_NN as_IN yet_RB unimagined_VVN ._SENT The_DT backstop_NN technology_NN is_VBZ 
typically_RB assumed_VVN either_CC not_RB to_TO currently_RB exist_VV ,_, or_CC to_TO exist_VV only_RB at_IN 
higher_JJR costs_NNS relative_JJ to_TO conventional_JJ alternatives_NNS ._SENT

Barrier_NN 
Any_DT obstacle_NN to_TO reaching_VVG a_DT goal_NN ,_, adaptation_NN or_CC mitigation_NN potential_NN 
that_DT can_MD be_VB overcome_VVN or_CC attenuated_VVN by_IN a_DT policy_NN ,_, programme_NN ,_, or_CC 
measure_NN ._SENT Barrier_NN removal_NN includes_VVZ correcting_VVG market_NN failures_NNS 
directly_RB or_CC reducing_VVG the_DT transactions_NNS costs_NNS in_IN the_DT public_JJ and_CC private_JJ 
sectors_NNS by_IN e.g._FW improving_VVG institutional_JJ capacity_NN ,_, reducing_VVG risk_NN 
and_CC uncertainty_NN ,_, facilitating_VVG market_NN transactions_NNS ,_, and_CC enforcing_VVG 
regulatory_JJ policies_NNS ._SENT 
Baseline_NN

as_IN a_DT reference_NN in_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN intervention_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT

A_DT measurable_JJ variable_NN used_VVN as_IN a_DT baseline_NN or_CC reference_NN in_IN evaluating_VVG 
the_DT performance_NN of_IN an_DT organization_NN ._SENT Benchmarks_NNS may_MD he_PP drawn_VVN 
from_IN internal_JJ experience_NN ,_, that_WDT of_IN other_JJ organizations_NNS or_CC from_IN legal_JJ 
requirement_NN and_CC are_VBP often_RB used_VVN to_TO gauge_VV changes_NNS in_IN performance_NN 
over_IN time_NN ._SENT 
Benefit_NN transfer_NN

Biochemical_NP Oxygen_NP Demand_NN (_( BOD_NP )_)

(_( bacteria_NNS )_) in_IN the_DT bio-chemical_JJ oxidation_NN of_IN organic_JJ and_CC inorganic_JJ

Biological_JJ options_NNS 
Biological_JJ options_NNS for_IN mitigation_NN of_IN climate-change_NN involve_VVP one_CD or_CC

carbon_NN pool_NN ,_, thereby_RB preventing_VVG CO2_JJ emissions_NNS to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN ;_:

Carbon_NN cycle_NN

Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
CO2_NP is_VBZ a_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT by-product_NN of_IN burning_VVG fossil_NN 
fuels_NNS or_CC biomass_NN ,_, of_IN land-use_NN changes_NNS and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN that_WDT affects_VVZ 
Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT 
other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB it_PP has_VHZ a_DT Global_NP 
Warming_VVG Potential_JJ of_IN 1._CD 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN fertilization_NN 
The_DT enhancement_NN of_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN plants_NNS because_IN of_IN increased_VVN 
atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP concentration_NN ._SENT Depending_VVG on_IN their_PP$ mechanism_NN of_IN 
photosynthesis_NN ,_, certain_JJ types_NNS of_IN plants_NNS are_VBP more_RBR sensitive_JJ to_TO changes_NNS 
in_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_JJ concentration_NN than_IN others_NNS ._SENT 
Carbon_NN intensity_NN 
The_DT amount_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN CO2_NP per_IN unit_NN of_IN GDP_NP ._SENT 
Carbon_NN leakage_NN 
The_DT part_NN of_IN emissions_NNS reductions_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS that_WDT may_MD 
be_VB offset_VVN by_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT emissions_NNS in_IN the_DT non-constrained_JJ 
countries_NNS above_IN their_PP$ baseline_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT This_DT can_MD occur_VV through_IN (_( 1_LS )_)

regions_NNS ;_: (_( 2_LS )_) increased_VVN consumption_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS in_IN these_DT regions_NNS 
through_IN decline_NN in_IN the_DT international_JJ price_NN of_IN oil_NN and_CC gas_NN triggered_VVD 
by_IN lower_JJR demand_NN for_IN these_DT energies_NNS ;_: and_CC (_( 3_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN incomes_NNS 
(_( thus_RB in_IN energy_NN demand_NN )_) because_IN of_IN better_JJR terms_NNS of_IN trade_NN ._SENT Leakage_NN 
also_RB refers_VVZ to_TO GHG-related_JJ effects_NNS of_IN GHG-emission_NP reduction_NN or_CC 
CO2-sequestration_NN project_NN activities_NNS that_WDT occur_VVP outside_IN the_DT project_NN 
boundaries_NNS and_CC that_WDT are_VBP measurable_JJ and_CC attributable_JJ to_TO the_DT activity_NN ._SENT 
On_IN most_JJS occasions_NNS ,_, leakage_NN is_VBZ understood_VVN as_IN counteracting_VVG the_DT 
initial_JJ activity_NN ._SENT Nevertheless_RB ,_, there_EX may_MD be_VB situations_NNS where_WRB effects_NNS 
attributable_JJ to_TO the_DT activity_NN outside_IN the_DT project_NN area_NN lead_NN to_TO GHGemission_NP 
reductions_NNS ._SENT These_DT are_VBP commonly_RB called_VVN spill-over_NN ._SENT While_NN 
(_( negative_JJ )_) leakage_NN leads_VVZ to_TO a_DT discount_NN of_IN emission_NN reductions_NNS as_RB 
verified_VVN ,_, positive_JJ spill-over_NN may_MD not_RB in_IN all_DT cases_NNS be_VB accounted_VVN for_IN ._SENT 
Carbon_NN pool_NN

may_MD choose_VV not_RB to_TO account_VV one_CD or_CC more_JJR carbon_NN pools_NNS if_IN they_PP provide_VVP 
transparent_JJ and_CC verifiable_JJ information_NN showing_VVG that_IN/that the_DT choice_NN will_MD 
not_RB increase_VV the_DT expected_VVN net_JJ anthropogenic_JJ GHG_NP removals_NNS by_IN 
sinks_NNS ._SENT 
Carbon_NN price_NN 
What_WP has_VHZ to_TO be_VB paid_VVN (_( to_TO some_DT public_JJ authority_NN as_IN a_DT tax_NN rate_NN ,_, or_CC on_IN 
some_DT emission_NN permit_NN exchange_NN )_) for_IN the_DT emission_NN of_IN 1_CD tonne_NN of_IN CO2_NP 
into_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT models_NNS and_CC this_DT Report_NP ,_, the_DT carbon_NN price_NN 
is_VBZ the_DT social_JJ cost_NN of_IN avoiding_VVG an_DT additional_JJ unit_NN of_IN CO2_NP equivalent_NN

in_IN this_DT Report_NP as_IN a_DT cut-off_NN rate_NN for_IN marginal_JJ abatement_NN costs_NNS in_IN the_DT

Cap_NN 
Mandated_VVN restraint_NN as_IN an_DT upper_JJ limit_NN on_IN emissions_NNS ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP mandates_VVZ emissions_NNS caps_NNS in_IN a_DT scheduled_VVN timeframe_NN on_IN the_DT 
anthropogenic_JJ GHG_NP emissions_NNS released_VVN by_IN Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS ._SENT By_IN 
-2012_CD the_DT EU_NP e.g._FW must_MD reduce_VV its_PP$ CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN 
six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO a_DT level_NN 8_CD %_NN lower_JJR than_IN the_DT 1990-level_JJ ._SENT

Chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS covered_VVN under_IN the_DT 1987_CD Montreal_NP Protocol_NP and_CC used_VVN 
for_IN refrigeration_NN ,_, air_NN conditioning_NN ,_, packaging_NN ,_, insulation_NN ,_, solvents_NNS ,_, 
or_CC aerosol_NN propellants_NNS ._SENT Because_IN they_PP are_VBP not_RB destroyed_VVN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR 
atmosphere_NN ,_, CFCs_NNS drift_VVP into_IN the_DT upper_JJ atmosphere_NN where_WRB ,_, given_VVN 
suitable_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, they_PP break_VVP down_RP ozone_NN ._SENT These_DT gases_NNS are_VBP being_VBG 
replaced_VVN by_IN other_JJ compounds_NNS ,_, including_VVG hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NNS 
and_CC hydrofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP greenhouse_NN gases_NNS covered_VVN under_IN 
the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP (_( CDM_NP )_) 
Defined_VVN in_IN Article_NP 12_CD of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, the_DT CDM_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN 
to_TO meet_VV two_CD objectives_NNS :_: (_( 1_LS )_) to_TO assist_VV parties_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP 
I_PP in_IN achieving_VVG sustainable_JJ development_NN and_CC in_IN contributing_VVG to_TO 
the_DT ultimate_JJ objective_NN of_IN the_DT convention_NN ;_: and_CC (_( 2_LS )_) to_TO assist_VV parties_NNS 
included_VVN in_IN Annex_NP I_NP in_IN achieving_VVG compliance_NN with_IN their_PP$ quantified_VVN 
emission_NN limitation_NN and_CC reduction_NN commitments_NNS ._SENT Certified_NP Emission_NP 
Reduction_NN Units_NNS from_IN CDM_NP projects_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN Non-Annex_NP 
I_PP countries_NNS that_WDT limit_VVP or_CC reduce_VVP GHG_NP emissions_NNS ,_, when_WRB certified_VVN 
by_IN operational_JJ entities_NNS designated_VVN by_IN Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS /_SYM 
Meeting_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS ,_, can_MD be_VB accrued_VVN to_TO the_DT investor_NN (_( government_NN 
or_CC industry_NN )_) from_IN parties_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP ._SENT A_DT share_NN of_IN the_DT proceeds_NNS from_IN 
certified_JJ project_NN activities_NNS is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO cover_VV administrative_JJ expenses_NNS 
as_RB well_RB as_RB to_TO assist_VV developing_VVG country_NN parties_NNS that_WDT are_VBP particularly_RB 
vulnerable_JJ to_TO the_DT adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN to_TO meet_VV the_DT costs_NNS 
of_IN adaptation_NN ._SENT 


Climate_NN Change_NP (_( CC_NP )_) 
climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD 
be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM 
or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS ,_, and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ 
period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ 
to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO persistent_JJ 
anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN 
land_NN use_NN ._SENT 
Note_NN that_IN/that UNFCCC_NP ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ “_JJ climate-change_NN ”_NN as_IN “_NN a_DT 
change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ 
activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC 
which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVD over_RP 
comparable_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ”_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN 
between_IN “_JJ climate-change_NN ”_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG 
the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, and_CC “_JJ climate_NN variability_NN ”_NN attributable_JJ 
to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN feedback_NN 
An_DT interaction_NN mechanism_NN between_IN processes_NNS in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN 
is_VBZ a_DT climate_NN feedback_NN when_WRB the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT initial_JJ process_NN triggers_NNS 
changes_NNS in_IN secondary_JJ processes_NNS that_WDT in_RB turn_VVP influence_VV the_DT initial_JJ 
one_CD ._SENT A_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN intensifies_VVZ the_DT initial_JJ process_NN ;_: a_DT negative_JJ 
feedback_NN reduces_VVZ the_DT initial_JJ process_NN ._SENT Example_NN of_IN a_DT positive_JJ climate_NN 
feedback_NN :_: higher_JJR temperatures_NNS as_IN initial_JJ process_NN cause_NN melting_VVG of_IN 
the_DT arctic_JJ ice_NN leading_VVG to_TO less_JJR reflection_NN of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, what_WP leads_VVZ 
to_TO higher_JJR temperatures_NNS ._SENT Example_NN of_IN a_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN :_: higher_JJR 
temperatures_NNS increase_VVP the_DT amount_NN of_IN cloud_NN cover_NN (_( thickness_NN or_CC 
extent_NN )_) that_WDT could_MD reduce_VV incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN and_CC so_RB limit_VV the_DT 
increase_NN in_IN temperature_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
In_IN IPCC_NP Reports_NP ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT 
equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN annual_JJ mean_JJ global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ CO2-equivalent_NN 
concentration_NN ._SENT The_DT evaluation_NN of_IN the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
is_VBZ expensive_JJ and_CC often_RB hampered_VVN by_IN computational_JJ constraints_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ a_DT related_JJ measure_NN that_RB 
circumvents_VVZ the_DT computational_JJ problem_NN by_IN avoiding_VVG the_DT requirement_NN 
of_IN equilibrium_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN for_IN evolving_VVG 
non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT 
feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN 
and_CC climate_NN state_NN ._SENT The_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT 
equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ mean_JJ global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( K_NP /_SYM W_NP /_SYM m2_NN )_) 
The_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ surface_NN 
temperature_NN ,_, averaged_VVN over_IN a_DT 20-year_JJ period_NN ,_, centred_VVN at_IN the_DT time_NN 
of_IN CO2_NP doubling_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, at_IN year_NN 70_CD in_IN a_DT 1_CD %_NN per_IN year_NN compound_NN CO2_NP 
increase_NN experiment_NN with_IN a_DT global_JJ coupled_VVN climate_NN model_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT 
measure_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN and_CC rapidity_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN temperature_NN 
response_NN to_TO greenhouse_NN gas_NN forcing_VVG ._SENT 
Climate_NN threshold_NN 
The_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT atmospheric_JJ concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS triggers_VVZ a_DT significant_JJ climatic_JJ or_CC environmental_JJ event_NN ,_, which_WDT 
is_VBZ considered_VVN unalterable_JJ ,_, such_JJ as_IN widespread_JJ bleaching_VVG of_IN corals_NNS or_CC 
a_DT collapse_NN of_IN oceanic_JJ circulation_NN systems_NNS ._SENT 
CO2-equivalent_JJ concentration_NN 
The_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ 
amount_NN of_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG as_IN a_DT given_VVN mixture_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
and_CC other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN 
The_DT amount_NN of_IN CO2_NP emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ radiative_JJ 
forcing_VVG as_IN an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT well_RB mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, or_CC a_DT 
mixture_NN of_IN well_RB mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, all_RB multiplied_VVN with_IN their_PP$ 
respective_JJ Global_NP Warming_NP Potentials_NP to_TO take_VV into_IN account_NN the_DT 
differing_VVG times_NNS they_PP remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Co-benefits_NP 
The_DT benefits_NNS of_IN policies_NNS implemented_VVN for_IN various_JJ reasons_NNS at_IN the_DT 
same_JJ time_NN ,_, acknowledging_VVG that_IN/that most_JJS policies_NNS designed_VVN to_TO address_VV 
greenhouse_NN gas_NN mitigation_NN have_VHP other_JJ ,_, often_RB at_IN least_JJS equally_RB 
important_JJ ,_, rationales_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, related_VVN to_TO objectives_NNS of_IN development_NN ,_, 
sustainability_NN ,_, and_CC equity_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT term_NN co-impact_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN in_IN a_DT 
more_RBR generic_JJ sense_NN to_TO cover_VV both_DT positive_JJ and_CC negative_JJ side_NN of_IN the_DT 
benefits_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB ancillary_JJ benefits_NNS ._SENT 
Co-generation_NN 
The_DT use_NN of_IN waste_NN heat_NN from_IN thermal_JJ electricity-generation_NN plants_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT heat_NN is_VBZ e.g._FW condensing_VVG heat_NN from_IN steam_NN turbines_NNS or_CC hot_JJ flue_NN 
gases_NNS exhausted_VVN from_IN gas_NN turbines_NNS ,_, for_IN industrial_JJ use_NN ,_, buildings_NNS or_CC 
district_NN heating_NN ._SENT Synonym_NN for_IN Combined_NP Heat_NP and_CC Power_NP (_( CHP_NP )_) 
generation_NN ._SENT 
Combined-cycle_NN Gas_NP Turbine_NP (_( CCGT_NP )_) 
Power_NN plant_NN that_WDT combines_VVZ two_CD processes_NNS for_IN generating_VVG electricity_NN ._SENT 
First_RB ,_, gas_NN or_CC light_JJ fuel_NN oil_NN feeds_VVZ a_DT gas_NN turbine_NN that_WDT inevitably_RB exhausts_VVZ 
hot_JJ flue_NN gases_NNS (_( >_SYM 800_CD °_SYM C_NP )_) ._SENT Second_RB ,_, heat_NN recovered_VVD from_IN these_DT gases_NNS ,_, 
with_IN additional_JJ firing_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT source_NN for_IN producing_VVG steam_NN that_WDT drives_VVZ a_DT 
steam_NN turbine_NN ._SENT The_DT turbines_NNS rotate_VVP separate_JJ alternators_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP becomes_VVZ an_DT integrated_JJ CCGT_NP when_WRB the_DT fuel_NN is_VBZ syngas_NN from_IN a_DT 
coal_NN or_CC biomass_NN gasification_NN reactor_NN with_IN exchange_NN of_IN energy_NN flows_NNS 
between_IN the_DT gasification_NN and_CC CCGT_NP plants_NNS ._SENT

(_( 1995_CD )_) ,_, followed_VVN by_IN 2.Geneva_JJ (_( 1996_CD )_) ,_, 3.Kyoto_NP (_( 1997_CD )_) ,_, 4.Buenos_NP

Cost_NN 
The_DT consumption_NN of_IN resources_NNS such_JJ as_IN labor_NN time_NN ,_, capital_NN ,_, materials_NNS ,_,

resources_NNS are_VBP valued_VVN at_IN their_PP$ opportunity_NN cost_NN ,_, being_VBG the_DT value_NN of_IN 
the_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ alternative_JJ use_NN of_IN the_DT resources_NNS ._SENT Costs_NNS are_VBP defined_VVN 
in_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN ways_NNS and_CC under_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS that_WDT affect_VVP 
their_PP$ value_NN 
Cost_NN types_NNS include_VVP :_: administrative_JJ costs_NNS of_IN planning_NN ,_, management_NN ,_, 
monitoring_NN ,_, audits_NN ,_, accounting_NN ,_, reporting_VVG ,_, clerical_JJ activities_NNS ,_, 
etc._FW associated_VVN with_IN a_DT project_NN or_CC programme_NN ;_: damage_NN costs_VVZ to_TO

and_CC regulation_NN ,_, capacity_NN building_NN efforts_NNS ,_, information_NN ,_, training_VVG and_NP 
education_NN ,_, etc._FW to_TO put_VV a_DT policy_NN into_IN place_NN ;_: private_JJ costs_NNS are_VBP carried_VVN 


by_IN individuals_NNS ,_, companies_NNS or_CC other_JJ private_JJ entities_NNS that_WDT undertake_VVP the_DT 
action_NN ,_, where_WRB social_JJ costs_NNS include_VVP additionally_RB the_DT external_JJ costs_NNS on_IN 
the_DT environment_NN and_CC on_IN society_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ._SENT 
Costs_NNS can_MD be_VB expressed_VVN as_IN total_JJ ,_, average_JJ (_( unit_NN ,_, specific_JJ )_) being_VBG the_DT 
total_NN divided_VVN by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN units_NNS of_IN the_DT item_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT cost_NN 
is_VBZ being_VBG assessed_VVN ,_, and_CC marginal_JJ or_CC incremental_JJ costs_NNS as_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN 
the_DT last_JJ additional_JJ unit_NN ._SENT 
The_DT perspectives_NNS adopted_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN are_VBP :_: Project_NN level_NN considers_VVZ a_DT 
“_JJ standalone_JJ ”_NN activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ assumed_VVN not_RB to_TO have_VH significant_JJ indirect_JJ 
economic_JJ impacts_NNS on_IN markets_NNS and_CC prices_NNS (_( both_DT demand_NN and_CC supply_NN )_) 
beyond_IN the_DT activity_NN itself_PP ._SENT The_DT activity_NN can_MD be_VB the_DT implementation_NN of_IN 
specific_JJ technical_JJ facilities_NNS ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, demand-side_JJ regulations_NNS ,_, 
information_NN efforts_NNS ,_, technical_JJ standards_NNS ,_, etc._FW Technology_NP level_NN 
considers_VVZ a_DT specific_JJ greenhouse-gas_NN mitigation_NN technology_NN ,_, usually_RB 
with_IN several_JJ applications_NNS in_IN different_JJ projects_NNS and_CC sectors_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
literature_NN on_IN technologies_NNS covers_VVZ their_PP$ technical_JJ characteristics_NNS ,_,

and_CC matures_VVZ ._SENT Sector_NN level_NN considers_VVZ sector_NN policies_NNS in_IN a_DT “_JJ partialequilibrium_NN ”_NN 
context_NN ,_, for_IN which_WDT other_JJ sectors_NNS and_CC the_DT macroeconomic_JJ 
variables_NNS are_VBP assumed_VVN to_TO be_VB as_RB given_VVN ._SENT The_DT policies_NNS can_MD include_VV 
economic_JJ instruments_NNS related_VVN to_TO prices_NNS ,_, taxes_NNS ,_, trade_NN ,_, and_CC financing_NN ,_, 
specific_JJ large-scale_JJ investment_NN projects_NNS ,_, and_CC demand-side_JJ regulation_NN 
efforts_NNS ._SENT Macroeconomic_JJ level_NN considers_VVZ the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN policies_NNS on_IN

all_DT sectors_NNS and_CC markets_NNS ._SENT The_DT policies_NNS include_VVP all_DT sorts_NNS of_IN economic_JJ

investment_NN programmes_NNS ,_, and_CC technology_NN and_CC innovation_NN policies_NNS ._SENT

Desertification_NN

Combat_NN Desertification_NN defines_VVZ land_NN degradation_NN as_IN a_DT reduction_NN or_CC

Discounting_NN 
A_DT mathematical_JJ operation_NN making_VVG monetary_JJ (_( or_CC other_JJ )_) amounts_NNS

across_IN time_NN ._SENT The_DT operator_NN uses_VVZ a_DT fixed_VVN or_CC possibly_RB time-varying_JJ

less_JJR today_NN ._SENT In_IN a_DT descriptive_JJ discounting_NN approach_NN one_CD accepts_VVZ the_DT

day-to-day_JJ decisions_NNS (_( private_JJ discount_NN rate_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN a_DT prescriptive_JJ 
(_( ethical_JJ or_CC normative_JJ )_) discounting_NN approach_NN the_DT discount_NN rate_NN is_VBZ 
fixed_VVN from_IN a_DT social_JJ perspective_NN ,_, e.g._FW based_VVN on_IN an_DT ethical_JJ judgement_NN 
about_IN the_DT interests_NNS of_IN future_JJ generations_NNS (_( social_JJ discount_NN rate_NN )_) ._SENT

Emissions_NNS Direct_NP /_SYM Indirect_NN 
Direct_JJ emissions_NNS or_CC “_JJ point_NN of_IN emission_NN ”_NN are_VBP defined_VVN at_IN the_DT point_NN 
in_IN the_DT energy_NN chain_NN where_WRB they_PP are_VBP released_VVN and_CC are_VBP attributed_VVN to_TO 
that_DT point_NN in_IN the_DT energy_NN chain_NN ,_, whether_IN a_DT sector_NN ,_, a_DT technology_NN or_CC an_DT

discharge_NN pollution_NN -_: in_IN this_DT case_NN an_DT amount_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
emissions_NNS -_: can_MD be_VB exchanged_VVN through_IN either_CC a_DT free_JJ or_CC a_DT controlled_VVN

or_CC group_NN of_IN countries_NNS within_IN a_DT framework_NN of_IN maximum_JJ total_NN

of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP )_) project_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Certified_NP Emission_NP

exceeded_VVD ._SENT Many_JJ standards_NNS use_VVP emission_NN factors_NNS in_IN their_PP$ prescription_NN 
and_CC therefore_RB do_VVP not_RB impose_VV absolute_JJ limits_NNS on_IN the_DT emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Emissions_NNS trading_NN 
A_DT market-based_JJ approach_NN to_TO achieving_VVG environmental_JJ objectives_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP allows_VVZ those_DT reducing_VVG GHG_NP emissions_NNS below_IN their_PP$ emission_NN cap_NN 
to_TO use_VV or_CC trade_VV the_DT excess_JJ reductions_NNS to_TO offset_VV emissions_NNS at_IN another_DT 
source_NN inside_IN or_CC outside_IN the_DT country_NN ._SENT In_IN general_NN ,_, trading_NN can_MD occur_VV at_IN 
the_DT intra-company_NN ,_, domestic_JJ ,_, and_CC international_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT The_DT Second_NP 
Assessment_NP Report_NP by_IN the_DT IPCC_NP adopted_VVD the_DT convention_NN of_IN using_VVG 
permits_NNS for_IN domestic_JJ trading_NN systems_NNS and_CC quotas_NNS for_IN international_JJ 
trading_NN systems_NNS ._SENT Emissions_NNS trading_NN under_IN Article_NP 17_CD of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP is_VBZ a_DT tradable_JJ quota_NN system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT assigned_VVN amounts_NNS 
calculated_VVN from_IN the_DT emission_NN reduction_NN and_CC limitation_NN commitments_NNS 
listed_VVN in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Protocol_NP ._SENT

Energy_NN 
The_DT amount_NN of_IN work_NN or_CC heat_NN delivered_VVN ._SENT Energy_NP is_VBZ classified_VVN in_IN a_DT 
variety_NN of_IN types_NNS and_CC becomes_VVZ useful_JJ to_TO human_JJ ends_NNS when_WRB it_PP flows_VVZ 
from_IN one_CD place_NN to_TO another_DT or_CC is_VBZ converted_VVN from_IN one_CD type_NN into_IN another_DT ._SENT 
Primary_JJ energy_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN energy_NN sources_NNS )_) is_VBZ the_DT energy_NN 
embodied_VVN in_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, coal_NN ,_, crude_JJ oil_NN ,_, natural_JJ gas_NN ,_, 
uranium_NN )_) that_WDT has_VHZ not_RB undergone_VVN any_DT anthropogenic_JJ conversion_NN ._SENT It_PP 
is_VBZ transformed_VVN into_IN secondary_JJ energy_NN by_IN cleaning_VVG (_( natural_JJ gas_NN )_) ,_, 
refining_NN (_( oil_NN in_IN oil_NN products_NNS )_) or_CC by_IN conversion_NN into_IN electricity_NN or_CC heat_NN ._SENT 
When_WRB the_DT secondary_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ delivered_VVN at_IN the_DT end-use_NN facilities_NNS it_PP 
is_VBZ called_VVN final_JJ energy_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, electricity_NN at_IN the_DT wall_NN outlet_NN )_) ,_, where_WRB it_PP 
becomes_VVZ usable_JJ energy_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, light_JJ )_) ._SENT Daily_RB ,_, the_DT sun_NN supplies_VVZ large_JJ 
quantities_NNS of_IN energy_NN as_IN rainfall_NN ,_, winds_NNS ,_, radiation_NN ,_, etc._FW Some_DT share_NN 
is_VBZ stored_VVN in_IN biomass_NN or_CC rivers_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB harvested_VVN by_IN men_NNS ._SENT Some_RB 
share_NN is_VBZ directly_RB usable_JJ such_JJ as_IN daylight_NN ,_, ventilation_NN or_CC ambient_JJ heat_NN ._SENT 
Renewable_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN from_IN the_DT continuing_JJ or_CC repetitive_JJ 
currents_NNS of_IN energy_NN occurring_VVG in_IN the_DT natural_JJ environment_NN and_CC includes_VVZ 
non-carbon_NN technologies_NNS such_JJ as_IN solar_JJ energy_NN ,_, hydropower_NN ,_, wind_VVP ,_, 
tide_NN and_CC waves_NNS and_CC geothermal_JJ heat_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN carbon-neutral_NN 
technologies_NNS such_JJ as_IN biomass_NN ._SENT Embodied_VVN energy_NN is_VBZ the_DT energy_NN used_VVD 
to_TO produce_VV a_DT material_NN substance_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN processed_JJ metals_NNS or_CC building_NN 
materials_NNS )_) ,_, taking_VVG into_IN account_NN energy_NN used_VVN at_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN 
facility_NN (_( zero_CD order_NN )_) ,_, energy_NN used_VVN in_IN producing_VVG the_DT materials_NNS that_WDT are_VBP 
used_VVN in_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN facility_NN (_( first_JJ order_NN )_) ,_, and_CC so_RB on_IN ._SENT

activity_NN to_TO its_PP$ energy_NN input_NN ._SENT

or_CC final_JJ energy_NN use_NN to_TO Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB specific_JJ

Environmentally_RB sustainable_JJ technologies_NNS

Externality_NN /_SYM External_NP cost_NN /_SYM External_NP benefit_NN 
Externalities_NNS arise_VVP from_IN a_DT human_JJ activity_NN ,_, when_WRB agents_NNS responsible_JJ

others’_JJ production_NN and_CC consumption_NN possibilities_NNS ,_, while_IN there_EX exists_VVZ

are_VBP external_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT When_WRB positive_JJ they_PP are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_RB external_JJ

Forest_NP 
Defined_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP as_IN a_DT minimum_JJ area_NN of_IN land_NN of_IN 
.05-1.0_CD ha_NP with_IN tree-crown_NN cover_NN (_( or_CC equivalent_JJ stocking_VVG level_NN )_)

forest_NN ,_, as_RB are_VBP areas_NNS normally_RB forming_VVG part_NN of_IN the_DT forest_NN area_NN that_WDT are_VBP

General_JJ circulation_NN (_( climate_NN )_) model_NN (_( GCM_NP )_) 
A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT 
physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ 
interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, and_CC accounting_NN for_IN all_DT or_CC some_DT 
of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD be_VB represented_VVN 
by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ,_, i.e._FW for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC 
combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, 
differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT 
extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP 
explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT parameters_NNS are_VBP 
assessed_VVN empirically_RB ._SENT Coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN /_SYM ocean_NN /_SYM sea-ice_JJ General_NP 
Circulation_NN Models_NNS provide_VVP a_DT comprehensive_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT 
climate-system_NN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS 
with_IN active_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT

Global_NP Environmental_NP Facility_NP (_( GEF_NP )_) 
The_DT Global_NP Environment_NP Facility_NP (_( GEF_NP )_) ,_, established_VVN in_IN 1991_CD ,_, helps_VVZ 
developing_VVG countries_NNS fund_NN projects_NNS and_CC programmes_NNS that_WDT protect_VV 
the_DT global_JJ environment_NN ._SENT GEF_NP grants_VVZ support_NN projects_NNS related_VVN to_TO 
biodiversity_NN ,_, climate-change_NN ,_, international_JJ waters_NNS ,_, land_NN degradation_NN ,_, 
the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ,_, and_CC persistent_JJ organic_JJ pollutants_NNS 
Global_JJ warming_NN 
Global_JJ warming_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN ,_, observed_VVD or_CC 
projected_VVN ,_, in_IN global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, as_RB one_CD of_IN the_DT consequences_NNS 
of_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG caused_VVN by_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) 
An_DT index_NN ,_, based_VVN upon_IN radiative_JJ properties_NNS of_IN well_RB mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS ,_, measuring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN 
well_RB mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN in_IN today’s_NN atmosphere_NN integrated_VVN over_RP 
a_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN CO2_NP ._SENT The_DT GWP_NP represents_VVZ 
the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN that_IN/that these_DT 
gases_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ relative_JJ effectiveness_NN in_IN 
absorbing_VVG outgoing_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP is_VBZ based_VVN 
on_IN GWPs_NP from_IN pulse_NN emissions_NNS over_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN frame_NN ._SENT 
Green_JJ accounting_NN 
Attempts_NNS to_TO integrate_VV into_IN macroeconomic_JJ studies_NNS a_DT broader_JJR set_VVN of_IN

development_NN oriented_VVD policy_NN aspects_NNS ._SENT Green_JJ accounting_NN includes_VVZ 
both_CC monetary_JJ valuations_NNS that_WDT attempt_VVP to_TO calculate_VV a_DT ‘green_NN national_JJ 
product’_NN with_IN the_DT economic_JJ damage_NN by_IN pollutants_NNS subtracted_VVN from_IN the_DT 
national_JJ product_NN ,_, and_CC accounting_NN systems_NNS that_WDT include_VVP quantitative_JJ 
non-monetary_JJ pollution_NN ,_, depletion_NN and_CC other_JJ data_NNS ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN effect_NN 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS effectively_RB absorb_VVP infrared_JJ radiation_NN ,_, emitted_VVN 
by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP due_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ 
gases_NNS and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ emitted_VVN to_TO all_DT sides_NNS ,_, 
including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS 
trap_NN heat_NN within_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT 
greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT 
Thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ strongly_RB coupled_VVN 
to_TO the_DT temperature_NN at_IN the_DT altitude_NN at_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ emitted_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
troposphere_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN generally_RB decreases_VVZ with_IN height_NN ._SENT 
Effectively_RB ,_, infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN to_TO space_NN originates_VVZ from_IN an_DT 
altitude_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_IN average_NN ,_, –_NP 19_CD °_SYM C_NP ,_, in_IN balance_NN with_IN 
the_DT net_JJ incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN is_VBZ kept_VVN 
at_IN a_DT much_RB higher_JJR temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_IN average_NN ,_, +14_NN °_SYM C_NP ._SENT 
An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT 
increased_VVN infrared_JJ opacity_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC therefore_RB to_TO an_DT 
effective_JJ radiation_NN into_IN space_NN from_IN a_DT higher_JJR altitude_NN at_IN a_DT lower_JJR 
temperature_NN ._SENT This_DT causes_VVZ a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG that_IN/that leads_NNS to_TO an_DT 
enhancement_NN of_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ enhanced_JJ 
greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT 


Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
both_DT natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN at_IN 
specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN infrared_JJ radiation_NN 
emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT 
property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN 
(_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT earth’s_NN atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorineand_NN 
bromine-containing_NN substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP 
Protocol_NP ._SENT Besides_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN and_CC methane_NN ,_, the_DT 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN ,_, 
hydrofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS ._SENT 
Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP (_( GDP_NP )_) 
The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, at_IN purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT resident_NN 
and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT taxes_NNS and_CC 
minus_CC any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT products_NNS in_IN 
a_DT country_NN or_CC a_DT geographic_JJ region_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN ,_, normally_RB one_CD 
year_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG for_IN depreciation_NN of_IN fabricated_VVN 
assets_NNS or_CC depletion_NN and_CC degradation_NN of_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT 
Gross_NP National_NP Product_NP (_( GNP_NP )_)

domestic_JJ and_CC foreign_JJ sources_NNS claimed_VVN by_IN residents_NNS ._SENT GNP_NP comprises_VVZ 
Gross_JJ Domestic_JJ Product_NN plus_CC net_JJ receipts_NNS of_IN primary_JJ income_NN from_IN 
non-resident_JJ income_NN ._SENT 
Gross_NP World_NP Product_NP 
An_DT aggregation_NN of_IN the_DT individual_JJ country’s_NN Gross_NP Domestic_NP Products_NPS 
to_TO obtain_VV the_DT sum_NN for_IN the_DT world_NN ._SENT

Governance_NN 
The_DT way_NN government_NN is_VBZ understood_VVN has_VHZ changed_VVN in_IN response_NN to_TO 
social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ changes_NNS over_IN recent_JJ decades_NNS ._SENT 
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT corresponding_JJ shift_NN from_IN government_NN defined_VVN strictly_RB 
by_IN the_DT nation-state_NN to_TO a_DT more_RBR inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN governance_NN ,_, 
recognizing_VVG the_DT contributions_NNS of_IN various_JJ levels_NNS of_IN government_NN 
(_( global_JJ ,_, international_JJ ,_, regional_JJ ,_, local_JJ )_) and_CC the_DT roles_NNS of_IN the_DT private_JJ 
sector_NN ,_, of_IN non-governmental_JJ actors_NNS and_CC of_IN civil_JJ society_NN ._SENT 
Hot_JJ air_NN 
Under_IN the_DT terms_NNS of_IN the_DT 1997_CD Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, national_JJ emission_NN 
targets_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP are_VBP expressed_VVN relative_JJ to_TO emissions_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN 
._SENT For_IN countries_NNS in_IN the_DT former_JJ Soviet_NP Union_NP and_CC Eastern_NP Europe_NP 
this_DT target_NN has_VHZ proven_VVN to_TO be_VB higher_JJR than_IN their_PP$ current_JJ and_CC projected_VVN 
emissions_NNS for_IN reasons_NNS unrelated_JJ to_TO climate-change_NN mitigation_NN 
activities_NNS ._SENT Russia_NP and_CC Ukraine_NP ,_, in_IN particular_JJ ,_, are_VBP expected_VVN to_TO have_VH 
a_DT substantial_JJ volume_NN of_IN excess_JJ emission_NN allowances_NNS over_IN the_DT period_NN 
-2012_CD relative_NN to_TO their_PP$ forecast_NN emissions_NNS ._SENT These_DT allowances_NNS 
are_VBP sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB hot_JJ air_NN because_IN ,_, while_IN they_PP can_MD be_VB 
traded_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol’s_NP flexibility_NN mechanisms_NNS ,_, they_PP did_VVD 
not_RB result_NN from_IN mitigation_NN activities_NNS ._SENT 
Hybrid_JJ vehicle_NN 
Any_DT vehicle_NN that_WDT employs_VVZ two_CD sources_NNS of_IN propulsion_NN ,_, especially_RB a_DT 
vehicle_NN that_WDT combines_VVZ an_DT internal_JJ combustion_NN engine_NN with_IN an_DT electric_JJ

Hydrofluorocarbons_NP (_( HFCs_NP )_) 
One_CD of_IN the_DT six_CD gases_NNS or_CC groups_NNS of_IN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB curbed_VVN under_IN the_DT 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT They_PP are_VBP produced_VVN commercially_RB as_IN a_DT substitute_NN 
for_IN chlorofluorocarbons_NNS ._SENT HFCs_NNS are_VBP largely_RB used_VVN in_IN refrigeration_NN and_CC 
semiconductor_NN manufacturing_NN ._SENT Their_PP$ Global_NP Warming_NP Potentials_NP 
range_NN from_IN 1_CD ,_, 300_CD to_TO 11_CD ,_, 700._CD 
Implementation_NN 
Implementation_NN describes_VVZ the_DT actions_NNS taken_VVN to_TO meet_VV commitments_NNS 
under_IN a_DT treaty_NN and_CC encompasses_VVZ legal_JJ and_CC effective_JJ phases_NNS ._SENT Legal_JJ 
implementation_NN refers_VVZ to_TO legislation_NN ,_, regulations_NNS ,_, judicial_JJ decrees_NNS ,_, 
including_VVG other_JJ actions_NNS such_JJ as_IN efforts_NNS to_TO administer_VV progress_NN ,_, which_WDT 
governments_NNS take_VVP to_TO translate_VV international_JJ accords_NNS into_IN domestic_JJ 
law_NN and_CC policy_NN ._SENT Effective_JJ implementation_NN needs_VVZ policies_NNS and_CC 
programmes_NNS that_WDT induce_VVP changes_NNS in_IN the_DT behaviour_NN and_CC decisions_NNS 
of_IN target_NN groups_NNS ._SENT Target_NN groups_NNS then_RB take_VVP effective_JJ measures_NNS of_IN 
mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN ._SENT 
Income_NN elasticity_NN (_( of_IN demand_NN )_) 
This_DT is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT percentage_NN change_NN in_IN quantity_NN of_IN demand_NN for_IN 
a_DT good_JJ or_CC service_NN to_TO a_DT one_CD percentage_NN change_NN in_IN income_NN ._SENT For_IN most_JJS 
goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS ,_, demand_NN goes_VVZ up_RP when_WRB income_NN grows_VVZ ,_, making_VVG 
income_NN elasticity_NN positive_JJ ._SENT When_WRB the_DT elasticity_NN is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN one_CD ,_, 
goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS are_VBP called_VVN necessities_NNS ._SENT 
Industrial_JJ ecology_NN 
The_DT relationship_NN of_IN a_DT particular_JJ industry_NN with_IN its_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT It_PP 
often_RB refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT conscious_JJ planning_NN of_IN industrial_JJ processes_VVZ to_TO

no_DT additional_JJ investment_NN cost_NN ._SENT

Interaction_NN effect_NN 
The_DT consequence_NN of_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN climate-change_NN policy_NN

cost-increasing_VVG tax_NN interaction_NN and_CC cost-reducing_JJ revenue-recycling_NN

can_MD have_VH on_IN labour_NN and_CC capital_NN markets_NNS through_IN their_PP$ effects_NNS on_IN real_JJ 
wages_NNS and_CC the_DT real_JJ return_NN to_TO capital_NN ._SENT Restricting_VVG allowable_JJ GHG_NP 


emissions_NNS ,_, raises_VVZ the_DT carbon_NN price_NN and_CC so_RB the_DT costs_NNS of_IN production_NN 
and_CC the_DT prices_NNS of_IN output_NN ,_, thus_RB reducing_VVG the_DT real_JJ return_NN to_TO labour_VV and_CC 
capital_NN ._SENT With_IN policies_NNS that_WDT raise_VVP revenue_NN for_IN the_DT government_NN ,_, carbon_NN

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP

Session_NN of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) in_IN 1997_CD in_IN Kyoto_NP ._SENT It_PP 
contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO those_DT included_VVD 
in_IN the_DT FCCC_NP ._SENT Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ

at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT commitment_NN period_NN 2008-2012_CD ._SENT 
The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP came_VVD into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005._CD

of_IN ,_, occurrences_NNS /_SYM outcomes_NNS 
of_IN an_DT uncertain_JJ

are_VBP said_VVN

<_SYM 33_CD %_NN Unlikely_RB 
<_SYM 10_CD %_NN Very_JJ unlikely_JJ

(_( e.g._FW ,_, chemical_JJ feedstock_NN )_) ._SENT

Montreal_NP Protocol_NP 
The_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP on_IN Substances_NP that_IN/that Deplete_NP the_DT Ozone_NN Layer_NP 
was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN Montreal_NP in_IN 1987_CD ,_, and_CC subsequently_RB adjusted_VVN and_CC 
amended_VVN in_IN London_NP (_( 1990_CD )_) ,_, Copenhagen_NP (_( 1992_CD )_) ,_, Vienna_NP (_( 1995_CD )_) ,_, 
Montreal_NP (_( 1997_CD )_) and_CC Beijing_NP (_( 1999_CD )_) ._SENT It_PP controls_VVZ the_DT consumption_NN 
and_CC production_NN of_IN chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN chemicals_NNS that_RB 
destroy_VV stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN chlorofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, methyl_NN 
chloroform_NN ,_, carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN ,_, and_CC many_JJ others_NNS ._SENT

reduction_NN of_IN emissions_NNS (_( multi-gas_NN reduction_NN )_) or_CC stabilization_NN of_IN

they_PP have_VHP adopted_VVN to_TO limit_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ GHG_NP emissions_NNS ._SENT

the_DT UNFCCC_NP and_CC ,_, subsequently_RB ,_, must_MD communicate_VV their_PP$ progress_NN 
to_TO the_DT COP_NN regularly_RB ._SENT The_DT National_NP Action_NP Plans_NPS form_NN part_NN of_IN the_DT 
National_NP Communications_NPS ,_, which_WDT include_VVP the_DT national_JJ inventory_NN of_IN 
GHG_NN sources_NNS and_CC sinks_NNS ._SENT 
Net_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN removals_NNS by_IN sinks_NNS

GHG_NN removals_NNS by_IN sinks’_NN equals_VVZ the_DT actual_JJ net_JJ GHG_NP removals_NNS 
by_IN sinks_NNS minus_IN the_DT baseline_NN net_JJ GHG_NP removals_NNS by_IN sinks_NNS minus_NN 
leakage_NN ._SENT

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Non-Annex_NP I_NP Countries_NPS /_SYM Parties_NNS

not_RB included_VVN in_IN Annex_NP I_PP ._SENT 
Non-Annex_NP B_NP Countries_NPS /_SYM Parties_NNS 
The_DT countries_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
No-regret_NN policy_NN (_( options_NNS /_SYM potential_JJ )_) 
Such_JJ policy_NN would_MD generate_VV net_JJ social_JJ benefits_NNS whether_IN or_CC not_RB 
there_EX is_VBZ climate-change_NN associated_VVN with_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT No-regret_NN options_NNS for_IN GHG_NP emissions_NNS reduction_NN 
refer_VVP to_TO options_NNS whose_WP$ benefits_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN reduced_VVN energy_NN costs_NNS and_CC 
reduced_VVN emissions_NNS of_IN local_NN /_SYM regional_JJ pollutants_NNS )_) equal_VVP or_CC exceed_VVP their_PP$ 
costs_NNS to_TO society_NN ,_, excluding_VVG the_DT benefits_NNS of_IN avoided_VVN climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Normative_JJ analysis_NN

Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) 
Ozone_NN ,_, the_DT tri-atomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ atmospheric_JJ 
constituent_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, ozone_NN is_VBZ created_VVN both_CC naturally_RB 
and_CC by_IN photochemical_JJ reactions_NNS involving_VVG gases_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN

ozone_NN plays_VVZ a_DT dominant_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT stratospheric_JJ radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT

Pareto_JJ criterion_NN 
A_DT criterion_NN testing_NN whether_IN an_DT individual’s_NN welfare_NN can_MD be_VB 
increased_VVN without_IN making_VVG others_NNS in_IN the_DT society_NN worse_RBR off_RB ._SENT A_DT Pareto_NP 
improvement_NN occurs_VVZ when_WRB an_DT individual’s_NN welfare_NN is_VBZ improved_VVN 
without_IN making_VVG the_DT welfare_NN of_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN society_NN worse_RBR off_RB ._SENT A_DT 


Pareto_JJ optimum_NN is_VBZ reached_VVN when_WRB no_DT one’s_JJ welfare_NN can_MD be_VB increased_VVN 
without_IN making_VVG the_DT welfare_NN of_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN society_NN worse_RBR off_RB ,_, given_VVN 
a_DT particular_JJ distribution_NN of_IN income_NN ._SENT Different_JJ income_NN distributions_NNS 
lead_VV to_TO different_JJ Pareto_NP optima_NNS ._SENT

Potential_JJ 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN 
mitigation_NN or_CC adaptation_NN that_WDT could_MD be_VB -_: but_CC is_VBZ not_RB yet_RB –_NN realized_VVD over_RP 
time_NN ._SENT As_IN potential_JJ levels_NNS are_VBP identified_VVN :_: market_NN ,_, economic_JJ ,_, technical_JJ 
and_CC physical_JJ ._SENT 
•_JJ Market_NN potential_NN indicates_VVZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN GHG_NP mitigation_NN that_RB 
might_MD be_VB expected_VVN to_TO occur_VV under_IN forecast_NN market_NN conditions_NNS 
including_VVG policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS in_IN place_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN ._SENT ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ based_VVN 
on_IN private_JJ unit_NN costs_NNS and_CC discount_NN rates_NNS ,_, as_IN they_PP appear_VVP in_IN the_DT 
base_NN year_NN and_CC as_RB they_PP are_VBP expected_VVN to_TO change_VV in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN 
any_DT additional_JJ policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS ._SENT 
•_NP Economic_NP potential_NN is_VBZ in_IN most_JJS studies_NNS used_VVN as_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN 
GHG_NN mitigation_NN that_WDT is_VBZ cost-effective_JJ for_IN a_DT given_VVN carbon_NN price_NN ,_, 
based_VVN on_IN social_JJ cost_NN pricing_NN and_CC discount_NN rates_NNS ,_, including_VVG 
energy_NN savings_NNS ,_, but_CC without_IN most_JJS externalities_NNS ._SENT Theoretically_RB ,_, 
it_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT potential_NN for_IN cost-effective_JJ GHG_NP mitigation_NN 
when_WRB non-market_NN social_JJ costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS are_VBP included_VVN with_IN 
market_NN costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS in_IN assessing_VVG the_DT options_NNS for_IN particular_JJ 
levels_NNS of_IN carbon_NN prices_NNS (_( as_RB affected_VVN by_IN mitigation_NN policies_NNS )_) and_CC 
when_WRB using_VVG social_JJ discount_NN rates_NNS instead_RB of_IN private_JJ ones_NNS ._SENT This_DT 
includes_VVZ externalities_NNS ,_, i.e._FW ,_, non-market_NN costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS such_JJ 
as_IN environmental_JJ co-benefits_NNS 
•_JJ Technical_JJ potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN by_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ possible_JJ 
to_TO reduce_VV GHG_NP emissions_NNS or_CC improve_VV energy_NN efficiency_NN by_IN 
implementing_VVG a_DT technology_NN or_CC practice_NN that_WDT has_VHZ already_RB been_VBN 
demonstrated_VVN ._SENT No_DT explicit_JJ reference_NN to_TO costs_NNS is_VBZ made_VVN but_RB 
adopting_VVG ‘practical_JJ constraints’_NN may_MD take_VV into_IN account_NN implicit_JJ 
economic_JJ considerations_NNS ._SENT 
•_JJ Physical_JJ potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT theoretical_JJ (_( thermodynamic_JJ )_) 
and_CC sometimes_RB ,_, in_IN practice_NN ,_, rather_RB uncertain_JJ upper_JJ limit_NN to_TO 
mitigation_NN ._SENT 
Precautionary_JJ Principle_NN

parties_NNS should_MD take_VV precautionary_JJ measures_NNS to_TO anticipate_VV ,_, prevent_VV 
or_CC minimize_VV the_DT causes_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN and_CC mitigate_VV its_PP$ adverse_JJ 
effects_NNS ._SENT Where_WRB there_EX are_VBP threats_NNS of_IN serious_JJ or_CC irreversible_JJ damage_NN ,_, 
lack_NN of_IN full_JJ scientific_JJ certainty_NN should_MD not_RB be_VB used_VVN as_IN a_DT reason_NN to_TO 
postpone_VV such_JJ measures_NNS ,_, taking_VVG into_IN account_NN that_IN/that policies_NNS and_CC 
measures_NNS to_TO deal_VV with_IN climate-change_NN should_MD be_VB cost-effective_JJ in_IN

Present_JJ value_NN 
The_DT value_NN of_IN a_DT money_NN amount_NN differs_VVZ when_WRB the_DT amount_NN is_VBZ available_JJ 
at_IN different_JJ moments_NNS in_IN time_NN (_( years_NNS )_) ._SENT To_TO make_VV amounts_NNS at_IN differing_VVG 
times_NNS comparable_JJ and_CC additive_JJ ,_, a_DT date_NN is_VBZ fixed_VVN as_IN the_DT ‘present’_NN ._SENT 
Amounts_NNS available_JJ at_IN different_JJ dates_NNS in_IN the_DT future_NN are_VBP discounted_VVN 
back_RB to_TO a_DT present_JJ value_NN ,_, and_CC summed_VVD to_TO get_VV the_DT present_JJ value_NN of_IN 
a_DT series_NN of_IN future_JJ cash_NN flows_NNS ._SENT Net_JJ present_JJ value_NN is_VBZ the_DT difference_NN

value_NN of_IN the_DT costs_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB discounting_VVG ._SENT 
Price_NN elasticity_NN of_IN demand_NN 
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT percentage_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT quantity_NN of_IN demand_NN for_IN a_DT 
good_JJ or_CC service_NN to_TO one_CD percentage_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT price_NN of_IN that_DT good_JJ or_CC 
service_NN ._SENT When_WRB the_DT absolute_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT elasticity_NN is_VBZ between_IN 0_CD and_CC 
,_, demand_NN is_VBZ called_VVN inelastic_JJ ;_: when_WRB it_PP is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN one_CD ,_, demand_NN is_VBZ 
called_VVN elastic_JJ ._SENT

Subsidy_NN

to_TO encourage_VV ._SENT The_DT reduction_NN of_IN GHG_NP emissions_NNS is_VBZ stimulated_VVN by_IN 
lowering_VVG existing_JJ subsidies_NNS that_WDT have_VHP the_DT effect_NN of_IN raising_VVG emissions_NNS 
(_( such_JJ as_IN subsidies_NNS to_TO fossil_JJ fuel_NN use_NN )_) or_CC by_IN providing_VVG subsidies_NNS for_IN 
practices_NNS that_WDT reduce_VVP emissions_NNS or_CC enhance_VV sinks_NNS (_( e.g._FW for_IN insulation_NN 
of_IN buildings_NNS or_CC for_IN planting_VVG trees_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) 
One_CD of_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB curbed_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ largely_RB used_VVN in_IN heavy_JJ industry_NN to_TO insulate_VV high-voltage_NN 
equipment_NN and_CC to_TO assist_VV in_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN of_IN cable-cooling_NN 
systems_NNS and_CC semi-conductors_NNS ._SENT Its_PP$ Global_JJ Warming_NN Potential_JJ is_VBZ 
,_, 900._CD 


Supplementarity_NN 
The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP states_VVZ that_IN/that emissions_NNS trading_NN and_CC Joint_NP 
Implementation_NN activities_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB supplemental_JJ to_TO domestic_JJ 
policies_NNS (_( e.g._FW energy_NN taxes_NNS ,_, fuel_NN efficiency_NN standards_NNS )_) taken_VVN by_IN 
developed_JJ countries_NNS to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ GHG_NP emissions_NNS ._SENT Under_IN some_DT 
proposed_VVN definitions_NNS of_IN supplementarity_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT concrete_JJ ceiling_NN on_IN 
level_NN of_IN use_NN )_) ,_, developed_VVD countries_NNS could_MD be_VB restricted_VVN in_IN their_PP$ use_NN of_IN 
the_DT Kyoto_NP Mechanisms_NNS to_TO achieve_VV their_PP$ reduction_NN targets_NNS ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ a_DT 
subject_JJ for_IN further_JJR negotiation_NN and_CC clarification_NN by_IN the_DT parties_NNS ._SENT 
Sustainable_JJ Development_NP (_( SD_NP )_) 
The_DT concept_NN of_IN sustainable_JJ development_NN was_VBD introduced_VVN in_IN the_DT 
World_NP Conservation_NP Strategy_NP (_( IUCN_NP 1980_CD )_) and_CC had_VHD its_PP$ roots_NNS 
in_IN the_DT concept_NN of_IN a_DT sustainable_JJ society_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT management_NN 
of_IN renewable_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Adopted_VVN by_IN the_DT WCED_NP in_IN 1987_CD and_CC 
by_IN the_DT Rio_NP Conference_NP in_IN 1992_CD as_IN a_DT process_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN which_WDT 
the_DT exploitation_NN of_IN resources_NNS ,_, the_DT direction_NN of_IN investments_NNS ,_, the_DT 
orientation_NN of_IN technological_JJ development_NN and_CC institutional_JJ change_NN 
are_VBP all_RB in_IN harmony_NN and_CC enhance_VV both_DT current_JJ and_CC future_JJ potential_NN 
to_TO meet_VV human_JJ needs_NNS and_CC aspirations_NNS ._SENT SD_NP integrates_VVZ the_DT political_JJ ,_, 
social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ dimensions_NNS ._SENT 
Targets_NNS and_CC timetables_NNS 
A_DT target_NN is_VBZ the_DT reduction_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ percentage_NN of_IN GHG_NP emissions_NNS 
from_IN a_DT baseline_JJ date_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS )_) to_TO be_VB achieved_VVN by_IN a_DT set_NN 
date_NN or_CC timetable_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, 2008-2012_CD )_) ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP the_DT 
EU_NP agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV its_PP$ GHG_NP emissions_NNS by_IN 8_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS 
by_IN the_DT 2008-2012_CD commitment_NN period_NN ._SENT Targets_NNS and_CC timetables_NNS are_VBP 
an_DT emissions_NNS cap_NN on_IN the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN GHG_NP emissions_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB 
emitted_VVN by_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC region_NN in_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN period_NN ._SENT 
Tax_NN 
A_DT carbon_NN tax_NN is_VBZ a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT carbon_NN content_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ._SENT Because_RB 
virtually_RB all_RB of_IN the_DT carbon_NN in_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS is_VBZ ultimately_RB emitted_VVN as_RB 
CO2_NP ,_, a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN is_VBZ equivalent_JJ to_TO an_DT emission_NN tax_NN on_IN each_DT unit_NN of_IN 
CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT An_DT energy_NN tax_NN -_: a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT energy_NN 
content_NN of_IN fuels_NNS -_: reduces_VVZ demand_NN for_IN energy_NN and_CC so_RB reduces_VVZ CO2_NP 
emissions_NNS from_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN use_NN ._SENT An_DT eco-tax_NN is_VBZ designed_VVN to_TO influence_VV 
human_JJ behaviour_NN (_( specifically_RB economic_JJ behaviour_NN )_) to_TO follow_VV an_DT 
ecologically_RB benign_JJ path_NN ._SENT 
An_DT international_JJ carbon_NN /_SYM emission_NN /_SYM energy_NN tax_NN is_VBZ a_DT tax_NN imposed_VVD 
on_IN specified_JJ sources_NNS in_IN participating_VVG countries_NNS by_IN an_DT international_JJ 
authority_NN ._SENT The_DT revenue_NN is_VBZ distributed_VVN or_CC used_VVN as_IN specified_VVN by_IN this_DT 
authority_NN or_CC by_IN participating_VVG countries_NNS ._SENT A_DT harmonized_VVN tax_NN commits_VVZ 
participating_VVG countries_NNS to_TO impose_VV a_DT tax_NN at_IN a_DT common_JJ rate_NN on_IN the_DT same_JJ 
sources_NNS ,_, because_IN imposing_VVG different_JJ rates_NNS across_IN countries_NNS would_MD 
not_RB be_VB cost-effective_JJ ._SENT A_DT tax_NN credit_NN is_VBZ a_DT reduction_NN of_IN tax_NN in_IN order_NN 
to_TO stimulate_VV purchasing_NN of_IN or_CC investment_NN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ product_NN ,_, like_VVP 
GHG_NN emission_NN reducing_VVG technologies_NNS ._SENT A_DT carbon_NN charge_NN is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ 
as_IN a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Interaction_NP effect_NN 
Technological_JJ change_NN 
Mostly_RB considered_VVN as_IN technological_JJ improvement_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, more_RBR or_CC 
better_JJR goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS can_MD be_VB provided_VVN from_IN a_DT given_VVN amount_NN 
of_IN resources_NNS (_( production_NN factors_NNS )_) ._SENT Economic_JJ models_NNS distinguish_VVP 
autonomous_JJ (_( exogenous_JJ )_) ,_, endogenous_JJ and_CC induced_VVN technological_JJ 
change_NN ._SENT 
Autonomous_JJ (_( exogenous_JJ )_) technological_JJ change_NN is_VBZ imposed_VVN from_IN 
outside_IN the_DT model_NN ,_, usually_RB in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT time_NN trend_NN affecting_VVG 
energy_NN demand_NN or_CC world_NN output_NN growth_NN ._SENT Endogenous_JJ technological_JJ 
change_NN is_VBZ the_DT outcome_NN of_IN economic_JJ activity_NN within_IN the_DT model_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, 
the_DT choice_NN of_IN technologies_NNS is_VBZ included_VVN within_IN the_DT model_NN and_CC affects_VVZ 
energy_NN demand_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC economic_JJ growth_NN ._SENT Induced_VVN technological_JJ 
change_NN implies_VVZ endogenous_JJ technological_JJ change_NN but_CC adds_VVZ further_RBR 
changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN taxes_NNS 
triggering_VVG R_NP &_CC D_NP efforts_NNS ._SENT 
Technology_NN

that_IN/that employs_VVZ both_DT technical_JJ artefacts_NNS (_( hardware_NN ,_, equipment_NN )_) and_CC 
(_( social_JJ )_) information_NN (_( ‘software’_NP ,_, know-how_NN for_IN production_NN and_CC use_NN 
of_IN artefacts_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Technology_NN transfer_NN

money_NN and_CC goods_NNS among_IN stakeholders_NNS ,_, which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO the_DT spreading_VVG 
of_IN technology_NN for_IN adaptation_NN or_CC mitigation_NN The_DT term_NN encompasses_VVZ 
both_DT diffusion_NN of_IN technologies_NNS and_CC technological_JJ cooperation_NN across_IN 
and_CC within_IN countries_NNS ._SENT 
Tolerable_JJ windows_NNS approach_NN (_( TWA_NP )_) 
This_DT approach_NN seeks_VVZ to_TO identify_VV the_DT set_NN of_IN all_DT climate-protection_NN 
strategies_NNS that_WDT are_VBP simultaneously_RB compatible_JJ with_IN 1_CD )_) prescribed_JJ 
long-term_JJ climate-protection_NN goals_NNS ,_, and_CC 2_LS )_) normative_JJ restrictions_NNS on_IN 
the_DT emissions_NNS mitigation_NN burden_NN ._SENT The_DT constraints_NNS may_MD include_VV limits_NNS

the_DT weakening_NN of_IN the_DT thermohaline_NN circulation_NN ,_, on_IN ecosystem_NN losses_NNS

emission_NN corridor_NN of_IN complying_VVG emission_NN paths_NNS ._SENT 
Top-down_NN models_NNS

supply_NN from_IN main_JJ sectors_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT energy_NN sector_NN ,_, transportation_NN ,_,

technology_NN data_NNS ,_, narrowing_VVG the_DT gap_NN to_TO bottom-up_JJ models_NNS ._SENT 
Trace_NP gas_NN

Uncertainty_NN

future_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN )_) ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD result_VV from_IN lack_NN 
of_IN information_NN or_CC from_IN disagreement_NN about_IN what_WP is_VBZ known_VVN or_CC even_RB 
knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD have_VH many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, from_IN quantifiable_JJ 
errors_NNS in_IN the_DT data_NNS to_TO ambiguously_RB defined_VVN concepts_NNS or_CC terminology_NN ,_, or_CC

reflecting_VVG the_DT judgment_NN of_IN a_DT team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB likelihood_NN ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) 
The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP York_NP and_NP 
signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 
countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Economic_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ 
objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT ‘stabilization_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ 
interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN system’_NN ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN 
all_DT parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Convention_NP parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_PP aimed_VVD 
to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emission_NN not_RB controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP 
Protocol_NN to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT convention_NN came_VVD into_IN 
force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD 


Value_NN added_VVD

Values_NNS 
Worth_NP ,_, desirability_NN or_CC utility_NN based_VVN on_IN individual_JJ preferences_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS 
social_JJ science_NN disciplines_NNS use_VVP several_JJ definitions_NNS of_IN value_NN ._SENT Related_VVN 
to_TO nature_NN and_CC environment_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN intrinsic_JJ 
and_CC instrumental_JJ values_NNS ,_, the_DT latter_NN assigned_VVN by_IN humans_NNS ._SENT Within_IN 
instrumental_JJ values_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT unsettled_JJ catalogue_NN of_IN different_JJ 
values_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN (_( direct_JJ and_CC indirect_JJ )_) use_NN ,_, option_NN ,_, conservation_NN ,_, 
serendipity_NN ,_, bequest_NN ,_, existence_NN ,_, etc._FW 
Mainstream_NN economics_NNS define_VV the_DT total_JJ value_NN of_IN any_DT resource_NN as_IN the_DT 
sum_NN of_IN the_DT values_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ individuals_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT use_NN 
of_IN the_DT resource_NN ._SENT The_DT economic_JJ values_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP the_DT foundation_NN of_IN 
the_DT estimation_NN of_IN costs_NNS ,_, are_VBP measured_VVN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT willingness_NN to_TO 
pay_VV by_IN individuals_NNS to_TO receive_VV the_DT resource_NN or_CC by_IN the_DT willingness_NN of_IN 
individuals_NNS to_TO accept_VV payment_NN to_TO part_NN with_IN the_DT resource_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
contingent_JJ valuation_NN method_NN ._SENT

Adaptation_NN 
Adjustment_NN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO actual_JJ or_CC 
expected_VVN climatic_JJ stimuli_NNS or_CC their_PP$ effects_NNS ,_, which_WDT moderates_VVZ harm_NN 
or_CC exploits_VVZ beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN adaptation_NN 
can_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN ,_, including_VVG anticipatory_JJ ,_, autonomous_JJ and_NP 
planned_JJ adaptation_NN :_: 
Anticipatory_JJ adaptation_NN –_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT takes_VVZ place_NN before_RB 
impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN are_VBP replaced-dns_NNS NONE_NONE referred_VVD 
to_TO as_RB proactive_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
Autonomous_JJ adaptation_NN –_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT does_VVZ not_RB constitute_VV 
a_DT conscious_JJ response_NN to_TO climatic_JJ stimuli_NNS but_CC is_VBZ 
triggered_VVN by_IN ecological_JJ changes_NNS in_IN natural_JJ systems_NNS 
and_CC by_IN market_NN or_CC welfare_NN changes_NNS in_IN human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT 
Also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB spontaneous_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
Planned_JJ adaptation_NN –_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT deliberate_JJ 
policy_NN decision_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN an_DT awareness_NN that_RB 
conditions_NNS have_VHP changed_VVN or_CC are_VBP about_RB to_TO change_VV and_CC 
that_DT action_NN is_VBZ required_VVN to_TO return_VV to_TO ,_, maintain_VV ,_, or_CC 
achieve_VV a_DT desired_VVN state_NN ._SENT

and_CC evaluating_VVG them_PP in_IN terms_NNS of_IN criteria_NNS such_JJ as_IN availability_NN ,_, benefits_NNS ,_, 
costs_NNS ,_, effectiveness_NN ,_, efficiency_NN and_CC feasibility_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN benefits_NNS

adoption_NN and_CC implementation_NN of_IN adaptation_NN measures_NNS ._SENT

adaptation_NN measures_NNS ,_, including_VVG transition_NN costs_NNS ._SENT 
Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN (_( in_IN relation_NN to_TO climate-change_NN impacts_NNS )_)

climate_NN variability_NN and_CC extremes_NNS )_) to_TO moderate_VV potential_JJ damages_NNS ,_, 
to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO cope_VV with_IN the_DT consequences_NNS ._SENT 
Aerosols_NNS 
A_DT collection_NN of_IN air-borne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT typical_JJ 
size_NN between_IN 0.01_CD and_CC 10_CD μm_NN ,_, that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN 
at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ 
replaced-dns_NNS NONE_NONE may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN two_CD ways_NNS :_: 
directly_RB through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG radiation_NN ,_, and_CC indirectly_RB 
through_IN acting_VVG as_IN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS for_IN cloud_NN formation_NN 
or_CC modifying_VVG the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT 
Afforestation_NN

forested_VVN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN at_IN least_JJS 50_CD years_NNS to_TO forested_JJ land_NN through_RB 
planting_NN ,_, seeding_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT human-induced_JJ promotion_NN of_IN natural_JJ 
seed_NN sources_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB reforestation_NN and_CC deforestation_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT 
discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC related_JJ terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN afforestation_NN ,_, 
reforestation_NN and_CC deforestation_NN ,_, see_VVP the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ 
Report_NN on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NP Change_NP ,_, and_CC Forestry_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 
)_) ._SENT

about_RB )_) the_DT relative_JJ importance_NN of_IN impacts_NNS in_IN different_JJ sectors_NNS and_CC 
regions_NNS ._SENT Measures_NNS of_IN aggregate_JJ impacts_NNS include_VVP ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, 
the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN people_NNS affected_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT total_JJ economic_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT 
Albedo_NN

often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Snow-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS have_VHP a_DT 
Appendix_NP I_NP :_: Glossary_NN 
Notes_NNS :_: 
._SENT This_DT glossary_NN defines_VVZ some_DT specific_JJ terms_NNS as_IN the_DT lead_JJ authors_NNS intend_VVP them_PP to_TO be_VB interpreted_VVN in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN this_DT Report_NP ._SENT 
.Words_NNS in_IN italic_NN indicate_VVP that_IN/that the_DT following_VVG term_NN is_VBZ also_RB contained_VVN in_IN this_DT glossary_NN ._SENT 
high_JJ albedo_NN ;_: the_DT albedo_NN of_IN soils_NNS ranges_NNS from_IN high_JJ to_TO low_JJ ;_: vegetation-_NN 
covered_JJ surfaces_NNS and_CC oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT low_JJ albedo_NN ._SENT The_DT 
Earth’s_NP albedo_NN varies_VVZ mainly_RB through_IN varying_VVG cloudiness_NN ,_, snow_NN ,_, 
ice_NN ,_, leaf_NN area_NN ,_, and_CC land-cover_NN changes_NNS ._SENT 
Algae_NN

in_IN marine_NN and_CC freshwater_NN ecosystems_NNS ._SENT

Alpine_NP

characterised_VVN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN rosette-forming_VVG herbaceous_JJ

AOGCM_NP

Aquifer_NN 
A_DT stratum_NN of_IN permeable_JJ rock_NN that_WDT bears_VVZ water_NN ._SENT An_DT unconfined_NN 
aquifer_NN is_VBZ recharged_VVN directly_RB by_IN local_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, rivers_NNS and_CC lakes_NNS ,_, 
and_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN recharge_NN will_MD be_VB influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT permeability_NN 
of_IN the_DT overlying_VVG rocks_NNS and_CC soils_NNS ._SENT

Climate_NN

the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT

climate-change_NN

This_DT usage_NN differs_VVZ from_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP

concentration_NN /_SYM radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB
