and_CC technological_JJ development_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN (_( change_NN )_) scenario_NN

climate_NN scenario_NN and_CC the_DT current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT

of_IN CO2_JJ concentration_NN above_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT 
climate-system_NN

land_NN surface_NN ,_, and_CC biosphere_NN ._SENT climate-system_NN dynamics_NNS

eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, or_CC human-induced_JJ modifications_NNS to_TO

gases_NNS ,_, triggers_VVZ a_DT significant_JJ climatic_JJ or_CC environmental_JJ event_NN

collapse_NN of_IN oceanic_JJ circulation_NN systems_NNS ._SENT

forcing_VVG (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT

Coral_NP 
The_DT term_NN ‘coral’_NN has_VHZ several_JJ meanings_NNS ,_, but_CC is_VBZ usually_RB the_DT common_JJ 
name_NN for_IN the_DT Order_NP Scleractinia_NP ,_, all_DT members_NNS of_IN which_WDT have_VHP

Ecosystem_NN approach_NN

El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) 
El_NP Niño_NP ,_, in_IN its_PP$ original_JJ sense_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT warm-water_NN current_JJ that_IN/that periodically_RB 
flows_NNS along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT 
local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN 
the_DT inter-tropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN and_CC circulation_NN in_IN the_DT Indian_NP 
and_CC PacificOceans_NP ,_, called_VVD the_DT SouthernOscillation_NN ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN 
atmosphere-ocean_JJ phenomenon_NN is_VBZ collectively_RB known_VVN as_IN El_NP 
Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT El_NP Niño_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_JJ 
tradewindsweaken_NNS and_CC the_DT equatorial_JJ countercurrent_NN strengthens_VVZ ,_, 
causing_VVG warm_JJ surface_NN waters_NNS in_IN the_DT Indonesian_JJ area_NN to_TO flow_VV 
eastward_RB to_TO overlie_VV the_DT cold_JJ waters_NNS of_IN the_DT Peru_NP current_NN ._SENT This_DT event_NN 
has_VHZ great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, and_CC precipitation_NN 
patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ effects_NNS 
throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC inmany_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN theworld_NN ._SENT 
The_DT opposite_NN of_IN an_DT El_NP Niño_NP event_NN is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT

Greenhouse_NN effect_NN

atmosphere_NN warms_VVZ the_DT Earth_NN ._SENT 
In_IN common_JJ parlance_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN ‘greenhouse_NN effect’_NN may_MD be_VB used_VVN 
to_TO refer_VV either_RB to_TO the_DT natural_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO naturally_RB 
occurring_VVG greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO the_DT enhanced_JJ (_( anthropogenic_JJ )_)

of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
both_DT natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN 
at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN infrared_NN 
radiation_NN emitted_VVD by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, and_NP 
clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN replaced-dns_NNS NONE_NONE vapour_NN 
(_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN 
(_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT 
Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT As_RB well_RB as_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP ,_, and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN 
(_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT

same_JJ area_NN (_( see_VV also_RB net_JJ biome_NN production_NN (_( NBP_NP )_) ._SENT

The_DT biogeographic_JJ zone_NN below_IN the_DT tree_NN line_NN and_CC above_IN the_DT montane_JJ 
zone_NN that_WDT is_VBZ characterised_VVN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN coniferous_JJ forest_NN 
and_CC trees_NNS ._SENT 
Succulent_JJ 
Succulent_JJ plants_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, cactuses_NNS ,_, possessing_VVG organs_NNS that_DT store_NN 
water_NN ,_, thus_RB facilitating_VVG survival_NN during_IN drought_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT 
Surface_NN runoff_NN 
The_DT water_NN that_WDT travels_VVZ over_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN to_TO the_DT nearest_JJS surface_NN 
stream_NN ;_: runoff_NN of_IN a_DT drainage_NN basin_NN that_WDT has_VHZ not_RB passed_VVN beneath_IN the_DT 
surface_NN since_IN precipitation_NN ._SENT 
Sustainable_JJ development_NN 
Development_NN that_WDT meets_VVZ the_DT cultural_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, political_JJ and_CC economic_JJ 
needs_NNS of_IN the_DT present_JJ generation_NN without_IN compromising_VVG 
the_DT ability_NN of_IN future_JJ generations_NNS to_TO meet_VV their_PP$ own_JJ needs_NNS ._SENT

Taiga_NN 
The_DT northernmost_JJ belt_NN of_IN boreal_JJ forest_NN adjacent_JJ to_TO theArctic_JJ tundra_NN ._SENT 
Thermal_JJ expansion_NN 
In_IN connection_NN with_IN sea-level_NN rise_NN ,_, this_DT refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN 
volume_NN (_( and_CC decrease_NN in_IN density_NN )_) that_IN/that results_NNS from_IN warming_NN 
water_NN ._SENT A_DT warming_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT expansion_NN of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN volume_NN and_CC hence_RB an_DT increase_NN in_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT 
Thermocline_NN 
The_DT region_NN in_IN the_DT world’s_NNS ocean_NN ,_, typically_RB at_IN a_DT depth_NN of_IN 1_CD km_NN ,_, 
where_WRB temperature_NN decreases_VVZ rapidly_RB with_IN depth_NN and_CC which_WDT 
marks_VVZ the_DT boundary_NN between_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT 
Thermohaline_NN circulation_NN (_( THC_NP )_) 
Large-scale_JJ ,_, density-driven_JJ circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN 
differences_NNS in_IN temperature_NN and_CC salinity_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT NorthAtlantic_NP ,_, the_DT 
thermohaline_NN circulation_NN consists_VVZ of_IN warm_JJ surface_NN water_NN flowing_VVG 
northward_JJ and_CC cold_JJ deepwater_NN flowing_VVG southward_NN ,_, resulting_VVG in_IN a_DT 
net_JJ poleward_JJ transport_NN of_IN heat_NN ._SENT The_DT surface_NN water_NN sinks_NNS in_IN highly_RB 
restricted_JJ regions_NNS located_VVN in_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS ._SENT Also_RB called_VVN meridional_NN 
overturning_VVG circulation_NN (_( MOC_NP )_) ._SENT 
Thermokarst_NP 
Aragged_JJ landscape_NN full_JJ of_IN shallow_JJ pits_NNS ,_, hummocks_NNS and_CC depressions_NNS 
often_RB filled_VVN with_IN water_NN (_( ponds_NNS )_) ,_, which_WDT results_VVZ from_IN thawing_VVG 
of_IN ground_NN ice_NN or_CC permafrost_NN ._SENT Thermokarst_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP the_DT 
processes_NNS driven_VVN by_IN warming_VVG that_DT lead_NN to_TO the_DT formation_NN of_IN 
thermokarst_NN ._SENT 
Threshold_NN 
The_DT level_NN of_IN magnitude_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN process_NN at_IN which_WDT sudden_JJ or_CC 
rapid_JJ change_NN occurs_VVZ ._SENT A_DT point_NN or_CC level_NN at_IN which_WDT new_JJ properties_NNS 
emerge_VV in_IN an_DT ecological_JJ ,_, economic_JJ or_CC other_JJ system_NN ,_, invalidating_VVG 
predictions_NNS based_VVN on_IN mathematical_JJ relationships_NNS that_WDT apply_VVP at_IN 
lower_JJR levels_NNS ._SENT 
Transpiration_NN

through_IN stomata_NNS ._SENT 
Tree_NN line_NN

is_VBZ more_RBR elevated_JJ or_CC more_RBR poleward_JJ than_IN the_DT forest_NN line_NN ._SENT 
Trophic_JJ level_NN 
The_DT position_NN that_IN/that an_DT organism_NN occupies_VVZ in_IN a_DT food_NN chain_NN ._SENT 
Trophic_JJ relationship_NN

on_IN another_DT ._SENT 
Troposphere_NN 
The_DT lowest_JJS part_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN from_IN the_DT surface_NN to_TO about_RB 
km_NN in_IN altitude_NN in_IN mid-latitudes_NNS (_( ranging_VVG from_IN 9_CD km_NN in_IN high_JJ 
latitudes_NNS to_TO 16_CD km_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS on_IN average_NN )_) where_WRB clouds_NNS and_CC 
‘weather’_NN phenomena_NNS occur_VVP ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, temperatures_NNS 
generally_RB decrease_NN with_IN height_NN ._SENT 
Tsunami_NN

and_CC short_JJ growing_VVG seasons_NNS ._SENT 
Uncertainty_NN 
An_DT expression_NN of_IN the_DT degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT value_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, the_DT future_NN 
state_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN )_) is_VBZ unknown_JJ ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD result_VV 
from_IN lack_NN of_IN information_NN or_CC from_IN disagreement_NN about_IN what_WP is_VBZ 
known_VVN or_CC even_RB knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD have_VH many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, 
from_IN quantifiable_JJ errors_NNS in_IN the_DT data_NNS to_TO ambiguously_RB defined_VVN concepts_NNS 
or_CC terminology_NN ,_, or_CC uncertain_JJ projections_NNS of_IN human_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT 
Uncertainty_NN can_MD therefore_RB be_VB represented_VVN by_IN quantitative_JJ 
measures_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT range_NN of_IN values_NNS calculated_VVN by_IN various_JJ models_NNS )_) 
or_CC by_IN qualitative_JJ statements_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, reflecting_VVG the_DT judgement_NN of_IN a_DT 
team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB confidence_NN and_CC likelihood_NN ._SENT 
Undernutrition_NN 
The_DT temporary_JJ or_CC chronic_JJ state_NN resulting_VVG from_IN intake_NN of_IN lower_JJR 
than_IN recommended_JJ daily_JJ dietary_JJ energy_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC protein_NN requirements_NNS ,_, 
through_IN either_DT insufficient_JJ food_NN intake_NN ,_, poor_JJ absorption_NN ,_, 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC poor_JJ biological_JJ use_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS consumed_VVN ._SENT

ruminants_NNS ,_, swine_NN ,_, camel_NN ,_, hippopotamus_NN ,_, horse_NN ,_, rhinoceros_NNS and_CC

United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN 
Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) 
The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD ,_, in_IN New_NP York_NP ,_, and_NP 
signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 
countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ objective_NN 
is_VBZ the_DT ‘stabilisation_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ 
interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN system’_NN ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS 
for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Convention_NP ,_, Parties_NP included_VVD 
inAnnex_NN I_PP aim_VVP to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN 
by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT 
Convention_NN entered_VVD in_IN force_NN inMarch_NP 1994._CD See_VV also_RB Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Upwelling_JJ region_NN

the_DT bottom_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN surface_NN ._SENT 
Urbanisation_NP 
The_DT conversion_NN of_IN land_NN from_IN a_DT natural_JJ state_NN or_CC managed_VVD natural_JJ 
state_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN agriculture_NN )_) to_TO cities_NNS ;_: a_DT process_NN driven_VVN by_IN net_JJ ruralto-_NN 
urban_JJ migration_NN through_IN which_WDT an_DT increasing_VVG percentage_NN of_IN 
the_DT population_NN in_IN any_DT nation_NN or_CC region_NN come_VVP to_TO live_VV in_IN settlements_NNS 
that_WDT are_VBP defined_VVN as_IN ‘urban_JJ centres’_NN ._SENT

Vector_NP 
A_DT blood-sucking_JJ organism_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN an_DT insect_NN ,_, that_WDT transmits_VVZ a_DT 
pathogen_NN from_IN one_CD host_NN to_TO another_DT ._SENT See_VV also_RB vector-borne_JJ diseases_NNS ._SENT 
Vector-borne_JJ diseases_NNS

(_( such_JJ as_IN a_DT mosquito_NN or_CC tick_NN )_) ;_: e.g._FW ,_, malaria_NN ,_, dengue_NN fever_NN and_NP 
leishmaniasis_NN ._SENT 
Vernalisation_NN 
The_DT biological_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN certain_JJ crops_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN winter_NN cereals_NNS ,_, 
which_WDT need_VVP periods_NNS of_IN extreme_JJ cold_JJ temperatures_NNS before_RB 
emergence_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC during_IN early_JJ vegetative_JJ stages_NNS ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO 
flower_NN and_CC produce_VV seeds_NNS ._SENT By_IN extension_NN ,_, the_DT act_NN or_CC process_NN of_IN 
hastening_VVG the_DT flowering_VVG and_CC fruiting_VVG of_IN plants_NNS by_IN treating_VVG seeds_NNS ,_, 
bulbs_NNS or_CC seedlings_NNS with_IN cold_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, so_RB as_RB to_TO induce_VV a_DT 
shortening_VVG of_IN the_DT vegetative_JJ period_NN ._SENT 
Vulnerability_NN 
Vulnerability_NN is_VBZ the_DT degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN is_VBZ susceptible_JJ to_TO ,_, 
and_CC unable_JJ to_TO cope_VV with_IN ,_, adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, including_VVG 
climate_NN variability_NN and_CC extremes_NNS ._SENT Vulnerability_NN is_VBZ a_DT function_NN 
of_IN the_DT character_NN ,_, magnitude_NN ,_, and_CC rate_NN of_IN climate-change_NN and_NP 
variation_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN is_VBZ exposed_VVN ,_, its_PP$ sensitivity_NN ,_, and_CC its_PP$ 
adaptive_JJ capacity_NN ._SENT 
Water_NN consumption_NN 
Amount_NN of_IN extracted_VVN water_NN irretrievably_RB lost_VVD during_IN its_PP$ use_NN (_( by_IN 
evaporation_NN and_CC goods_NNS production_NN )_) .Water_NN consumption_NN is_VBZ equal_JJ 
to_TO water_VV withdrawal_NN minus_CC return_NN flow_NN ._SENT 
Water_NN productivity_NN 
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN crop_NN seed_NN produced_VVN per_IN unit_NN water_NN applied_VVD ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
case_NN of_IN irrigation_NN ,_, see_VV irrigation_NN water-use_NN efficiency_NN ._SENT For_IN rainfed_JJ 
crops_NNS ,_, water_NN productivity_NN is_VBZ typically_RB 1_CD t_NN /_SYM 100_CD mm_NN ._SENT 
Water_NN stress_NN 
A_DT country_NN is_VBZ water-stressed_VVN if_IN the_DT available_JJ freshwater_NN supply_NN 
relative_JJ to_TO water_NN withdrawals_NNS acts_VVZ as_IN an_DT important_JJ constraint_NN on_IN 
development_NN ._SENT Withdrawals_NNS exceeding_VVG 20_CD %_NN of_IN renewable_JJ water_NN 
supply_NN have_VHP been_VBN used_VVN as_IN an_DT indicator_NN of_IN water_NN stress_NN ._SENT A_DT crop_NN is_VBZ 
water-stressed_VVN if_IN soil-available_JJ water_NN ,_, and_CC thus_RB actual_JJ evapotranspiration_NN ,_, 
is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN potential_JJ evapotranspiration_NN demands_NNS ._SENT 
Water-use_NN efficiency_NN 
Carbon_NN gain_NN in_IN photosynthesis_NN per_IN unit_NN water_NN lost_VVN in_IN evapotranspiration_NN ._SENT 
It_PP can_MD be_VB expressed_VVN on_IN a_DT short-term_JJ basis_NN as_IN the_DT ratio_NN 
of_IN photosynthetic_JJ carbon_NN gain_NN per_IN unit_NN transpirational_JJ water_NN loss_NN ,_, 
or_CC on_IN a_DT seasonal_JJ basis_NN as_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN net_JJ primary_JJ production_NN or_CC 
agricultural_JJ yield_NN to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN available_JJ water_NN ._SENT 
Welfare_NN

humans_NNS on_IN an_DT individual_JJ or_CC collective_JJ basis_NN ._SENT The_DT constituents_NNS of_IN

basic_JJ needs_NNS ,_, freedom_NN and_CC choice_NN ,_, health_NN ,_, good_JJ social_JJ relations_NNS ,_,

Wetland_NP

soils_NNS ,_, often_RB between_IN an_DT aquatic_NN and_CC a_DT terrestrial_JJ ecosystem_NN ,_, fed_VVN

C.J._NP Cleveland_NP and_CC C_NP ._SENT Morris_NP ,_, 2006_CD :_: Dictionary_NP of_IN Energy_NP ,_, Elsevier_NP ,_, Amsterdam_NP ._SENT Defi_NP nitions_NNS of_IN regions_NNS and_CC country_NN groupings_NNS are_VBP given_VVN in_IN Section_NP A.II.6_NP of_IN Annex_NP II_NP of_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT Glossary_NN Adaptation_NP :_: Initiatives_NNS and_CC measures_NNS to_TO reduce_VV the_DT vulnerability_NN or_CC increase_VV the_DT resilience_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS to_TO actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate-change_NN impacts_NNS ._SENT Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN adaptation_NN exist_VVP ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, anticipatory_JJ and_CC reactive_JJ ,_, private_JJ and_CC public_JJ ,_, and_CC autonomous_JJ and_CC planned_JJ ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP raising_VVG river_NN or_CC coastal_JJ dikes_NNS ,_, retreating_VVG from_IN coastal_JJ areas_NNS subject_JJ to_TO fl_NN ooding_NN from_IN sea_NN level_NN rise_NN or_CC introducing_VVG alternative_JJ temperature-appropriate_NN or_CC drought-adapted_JJ crops_NNS for_IN conventional_JJ ones_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS :_: A_DT collection_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, typically_RB between_IN 0.01_CD and_CC 10_CD μm_NN in_IN size_NN and_CC residing_VVG in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB black_JJ carbon_NN ._SENT Afforestation_NN :_: Direct_JJ human-induced_JJ conversion_NN of_IN land_NN that_WDT has_VHZ not_RB been_VBN forested_VVN historically_RB to_TO forested_JJ land_NN through_IN planting_NN ,_, seeding_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT human-induced_JJ promotion_NN of_IN natural_JJ seed_NN sources.1_NN See_VV also_RB deforestation_NN ,_, reforestation_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ._SENT Annex_NP I_NP countries_NNS :_: The_DT group_NN of_IN countries_NNS included_VVN in_IN Annex_NP I_NP (_( as_RB amended_VVN since_IN Malta_NP was_VBD added_VVN after_IN that_DT date_NN )_) to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ,_, including_VVG developed_VVN countries_NNS and_CC some_DT countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN ._SENT Under_IN Articles_NPS 4.2_NP (_( a_DT )_) and_CC 4.2_CD (_( b_LS )_) of_IN the_DT Convention_NP ,_, Annex_NP I_NP countries_NNS were_VBD encouraged_VVN to_TO return_VV individually_RB or_CC jointly_RB to_TO their_PP$ 1990_CD levels_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS by_IN 2000._CD The_DT group_NN is_VBZ largely_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT By_IN default_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ countries_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Non-Annex_NP I_NP countries_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB reduction_NN commitments_NNS under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT The_DT group_NN is_VBZ largely_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT Annex_NP I_NN countries_NNS to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT By_IN default_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ countries_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Non-Annex_NP I_NP countries_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB UNFCCC_NP ,_, Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT For_IN a_DT discussion_NN Verardo_NP ,_, D.J._NP Dokken_NP (_( eds_NNS ._SENT )_) ]_SYM ,_, Cambridge_NP University_NP Press_NP ,_, Cambridge_NP ,_, United_NP Kingdom_NP and_CC New_NP York_NP ,_, NY_NP ,_, USA_NP ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ :_: Related_VVN to_TO or_CC resulting_VVG from_IN the_DT infl_NN uence_NN of_IN human_JJ beings_NNS on_IN nature_NN ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, greenhouse_NN gas_NN precursors_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS result_NN from_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN changes_NNS ,_, livestock_NN ,_, fertilization_NN ,_, industrial_JJ ,_, commercial_JJ and_CC other_JJ activities_NNS that_WDT result_VVP in_IN a_DT net_JJ increase_NN in_IN emissions_NNS ._SENT Availability_NN (_( of_IN a_DT production_NN plant_NN )_) :_: The_DT percentage_NN of_IN time_NN a_DT plant_NN is_VBZ ready_JJ to_TO produce_VV ,_, measured_VVN as_IN uptime_NN to_TO total_JJ time_NN (_( total_JJ time_NN =_SYM uptime_RB +_SYM downtime_NN due_JJ to_TO maintenance_NN and_CC outages_NNS )_) ._SENT Balancing_VVG power_NN /_SYM reserves_NNS :_: Due_JJ to_TO instantaneous_JJ and_CC short-term_JJ fl_NN uctuations_NNS in_IN electric_JJ loads_NNS and_CC uncertain_JJ availability_NN of_IN power_NN plants_NNS there_EX is_VBZ a_DT constant_JJ need_NN for_IN spinning_NN and_CC quick-start_NN generators_NNS that_IN/that balance_NN demand_NN and_CC supply_NN at_IN the_DT imposed_VVN quality_NN levels_NNS for_IN frequency_NN and_CC voltage_NN ._SENT Barrier_NN :_: Any_DT obstacle_NN to_TO developing_VVG and_CC deploying_VVG a_DT renewable_JJ energy_NN (_( RE_NP )_) potential_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB overcome_VVN or_CC attenuated_VVN by_IN a_DT policy_NN ,_, programme_NN or_CC measure_NN ._SENT Barriers_NNS to_TO RE_JJ deployment_NN are_VBP unintentional_JJ or_CC intentionally_RB constructed_VVN impediments_NNS made_VVN by_IN man_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, badly_RB oriented_VVN buildings_NNS or_CC power_NN grid_NN access_NN criteria_NNS that_WDT discriminate_VVP against_IN independent_JJ RE_NN generators_NNS )_) ._SENT Distinct_JJ from_IN barriers_NNS are_VBP issues_NNS like_IN intrinsically_RB natural_JJ properties_NNS impeding_VVG the_DT application_NN of_IN some_DT RE_JJ sources_NNS at_IN some_DT place_NN or_CC time_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, fl_NN at_IN land_NN impedes_VVZ hydropower_NN and_CC night_NN the_DT collection_NN of_IN direct_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN )_) ._SENT Barrier_NN removal_NN includes_VVZ correcting_VVG market_NN failures_NNS directly_RB or_CC reducing_VVG the_DT transactions_NNS costs_NNS in_IN the_DT public_JJ and_CC private_JJ sectors_NNS by_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, improving_VVG institutional_JJ capacity_NN ,_, reducing_VVG risk_NN and_CC uncertainty_NN ,_, facilitating_VVG market_NN transactions_NNS and_CC enforcing_VVG regulatory_JJ policies_NNS ._SENT Baseline_NN :_: The_DT reference_NN scenario_NN for_IN measurable_JJ quantities_NNS from_IN which_WDT an_DT alternative_JJ outcome_NN can_MD be_VB measured_VVN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT non-intervention_NN scenario_NN is_VBZ used_VVN as_IN a_DT reference_NN in_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN intervention_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT A_DT baseline_NN may_MD be_VB an_DT extrapolation_NN of_IN recent_JJ trends_NNS ,_, or_CC it_PP may_MD assume_VV frozen_JJ technology_NN or_CC costs_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB business_NN as_IN usual_JJ ,_, models_NNS ,_, scenario_NN ._SENT 

Benchmark_NN :_: A_DT measurable_JJ variable_NN used_VVN as_IN a_DT baseline_NN or_CC reference_NN in_IN evaluating_VVG the_DT performance_NN of_IN a_DT technology_NN ,_, a_DT system_NN or_CC an_DT organization_NN ._SENT Benchmarks_NNS may_MD be_VB drawn_VVN from_IN internal_JJ experience_NN ,_, from_IN external_JJ correspondences_NNS or_CC from_IN legal_JJ requirements_NNS and_CC are_VBP often_RB used_VVN to_TO gauge_VV changes_NNS in_IN performance_NN over_IN time_NN ._SENT Biodiversity_NN :_: The_DT variability_NN among_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS from_IN all_DT sources_NNS including_VVG ,_, inter_VV alia_NP ,_, terrestrial_JJ ,_, marine_JJ and_CC other_JJ aquatic_JJ ecosystems_NNS and_CC the_DT ecological_JJ complexes_NNS of_IN which_WDT they_PP are_VBP part_NN ;_: this_DT includes_VVZ diversity_NN within_IN species_NNS ,_, among_IN species_NNS and_CC of_IN ecosystems_NNS ._SENT Bioenergy_NN :_: Energy_NN derived_VVN from_IN any_DT form_NN of_IN biomass_NN ._SENT Biofuel_NN :_: Any_DT liquid_JJ ,_, gaseous_JJ or_CC solid_JJ fuel_NN produced_VVN from_IN biomass_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, soybean_NN oil_NN ,_, alcohol_NN from_IN fermented_VVN sugar_NN ,_, black_JJ liquor_NN from_IN the_DT paper_NN manufacturing_NN process_NN ,_, wood_NN as_IN fuel_NN ,_, etc._FW Traditional_JJ biofuels_NNS include_VVP wood_NN ,_, dung_NN ,_, grass_NN and_CC agricultural_JJ residues_NNS ._SENT First-generation_NN manufactured_VVD biofuel_NN is_VBZ derived_VVN from_IN grains_NNS ,_, oilseeds_NNS ,_, animal_JJ fats_NNS and_CC waste_NN vegetable_NN oils_NNS with_IN mature_JJ conversion_NN technologies_NNS ._SENT Second-generation_NN biofuel_NN uses_VVZ non-traditional_JJ biochemical_JJ and_CC thermochemical_JJ conversion_NN processes_NNS and_CC feedstock_NN mostly_RB derived_VVN from_IN the_DT lignocellulosic_JJ fractions_NNS of_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, agricultural_JJ and_CC forestry_NN residues_NNS ,_, municipal_JJ solid_JJ waste_NN ,_, etc._FW Third-generation_NN biofuel_NN would_MD be_VB derived_VVN from_IN feedstocks_NNS like_IN algae_NN and_CC energy_NN crops_NNS by_IN advanced_JJ processes_NNS still_RB under_IN development_NN ._SENT These_DT second-_NN and_CC third-generation_NN biofuels_NNS produced_VVN through_IN new_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN next-generation_NN or_CC advanced_JJ biofuels_NNS or_CC advanced_JJ biofuel_NN technologies_NNS ._SENT Biomass_NN :_: Material_NN of_IN biological_JJ origin_NN (_( plants_NNS or_CC animal_NN matter_NN )_) ,_, excluding_VVG material_NN embedded_VVN in_IN geological_JJ formations_NNS and_CC transformed_VVN to_TO fossil_JJ fuels_NNS or_CC peat_NN ._SENT The_DT International_NP Energy_NP Agency_NP (_( World_NP Energy_NP Outlook_NP 2010_CD )_) defi_NN nes_NNS traditional_JJ biomass_NN as_IN biomass_NN consumption_NN in_IN the_DT residential_JJ sector_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS that_WDT refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT often_RB unsustainable_JJ use_NN of_IN wood_NN ,_, charcoal_NN ,_, agricultural_JJ residues_NNS and_CC animal_JJ dung_NN for_IN cooking_NN and_CC heating_NN ._SENT All_DT other_JJ biomass_NN use_NN is_VBZ defi_NN ned_VVN as_IN modern_JJ biomass_NN ,_, differentiated_VVD further_RBR by_IN this_DT report_NN into_IN two_CD groups_NNS ._SENT Modern_JJ bioenergy_NN encompasses_VVZ ,_, forest_NN products_NNS ,_, food_NN and_CC related_JJ industries_NNS ._SENT Black_JJ carbon_NN :_: Operationally_RB defi_NN ned_JJ aerosol_NN species_NNS based_VVN on_IN measurement_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN ._SENT Business_NN as_IN usual_JJ (_( BAU_NP )_) :_: The_DT future_NN is_VBZ projected_VVN or_CC predicted_VVN on_IN the_DT assumption_NN that_IN/that operating_VVG conditions_NNS and_CC applied_JJ policies_NNS remain_VVP what_WP they_PP are_VBP at_IN present_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB baseline_JJ ,_, models_NNS ,_, scenario_NN ._SENT Capacity_NN :_: In_IN general_NN ,_, the_DT intended_VVD output_NN level_NN for_IN a_DT sustained_JJ period_NN under_IN normal_JJ circumstances_NNS ._SENT Capacity_NN building_NN :_: In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN policies_NNS ,_, the_DT development_NN of_IN technical_JJ skills_NNS and_CC institutional_JJ capability_NN (_( the_DT art_NN of_IN doing_VVG )_) and_CC capacity_NN (_( suffi_NN cient_NN means_NNS )_) of_IN mitigation_NN capacity_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN cycle_NN :_: Describes_VVZ the_DT fl_NN ow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, methane_NN ,_, etc_FW )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, oceans_NNS ,_, terrestrial_JJ biosphere_NN and_CC lithosphere_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) :_: CO2_NP is_VBZ a_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN and_CC a_DT by-product_NN of_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS or_CC biomass_NN ,_, of_IN land_NN use_NN changes_NNS and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN that_WDT affects_VVZ Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB it_PP has_VHZ a_DT global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN of_IN 1._CD Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) :_: CO2_JJ from_IN industrial_JJ and_CC energy-related_JJ sources_NNS is_VBZ separated_VVN ,_, compressed_VVN and_CC transported_VVN to_TO a_DT storage_NN location_NN for_IN long-term_JJ isolation_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Cellulose_NN :_: The_DT principal_JJ chemical_NN constituent_NN of_IN the_DT cell_NN walls_NNS of_IN plants_NNS and_CC the_DT source_NN of_IN fi_NP brous_JJ materials_NNS for_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN of_IN various_JJ

of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVN over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ”_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN ‘climate_NN change’_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, and_CC ‘climate_NN variability’_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN (_( CO2eq_NP )_) :_: The_DT amount_NN of_IN CO2_NP emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT )_) comparable_JJ across_IN time_NN (_( see_VV Annex_NP II_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT operator_NN uses_VVZ a_DT fi_NN xed_JJ or_CC possibly_RB time-varying_JJ discount_NN rate_NN (_( >_SYM 0_CD )_) from_IN ,_, driven_VVN by_IN a_DT difference_NN in_IN voltage_NN between_IN the_DT ends_NNS of_IN the_DT conductor_NN ._SENT Electrical_JJ power_NN is_VBZ generated_VVN by_IN work_NN from_IN heat_NN in_IN ._SENT Emissions_NNS trading_NN :_: A_DT market-based_JJ instrument_NN to_TO reduce_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC other_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT The_DT environmental_JJ objective_NN or_CC sum_NN of_IN :_: The_DT amount_NN of_IN work_NN or_CC heat_NN delivered_VVN ._SENT Energy_NP is_VBZ classifi_NN ed_VVN in_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN types_NNS and_CC becomes_VVZ available_JJ to_TO human_JJ ends_NNS when_WRB it_PP fl_VVP ows_NNS from_IN one_CD place_NN to_TO another_DT or_CC is_VBZ converted_VVN from_IN one_CD type_NN into_IN another_DT ._SENT Daily_RB ,_, the_DT sun_NN supplies_VVZ large_JJ fl_NN ows_NNS of_IN radiation_NN energy_NN ._SENT Part_NN of_IN that_DT energy_NN is_VBZ used_VVN directly_RB ,_, while_IN part_NN undergoes_VVZ several_JJ conversions_NNS creating_VVG water_NN evaporation_NN ,_, winds_NNS ,_, etc._FW Some_DT share_NN is_VBZ stored_VVN in_IN biomass_NN or_CC rivers_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB harvested_VVN ._SENT Some_DT share_NN is_VBZ directly_RB usable_JJ such_JJ as_IN daylight_NN ,_, ventilation_NN or_CC ambient_JJ heat_NN ._SENT Primary_JJ energy_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN energy_NN sources_NNS )_) is_VBZ the_DT energy_NN embodied_VVN in_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, coal_NN ,_, crude_JJ oil_NN ,_, natural_JJ gas_NN ,_, uranium_NN ,_, and_CC renewable_JJ sources_NNS )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ defi_NN ned_VVN in_IN several_JJ alternative_JJ ways_NNS ._SENT The_DT International_NP Energy_NP Agency_NP utilizes_VVZ the_DT physical_JJ energy_NN content_NN method_NN ,_, which_WDT defi_VVZ nes_JJ primary_JJ energy_NN as_IN energy_NN that_WDT has_VHZ not_RB undergone_VVN any_DT anthropogenic_JJ conversion_NN ._SENT The_DT method_NN used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN is_VBZ the_DT direct_JJ equivalent_NN method_NN (_( see_VV Annex_NP II_NP )_) ,_, which_WDT counts_VVZ one_CD unit_NN of_IN secondary_JJ energy_NN provided_VVN from_IN non-combustible_JJ sources_NNS as_IN one_CD unit_NN of_IN primary_JJ energy_NN ,_, but_CC treats_VVZ combustion_NN energy_NN as_IN the_DT energy_NN potential_NN contained_VVN in_IN fuels_NNS prior_RB to_TO treatment_NN or_CC combustion_NN ._SENT Primary_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ transformed_VVN into_IN secondary_JJ energy_NN by_IN cleaning_VVG (_( natural_JJ gas_NN )_) ,_, refi_NN ning_NN (_( crude_JJ oil_NN to_TO oil_NN products_NNS )_) or_CC by_IN conversion_NN into_IN electricity_NN or_CC heat_NN ._SENT When_WRB the_DT secondary_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ delivered_VVN at_IN the_DT end-use_NN facilities_NNS it_PP is_VBZ called_VVN fi_NN nal_NNS energy_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, electricity_NN at_IN the_DT wall_NN outlet_NN )_) ,_, where_WRB it_PP becomes_VVZ usable_JJ energy_NN in_IN supplying_VVG services_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, light_JJ )_) ._SENT Embodied_VVN energy_NN is_VBZ the_DT energy_NN used_VVN to_TO produce_VV a_DT material_NN substance_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN processed_JJ metals_NNS or_CC building_NN materials_NNS )_) ,_, taking_VVG into_IN account_NN energy_NN used_VVN at_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN facility_NN (_( zero_CD order_NN )_) ,_, energy_NN used_VVN in_IN producing_VVG the_DT materials_NNS that_WDT are_VBP used_VVN in_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN facility_NN (_( fi_NN rst_NN order_NN )_) ,_, and_CC so_RB on_IN ._SENT Renewable_JJ energy_NN (_( RE_NN )_) is_VBZ any_DT form_NN of_IN energy_NN from_IN solar_JJ ,_, geophysical_JJ or_CC biological_JJ sources_NNS that_WDT is_VBZ replenished_VVN by_IN natural_JJ processes_NNS at_IN a_DT rate_NN that_WDT equals_VVZ or_CC exceeds_VVZ its_PP$ rate_NN of_IN use_NN ._SENT Renewable_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN from_IN the_DT continuing_JJ or_CC repetitive_JJ fl_NN ows_NNS of_IN energy_NN occurring_VVG in_IN the_DT natural_JJ environment_NN and_CC includes_VVZ low-carbon_NN technologies_NNS such_JJ as_IN solar_JJ energy_NN ,_, hydropower_NN ,_, wind_NN ,_, tide_NN and_CC waves_NNS and_CC ocean_NN thermal_JJ energy_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN renewable_JJ fuels_NNS such_JJ as_IN biomass_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT more_RBR detailed_JJ description_NN see_VVP specifi_NNS c_SYM renewable_JJ energy_NN types_NNS in_IN this_DT glossary_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, biomass_NN ,_, solar_JJ ,_, hydropower_NN ,_, ocean_NN ,_, geothermal_JJ and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Energy_NN access_NN :_: People_NNS are_VBP provided_VVN the_DT ability_NN to_TO benefi_NN t_NN from_IN affordable_JJ ,_, clean_JJ and_CC reliable_JJ energy_NN services_NNS for_IN basic_JJ human_JJ needs_NNS (_( cooking_NN and_CC heating_NN ,_, lighting_NN ,_, communication_NN ,_, mobility_NN )_) and_CC productive_JJ uses_NNS ._SENT Energy_NN carrier_NN :_: A_DT substance_NN for_IN delivering_VVG mechanical_JJ work_NN or_CC transfer_NN of_IN heat_NN ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN energy_NN carriers_NNS include_VVP :_: solid_JJ ,_, liquid_JJ or_CC gaseous_JJ fuels_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, biomass_NN ,_, coal_NN ,_, oil_NN ,_, natural_JJ gas_NN ,_, hydrogen_NN )_) ;_: pressurized_VVN /_SYM heated_VVN /_SYM cooled_VVN fl_NN uids_NNS (_( air_NN ,_, water_NN ,_, steam_NN )_) ;_: and_CC electric_JJ current_NN ._SENT Energy_NP effi_NP ciency_NN :_: The_DT ratio_NN of_IN useful_JJ energy_NN or_CC other_JJ useful_JJ physical_JJ outputs_NNS obtained_VVN from_IN a_DT system_NN ,_, conversion_NN process_NN ,_, transmission_NN or_CC storage_NN activity_NN to_TO the_DT input_NN of_IN energy_NN (_( measured_VVN as_IN kWh_NP /_SYM kWh_NN ,_, tonnes_NNS /_SYM kWh_NN or_CC any_DT other_JJ physical_JJ measure_NN of_IN useful_JJ output_NN like_IN tonne-km_NN transported_VVN ,_, etc._FW )_) ._SENT Energy_NP effi_NP ciency_NN is_VBZ a_DT component_NN of_IN energy_NN intensity_NN ._SENT Energy_NN intensity_NN :_: The_DT ratio_NN of_IN energy_NN inputs_NNS (_( in_IN Joules_NP )_) to_TO the_DT economic_JJ output_NN (_( in_IN dollars_NNS )_) that_WDT absorbed_VVD the_DT energy_NN input_NN ._SENT Energy_NN intensity_NN is_VBZ the_DT reciprocal_NN of_IN energy_NN productivity_NN ._SENT At_IN the_DT national_JJ level_NN ,_, energy_NN intensity_NN is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN total_JJ domestic_JJ primary_NN (_( or_CC fi_NN nal_NN )_) energy_NN use_NN to_TO gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT energy_NN intensity_NN of_IN an_DT economy_NN is_VBZ the_DT weighted_JJ sum_NN of_IN the_DT energy_NN intensities_NNS of_IN particular_JJ activities_NNS with_IN the_DT activities’_JJ shares_NNS in_IN GDP_NP as_IN weights_NNS ._SENT Energy_NN intensities_NNS are_VBP obtained_VVN from_IN available_JJ statistics_NNS (_( International_NP Energy_NP Agency_NP ,_, International_NP Monetary_NP Fund_NP )_) and_CC published_VVN annually_RB for_IN most_JJS countries_NNS in_IN the_DT world_NN ._SENT Energy_NN intensity_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN as_IN a_DT name_NN for_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN energy_NN inputs_NNS to_TO output_NN or_CC performance_NN in_IN physical_JJ terms_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, tonnes_NNS of_IN steel_NN output_NN ,_, tonne-km_NN transported_VVD ,_, etc._FW )_) and_CC in_IN such_JJ cases_NNS ,_, is_VBZ the_DT reciprocal_NN of_IN energy_NN effi_NN ciency_NN ._SENT Energy_NN productivity_NN :_: The_DT reciprocal_NN of_IN energy_NN intensity_NN ._SENT Energy_NN savings_NNS :_: Decreasing_VVG energy_NN intensity_NN by_IN changing_VVG the_DT activities_NNS that_WDT demand_VVP energy_NN inputs_NNS ._SENT Energy_NN savings_NNS can_MD be_VB realized_VVN by_IN technical_JJ ,_, 

organizational_JJ ,_, institutional_JJ and_CC structural_JJ actions_NNS and_CC by_IN changed_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT Energy_NN security_NN :_: The_DT goal_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN country_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT global_JJ community_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ,_, to_TO maintain_VV an_DT adequate_JJ energy_NN supply_NN ._SENT Measures_NNS encompass_VVP safeguarding_VVG access_NN to_TO energy_NN resources_NNS ;_: enabling_VVG development_NN and_CC deployment_NN of_IN technologies_NNS ;_: building_VVG suffi_NN cient_JJ infrastructure_NN to_TO generate_VV ,_, store_VV and_CC transmit_VV energy_NN supplies_NNS ;_: ensuring_VVG enforceable_JJ contracts_NNS of_IN delivery_NN ;_: and_CC access_NN to_TO energy_NN at_IN affordable_JJ prices_NNS for_IN a_DT specifi_NN c_SYM society_NN or_CC groups_NNS in_IN society_NN ._SENT Energy_NN services_NNS :_: Energy_NN services_NNS are_VBP the_DT tasks_NNS to_TO be_VB performed_VVN using_VVG energy_NN ._SENT A_DT specifi_NN c_SYM energy_NN service_NN such_JJ as_IN lighting_NN may_MD be_VB supplied_VVN by_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN different_JJ means_NNS from_IN daylighting_NN to_TO oil_NN lamps_NNS to_TO incandescent_JJ ,_, fl_JJ uorescent_NN or_CC light-emitting_NN diode_NN devices_NNS ._SENT The_DT amount_NN of_IN energy_NN used_VVN to_TO provide_VV a_DT service_NN may_MD vary_VV over_IN a_DT factor_NN of_IN 10_CD or_CC more_JJR ,_, and_CC the_DT corresponding_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS may_MD vary_VV from_IN zero_CD to_TO a_DT very_RB high_JJ value_NN depending_VVG on_IN the_DT source_NN of_IN energy_NN and_CC the_DT type_NN of_IN end-use_NN device_NN ._SENT Energy_NN transfer_NN :_: Energy_NN is_VBZ transferred_VVN as_IN work_NN ,_, light_NN or_CC heat_NN ._SENT Heat_NN transfer_NN spontaneously_RB occurs_VVZ from_IN objects_NNS at_IN higher_JJR temperature_NN to_TO objects_NNS at_IN lower_JJR temperature_NN and_CC is_VBZ classifi_NN ed_VVN as_IN conduction_NN (_( when_WRB the_DT objects_NNS have_VHP contact_NN )_) ,_, convection_NN (_( when_WRB a_DT fl_NN uid_NN like_IN air_NN or_CC water_NN takes_VVZ the_DT heat_NN from_IN the_DT warmer_JJR object_NN and_CC is_VBZ moved_VVN to_TO the_DT colder_JJR object_NN to_TO deliver_VV the_DT heat_NN )_) and_CC radiation_NN (_( when_WRB heat_NN travels_VVZ through_IN space_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN electromagnetic_JJ waves_NNS )_) ._SENT Externality_NN /_SYM external_JJ cost_NN /_SYM external_JJ benefi_NN t_NN :_: Externalities_NNS arise_VVP from_IN a_DT human_JJ activity_NN ,_, when_WRB agents_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT activity_NN do_VVP not_RB take_VV full_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT activity’s_JJ impact_NN on_IN others’_JJ production_NN and_CC consumption_NN possibilities_NNS ,_, and_CC no_DT compensation_NN exists_VVZ for_IN such_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT When_WRB the_DT impact_NN is_VBZ negative_JJ ,_, they_PP are_VBP external_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT When_WRB positive_JJ they_PP are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_RB external_JJ benefi_NN ts_NNS ._SENT Feed-in_NN tariff_NN :_: The_DT price_NN per_IN unit_NN of_IN electricity_NN that_IN/that a_DT utility_NN or_CC power_NN supplier_NN has_VHZ to_TO pay_VV for_IN distributed_VVN or_CC renewable_JJ electricity_NN fed_VVN into_IN the_DT grid_NN by_IN non-utility_JJ generators_NNS ._SENT A_DT public_JJ authority_NN regulates_VVZ the_DT tariff_NN ._SENT There_EX may_MD also_RB be_VB a_DT tariff_NN for_IN supporting_VVG renewable_JJ heat_NN supplies_NNS ._SENT Financing_NN :_: Raising_VVG or_CC providing_VVG money_NN or_CC capital_NN by_IN individuals_NNS ,_, businesses_NNS ,_, banks_NNS ,_, venture_NN funds_NNS ,_, public_JJ instances_NNS ,_, etc._FW for_IN realizing_VVG a_DT project_NN or_CC continuing_VVG an_DT activity_NN ._SENT Depending_VVG on_IN the_DT fi_NN nancier_NN the_DT money_NN is_VBZ raised_VVN and_CC is_VBZ provided_VVN differently_RB ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, businesses_NNS may_MD raise_VV money_NN from_IN internal_JJ company_NN profi_NN ts_NNS ,_, debt_NN or_CC equity_NN (_( shares_NNS )_) ._SENT Project_NN fi_NNS nancing_NN of_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN may_MD be_VB provided_VVN by_IN fi_NN nanciers_NNS to_TO distinct_JJ ,_, single-purpose_NN companies_NNS ,_, whose_WP$ renewable_JJ energy_NN sales_NNS are_VBP usually_RB guaranteed_VVN by_IN power_NN purchase_NN agreements_NNS ._SENT Non-recourse_NN fi_NN nancing_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN off-balance_JJ sheet_NN since_IN the_DT fi_NN nanciers_NNS rely_VVP on_IN the_DT certainty_NN of_IN project_NN cash_NN fl_NN ows_NNS to_TO pay_VV back_RB the_DT loan_NN ,_, not_RB on_IN the_DT creditworthiness_NN of_IN the_DT project_NN developer_NN ._SENT Public_JJ equity_NN fi_NN nancing_NN is_VBZ capital_NN provided_VVN for_IN publicly_RB listed_VVN companies_NNS ._SENT Private_JJ equity_NN fi_NN nancing_NN is_VBZ capital_NN provided_VVN directly_RB to_TO private_JJ companies_NNS ._SENT Corporate_JJ fi_NN nancing_NN by_IN banks_NNS via_IN debt_NN obligations_NNS uses_VVZ ‘onbalance_NN sheet’_NN assets_NNS as_IN collateral_NN and_CC is_VBZ therefore_RB limited_VVN by_IN the_DT debt_NN ratio_NN of_IN companies_NNS that_WDT must_MD rationalize_VV each_DT additional_JJ loan_NN with_IN other_JJ capital_NN needs_NNS ._SENT Fiscal_JJ incentive_NN :_: Actors_NNS (_( individuals_NNS ,_, households_NNS ,_, companies_NNS )_) are_VBP granted_VVN a_DT reduction_NN of_IN their_PP$ contribution_NN to_TO the_DT public_JJ treasury_NN via_IN income_NN or_CC other_JJ taxes_NNS ._SENT Fuel_NN cell_NN :_: A_DT fuel_NN cell_NN generates_VVZ electricity_NN in_IN a_DT direct_JJ and_CC continuous_JJ way_NN from_IN the_DT controlled_JJ electrochemical_JJ reaction_NN of_IN hydrogen_NN or_CC another_DT fuel_NN and_CC oxygen_NN ._SENT With_IN hydrogen_NN as_IN fuel_NN it_PP emits_VVZ only_RB water_VV and_CC heat_VV (_( no_DT CO2_NP )_) and_CC the_DT heat_NN can_MD be_VB utilized_VVN (_( see_VV cogeneration_NN )_) ._SENT General_JJ equilibrium_NN models_NNS :_: General_JJ equilibrium_NN models_NNS consider_VVP simultaneously_RB all_PDT the_DT markets_NNS and_CC feedback_NN effects_NNS among_IN them_PP in_IN an_DT economy_NN leading_VVG to_TO market_NN clearance_NN ._SENT Generation_NN control_NN :_: Generation_NN of_IN electricity_NN at_IN a_DT renewable_JJ energy_NN plant_NN may_MD be_VB subject_JJ to_TO various_JJ controls_NNS ._SENT Active_JJ control_NN is_VBZ a_DT deliberate_JJ intervention_NN in_IN the_DT functioning_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN (_( for_IN example_NN ,_, wind_NN turbine_NN pitch_NN control_NN :_: changing_VVG the_DT orientation_NN of_IN the_DT blades_NNS for_IN varying_VVG a_DT wind_NN turbine’s_NN output_NN )_) ._SENT Passive_JJ control_NN is_VBZ when_WRB natural_JJ forces_NNS adjust_VVP the_DT functioning_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN (_( for_IN example_NN ,_, wind_NN turbine_NN stall_NN control_NN :_: the_DT design_NN of_IN the_DT blade_NN shape_NN such_JJ that_IN/that at_IN a_DT desired_VVN speed_NN the_DT blade_NN spills_VVZ the_DT wind_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO automatically_RB control_VV the_DT wind_NN turbine’s_NN output_NN )_) ._SENT Geothermal_JJ energy_NN :_: Accessible_JJ thermal_JJ energy_NN stored_VVN in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP interior_NN ,_, in_IN both_DT rock_NN and_CC trapped_JJ steam_NN or_CC liquid_JJ water_NN (_( hydrothermal_JJ resources_NNS )_) ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO generate_VV electric_JJ energy_NN in_IN a_DT thermal_JJ power_NN plant_NN ,_, or_CC to_TO supply_VV heat_NN to_TO any_DT process_NN requiring_VVG it_PP ._SENT The_DT main_JJ sources_NNS of_IN geothermal_JJ energy_NN are_VBP the_DT residual_JJ energy_NN available_JJ from_IN planet_NN formation_NN and_CC the_DT energy_NN continuously_RB generated_VVN from_IN radionuclide_NN decay_NN ._SENT Geothermal_JJ gradient_NN :_: Rate_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT Earth’s_NP temperature_NN increases_NNS with_IN depth_NN ,_, indicating_VVG heat_NN fl_NN owing_VVG from_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP warm_JJ interior_NN to_TO its_PP$ colder_JJR parts_NNS ._SENT Global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN (_( GWP_NP )_) :_: GWP_NP is_VBZ an_DT index_NN ,_, based_VVN upon_IN radiative_JJ properties_NNS of_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, measuring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN in_IN today’s_NN atmosphere_NN integrated_VVN over_IN a_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, relative_JJ 

Glossary_NN ,_, Acronyms_NP ,_, Chemical_NP Symbols_NP and_CC Prefi_NP xes_JJ Annex_NN I_PP to_TO that_DT of_IN CO2_NP ._SENT The_DT GWP_NP represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN that_IN/that these_DT gases_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ relative_JJ effectiveness_NN in_IN absorbing_VVG outgoing_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ranks_VVZ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN GWPs_NP from_IN single_JJ pulse_NN emissions_NNS over_IN subsequent_JJ 100-year_JJ time_NN frames_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN and_CC CO2-_NN equivalent_NN emission_NN ._SENT Governance_NN :_: Governance_NN is_VBZ a_DT comprehensive_JJ and_CC inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN the_DT full_JJ range_NN of_IN means_NNS for_IN deciding_VVG ,_, managing_VVG and_CC implementing_VVG policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS ._SENT Whereas_IN government_NN is_VBZ defi_RB ned_VVN strictly_RB in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT nation-state_NN ,_, the_DT more_RBR inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN governance_NN ,_, recognizes_VVZ the_DT contributions_NNS of_IN various_JJ levels_NNS of_IN government_NN (_( global_JJ ,_, international_JJ ,_, regional_JJ ,_, local_JJ )_) and_CC the_DT contributing_VVG roles_NNS of_IN the_DT private_JJ sector_NN ,_, of_IN nongovernmental_JJ actors_NNS and_CC of_IN civil_JJ society_NN to_TO addressing_VVG the_DT many_JJ types_NNS of_IN issues_NNS facing_VVG the_DT global_JJ community_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) :_: Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, both_CC natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN at_IN specifi_NP c_SYM wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Besides_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ sulphur_NN hexafl_NN uoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofl_NN uorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfl_NN uorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT Grid_NN (_( electric_JJ grid_NN ,_, electricity_NN grid_NN ,_, power_NN grid_NN )_) :_: A_DT network_NN consisting_VVG of_IN wires_NNS ,_, switches_NNS and_CC transformers_NNS to_TO transmit_VV electricity_NN from_IN power_NN sources_NNS to_TO power_NN users_NNS ._SENT A_DT large_JJ network_NN is_VBZ layered_VVN from_IN low-voltage_NN (_( 110-240_CD V_NN )_) distribution_NN ,_, over_IN intermediate_JJ voltage_NN (_( 1-50_CD kV_NN )_) to_TO high-voltage_NN (_( above_IN 50_CD kV_NN to_TO MV_NP )_) transport_NN subsystems_NNS ._SENT Interconnected_VVN grids_NNS cover_VVP large_JJ areas_NNS up_RB to_TO continents_NNS ._SENT The_DT grid_NN is_VBZ a_DT power_NN exchange_NN platform_NN enhancing_VVG supply_NN reliability_NN and_CC economies_NNS of_IN scale_NN ._SENT Grid_NN connection_NN for_IN a_DT power_NN producer_NN is_VBZ mostly_RB crucial_JJ for_IN economical_JJ operation_NN ._SENT Grid_NN codes_NNS are_VBP technical_JJ conditions_NNS for_IN equipment_NN and_CC operation_NN that_IN/that a_DT power_NN producer_NN must_MD obey_VV for_IN getting_VVG supply_NN access_NN to_TO the_DT grid_NN ;_: also_RB consumer_NN connections_NNS must_MD respect_VV technical_JJ rules_NNS ._SENT Grid_NN access_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT acceptance_NN of_IN power_NN producers_NNS to_TO deliver_VV to_TO the_DT grid_NN ._SENT Grid_NN integration_NN accommodates_VVZ power_NN production_NN from_IN a_DT portfolio_NN of_IN diverse_JJ and_CC some_DT variable_JJ generation_NN sources_NNS in_IN a_DT balanced_JJ power_NN system_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB transmission_NN and_CC distribution_NN ._SENT Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP (_( GDP_NP )_) :_: The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, at_IN purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT resident_NN and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT taxes_NNS and_CC minus_IN any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT products_NNS in_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC a_DT geographic_JJ region_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN ,_, normally_RB one_CD year_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG for_IN depreciation_NN of_IN fabricated_VVN assets_NNS or_CC depletion_NN and_CC degradation_NN of_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Heat_NN exchanger_NN :_: Devices_NNS for_IN effi_NP cient_JJ heat_NN transfer_NN from_IN one_CD medium_NN to_TO another_DT without_IN mixing_VVG the_DT hot_JJ and_CC cold_JJ fl_NN ows_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, radiators_NNS ,_, boilers_NNS ,_, steam_NN generators_NNS ,_, condensers_NNS ._SENT Heat_NN pump_NN :_: Installation_NN that_WDT transfers_VVZ heat_NN from_IN a_DT colder_JJR to_TO a_DT hotter_JJR place_NN ,_, opposite_JJ to_TO the_DT natural_JJ direction_NN of_IN heat_NN fl_NN ows_NN (_( see_VV energy_NN transfer_NN )_) ._SENT Technically_RB similar_JJ to_TO a_DT refrigerator_NN ,_, heat_NN pumps_NNS are_VBP used_VVN to_TO extract_VV heat_NN from_IN ambient_JJ environments_NNS like_IN the_DT ground_NN (_( geothermal_JJ or_CC ground_NN source_NN )_) ,_, water_NN or_CC air_NN ._SENT Heat_NN pumps_NNS can_MD be_VB inverted_VVN to_TO provide_VV cooling_VVG in_IN summer_NN ._SENT Human_NP Development_NP Index_NP (_( HDI_NP )_) :_: The_DT HDI_NP allows_VVZ the_DT assessment_NN of_IN countries’_JJ progress_NN regarding_VVG social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ development_NN as_IN a_DT composite_JJ index_NN of_IN three_CD indicators_NNS :_: 1_LS )_) health_NN measured_VVN by_IN life_NN expectancy_NN at_IN birth_NN ;_: 2_LS )_) knowledge_NN as_IN measured_VVN by_IN a_DT combination_NN of_IN the_DT adult_JJ literacy_NN rate_NN and_CC the_DT combined_JJ primary_NN ,_, secondary_JJ and_CC tertiary_JJ school_NN enrolment_NN ratio_NN ;_: and_CC 3_LS )_) standard_JJ of_IN living_VVG as_IN gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN per_IN capita_NN (_( in_IN purchasing_VVG power_NN parity_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT HDI_NP only_RB acts_VVZ as_IN a_DT broad_JJ proxy_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT key_JJ issues_NNS of_IN human_JJ development_NN ;_: for_IN instance_NN ,_, it_PP does_VVZ not_RB refl_JJ ect_NN issues_NNS such_JJ as_IN political_JJ participation_NN or_CC gender_NN inequalities_NNS ._SENT Hybrid_JJ vehicle_NN :_: also_RB UNFCCC_NP ._SENT Land_NN use_NN (_( change_VV ;_: direct_JJ and_CC indirect_JJ )_) :_: The_DT total_NN of_IN arrangements_NNS ,_, activities_NNS and_CC inputs_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN a_DT :_: A_DT solid_JJ waste_NN disposal_NN site_NN where_WRB waste_NN is_VBZ deposited_VVN below_IN ,_, at_IN or_CC above_IN ground_NN level_NN ._SENT Limited_VVN to_TO engineered_JJ sites_NNS with_IN )_) at_IN a_DT specifi_NP ed_NN conversion_NN rate_NN and_CC within_IN a_DT specifi_NP ed_NN time_NN frame_NN ._SENT Lock-in_NN :_: Technologies_NNS that_WDT cover_VVP large_JJ market_NN shares_NNS Photovoltaics_NNS (_( PV_NP )_) :_: The_DT technology_NN of_IN converting_VVG light_JJ energy_NN directly_RB into_IN electricity_NN by_IN mobilizing_VVG electrons_NNS in_IN solid_JJ state_NN devices_NNS ._SENT The_DT specially_RB prepared_VVN thin_JJ sheet_NN semiconductors_NNS are_VBP called_VVN PV_NP cells_NNS ._SENT See_VV solar_JJ energy_NN ._SENT Policies_NNS :_: Policies_NNS are_VBP which_WDT a_DT judgment_NN or_CC decision_NN may_MD be_VB based_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN policies_NNS and_CC policy_NN instruments_NNS to_TO support_VV renewable_JJ energy_NN ,_, four_CD inclusive_JJ criteria_NNS are_VBP common_JJ :_: Effectiveness_NN (_( effi_NN cacy_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT intended_JJ objectives_NNS are_VBP met_VVN ,_, for_IN instance_NN the_DT actual_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT output_NN of_IN renewable_JJ electricity_NN generated_VVD or_CC shares_NNS of_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN in_IN total_JJ energy_NN supplies_NNS within_IN a_DT specifi_NP ed_NN time_NN period_NN ._SENT Beyond_IN quantitative_JJ targets_NNS ,_, this_DT may_MD include_VV factors_NNS such_JJ as_IN achieved_VVN degrees_NNS of_IN technological_JJ diversity_NN (_( promotion_NN of_IN different_JJ renewable_JJ energy_NN technologies_NNS )_) or_CC of_IN spatial_JJ diversity_NN (_( geographical_JJ distribution_NN of_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN supplies_NNS )_) ._SENT Effi_NP ciency_NN is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN outcomes_NNS to_TO inputs_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, renewable_JJ energy_NN targets_NNS realized_VVN for_IN economic_JJ resources_NNS spent_VVD ,_, mostly_RB measured_VVN at_IN one_CD point_NN of_IN time_NN (_( static_JJ effi_NN ciency_NN )_) ,_, also_RB called_VVN costeffectiveness_NN ._SENT Dynamic_JJ effi_NN ciency_NN adds_VVZ a_DT future_JJ time_NN dimension_NN by_IN including_VVG how_WRB much_JJ innovation_NN is_VBZ triggered_VVN to_TO improve_VV the_DT ratio_NN of_IN outcomes_NNS to_TO inputs_NNS ._SENT Equity_NN covers_VVZ the_DT incidence_NN and_CC distributional_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN a_DT policy_NN ,_, including_VVG fairness_NN ,_, justice_NN and_CC respect_NN for_IN the_DT rights_NNS of_IN indigenous_JJ peoples_NNS ._SENT The_DT equity_NN criterion_NN looks_VVZ at_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN costs_NNS and_CC benefi_NN ts_NNS of_IN a_DT policy_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT inclusion_NN and_CC participation_NN of_IN wide_JJ ranges_NNS of_IN different_JJ stakeholders_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, local_JJ populations_NNS ,_, independent_JJ power_NN producers_NNS )_) ._SENT Institutional_JJ feasibility_NN is_VBZ the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT policy_NN or_CC policy_NN instrument_NN is_VBZ seen_VVN as_IN legitimate_JJ ,_, able_JJ to_TO gain_VV acceptance_NN ,_, and_CC able_JJ to_TO be_VB adopted_VVN and_CC implemented_VVN ._SENT It_PP covers_VVZ administrative_JJ feasibility_NN when_WRB compatible_JJ with_IN the_DT available_JJ information_NN base_NN and_CC administrative_JJ capacity_NN ,_, legal_JJ structure_NN and_CC economic_JJ realities_NNS ._SENT Political_JJ feasibility_NN needs_VVZ acceptance_NN and_CC support_NN by_IN stakeholders_NNS ,_, organizations_NNS and_CC constituencies_NNS ,_, and_CC compatibility_NN with_IN prevailing_VVG cultures_NNS and_CC traditions_NNS ._SENT Polluter_NN pays_VVZ principle_NN :_: In_IN 1972_CD the_DT OECD_NP agreed_VVD that_IN/that polluters_NNS should_MD pay_VV the_DT costs_NNS of_IN abating_VVG the_DT own_JJ environmental_JJ pollution_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN by_IN installation_NN of_IN fi_NN lters_NNS ,_, sanitation_NN plants_NNS and_CC other_JJ add-on_JJ techniques_NNS ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ the_DT narrow_JJ defi_NN nition_NN ._SENT The_DT extended_JJ defi_NN nition_NN is_VBZ when_WRB polluters_NNS would_MD additionally_RB pay_VV for_IN the_DT damage_NN caused_VVN by_IN their_PP$ residual_JJ pollution_NN (_( eventually_RB also_RB historical_JJ pollution_NN )_) ._SENT Another_DT extension_NN is_VBZ the_DT precautionary_JJ polluter_NN pays_VVZ principle_NN where_WRB potential_JJ polluters_NNS are_VBP mandated_VVN to_TO take_VV insurance_NN or_CC preventive_JJ measures_NNS for_IN pollution_NN that_WDT may_MD occur_VV in_IN the_DT future_NN ._SENT The_DT acronym_NN PPP_NP has_VHZ also_RB other_JJ meanings_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN Preventing_NP Pollution_NP Pays-off_NP ,_, Public_NP Private_NP Partnership_NP ,_, or_CC Purchasing_NP Power_NP Parity_NP ._SENT Portfolio_NN analysis_NN :_: Examination_NN of_IN a_DT collection_NN of_IN assets_NNS or_CC policies_NNS that_WDT are_VBP characterized_VVN by_IN different_JJ risks_NNS and_CC payoffs_NNS ._SENT The_DT objective_JJ function_NN is_VBZ built_VVN up_RP around_IN the_DT variability_NN of_IN returns_NNS and_CC their_PP$ risks_NNS ,_, leading_VVG up_RP to_TO the_DT decision_NN rule_NN to_TO choose_VV the_DT portfolio_NN with_IN highest_JJS expected_VVN return_NN ._SENT Potential_NN :_: Several_JJ levels_NNS of_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN supply_NN potentials_NNS can_MD be_VB identifi_NN ed_NN ,_, although_IN every_DT level_NN may_MD span_VV a_DT broad_JJ range_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, resource_NN potential_NN encompasses_VVZ all_DT levels_NNS for_IN a_DT specifi_NN c_SYM renewable_JJ energy_NN resource_NN ._SENT Market_NN potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN renewable_JJ are_VBP based_VVN on_IN expected_VVN private_JJ revenues_NNS and_CC expenditures_NNS ,_, calculated_VVN at_IN private_JJ prices_NNS (_( incorporating_VVG subsidies_NNS ,_, levies_NNS and_CC rents_NNS )_) and_CC with_IN private_JJ discount_NN rates_NNS ._SENT The_DT private_JJ context_NN is_VBZ partly_RB shaped_VVN by_IN public_JJ authority_NN policies_NNS ._SENT Economic_JJ potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN output_NN projected_VVN when_WRB all_DT social_JJ costs_NNS and_CC benefi_NN ts_NNS related_VVN to_TO that_DT output_NN are_VBP included_VVN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ full_JJ transparency_NN of_IN information_NN ,_, and_CC assuming_VVG exchanges_NNS in_IN the_DT economy_NN install_VV a_DT general_JJ equilibrium_NN characterized_VVN by_IN spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ effi_NN ciency_NN ._SENT Negative_JJ externalities_NNS and_CC co-benefi_NN ts_NNS of_IN all_DT energy_NN uses_VVZ and_CC of_IN other_JJ economic_JJ activities_NNS are_VBP priced_VVN ._SENT Social_JJ discount_NN rates_NNS balance_VV the_DT interests_NNS of_IN consecutive_JJ human_JJ generations_NNS ._SENT Sustainable_JJ development_NN potential_NN is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN reference_NN to_TO costs_NNS ,_, barriers_NNS or_CC policies_NNS is_VBZ made_VVN ._SENT 

Glossary_NN ,_, Acronyms_NP ,_, Chemical_NP Symbols_NP and_CC Prefi_NP xes_NN Annex_NP I_NP Technical_NP potentials_NNS reported_VVD in_IN the_DT literature_NN being_VBG assessed_VVN in_IN this_DT in_IN the_DT underlying_VVG report_NN ._SENT Theoretical_JJ potential_NN is_VBZ derived_VVN from_IN natural_JJ and_CC climatic_JJ (_( physical_JJ )_) parameters_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, total_JJ solar_JJ irradiation_NN on_IN a_DT continent’s_NNS surface_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT theoretical_JJ potential_NN can_MD be_VB quantifi_NNS ed_VVN with_IN reasonable_JJ accuracy_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT information_NN is_VBZ of_IN limited_JJ practical_JJ relevance_NN ._SENT It_PP represents_VVZ the_DT upper_JJ limit_NN of_IN what_WP can_MD be_VB produced_VVN from_IN an_DT energy_NN resource_NN based_VVN on_IN second_JJ )_) ._SENT Present_JJ value_NN :_: The_DT value_NN of_IN a_DT money_NN amount_NN differs_VVZ when_WRB the_DT amount_NN is_VBZ available_JJ at_IN different_JJ moments_NNS in_IN time_NN (_( /_SYM rate_NN ._SENT Public_JJ fi_NN nance_NN :_: Public_JJ support_NN for_IN which_WDT a_DT fi_NN nancial_NN return_NN is_VBZ expected_VVN (_( loans_NNS ,_, equity_NN )_) or_CC fi_NP nancial_JJ and_CC private_JJ sectors_NNS to_TO deliver_VV services_NNS or_CC infrastructure_NN ._SENT Quota_NN (_( on_IN renewable_JJ electricity_NN /_SYM energy_NN )_) :_: Established_VVN quotas_NNS obligate_VV tradable_JJ certifi_NN cates_NN Reactive_JJ power_NN :_: The_DT part_NN of_IN instantaneous_JJ power_NN that_WDT does_VVZ no_DT real_JJ work_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ function_NN is_VBZ to_TO establish_VV and_CC sustain_VV the_DT electric_JJ and_CC magnetic_JJ fi_NN elds_NNS required_VVN to_TO let_VV active_JJ power_NN perform_VV useful_JJ work_NN ._SENT Rebound_NN effect_NN :_: After_IN implementation_NN of_IN effi_NN cient_NN technologies_NNS and_CC practices_NNS ,_, part_NN of_IN the_DT expected_VVN energy_NN savings_NNS is_VBZ not_RB realized_VVN because_IN the_DT accompanying_JJ savings_NNS in_IN energy_NN bills_NNS may_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO acquire_VV more_JJR energy_NN services_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, improvements_NNS in_IN car_NN engine_NN effi_NN ciency_NN lower_RBR the_DT cost_NN per_IN kilometre_NN driven_VVN ,_, encouraging_VVG consumers_NNS to_TO drive_VV more_RBR often_RB or_CC longer_JJR distances_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO spend_VV the_DT saved_VVN money_NN on_IN other_JJ energy-consuming_VVG activities_NNS ._SENT Successful_JJ energy_NN effi_NN ciency_NN policies_NNS may_MD lead_VV to_TO lower_VV economy-wide_JJ energy_NN demand_NN and_CC if_IN so_RB to_TO lower_JJR energy_NN prices_NNS with_IN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN the_DT fi_NN nancial_NN savings_NNS stimulating_VVG rebound_NN effects_NNS ._SENT The_DT rebound_NN effect_NN is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN non-realized_JJ energy_NN and_CC resource_NN savings_NNS compared_VVN to_TO the_DT potential_JJ savings_NNS in_IN case_NN consumption_NN would_MD have_VH remained_VVN constant_JJ as_IN before_IN the_DT effi_NN ciency_NN measures_NNS were_VBD implemented_VVN ._SENT For_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT main_JJ concern_NN about_IN rebound_NN effects_NNS is_VBZ their_PP$ impact_NN on_IN CO2_JJ emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN rebound_NN )_) ._SENT Reforestation_NN :_: Direct_JJ human-induced_JJ conversion_NN of_IN non-forested_JJ land_NN to_TO forested_JJ land_NN through_IN planting_NN ,_, seeding_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT human-induced_JJ promotion_NN of_IN natural_JJ seed_NN sources_NNS ,_, on_IN land_NN that_WDT was_VBD previously_RB forested_VVN but_CC and_CC imposing_VVG rules_NNS or_CC orders_NNS ._SENT Informational_JJ ,_, transactional_JJ ,_, administrative_JJ and_CC political_JJ constraints_NNS in_IN practice_NN limit_NN the_DT regulator’s_NN ,_, shortage_NN of_IN supply_NN capacity_NN or_CC by_IN failures_NNS in_IN parts_NNS of_IN the_DT grid_NN ._SENT Reliability_NN differs_VVZ from_IN security_NN and_CC from_IN fl_NN uctuations_NNS future_NN may_MD develop_VV based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN key_JJ relationships_NNS and_CC driving_JJ forces_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, rate_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN ,_, prices_NNS )_) on_IN social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ development_NN ,_, energy_NN use_NN ,_, etc._FW Note_VV that_IN/that scenarios_NNS are_VBP neither_DT predictions_NNS nor_CC forecasts_NNS ,_, but_CC are_VBP useful_JJ to_TO provide_VV a_DT view_NN of_IN the_DT implications_NNS of_IN alternative_JJ developments_NNS and_CC actions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB baseline_JJ ,_, business_NN as_IN usual_JJ ,_, models_NNS ._SENT 

Seismicity_NN :_: The_DT distribution_NN and_CC frequency_NN of_IN earthquakes_NNS in_IN time_NN ,_, magnitude_NN and_CC space_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT yearly_JJ number_NN of_IN earthquakes_NNS of_IN magnitude_NN between_IN 5_CD and_CC 6_CD per_IN 100_CD km2_NN or_CC in_IN some_DT region_NN ._SENT Sink_NN :_: Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN that_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC aerosol_NN ,_, or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC aerosol_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Solar_JJ collector_NN :_: A_DT device_NN for_IN converting_VVG solar_JJ energy_NN to_TO thermal_JJ energy_NN (_( heat_NN )_) of_IN a_DT fl_NN owing_VVG fl_NN uid_NN ._SENT Solar_JJ energy_NN :_: Energy_NN from_IN the_DT Sun_NP that_WDT is_VBZ captured_VVN either_RB as_IN heat_NN ,_, as_IN light_NN that_WDT is_VBZ converted_VVN into_IN chemical_JJ energy_NN by_IN natural_JJ or_CC artifi_JJ cial_JJ photosynthesis_NN ,_, or_CC by_IN photovoltaic_JJ panels_NNS and_CC converted_VVN directly_RB into_IN electricity_NN ._SENT Concentrating_VVG solar_JJ power_NN (_( CSP_NP )_) systems_NNS use_VVP either_DT lenses_NNS or_CC mirrors_VVZ to_TO capture_VV large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN solar_JJ energy_NN and_CC focus_VV it_PP down_RP to_TO a_DT smaller_JJR region_NN of_IN space_NN ._SENT The_DT higher_JJR temperatures_NNS produced_VVN can_MD operate_VV a_DT thermal_JJ steam_NN turbine_NN or_CC be_VB used_VVN in_IN high-temperature_NN industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Direct_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN solar_JJ energy_NN as_IN it_PP arrives_VVZ at_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN before_IN it_PP is_VBZ stored_VVN in_IN water_NN or_CC soils_NNS ._SENT Solar_JJ thermal_JJ is_VBZ the_DT use_NN of_IN direct_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN for_IN heat_NN end-uses_NNS ,_, excluding_VVG CSP_NP ._SENT Active_JJ solar_JJ needs_NNS equipment_NN like_IN panels_NNS ,_, pumps_NNS and_CC fans_NNS to_TO collect_VV and_CC distribute_VV the_DT energy_NN ._SENT Passive_JJ solar_JJ is_VBZ based_VVN on_IN structural_JJ design_NN and_CC construction_NN techniques_NNS that_WDT enable_VVP buildings_NNS to_TO utilize_VV solar_JJ energy_NN for_IN heating_NN ,_, cooling_VVG and_CC lighting_VVG by_IN non-mechanical_JJ means_NNS ._SENT Solar_JJ irradiance_NN :_: The_DT rate_NN of_IN solar_JJ power_NN incidence_NN on_IN a_DT surface_NN (_( W_NP /_SYM m2_NN )_) ._SENT Irradiance_NN depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT orientation_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN ,_, with_IN as_IN special_JJ orientations_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) surfaces_VVZ perpendicular_JJ to_TO the_DT beam_NN solar_JJ radiation_NN ;_: (_( b_LS )_) surfaces_VVZ horizontal_JJ with_IN or_CC on_IN the_DT ground_NN ._SENT Full_JJ sun_NN is_VBZ solar_JJ irradiance_NN that_WDT is_VBZ approximately_RB 1_CD ,_, 000_CD W_NN /_SYM m2_JJ ._SENT Solar_JJ radiation_NN :_: The_DT sun_NN radiates_VVZ light_NN and_CC heat_NN energy_NN in_IN wavelengths_NNS from_IN ultraviolet_NN to_TO infrared_NN ._SENT Radiation_NN arriving_VVG at_IN surfaces_NNS may_MD be_VB absorbed_VVN ,_, refl_JJ ected_JJ or_CC transmitted_JJ ._SENT Global_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN consists_VVZ of_IN beam_NN (_( arriving_VVG on_IN Earth_NN in_IN a_DT straight_JJ line_NN )_) and_CC diffuse_JJ radiation_NN (_( arriving_VVG on_IN Earth_NN after_IN being_VBG scattered_VVN by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS )_) ._SENT Standards_NNS :_: Set_VVN of_IN rules_NNS or_CC codes_NNS mandating_VVG or_CC defi_NN ning_NN product_NN performance_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, grades_NNS ,_, dimensions_NNS ,_, characteristics_NNS ,_, test_NN methods_NNS and_CC rules_NNS for_IN use_NN )_) ._SENT Product_NN ,_, technology_NN or_CC performance_NN standards_NNS establish_VV minimum_JJ requirements_NNS for_IN affected_JJ products_NNS or_CC technologies_NNS ._SENT Subsidy_NN :_: Direct_JJ payment_NN from_IN the_DT government_NN or_CC a_DT tax_NN reduction_NN to_TO a_DT private_JJ party_NN for_IN implementing_VVG a_DT practice_NN the_DT government_NN wishes_VVZ to_TO encourage_VV ._SENT The_DT reduction_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS is_VBZ stimulated_VVN by_IN lowering_VVG existing_JJ subsidies_NNS that_WDT have_VHP the_DT effect_NN of_IN raising_VVG emissions_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN subsidies_NNS for_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN use_NN )_) or_CC by_IN providing_VVG subsidies_NNS for_IN practices_NNS that_WDT reduce_VVP emissions_NNS or_CC enhance_VV sinks_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, renewable_JJ energy_NN projects_NNS ,_, insulation_NN of_IN buildings_NNS or_CC planting_NN trees_NNS )_) ._SENT Sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NP )_) :_: The_DT concept_NN of_IN sustainable_JJ development_NN was_VBD introduced_VVN in_IN the_DT World_NP Conservation_NP Strategy_NP of_IN the_DT International_NP Union_NP for_IN Conservation_NP of_IN Nature_NP in_IN 1980_CD and_CC had_VHD its_PP$ roots_NNS in_IN the_DT concept_NN of_IN a_DT sustainable_JJ society_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT management_NN of_IN renewable_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Adopted_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Council_NP for_IN Environment_NP and_CC Development_NP in_IN 1987_CD and_CC by_IN the_DT Rio_NP Conference_NP in_IN 1992_CD as_IN a_DT process_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT exploitation_NN of_IN resources_NNS ,_, the_DT direction_NN of_IN investments_NNS ,_, the_DT orientation_NN of_IN technological_JJ development_NN and_CC institutional_JJ change_NN are_VBP all_RB in_IN harmony_NN and_CC enhance_VV both_DT current_JJ and_CC future_JJ potential_NN to_TO meet_VV human_JJ needs_NNS and_CC aspirations_NNS ._SENT SD_NP integrates_VVZ the_DT political_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, and_CC respects_VVZ resource_NN and_CC sink_NN constraints_NNS ._SENT Tax_NN :_: A_DT carbon_NN tax_NN is_VBZ a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT carbon_NN content_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ._SENT Because_IN virtually_RB all_DT of_IN the_DT carbon_NN in_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS is_VBZ ultimately_RB emitted_VVN as_IN CO2_NP ,_, a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN is_VBZ equivalent_JJ to_TO an_DT emission_NN tax_NN on_IN CO2_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT An_DT energy_NN tax_NN —_NN a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT energy_NN content_NN of_IN fuels_NNS —_NN reduces_VVZ demand_NN for_IN energy_NN and_CC so_RB reduces_VVZ CO2_JJ emissions_NNS from_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN use_NN ._SENT An_DT ecotax_NN is_VBZ a_DT carbon_NN ,_, emissions_NNS or_CC energy_NN tax_NN designed_VVN to_TO infl_NN uence_NN human_JJ behaviour_NN (_( specifi_RB cally_RB economic_JJ behaviour_NN )_) to_TO follow_VV an_DT ecologically_RB benign_JJ path_NN ._SENT A_DT tax_NN credit_NN is_VBZ a_DT reduction_NN of_IN tax_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO stimulate_VV purchasing_NN of_IN or_CC investment_NN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ product_NN ,_, like_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN emission-reducing_NN technologies_NNS ._SENT A_DT levy_NN or_CC charge_NN is_VBZ used_VVN as_IN synonymous_JJ for_IN tax_NN ._SENT Technological_JJ change_NN :_: Mostly_RB considered_VVN as_IN technological_JJ improvement_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, more_JJR or_CC better_JJR goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS can_MD be_VB provided_VVN from_IN a_DT given_VVN amount_NN of_IN resources_NNS (_( production_NN factors_NNS )_) ._SENT Economic_JJ models_NNS distinguish_VV autonomous_JJ (_( exogenous_JJ )_) ,_, endogenous_JJ and_CC induced_VVN technological_JJ change_NN ._SENT Autonomous_JJ (_( exogenous_JJ )_) technological_JJ change_NN is_VBZ imposed_VVN from_IN outside_IN the_DT model_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, as_IN a_DT parameter_NN )_) ,_, usually_RB in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT time_NN trend_NN affecting_VVG factor_NN or_CC /_SYM and_CC energy_NN productivity_NN and_CC therefore_RB energy_NN demand_NN or_CC output_NN growth_NN ._SENT Endogenous_JJ technological_JJ change_NN is_VBZ the_DT outcome_NN of_IN economic_JJ activity_NN within_IN the_DT model_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, as_IN a_DT variable_NN )_) so_IN that_DT factor_NN productivity_NN or_CC the_DT choice_NN of_IN technologies_NNS is_VBZ included_VVN within_IN the_DT model_NN and_CC affects_VVZ energy_NN demand_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC economic_JJ growth_NN ._SENT 

Glossary_NN ,_, Acronyms_NP ,_, Chemical_NP Symbols_NP and_CC Prefi_NP xes_NN Annex_NP I_NP Induced_NP technological_JJ change_NN implies_VVZ endogenous_JJ technological_JJ change_NN but_CC adds_VVZ further_JJR changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN taxes_NNS triggering_VVG research_NN and_CC development_NN efforts_NNS ._SENT Technology_NN :_: The_DT practical_JJ application_NN of_IN knowledge_NN to_TO achieve_VV particular_JJ tasks_NNS that_WDT employs_VVZ both_DT technical_JJ artefacts_NNS (_( hardware_NN ,_, equipment_NN )_) and_CC (_( social_JJ )_) information_NN (_( ‘software’_NP ,_, know-how_NN for_IN production_NN and_CC use_NN of_IN artefacts_NNS )_) ._SENT Supply_NN push_NN aims_VVZ at_IN developing_VVG specifi_NNS c_SYM technologies_NNS through_IN support_NN for_IN research_NN ,_, development_NN and_CC demonstration_NN ._SENT Demand_NN pull_NN is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN of_IN creating_VVG market_NN and_CC other_JJ incentives_NNS to_TO induce_VV the_DT introduction_NN of_IN particular_JJ sets_NNS of_IN technologies_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, low-carbon_NN technologies_NNS through_IN carbon_NN pricing_NN )_) or_CC single_JJ technologies_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, through_IN technology-specifi_NP c_SYM feed-in_NN tariffs_NNS )_) ._SENT Technology_NN transfer_NN :_: The_DT exchange_NN of_IN knowledge_NN ,_, hardware_NN and_CC associated_JJ software_NN ,_, money_NN and_CC goods_NNS among_IN stakeholders_NNS ,_, which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO the_DT spread_NN of_IN technology_NN for_IN adaptation_NN or_CC mitigation_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN encompasses_VVZ both_DT diffusion_NN of_IN technologies_NNS and_CC technological_JJ cooperation_NN across_IN and_CC within_IN countries_NNS ._SENT Tradable_JJ certifi_NN cates_NN (_( tradable_JJ green_JJ certifi_NN cates_NN )_) :_: Parties_NNS subject_JJ to_TO a_DT renewable_JJ energy_NN quota_NN meet_VV the_DT annual_JJ obligation_NN by_IN delivering_VVG the_DT appropriate_JJ the_DT renewable_JJ energy_NN producers_NNS to_TO sell_VV or_CC for_IN their_PP$ own_JJ use_NN in_IN fulfi_NNS lling_VVG their_PP$ quota_NN ._SENT See_VV quota_NN ._SENT Transmission_NN and_CC distribution_NN (_( electricity_NN )_) :_: The_DT network_NN that_WDT transmits_VVZ electricity_NN through_IN wires_NNS from_IN where_WRB it_PP is_VBZ generated_VVN to_TO where_WRB it_PP is_VBZ used_VVN ._SENT The_DT distribution_NN system_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT lower-voltage_NN system_NN that_WDT actually_RB delivers_VVZ the_DT electricity_NN to_TO the_DT end_NN user_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB grid_NN ._SENT Turbine_NN :_: Equipment_NN that_WDT converts_VVZ the_DT kinetic_JJ energy_NN of_IN a_DT fl_NN ow_NN of_IN air_NN ,_, water_NN ,_, hot_JJ gas_NN or_CC steam_NN into_IN rotary_JJ mechanical_JJ power_NN ,_, used_VVN for_IN direct_JJ drive_NN or_CC electricity_NN generation_NN (_( see_VV wind_NN ,_, hydro_NN ,_, gas_NN or_CC steam_NN turbines_NNS )_) ._SENT Condensing_VVG steam_NN turbines_NNS exhaust_VVP depleted_VVN steam_NN in_IN a_DT heat_NN exchanger_NN (_( called_VVN condenser_NN )_) using_VVG ambient_JJ cooling_NN from_IN water_NN (_( river_NN ,_, lake_NN ,_, sea_NN )_) or_CC air_NN sources_NNS (_( cooling_VVG towers_NNS )_) ._SENT A_DT backpressure_NN steam_NN turbine_NN has_VHZ no_DT condenser_NN at_IN ambient_JJ temperature_NN conditions_NNS ,_, but_CC exhausts_VVZ all_DT steam_NN at_IN higher_JJR temperatures_NNS for_IN use_NN in_IN particular_JJ heat_NN end-uses_NNS ._SENT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) :_: The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP York_NP and_CC signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 150_CD countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Economic_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT “_JJ stabilization_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ”_NN ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Convention_NN ,_, parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_PP aimed_VVD to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT convention_NN came_VVD into_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD In_IN 1997_CD ,_, the_DT UNFCCC_NP adopted_VVD the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Annex_NP I_NN countries_NNS ,_, Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS and_CC Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Valley_NP of_IN death_NN :_: Expression_NN for_IN a_DT phase_NN in_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN some_DT technology_NN when_WRB it_PP is_VBZ generating_VVG a_DT large_JJ and_CC negative_JJ cash_NN fl_NN ow_NN because_IN development_NN costs_NNS increase_NN but_CC the_DT risks_NNS associated_VVN with_IN the_DT technology_NN are_VBP not_RB reduced_VVN enough_RB to_TO entice_VV private_JJ investors_NNS to_TO take_VV on_IN the_DT fi_NP nancing_NN burden_NN ._SENT Value_NN added_VVD :_: The_DT net_JJ output_NN of_IN a_DT sector_NN or_CC activity_NN after_IN adding_VVG up_RP all_DT outputs_NNS and_CC subtracting_VVG intermediate_JJ inputs_NNS ._SENT Values_NNS :_: Worth_NP ,_, desirability_NN or_CC utility_NN based_VVN on_IN individual_JJ preferences_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS social_JJ science_NN disciplines_NNS use_VVP several_JJ defi_NN nitions_NNS of_IN value_NN ._SENT Related_VVN to_TO nature_NN and_CC environment_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN intrinsic_JJ and_CC instrumental_JJ values_NNS ,_, the_DT latter_NN assigned_VVN by_IN humans_NNS ._SENT Within_IN instrumental_JJ values_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT unsettled_JJ catalogue_NN of_IN different_JJ values_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN (_( direct_JJ and_CC indirect_JJ )_) use_NN ,_, option_NN ,_, conservation_NN ,_, serendipity_NN ,_, bequest_NN ,_, existence_NN ,_, etc._FW Mainstream_NN economics_NNS defi_NNS ne_RB the_DT total_JJ value_NN of_IN any_DT resource_NN as_IN the_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT values_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ individuals_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT resource_NN ._SENT The_DT economic_JJ values_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP the_DT foundation_NN of_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN costs_NNS ,_, are_VBP measured_VVN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT willingness_NN to_TO pay_VV by_IN individuals_NNS to_TO receive_VV the_DT resource_NN or_CC by_IN the_DT willingness_NN of_IN individuals_NNS to_TO accept_VV payment_NN to_TO part_NN with_IN the_DT resource_NN ._SENT Vent_NP (_( geothermal_JJ /_SYM hydrothermal_JJ /_SYM submarine_NN )_) :_: An_DT opening_NN at_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NP (_( terrestrial_JJ or_CC
