Glossary_NN ,_, Acronyms_NP ,_, Chemical_NP Symbols_NP and_CC Prefi_NP xes_JJ Annex_NN I_PP 
IPCC_NP ,_, 2012_CD :_: Glossary_NN of_IN terms_NNS ._SENT In_RB :_: Managing_VVG the_DT Risks_NP of_IN Extreme_NP Events_NP and_CC Disasters_NP to_TO Advance_NP Climate_NN Change_NP Adaptation_NP [_SYM Field_NP ,_, C.B._NP ,_, V._NP Barros_NP ,_, T.F._NP Stocker_NP ,_, D_NP ._SENT Qin_NP ,_, D.J._NP Dokken_NP ,_, K.L._NP Ebi_NP ,_, M.D._NP Mastrandrea_NP ,_, K.J._NP Mach_NP ,_, G.-K_NP ._SENT Plattner_NP ,_, S.K._NP Allen_NP ,_, M_NP ._SENT Tignor_NP ,_, and_CC P.M._NP Midgley_NP (_( eds_NNS ._SENT )_) ]_SYM ._SENT A_DT Special_JJ Report_NN of_IN Working_JJ Groups_NNS I_PP and_CC II_NP of_IN the_DT Intergovernmental_NP Panel_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( IPCC_NP )_) ._SENT Cambridge_NP University_NP Press_NP ,_, Cambridge_NP ,_, UK_NP ,_, and_CC New_NP York_NP ,_, NY_NP ,_, USA_NP ,_, pp_NP ._SENT 555-564_LS ._SENT Glossary_NN of_IN Terms_NNS II_NP ANNEX_NP 

Abrupt_JJ climate_NN change_VV The_DT nonlinearity_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN may_MD lead_VV to_TO abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, sometimes_RB called_VVN rapid_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, abrupt_JJ events_NNS ,_, or_CC even_RB surprises_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN abrupt_JJ often_RB refers_VVZ to_TO time_VV scales_NNS faster_RBR than_IN the_DT typical_JJ time_NN scale_NN of_IN the_DT responsible_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT However_RB ,_, not_RB all_DT abrupt_JJ climate_NN changes_NNS need_MD be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN ._SENT Some_DT changes_NNS may_MD be_VB truly_RB unexpected_JJ ,_, resulting_VVG from_IN a_DT strong_JJ ,_, rapidly_RB changing_VVG forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT nonlinear_JJ system_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN In_IN human_JJ systems_NNS ,_, the_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO moderate_JJ harm_NN or_CC exploit_VV beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT In_IN natural_JJ systems_NNS ,_, the_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ;_: human_JJ intervention_NN may_MD facilitate_VV adjustment_NN to_TO expected_VVN climate_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN assessment_NN The_DT practice_NN of_IN identifying_VVG options_NNS to_TO adapt_VV to_TO climate-change_NN and_CC evaluating_VVG them_PP in_IN terms_NNS of_IN criteria_NNS such_JJ as_IN availability_NN ,_, benefits_NNS ,_, costs_NNS ,_, effectiveness_NN ,_, efficiency_NN ,_, and_CC feasibility_NN ._SENT Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN The_DT combination_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS ,_, attributes_NNS ,_, and_CC resources_NNS available_JJ to_TO an_DT individual_NN ,_, community_NN ,_, society_NN ,_, or_CC organization_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO prepare_VV for_IN and_CC undertake_VV actions_NNS to_TO reduce_VV adverse_JJ impacts_NNS ,_, moderate_JJ harm_NN ,_, or_CC exploit_VV beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS A_DT collection_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT typical_JJ size_NN between_IN 0.01_CD and_CC 10_CD μm_NN ,_, that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN several_JJ ways_NNS :_: directly_RB through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG radiation_NN ,_, and_CC indirectly_RB by_IN acting_VVG as_IN cloud_NN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS or_CC modifying_VVG the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Albedo_NN The_DT fraction_NN of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN reflected_VVN by_IN a_DT surface_NN or_CC object_NN ,_, often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Snow-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS have_VHP a_DT high_JJ albedo_NN ,_, the_DT surface_NN albedo_NN of_IN soils_NNS ranges_NNS from_IN high_JJ to_TO low_JJ ,_, and_CC vegetation-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS and_CC oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT low_JJ albedo_NN ._SENT The_DT Earth’s_NP planetary_NN albedo_NN varies_VVZ mainly_RB through_IN varying_VVG cloudiness_NN ,_, snow_NN ,_, ice_NN ,_, leaf_NN area_NN ,_, and_CC land_NN cover_NN changes_NNS ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ Resulting_NN from_IN or_CC produced_VVN by_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS Emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, greenhouse_NN gas_NN precursors_NNS ,_, and_CC aerosols_NNS associated_VVN with_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT activities_NNS include_VVP the_DT burning_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN changes_NNS ,_, livestock_NN ,_, fertilization_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, that_DT result_NN in_IN a_DT net_JJ increase_NN in_IN emissions_NNS ._SENT Atlantic_NP Multi-decadal_NP Oscillation_NP (_( AMO_NP )_) A_DT multi-decadal_JJ (_( 65-_CD to_TO 75-year_NP )_) fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP ,_, in_IN which_WDT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS showed_VVD warm_JJ phases_NNS during_IN roughly_RB to_TO 1880_CD and_CC 1930_CD to_TO 1960_CD and_CC cool_JJ phases_NNS during_IN 1905_CD to_TO 1925_CD and_CC 1970_CD to_TO 1990_CD with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN 0.4_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT Atmosphere_NN The_DT gaseous_JJ envelope_NN surrounding_VVG the_DT Earth_NN ._SENT The_DT dry_JJ atmosphere_NN consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, together_RB with_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN ,_, and_CC radiatively_RB active_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( 0.035_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC ozone_NN ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN water_NN vapor_NN ,_, whose_WP$ amounts_NNS are_VBP highly_RB variable_JJ but_CC typically_RB around_IN 1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN also_RB contains_VVZ clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ._SENT Available_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN That_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN that_WDT may_MD be_VB converted_VVN to_TO kinetic_JJ energy_NN in_IN an_DT adiabatically_RB enclosed_VVN system_NN ._SENT Baseline_NN /_SYM reference_IN The_DT baseline_NN (_( or_CC reference_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT state_NN against_IN which_WDT change_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN ._SENT It_PP might_MD be_VB a_DT ‘current_JJ baseline_NN ,_, ’_NN in_IN which_WDT case_NN it_PP represents_VVZ observable_JJ ,_, present-day_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP might_MD also_RB be_VB a_DT ‘future_NN baseline_NN ,_, ’_NN which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT projected_JJ future_NN set_VVN of_IN conditions_NNS excluding_VVG the_DT driving_VVG factor_NN of_IN interest_NN ._SENT Alternative_JJ interpretations_NNS of_IN the_DT reference_NN conditions_NNS can_MD give_VV rise_NN to_TO multiple_JJ baselines_NNS ._SENT Capacity_NN The_DT combination_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT strengths_NNS ,_, attributes_NNS ,_, and_CC resources_NNS available_JJ to_TO an_DT individual_NN ,_, community_NN ,_, society_NN ,_, or_CC organization_NN ,_, which_WDT can_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO achieve_VV established_JJ goals_NNS ._SENT Carbon_NN cycle_NN The_DT term_NN used_VVN to_TO describe_VV the_DT flow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, ocean_NN ,_, terrestrial_JJ biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC lithosphere_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN fixed_VVN by_IN photosynthesis_NN into_IN organic_JJ matter_NN ._SENT A_DT byproduct_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN combustion_NN and_CC biomass_NN burning_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ also_RB emitted_VVN from_IN land_NN use_NN changes_NNS and_CC other_JJ industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN ,_, thus_RB having_VHG a_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ of_IN 1._CD Catchment_NN An_DT area_NN that_WDT collects_VVZ and_CC drains_VVZ precipitation_NN ._SENT Clausius-Clapeyron_NN relationship_NN (_( or_CC equation_NN )_) The_DT differential_JJ equation_NN relating_VVG the_DT pressure_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN (_( usually_RB 


water_NN vapor_NN )_) to_TO temperature_NN in_IN a_DT system_NN in_IN which_WDT two_CD phases_NNS of_IN the_DT substance_NN (_( water_NN )_) are_VBP in_IN equilibrium_NN ._SENT Climate_NN Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_JJ weather_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN for_IN averaging_VVG these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT In_IN various_JJ chapters_NNS in_IN this_DT report_NN different_JJ averaging_NN periods_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 20_CD years_NNS ,_, are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ._SENT climate-change_NN A_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use.1_NN See_VV also_RB Climate_NN variability_NN and_CC Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN ._SENT Climate_NN extreme_NN (_( extreme_JJ weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN )_) The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT value_NN of_IN a_DT weather_NN or_CC climate_NN variable_NN above_IN (_( or_CC below_RB )_) a_DT threshold_NN value_NN near_IN the_DT upper_JJ (_( or_CC lower_VV )_) ends_VVZ of_IN the_DT range_NN of_IN observed_JJ values_NNS of_IN the_DT variable_NN ._SENT For_IN simplicity_NN ,_, both_DT extreme_JJ weather_NN events_NNS and_CC extreme_JJ climate_NN events_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO collectively_RB as_IN ‘climate_JJ extremes.’_NN The_DT full_JJ definition_NN is_VBZ provided_VVN in_IN Section_NP 3.1.2_CD ._SENT Climate_NN feedback_NN An_DT interaction_NN mechanism_NN between_IN processes_NNS in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ called_VVN a_DT climate_NN feedback_NN when_WRB the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT initial_JJ process_NN triggers_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN a_DT second_JJ process_NN that_IN/that in_IN turn_NN influences_VVZ the_DT initial_JJ one_CD ._SENT A_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN intensifies_VVZ the_DT original_JJ process_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN reduces_VVZ it_PP ._SENT Climate_NN model_NN A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_NN ,_, and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS ,_, and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN/that accounts_NNS for_IN all_DT or_CC some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD be_VB represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_NN ,_, or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parameterizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT Coupled_VVN Atmosphere-Ocean_JJ Global_JJ Climate_NN Models_NNS (_( AOGCMs_NP )_) ,_, also_RB referred_VVD to_TO as_IN Atmosphere-Ocean_NP General_NP Circulation_NP Models_NNS ,_, provide_VVP a_DT representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ near_IN the_DT most_RBS comprehensive_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN currently_RB available_JJ ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN toward_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, seasonal_JJ ,_, and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projection_NN A_DT projection_NN of_IN the_DT response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO emissions_NNS or_CC concentration_NN scenarios_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, or_CC radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenarios_NNS ,_, often_RB based_VVN upon_IN simulations_NNS by_IN climate_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN predictions_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO emphasize_VV that_IN/that climate_NN projections_NNS depend_VVP upon_IN the_DT emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative-forcing_JJ scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, e.g._FW ,_, future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN and_CC are_VBP therefore_RB subject_JJ to_TO substantial_JJ uncertainty_NN ._SENT Climate_NN scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ climate_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN an_DT internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN climatological_JJ relationships_NNS that_WDT has_VHZ been_VBN constructed_VVN for_IN explicit_JJ use_NN in_IN investigating_VVG the_DT potential_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN anthropogenic_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, often_RB serving_VVG as_IN input_NN to_TO impact_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS often_RB serve_VVP as_IN the_DT raw_JJ material_NN for_IN constructing_VVG climate_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, but_CC climate_NN scenarios_NNS usually_RB require_VVP additional_JJ information_NN such_JJ as_IN about_IN the_DT observed_JJ current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT climate-system_NN The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN ._SENT Climate_NN threshold_NN A_DT critical_JJ limit_NN within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT induces_VVZ a_DT non-linear_JJ response_NN to_TO a_DT given_VVN forcing_VVG ._SENT See_VV also_RB Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ._SENT Climate_NN variability_NN Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN at_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_DT of_IN individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC to_TO variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ 


or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT Cold_JJ days_NNS /_SYM cold_JJ nights_NNS Days_NNS where_WRB maximum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, or_CC nights_NNS where_WRB minimum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, falls_VVZ below_IN the_DT 10th_JJ percentile_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT respective_JJ temperature_NN distributions_NNS are_VBP generally_RB defined_VVN with_IN respect_NN to_TO the_DT -1990_CD reference_NN period_NN ._SENT Community-based_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN management_NN See_VV Local_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN management_NN ._SENT Confidence_NN Confidence_NN in_IN the_DT validity_NN of_IN a_DT finding_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN the_DT type_NN ,_, amount_NN ,_, quality_NN ,_, and_CC consistency_NN of_IN evidence_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN agreement_NN ._SENT Confidence_NN is_VBZ expressed_VVN qualitatively_RB ._SENT Control_NN run_VVP A_DT model_NN run_NN carried_VVD out_RP to_TO provide_VV a_DT ‘baseline’_NN for_IN comparison_NN with_IN climate-change_NN experiments_NNS ._SENT The_DT control_NN run_NN uses_VVZ constant_JJ values_NNS for_IN the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG due_JJ to_TO greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC anthropogenic_JJ aerosols_NNS appropriate_JJ to_TO pre-industrial_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT Convection_NN Vertical_JJ motion_NN driven_VVN by_IN buoyancy_NN forces_NNS arising_VVG from_IN static_JJ instability_NN ,_, usually_RB caused_VVN by_IN near-surface_NN cooling_NN or_CC increases_NNS in_IN salinity_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC near-surface_NN warming_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT At_IN the_DT location_NN of_IN convection_NN ,_, the_DT horizontal_JJ scale_NN is_VBZ approximately_RB the_DT same_JJ as_IN the_DT vertical_JJ scale_NN ,_, as_RB opposed_VVN to_TO the_DT large_JJ contrast_NN between_IN these_DT scales_NNS in_IN the_DT general_JJ circulation_NN ._SENT The_DT net_JJ vertical_JJ mass_NN transport_NN is_VBZ usually_RB much_RB smaller_JJR than_IN the_DT upward_JJ and_CC downward_JJ exchange_NN ._SENT Coping_VVG The_DT use_NN of_IN available_JJ skills_NNS ,_, resources_NNS ,_, and_CC opportunities_NNS ,_, to_TO address_VV ,_, manage_VV ,_, and_CC overcome_VV adverse_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN Climate_NN varies_VVZ continually_RB on_IN all_DT ,_, without_IN providing_VVG a_DT reason_NN for_IN that_DT change_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN of_IN causes_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN is_VBZ the_DT process_NN of_IN establishing_VVG the_DT most_RBS likely_JJ causes_NNS for_IN the_DT detected_VVN change_NN with_IN some_DT defined_VVN level_NN of_IN confidence_NN ._SENT Diabatic_NP A_DT process_NN in_IN which_WDT external_JJ heat_NN is_VBZ gained_VVN or_CC lost_VVN by_IN the_DT system_NN ._SENT Disaster_NN Severe_NP alterations_NNS in_IN the_DT normal_JJ functioning_NN of_IN a_DT community_NN or_CC a_DT society_NN due_JJ to_TO due_JJ to_TO hazardous_JJ physical_JJ events_NNS interacting_VVG with_IN vulnerable_JJ social_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, leading_VVG to_TO widespread_JJ adverse_JJ human_NN ,_, material_NN ,_, economic_JJ ,_, or_CC environmental_JJ effects_NNS that_WDT require_VVP immediate_JJ emergency_NN response_NN to_TO satisfy_VV critical_JJ human_JJ needs_NNS and_CC that_WDT may_MD require_VV external_JJ ,_, and_CC measures_VVZ to_TO improve_VV the_DT understanding_NN of_IN disaster_NN risk_NN ,_, foster_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN reduction_NN and_CC transfer_NN ,_, and_CC promote_VV continuous_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT strategic_JJ and_CC instrumental_JJ measures_NNS employed_VVN for_IN anticipating_VVG future_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN ;_: reducing_VVG existing_JJ exposure_NN ,_, hazard_NN ,_, or_CC 24-hour_JJ period_NN ._SENT Downscaling_NP Downscaling_NP is_VBZ a_DT method_NN that_WDT derives_VVZ local-_NN to_TO regional-scale_VV (_( up_RB to_TO km_NN )_) information_NN from_IN larger-scale_JJ enough_RB to_TO cause_VV a_DT serious_JJ hydrological_JJ imbalance_NN ._SENT Drought_NN is_VBZ a_DT relative_JJ term_NN (_( see_VV Box_NP 3-3_CD )_) ,_, therefore_RB any_DT discussion_NN in_IN 


drought_NN ,_, also_RB termed_VVD agricultural_JJ drought_NN )_) ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT runoff_NN and_CC percolation_NN season_NN primarily_RB affects_VVZ water_NN supplies_NNS (_( in_IN addition_NN to_TO reductions_NNS in_IN precipitation_NN ._SENT A_DT period_NN with_IN an_DT abnormal_JJ precipitation_NN deficit_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN a_DT meteorological_JJ drought_NN ._SENT A_DT megadrought_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB lengthy_JJ and_CC pervasive_JJ drought_NN ,_, lasting_VVG much_RB longer_RBR than_IN normal_JJ ,_, usually_RB a_DT decade_NN or_CC more_JJR ._SENT Early_JJ warning_NN system_NN The_DT set_NN of_IN capacities_NNS needed_VVN to_TO generate_VV and_CC disseminate_VV timely_JJ and_CC meaningful_JJ warning_VVG information_NN to_TO enable_VV individuals_NNS ,_, communities_NNS ,_, and_CC organizations_NNS threatened_VVN by_IN a_DT hazard_NN to_TO prepare_VV and_CC to_TO act_VV appropriately_RB and_CC in_IN sufficient_JJ time_NN to_TO reduce_VV the_DT possibility_NN of_IN harm_NN or_CC loss_NN ._SENT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD initially_RB used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_NN that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ since_RB become_VVN identified_VVN with_IN a_DT basin-wide_JJ warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP east_RB of_IN the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN a_DT global-scale_JJ tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere-ocean_NN phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ time_NN scales_NNS of_IN 2_CD to_TO about_RB 7_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ collectively_RB known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN difference_NN between_IN Darwin_NP and_CC Tahiti_NP and_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT central_JJ and_CC eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_VVG trade_NN winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS such_JJ that_IN/that the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT trade_NN winds_NNS ._SENT This_DT event_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT Emissions_NNS scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ development_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN projections_NNS shown_VVN in_IN Chapter_NP 3_CD of_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT Ensemble_RB A_DT group_NN of_IN parallel_JJ model_NN simulations_NNS used_VVN for_IN climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT Variation_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS across_IN the_DT ensemble_NN members_NNS gives_VVZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN uncertainty_NN ._SENT Ensembles_NNS made_VVN with_IN the_DT same_JJ model_NN but_CC economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, or_CC cultural_JJ assets_NNS in_IN places_NNS that_WDT could_MD be_VB adversely_RB affected_VVN ._SENT External_JJ forcing_VVG External_NP forcing_VVG refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT forcing_VVG agent_NN outside_IN the_DT climate-system_NN causing_VVG a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, and_CC anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN are_VBP external_JJ forcings_NNS ._SENT Extratropical_JJ cyclone_NN Any_DT water_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB extreme_JJ sea_NN level_NN )_) Extreme_NP coastal_JJ high_JJ water_NN depends_VVZ on_IN average_JJ sea_NN level_NN ,_, tides_NNS ,_, and_CC regional_JJ weather_NN systems_NNS ._SENT Extreme_JJ coastal_JJ high_JJ water_NN events_NNS are_VBP usually_RB defined_VVN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT higher_JJR percentiles_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, 90th_JJ to_TO 99.9th_NN )_) of_IN a_DT distribution_NN of_IN hourly_JJ values_NNS of_IN observed_JJ sea_NN level_NN at_IN a_DT station_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN reference_NN period_NN ._SENT Extreme_JJ weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN See_VV Climate_NN extreme_NN ._SENT Famine_NN Scarcity_NN of_IN food_NN over_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN and_CC over_IN a_DT large_JJ geographical_JJ area_NN ,_, such_JJ the_DT accumulation_NN of_IN water_NN over_IN areas_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB normally_RB submerged_VVN ._SENT Floods_NNS include_VVP river_NN (_( fluvial_JJ )_) floods_NNS ,_, flash_JJ floods_NNS ,_, urban_JJ floods_NNS ,_, pluvial_JJ floods_NNS ,_, sewer_NN floods_NNS ,_, coastal_JJ floods_NNS ,_, and_CC glacial_JJ lake_NN outburst_NN floods_NNS ._SENT 

Frozen_JJ ground_NN Soil_NN or_CC rock_NN in_IN which_WDT part_NN or_CC all_DT of_IN the_DT pore_NN water_NN is_VBZ frozen_VVN ._SENT Perennially_RB frozen_VVN ground_NN is_VBZ called_VVN Flood_NP associated_VVN with_IN outburst_NN of_IN glacial_JJ lake_NN ._SENT Glacial_JJ lake_NN outburst_NN floods_NNS are_VBP typically_RB a_DT result_NN of_IN cumulative_JJ developments_NNS and_CC occur_VV (_( i_NP )_) only_RB once_RB (_( e.g._FW ,_, full_JJ breach_NN failure_NN of_IN moraine-dammed_JJ lakes_NNS )_) ,_, (_( ii_NNS )_) for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, new_JJ formation_NN and_CC outburst_NN of_IN glacial_JJ lakes_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC (_( iii_NNS )_) repeatedly_RB (_( e.g._FW ,_, ice-dammed_JJ lakes_NNS with_IN drainage_NN cycles_NNS ,_, or_CC ice_NN fall_NN )_) ._SENT Glacier_NP A_DT mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN that_WDT flows_VVZ downhill_RB under_IN gravity_NN (_( through_IN internal_JJ deformation_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC sliding_VVG at_IN the_DT base_NN )_) and_CC is_VBZ constrained_VVN by_IN internal_JJ stress_NN and_CC friction_NN at_IN the_DT base_NN and_CC sides_NNS ._SENT A_DT glacier_NN is_VBZ maintained_VVN by_IN accumulation_NN of_IN snow_NN at_IN high_JJ altitudes_NNS ,_, balanced_VVN by_IN melting_VVG at_IN low_JJ altitudes_NNS or_CC discharge_NN into_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT Global_JJ climate_NN model_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN ,_, both_CC abbreviated_VVD as_IN GCM_NP )_) See_VV Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT Global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN The_DT global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN ._SENT However_RB ,_, for_IN changes_NNS over_IN time_NN ,_, only_JJ anomalies_NNS ,_, as_IN departures_NNS from_IN a_DT climatology_NN ,_, are_VBP used_VVN ,_, most_RBS commonly_RB based_VVN on_IN the_DT area-weighted_JJ global_JJ average_NN of_IN the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN anomaly_NN and_CC land_NN surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN anomaly_NN ._SENT Governance_NN The_DT way_NN government_NN is_VBZ understood_VVN has_VHZ changed_VVN in_IN response_NN to_TO social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, and_CC technological_JJ changes_NNS over_IN recent_JJ decades_NNS ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ a_DT corresponding_JJ shift_NN from_IN government_NN defined_VVN strictly_RB by_IN the_DT nation-state_NN to_TO a_DT more_RBR inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN governance_NN ,_, recognizing_VVG the_DT contributions_NNS of_IN various_JJ levels_NNS of_IN government_NN (_( global_JJ ,_, international_JJ ,_, regional_JJ ,_, local_JJ )_) and_CC the_DT roles_NNS of_IN the_DT private_JJ sector_NN ,_, of_IN nongovernmental_JJ actors_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN civil_JJ society_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN effect_NN Greenhouse_NP gases_VVZ effectively_RB absorb_VV thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN ,_, emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP due_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ gases_NNS ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ emitted_VVN to_TO all_DT sides_NNS ,_, including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS trap_NN heat_NN within_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ strongly_RB coupled_VVN to_TO the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN the_DT altitude_NN at_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ emitted_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN generally_RB decreases_VVZ with_IN height_NN ._SENT Effectively_RB ,_, infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN to_TO space_NN originates_VVZ from_IN an_DT altitude_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_IN average_NN ,_, -19_CD °_SYM C_NP ,_, in_IN balance_NN with_IN the_DT net_JJ incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN is_VBZ kept_VVN at_IN a_DT much_RB higher_JJR temperature_NN of_IN ,_, on_IN average_NN ,_, 14_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT increased_VVN infrared_JJ opacity_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC therefore_RB to_TO an_DT effective_JJ radiation_NN into_IN space_NN from_IN a_DT higher_JJR altitude_NN at_IN a_DT lower_JJR temperature_NN ._SENT This_DT causes_VVZ a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG that_IN/that leads_NNS to_TO an_DT enhancement_NN of_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ enhanced_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gas_NN Greenhouse_NP gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, both_CC natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, which_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapor_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC brominecontaining_NN substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Besides_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP ,_, and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ sulfur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT Hazard_VV The_DT potential_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT natural_JJ or_CC human-induced_JJ physical_JJ event_NN that_WDT may_MD cause_VV loss_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, injury_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ health_NN impacts_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN damage_NN and_CC loss_NN to_TO property_NN ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, service_NN provision_NN ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Heat_NN wave_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB extreme_JJ heat_NN event_NN )_) A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB hot_JJ weather_NN ._SENT Heat_NN waves_NNS and_CC warm_JJ spells_NNS have_VHP various_JJ and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS overlapping_VVG definitions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Warm_NP spell_NN ._SENT Holocene_JJ The_DT Holocene_JJ geological_JJ epoch_NN is_VBZ the_DT latter_NN of_IN two_CD Quaternary_JJ epochs_NNS ,_, extending_VVG from_IN about_RB 11.6_CD thousand_CD years_NNS before_IN present_JJ to_TO and_CC including_VVG the_DT present_NN ._SENT Human_JJ security_NN Human_JJ security_NN can_MD be_VB said_VVN to_TO have_VH two_CD main_JJ aspects_NNS ._SENT It_PP means_VVZ ,_, first_RB ,_, safety_NN from_IN such_JJ chronic_JJ threats_NNS as_IN hunger_NN ,_, disease_NN ,_, and_CC repression_NN ._SENT And_CC second_JJ ,_, it_PP means_VVZ protection_NN from_IN sudden_JJ and_CC hurtful_JJ disruptions_NNS in_IN the_DT patterns_NNS of_IN daily_JJ life_NN –_NN whether_IN in_IN homes_NNS ,_, in_IN jobs_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN communities_NNS ._SENT Such_JJ threats_NNS can_MD exist_VV at_IN all_DT levels_NNS of_IN national_JJ income_NN and_CC development_NN ._SENT Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN water_NN cycle_NN )_) The_DT cycle_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN evaporates_VVZ from_IN the_DT oceans_NNS and_CC the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, is_VBZ carried_VVN over_IN the_DT Earth_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN as_IN water_NN vapor_NN ,_, condenses_VVZ to_TO form_VV clouds_NNS ,_, precipitates_NNS again_RB as_IN rain_NN or_CC snow_NN ,_, is_VBZ intercepted_VVN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC vegetation_NN ,_, provides_VVZ runoff_NN on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, infiltrates_NNS into_IN soils_NNS ,_, recharges_VVZ groundwater_NN ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC discharges_NNS into_IN streams_NNS and_CC flows_VVZ out_RP into_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, and_CC ultimately_RB evaporates_VVZ again_RB from_IN the_DT oceans_NNS or_CC land_NN surface_NN ._SENT The_DT various_JJ systems_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN are_VBP usually_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN hydrological_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT 


Impacts_NNS Effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN ‘impacts’_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS of_IN physical_JJ events_NNS ,_, of_IN disasters_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Indian_NP Ocean_NP Dipole_NP (_( IOD_NP )_) Large-scale_NP interannual_JJ variability_NN of_IN sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT Indian_NP Ocean_NP ._SENT This_DT pattern_NN manifests_VVZ through_IN a_DT zonal_JJ gradient_NN of_IN tropical_JJ sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN one_CD extreme_JJ phase_NN in_IN boreal_JJ autumn_NN shows_NNS cooling_VVG off_RP Sumatra_NP and_CC warming_VVG off_RP Somalia_NN in_IN the_DT west_NN ,_, combined_VVN with_IN anomalous_JJ easterlies_NNS along_IN the_DT equator_NN ._SENT Insurance_NN /_SYM reinsurance_NN A_DT family_NN of_IN financial_JJ instruments_NNS for_IN sharing_VVG and_CC transferring_VVG risk_NN among_IN a_DT pool_NN of_IN at-risk_NN households_NNS ,_, businesses_NNS ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC governments_NNS ._SENT See_VV Risk_NN transfer_NN ._SENT Landslide_NN A_DT mass_NN of_IN material_NN that_WDT has_VHZ moved_VVN downhill_RB by_IN gravity_NN ,_, often_RB assisted_VVN by_IN water_NN when_WRB the_DT material_NN is_VBZ saturated_VVN ._SENT The_DT movement_NN of_IN soil_NN ,_, rock_NN ,_, or_CC debris_NN down_IN a_DT slope_NN can_MD occur_VV rapidly_RB ,_, or_CC may_MD involve_VV slow_JJ ,_, gradual_JJ failure_NN ._SENT Land_NN surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN The_DT air_NN temperature_NN as_IN measured_VVN in_IN well-ventilated_JJ screens_NNS over_IN land_NN at_IN .5_CD to_TO 2_CD m_NN above_IN the_DT ground_NN ._SENT Land_NN use_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN Land_NP use_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT total_NN of_IN arrangements_NNS ,_, activities_NNS ,_, and_CC inputs_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ land_NN cover_NN type_NN (_( a_DT set_NN of_IN human_JJ actions_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT term_NN land_NN use_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN the_DT social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ purposes_NNS for_IN which_WDT land_NN is_VBZ managed_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, grazing_NN ,_, timber_NN extraction_NN ,_, and_CC conservation_NN )_) ._SENT Land_NN use_NN change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN or_CC management_NN of_IN land_NN by_IN humans_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD lead_VV to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN land_NN cover_NN ._SENT Land_NN cover_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN may_MD have_VH an_DT impact_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN albedo_NN ,_, evapotranspiration_NN ,_, sources_NNS and_CC sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, or_CC other_JJ properties_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN and_CC may_MD thus_RB have_VH radiative_JJ forcing_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC other_JJ impacts_NNS on_IN climate_NN ,_, locally_RB or_CC globally_RB ._SENT Lapse_NN rate_NN The_DT rate_NN of_IN change_NN of_IN an_DT atmospheric_JJ variable_NN ,_, usually_RB temperature_NN ,_, with_IN height_NN ._SENT The_DT lapse_NN rate_NN is_VBZ considered_VVN positive_JJ when_WRB the_DT variable_JJ decreases_NNS with_IN height_NN ._SENT Latent_JJ heat_NN flux_NN The_DT flux_NN of_IN heat_NN from_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN that_WDT is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN evaporation_NN or_CC condensation_NN of_IN water_NN vapor_NN at_IN the_DT surface_NN ;_: a_DT component_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN energy_NN budget_NN ._SENT Likelihood_NN A_DT probabilistic_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT single_JJ event_NN or_CC of_IN an_DT outcome_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT climate_NN parameter_NN ,_, observed_JJ trend_NN ,_, or_CC projected_VVN change_NN lying_VVG in_IN a_DT given_VVN range_NN ._SENT Likelihood_NN may_MD be_VB based_VVN on_IN statistical_JJ or_CC modeling_NN analyses_NNS ,_, elicitation_NN of_IN expert_NN views_NNS ,_, or_CC other_JJ quantitative_JJ analyses_NNS ._SENT Local_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN management_NN (_( LDRM_NP )_) The_DT process_NN in_IN which_WDT local_JJ actors_NNS (_( citizens_NNS ,_, communities_NNS ,_, government_NN ,_, non-profit_JJ organizations_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, and_CC businesses_NNS )_) engage_VVP in_RB and_CC have_VH ownership_NN of_IN the_DT identification_NN ,_, analysis_NN ,_, evaluation_NN ,_, monitoring_NN ,_, and_CC treatment_NN of_IN disaster_NN risk_NN and_CC disasters_NNS ,_, through_IN measures_NNS that_WDT reduce_VVP or_CC anticipate_VVP hazard_NN ,_, exposure_NN ,_, or_CC vulnerability_NN ;_: transfer_NN risk_NN ;_: improve_VV disaster_NN response_NN and_CC recovery_NN ;_: and_CC promote_VV an_DT overall_JJ increase_NN in_IN capacities_NNS ._SENT LDRM_NP normally_RB requires_VVZ coordination_NN with_IN and_CC support_NN from_IN external_JJ actors_NNS at_IN the_DT regional_JJ ,_, national_JJ ,_, or_CC international_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT Community-based_JJ disaster_NN risk_NN management_NN is_VBZ a_DT subset_NN of_IN LDRM_NP where_WRB community_NN members_NNS and_CC organizations_NNS are_VBP in_IN the_DT center_NN of_IN decisionmaking_VVG ._SENT Mass_NP movement_NN Mass_NP movement_NN in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN mountainous_JJ phenomena_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO different_JJ types_NNS of_IN mass_JJ transport_NN processes_NNS including_VVG landslides_NNS ,_, avalanches_NNS ,_, rock_NN fall_NN ,_, or_CC debris_NN flows_NNS ._SENT Mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN Sea_NP level_NN measured_VVN by_IN a_DT tide_NN gauge_NN with_IN respect_NN to_TO the_DT land_NN upon_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ situated_VVN ._SENT Mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN is_VBZ normally_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_JJ relative_JJ sea_NN level_NN over_IN a_DT period_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT month_NN or_CC a_DT year_NN ,_, long_RB enough_RB to_TO average_VV out_RP transients_NNS such_JJ as_IN waves_NNS and_CC tides_NNS ._SENT See_VV Sea_NP level_NN change_NN ._SENT Meridional_JJ overturning_VVG circulation_NN (_( MOC_NP )_) Meridional_NP (_( north-south_JJ )_) overturning_VVG circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN quantified_VVN by_IN zonal_JJ (_( east-west_JJ )_) sums_NNS of_IN mass_JJ transports_NNS in_IN depth_NN or_CC density_NN layers_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP ,_, away_RB from_IN the_DT subpolar_NN regions_NNS ,_, the_DT MOC_NP (_( which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN principle_NN an_DT observable_JJ quantity_NN )_) is_VBZ often_RB identified_VVN with_IN the_DT thermohaline_NN circulation_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT conceptual_JJ interpretation_NN ._SENT However_RB ,_, it_PP must_MD be_VB borne_VVN in_IN mind_NN that_IN/that MOC_NP can_MD also_RB include_VV shallower_JJR ,_, winddriven_JJ overturning_VVG cells_NNS such_JJ as_IN occur_VVP in_IN the_DT upper_JJ ocean_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS and_CC subtropics_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT warm_NN (_( less_CC dense_JJ )_) waters_NNS moving_VVG poleward_NN are_VBP transformed_VVN to_TO slightly_RB denser_JJR waters_NNS and_CC subducted_VVD equatorward_RB at_IN deeper_JJR levels_NNS ._SENT Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN disaster_NN risk_NN and_CC disaster_NN )_) The_DT lessening_VVG of_IN the_DT potential_JJ adverse_JJ impacts_NNS of_IN physical_JJ hazards_NNS (_( including_VVG those_DT that_WDT are_VBP human-induced_VVN )_) through_IN actions_NNS that_WDT reduce_VVP hazard_NN ,_, exposure_NN ,_, and_CC vulnerability_NN ._SENT Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) A_DT human_JJ intervention_NN to_TO reduce_VV the_DT sources_NNS or_CC enhance_VV the_DT sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT Modes_NNS of_IN climate_NN variability_NN Natural_JJ variability_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, in_IN particular_JJ on_IN seasonal_JJ and_CC longer_JJR time_NN scales_NNS ,_, predominantly_RB occurs_VVZ with_IN preferred_JJ spatial_JJ patterns_NNS 

and_CC time_NN scales_NNS ,_, through_IN the_DT dynamical_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN and_CC through_IN interactions_NNS with_IN the_DT land_NN and_CC ocean_NN surfaces_NNS ._SENT Such_JJ patterns_NNS are_VBP often_RB called_VVN regimes_NNS ,_, modes_NNS ,_, or_CC teleconnections_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP (_( NAO_NP )_) ,_, the_DT Pacific-North_NP American_NP pattern_NN (_( PNA_NP )_) ,_, the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) ,_, the_DT Northern_NP Annular_NP Mode_NP (_( NAM_NP ;_: previously_RB called_VVN the_DT Arctic_NP Oscillation_NP ,_, AO_NP )_) ,_, and_CC the_DT Southern_NP Annular_NP Mode_NP (_( SAM_NP ;_: previously_RB called_VVN the_DT Antarctic_NP Oscillation_NP ,_, AAO_NP )_) ._SENT Monsoon_NN A_DT monsoon_NN is_VBZ a_DT tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ seasonal_JJ reversal_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT surface_NN winds_NNS and_CC associated_VVN precipitation_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN differential_JJ heating_NN between_IN a_DT continental-scale_JJ land_NN mass_NN and_CC the_DT adjacent_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT Monsoon_NN rains_NNS occur_VVP mainly_RB over_IN land_NN in_IN summer_NN ._SENT Nonlinearity_NN A_DT process_NN is_VBZ called_VVN nonlinear_JJ when_WRB there_EX is_VBZ no_DT simple_JJ proportional_JJ relation_NN between_IN cause_NN and_CC effect_NN ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN contains_VVZ many_JJ such_JJ nonlinear_JJ processes_NNS ,_, resulting_VVG in_IN a_DT system_NN with_IN a_DT potentially_RB very_RB complex_JJ behavior_NN ._SENT Such_JJ complexity_NN may_MD lead_VV to_TO abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Predictability_NN ._SENT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP (_( NAO_NP )_) The_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP consists_VVZ of_IN opposing_VVG variations_NNS in_IN barometric_JJ pressure_NN near_IN Iceland_NP and_CC near_IN the_DT Azores_NNS ._SENT It_PP therefore_RB corresponds_VVZ to_TO fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN the_DT main_JJ westerly_JJ winds_NNS across_IN the_DT Atlantic_NP into_IN Europe_NP ,_, and_CC thus_RB to_TO fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT embedded_VVN cyclones_NNS with_IN their_PP$ associated_VVN frontal_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT Northern_NP Annular_NP Mode_NP (_( NAM_NP )_) A_DT winter_NN fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT amplitude_NN of_IN a_DT pattern_NN characterized_VVN by_IN low_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN in_IN the_DT Arctic_NP and_CC strong_JJ mid-latitude_NN westerlies_NNS ._SENT NAM_NP has_VHZ links_NNS with_IN the_DT northern_JJ polar_JJ vortex_NN into_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ pattern_NN has_VHZ a_DT bias_NN to_TO the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP and_CC has_VHZ a_DT large_JJ correlation_NN with_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT Pacific_NP Decadal_NP Oscillation_NP (_( PDO_NP )_) The_DT pattern_NN and_CC time_NN series_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ empirical_JJ orthogonal_JJ function_NN of_IN sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN over_IN the_DT North_NP Pacific_NP north_NN of_IN 20_CD °_SYM N_NP ._SENT PDO_NP broadened_VVD to_TO cover_VV the_DT whole_JJ Pacific_NP Basin_NP is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT Inter-decadal_NP Pacific_NP Oscillation_NP (_( IPO_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT PDO_NP and_CC IPO_NN exhibit_NN virtually_RB identical_JJ temporal_JJ evolution_NN ._SENT Parameterization_NN In_IN climate_NN models_NNS ,_, this_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT technique_NN of_IN representing_VVG processes_NNS that_WDT cannot_MD be_VB explicitly_RB resolved_VVN at_IN the_DT spatial_JJ or_CC temporal_JJ resolution_NN of_IN the_DT model_NN (_( sub-grid_JJ scale_NN processes_NNS )_) by_IN relationships_NNS between_IN model-resolved_JJ larger-scale_JJ flow_NN and_CC the_DT area-_NN or_CC time-averaged_JJ effect_NN of_IN such_JJ sub-grid_JJ scale_NN processes_NNS ._SENT Percentile_NN A_DT percentile_NN is_VBZ a_DT value_NN on_IN a_DT scale_NN of_IN 100_CD that_WDT indicates_VVZ the_DT percentage_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS set_VVP values_NNS that_WDT is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO or_CC below_IN it_PP ._SENT The_DT percentile_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN to_TO estimate_VV the_DT extremes_NNS of_IN a_DT distribution_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT 90th_NN (_( 10th_JJ )_) percentile_NN may_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT threshold_NN for_IN the_DT upper_JJ (_( lower_VV )_) extremes_NNS ._SENT Permafrost_NN Ground_NN (_( soil_NN or_CC rock_NN and_CC included_VVD ice_NN and_CC organic_JJ material_NN )_) that_WDT remains_VVZ at_IN or_CC below_IN 0_CD °_SYM C_NP for_IN at_IN least_JJS 2_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._SENT Predictability_NN The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT future_JJ states_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN may_MD be_VB predicted_VVN based_VVN on_IN knowledge_NN of_IN current_JJ and_CC past_JJ states_NNS of_IN the_DT system_NN ._SENT Probability_NN density_NN function_NN (_( PDF_NP )_) A_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN is_VBZ a_DT function_NN that_WDT indicates_VVZ the_DT relative_JJ chances_NNS of_IN occurrence_NN of_IN different_JJ outcomes_NNS of_IN a_DT variable_NN ._SENT The_DT function_NN integrates_VVZ to_TO unity_NN over_IN the_DT domain_NN for_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN and_CC has_VHZ the_DT property_NN that_IN/that the_DT integral_NN over_IN a_DT sub-domain_JJ equals_VVZ the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that the_DT outcome_NN of_IN the_DT variable_NN lies_VVZ within_IN that_DT sub-domain_JJ ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that a_DT temperature_NN anomaly_NN defined_VVN in_IN a_DT particular_JJ way_NN is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN zero_CD is_VBZ obtained_VVN from_IN its_PP$ PDF_NN by_IN integrating_VVG the_DT PDF_NN over_IN all_DT possible_JJ temperature_NN anomalies_NNS greater_JJR than_IN zero_CD ._SENT Probability_NN density_NN functions_NNS that_WDT describe_VVP two_CD or_CC more_JJR variables_NNS simultaneously_RB are_VBP similarly_RB defined_VVN ._SENT Projection_NN A_DT projection_NN is_VBZ a_DT potential_JJ future_JJ evolution_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN or_CC set_VVN of_IN quantities_NNS ,_, often_RB computed_VVN with_IN the_DT aid_NN of_IN a_DT model_NN ._SENT Projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN predictions_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO emphasize_VV that_IN/that projections_NNS involve_VVP assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ,_, and_CC are_VBP therefore_RB subject_JJ to_TO substantial_JJ uncertainty_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN projection_NN and_CC Climate_NN prediction_NN ._SENT Proxy_JJ climate_NN indicator_NN A_DT proxy_JJ climate_NN indicator_NN is_VBZ a_DT local_JJ record_NN that_WDT is_VBZ interpreted_VVN ,_, using_VVG physical_JJ and_CC biophysical_JJ principles_NNS ,_, to_TO represent_VV some_DT combination_NN of_IN climate-related_JJ variations_NNS back_RB in_IN time_NN ._SENT Climate-related_JJ data_NNS derived_VVN in_IN this_DT way_NN are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN proxy_JJ data_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN proxies_NNS include_VVP pollen_NN analysis_NN ,_, tree_NN ring_NN records_NNS ,_, characteristics_NNS of_IN corals_NNS ,_, and_CC various_JJ data_NNS derived_VVN from_IN ice_NN cores_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN ‘proxy’_NN can_MD also_RB be_VB used_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO indirect_JJ estimates_NNS of_IN present-day_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN observations_NNS ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG Radiative_NN forcing_VVG is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_JJ ,_, downward_JJ minus_CC upward_RB ,_, irradiance_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN an_DT external_JJ driver_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ computed_VVN with_IN all_DT tropospheric_JJ properties_NNS held_VVD fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ,_, and_CC after_IN allowing_VVG for_IN stratospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, if_IN perturbed_VVN ,_, to_TO readjust_VV to_TO radiative-dynamical_JJ equilibrium_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ 


forcing_VVG is_VBZ called_VVN instantaneous_JJ if_IN no_DT change_NN in_IN stratospheric_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ accounted_VVN for_IN ._SENT For_IN the_DT purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ further_RBR defined_VVN as_IN the_DT change_NN relative_JJ to_TO the_DT year_NN 1750_CD and_CC ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB noted_VVN ,_, refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT global_JJ and_CC annual_JJ average_JJ value_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB confused_VVN with_IN cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, a_DT similar_JJ terminology_NN for_IN describing_VVG an_DT unrelated_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT impact_NN of_IN clouds_NNS on_IN the_DT irradiance_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Reanalysis_NN Reanalyses_NNS are_VBP atmospheric_JJ and_CC oceanic_JJ analyses_NNS of_IN temperature_NN ,_, wind_NN ,_, current_JJ ,_, and_CC other_JJ meteorological_JJ and_CC oceanographic_JJ quantities_NNS ,_, created_VVN by_IN processing_VVG past_JJ meteorological_JJ and_CC oceanographic_JJ data_NNS using_VVG fixed_VVN state-of-the-art_JJ weather_NN forecasting_NN models_NNS and_CC data_NNS assimilation_NN techniques_NNS ._SENT Using_VVG fixed_VVN data_NNS assimilation_NN avoids_VVZ effects_NNS from_IN the_DT changing_VVG analysis_NN system_NN that_WDT occur_VVP in_IN operational_JJ analyses_NNS ._SENT Although_IN continuity_NN is_VBZ improved_VVN ,_, global_JJ reanalyses_NNS still_RB suffer_VVP from_IN changing_VVG coverage_NN and_CC biases_NNS in_IN the_DT observing_VVG systems_NNS ._SENT Relative_JJ sea_NN level_NN See_NP Mean_NP sea_NN level_NN ._SENT Resilience_NN The_DT ability_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN and_CC its_PP$ component_NN parts_NNS to_TO anticipate_VV ,_, absorb_VV ,_, accommodate_VV ,_, or_CC recover_VV from_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN a_DT hazardous_JJ event_NN in_IN a_DT timely_JJ and_CC efficient_JJ manner_NN ,_, including_VVG through_IN ensuring_VVG the_DT preservation_NN ,_, restoration_NN ,_, or_CC improvement_NN of_IN its_PP$ essential_JJ basic_JJ structures_NNS and_CC functions_NNS ._SENT Return_NN period_NN An_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT average_JJ time_NN interval_NN between_IN occurrences_NNS of_IN an_DT event_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, flood_NN or_CC extreme_JJ rainfall_NN )_) of_IN (_( or_CC below_RB /_SYM above_IN )_) a_DT defined_VVN size_NN or_CC intensity_NN ._SENT Return_NN value_NN The_DT highest_JJS (_( or_CC ,_, alternatively_RB ,_, lowest_JJS )_) value_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN variable_NN ,_, on_IN average_NN occurring_VVG once_RB in_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, in_IN 10_CD years_NNS )_) ._SENT Risk_VV transfer_VV The_DT process_NN of_IN formally_RB or_CC informally_RB shifting_VVG the_DT financial_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN particular_JJ risks_NNS from_IN one_CD party_NN to_TO another_DT whereby_WRB a_DT household_NN ,_, community_NN ,_, enterprise_NN ,_, or_CC state_NN authority_NN will_MD obtain_VV resources_NNS from_IN the_DT other_JJ party_NN after_IN a_DT disaster_NN occurs_VVZ ,_, in_IN exchange_NN for_IN ongoing_JJ or_CC compensatory_JJ social_JJ or_CC financial_JJ benefits_NNS provided_VVN to_TO that_DT other_JJ party_NN ._SENT Runoff_NN That_DT part_NN of_IN precipitation_NN that_WDT does_VVZ not_RB evaporate_VV and_CC is_VBZ not_RB transpired_VVN ,_, but_CC flows_VVZ through_IN the_DT ground_NN or_CC over_IN the_DT ground_NN surface_NN and_CC returns_NNS to_TO bodies_NNS of_IN water_NN ._SENT See_VV Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT Scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN description_NN of_IN how_WRB the_DT future_NN may_MD develop_VV based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN driving_VVG forces_NNS and_CC key_JJ relationships_NNS ._SENT Scenarios_NNS may_MD be_VB derived_VVN from_IN projections_NNS ,_, but_CC are_VBP often_RB based_VVN on_IN additional_JJ information_NN from_IN other_JJ sources_NNS ,_, sometimes_RB combined_VVN with_IN a_DT narrative_JJ storyline_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN scenario_NN and_CC Emissions_NNS scenario_NN ._SENT Sea_NP level_NN change_NN Changes_NP in_IN sea_NN level_NN ,_, globally_RB or_CC locally_RB ,_, due_JJ to_TO (_( i_NP )_) changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN basins_NNS ,_, (_( ii_NP )_) changes_NNS in_IN the_DT total_JJ mass_NN and_CC distribution_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC land_NN ice_NN ,_, (_( iii_NP )_) changes_NNS in_IN water_NN density_NN ,_, and_CC (_( iv_NN )_) changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN circulation_NN ._SENT Sea_NP level_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN changes_NNS in_IN water_NN density_NN are_VBP called_VVN steric_JJ ._SENT Density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN temperature_NN changes_NNS only_RB are_VBP called_VVN thermosteric_JJ ,_, while_IN density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN salinity_NN changes_NNS are_VBP called_VVN halosteric_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Mean_NP sea_NN level_NN ._SENT Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) The_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT subsurface_JJ bulk_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT top_JJ few_JJ meters_NNS of_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, measured_VVN by_IN ships_NNS ,_, buoys_NNS ,_, and_CC drifters_NNS ._SENT From_IN ships_NNS ,_, measurements_NNS of_IN water_NN samples_NNS in_IN buckets_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB switched_VVN in_IN the_DT 1940s_NNS to_TO samples_NNS from_IN engine_NN intake_NN water_NN ._SENT Satellite_NN measurements_NNS of_IN skin_NN temperature_NN (_( uppermost_JJ layer_NN ;_: a_DT fraction_NN of_IN a_DT millimeter_NN thick_JJ )_) in_IN the_DT infrared_NN or_CC the_DT top_JJ centimeter_NN or_CC so_RB in_IN the_DT microwave_NN are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ,_, but_CC must_MD be_VB adjusted_VVN to_TO be_VB compatible_JJ with_IN the_DT bulk_JJ temperature_NN ._SENT Sensible_JJ heat_NN flux_NN The_DT flux_NN of_IN heat_NN from_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN that_WDT is_VBZ not_RB associated_VVN with_IN phase_NN changes_NNS of_IN water_NN ;_: a_DT component_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN energy_NN budget_NN ._SENT Significant_JJ wave_NN particular_JJ time_NN period_NN ._SENT Soil_NN moisture_NN Water_NP stored_VVD in_IN or_CC at_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN and_CC available_JJ for_IN evapotranspiration_NN ._SENT Southern_NP scenarios_NNS See_VV Emissions_NNS scenario_NN ._SENT Storm_NN surge_NN The_DT temporary_JJ increase_NN ,_, at_IN a_DT particular_JJ locality_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT sea_NN due_JJ to_TO extreme_JJ meteorological_JJ conditions_NNS (_( low_JJ atmospheric_JJ pressure_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC strong_JJ winds_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT storm_NN surge_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN being_VBG the_DT excess_NN above_IN the_DT level_NN expected_VVN from_IN the_DT tidal_JJ variation_NN alone_RB at_IN that_DT time_NN and_CC place_NN ._SENT Storm_NN tracks_NNS Originally_RB ,_, a_DT term_NN main_JJ tracks_NNS of_IN extratropical_JJ disturbances_NNS occur_VVP as_IN sequences_NNS of_IN low_JJ (_( cyclonic_JJ )_) and_CC high_JJ (_( anticyclonic_JJ )_) pressure_NN systems_NNS ._SENT Streamflow_NP Water_NP flow_NN within_IN a_DT river_NN channel_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, expressed_VVN in_IN m3_JJ s-1_NN ._SENT A_DT synonym_NN for_IN river_NN discharge_NN ._SENT Subsidiarity_NN The_DT principle_NN that_IN/that decisions_NNS of_IN government_NN (_( other_JJ things_NNS being_VBG equal_JJ )_) are_VBP best_RBS made_VVN and_CC implemented_VVN ,_, if_IN possible_JJ ,_, at_IN the_DT lowest_JJS most_RBS decentralized_JJ level_NN closest_JJS to_TO the_DT citizen_NN ._SENT Subsidiarity_NN is_VBZ designed_VVN to_TO strengthen_VV accountability_NN and_CC reduce_VV the_DT dangers_NNS of_IN making_VVG decisions_NNS in_IN places_NNS remote_JJ from_IN their_PP$ point_NN of_IN application_NN ._SENT The_DT principle_NN does_VVZ not_RB necessarily_RB limit_VV or_CC higher_JJR level_NN ._SENT Surface_NN temperature_NN See_VV Global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, Land_NP surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, and_CC Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN ._SENT their_PP$ own_JJ needs_NNS ._SENT Transpiration_NN The_DT evaporation_NN of_IN water_NN vapor_NN from_IN the_DT surfaces_NNS of_IN leaves_NNS through_IN stomata_NNS ._SENT Transformation_NN The_DT that_WDT originates_VVZ over_IN tropical_JJ oceans_NNS ._SENT Distinguished_VVN from_IN weaker_JJR systems_NNS (_( often_RB named_VVN tropical_JJ disturbances_NNS or_CC depressions_NNS )_) by_IN exceeding_VVG a_DT threshold_NN wind_NN speed_NN ._SENT A_DT tropical_JJ storm_NN is_VBZ a_DT tropical_JJ cyclone_NN with_IN one-minute_JJ average_JJ surface_NN winds_NNS between_IN 18_CD and_CC 32_CD ._SENT Uncertainty_NN An_DT expression_NN of_IN the_DT degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT value_NN or_CC relationship_NN is_VBZ unknown_JJ ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD result_VV from_IN lack_NN of_IN This_DT glossary_NN defines_VVZ some_DT specific_JJ terms_NNS as_IN the_DT Lead_JJ Authors_NNS intend_VVP 
them_PP to_TO be_VB interpreted_VVN in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT Red_NP ,_, italicized_VVD 
words_NNS indicate_VVP that_IN/that the_DT term_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN in_IN the_DT Glossary_NP ._SENT 
Abrupt_JJ climate_NN change_VV A_DT large-scale_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN 
that_IN/that takes_VVZ place_NN over_IN a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS or_CC less_JJR ,_, persists_VVZ (_( or_CC is_VBZ anticipated_VVN to_TO 
persist_VV )_) for_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS and_CC causes_VVZ substantial_JJ disruptions_NNS in_IN 
human_JJ and_CC natural_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT 
Active_JJ layer_NN The_DT layer_NN of_IN ground_NN that_WDT is_VBZ subject_JJ to_TO annual_JJ thawing_VVG and_CC 
freezing_NN in_IN areas_NNS underlain_VVN by_IN permafrost_NN ._SENT 
Adjustment_NN time_NN See_NP Lifetime_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Response_NP time_NN ._SENT 
Advection_NN Transport_NN of_IN water_NN or_CC air_NN along_IN with_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, temperature_NN ,_, 
chemical_NN tracers_NNS )_) by_IN winds_NNS or_CC currents_NNS ._SENT Regarding_VVG the_DT general_NN 
distinction_NN between_IN advection_NN and_CC convection_NN ,_, the_DT former_JJ describes_VVZ transport_NN 
by_IN large-scale_JJ motions_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC ocean_NN ,_, while_IN convection_NN 
describes_VVZ the_DT predominantly_RB vertical_JJ ,_, locally_RB induced_VVN motions_NNS ._SENT 
Aerosol_NN A_DT suspension_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT typical_JJ 
size_NN between_IN a_DT few_JJ nanometres_NNS and_CC 10_CD μm_NN that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT For_IN convenience_NN the_DT term_NN aerosol_NN ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ 
both_CC the_DT particles_NNS and_CC the_DT suspending_VVG gas_NN ,_, is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN in_IN 
its_PP$ plural_JJ form_NN to_TO mean_VV aerosol_NN particles_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_RB natural_JJ 
or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN several_JJ ways_NNS :_: 
directly_RB through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG radiation_NN (_( see_VV Aerosol_NP –_NN radiation_NN 
interaction_NN )_) and_CC indirectly_RB by_IN acting_VVG as_IN cloud_NN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS or_CC ice_NN 
nuclei_NNS ,_, modifying_VVG the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS (_( see_VV Aerosol_NP –_NN 
cloud_NN interaction_NN )_) ._SENT 
Aerosol_NN –_NN cloud_NN interaction_NN A_DT process_NN by_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN to_TO 
aerosol_NN affects_VVZ the_DT microphysical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC evolution_NN of_IN clouds_NNS 
through_IN the_DT aerosol_NN role_NN as_IN cloud_NN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS or_CC ice_NN nuclei_NNS ,_, particularly_RB 
in_IN ways_NNS that_WDT affect_VVP radiation_NN or_CC precipitation_NN ;_: such_JJ processes_NNS can_MD 
also_RB include_VV the_DT effect_NN of_IN clouds_NNS and_CC precipitation_NN on_IN aerosol_NN ._SENT The_DT aerosol_NN 
perturbation_NN can_MD be_VB anthropogenic_JJ or_CC come_VVN from_IN some_DT natural_JJ source_NN ._SENT The_DT 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG from_IN such_JJ interactions_NNS has_VHZ traditionally_RB been_VBN attributed_VVN 
to_TO numerous_JJ indirect_JJ aerosol_NN effects_NNS ,_, but_CC in_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, only_RB two_CD levels_NNS of_IN 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC effect_NN )_) are_VBP distinguished_VVN :_: 
Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC effect_NN )_) due_JJ to_TO aerosol_NN –_NN cloud_NN interactions_NNS 
(_( RFaci_NP )_) The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC radiative_JJ effect_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT perturbation_NN is_VBZ 
internally_RB generated_VVN )_) due_JJ to_TO the_DT change_NN in_IN number_NN or_CC size_NN distribution_NN 
of_IN cloud_NN droplets_NNS or_CC ice_NN crystals_NNS that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT proximate_JJ result_NN of_IN an_DT aerosol_NN 
perturbation_NN ,_, with_IN other_JJ variables_NNS (_( in_IN particular_JJ total_JJ cloud_NN water_NN 
content_NN )_) remaining_VVG equal_JJ ._SENT In_IN liquid_JJ clouds_NNS ,_, an_DT increase_NN in_IN cloud_NN droplet_NN 
concentration_NN and_CC surface_NN area_NN would_MD increase_VV the_DT cloud_NN albedo_NN ._SENT This_DT 
effect_NN is_VBZ also_RB known_VVN as_IN the_DT cloud_NN albedo_NN effect_NN ,_, first_JJ indirect_JJ effect_NN ,_, or_CC 
Twomey_NP effect_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT largely_RB theoretical_JJ concept_NN that_WDT cannot_MD readily_RB be_VB 
isolated_VVN in_IN observations_NNS or_CC comprehensive_JJ process_NN models_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT 
rapidity_NN and_CC ubiquity_NN of_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS ._SENT 
Effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC effect_NN )_) due_JJ to_TO aerosol_NN –_NN cloud_NN interactions_NNS 
(_( ERFaci_NP )_) The_DT final_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC effect_NN )_) from_IN the_DT aerosol_NN 
perturbation_NN including_VVG the_DT rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS to_TO the_DT initial_JJ change_NN 
in_IN droplet_NN or_CC crystal_NN formation_NN rate_NN ._SENT These_DT adjustments_NNS include_VVP changes_NNS 
in_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN convection_NN ,_, precipitation_NN efficiency_NN ,_, cloud_NN fraction_NN ,_, 
lifetime_NN or_CC water_NN content_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT formation_NN or_CC suppression_NN 
of_IN clouds_NNS in_IN remote_JJ areas_NNS due_JJ to_TO altered_JJ circulations_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT total_JJ effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG due_JJ to_TO both_DT aerosol_NN –_NN cloud_NN and_NP

forcing_VVG (_( ERFari+aci_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Aerosol_NP –_NN radiation_NN interaction_NN ._SENT

Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG (_( or_CC effect_NN )_) due_JJ to_TO aerosol_NN –_NN radiation_NN interactions_NNS

change_NN in_IN radiation_NN ._SENT These_DT adjustments_NNS include_VVP changes_NNS in_IN cloud_NN 
caused_VVN by_IN the_DT impact_NN of_IN the_DT radiative_JJ heating_NN on_IN convective_JJ or_CC largerscale_JJ

Bayesian_JJ method_NN /_SYM approach_NN A_DT Bayesian_NP method_NN is_VBZ a_DT method_NN by_IN 
which_WDT a_DT statistical_JJ analysis_NN of_IN an_DT unknown_JJ or_CC uncertain_JJ quantity_NN (_( ies_NN )_) is_VBZ carried_VVN 
out_RB in_IN two_CD steps_NNS ._SENT First_RB ,_, a_DT prior_JJ probability_NN distribution_NN for_IN the_DT uncertain_JJ 
quantity_NN (_( ies_NN )_) is_VBZ formulated_VVN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN existing_VVG knowledge_NN (_( either_CC by_IN 
eliciting_VVG expert_NN opinion_NN or_CC by_IN using_VVG existing_JJ data_NNS and_CC studies_NNS )_) ._SENT At_IN this_DT first_JJ 
stage_NN ,_, an_DT element_NN of_IN subjectivity_NN may_MD influence_VV the_DT choice_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN many_JJ 
cases_NNS ,_, the_DT prior_JJ probability_NN distribution_NN can_MD be_VB chosen_VVN as_RB neutrally_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, 
in_IN order_NN not_RB to_TO influence_VV the_DT final_JJ outcome_NN of_IN the_DT analysis_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
second_JJ step_NN ,_, newly_RB acquired_VVN data_NNS are_VBP used_VVN to_TO update_VV the_DT prior_JJ distribution_NN 
into_IN a_DT posterior_JJ distribution_NN ._SENT The_DT update_NN is_VBZ carried_VVN out_RP either_CC through_IN an_DT 
analytic_JJ computation_NN or_CC though_IN numeric_JJ approximation_NN ,_, using_VVG a_DT theorem_NN 
formulated_VVN by_IN and_CC named_VVN after_IN the_DT British_JJ mathematician_NN Thomas_NP Bayes_NP 
(_( 1702_CD –_NN 1761_CD )_) ._SENT

._SENT Measurements_NNS of_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN 13C_NP /_SYM 12C_JJ in_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN molecules_NNS are_VBP

Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP (_( CDR_NP )_) Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP methods_NNS

geoengineering_NN ,_, though_IN this_DT may_MD not_RB be_VB the_DT case_NN for_IN others_NNS ,_, with_IN the_DT distinction_NN

CDR_NN activities_NNS ._SENT The_DT boundary_NN between_IN CDR_NP and_CC mitigation_NN is_VBZ not_RB clear_JJ and_CC 


there_EX could_MD be_VB some_DT overlap_VVP between_IN the_DT two_CD given_VVN current_JJ definitions_NNS

Chaotic_JJ A_DT dynamical_JJ system_NN such_JJ as_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, governed_VVN by_IN 
nonlinear_JJ deterministic_JJ equations_NNS (_( see_VV Nonlinearity_NN )_) ,_, may_MD exhibit_VV erratic_JJ or_CC 
chaotic_JJ behaviour_NN in_IN the_DT sense_NN that_IN/that very_RB small_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT initial_JJ state_NN 
of_IN the_DT system_NN in_IN time_NN lead_NN to_TO large_JJ and_CC apparently_RB unpredictable_JJ changes_NNS 
in_IN its_PP$ temporal_JJ evolution_NN ._SENT Such_JJ chaotic_JJ behaviour_NN limits_VVZ the_DT predictability_NN 
of_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN a_DT nonlinear_JJ dynamical_JJ system_NN at_IN specific_JJ future_JJ times_NNS ,_, 
although_IN changes_NNS in_IN its_PP$ statistics_NNS may_MD still_RB be_VB predictable_JJ given_VVN changes_NNS in_IN 
the_DT system_NN parameters_NNS or_CC boundary_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT

consists_VVZ mainly_RB of_IN carbon_NN with_IN a_DT disturbed_JJ graphitic_JJ structure_NN ,_, with_IN lesser_JJR

Chronology_NN Arrangement_NN of_IN events_NNS according_VVG to_TO dates_NNS or_CC times_NNS of_IN 
occurrence_NN ._SENT 
Clathrate_JJ (_( methane_NN )_) A_DT partly_RB frozen_VVN slushy_JJ mix_NN of_IN methane_NN gas_NN and_NP 
ice_NN ,_, usually_RB found_VVN in_IN sediments_NNS ._SENT 
Clausius_NP –_NP Clapeyron_NP equation_NN /_SYM relationship_NN The_DT thermodynamic_JJ 
relationship_NN between_IN small_JJ changes_NNS in_IN temperature_NN and_CC vapour_NN pressure_NN 
in_IN an_DT equilibrium_NN system_NN with_IN condensed_JJ phases_NNS present_JJ ._SENT For_IN trace_NN gases_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN water_NN vapour_NN ,_, this_DT relation_NN gives_VVZ the_DT increase_NN in_IN equilibrium_NN (_( or_CC 
saturation_NN )_) water_NN vapour_NN pressure_NN per_IN unit_NN change_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_NN 
weather_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT 
mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG 
from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN for_IN 
averaging_VVG these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP 
Organization_NN ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ 
the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN –_NN carbon_NN cycle_NN feedback_NN A_DT climate_NN feedback_NN involving_VVG 
changes_NNS in_IN the_DT properties_NNS of_IN land_NN and_CC ocean_NN carbon_NN cycle_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO climate_NN 
change_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, changes_NNS in_IN oceanic_JJ temperature_NN and_CC circulation_NN 
could_MD affect_VV the_DT atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN CO2_JJ flux_NN ;_: on_IN the_DT continents_NNS ,_, climate_NN 
change_NN could_MD affect_VV plant_NN photosynthesis_NN and_CC soil_NN microbial_JJ respiration_NN 
and_CC hence_RB the_DT flux_NN of_IN CO2_NP between_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC the_DT land_NN biosphere_NN ._SENT 
climate-change_NN climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT 
climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS 
in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS ,_, and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT 
extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ 
to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS of_IN 
the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS and_CC persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS 
in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that the_DT Framework_NN 
Convention_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ 
climate-change_NN as_RB :_: ‘a_NN change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB 
to_TO human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN 
and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVD over_RP 
comparable_JJ time_NN periods’_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN 
climate-change_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
composition_NN ,_, and_CC climate_NN variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN ,_, Detection_NP and_CC Attribution_NP ._SENT 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN Due_JJ to_TO the_DT thermal_JJ inertia_NN of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN and_CC slow_JJ processes_NNS in_IN the_DT cryosphere_NN and_CC land_NN surfaces_NNS ,_, the_DT climate_NN 
would_MD continue_VV to_TO change_VV even_RB if_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN were_VBD held_VVN 
fixed_VVN at_IN today’s_NN values_NNS ._SENT Past_JJ change_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ composition_NN leads_VVZ to_TO 
a_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, which_WDT continues_VVZ for_IN as_RB long_JJ as_IN a_DT radiative_JJ 
imbalance_NN persists_VVZ and_CC until_IN all_DT components_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN have_VHP 
adjusted_VVN to_TO a_DT new_JJ state_NN ._SENT The_DT further_JJR change_NN in_IN temperature_NN after_IN the_DT composition_NN 
of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN is_VBZ held_VVN constant_JJ is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT constant_JJ 
composition_NN temperature_NN commitment_NN or_CC simply_RB committed_VVN warming_NN or_CC 
warming_NN commitment_NN ._SENT climate-change_NN commitment_NN includes_VVZ other_JJ future_NN 
changes_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ,_, 
in_IN extreme_JJ climate_NN events_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN sea_NN level_NN change_NN ._SENT The_DT constant_JJ emission_NN 
commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV from_IN keeping_VVG 
anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS constant_JJ and_CC the_DT zero_CD emission_NN commitment_NN 
is_VBZ the_DT climate-change_NN commitment_NN when_WRB emissions_NNS are_VBP set_VVN to_TO zero_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN feedback_NN An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN in_IN one_CD 
climate_NN quantity_NN causes_VVZ a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT 
second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT 
negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ weakened_VVN 
by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ 
perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT In_IN this_DT Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, a_DT somewhat_RB narrower_JJR 
definition_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN which_WDT the_DT climate_NN quantity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ perturbed_VVN is_VBZ 
the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN turn_NN causes_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT 
global_JJ radiation_NN budget_NN ._SENT In_IN either_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN can_MD either_RB 
be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN 
Feedback_NN Parameter_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN Feedback_NP Parameter_NP A_DT way_NN to_TO quantify_VV the_DT radiative_JJ 
response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO a_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
change_NN induced_VVD by_IN a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT It_PP varies_VVZ as_IN the_DT inverse_NN of_IN the_DT effective_JJ 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT Formally_RB ,_, the_DT Climate_NN Feedback_NP Parameter_NP (_( a_DT ;_: units_NNS :_: 
W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD °_SYM C_NP –_NP 1_CD )_) is_VBZ defined_VVN as_RB :_: a_DT =_SYM (_( ΔQ_JJ –_NN ΔF_NN )_) /_SYM ΔT_NN ,_, where_WRB Q_NP is_VBZ the_DT global_JJ mean_NN 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, T_NN is_VBZ the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ air_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, F_NP is_VBZ the_DT 
heat_NN flux_NN into_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC Δ_NN represents_VVZ a_DT change_NN with_IN respect_NN to_TO an_DT 
unperturbed_JJ climate_NN ._SENT

Climate_NN index_NN A_DT time_NN series_NN constructed_VVN from_IN climate_NN variables_NNS that_RB 
provides_VVZ an_DT aggregate_JJ summary_NN of_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT For_IN

Azores_NP provides_VVZ a_DT simple_JJ yet_CC useful_JJ historical_JJ NAO_NP index_NN ._SENT Because_IN of_IN their_PP$

that_WDT have_VHP maximum_JJ variance_NN subject_NN to_TO certain_JJ normalisation_NN constraints_NNS 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, the_DT NAM_NP and_CC SAM_NP indices_NN which_WDT are_VBP principal_JJ components_NNS of_IN Northern_NP 
Hemisphere_NP and_CC Southern_NP Hemisphere_NP gridded_VVD pressure_NN anomalies_NNS ,_, 
respectively_RB )_) ._SENT See_VV Box_NP 2.5_CD for_IN a_DT summary_NN of_IN definitions_NNS for_IN established_VVN

Climate_NN model_NN (_( spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN )_) A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN 
of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_CC biological_JJ 
properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, 
and_CC accounting_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD 
be_VB represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN 
or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS 
can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, 
the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP 
explicitly_RB represented_VVN or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS 
are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT Coupled_VVN Atmosphere_NN –_NN Ocean_NP General_NP Circulation_NP Models_NPS 
(_( AOGCMs_NNS )_) provide_VVP a_DT representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ near_RB or_JJ 
at_IN the_DT most_RBS comprehensive_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN currently_RB available_JJ ._SENT There_RB 
is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN 
and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC 
simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, seasonal_JJ 
and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Earth_NP System_NP Model_NP ,_,

Climate_NN pattern_NN A_DT set_NN of_IN spatially_RB varying_VVG coefficients_NNS obtained_VVN by_IN

is_VBZ an_DT eigenvector_NN of_IN the_DT covariance_NN matrix_NN ,_, referred_VVD to_TO as_IN an_DT Empirical_NP 
Orthogonal_JJ Function_NP (_( EOF_NP )_) in_IN climate_NN science_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN prediction_NN A_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC climate_NN forecast_NN is_VBZ the_DT

climate-system_NN )_) an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT actual_JJ evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN in_IN 
the_DT future_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, at_IN seasonal_JJ ,_, interannual_JJ or_CC decadal_JJ time_NN scales_NNS ._SENT
