to_TO initial_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, such_JJ predictions_NNS are_VBP usually_RB probabilistic_JJ in_IN nature_NN ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Climate_NN projection_NN ,_, Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, Model_NP initialization_NN and_CC Predictability_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN projection_NN A_DT climate_NN projection_NN is_VBZ the_DT simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN

not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN scenario_NN ._SENT

Climate_NN sensitivity_NN In_IN IPCC_NP reports_NNS ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
(_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN (_( steady_JJ state_NN )_) change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ 
global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN concentration_NN ._SENT Owing_VVG to_TO computational_JJ constraints_NNS ,_, 
the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB 
estimated_VVN by_IN running_VVG an_DT atmospheric_JJ general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN coupled_VVN 
to_TO a_DT mixed-layer_NN ocean_NN model_NN ,_, because_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ 
largely_RB determined_VVN by_IN atmospheric_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Efficient_JJ models_NNS can_MD be_VB run_VVN 
to_TO equilibrium_NN with_IN a_DT dynamic_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN 
(_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) –_NP 1_CD )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT 
The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO doubled_VVN carbon_NN dioxide_NN concentration_NN 
that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN evolving_VVG 
non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT 
climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN 
and_CC climate_NN state_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN 
sensitivity_NN ._SENT 
The_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ

simulation_NN in_IN which_WDT CO2_NP increases_VVZ at_IN 1_CD %_NN yr_NN –_NN 1._CD It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT 
strength_NN and_CC rapidity_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN forcing_VVG ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN See_VV climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT 
climate-system_NN The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN 
consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, 
the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT lithosphere_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS 
between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN 
its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ 
eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT 
changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN variability_NN Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_NN 
state_NN and_CC other_JJ statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN 
extremes_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_RB 
that_DT of_IN individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ 
processes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC to_TO variations_NNS 
in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Cloud_NN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS (_( CCN_NP )_) The_DT subset_NN of_IN aerosol_NN particles_NNS 
that_DT serve_NN as_IN an_DT initial_JJ site_NN for_IN the_DT condensation_NN of_IN liquid_JJ water_NN ,_, which_WDT can_MD 
lead_VV to_TO the_DT formation_NN of_IN cloud_NN droplets_NNS ,_, under_IN typical_JJ cloud_NN formation_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT main_JJ factor_NN that_WDT determines_VVZ which_WDT aerosol_NN particles_NNS are_VBP CCN_NP at_IN 
a_DT given_VVN supersaturation_NN is_VBZ their_PP$ size_NN ._SENT 
Cloud_NN feedback_NN A_DT climate_NN feedback_NN involving_VVG changes_NNS in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT 
properties_NNS of_IN clouds_NNS as_IN a_DT response_NN to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT local_JJ or_CC global_JJ mean_NN 
surface_NN temperature_NN ._SENT Understanding_VVG cloud_NN feedbacks_NNS and_CC determining_VVG 
their_PP$ magnitude_NN and_CC sign_NN require_VVP an_DT understanding_NN of_IN how_WRB a_DT change_NN in_IN climate_NN 
may_MD affect_VV the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN cloud_NN types_NNS ,_, the_DT cloud_NN fraction_NN and_CC height_NN ,_, 
the_DT radiative_JJ properties_NNS of_IN clouds_NNS ,_, and_CC finally_RB the_DT Earth’s_NP radiation_NN budget_NN ._SENT 
At_IN present_JJ ,_, cloud_NN feedbacks_NNS remain_VVP the_DT largest_JJS source_NN of_IN uncertainty_NN in_IN 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN estimates_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Cloud_NP radiative_JJ effect_NN ._SENT 
Cloud_NN radiative_JJ effect_NN The_DT radiative_JJ effect_NN of_IN clouds_NNS relative_JJ to_TO the_DT 
identical_JJ situation_NN without_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT In_IN previous_JJ IPCC_NP reports_VVZ this_DT was_VBD called_VVN 
cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, but_CC that_IN/that terminology_NN is_VBZ inconsistent_JJ with_IN other_JJ uses_NNS 
of_IN the_DT forcing_VVG term_NN and_CC is_VBZ not_RB maintained_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Cloud_NP 
feedback_NN ._SENT

Cold_JJ days_NNS /_SYM cold_JJ nights_NNS Days_NNS where_WRB maximum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, or_CC nights_NNS 
where_WRB minimum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, falls_VVZ below_IN the_DT 10th_JJ percentile_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT 
respective_JJ temperature_NN distributions_NNS are_VBP generally_RB defined_VVN with_IN respect_NN to_TO 
the_DT 1961_CD –_NN 1990_CD reference_NN period_NN ._SENT For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP Box_NP 
.4_LS ._SENT 
Compatible_JJ emissions_NNS Earth_NP System_NP Models_NNS that_WDT simulate_VVP the_DT land_NN 
and_CC ocean_NN carbon_NN cycle_NN can_MD calculate_VV CO2_JJ emissions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP compatible_JJ 
with_IN a_DT given_VVN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP concentration_NN trajectory_NN ._SENT The_DT compatible_JJ 
emissions_NNS over_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN are_VBP equal_JJ to_TO the_DT increase_NN of_IN carbon_NN 
over_IN that_DT same_JJ period_NN of_IN time_NN in_IN the_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT three_CD active_JJ reservoirs_NNS :_: the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT land_NN and_CC the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT 
Confidence_NN The_DT validity_NN of_IN a_DT finding_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT type_NN ,_, amount_NN ,_, quality_NN ,_, 
and_CC consistency_NN of_IN evidence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, mechanistic_JJ understanding_NN ,_, theory_NN ,_, data_NNS ,_, 
models_NNS ,_, expert_NN judgment_NN )_) and_CC on_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN agreement_NN ._SENT Confidence_NN is_VBZ 
expressed_VVN qualitatively_RB (_( Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV Figure_NP 1.11_CD for_IN the_DT 
levels_NNS of_IN confidence_NN and_CC Table_NP 1.1_CD for_IN the_DT list_NN of_IN likelihood_NN qualifiers_NNS ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Uncertainty_NN ._SENT 
Convection_NN Vertical_JJ motion_NN driven_VVN by_IN buoyancy_NN forces_NNS arising_VVG from_IN 
static_JJ instability_NN ,_, usually_RB caused_VVN by_IN near-surface_NN cooling_NN or_CC increases_VVZ in_IN 
salinity_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC near-surface_NN warming_NN or_CC cloud-top_JJ 
radiative_JJ cooling_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN convection_NN 
gives_VVZ rise_NN to_TO cumulus_NN clouds_NNS and_CC precipitation_NN and_CC is_VBZ effective_JJ at_IN 
both_CC scavenging_VVG and_CC vertically_RB transporting_VVG chemical_NN species_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT ocean_NN 
convection_NN can_MD carry_VV surface_NN waters_NNS to_TO deep_JJ within_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT 


Cosmogenic_JJ radioisotopes_NNS Rare_JJ radioactive_JJ isotopes_NNS that_WDT are_VBP created_VVN 
by_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN a_DT high-energy_NP cosmic_JJ ray_NN particles_NNS with_IN atoms_NNS 
nuclei_NNS ._SENT They_PP are_VBP often_RB used_VVN as_IN indicator_NN of_IN solar_JJ activity_NN which_WDT modulates_VVZ 
the_DT cosmic_JJ rays_NNS intensity_NN or_CC as_IN tracers_NNS of_IN atmospheric_JJ transport_NN processes_VVZ ,_, 
and_CC are_VBP also_RB called_VVN cosmogenic_JJ radionuclides_NNS ._SENT 
Cryosphere_NP All_NP regions_NNS on_IN and_CC beneath_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NP and_NP 
ocean_NN where_WRB water_NN is_VBZ in_IN solid_JJ form_NN ,_, including_VVG sea_NN ice_NN ,_, lake_NN ice_NN ,_, river_NN ice_NN ,_, 
snow_NN cover_NN ,_, glaciers_NNS and_CC ice_NN sheets_NNS ,_, and_CC frozen_JJ ground_NN (_( which_WDT includes_VVZ 
permafrost_NN )_) ._SENT 
Dansgaard_NP –_NP Oeschger_NP events_NNS Abrupt_NN events_NNS characterized_VVN in_IN Greenland_NP 
ice_NN cores_NNS and_CC in_IN palaeoclimate_JJ records_NNS from_IN the_DT nearby_JJ North_NP Atlantic_NP 
by_IN a_DT cold_JJ glacial_JJ state_NN ,_, followed_VVN by_IN a_DT rapid_JJ transition_NN to_TO a_DT warmer_JJR phase_NN ,_,

Oeschger_NP events_NNS are_VBP observed_VVN in_IN other_JJ regions_NNS as_IN well_RB ._SENT

Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN Detection_NN of_IN change_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT 
process_NN of_IN demonstrating_VVG that_DT climate_NN or_CC a_DT system_NN affected_VVN by_IN climate_NN has_VHZ 
changed_VVN in_IN some_DT defined_VVN statistical_JJ sense_NN ,_, without_IN providing_VVG a_DT reason_NN for_IN 
that_DT change_NN ._SENT An_DT identified_VVN change_NN is_VBZ detected_VVN in_IN observations_NNS if_IN its_PP$ likelihood_NN 
of_IN occurrence_NN by_IN chance_NN due_JJ to_TO internal_JJ variability_NN alone_RB is_VBZ determined_VVN 
to_TO be_VB small_JJ ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, <_SYM 10_CD %_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT process_NN 
of_IN evaluating_VVG the_DT relative_JJ contributions_NNS of_IN multiple_JJ causal_JJ factors_NNS to_TO 
a_DT change_NN or_CC event_NN with_IN an_DT assignment_NN of_IN statistical_JJ confidence_NN (_( Hegerl_NP et_NP 
al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT

Dobson_NP Unit_NP (_( DU_NP )_) A_DT unit_NN to_TO measure_VV the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN ozone_NN in_IN a_DT

of_IN Dobson_NP Units_NP is_VBZ the_DT thickness_NN in_IN units_NNS of_IN 10_CD –_NN 5_CD m_NN that_IN/that the_DT ozone_NN column_NN 
would_MD occupy_VV if_IN compressed_VVN into_IN a_DT layer_NN of_IN uniform_JJ density_NN at_IN a_DT pressure_NN 
of_IN 1013_CD hPa_NN and_CC a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 0_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT One_NP DU_NP corresponds_VVZ to_TO a_DT column_NN of_IN 
ozone_NN containing_VVG 2.69_CD ×_NP 1020_CD molecules_NNS per_IN square_JJ metre_NN ._SENT A_DT typical_JJ value_NN

very_RB variable_JJ ,_, is_VBZ 300_CD DU_NP ._SENT 
Downscaling_NP Downscaling_NP is_VBZ a_DT method_NN that_WDT derives_VVZ local-_NN to_TO regionalscale_NN 
(_( 10_CD to_TO 100_CD km_NN )_) information_NN from_IN larger-scale_JJ models_NNS or_CC data_NNS analyses_NNS ._SENT 
Two_CD main_JJ methods_NNS exist_VVP :_: dynamical_JJ downscaling_NN and_CC empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ 
downscaling_NN ._SENT The_DT dynamical_JJ method_NN uses_VVZ the_DT output_NN of_IN regional_JJ climate_NN 
models_NNS ,_, global_JJ models_NNS with_IN variable_JJ spatial_JJ resolution_NN or_CC high-resolution_NN 
global_JJ models_NNS ._SENT The_DT empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ methods_NNS develop_VVP statistical_JJ relationships_NNS 
that_DT link_NN the_DT large-scale_JJ atmospheric_JJ variables_NNS with_IN local_NN /_SYM 
regional_JJ 
climate_NN variables_NNS ._SENT In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT driving_VVG model_NN remains_VVZ an_DT 
important_JJ limitation_NN on_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT downscaled_JJ information_NN ._SENT 
Drought_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB dry_JJ weather_NN long_RB enough_RB to_TO cause_VV a_DT 
serious_JJ hydrological_JJ imbalance_NN ._SENT Drought_NN is_VBZ a_DT relative_JJ term_NN ;_: therefore_RB any_RB 
discussion_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN precipitation_NN deficit_NN must_MD refer_VV to_TO the_DT particular_JJ 
precipitation-related_JJ activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ under_IN discussion_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, shortage_NN 
of_IN precipitation_NN during_IN the_DT growing_VVG season_NN impinges_VVZ on_IN crop_NN production_NN 
or_CC ecosystem_NN function_NN in_IN general_JJ (_( due_JJ to_TO soil_VV moisture_NN drought_NN ,_, also_RB 
termed_VVN agricultural_JJ drought_NN )_) ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT runoff_NN and_CC percolation_NN season_NN 
primarily_RB affects_VVZ water_NN supplies_NNS (_( hydrological_JJ drought_NN )_) ._SENT Storage_NN changes_NNS 
in_IN soil_NN moisture_NN and_CC groundwater_NN are_VBP also_RB affected_VVN by_IN increases_NNS in_IN actual_JJ 
evapotranspiration_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO reductions_NNS in_IN precipitation_NN ._SENT A_DT period_NN with_IN 
an_DT abnormal_JJ precipitation_NN deficit_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN a_DT meteorological_JJ drought_NN ._SENT A_DT 
megadrought_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB lengthy_JJ and_CC pervasive_JJ drought_NN ,_, lasting_VVG much_RB longer_RBR 
than_IN normal_JJ ,_, usually_RB a_DT decade_NN or_CC more_JJR ._SENT For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP 
Box_NP 2.4_NP ._SENT 
Dynamical_JJ system_NN A_DT process_NN or_CC set_VVN of_IN processes_NNS whose_WP$ evolution_NN in_IN

is_VBZ a_DT dynamical_JJ system_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, Chaotic_NP ,_, Nonlinearity_NN 
and_CC Predictability_NP ._SENT 
Earth_NP System_NP Model_NP (_( ESM_NP )_) A_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN general_NN 
circulation_NN model_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT representation_NN of_IN the_DT carbon_NN cycle_NN is_VBZ included_VVN ,_, 
allowing_VVG for_IN interactive_JJ calculation_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP or_CC compatible_JJ 
emissions_NNS ._SENT Additional_JJ components_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmospheric_JJ chemistry_NN ,_, ice_NN sheets_NNS ,_, 
dynamic_JJ vegetation_NN ,_, nitrogen_NN cycle_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB urban_JJ or_CC crop_NN models_NNS )_) may_MD be_VB 
included_VVD ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT 
Earth_NP System_NP Model_NP of_IN Intermediate_NP Complexity_NP (_( EMIC_NP )_) A_DT climate_NN

fashion_NN ._SENT 
Earth_NP System_NP sensitivity_NN The_DT equilibrium_NN temperature_NN response_NN of_IN 
the_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN –_NN cryosphere_NN –_NN vegetation_NN –_NN carbon_NN cycle_NN 
system_NN to_TO a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP concentration_NN is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO 
as_IN Earth_NP System_NP sensitivity_NN ._SENT Because_IN it_PP allows_VVZ slow_JJ components_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, ice_NN 
sheets_NNS ,_, vegetation_NN )_) of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO adjust_VV to_TO the_DT external_JJ perturbation_NN ,_, 
it_PP may_MD differ_VV substantially_RB from_IN the_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN derived_VVN from_IN 
coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN models_NNS ._SENT 
Ecosystem_NN An_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ a_DT functional_JJ unit_NN consisting_VVG of_IN living_NN

between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT components_NNS included_VVD in_IN a_DT given_VVN ecosystem_NN and_CC its_PP$ spatial_JJ 
boundaries_NNS depend_VVP on_IN the_DT purpose_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN :_: 
in_IN some_DT cases_NNS they_PP are_VBP relatively_RB sharp_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS they_PP are_VBP diffuse_JJ ._SENT

other_JJ ecosystems_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PP$ scale_NN can_MD range_VV from_IN very_RB small_JJ to_TO the_DT entire_NN

environment_NN ._SENT

Efficacy_NN A_DT measure_NN of_IN how_WRB effective_JJ a_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG from_IN a_DT given_VVN

mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN compared_VVN to_TO an_DT equivalent_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
from_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT A_DT carbon_NN dioxide_NN increase_NN by_IN definition_NN has_VHZ an_DT

of_IN 1.0_CD ._SENT Variations_NNS in_IN climate_NN efficacy_NN may_MD result_VV from_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS 
to_TO the_DT applied_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, which_WDT differ_VVP with_IN different_JJ forcings_NNS ._SENT 
Ekman_NP pumping_VVG Frictional_JJ stress_NN at_IN the_DT surface_NN between_IN two_CD fluids_NNS 
(_( atmosphere_NN and_CC ocean_NN )_) or_CC between_IN a_DT fluid_NN and_CC the_DT adjacent_JJ solid_JJ surface_NN 
(_( the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN )_) forces_VVZ a_DT circulation_NN ._SENT When_WRB the_DT resulting_VVG mass_NN 


transport_NN 
is_VBZ converging_VVG ,_, mass_JJ conservation_NN requires_VVZ a_DT vertical_JJ flow_NN away_RB 
from_IN the_DT surface_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ called_VVN Ekman_NP pumping_VVG ._SENT The_DT opposite_JJ effect_NN ,_, in_IN case_NN 
of_IN divergence_NN ,_, is_VBZ called_VVN Ekman_NP suction_NN ._SENT The_DT effect_NN is_VBZ important_JJ in_IN both_CC the_DT 
atmosphere_NN and_CC the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT

the_DT power_NN arriving_VVG at_IN the_DT Earth_NN per_IN unit_NN area_NN ,_, per_IN unit_NN wavelength_NN ._SENT 
El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD initially_RB 
used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_NN that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ along_IN the_DT 
coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ since_RB become_VVN 
identified_VVN with_IN a_DT basin-wide_JJ warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP east_RB of_IN 
the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN a_DT globalscale_NN 
tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP 
Oscillation_NN ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ 
time_NN scales_NNS of_IN two_CD to_TO about_RB seven_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP 
Oscillation_NN (_( ENSO_NP )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN 
difference_NN between_IN Tahiti_NP and_CC Darwin_NP or_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN 
the_DT central_JJ and_CC eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_JJ 
trade_NN winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS 
such_JJ that_IN/that the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT 
trade_NN winds_NNS ._SENT This_DT event_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN 
and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ 
effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, 
through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT 
For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP Box_NP 2.5_CD ._SENT 
Emission_NN scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ development_NN 
of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP potentially_RB radiatively_RB active_JJ 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ 
set_VVN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN driving_JJ forces_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN demographic_JJ and_NP 
socioeconomic_JJ development_NN ,_, technological_JJ change_NN )_) and_CC their_PP$ key_JJ relationships_NNS ._SENT 
Concentration_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, derived_VVN from_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, are_VBP used_VVN 
as_IN input_NN to_TO a_DT climate_NN model_NN to_TO compute_VV climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT In_IN IPCC_NP (_( 1992_CD )_) 
a_DT set_NN of_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS was_VBD presented_VVN which_WDT were_VBD used_VVN as_IN a_DT basis_NN

referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT IS92_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ Report_NP on_IN Emission_NP 
Scenarios_NNS (_( Nakićenović_NP and_CC Swart_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) emission_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ 
SRES_NP scenarios_NNS ,_, were_VBD published_VVN ,_, some_DT of_IN which_WDT were_VBD used_VVN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, 
as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN projections_NNS presented_VVN in_IN Chapters_NP 9_CD to_TO 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP 
(_( 2001_CD )_) and_CC Chapters_NP 10_CD and_CC 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2007_CD )_) ._SENT New_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS 
for_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT four_CD Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP ,_, were_VBD 
developed_VVN for_IN ,_, but_CC independently_RB of_IN ,_, the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP assessment_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Climate_NN scenario_NN and_CC Scenario_NN ._SENT 
Energy_NN balance_NN The_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT total_JJ incoming_NN and_CC total_NN 
outgoing_JJ energy_NN ._SENT If_IN this_DT balance_NN is_VBZ positive_JJ ,_, warming_NN occurs_VVZ ;_: if_IN it_PP is_VBZ negative_JJ ,_, 
cooling_NN occurs_VVZ ._SENT Averaged_VVN over_IN the_DT globe_NN and_CC over_IN long_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ,_, 
this_DT balance_NN must_MD be_VB zero_CD ._SENT Because_IN the_DT climate-system_NN derives_VVZ virtually_RB all_RB 
its_PP$ energy_NN from_IN the_DT Sun_NP ,_, zero_CD balance_NN implies_VVZ that_IN/that ,_, globally_RB ,_, the_DT absorbed_VVN 
solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN minus_CC reflected_VVD solar_JJ radiation_NN 
at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC outgoing_JJ longwave_NN radiation_NN emitted_VVD 
by_IN the_DT climate-system_NN are_VBP equal_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Energy_NP budget_NN ._SENT 
Energy_NP Balance_NP Model_NP (_( EBM_NP )_) An_DT energy_NN balance_NN model_NN is_VBZ a_DT simplified_VVN 
model_NN that_WDT analyses_VVZ the_DT energy_NN budget_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NN to_TO compute_VV 
changes_NNS in_IN the_DT climate_NN ._SENT In_IN its_PP$ simplest_JJS form_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT explicit_JJ spatial_JJ 
dimension_NN and_CC the_DT model_NN then_RB provides_VVZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN 
globally_RB averaged_VVN temperature_NN computed_VVN from_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN radiation_NN ._SENT 
This_DT zero-dimensional_JJ energy_NN balance_NN model_NN can_MD be_VB extended_VVN to_TO a_DT onedimensional_NN 
or_CC two-dimensional_JJ model_NN if_IN changes_NNS to_TO the_DT energy_NN budget_NN 
with_IN respect_NN to_TO latitude_NN ,_, or_CC both_DT latitude_NN and_CC longitude_NN ,_, are_VBP explicitly_RB considered_VVN ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT 
Energy_NN budget_NN (_( of_IN the_DT Earth_NN )_) The_DT Earth_NN is_VBZ a_DT physical_JJ system_NN with_IN 
an_DT energy_NN budget_NN that_WDT includes_VVZ all_DT gains_NNS of_IN incoming_JJ energy_NN and_CC all_DT losses_NNS 
of_IN outgoing_JJ energy_NN ._SENT The_DT Earth’s_NP energy_NN budget_NN is_VBZ determined_VVN by_IN measuring_VVG 
how_WRB much_JJ energy_NN comes_VVZ into_IN the_DT Earth_NP system_NN from_IN the_DT Sun_NP ,_, how_WRB 
much_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ lost_VVN to_TO space_NN ,_, and_CC accounting_NN for_IN the_DT remainder_NN on_IN Earth_NP 
and_CC its_PP$ atmosphere_NN ._SENT Solar_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ the_DT dominant_JJ source_NN of_IN energy_NN into_IN 
the_DT Earth_NP system_NN ._SENT Incoming_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN may_MD be_VB scattered_VVN and_CC reflected_VVN 
by_IN clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS or_CC absorbed_VVN in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT transmitted_VVD 
radiation_NN is_VBZ then_RB either_RB absorbed_VVN or_CC reflected_VVN at_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT The_DT 
average_JJ albedo_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NN is_VBZ about_RB 0.3_CD ,_, which_WDT means_VVZ that_IN/that 30_CD %_NN of_IN the_DT 
incident_NN solar_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ reflected_VVN into_IN space_NN ,_, while_IN 70_CD %_NN is_VBZ absorbed_VVN by_IN 
the_DT Earth_NN ._SENT Radiant_JJ solar_JJ or_CC shortwave_NN energy_NN is_VBZ transformed_VVN into_IN sensible_NN 
heat_NN ,_, latent_JJ energy_NN (_( involving_VVG different_JJ water_NN states_NNS )_) ,_, potential_JJ energy_NN ,_, and_NP 
kinetic_JJ energy_NN before_IN being_VBG emitted_VVN as_IN infrared_JJ radiation_NN ._SENT With_IN the_DT average_NN 
surface_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NN of_IN about_RB 15_CD °_SYM C_NP (_( 288_NP K_NP )_) ,_, the_DT main_JJ outgoing_JJ 
energy_NN flux_NN is_VBZ in_IN the_DT infrared_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Energy_NP balance_NN ,_, 
Latent_JJ heat_NN flux_NN ,_, Sensible_JJ heat_NN flux_NN ._SENT 
Ensemble_RB A_DT collection_NN of_IN model_NN simulations_NNS characterizing_VVG a_DT climate_NN 
prediction_NN or_CC projection_NN ._SENT Differences_NNS in_IN initial_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC model_NN formulation_NN 
result_NN in_IN different_JJ evolutions_NNS of_IN the_DT modelled_VVN system_NN and_CC may_MD give_VV 
information_NN on_IN uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN model_NN error_NN and_CC error_NN in_IN initial_JJ

Equilibrium_NN and_CC transient_JJ climate_NN experiment_NN An_DT equilibrium_NN

of_IN the_DT model_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB on_IN the_DT time-dependent_JJ response_NN ._SENT If_IN the_DT forcing_VVG is_VBZ

area_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT altitude_NN of_IN this_DT boundary_NN is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN equilibrium_NN

Equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentration_NN The_DT concentration_NN 
of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG as_RB 
a_DT given_VVN mixture_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN and_CC other_JJ forcing_VVG components_NNS ._SENT Those_DT 
values_NNS may_MD consider_VV only_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, or_CC a_DT combination_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN

metric_JJ for_IN comparing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN different_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ 
climate-change_NN responses_NNS nor_CC future_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ generally_RB 
no_DT connection_NN between_IN equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emissions_NNS and_CC resulting_VVG

Equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emission_NN The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ integrated_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, 
over_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, as_IN an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC 
a_DT mixture_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT The_DT equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emission_NN is_VBZ

Warming_VVG Potential_JJ for_IN the_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN 


gases_VVZ it_PP is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN summing_VVG the_DT equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emissions_NNS 
of_IN each_DT gas_NN ._SENT Equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emission_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ scale_NN for_IN

Geoengineering_NP Geoengineering_NP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT broad_JJ set_NN of_IN methods_NNS and_CC

to_TO either_DT (_( 1_LS )_) reduce_VV the_DT amount_NN of_IN absorbed_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN in_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN (_( Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP )_) or_CC (_( 2_LS )_) increase_VV net_JJ carbon_NN sinks_NNS 
from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT scale_NN sufficiently_RB large_JJ to_TO alter_VV climate_NN (_( Carbon_NP 
Dioxide_NN Removal_NN )_) ._SENT Scale_NN and_CC intent_NN are_VBP of_IN central_JJ importance_NN ._SENT Two_CD key_NN

they_PP use_VVP or_CC affect_VVP the_DT climate-system_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmosphere_NN ,_, land_NN or_CC ocean_NN )_)

that_WDT cross_VVP national_JJ boundaries_NNS ._SENT Geoengineering_NP is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN weather_NN 
modification_NN and_CC ecological_JJ engineering_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT boundary_NN can_MD be_VB fuzzy_JJ 
(_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012_CD ,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT 
Geoid_NN The_DT equipotential_JJ surface_NN having_VHG the_DT same_JJ geopotential_NN at_IN each_DT

(_( the_DT zero-frequency_NN gravitational_JJ tide_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT Sun_NP and_CC Moon_NP )_) is_VBZ considered_VVN 
in_IN geodetic_JJ studies_NNS ._SENT 
Geostrophic_JJ winds_NNS or_CC currents_NNS A_DT wind_NN or_CC current_NN that_WDT is_VBZ in_IN balance_NN

of_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN friction_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, the_DT wind_NN or_CC current_JJ is_VBZ directly_RB parallel_JJ 
to_TO isobars_NNS and_CC its_PP$ speed_NN is_VBZ proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT horizontal_JJ pressure_NN gradient_NN ._SENT

Glacial_JJ isostatic_JJ adjustment_NN (_( GIA_NN )_) The_DT deformation_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NN

Glacier_NP A_DT perennial_JJ mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN that_WDT originates_VVZ from_IN compressed_VVN 
snow_NN ,_, shows_VVZ evidence_NN of_IN past_JJ or_CC present_JJ flow_NN (_( through_IN internal_JJ deformation_NN 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC sliding_VVG at_IN the_DT base_NN )_) and_CC is_VBZ constrained_VVN by_IN internal_JJ stress_NN and_CC 
friction_NN at_IN the_DT base_NN and_CC sides_NNS ._SENT A_DT glacier_NN is_VBZ maintained_VVN by_IN accumulation_NN of_IN 
snow_NN at_IN high_JJ altitudes_NNS ,_, balanced_VVN by_IN melting_VVG at_IN low_JJ altitudes_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC discharge_NN 
into_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT An_DT ice_NN mass_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ origin_NN as_IN glaciers_NNS ,_, but_CC of_IN 
continental_JJ size_NN ,_, is_VBZ called_VVN an_DT ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT For_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN simplicity_NN in_IN this_DT 
Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, all_DT ice_NN masses_NNS other_JJ than_IN ice_NN sheets_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_RB 


glaciers_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Equilibrium_NN line_NN and_CC Mass_NP balance_NN /_SYM budget_NN (_( of_IN glaciers_NNS or_CC 
ice_NN sheets_NNS )_) ._SENT

to_TO around_RB 1990._CD 
Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN An_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_NN

Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) An_DT index_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN radiative_JJ 
properties_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, measuring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG following_NN 
a_DT pulse_NN emission_NN of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN greenhouse_NN gas_NN in_IN the_DT presentday_NN 
atmosphere_NN integrated_VVN over_IN a_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN 
carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT The_DT GWP_NP represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG 
times_CC these_DT gases_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ relative_JJ effectiveness_NN 
in_IN causing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP is_VBZ based_VVN on_IN GWPs_NP 
from_IN pulse_NN emissions_NNS over_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN frame_NN ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN effect_NN The_DT infrared_JJ radiative_JJ effect_NN of_IN all_DT infrared-absorbing_NN 
constituents_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, clouds_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( to_TO a_DT 
small_JJ extent_NN )_) aerosols_NNS absorb_VVP terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP 
surface_NN and_CC elsewhere_RB in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT These_DT substances_NNS emit_VVP infrared_JJ 
radiation_NN in_IN all_DT directions_NNS ,_, but_RB ,_, everything_NN else_RB being_VBG equal_JJ ,_, the_DT net_NN 
amount_NN emitted_VVD to_TO space_NN is_VBZ normally_RB less_RBR than_IN would_MD have_VH been_VBN emitted_VVN 
in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN these_DT absorbers_NNS because_IN of_IN the_DT decline_NN of_IN temperature_NN 
with_IN altitude_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN and_CC the_DT consequent_JJ weakening_NN of_IN emission_NN ._SENT 
An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS increases_VVZ the_DT 
magnitude_NN of_IN this_DT effect_NN ;_: the_DT difference_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB called_VVN the_DT enhanced_JJ 
greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT The_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentration_NN because_RB 
of_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS contributes_VVZ to_TO an_DT instantaneous_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT 
Surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC troposphere_NN warm_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO this_DT forcing_VVG ,_, 
gradually_RB restoring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ balance_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) Greenhouse_NP gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS 
of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, both_CC natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP 
and_CC emit_VV radiation_NN at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN terrestrial_NN 
radiation_NN emitted_VVD by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP ,_, and_CC by_IN 
clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, 
carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) 
are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, 
there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC brominecontaining_NN 
substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Beside_IN CO2_NP ,_, 
N2O_NP and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_NNS sulphur_NN 
hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT For_IN a_DT list_NN of_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, see_VV Table_NN 2.A.1_JJ ._SENT 
Gross_NP Primary_NP Production_NP (_( GPP_NP )_) The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN fixed_VVN by_IN the_DT 
autotrophs_NNS (_( e.g._FW plants_NNS and_CC algaes_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Grounding_VVG line_NN The_DT junction_NN between_IN a_DT glacier_NN or_CC ice_NN sheet_NN and_CC ice_NN 
shelf_NN ;_: the_DT place_NN where_WRB ice_NN starts_VVZ to_TO float_VV ._SENT This_DT junction_NN normally_RB occurs_VVZ over_RP 
a_DT finite_JJ zone_NN ,_, rather_RB than_IN at_IN a_DT line_NN ._SENT 
Gyre_NN Basin-scale_NP ocean_NN horizontal_JJ circulation_NN pattern_NN with_IN slow_JJ flow_NN 
circulating_VVG around_IN the_DT ocean_NN basin_NN ,_, closed_VVN by_IN a_DT strong_JJ and_CC narrow_JJ (_( 100_CD to_TO 
km_NN wide_JJ )_) boundary_NN current_JJ on_IN the_DT western_JJ side_NN ._SENT The_DT subtropical_JJ gyres_NNS 
in_IN each_DT ocean_NN are_VBP associated_VVN with_IN high_JJ pressure_NN in_IN the_DT centre_NN of_IN the_DT gyres_NNS ;_: 
the_DT subpolar_NN gyres_NNS are_VBP associated_VVN with_IN low_JJ pressure_NN ._SENT 
Hadley_NP Circulation_NP A_DT direct_JJ ,_, thermally_RB driven_VVN overturning_VVG cell_NN in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN consisting_VVG of_IN poleward_JJ flow_NN in_IN the_DT upper_JJ troposphere_NN ,_, subsiding_VVG

Inter-Tropical_NP Convergence_NP Zone_NP ._SENT 
Halocarbons_NNS A_DT collective_JJ term_NN for_IN the_DT group_NN of_IN partially_RB halogenated_VVN

also_RB involved_VVN in_IN the_DT depletion_NN of_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT

rapidly_RB with_IN depth_NN ._SENT Generally_RB saltier_JJR water_NN is_VBZ denser_JJR and_CC lies_VVZ below_RB less_JJR

than_IN the_DT deep_JJ waters_NNS and_CC the_DT halocline_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN maintaining_VVG

into_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT it_PP will_MD eventually_RB evaporate_VV again_RB ._SENT The_DT various_JJ

~_SYM 0.8_CD )_) than_IN the_DT average_JJ planetary_JJ albedo_NN (_( ~_SYM 0.3_CD )_) ._SENT With_IN increasing_VVG temperatures_NNS ,_,

in_IN some_DT cases_NNS into_IN the_DT sea_NN or_CC into_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS floating_VVG on_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT There_EX are_VBP 
only_RB two_CD ice_NN sheets_NNS in_IN the_DT modern_JJ world_NN ,_, one_CD on_IN Greenland_NP and_CC one_CD on_RB 
Antarctica_NP ._SENT During_IN glacial_JJ periods_NNS there_EX were_VBD others_NNS ._SENT

ocean_NN flows_NNS via_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS ._SENT

Interglacials_NNS or_CC interglaciations_NNS The_DT warm_JJ periods_NNS between_IN ice_NN age_NN

Isostatic_JJ or_CC Isostasy_NP Isostasy_NP refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT response_NN of_IN the_DT earth_NN to_TO

on_IN longer_JJR time_NN scales_NNS ,_, as_RB in_IN the_DT response_NN to_TO the_DT last_JJ deglaciation_NN following_NN 
the_DT Last_JJ Glacial_NP Maximum_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Glacial_NP Isostatic_NP Adjustment_NP (_( GIA_NN )_) ._SENT 
Isotopes_NNS Atoms_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ chemical_NN element_NN that_WDT have_VHP the_DT same_JJ the_DT 
number_NN of_IN protons_NNS but_CC differ_VVP in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN neutrons_NNS ._SENT Some_DT proton_NN –_NN

have_VHP more_JJR than_IN one_CD stable_JJ isotope_NN ._SENT Isotopes_NNS can_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO trace_VV transport_NN 
processes_NNS or_CC to_TO study_VV processes_NNS that_WDT change_VVP the_DT isotopic_JJ ratio_NN ._SENT Radioisotopes_NNS 
provide_VV in_IN addition_NN time_NN information_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB used_VVN for_IN radiometric_JJ 
dating_VVG ._SENT 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP 
Convention_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN 1997_CD in_IN Kyoto_NP ,_, 
Japan_NP ,_, at_IN the_DT Third_NP Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) to_TO the_DT 
UNFCCC_NP ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO those_DT 
included_VVN in_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT Countries_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Protocol_NP 
(_( most_JJS Organisation_NP for_IN Economic_NP Cooperation_NP and_CC Development_NP countries_NNS 
and_CC countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, methane_NN ,_, nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, perfluorocarbons_NNS ,_, and_CC sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN )_) by_IN 
at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT commitment_NN period_NN 2008_CD –_NN 2012._CD The_DT 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP entered_VVD into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005._CD

)_) ._SENT

decreases_NNS with_IN height_NN ._SENT 
Last_JJ Glacial_NP Maximum_NP (_( LGM_NP )_) The_DT period_NN during_IN the_DT last_JJ ice_NN age_NN when_WRB

ka_NP ago_RB ._SENT This_DT period_NN has_VHZ been_VBN widely_RB studied_VVN because_IN the_DT radiative_JJ forcings_NNS 
and_CC boundary_NN conditions_NNS are_VBP relatively_RB well_RB known_VVN ._SENT

Latent_JJ heat_NN flux_NN The_DT turbulent_JJ flux_NN of_IN heat_NN from_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN 
to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN that_WDT is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN evaporation_NN or_CC condensation_NN of_IN

Lifetime_NN Lifetime_NN is_VBZ a_DT general_JJ term_NN used_VVN for_IN various_JJ time_NN scales_NNS characterizing_VVG 
the_DT rate_NN of_IN processes_NNS affecting_VVG the_DT concentration_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT following_VVG lifetimes_NNS may_MD be_VB distinguished_VVN :_: 
Turnover_NN time_NN (_( T_NN )_) (_( also_RB called_VVN global_JJ atmospheric_JJ lifetime_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT 
ratio_NN of_IN the_DT mass_JJ M_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT gaseous_JJ compound_NN in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN )_) and_CC the_DT total_JJ rate_NN of_IN removal_NN S_NN from_IN the_DT reservoir_NN :_: T_NN =_SYM M_NP /_SYM S_NP ._SENT 
For_IN each_DT removal_NN process_NN ,_, separate_JJ turnover_NN times_NNS can_MD be_VB defined_VVN ._SENT In_RB 
soil_NN carbon_NN biology_NN ,_, this_DT is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Mean_NP Residence_NP Time_NP ._SENT 
Adjustment_NN time_NN or_CC response_NN time_NN (_( Ta_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT time_NN scale_NN characterizing_VVG 
the_DT decay_NN of_IN an_DT instantaneous_JJ pulse_NN input_NN into_IN the_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT The_DT 
term_NN adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN to_TO characterize_VV the_DT adjustment_NN of_IN 
the_DT mass_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN following_VVG a_DT step_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT source_NN strength_NN ._SENT 
Half-life_NN or_CC decay_NN constant_JJ is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO quantify_VV a_DT first-order_NN exponential_NN 
decay_NN process_NN ._SENT See_VV Response_NP time_NN for_IN a_DT different_JJ definition_NN pertinent_JJ to_TO 
climate_NN variations_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT term_NN lifetime_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB used_VVN ,_, for_IN simplicity_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT surrogate_NN for_IN 
adjustment_NN time_NN ._SENT 
In_IN simple_JJ cases_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT global_JJ removal_NN of_IN the_DT compound_NN is_VBZ directly_RB 
proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT total_JJ mass_NN of_IN the_DT reservoir_NN ,_, the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN 
equals_VVZ the_DT turnover_NN time_NN :_: T_NN =_SYM Ta_NP ._SENT An_DT example_NN is_VBZ CFC-11_NP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ 
removed_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN only_RB by_IN photochemical_JJ processes_NNS in_IN the_DT 
stratosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN more_JJR complicated_JJ cases_NNS ,_, where_WRB several_JJ reservoirs_NNS are_VBP 
involved_VVN or_CC where_WRB the_DT removal_NN is_VBZ not_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT total_JJ mass_NN ,_, 
the_DT equality_NN T_NN =_SYM Ta_NP no_RB longer_RBR holds_VVZ ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT extreme_NN 
example_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ turnover_NN time_NN is_VBZ only_RB about_RB 4_CD years_NNS because_IN of_IN the_DT rapid_JJ 
exchange_NN between_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC the_DT ocean_NN and_CC terrestrial_JJ biota_NN ._SENT 
However_RB ,_, a_DT large_JJ part_NN of_IN that_WDT CO2_NP is_VBZ returned_VVN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN within_IN 
a_DT few_JJ years_NNS ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN of_IN CO2_NP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN is_VBZ 
actually_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN removal_NN of_IN carbon_NN from_IN the_DT surface_NN 
layer_NN of_IN the_DT oceans_NNS into_IN its_PP$ deeper_JJR layers_NNS ._SENT Although_IN an_DT approximate_JJ 
value_NN of_IN 100_CD years_NNS may_MD be_VB given_VVN for_IN the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN of_IN CO2_NP in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT actual_JJ adjustment_NN is_VBZ faster_RBR initially_RB and_CC slower_JJR later_RBR 
on_RB ._SENT In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, the_DT adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN 
the_DT turnover_NN time_NN because_IN the_DT removal_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB through_IN a_DT chemical_NN 
reaction_NN with_IN the_DT hydroxyl_NN radical_NN (_( OH_NP )_) ,_, the_DT concentration_NN of_IN which_WDT 
itself_PP depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT CH4_NP concentration_NN ._SENT Therefore_RB ,_, the_DT CH4_NP removal_NN 
rate_NN S_NN is_VBZ not_RB proportional_JJ to_TO its_PP$ total_JJ mass_NN M_NN ._SENT 
Likelihood_NN The_DT chance_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ outcome_NN occurring_VVG ,_, where_WRB this_DT 
might_MD be_VB estimated_VVN probabilistically_RB ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ expressed_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN using_VVG a_DT 
standard_JJ terminology_NN ,_, defined_VVN in_IN Table_NP 1.1_CD ._SENT See_VV also_RB Confidence_NN and_CC Uncertainty_NN ._SENT 
Lithosphere_NN The_DT upper_JJ layer_NN of_IN the_DT solid_JJ Earth_NN ,_, both_DT continental_JJ and_NP 
oceanic_JJ ,_, which_WDT comprises_VVZ all_DT crustal_JJ rocks_NNS and_CC the_DT cold_NN ,_, mainly_RB elastic_JJ 
part_NN of_IN the_DT uppermost_JJ mantle_NN ._SENT Volcanic_JJ activity_NN ,_, although_IN part_NN of_IN the_DT lithosphere_NN ,_, 
is_VBZ not_RB considered_VVN as_IN part_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, but_CC acts_NNS as_IN an_DT 
external_JJ forcing_VVG factor_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Isostatic_JJ ._SENT 
Little_NP Ice_NP Age_NP (_( LIA_NP )_) An_DT interval_NN during_IN the_DT last_JJ millennium_NN characterized_VVD 
by_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN extensive_JJ expansions_NNS of_IN mountain_NN glaciers_NNS and_CC 
moderate_JJ retreats_NNS in_IN between_IN them_PP ,_, both_CC in_IN the_DT Northern_NP and_CC Southern_NP 
Hemispheres_NNS ._SENT The_DT timing_NN of_IN glacial_JJ advances_NNS differs_VVZ between_IN regions_NNS and_CC 
the_DT LIA_NN is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, not_RB clearly_RB defined_VVN in_IN time_NN ._SENT Most_JJS definitions_NNS lie_VVP in_IN the_DT 
period_NN 1400_CD CE_NP and_CC 1900_NP CE_NP ._SENT Currently_RB available_JJ reconstructions_NNS of_IN average_NN 
Northern_NP Hemisphere_NP temperature_NN indicate_VVP that_IN/that the_DT coolest_JJS periods_NNS at_IN 
the_DT hemispheric_JJ scale_NN may_MD have_VH occurred_VVN from_IN 1450_CD to_TO 1850_CD CE_NP ._SENT

Madden_NP –_NP Julian_NP Oscillation_NP (_( MJO_NP )_) The_DT largest_JJS single_JJ component_NN of_IN 
tropical_JJ atmospheric_JJ intraseasonal_JJ variability_NN (_( periods_NNS from_IN 30_CD to_TO 90_CD days_NNS )_) ._SENT 
The_DT MJO_NP propagates_VVZ eastwards_NNS at_IN around_RB 5_CD m_NN s_NNS –_JJ 1_CD in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT largescale_JJ 
coupling_NN between_IN atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN and_CC deep_JJ convection_NN ._SENT As_IN it_PP 
progresses_NNS ,_, it_PP is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN large_JJ regions_NNS of_IN both_DT enhanced_VVN and_CC suppressed_VVN 
rainfall_NN ,_, mainly_RB over_IN the_DT Indian_JJ and_CC western_JJ Pacific_JJ Oceans_NNS ._SENT Each_DT 
MJO_NP event_NN lasts_VVZ approximately_RB 30_CD to_TO 60_CD days_NNS ,_, hence_RB the_DT MJO_NP is_VBZ also_RB known_VVN 
as_IN the_DT 30-_CD to_TO 60-day_JJ wave_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT intraseasonal_JJ oscillation_NN ._SENT 
Marine-based_JJ ice_NN sheet_NN An_DT ice_NN sheet_NN containing_VVG a_DT substantial_JJ region_NN 
that_IN/that rests_VVZ on_IN a_DT bed_NN lying_VVG below_IN sea_NN level_NN and_CC whose_WP$ perimeter_NN is_VBZ in_IN contact_NN

Mass_JJ balance_NN /_SYM budget_NN (_( of_IN glaciers_NNS or_CC ice_NN sheets_NNS )_) The_DT balance_NN 
between_IN the_DT mass_JJ input_NN to_TO the_DT ice_NN body_NN (_( accumulation_NN )_) and_CC the_DT mass_JJ loss_NN 
(_( ablation_NN and_CC iceberg_NN calving_VVG )_) over_IN a_DT stated_JJ period_NN of_IN time_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ often_RB 
a_DT year_NN or_CC a_DT season_NN ._SENT Point_NN mass_NN balance_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT mass_JJ balance_NN at_IN a_DT 
particular_JJ location_NN on_IN the_DT glacier_NN or_CC ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT Surface_NN mass_NN balance_NN is_VBZ the_DT 
difference_NN between_IN surface_NN accumulation_NN and_CC surface_NN ablation_NN ._SENT The_DT input_NN 
and_CC output_NN terms_NNS for_IN mass_JJ balance_NN are_VBP :_: 
Accumulation_NP All_NP processes_NNS that_WDT add_VVP to_TO the_DT mass_NN of_IN a_DT glacier_NN ._SENT The_DT 
main_JJ contribution_NN to_TO accumulation_NN is_VBZ snowfall_NN ._SENT Accumulation_NP also_RB 
includes_VVZ deposition_NN of_IN hoar_NN ,_, freezing_NN rain_NN ,_, other_JJ types_NNS of_IN solid_JJ precipitation_NN ,_, 
gain_NN of_IN wind-blown_JJ snow_NN ,_, and_CC avalanching_VVG ._SENT 
Ablation_NN Surface_NP processes_VVZ that_RB reduce_VV the_DT mass_NN of_IN a_DT glacier_NN ._SENT The_DT 
main_JJ contributor_NN to_TO ablation_NN is_VBZ melting_VVG with_IN runoff_NN but_CC on_IN some_DT glaciers_NNS 
sublimation_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN wind-blown_JJ snow_NN and_CC avalanching_VVG are_VBP also_RB 
significant_JJ processes_NNS of_IN ablation_NN ._SENT 
Discharge_NN /_SYM outflow_NN Mass_NP loss_NN by_IN iceberg_NN calving_VVG or_CC ice_NN discharge_NN 
across_IN the_DT grounding_VVG line_NN of_IN a_DT floating_JJ ice_NN shelf_NN ._SENT Although_IN often_RB treated_VVN 
as_IN an_DT ablation_NN term_NN ,_, in_IN this_DT report_NN iceberg_NN calving_VVG and_CC discharge_NN is_VBZ considered_VVN 
separately_RB from_IN surface_NN ablation_NN ._SENT 
Mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN The_DT surface_NN level_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN at_IN a_DT particular_JJ point_NN 
averaged_VVN over_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN of_IN time_NN such_JJ as_IN a_DT month_NN or_CC year_NN ._SENT Mean_VV 
sea_NN level_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN as_IN a_DT national_JJ datum_NN to_TO which_WDT heights_NNS on_IN land_NN are_VBP 
referred_VVD ._SENT

Medieval_JJ Warm_NP Period_NP (_( MWP_NP )_) An_DT interval_NN of_IN relatively_RB warm_JJ conditions_NNS 
and_CC other_JJ notable_JJ climate_NN anomalies_NNS such_JJ as_IN more_RBR extensive_JJ 
drought_NN in_IN some_DT continental_JJ regions_NNS ._SENT The_DT timing_NN of_IN this_DT interval_NN is_VBZ not_RB 
clearly_RB defined_VVN ,_, with_IN different_JJ records_NNS showing_VVG onset_NN and_CC termination_NN of_IN 
the_DT warmth_NN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT showing_VVG intermittent_JJ warmth_NN ._SENT 
Most_JJS definitions_NNS lie_VVP within_IN the_DT period_NN 900_CD to_TO 1400_CD CE_NP ._SENT Currently_RB available_JJ 
reconstructions_NNS of_IN average_JJ Northern_NP Hemisphere_NP temperature_NN indicate_VVP that_DT

to_TO 1250_CD CE_NP ._SENT Currently_RB available_JJ records_NNS and_CC temperature_NN reconstructions_NNS 
indicate_VV that_IN/that average_JJ temperatures_NNS during_IN parts_NNS of_IN the_DT MWP_NP were_VBD indeed_RB

been_VBN as_RB ubiquitous_JJ across_IN seasons_NNS and_CC geographical_JJ regions_NNS as_IN the_DT 20th_JJ 
century_NN warming_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ also_RB called_VVN Medieval_NP Climate_NN Anomaly_NP ._SENT 
Meridional_JJ Overturning_NP Circulation_NP (_( MOC_NP )_) Meridional_NP (_( north_NN –_NN 
south_NN )_) overturning_VVG circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN quantified_VVN by_IN zonal_JJ (_( east_JJ –_NN west_NN )_)

away_RB from_IN the_DT subpolar_NN regions_NNS ,_, the_DT MOC_NP (_( which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN principle_NN an_DT observable_JJ 
quantity_NN )_) is_VBZ often_RB identified_VVN with_IN the_DT thermohaline_NN circulation_NN (_( THC_NP )_) ,_, 


which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT conceptual_JJ and_CC incomplete_JJ interpretation_NN ._SENT It_PP must_MD be_VB borne_VVN in_IN 
mind_VV that_IN/that the_DT MOC_NP is_VBZ also_RB driven_VVN by_IN wind_NN ,_, and_CC can_MD also_RB include_VV shallower_JJR 
overturning_VVG cells_NNS such_JJ as_IN occur_VVP in_IN the_DT upper_JJ ocean_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS and_CC subtropics_NNS ,_, 
in_IN which_WDT warm_JJ (_( light_JJ )_) waters_NNS moving_VVG poleward_NN are_VBP transformed_VVN to_TO 
slightly_RB denser_JJR waters_NNS and_CC subducted_VVD equatorward_RB at_IN deeper_JJR levels_NNS ._SENT

Metric_JJ A_DT consistent_JJ measurement_NN of_IN a_DT characteristic_NN of_IN an_DT object_NN or_CC 
activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ otherwise_RB difficult_JJ to_TO quantify_VV ._SENT Within_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN the_DT

Model_NN drift_NN Since_IN model_NN climate_NN differs_VVZ to_TO some_DT extent_NN from_IN observed_VVN

scales_NNS for_IN different_JJ variables_NNS ,_, can_MD obscure_VV the_DT initial-condition_NN forecast_NN 
information_NN and_CC is_VBZ usually_RB removed_VVN a_DT posteriori_RB by_IN an_DT empirical_JJ ,_, usually_RB 
linear_JJ ,_, adjustment_NN ._SENT

Model_NN initialization_NN A_DT climate_NN forecast_NN typically_RB proceeds_VVZ by_IN integrating_VVG 
a_DT climate_NN model_NN forward_RB in_IN time_NN from_IN an_DT initial_JJ state_NN that_WDT is_VBZ intended_VVN 
to_TO reflect_VV the_DT actual_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Available_JJ observations_NNS of_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN are_VBP ‘assimilated’_JJ into_IN the_DT model_NN ._SENT Initialization_NN is_VBZ a_DT complex_NN 
process_NN that_WDT is_VBZ limited_VVN by_IN available_JJ observations_NNS ,_, observational_JJ errors_NNS 
and_CC ,_, depending_VVG on_IN the_DT procedure_NN used_VVD ,_, may_MD be_VB affected_VVN by_IN uncertainty_NN in_IN 
the_DT history_NN of_IN climate_NN forcing_VVG ._SENT The_DT initial_JJ conditions_NNS will_MD contain_VV errors_NNS that_RB 
grow_VV as_IN the_DT forecast_NN progresses_VVZ ,_, thereby_RB limiting_VVG the_DT time_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT 
forecast_NN will_MD be_VB useful_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN prediction_NN ._SENT

Phase_NN 5_CD (_( CMIP5_NP )_) ._SENT Does_VVZ not_RB necessarily_RB provide_VV an_DT exhaustive_JJ and_CC formal_JJ

of_IN the_DT uncertainty_NN in_IN feedbacks_NNS ,_, forcing_VVG or_CC projections_NNS even_RB when_WRB

using_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ framework_NN ._SENT 
Mode_NN of_IN climate_NN variability_NN Underlying_JJ space_NN –_NN time_NN structure_NN with_IN

Mole_NP fraction_NN Mole_NP fraction_NN ,_, or_CC mixing_VVG ratio_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN 
of_IN moles_NNS of_IN a_DT constituent_NN in_IN a_DT given_VVN volume_NN to_TO the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN moles_NNS 
of_IN all_DT constituents_NNS in_IN that_DT volume_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ usually_RB reported_VVN for_IN dry_JJ air_NN ._SENT Typical_JJ 
values_NNS for_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP in_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN μmol_NN mol_NN –_NP 1_CD 
(_( parts_NNS per_IN million_CD :_: ppm_NN )_) ,_, nmol_NN mol_NN –_NN 1_CD (_( parts_NNS per_IN billion_CD :_: ppb_NN )_) ,_, and_CC fmol_NN mol_NN –_NP 1_CD 
(_( parts_NNS per_IN trillion_CD :_: ppt_NNS )_) ._SENT Mole_NN fraction_NN differs_VVZ from_IN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN ,_, 
often_RB expressed_VVN in_IN ppmv_NP etc._FW ,_, by_IN the_DT corrections_NNS for_IN non-ideality_NN of_IN gases_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT correction_NN is_VBZ significant_JJ relative_NN to_TO measurement_NN precision_NN for_IN many_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( Schwartz_NP and_CC Warneck_NP ,_, 1995_CD )_) ._SENT 
Monsoon_NN A_DT monsoon_NN is_VBZ a_DT tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ seasonal_JJ reversal_NN in_IN 
both_CC the_DT surface_NN winds_NNS and_CC associated_VVN precipitation_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN differential_NN 
heating_VVG between_IN a_DT continental-scale_JJ land_NN mass_NN and_CC the_DT adjacent_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT 
Monsoon_NN rains_NNS occur_VVP mainly_RB over_IN land_NN in_IN summer_NN ._SENT 
Montreal_NP Protocol_NP The_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP on_IN Substances_NP that_IN/that Deplete_NP 
the_DT Ozone_NN Layer_NP was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN Montreal_NP in_IN 1987_CD ,_, and_CC subsequently_RB 
adjusted_VVN and_CC amended_VVN in_IN London_NP (_( 1990_CD )_) ,_, Copenhagen_NP (_( 1992_CD )_) ,_, Vienna_NP 
(_( 1995_CD )_) ,_, Montreal_NP (_( 1997_CD )_) and_CC Beijing_NP (_( 1999_CD )_) ._SENT It_PP controls_VVZ the_DT consumption_NN 
and_CC production_NN of_IN chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN chemicals_NNS that_RB 
destroy_VV stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN chlorofluorocarbons_NNS ,_, methyl_NN chloroform_NN ,_, 
carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN and_CC many_JJ others_NNS ._SENT 
Near-surface_NN permafrost_NN A_DT term_NN frequently_RB used_VVN in_IN climate_NN model_NN 
applications_NNS to_TO refer_VV to_TO permafrost_NN at_IN depths_NNS close_JJ to_TO the_DT ground_NN surface_NN 
(_( typically_RB down_RB to_TO 3.5_CD m_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN modelling_VVG studies_NNS ,_, near-surface_NN permafrost_NN 
is_VBZ usually_RB diagnosed_VVN from_IN 20_CD or_CC 30_CD year_NN climate_NN averages_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ different_JJ 
from_IN the_DT conventional_JJ definition_NN of_IN permafrost_NN ._SENT Disappearance_NN of_IN 
near-surface_NN permafrost_NN in_IN a_DT location_NN does_VVZ not_RB preclude_VV the_DT longer-term_JJ 
persistence_NN of_IN permafrost_NN at_IN greater_JJR depth_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Active_JJ layer_NN ,_, Frozen_NP 
ground_NN and_CC Thermokarst_NP ._SENT 
Near-term_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( NTCF_NP )_) Near-term_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( NTCF_NP )_) 
refer_VV to_TO those_DT compounds_NNS whose_WP$ impact_NN on_IN climate_NN occurs_VVZ primarily_RB within_IN 
the_DT first_JJ decade_NN after_IN their_PP$ emission_NN ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS is_VBZ primarily_RB 
composed_VVN of_IN those_DT with_IN short_JJ lifetimes_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN compared_VVN to_TO 
well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, and_CC has_VHZ been_VBN sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB 
short_RB lived_VVN climate_NN forcers_NNS or_CC short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutants_NNS ._SENT However_RB ,_, the_DT 
common_JJ property_NN that_WDT is_VBZ of_IN greatest_JJS interest_NN to_TO a_DT climate_NN assessment_NN is_VBZ 
the_DT timescale_NN over_IN which_WDT their_PP$ impact_NN on_IN climate_NN is_VBZ felt_VVN ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS 
includes_VVZ methane_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ also_RB a_DT well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, as_RB 
well_RB as_IN ozone_NN and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, or_CC their_PP$ precursors_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT halogenated_VVD 
species_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT These_DT compounds_NNS do_VVP 
not_RB accumulate_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN decadal_JJ to_TO centennial_NN timescales_NNS ,_, 
and_CC so_IN their_PP$ effect_NN on_IN climate_NN is_VBZ predominantly_RB in_IN the_DT near_JJ term_NN following_NN 
their_PP$ emission_NN ._SENT 
Nitrogen_NN deposition_NN Nitrogen_NP deposition_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT nitrogen_NN 
transferred_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN by_IN the_DT processes_NNS of_IN 
wet_JJ deposition_NN and_CC dry_JJ deposition_NN ._SENT 
Nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) One_CD of_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB mitigated_VVN 
under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT The_DT main_JJ anthropogenic_JJ source_NN of_IN nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN is_VBZ agriculture_NN (_( soil_NN and_CC animal_JJ manure_NN management_NN )_) ,_, but_CC important_JJ 
contributions_NNS 
also_RB come_VVN from_IN sewage_NN treatment_NN ,_, combustion_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN ,_, 
and_CC chemical_JJ industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Nitrous_JJ oxide_NN is_VBZ also_RB produced_VVN naturally_RB 
from_IN a_DT wide_JJ variety_NN of_IN biological_JJ sources_NNS in_IN soil_NN and_CC water_NN ,_, particularly_RB 
microbial_JJ action_NN in_IN wet_JJ tropical_JJ forests_NNS ._SENT

Northern_NP Annular_NP Mode_NP (_( NAM_NP )_) A_DT winter_NN fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT amplitude_NN

Tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN acts_NNS as_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN

Ozone_NN layer_NN The_DT stratosphere_NN contains_VVZ a_DT layer_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT concentration_NN

conditions_NNS of_IN that_DT region_NN ._SENT This_DT phenomenon_NN is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT Ozone_NN

pH_NN pH_NN is_VBZ a_DT dimensionless_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN water_NN (_( or_CC any_DT solution_NN )_)

a_DT logarithmic_JJ scale_NN where_WRB pH_NN =_SYM –_JJ log10_NN (_( H+_NP )_) ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, a_DT pH_NN decrease_NN of_IN 1_CD unit_NN

Predictability_NN The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT future_JJ states_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN may_MD be_VB

Because_IN knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN system’s_NNS past_JJ and_CC current_JJ states_NNS is_VBZ generally_RB 
imperfect_JJ ,_, as_RB are_VBP the_DT models_NNS that_WDT utilize_VVP this_DT knowledge_NN to_TO produce_VV a_DT 
climate_NN prediction_NN ,_, and_CC because_IN the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ inherently_RB nonlinear_JJ 
and_CC chaotic_JJ ,_, predictability_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ inherently_RB limited_VVN ._SENT Even_RB 
with_IN arbitrarily_RB accurate_JJ models_NNS and_CC observations_NNS ,_, there_EX may_MD still_RB be_VB limits_NNS 
to_TO the_DT predictability_NN of_IN such_PDT a_DT nonlinear_JJ system_NN (_( AMS_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT

Probability_NN Density_NP Function_NP (_( PDF_NP )_) A_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN 
is_VBZ a_DT function_NN that_WDT indicates_VVZ the_DT relative_JJ chances_NNS of_IN occurrence_NN of_IN different_JJ 
outcomes_NNS of_IN a_DT variable_NN ._SENT The_DT function_NN integrates_VVZ to_TO unity_NN over_IN the_DT domain_NN 
for_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN and_CC has_VHZ the_DT property_NN that_IN/that the_DT integral_NN over_IN a_DT subdomain_NN 
equals_VVZ the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that the_DT outcome_NN of_IN the_DT variable_NN lies_VVZ within_IN 
that_DT sub-domain_JJ ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that a_DT temperature_NN anomaly_NN 
defined_VVN in_IN a_DT particular_JJ way_NN is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN zero_CD is_VBZ obtained_VVN from_IN its_PP$ PDF_NN 
by_IN integrating_VVG the_DT PDF_NN over_IN all_DT possible_JJ temperature_NN anomalies_NNS greater_JJR 
than_IN zero_CD ._SENT Probability_NN density_NN functions_NNS that_WDT describe_VVP two_CD or_CC more_JJR variables_NNS 
simultaneously_RB are_VBP similarly_RB defined_VVN ._SENT 
Process-based_JJ Model_NP Theoretical_NP concepts_NNS and_CC computational_JJ methods_NNS 
that_WDT represent_VVP and_CC simulate_VVP the_DT behaviour_NN of_IN real-world_NN systems_NNS

not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN prediction_NN and_CC Climate_NN projection_NN ._SENT

Quasi-Biennal_NP Oscillation_NP (_( QBO_NP )_) A_DT near-periodic_JJ oscillation_NN of_IN the_DT

and_CC are_VBP driven_VVN by_IN wave_NN energy_NN that_WDT propagates_VVZ up_RP from_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ._SENT

the_DT present_NN ,_, and_CC includes_VVZ the_DT Pleistocene_JJ and_CC Holocene_JJ epochs_NNS ._SENT 
Radiative_JJ effect_NN The_DT impact_NN on_IN a_DT radiation_NN flux_NN or_CC heating_NN rate_NN (_( most_JJS 
commonly_RB ,_, on_IN the_DT downward_JJ flux_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN atmosphere_NN )_) caused_VVN by_IN 
the_DT interaction_NN of_IN a_DT particular_JJ constituent_NN with_IN either_CC the_DT infrared_JJ or_CC solar_JJ 
radiation_NN fields_NNS through_IN absorption_NN ,_, scattering_NN and_CC emission_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO 
an_DT otherwise_RB identical_JJ atmosphere_NN free_JJ of_IN that_DT constituent_NN ._SENT This_DT quantifies_VVZ 
the_DT impact_NN of_IN the_DT constituent_NN on_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Examples_NNS include_VVP 
the_DT aerosol_NN –_NN radiation_NN interactions_NNS ,_, cloud_VVP radiative_JJ effect_NN ,_, and_CC greenhouse_NN 
effect_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT portion_NN of_IN any_DT top-of-atmosphere_NN radiative_JJ effect_NN 
that_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO anthropogenic_JJ or_CC other_JJ external_JJ influences_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, volcanic_JJ 
eruptions_NNS or_CC changes_NNS in_IN the_DT sun_NN )_) is_VBZ termed_VVN the_DT instantaneous_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT 
Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG Radiative_NN forcing_VVG is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_NN ,_, downward_RB 
minus_CC upward_RB ,_, radiative_JJ flux_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN 
or_CC top_JJ of_IN atmosphere_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN an_DT external_JJ driver_NN of_IN climate_NN 
change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT Sometimes_RB internal_JJ drivers_NNS are_VBP still_RB treated_VVN as_RB 
forcings_NNS even_RB though_IN they_PP result_VVP from_IN the_DT alteration_NN in_IN climate_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN 
aerosol_NN or_CC greenhouse_NN gas_NN changes_NNS in_IN paleoclimates_NNS ._SENT The_DT traditional_JJ radiative_JJ 
forcing_VVG is_VBZ computed_VVN with_IN all_DT tropospheric_JJ properties_NNS held_VVD fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ 
unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ,_, and_CC after_IN allowing_VVG for_IN stratospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, if_IN 
perturbed_VVN ,_, to_TO readjust_VV to_TO radiative-dynamical_JJ equilibrium_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
is_VBZ called_VVN instantaneous_JJ if_IN no_DT change_NN in_IN stratospheric_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ 
accounted_VVN for_IN ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG once_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS are_VBP accounted_VVN 
for_IN is_VBZ termed_VVN the_DT effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT For_IN the_DT purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ further_RBR defined_VVN as_IN the_DT change_NN relative_JJ to_TO the_DT year_NN 1750_CD 
and_CC ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB noted_VVN ,_, refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT global_JJ and_CC annual_JJ average_JJ value_NN ._SENT 
Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB confused_VVN with_IN cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, which_WDT 
describes_VVZ an_DT unrelated_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT impact_NN of_IN clouds_NNS on_IN the_DT radiative_JJ 
flux_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Rapid_JJ adjustment_NN The_DT response_NN to_TO an_DT agent_NN perturbing_VVG the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ driven_VVN directly_RB by_IN the_DT agent_NN ,_, independently_RB of_IN any_DT change_NN 
in_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN and_NP 
aerosols_NNS ,_, by_IN altering_VVG internal_JJ heating_NN and_CC cooling_VVG rates_NNS within_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
can_MD each_DT cause_NN changes_VVZ to_TO cloud_VV cover_NN and_CC other_JJ variables_NNS thereby_RB 
producing_VVG a_DT radiative_JJ effect_NN even_RB in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN any_DT surface_NN warming_NN or_CC 
cooling_NN ._SENT Adjustments_NNS are_VBP rapid_JJ in_IN the_DT sense_NN that_IN/that they_PP begin_VVP to_TO occur_VV right_RB 
away_RB ,_, before_IN climate_NN feedbacks_NNS which_WDT are_VBP driven_VVN by_IN warming_NN (_( although_IN 
some_DT adjustments_NNS may_MD still_RB take_VV significant_JJ time_NN to_TO proceed_VV to_TO completion_NN ,_, 
for_IN example_NN those_DT involving_VVG vegetation_NN or_CC ice_NN sheets_NNS )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ also_RB called_VVN the_DT 
rapid_JJ response_NN or_CC fast_JJ adjustment_NN ._SENT For_IN further_JJR explanation_NN on_IN the_DT concept_NN ,_, 
see_VV Sections_NNS 7.1_CD and_CC 8.1_CD ._SENT 
Rapid_JJ climate-change_NN See_VV Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Rapid_JJ dynamical_JJ change_NN (_( of_IN glaciers_NNS or_CC ice_NN sheets_NNS )_) Changes_NP in_IN 
glacier_NN or_CC ice_NN sheet_NN mass_NN controlled_VVN by_IN changes_NNS in_IN flow_NN speed_NN and_CC discharge_NN 
rather_RB than_IN by_IN accumulation_NN or_CC ablation_NN ._SENT This_DT can_MD result_VV in_IN a_DT rate_NN 
of_IN mass_JJ change_NN larger_JJR than_IN that_DT due_JJ to_TO any_DT imbalance_NN between_IN accumulation_NN 
and_CC ablation_NN ._SENT Rapid_JJ dynamical_JJ change_NN may_MD be_VB initiated_VVN by_IN a_DT climatic_JJ 
trigger_VV ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN incursion_NN of_IN warm_JJ ocean_NN water_NN beneath_IN an_DT ice_NN shelf_NN ,_, or_CC 
thinning_VVG of_IN a_DT grounded_VVN tidewater_NN terminus_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD lead_VV to_TO reactions_NNS 
within_IN the_DT glacier_NN system_NN ,_, that_WDT may_MD result_VV in_IN rapid_JJ ice_NN loss_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Mass_NP 
balance_NN /_SYM budget_NN (_( of_IN glaciers_NNS or_CC ice_NN sheets_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Reanalysis_NN Reanalyses_NNS are_VBP estimates_NNS of_IN historical_JJ atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN 
and_CC wind_NN or_CC oceanographic_JJ temperature_NN and_CC current_JJ ,_, and_CC other_JJ 
quantities_NNS ,_, created_VVN by_IN processing_VVG past_JJ meteorological_JJ or_CC oceanographic_JJ 
data_NNS using_VVG fixed_VVN state-of-the-art_JJ weather_NN forecasting_NN or_CC ocean_NN circulation_NN 
models_NNS with_IN data_NN assimilation_NN techniques_NNS ._SENT Using_VVG fixed_VVN data_NNS assimilation_NN 
avoids_VVZ effects_NNS from_IN the_DT changing_VVG analysis_NN system_NN that_WDT occur_VVP in_IN operational_JJ 
analyses_NNS ._SENT Although_IN continuity_NN is_VBZ improved_VVN ,_, global_JJ reanalyses_NNS still_RB suffer_VVP 
from_IN changing_VVG coverage_NN and_CC biases_NNS in_IN the_DT observing_VVG systems_NNS ._SENT 


Rebound_NN effect_NN When_WRB CO2_NP is_VBZ removed_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT CO2_NP 
concentration_NN gradient_NN between_IN atmospheric_JJ and_CC land_NN /_SYM ocean_NN carbon_NN reservoirs_NNS 
is_VBZ reduced_VVN ._SENT This_DT leads_VVZ to_TO a_DT reduction_NN or_CC reversal_NN in_IN subsequent_JJ inherent_JJ 
rate_NN of_IN removal_NN of_IN CO2_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN natural_JJ carbon_NN cycle_NN 
processes_NNS on_IN land_NN and_CC ocean_NN ._SENT 
Reconstruction_NN (_( of_IN climate_NN variable_NN )_) Approach_NN to_TO reconstructing_VVG 
the_DT past_JJ temporal_JJ and_CC spatial_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN a_DT climate_NN variable_NN from_IN 
predictors_NNS ._SENT The_DT predictors_NNS can_MD be_VB instrumental_JJ data_NNS if_IN the_DT reconstruction_NN is_VBZ 
used_VVN to_TO infill_NN missing_VVG data_NNS or_CC proxy_JJ data_NNS if_IN it_PP is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO develop_VV paleoclimate_NN 
reconstructions_NNS ._SENT Various_JJ techniques_NNS have_VHP been_VBN developed_VVN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN :_: 
linear_JJ multivariate_JJ regression_NN based_VVN methods_NNS and_CC nonlinear_JJ Bayesian_NP and_NP 
analog_JJ methods_NNS ._SENT

Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) Scenarios_NP that_RB 
include_VV time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS of_IN the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC chemically_RB active_JJ gases_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN land_NN 
use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN representative_NN signifies_VVZ that_DT 
each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ possible_JJ scenarios_NNS that_WDT would_MD lead_VV to_TO 
the_DT specific_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN pathway_NN emphasizes_VVZ 
that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT long-term_JJ concentration_NN levels_NNS are_VBP of_IN interest_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB 
the_DT trajectory_NN taken_VVN over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV that_DT outcome_NN ._SENT (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT 
RCPs_NNS usually_RB refer_VVP to_TO the_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT concentration_NN pathway_NN extending_VVG 
up_RB to_TO 2100_CD ,_, for_IN which_WDT Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS produced_VVD 
corresponding_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT Extended_JJ Concentration_NP Pathways_NP 
(_( ECPs_NNS )_) describe_VVP extensions_NNS of_IN the_DT RCPs_NP from_IN 2100_CD to_TO 2500_CD that_WDT were_VBD 
calculated_JJ using_VVG simple_JJ rules_NNS generated_VVN by_IN stakeholder_NN consultations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC do_VVP not_RB represent_VV fully_RB consistent_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT 
Four_NP RCPs_NP produced_VVD from_IN Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS were_VBD selected_VVN 
from_IN the_DT published_VVN literature_NN and_CC are_VBP used_VVN in_IN the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP Assessment_NP 
as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN predictions_NNS and_CC projections_NNS presented_VVD 
in_IN Chapters_NP 11_CD to_TO 14_CD :_: 
RCP2.6_NP One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN approximately_RB 
W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD before_IN 2100_CD and_CC then_RB declines_NNS (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP 
assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) 
RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilization_NN pathways_NNS in_IN 
which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ stabilized_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN m_NN –_NN 2_CD and_CC 
.0_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD after_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS assuming_VVG constant_JJ concentrations_NNS 
after_IN 2150_CD )_) 
RCP8.5_NP One_NP high_JJ pathway_NN for_IN which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG reaches_NNS greater_JJR 
than_IN 8.5_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD by_IN 2100_CD and_CC continues_VVZ to_TO rise_VV for_IN some_DT amount_NN of_IN 
time_NN (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD 
and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) 
For_IN further_JJR description_NN of_IN future_JJ scenarios_NNS ,_, see_VVP Box_NP 1.1_CD ._SENT 
Reservoir_NN A_DT component_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, other_JJ than_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
which_WDT has_VHZ the_DT capacity_NN to_TO store_VV ,_, accumulate_VV or_CC release_VV a_DT substance_NN 
of_IN concern_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, carbon_NN ,_, a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN ._SENT Oceans_NNS ,_, 
soils_NNS and_CC forests_NNS are_VBP examples_NNS of_IN reservoirs_NNS of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT Pool_NN is_VBZ an_DT equivalent_NN 
term_NN (_( note_NN that_IN/that the_DT definition_NN of_IN pool_NN often_RB includes_VVZ the_DT atmosphere_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT 
absolute_JJ quantity_NN of_IN the_DT substance_NN of_IN concern_NN held_VVN within_IN a_DT reservoir_NN at_IN a_DT 
specified_JJ time_NN is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT stock_NN ._SENT 
Resolution_NN In_IN climate_NN models_NNS ,_, this_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT physical_JJ distance_NN 
(_( metres_NNS or_CC degrees_NNS )_) between_IN each_DT point_NN on_IN the_DT grid_NN used_VVN to_TO compute_VV the_DT

between_IN each_DT model_NN computation_NN of_IN the_DT equations_NNS ._SENT 
Respiration_NN The_DT process_NN whereby_WRB living_NN organisms_NNS convert_VVP organic_JJ 
matter_NN to_TO carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, releasing_VVG energy_NN and_CC consuming_NN molecular_NN 
oxygen_NN ._SENT 
Response_NN time_NN The_DT response_NN time_NN or_CC adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT time_NN 
needed_VVN for_IN the_DT climate-system_NN or_CC its_PP$ components_NNS to_TO re-equilibrate_NNS to_TO a_DT 
new_JJ state_NN ,_, following_VVG a_DT forcing_VVG resulting_VVG from_IN external_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ very_RB 
different_JJ for_IN various_JJ components_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT The_DT response_NN time_NN 
of_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ relatively_RB short_JJ ,_, from_IN days_NNS to_TO weeks_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT 
stratosphere_NN reaches_VVZ equilibrium_NN on_IN a_DT time_NN scale_NN of_IN typically_RB a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ._SENT 
Due_JJ to_TO their_PP$ large_JJ heat_NN capacity_NN ,_, the_DT oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT much_RB longer_JJR response_NN 
time_NN :_: typically_RB decades_NNS ,_, but_CC up_RB to_TO centuries_NNS or_CC millennia_NNS ._SENT The_DT response_NN 
time_NN of_IN the_DT strongly_RB coupled_VVN surface_NN –_NN troposphere_NN system_NN is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, 
slow_RB compared_VVN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, and_CC mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT 
oceans_NNS ._SENT The_DT biosphere_NN may_MD respond_VV quickly_RB (_( e.g._FW ,_, to_TO droughts_NNS )_) ,_, but_CC also_RB 
very_RB slowly_RB to_TO imposed_VVN changes_NNS ._SENT See_VV lifetime_NN for_IN a_DT different_JJ definition_NN of_IN 
response_NN time_NN pertinent_JJ to_TO the_DT rate_NN of_IN processes_NNS affecting_VVG the_DT concentration_NN 
of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ._SENT

a_DT defined_VVN size_NN or_CC intensity_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Return_NN value_NN ._SENT 
Return_NN value_NN The_DT highest_JJS (_( or_CC ,_, alternatively_RB ,_, lowest_JJS )_) value_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN 
variable_JJ ,_, on_IN average_NN occurring_VVG once_RB in_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, in_IN 10_CD 
years_NNS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Return_NN period_NN ._SENT

forces_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, rate_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN ,_, prices_NNS )_) and_CC relationships_NNS ._SENT 
Note_NN that_IN/that scenarios_NNS are_VBP neither_DT predictions_NNS nor_CC forecasts_NNS ,_, but_CC are_VBP useful_JJ to_TO 
provide_VV a_DT view_NN of_IN the_DT implications_NNS of_IN developments_NNS and_CC actions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, Emission_NN scenario_NN ,_, Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP
