Sea_NP ice_NN Ice_NP found_VVD at_IN the_DT sea_NN surface_NN that_WDT has_VHZ originated_VVN from_IN the_DT freezing_NN 
of_IN seawater_NN ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN may_MD be_VB discontinuous_JJ pieces_NNS (_( ice_NN floes_NNS )_) moved_VVN on_RP 
the_DT ocean_NN surface_NN by_IN wind_NN and_CC currents_NNS (_( pack_NN ice_NN )_) ,_, or_CC a_DT motionless_JJ sheet_NN 
attached_VVN to_TO the_DT coast_NN (_( land-fast_NN ice_NN )_) ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN concentration_NN is_VBZ the_DT fraction_NN 
of_IN the_DT ocean_NN covered_VVN by_IN ice_NN ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN less_JJR than_IN one_CD year_NN old_JJ is_VBZ called_VVN firstyear_NN 
ice_NN ._SENT Perennial_JJ ice_NN is_VBZ sea_NN ice_NN that_WDT survives_VVZ at_IN least_JJS one_CD summer_NN ._SENT It_PP may_MD 
be_VB subdivided_VVN into_IN second-year_NN ice_NN and_CC multi-year_NN ice_NN ,_, where_WRB multiyear_JJ ice_NN 
has_VHZ survived_VVN at_IN least_JJS two_CD summers_NNS ._SENT 


Sea_NP level_NN change_NN Sea_NP level_NN can_MD change_VV ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB due_JJ 
to_TO (_( 1_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN basins_NNS ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) a_DT change_NN in_IN ocean_NN 
volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 3_LS )_) 
changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN water_NN density_NN ._SENT 
Global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN resulting_VVG from_IN change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN is_VBZ called_VVN barystatic_JJ ._SENT The_DT amount_NN of_IN barystatic_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN due_JJ to_TO 
the_DT addition_NN or_CC removal_NN of_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN is_VBZ called_VVN its_PP$ sea_NN level_NN equivalent_NN 
(_( SLE_NP )_) ._SENT Sea_NP level_NN changes_NNS ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB ,_, resulting_VVG from_IN changes_NNS 
in_IN water_NN density_NN are_VBP called_VVN steric_JJ ._SENT Density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN temperature_NN 
changes_NNS only_RB are_VBP called_VVN thermosteric_JJ ,_, while_IN density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVD 
by_IN salinity_NN changes_NNS are_VBP called_VVN halosteric_JJ ._SENT Barystatic_JJ and_CC steric_JJ sea_NN level_NN 
changes_NNS do_VVP not_RB include_VV the_DT effect_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN ocean_NN basins_NNS 
induced_VVN by_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN mass_NN and_CC its_PP$ distribution_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Relative_JJ Sea_NP Level_NP and_CC Thermal_NP expansion_NN ._SENT 
Sea_NP level_NN equivalent_NN (_( SLE_NP )_) The_DT sea_NN level_NN equivalent_NN of_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN 
water_NN (_( ice_NN ,_, liquid_NN or_CC vapour_NN )_) is_VBZ that_DT mass_NN ,_, converted_VVN to_TO a_DT volume_NN using_VVG a_DT 
density_NN of_IN 1000_CD kg_NN m_NN –_NP 3_CD ,_, and_CC divided_VVN by_IN the_DT present-day_JJ ocean_NN surface_NN area_NN 
of_IN 3.625_CD ×_NP 1014_CD m2_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, 362.5_CD Gt_NP of_IN water_NN mass_NN added_VVD to_TO the_DT ocean_NN will_MD 
cause_VV 1_CD mm_NN of_IN global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN rise_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sea_NP level_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Seasonally_RB frozen_VVN ground_NN See_VV Frozen_NP ground_NN ._SENT 
Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) The_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT 
subsurface_JJ bulk_JJ temperature_NN in_IN the_DT top_JJ few_JJ metres_NNS of_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, measured_VVN 
by_IN ships_NNS ,_, buoys_NNS and_CC drifters_NNS ._SENT From_IN ships_NNS ,_, measurements_NNS of_IN water_NN samples_NNS in_IN 
buckets_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB switched_VVN in_IN the_DT 1940s_NNS to_TO samples_NNS from_IN engine_NN intake_NN 
water_NN ._SENT Satellite_NN measurements_NNS of_IN skin_NN temperature_NN (_( uppermost_JJ layer_NN ;_: a_DT 
fraction_NN of_IN a_DT millimetre_NN thick_JJ )_) in_IN the_DT infrared_NN or_CC the_DT top_JJ centimetre_NN or_CC so_RB in_IN 
the_DT microwave_NN are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ,_, but_CC must_MD be_VB adjusted_VVN to_TO be_VB compatible_JJ with_IN 
the_DT bulk_JJ temperature_NN ._SENT

models_NNS refer_VVP specifically_RB to_TO transfer_VV functions_NNS formulated_VVN to_TO project_VV future_NN 
global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN ,_, or_CC contributions_NNS to_TO it_PP ,_, from_IN future_NN global_JJ

of_IN climate_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Equilibrium_NN and_CC transient_JJ climate_NN experiment_NN ._SENT 
Snow_NN cover_NN extent_NN The_DT areal_JJ extent_NN of_IN snow_NN covered_VVN ground_NN ._SENT 
Snow_NN water_NN equivalent_NN (_( SWE_NP )_) The_DT depth_NN of_IN liquid_JJ water_NN that_WDT would_MD 
result_NN if_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN snow_NN melted_VVN completely_RB ._SENT

Soil_NN temperature_NN The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT soil_NN ._SENT This_DT can_MD be_VB measured_VVN or_CC 
modelled_VVN at_IN multiple_JJ levels_NNS within_IN the_DT depth_NN of_IN the_DT soil_NN ._SENT 
Solar_JJ activity_NN General_NP term_NN describing_VVG a_DT variety_NN of_IN magnetic_JJ phenomena_NNS 
on_IN the_DT Sun_NP such_JJ as_IN sunspots_NNS ,_, faculae_NNS (_( bright_JJ areas_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC flares_VVZ (_( emission_NN 
of_IN high-energy_NN particles_NNS )_) ._SENT It_PP varies_VVZ on_IN time_NN scales_NNS from_IN minutes_NNS to_TO millions_NNS 
of_IN years_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Solar_NP cycle_NN ._SENT 
Solar_NP (_( ‘11-year’_NN )_) cycle_NN A_DT quasi-regular_JJ modulation_NN of_IN solar_JJ activity_NN 
with_IN varying_VVG amplitude_NN and_CC a_DT period_NN of_IN between_IN 8_CD and_CC 14_CD years_NNS ._SENT 
Solar_JJ radiation_NN Electromagnetic_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Sun_NP with_IN a_DT 
spectrum_NN close_NN to_TO the_DT one_CD of_IN a_DT black_JJ body_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 5770_CD K_NN ._SENT

Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP (_( SRM_NP )_) Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP

(_( e.g._FW ,_, surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, regional_JJ impacts_NNS ,_, etc_FW )_) ._SENT Artificial_JJ

SRES_NP scenarios_NNS SRES_NP scenarios_NNS are_VBP emission_NN scenarios_NNS developed_VVN by_IN

Terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN Radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT

radiation_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ to_TO be_VB distinguished_VVN from_IN the_DT near-infrared_JJ radiation_NN 
that_DT is_VBZ part_NN of_IN the_DT solar_JJ spectrum_NN ._SENT Infrared_JJ radiation_NN ,_, in_IN general_NN ,_, has_VHZ a_DT 
distinctive_JJ range_NN of_IN wavelengths_NNS (_( spectrum_NN )_) longer_JJR than_IN the_DT wavelength_NN of_IN 
the_DT red_JJ light_NN in_IN the_DT visible_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN ._SENT The_DT spectrum_NN of_IN terrestrial_NN 
radiation_NN is_VBZ almost_RB entirely_RB distinct_JJ from_IN that_IN/that of_IN shortwave_NN or_CC solar_JJ radiation_NN 
because_IN of_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN temperature_NN between_IN the_DT Sun_NP and_CC the_DT 
Earth_NP –_JJ atmosphere_NN system_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Outgoing_JJ longwave_NN radiation_NN ._SENT

and_CC hence_RB an_DT increase_NN in_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sea_NP level_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Thermocline_NN The_DT layer_NN of_IN maximum_JJ vertical_JJ temperature_NN gradient_NN in_IN 
the_DT ocean_NN ,_, lying_VVG between_IN the_DT surface_NN ocean_NN and_CC the_DT abyssal_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT In_IN subtropical_JJ 
regions_NNS ,_, its_PP$ source_NN waters_NNS are_VBP typically_RB surface_NN waters_NNS at_IN higher_JJR 
latitudes_NNS that_WDT have_VHP subducted_VVN (_( see_VV Subduction_NP )_) and_CC moved_VVD equatorward_RB ._SENT 
At_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS ,_, it_PP is_VBZ sometimes_RB absent_JJ ,_, replaced_VVN by_IN a_DT halocline_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ 
a_DT layer_NN of_IN maximum_JJ vertical_JJ salinity_NN gradient_NN ._SENT 
Thermohaline_NN circulation_NN (_( THC_NP )_) Large-scale_NP circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN 
that_IN/that transforms_VVZ low-density_NN upper_JJ ocean_NN waters_NNS to_TO higher-density_NN intermediate_NN 
and_CC deep_JJ waters_NNS and_CC returns_VVZ those_DT waters_NNS back_RB to_TO the_DT upper_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT 
The_DT circulation_NN is_VBZ asymmetric_JJ ,_, with_IN conversion_NN to_TO dense_JJ waters_NNS in_IN restricted_VVN 
regions_NNS at_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS and_CC the_DT return_NN to_TO the_DT surface_NN involving_VVG slow_JJ 
upwelling_NN and_CC diffusive_JJ processes_NNS over_IN much_RB larger_JJR geographic_JJ regions_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT THC_NP is_VBZ driven_VVN by_IN high_JJ densities_NNS at_IN or_CC near_IN the_DT surface_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN cold_NN 
temperatures_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC high_JJ salinities_NNS ,_, but_CC despite_IN its_PP$ suggestive_JJ though_RB 
common_JJ name_NN ,_, is_VBZ also_RB driven_VVN by_IN mechanical_JJ forces_NNS such_JJ as_IN wind_NN and_CC tides_NNS ._SENT 
Frequently_RB ,_, the_DT name_NN THC_NP has_VHZ been_VBN used_VVN synonymously_RB with_IN Meridional_NP 
Overturning_VVG Circulation_NN ._SENT

Total_JJ solar_JJ irradiance_NN (_( TSI_NP )_) The_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN in_IN

surface_NN 
normal_JJ to_TO the_DT incident_NN radiation_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP mean_NN distance_NN 
from_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT 
Reliable_JJ measurements_NNS of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN can_MD only_RB be_VB made_VVN from_IN space_NN 
and_CC the_DT precise_JJ record_NN extends_VVZ back_RB only_RB to_TO 1978._CD The_DT generally_RB accepted_VVN 
value_NN is_VBZ 1368_CD W_NN m−2_NN with_IN an_DT accuracy_NN of_IN about_RB 0.2_CD %_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ recently_RB 
been_VBN estimated_VVN to_TO 1360.8_CD ±_SYM 0.5_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD for_IN the_DT solar_JJ minimum_NN of_IN 2008._CD 
Variations_NNS of_IN a_DT few_JJ tenths_NNS of_IN a_DT percent_NN are_VBP common_JJ ,_, usually_RB associated_VVN 
with_IN the_DT passage_NN of_IN sunspots_NNS across_IN the_DT solar_JJ disk_NN ._SENT The_DT solar_JJ cycle_NN 
variation_NN of_IN TSI_NP is_VBZ of_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN 0.1_CD %_NN (_( AMS_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT Changes_NNS in_IN the_DT 
ultraviolet_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN during_IN a_DT solar_JJ cycle_NN are_VBP comparatively_RB 
larger_JJR (_( percent_NN )_) than_IN in_IN TSI_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Insolation_NN ._SENT

Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN to_TO cumulative_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS (_( TCRE_NP )_)

Tropopause_NN The_DT boundary_NN between_IN the_DT troposphere_NN and_CC the_DT stratosphere_NN ._SENT

Uncertainty_NN A_DT state_NN of_IN incomplete_JJ knowledge_NN that_WDT can_MD result_VV from_IN a_DT

knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD have_VH many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, from_IN imprecision_NN in_IN the_DT data_NNS 
to_TO ambiguously_RB defined_VVN concepts_NNS or_CC terminology_NN ,_, or_CC uncertain_JJ projections_NNS 
of_IN human_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD therefore_RB be_VB represented_VVN by_IN quantitative_JJ 
measures_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN )_) or_CC by_IN qualitative_JJ statements_NNS 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, reflecting_VVG the_DT judgment_NN of_IN a_DT team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) (_( see_VV Moss_NP and_NP 
Schneider_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: Manning_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2004_CD ;_: Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Confidence_NP and_CC Likelihood_NP ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP York_NP 
and_CC signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 150_CD 
countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT ‘stabilisation_NN 
of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN 
that_DT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system’_NN ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Convention_NP ,_, 
Parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_NP (_( all_DT OECD_NP countries_NNS and_CC countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS 
in_IN transition_NN )_) aim_VVP to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN 
by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT convention_NN 
entered_VVN in_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD In_IN 1997_CD ,_, the_DT UNFCCC_NP adopted_VVD the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Uptake_NN The_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN of_IN concern_NN to_TO a_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT The_DT 
uptake_NN of_IN carbon_NN containing_VVG substances_NNS ,_, in_IN particular_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, is_VBZ 
often_RB called_VVD (_( carbon_NN )_) sequestration_NN ._SENT 
Urban_JJ heat_NN island_NN (_( UHI_NP )_) The_DT relative_JJ warmth_NN of_IN a_DT city_NN compared_VVN with_IN 
surrounding_VVG rural_JJ areas_NNS ,_, associated_VVN with_IN changes_NNS in_IN runoff_NN ,_, effects_NNS on_IN heat_NN 
retention_NN ,_, and_CC changes_NNS in_IN surface_NN albedo_NN ._SENT 
Ventilation_NN The_DT exchange_NN of_IN ocean_NN properties_NNS with_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
surface_NN layer_NN such_JJ that_IN/that property_NN concentrations_NNS are_VBP brought_VVN closer_RBR to_TO equilibrium_NN 
values_NNS with_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN (_( AMS_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ,_, and_CC the_DT processes_VVZ that_DT 
propagate_VV these_DT properties_NNS into_IN the_DT ocean_NN interior_NN ._SENT 
Volatile_JJ Organic_NP Compounds_NP (_( VOC_NP )_) Important_JJ class_NN of_IN organic_JJ 
chemical_JJ air_NN pollutants_NNS that_WDT are_VBP volatile_JJ at_IN ambient_JJ air_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT Other_JJ 
terms_NNS used_VVD to_TO represent_VV VOCs_NNS are_VBP hydrocarbons_NNS (_( HCs_NP )_) ,_, reactive_JJ organic_JJ 
gases_NNS (_( ROGs_NP )_) and_CC non-methane_NN volatile_JJ organic_JJ compounds_NNS (_( NMVOCs_NP )_) ._SENT 
NMVOCs_NNS are_VBP major_JJ contributors_NNS (_( together_RB with_IN NOx_NP and_CC CO_NP )_) to_TO the_DT formation_NN 
of_IN photochemical_JJ oxidants_NNS such_JJ as_IN ozone_NN ._SENT 
Walker_NP Circulation_NP Direct_NP thermally_RB driven_VVN zonal_JJ overturning_VVG circulation_NN 
in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN over_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP ,_, with_IN rising_VVG air_NN in_IN the_DT 
western_JJ and_CC sinking_VVG air_NN in_IN the_DT eastern_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT 
Warm_JJ days_NNS /_SYM warm_JJ nights_NNS Days_NNS where_WRB maximum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, or_CC 
nights_RB where_WRB minimum_JJ temperature_NN ,_, exceeds_VVZ the_DT 90th_NN percentile_NN ,_, where_WRB 
the_DT respective_JJ temperature_NN distributions_NNS are_VBP generally_RB defined_VVN with_IN respect_NN

.4_LS ._SENT

horizontal_JJ extremum_NN of_IN a_DT property_NN such_JJ as_IN salinity_NN ._SENT North_NP Pacific_NP Intermediate_NP

of_IN water_NN masses_NNS ._SENT

Glossary_NN

main_JJ entry_NN can_MD contain_VV subentries_NNS ,_, in_IN bold_JJ and_CC italic_JJ ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_,

words_NNS indicate_VVP that_IN/that the_DT term_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN in_IN the_DT Glossary_NP ._SENT The_DT 
glossary_NN is_VBZ followed_VVN by_IN a_DT list_NN of_IN acronyms_NNS and_CC chemical_NN symbols_NNS ._SENT

Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN :_: A_DT large-scale_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN 
that_IN/that takes_VVZ place_NN over_IN a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS or_CC less_JJR ,_, persists_VVZ (_( or_CC is_VBZ anticipated_VVN

and_CC its_PP$ effects.1_NN 
Adaptation_NN Fund_NN :_: A_DT Fund_NN established_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP in_IN 
and_CC officially_RB launched_VVN in_IN 2007._CD The_DT Fund_NN finances_NNS adaptation_NN

the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Financing_NN comes_VVZ mainly_RB from_IN sales_NNS of_IN Certified_NP

other_JJ organisms_NNS to_TO adjust_VV to_TO potential_JJ damage_NN ,_, to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN 
opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO respond_VV to_TO consequences.2_NN 
Additionality_NN :_: Mitigation_NN projects_NNS (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Mechanisms_NNS )_) ,_, 
mitigation_NN policies_NNS ,_, or_CC climate_NN finance_NN are_VBP additional_JJ if_IN they_PP go_VVP 
beyond_IN a_DT business-as-usual_JJ level_NN ,_, or_CC baseline_NN ._SENT Additionality_NN is_VBZ required_VVN 
to_TO guarantee_VV the_DT environmental_JJ integrity_NN of_IN project-based_JJ offset_VVN mechanisms_NNS ,_, 
but_CC difficult_JJ to_TO establish_VV in_IN practice_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT counterfactual_JJ 
nature_NN of_IN the_DT baseline_NN ._SENT 
Reflecting_VVG progress_NN in_IN science_NN ,_, this_DT glossary_NN entry_NN differs_VVZ in_IN breadth_NN and_CC focus_VV from_IN 
the_DT entry_NN used_VVN in_IN the_DT Fourth_JJ Assessment_NP Report_NP and_CC other_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN previous_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS and_CC the_DT 
Millennium_NN Ecosystem_NP Assessment_NP (_( MEA_NP ,_, 2005_CD )_) ._SENT 
Adverse_JJ side-effects_NNS :_: The_DT negative_JJ effects_NNS that_IN/that a_DT policy_NN or_CC measure_NN

Aerosol_NN :_: A_DT suspension_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT 
typical_JJ size_NN between_IN a_DT few_JJ nanometres_NNS and_CC 10_CD μm_NN that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT For_IN convenience_NN the_DT term_NN aerosol_NN ,_, 
which_WDT includes_VVZ both_CC the_DT particles_NNS and_CC the_DT suspending_VVG gas_NN ,_, is_VBZ often_RB 
used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN in_IN its_PP$ plural_JJ form_NN to_TO mean_VV aerosol_NN particles_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS 
may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV 
climate_NN in_IN several_JJ ways_NNS :_: directly_RB through_IN scattering_VVG and_CC absorbing_VVG 
radiation_NN ,_, and_CC indirectly_RB by_IN acting_VVG as_IN cloud_NN condensation_NN nuclei_NNS or_CC ice_NN 
nuclei_NNS ,_, modifying_VVG the_DT optical_JJ properties_NNS and_CC lifetime_NN of_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ 
aerosols_NNS ,_, whether_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, originate_VV from_IN two_CD 
different_JJ pathways_NNS :_: emissions_NNS of_IN primary_JJ particulate_JJ matter_NN (_( PM_NP )_) ,_, and_NP 
formation_NN of_IN secondary_JJ PM_NP from_IN gaseous_JJ precursors_NNS ._SENT The_DT bulk_NN of_IN aerosols_NNS 
are_VBP of_IN natural_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Some_DT scientists_NNS use_VVP group_NN labels_NNS that_WDT refer_VVP 
to_TO the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN ,_, namely_RB :_: sea_NN salt_NN ,_, organic_JJ carbon_NN ,_, black_JJ 
carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) ,_, mineral_NN species_NNS (_( mainly_RB desert_NN dust_NN )_) ,_, sulphate_NN ,_, nitrate_NN ,_, and_NP 
ammonium_NN ._SENT These_DT labels_NNS are_VBP ,_, however_RB ,_, imperfect_JJ as_IN aerosols_NNS combine_VVP 
particles_NNS to_TO create_VV complex_JJ mixtures_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutants_NNS 
(_( SLCPs_NP )_) ._SENT

not_RB contained_VVN forests_NNS ._SENT Afforestation_NN projects_NNS are_VBP eligible_JJ under_IN a_DT number_NN

for_IN which_WDT particular_JJ criteria_NNS apply_VV (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, proof_NN must_MD be_VB given_VVN that_IN/that the_DT

uses_NNS before_IN 31_CD December_NP 1989_CD )_) ._SENT

Agriculture_NP ,_, Forestry_NP and_CC Other_NP Land_NP Use_NP (_( AFOLU_NP )_) :_: Agriculture_NP ,_, 
Forestry_NN and_CC Other_JJ Land_NP Use_NP plays_VVZ a_DT central_JJ role_NN for_IN food_NN security_NN and_NP 
sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT main_JJ mitigation_NN options_NNS within_IN 
AFOLU_NNS involve_VVP one_CD or_CC more_JJR of_IN three_CD strategies_NNS :_: prevention_NN of_IN emissions_NNS 
to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN conserving_VVG existing_JJ carbon_NN pools_NNS in_IN soils_NNS 
or_CC vegetation_NN or_CC by_IN reducing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC nitrous_JJ 


oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ;_: sequestration_NN —_NN increasing_VVG the_DT size_NN of_IN existing_VVG carbon_NN 
pools_NNS ,_, and_CC thereby_RB extracting_VVG carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ;_: 
and_CC substitution_NN —_NN substituting_VVG biological_JJ products_NNS for_IN fossil_NN 
fuels_NNS or_CC energy-intensive_JJ products_NNS ,_, thereby_RB reducing_VVG CO2_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT

often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Snow-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS have_VHP a_DT high_NN

albedo_NN varies_VVZ mainly_RB through_IN varying_VVG cloudiness_NN ,_, snow_NN ,_, ice_NN ,_, leaf_NN area_NN 
and_CC land_NN cover_NN changes_NNS ._SENT

Assigned_VVN Amount_NP (_( AA_NP )_) :_: Under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, the_DT AA_NP is_VBZ the_DT 
quantity_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS that_IN/that an_DT Annex_NP B_NP country_NN 
has_VHZ agreed_VVN to_TO as_IN its_PP$ cap_NN on_IN its_PP$ emissions_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ five-year_JJ commitment_NN 
period_NN (_( 2008_CD –_NN 2012_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT AA_NP is_VBZ the_DT country’s_NN total_JJ GHG_NP emissions_NNS 
in_IN 1990_CD multiplied_VVN by_IN five_CD (_( for_IN the_DT five-year_JJ commitment_NN period_NN )_) and_CC by_IN 
the_DT percentage_NN it_PP agreed_VVD to_TO as_RB listed_VVN in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
(_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, 92_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT EU_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Assigned_NP Amount_NP Unit_NP (_( AAU_NP )_) ._SENT 
Assigned_VVN Amount_NP Unit_NP (_( AAU_NP )_) :_: An_DT AAU_NP equals_VVZ 1_CD tonne_NN (_( metric_JJ ton_NN )_) of_IN 
CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS calculated_VVN using_VVG the_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ 
(_( GWP_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Assigned_NP Amount_NP (_( AA_NP )_) ._SENT 
Atmosphere_NN :_: The_DT gaseous_JJ envelope_NN surrounding_VVG the_DT earth_NN ,_, divided_VVN 
into_IN five_CD layers_NNS —_JJ the_DT troposphere_NN which_WDT contains_VVZ half_NN of_IN the_DT earth’s_NNS 
atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, the_DT mesosphere_NN ,_, the_DT thermosphere_NN ,_, 
and_CC the_DT exosphere_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT outer_JJ limit_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT 
dry_JJ atmosphere_NN consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN 
mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, together_RB 
with_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG 
ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN and_CC radiatively_JJ active_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) such_JJ 
as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) (_( 0.035_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC ozone_NN 
(_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ the_DT GHG_NP water_NN vapour_NN 
(_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, whose_WP$ amounts_NNS are_VBP highly_RB variable_JJ but_CC typically_RB around_IN 1_CD %_NN 
volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN also_RB contains_VVZ clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ._SENT 
Backstop_NN technology_NN :_: Models_NNS estimating_VVG mitigation_NN often_RB use_VV an_DT 
arbitrary_JJ carbon-free_JJ technology_NN (_( often_RB for_IN power_NN generation_NN )_) that_WDT 
might_MD become_VV available_JJ in_IN the_DT future_NN in_IN unlimited_JJ supply_NN over_IN the_DT horizon_NN 
of_IN the_DT model_NN ._SENT This_DT allows_VVZ modellers_NNS to_TO explore_VV the_DT consequences_NNS 
and_CC importance_NN of_IN a_DT generic_JJ solution_NN technology_NN without_IN becoming_VVG 
enmeshed_VVN in_IN picking_VVG the_DT actual_JJ technology_NN ._SENT This_DT ‘backstop’_JJ technology_NN 
might_MD be_VB a_DT nuclear_JJ technology_NN ,_, fossil_JJ technology_NN with_IN Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP 
Capture_NN and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) ,_, solar_JJ energy_NN ,_, or_CC something_NN as_IN yet_RB unimagined_VVN ._SENT 
The_DT backstop_NN technology_NN is_VBZ typically_RB assumed_VVN either_CC not_RB to_TO currently_RB 
exist_VV ,_, or_CC to_TO exist_VV only_RB at_IN higher_JJR costs_NNS relative_JJ to_TO conventional_JJ 
alternatives_NNS ._SENT 
Banking_NP (_( of_IN Assigned_NP Amount_NP Units_NP )_) :_: Any_DT transfer_NN of_IN Assigned_NP 
Amount_NN Units_NNS (_( AAUs_NP )_) from_IN an_DT existing_JJ period_NN into_IN a_DT future_JJ commitment_NN 
period_NN ._SENT According_VVG to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP [_SYM Article_NP 3_CD (_( 13_CD )_) ]_SYM ,_, Parties_NP 
included_VVN in_IN Annex_NP I_PP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN 
Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) may_MD save_VV excess_JJ AAUs_NNS from_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN 
period_NN for_IN compliance_NN with_IN their_PP$ respective_JJ cap_NN in_IN subsequent_JJ 
commitment_NN periods_NNS (_( post-2012_NN )_) ._SENT 


Baseline_NN /_SYM reference_NN :_: The_DT state_NN against_IN which_WDT change_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN transformation_NN pathways_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN ‘baseline_NN scenarios’_NN 
refers_VVZ to_TO scenarios_NNS that_WDT are_VBP based_VVN on_IN the_DT assumption_NN that_IN/that no_DT 
mitigation_NN policies_NNS or_CC measures_NNS will_MD be_VB implemented_VVN beyond_IN those_DT that_RB 
are_VBP already_RB in_IN force_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC are_VBP legislated_VVN or_CC planned_VVN to_TO be_VB adopted_VVN ._SENT 
Baseline_NN scenarios_NNS are_VBP not_RB intended_VVN to_TO be_VB predictions_NNS of_IN the_DT future_JJ ,_, 
but_CC rather_RB counterfactual_JJ constructions_NNS that_WDT can_MD serve_VV to_TO highlight_VV 
the_DT level_NN of_IN emissions_NNS that_WDT would_MD occur_VV without_IN further_JJR policy_NN effort_NN ._SENT 
Typically_RB ,_, baseline_JJ scenarios_NNS are_VBP then_RB compared_VVN to_TO mitigation_NN scenarios_NNS 
that_WDT are_VBP constructed_VVN to_TO meet_VV different_JJ goals_NNS for_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
(_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS ,_, atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS ,_, or_CC temperature_NN change_NN ._SENT 
The_DT term_NN ‘baseline_NN scenario’_NN is_VBZ used_VVN interchangeably_RB with_IN ‘reference_NN 
scenario’_NN and_CC ‘no_NN policy_NN scenario’_NN ._SENT In_IN much_JJ of_IN the_DT literature_NN the_DT term_NN 
is_VBZ also_RB synonymous_JJ with_IN the_DT term_NN ‘business-as-usual_NN (_( BAU_NP )_) scenario_NN ,_, ’_NN 
although_IN the_DT term_NN ‘BAU’_NN has_VHZ fallen_VVN out_RP of_IN favour_NN because_IN the_DT idea_NN of_IN 
‘business-as-usual’_NN in_IN century-long_JJ socioeconomic_JJ projections_NNS is_VBZ hard_JJ 
to_TO fathom_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, Emission_NN scenario_NN ,_, Representative_NP

cook_NN with_IN open_JJ wood_NN fires_NNS ,_, and_CC hundreds_NNS of_IN thousands_NNS smallindustries_NNS ._SENT

and_CC cleanly_RB using_VVG efficient_JJ cookstoves_NNS and_CC kilns_NNS ._SENT This_DT last_JJ use_NN of_IN

Black_JJ carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) :_: Operationally_RB defined_VVN aerosol_NN species_NNS based_VVN on_IN

stability_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB soot_VV ._SENT BC_NP is_VBZ mostly_RB formed_VVN 
by_IN the_DT incomplete_JJ combustion_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, biofuels_NNS ,_, and_CC biomass_NN 
but_CC it_PP also_RB occurs_VVZ naturally_RB ._SENT It_PP stays_VVZ in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN only_RB for_IN days_NNS or_CC 
weeks_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS strongly_RB light-absorbing_VVG component_NN of_IN particulate_JJ 
matter_NN (_( PM_NP )_) and_CC has_VHZ a_DT warming_NN effect_NN by_IN absorbing_VVG heat_NN into_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN and_CC reducing_VVG the_DT albedo_NN when_WRB deposited_VVN on_IN ice_NN or_CC snow_NN ._SENT

Carbon_NN cycle_NN :_: The_DT term_NN used_VVN to_TO describe_VV the_DT flow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ

to_TO 3.667_CD GtCO2_NN )_) ._SENT Carbon_NN is_VBZ the_DT major_JJ chemical_NN constituent_NN of_IN most_JJS 
organic_JJ matter_NN and_CC is_VBZ stored_VVN in_IN the_DT following_VVG major_JJ reservoirs_NNS :_: organic_JJ

Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) :_: A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, also_RB a_DT by-product_NN 
of_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS from_IN fossil_JJ carbon_NN deposits_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN oil_NN ,_, gas_NN and_CC 
coal_NN ,_, of_IN burning_NN biomass_NN ,_, of_IN land_NN use_NN changes_NNS (_( LUC_NP )_) and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ 
processes_VVZ (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, cement_NN production_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_NN anthropogenic_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT earth’s_JJ radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ 
the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ GHGs_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB 
has_VHZ a_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) of_IN 1._CD See_NP Annex_NP II.9.1_NP for_IN 
GWP_NN values_NNS for_IN other_JJ GHGs_NNS ._SENT 
Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) :_: A_DT process_NN in_IN which_WDT 
a_DT relatively_RB pure_JJ stream_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN industrial_JJ and_NP 
energy-related_JJ sources_NNS is_VBZ separated_JJ (_( captured_VVN )_) ,_, conditioned_VVN ,_, compressed_VVN ,_, 
and_CC transported_VVN to_TO a_DT storage_NN location_NN for_IN long-term_JJ isolation_NN 
from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Bioenergy_NN and_CC carbon_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN 
(_( BECCS_NP )_) ,_, CCS-ready_NP ,_, and_CC Sequestration_NP ._SENT

Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP (_( CDR_NP )_) :_: Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP methods_NNS 
refer_VV to_TO a_DT set_NN of_IN techniques_NNS that_WDT aim_VVP to_TO remove_VV carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
directly_RB from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN either_RB (_( 1_LS )_) increasing_VVG natural_JJ sinks_NNS for_IN 
carbon_NN or_CC (_( 2_LS )_) using_VVG chemical_JJ engineering_NN to_TO remove_VV the_DT CO2_NP ,_, with_IN the_DT 
intent_NN of_IN reducing_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP concentration_NN ._SENT CDR_NN methods_NNS 
involve_VV the_DT ocean_NN ,_, land_NN ,_, and_CC technical_JJ systems_NNS ,_, including_VVG such_JJ methods_NNS 
as_IN iron_NN fertilization_NN ,_, large-scale_JJ afforestation_NN ,_, and_CC direct_JJ capture_NN 
of_IN CO2_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN using_VVG engineered_JJ chemical_NN means_NNS ._SENT Some_RB 
CDR_NN methods_NNS fall_VVP under_IN the_DT category_NN of_IN geoengineering_NN ,_, though_IN this_DT 
may_MD not_RB be_VB the_DT case_NN for_IN others_NNS ,_, with_IN the_DT distinction_NN being_VBG based_VVN on_RP 
the_DT magnitude_NN ,_, scale_NN ,_, and_CC impact_NN of_IN the_DT particular_JJ CDR_NP activities_NNS ._SENT The_DT 


boundary_NN between_IN CDR_NP and_CC mitigation_NN is_VBZ not_RB clear_JJ and_CC there_EX could_MD be_VB 
some_DT overlap_VVP between_IN the_DT two_CD given_VVN current_JJ definitions_NNS (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012_CD ,_, 
p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP (_( SRM_NP )_) ._SENT 
Carbon_NN footprint_NN :_: Measure_NN of_IN the_DT exclusive_JJ total_JJ amount_NN of_IN emissions_NNS

Chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) :_: A_DT chlorofluorocarbon_NN is_VBZ an_DT organic_JJ

is_VBZ used_VVN for_IN refrigeration_NN ,_, air_NN conditioning_NN ,_, packaging_NN ,_, plastic_JJ foam_NN ,_, 
insulation_NN ,_, solvents_NNS ,_, or_CC aerosol_NN propellants_NNS ._SENT Because_IN they_PP are_VBP not_RB 
destroyed_VVN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR atmosphere_NN ,_, CFCs_NNS drift_VVP into_IN the_DT upper_JJ atmosphere_NN 
where_WRB ,_, given_VVN suitable_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, they_PP break_VVP down_RP ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) covered_VVD under_IN the_DT 1987_CD 
Montreal_NP Protocol_NP as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN which_WDT manufacturing_NN of_IN these_DT gases_NNS 
has_VHZ been_VBN phased_VVN out_RP and_CC they_PP are_VBP being_VBG replaced_VVN by_IN other_JJ compounds_NNS ,_, 
including_VVG hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) which_WDT are_VBP GHGs_NNS covered_VVN under_IN 
the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT

Reduction_NP Units_NP (_( CERs_NP )_) for_IN doing_VVG so_RB ._SENT The_DT CERs_NNS can_MD be_VB credited_VVN towards_IN

Climate_NN :_: Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_NN

the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN 
ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ 
period_NN for_IN averaging_VVG these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT 
World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS 
often_RB surface_NN variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN and_CC wind_NN ._SENT

of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
climate-change_NN :_: climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN 
the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB identified_VVN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN 
changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS ,_, and_CC that_DT 
persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT Climate_NN 
change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS of_IN the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS and_CC persistent_JJ 
anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC 
in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN 
Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ climate-change_NN as_RB :_: 
‘a_NN change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ 
activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT 
is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVD over_RB comparable_JJ 
time_NN periods’_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN climate_NN 
change_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, 
and_CC climate_NN variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN ._SENT 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN :_: Due_JJ to_TO the_DT thermal_JJ inertia_NN of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN and_CC slow_JJ processes_NNS in_IN the_DT cryosphere_NN and_CC land_NN surfaces_NNS ,_, the_DT climate_NN 
would_MD continue_VV to_TO change_VV even_RB if_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN 
were_VBD held_VVN fixed_VVN at_IN today’s_NN values_NNS ._SENT Past_JJ change_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ composition_NN 
leads_VVZ to_TO a_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, which_WDT continues_VVZ for_IN 


as_RB long_RB as_IN a_DT radiative_JJ imbalance_NN persists_VVZ and_CC until_IN all_DT components_NNS of_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN have_VHP adjusted_VVN to_TO a_DT new_JJ state_NN ._SENT The_DT further_JJR change_NN 
in_IN temperature_NN after_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN is_VBZ held_VVN constant_JJ 
is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT constant_JJ composition_NN temperature_NN commitment_NN 
or_CC simply_RB committed_VVN warming_NN or_CC warming_NN commitment_NN ._SENT Climate_NN 
change_NN commitment_NN includes_VVZ other_JJ future_JJ changes_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN in_IN 
the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ climate_NN 
events_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN sea_NN level_NN change_NN ._SENT The_DT constant_JJ emission_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ 
the_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV from_IN keeping_VVG anthropogenic_JJ 
emissions_NNS constant_JJ and_CC the_DT zero_CD emission_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN when_WRB emissions_NNS are_VBP set_VVN to_TO zero_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN (_( change_NN )_) feedback_NN :_: An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN 
in_IN one_CD climate_NN quantity_NN causes_VVZ a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT change_NN 
in_IN the_DT second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN 
the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN 
is_VBZ weakened_VVN by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN 
which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT In_IN this_DT Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, a_DT 
somewhat_RB narrower_JJR definition_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN which_WDT the_DT climate_NN quantity_NN 
that_WDT is_VBZ perturbed_VVN is_VBZ the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN 
turn_NN causes_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT global_JJ radiation_NN budget_NN ._SENT In_IN either_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT 
initial_JJ perturbation_NN can_MD either_RB be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN 
internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT

Climate_NN finance_NN :_: There_EX is_VBZ no_DT agreed_VVN definition_NN of_IN climate_NN finance_NN ._SENT 
The_DT term_NN ‘climate_NN finance’_NN is_VBZ applied_VVN both_CC to_TO the_DT financial_JJ resources_NNS

to_TO developing_VVG countries_NNS to_TO assist_VV them_PP in_IN addressing_VVG climate-change_NN ._SENT 
The_DT literature_NN includes_VVZ several_JJ concepts_NNS in_IN these_DT categories_NNS ,_, among_IN 
which_WDT the_DT most_RBS commonly_RB used_VVN include_VVP :_: 
Incremental_JJ costs_NNS :_: The_DT cost_NN of_IN capital_NN of_IN the_DT incremental_JJ investment_NN 
and_CC the_DT change_NN of_IN operating_VVG and_CC maintenance_NN costs_NNS for_IN a_DT 
mitigation_NN or_CC adaptation_NN project_NN in_IN comparison_NN to_TO a_DT reference_NN project_NN ._SENT

public_JJ funds_NNS ._SENT

Climate_NN model_NN (_( spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN )_) :_: A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN 
of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_CC biological_JJ 
properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, 
and_CC accounting_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate_NN 
system_NN can_MD be_VB represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, 
for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT spectrum_NN or_CC 
hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT 
number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_NN 
or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT 
empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT Coupled_VVN Atmosphere-Ocean_NP 
General_NP Circulation_NP Models_NPS (_( AOGCMs_NP )_) provide_VVP a_DT representation_NN of_IN the_DT 
climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ near_JJ or_CC at_IN the_DT most_RBS comprehensive_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT 
spectrum_NN currently_RB available_JJ ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_NN 
models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS 
are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN ,_, and_NP 
for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, seasonal_JJ and_CC interannual_JJ 
climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT 
Climate_NN prediction_NN :_: A_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC climate_NN forecast_NN is_VBZ the_DT 
result_NN of_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO produce_VV (_( starting_VVG from_IN a_DT particular_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT 
climate-system_NN )_) an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT actual_JJ evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN in_IN 
the_DT future_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, at_IN seasonal_JJ ,_, interannual_JJ ,_, or_CC decadal_JJ time_NN scales_NNS ._SENT 
Because_IN the_DT future_JJ evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN may_MD be_VB highly_RB sensitive_JJ 
to_TO initial_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, such_JJ predictions_NNS are_VBP usually_RB probabilistic_JJ in_IN 
nature_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN projection_NN ,_, and_CC Climate_NN scenario_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN projection_NN :_: A_DT climate_NN projection_NN is_VBZ the_DT simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO a_DT scenario_NN of_IN future_JJ emission_NN or_CC concentration_NN of_IN 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, generally_RB derived_VVN using_VVG climate_NN 
models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN predictions_NNS 
by_IN their_PP$ dependence_NN on_IN the_DT emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
scenario_NN used_VVD ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN turn_NN based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN 
example_NN ,_, future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_RB 
may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN scenario_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN scenario_NN :_: A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN representation_NN 
of_IN the_DT future_JJ climate_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN an_DT internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN climatological_JJ 
relationships_NNS that_WDT has_VHZ been_VBN constructed_VVN for_IN explicit_JJ use_NN in_IN 
investigating_VVG the_DT potential_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN anthropogenic_JJ climate_NN 


change_NN ,_, often_RB serving_VVG as_IN input_NN to_TO impact_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS 
often_RB serve_VV as_IN the_DT raw_JJ material_NN for_IN constructing_VVG climate_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, 
but_CC climate_NN scenarios_NNS usually_RB require_VVP additional_JJ information_NN such_JJ as_RB 
the_DT observed_JJ current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Emission_NP 
scenario_NN ,_, Mitigation_NN scenario_NN ,_, Representative_NP concentration_NN pathways_NNS 
(_( RCPs_NP )_) ,_, Scenario_NP ,_, Shared_JJ socio-economic_JJ pathways_NNS ,_, Socio-economic_JJ 
scenario_NN ,_, SRES_NP scenarios_NNS ,_, Stabilization_NP ,_, and_CC Transformation_NN pathway_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN :_: In_IN IPCC_NP reports_NNS ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
(_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN (_( steady_JJ state_NN )_) change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ 
global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
CO2-equivalent_JJ concentration_NN ._SENT Owing_VVG to_TO computational_JJ constraints_NNS ,_, 
the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB 
estimated_VVN by_IN running_VVG an_DT atmospheric_JJ general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN 
(_( GCM_NN )_) coupled_VVN to_TO a_DT mixed-layer_NN ocean_NN model_NN ,_, because_IN equilibrium_NN 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ largely_RB determined_VVN by_IN atmospheric_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT 
Efficient_JJ models_NNS can_MD be_VB run_VVN to_TO equilibrium_NN with_IN a_DT dynamic_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) –_NP 1_CD )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN 
change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_NN 
a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT 
The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO doubled_VVN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
concentration_NN that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN 
evolving_VVG non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN 
the_DT climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG 
history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT 
The_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, averaged_VVN over_IN a_DT 20-year_JJ period_NN ,_, centred_VVN at_IN 
the_DT time_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP doubling_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN simulation_NN 
in_IN which_WDT CO2_NP increases_VVZ at_IN 1_CD %_NN yr_NN –_NN 1._CD It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN and_CC 
rapidity_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) 
forcing_VVG ._SENT 
climate-system_NN :_: The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN 
consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, 
the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT lithosphere_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS 
between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN 
of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_RB 
volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ 
as_IN the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN 
(_( LUC_NP )_) ._SENT

crossed_VVN ,_, induces_VVZ a_DT non-linear_JJ response_NN to_TO a_DT given_VVN forcing_VVG ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN variability_NN :_: Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT

of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ

or_CC to_TO variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_VVG 
(_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT 
CO2-equivalent_JJ concentration_NN :_: The_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
(_( CO2_NP )_) that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG as_IN a_DT given_VVN mixture_NN 
of_IN CO2_NP and_CC other_JJ forcing_VVG components_NNS ._SENT Those_DT values_NNS may_MD consider_VV only_RB 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, or_CC a_DT combination_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ,_, aerosols_NNS ,_, and_NP 
surface_NN albedo_NN changes_NNS ._SENT CO2-equivalent_JJ concentration_NN is_VBZ a_DT metric_JJ for_IN 
comparing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN different_JJ forcing_VVG components_NNS 
at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ 
climate-change_NN responses_NNS nor_CC future_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ generally_RB 
no_DT connection_NN between_IN CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC resulting_VVG CO2-_NP 
equivalent_JJ concentrations_NNS ._SENT 
CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN :_: The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emission_NN 
that_DT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ integrated_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, over_IN a_DT 
given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, as_IN an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) 
or_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ._SENT The_DT CO2-equivalent_NP emission_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN multiplying_VVG 
the_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP by_IN its_PP$ Global_JJ Warming_JJ Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) 
for_IN the_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN (_( see_VV Annex_NP II.9.1_NP and_CC WGI_NP AR5_NP Table_NP 8.A.1_JJ 
for_IN GWP_NP values_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ GHGs_NNS )_) ._SENT For_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN GHGs_NP it_PP is_VBZ obtained_VVN 
by_IN summing_VVG the_DT CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN each_DT gas_NN ._SENT CO2-equivalent_NP 
emission_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ scale_NN for_IN comparing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ GHGs_NNS 
but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ climate-change_NN

Economic_JJ efficiency_NN :_: Economic_JJ efficiency_NN refers_VVZ to_TO an_DT economy’s_NN allocation_NN

to_TO make_VV at_IN least_JJS one_CD person_NN better_JJR off_RB without_IN making_VVG someone_NN else_RB 
worse_RBR off_RB ._SENT An_DT allocation_NN is_VBZ inefficient_JJ if_IN such_PDT a_DT reallocation_NN is_VBZ possible_JJ ._SENT 
This_DT is_VBZ also_RB known_VVN as_IN the_DT Pareto_NP Criterion_NN for_IN efficiency_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Pareto_NP

Ecosystem_NN :_: A_DT functional_JJ unit_NN consisting_VVG of_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS ,_, their_PP$ nonliving_NN

components_NNS included_VVD in_IN a_DT given_VVN ecosystem_NN and_CC its_PP$ spatial_JJ boundaries_NNS 
depend_VV on_IN the_DT purpose_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN :_: in_IN some_DT 
cases_NNS they_PP are_VBP relatively_RB sharp_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS they_PP are_VBP diffuse_JJ ._SENT Ecosystem_NN 
boundaries_NNS can_MD change_VV over_IN time_NN ._SENT Ecosystems_NNS are_VBP nested_VVN within_IN 
other_JJ ecosystems_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PP$ scale_NN can_MD range_VV from_IN very_RB small_JJ to_TO the_DT 
entire_JJ biosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT current_JJ era_NN ,_, most_JJS ecosystems_NNS either_CC contain_VV 
people_NNS as_IN key_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, or_CC are_VBP influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN human_JJ 
activities_NNS in_IN their_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT 
Ecosystem_NN services_NNS :_: Ecological_JJ processes_NNS or_CC functions_NNS having_VHG monetary_JJ 
or_CC non-monetary_JJ value_NN to_TO individuals_NNS or_CC society_NN at_IN large_JJ ._SENT These_DT 
are_VBP frequently_RB classified_VVN as_IN (_( 1_LS )_) supporting_JJ services_NNS such_JJ as_IN productivity_NN 
or_CC biodiversity_NN maintenance_NN ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) provisioning_VVG services_NNS such_JJ as_IN food_NN ,_,

sequestration_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 4_LS )_) cultural_JJ services_NNS such_JJ as_IN tourism_NN or_CC spiritual_JJ 
and_CC aesthetic_JJ appreciation_NN ._SENT

Emission_NN permit_NN :_: An_DT entitlement_NN allocated_VVN by_IN a_DT government_NN to_TO a_DT

of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP potentially_RB radiatively_RB 
active_JJ (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_NP

as_IN demographic_JJ and_CC socioeconomic_JJ development_NN ,_, technological_JJ 
change_NN ,_, energy_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN )_) and_CC their_PP$ key_JJ relationships_NNS ._SENT Concentration_NN

(_( 2007_CD )_) ._SENT New_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS for_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT four_CD Representative_NP

Emissions_NNS :_: 
Agricultural_JJ emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS associated_VVN with_IN agricultural_JJ 
systems_NNS —_JJ predominantly_RB methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) or_CC nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ._SENT 
These_DT include_VVP emissions_NNS from_IN enteric_JJ fermentation_NN in_IN domestic_JJ

of_IN savannas_NNS and_CC grassland_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN soils_NNS (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2006_CD )_) ._SENT

(_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, aerosols_NNS ,_, and_CC precursors_NNS of_IN a_DT GHG_NP or_CC aerosol_NN caused_VVN by_IN 
human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT activities_NNS include_VVP the_DT burning_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_,

Direct_JJ emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS that_WDT physically_RB arise_VVP from_IN activities_NNS

sector_NN ,_, a_DT company_NN ,_, or_CC a_DT process_NN ._SENT 
Embodied_VVN emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS that_WDT arise_VVP from_IN the_DT production_NN 
and_CC delivery_NN of_IN a_DT good_JJ or_CC service_NN or_CC the_DT build-up_NN of_IN infrastructure_NN ._SENT

Indirect_JJ emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP a_DT consequence_NN of_IN the_DT

indirect_JJ if_IN they_PP relate_VVP to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN heat_NN but_CC physically_RB arise_VV outside_JJ 
the_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN the_DT heat_NN user_NN ,_, or_CC to_TO electricity_NN production_NN 
but_CC physically_RB arise_VV outside_JJ of_IN the_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN the_DT power_NN supply_NN 
sector_NN ._SENT 
Scope_NN 1_CD ,_, Scope_NP 2_CD ,_, and_CC Scope_NP 3_CD emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS responsibility_NN 
as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT GHG_NP Protocol_NP ,_, a_DT private_JJ sector_NN initiative_NN ._SENT 
‘Scope_NN 1’_NN indicates_VVZ direct_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP 
from_IN sources_NNS owned_VVN or_CC controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT reporting_VVG entity_NN ._SENT ‘Scope_NN 
’_NN indicates_VVZ indirect_JJ GHG_NP emissions_NNS associated_VVN with_IN the_DT production_NN 
of_IN electricity_NN ,_, heat_NN ,_, or_CC steam_NN purchased_VVN by_IN the_DT reporting_VVG entity_NN ._SENT 
‘Scope_NN 3’_JJ indicates_VVZ all_DT other_JJ indirect_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, i_NP ._SENT e_LS ._SENT ,_, emissions_NNS associated_VVN 
with_IN the_DT extraction_NN and_CC production_NN of_IN purchased_VVN materials_NNS ,_, 
fuels_NNS ,_, and_CC services_NNS ,_, including_VVG transport_NN in_IN vehicles_NNS not_RB owned_VVN or_CC 
controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT reporting_VVG entity_NN ,_, outsourced_JJ activities_NNS ,_, waste_NN disposal_NN ,_, 
etc._FW (_( WBCSD_NP and_CC WRI_NP ,_, 2004_CD )_) ._SENT

Emission_NN standard_NN :_: An_DT emission_NN level_NN that_IN/that ,_, by_IN law_NN or_CC by_IN voluntary_JJ 
agreement_NN ,_, may_MD not_RB be_VB exceeded_VVN ._SENT Many_JJ standards_NNS use_VVP emission_NN factors_NNS 
in_IN their_PP$ prescription_NN and_CC therefore_RB do_VVP not_RB impose_VV absolute_JJ limits_NNS 
on_IN the_DT emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Emissions_NNS trading_NN :_: A_DT market-based_JJ instrument_NN used_VVN to_TO limit_VV emissions_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT environmental_JJ objective_NN or_CC sum_NN of_IN total_JJ allowed_VVN emissions_NNS is_VBZ 
expressed_VVN as_IN an_DT emissions_NNS cap._VVD The_DT cap_NN is_VBZ divided_VVN in_IN tradable_JJ emission_NN 
permits_NNS that_WDT are_VBP allocated_VVN —_NN either_CC by_IN auctioning_VVG or_CC handing_VVG out_RP for_IN 
free_RB (_( grandfathering_NP )_) —_NN to_TO entities_NNS within_IN the_DT jurisdiction_NN of_IN the_DT trading_NN 
scheme_NN ._SENT Entities_NNS need_VVP to_TO surrender_VV emission_NN permits_NNS equal_JJ to_TO the_DT 
amount_NN of_IN their_PP$ emissions_NNS (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, tonnes_NNS of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN )_) ._SENT An_DT entity_NN 
may_MD sell_VV excess_JJ permits_NNS ._SENT Trading_NN schemes_NNS may_MD occur_VV at_IN the_DT intra-company_NN ,_, 
domestic_JJ ,_, or_CC international_JJ level_NN and_CC may_MD apply_VV to_TO carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
(_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, or_CC other_JJ substances_NNS ._SENT Emissions_NNS 


trading_NN is_VBZ also_RB one_CD of_IN the_DT mechanisms_NNS under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Kyoto_NP Mechanisms_NNS ._SENT 
Energy_NN :_: The_DT power_NN of_IN ‘doing_JJ work’_NN possessed_VVN at_IN any_DT instant_NN by_IN a_DT

another_DT or_CC is_VBZ converted_VVN from_IN one_CD type_NN into_IN another_DT ._SENT 
Embodied_VVN energy_NN :_: The_DT energy_NN used_VVN to_TO produce_VV a_DT material_NN substance_NN

Primary_JJ energy_NN :_: Primary_JJ energy_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN energy_NN 
sources_NNS )_) is_VBZ the_DT energy_NN stored_VVN in_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, coal_NN ,_, crude_NN 
oil_NN ,_, natural_JJ gas_NN ,_, uranium_NN ,_, and_CC renewable_JJ sources_NNS )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN in_IN 
several_JJ alternative_JJ ways_NNS ._SENT The_DT International_NP Energy_NP Agency_NP (_( IEA_NP )_) 
utilizes_VVZ the_DT physical_JJ energy_NN content_NN method_NN ,_, which_WDT defines_VVZ primary_JJ 
energy_NN as_IN energy_NN that_WDT has_VHZ not_RB undergone_VVN any_DT anthropogenic_JJ 
conversion_NN ._SENT The_DT method_NN used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN is_VBZ the_DT direct_JJ equivalent_NN 
method_NN (_( see_VV Annex_NP II.4_NP )_) ,_, which_WDT counts_VVZ one_CD unit_NN of_IN secondary_JJ 
energy_NN provided_VVD from_IN non-combustible_JJ sources_NNS as_IN one_CD unit_NN of_IN primary_NN 
energy_NN ,_, but_CC treats_VVZ combustion_NN energy_NN as_IN the_DT energy_NN potential_NN 
contained_VVN in_IN fuels_NNS prior_RB to_TO treatment_NN or_CC combustion_NN ._SENT Primary_JJ 
energy_NN is_VBZ transformed_VVN into_IN secondary_JJ energy_NN by_IN cleaning_VVG (_( natural_JJ 
gas_NN )_) ,_, refining_NN (_( crude_JJ oil_NN to_TO oil_NN products_NNS )_) or_CC by_IN conversion_NN into_IN electricity_NN 
or_CC heat_NN ._SENT When_WRB the_DT secondary_JJ energy_NN is_VBZ delivered_VVN at_IN the_DT enduse_NN 
facilities_NNS it_PP is_VBZ called_VVN final_JJ energy_NN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, electricity_NN at_IN the_DT wall_NN 
outlet_NN )_) ,_, where_WRB it_PP becomes_VVZ usable_JJ energy_NN in_IN supplying_VVG energy_NN services_NNS 
(_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, light_JJ )_) ._SENT 
Renewable_JJ energy_NN (_( RE_NP )_) :_: Any_DT form_NN of_IN energy_NN from_IN solar_JJ ,_, geophysical_JJ ,_, 
or_CC biological_JJ sources_NNS that_WDT is_VBZ replenished_VVN by_IN natural_JJ processes_NNS 
at_IN a_DT rate_NN that_WDT equals_VVZ or_CC exceeds_VVZ its_PP$ rate_NN of_IN use_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT more_RBR detailed_JJ 
description_NN see_VVP Bioenergy_NP ,_, Solar_NP energy_NN ,_, Hydropower_NP ,_, Ocean_NP ,_, Geothermal_NP ,_, 
and_CC Wind_NP energy_NN ._SENT

Externality_NN /_SYM external_JJ cost_NN /_SYM external_JJ benefit_NN :_: Externalities_NNS arise_VVP from_IN 
a_DT human_JJ activity_NN when_WRB agents_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT activity_NN do_VVP not_RB take_VV

possibilities_NNS ,_, and_CC no_DT compensation_NN exists_VVZ for_IN such_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT

impacts_NNS are_VBP positive_JJ ,_, they_PP are_VBP external_JJ benefits_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Social_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT

Forest_NN :_: A_DT vegetation_NN type_NN dominated_VVN by_IN trees_NNS ._SENT Many_JJ definitions_NNS of_IN the_DT 
term_NN forest_NN are_VBP in_IN use_NN throughout_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, reflecting_VVG wide_JJ differences_NNS 
in_IN biogeophysical_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, social_JJ structure_NN and_CC economics_NNS ._SENT According_VVG 
to_TO the_DT 2005_CD United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) definition_NN a_DT forest_NN is_VBZ an_DT area_NN of_IN land_NN of_IN at_IN least_JJS 0.05_CD –_NN 1_CD hectare_NN ,_, 
of_IN which_WDT more_JJR than_IN 10_CD –_NN 30_CD %_NN is_VBZ covered_VVN by_IN tree_NN canopy_NN ._SENT Trees_NNS must_MD 
have_VHP a_DT potential_NN to_TO reach_VV a_DT minimum_NN of_IN 25_CD meters_NNS at_IN maturity_NN in_IN situ_NN ._SENT 
Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT Convention_NN can_MD choose_VV to_TO define_VV a_DT forest_NN from_IN within_IN 
those_DT ranges_NNS ._SENT Currently_RB ,_, the_DT definition_NN does_VVZ not_RB recognize_VV different_JJ 
biomes_NNS ,_, nor_CC do_VVP they_PP distinguish_VV natural_JJ forests_NNS from_IN plantations_NNS ,_, an_DT 
anomaly_NN being_VBG pointed_VVN out_RP by_IN many_JJ as_IN in_IN need_NN of_IN rectification_NN ._SENT 
For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC related_JJ terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN afforestation_NN ,_, 
reforestation_NN and_CC deforestation_NN see_VVP the_DT IPCC_NP Report_NP on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, 
Land-Use_NN Change_NP and_CC Forestry_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB the_DT Report_NP on_IN

Geoengineering_NP :_: Geoengineering_NP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT broad_JJ set_NN of_IN methods_NNS 
and_CC technologies_NNS that_WDT aim_VVP to_TO deliberately_RB alter_VV the_DT climate-system_NN 
in_IN order_NN to_TO alleviate_VV the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Most_RBS ,_, but_CC not_RB 
all_RB ,_, methods_NNS seek_VVP to_TO either_DT (_( 1_LS )_) reduce_VV the_DT amount_NN of_IN absorbed_VVN solar_JJ 
energy_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP )_) or_CC (_( 2_LS )_) 
increase_VV net_JJ carbon_NN sinks_NNS from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT scale_NN sufficiently_RB 
large_JJ to_TO alter_VV climate_NN (_( Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP )_) ._SENT Scale_NN and_CC intent_NN 
are_VBP of_IN central_JJ importance_NN ._SENT Two_CD key_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN geoengineering_NN 
methods_NNS of_IN particular_JJ concern_NN are_VBP that_IN/that they_PP use_VVP or_CC affect_VVP the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, atmosphere_NN ,_, land_NN or_CC ocean_NN )_) globally_RB or_CC regionally_RB 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC could_MD have_VH substantive_JJ unintended_JJ effects_NNS that_WDT cross_VVP national_JJ 
boundaries_NNS ._SENT Geoengineering_NP is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN weather_NN modification_NN 
and_CC ecological_JJ engineering_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT boundary_NN can_MD be_VB fuzzy_JJ (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 
,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT

Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) :_: An_DT index_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN radiative_JJ 
properties_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, measuring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
following_VVG a_DT pulse_NN emission_NN of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN GHG_NN in_IN the_DT 
present-day_JJ atmosphere_NN integrated_VVN over_IN a_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, relative_JJ 
to_TO that_DT of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT GWP_NP represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ 
effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG times_NNS these_DT gases_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC 
their_PP$ relative_JJ effectiveness_NN in_IN causing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
is_VBZ based_VVN on_IN GWPs_NP from_IN pulse_NN emissions_NNS over_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN 
frame_NN ._SENT Unless_IN stated_VVN otherwise_RB ,_, this_DT report_NN uses_VVZ GWP_NP values_NNS calculated_VVD 
with_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN horizon_NN which_WDT are_VBP often_RB derived_VVN from_IN the_DT IPCC_NP 
Second_NP Assessment_NP Report_NP (_( see_VV Annex_NP II.9.1_NP for_IN the_DT GWP_NP values_NNS of_IN the_DT 
different_JJ GHGs_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Governance_NN :_: A_DT comprehensive_JJ and_CC inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN the_DT full_JJ range_NN

Greenhouse_NN effect_NN :_: The_DT infrared_JJ radiative_JJ effect_NN of_IN all_DT infraredabsorbing_NN 
constituents_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, 
clouds_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( to_TO a_DT small_JJ extent_NN )_) aerosols_NNS absorb_VVP terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN 
emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT earth’s_NNS surface_NN and_CC elsewhere_RB in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT These_DT 
substances_NNS emit_VVP infrared_JJ radiation_NN in_IN all_DT directions_NNS ,_, but_RB ,_, everything_NN else_RB 
being_VBG equal_JJ ,_, the_DT net_JJ amount_NN emitted_VVN to_TO space_NN is_VBZ normally_RB less_JJR than_IN 
would_MD have_VH been_VBN emitted_VVN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN these_DT absorbers_NNS because_RB 
of_IN the_DT decline_NN of_IN temperature_NN with_IN altitude_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN and_CC the_DT 
consequent_JJ weakening_NN of_IN emission_NN ._SENT An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN 
of_IN GHGs_NP increases_VVZ the_DT magnitude_NN of_IN this_DT effect_NN ;_: the_DT difference_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB 
called_VVN the_DT enhanced_JJ greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT The_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT GHG_NP 
concentration_NN because_IN of_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS contributes_VVZ to_TO an_DT 
instantaneous_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC troposphere_NN 
warm_JJ in_IN response_NN to_TO this_DT forcing_VVG ,_, gradually_RB restoring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ balance_NN 
at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) :_: Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS 
of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, both_CC natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_RB 
absorb_VV and_CC emit_VV radiation_NN at_IN specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN 
of_IN terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT earth’s_NNS surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN 
itself_PP ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN 
vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN 
(_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT earth’s_NN atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC brominecontaining_NN 
substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Beside_RB 
CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT GHGs_NP sulphur_NN 
hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT For_IN a_DT list_NN of_IN well-mixed_JJ GHGs_NNS ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Table_NP 2.A.1_JJ ._SENT 
Gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) :_: The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, at_IN 
purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT resident_NN and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN the_DT 
economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT taxes_NNS and_CC minus_IN any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN the_DT 
value_NN of_IN the_DT products_NNS in_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC a_DT geographic_JJ region_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN 
period_NN ,_, normally_RB one_CD year_NN ._SENT GDP_NP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG for_IN

resources_NNS ._SENT

import_NN =_SYM GNE_NP +_SYM export_NN ._SENT 
Gross_JJ national_JJ product_NN :_: The_DT value_NN added_VVD from_IN domestic_JJ and_CC foreign_JJ

Human_NP Development_NP Index_NP (_( HDI_NP )_) :_: The_DT Human_NP Development_NP Index_NP 
allows_VVZ the_DT assessment_NN of_IN countries’_JJ progress_NN regarding_VVG social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ 
development_NN as_IN a_DT composite_JJ index_NN of_IN three_CD indicators_NNS :_: (_( 1_LS )_) health_NN 
measured_VVN by_IN life_NN expectancy_NN at_IN birth_NN ;_: (_( 2_LS )_) knowledge_NN as_IN measured_VVN by_IN 
a_DT combination_NN of_IN the_DT adult_JJ literacy_NN rate_NN and_CC the_DT combined_JJ primary_NN ,_, 
secondary_JJ and_CC tertiary_JJ school_NN enrolment_NN ratio_NN ;_: and_CC (_( 3_LS )_) standard_JJ of_IN living_VVG 
as_IN gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) per_IN capita_NN (_( in_IN purchasing_NN power_NN 
parity_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT HDI_NP sets_VVZ a_DT minimum_NN and_CC a_DT maximum_NN for_IN each_DT dimension_NN ,_, 
called_VVN goalposts_NNS ,_, and_CC then_RB shows_VVZ where_WRB each_DT country_NN stands_VVZ in_IN relation_NN 
to_TO these_DT goalposts_NNS ,_, expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT value_NN between_IN 0_CD and_CC 1._CD The_DT 
HDI_NP only_RB acts_VVZ as_IN a_DT broad_JJ proxy_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT key_JJ issues_NNS of_IN human_JJ 


development_NN ;_: for_IN instance_NN ,_, it_PP does_VVZ not_RB reflect_VV issues_NNS such_JJ as_IN political_JJ 
participation_NN or_CC gender_NN inequalities_NNS ._SENT

Industrial_NP Revolution_NP :_: A_DT period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ industrial_JJ growth_NN with_IN farreaching_JJ 
social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ consequences_NNS ,_, beginning_VVG in_IN Britain_NP during_IN 
the_DT second_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT 18th_JJ century_NN and_CC spreading_VVG to_TO Europe_NP and_NP 
later_RBR to_TO other_JJ countries_NNS including_VVG the_DT United_NP States_NPS ._SENT The_DT invention_NN of_IN 
the_DT steam_NN engine_NN was_VBD an_DT important_JJ trigger_NN of_IN this_DT development_NN ._SENT The_DT 
industrial_JJ revolution_NN marks_VVZ the_DT beginning_NN of_IN a_DT strong_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT 
use_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS and_CC emission_NN of_IN ,_, in_IN particular_JJ ,_, fossil_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT

arbitrarily_RB ,_, to_TO the_DT periods_NNS before_IN and_CC after_IN 1750_CD ,_, respectively_RB ._SENT 
Industrialized_JJ countries_NNS /_SYM developing_JJ countries_NNS :_: There_EX are_VBP a_DT diversity_NN 
of_IN approaches_NNS for_IN categorizing_VVG countries_NNS on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN their_PP$ level_NN 
of_IN development_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN defining_VVG terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN industrialized_JJ ,_, developed_VVD ,_, 
or_CC developing_VVG ._SENT Several_JJ categorizations_NNS are_VBP used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT (_( 1_CD )_) 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ on_IN the_DT definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN Cobo_NP (_( 1987_CD )_) and_CC previous_JJ 
IPCC_NN reports_NNS ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS system_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT established_JJ convention_NN for_IN 
designating_VVG of_IN developed_JJ and_CC developing_VVG countries_NNS or_CC areas_NNS ._SENT (_( 2_LS )_) The_DT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Statistics_NP Division_NP specifies_VVZ developed_VVN and_CC developing_VVG 
regions_NNS based_VVN on_IN common_JJ practice_NN ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, specific_JJ countries_NNS are_VBP

Many_JJ countries_NNS appear_VVP in_IN more_JJR than_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT categories_NNS ._SENT (_( 3_LS )_) The_DT 
World_NP Bank_NP uses_VVZ income_NN as_IN the_DT main_JJ criterion_NN for_IN classifying_VVG countries_NNS 
as_IN low_JJ ,_, lower_RBR middle_JJ ,_, upper_JJ middle_NN ,_, and_CC high_JJ income_NN ._SENT (_( 4_LS )_) The_DT UNDP_NP 
aggregates_NNS indicators_NNS for_IN life_NN expectancy_NN ,_, educational_JJ attainment_NN ,_, and_NP 
income_NN into_IN a_DT single_JJ composite_JJ Human_NP Development_NP Index_NP (_( HDI_NP )_) to_TO 
classify_VV countries_NNS as_IN low_JJ ,_, medium_JJ ,_, high_JJ ,_, or_CC very_RB high_JJ human_JJ development_NN ._SENT

Institution_NN :_: Institutions_NNS are_VBP rules_NNS and_CC norms_NNS held_VVN in_IN common_JJ by_IN social_JJ 
actors_NNS that_WDT guide_VV ,_, constrain_VV and_CC shape_VV human_JJ interaction_NN ._SENT Institutions_NNS 
can_MD be_VB formal_JJ ,_, such_JJ as_IN laws_NNS and_CC policies_NNS ,_, or_CC informal_JJ ,_, such_JJ as_RB 
norms_NNS and_CC conventions_NNS ._SENT Organizations_NNS —_NN such_JJ as_IN parliaments_NNS ,_, regulatory_JJ 
agencies_NNS ,_, private_JJ firms_NNS ,_, and_CC community_NN bodies_NNS —_NN develop_VV and_CC act_VV 
in_IN response_NN to_TO institutional_JJ frameworks_NNS and_CC the_DT incentives_NNS they_PP frame_VVP ._SENT 
Institutions_NNS can_MD guide_VV ,_, constrain_VV and_CC shape_VV human_JJ interaction_NN through_RB

IPAT_NN identity_NN :_: IPAT_NP is_VBZ the_DT lettering_NN of_IN a_DT formula_NN put_VVD forward_RB to_TO describe_VV

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP :_: The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP

Protocol_NP (_( most_JJS Organisation_NP for_IN Economic_NP Cooperation_NP and_CC Development_NP 
countries_NNS and_CC countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD to_TO 
reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) )_) by_IN at_IN 
least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT commitment_NN period_NN 2008_CD –_NN 2012._CD 
The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP entered_VVD into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005._CD

Leakage_NN :_: Phenomena_NNS whereby_WRB the_DT reduction_NN in_IN emissions_NNS (_( relative_JJ to_TO

nation_NN ,_, or_CC world_NN region_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Rebound_JJ effect_NN ._SENT

storage_NN location_NN and_CC eventual_JJ release_NN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN 
of_IN other_JJ substances_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN is_VBZ used_VVN more_RBR generically_RB ,_, such_JJ as_RB 
for_IN ‘methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) leakage’_NN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, from_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN extraction_NN activities_NNS )_) ,_, 
and_CC ‘hydrofluorocarbon_NP (_( HFC_NP )_) leakage’_NN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, from_IN refrigeration_NN and_CC 
air-conditioning_NN systems_NNS )_) ._SENT

–_NN 100_CD %_NN probability_NN ,_, very_RB likely_RB 90_CD –_NN 100_CD %_NN ,_, likely_RB 66_CD –_NN 100_CD %_NN ,_, 
about_RB as_RB likely_JJ as_IN not_RB 33_CD –_NN 66_CD %_NN ,_, unlikely_RB 0_CD –_NN 33_CD %_NN ,_, very_RB unlikely_RB 0_CD –_NN 10_CD

Market_NN failure_NN :_: When_WRB private_JJ decisions_NNS are_VBP based_VVN on_IN market_NN prices_NNS 
that_DT do_VVP not_RB reflect_VV the_DT real_JJ scarcity_NN of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS but_CC rather_RB

of_IN resources_NNS but_CC cause_VV welfare_NN losses_NNS ._SENT A_DT market_NN distortion_NN is_VBZ any_DT event_NN 
in_IN which_WDT a_DT market_NN reaches_VVZ a_DT market_NN clearing_NN price_NN that_WDT is_VBZ substantially_RB 
different_JJ from_IN the_DT price_NN that_IN/that a_DT market_NN would_MD achieve_VV while_IN operating_VVG 
under_IN conditions_NNS of_IN perfect_JJ competition_NN and_CC state_NN enforcement_NN of_IN legal_JJ 
contracts_NNS and_CC the_DT ownership_NN of_IN private_JJ property_NN ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN factors_NNS 
causing_VVG market_NN prices_NNS to_TO deviate_VV from_IN real_JJ economic_JJ scarcity_NN are_VBP environmental_JJ

together_RB with_IN an_DT action_NN plan_NN to_TO reach_VV the_DT goals_NNS ._SENT 
Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) :_: A_DT human_JJ intervention_NN to_TO reduce_VV the_DT 
sources_NNS or_CC enhance_VV the_DT sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ._SENT This_DT report_NN 
also_RB assesses_VVZ human_JJ interventions_NNS to_TO reduce_VV the_DT sources_NNS of_IN other_JJ 
substances_NNS which_WDT may_MD contribute_VV directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO limiting_VVG climate_NN 
change_NN ,_, including_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT reduction_NN of_IN particulate_JJ matter_NN 
(_( PM_NP )_) emissions_NNS that_WDT can_MD directly_RB alter_VV the_DT radiation_NN balance_NN (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, 
black_JJ carbon_NN )_) or_CC measures_VVZ that_IN/that control_NN emissions_NNS of_IN carbon_NN monoxide_NN ,_, 
nitrogen_NN oxides_NNS (_( NOx_NP )_) ,_, Volatile_NP Organic_NP Compounds_NP (_( VOCs_NP )_) and_CC other_JJ 


pollutants_NNS that_WDT can_MD alter_VV the_DT concentration_NN of_IN tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_)

Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) :_: Ozone_NN ,_, the_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ 
atmospheric_JJ constituent_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN both_CC naturally_RB 
and_CC by_IN photochemical_JJ reactions_NNS involving_VVG gases_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN human_JJ

the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN by_IN the_DT interaction_NN between_IN solar_JJ ultraviolet_NN

Purchasing_VVG power_NN parity_NN (_( PPP_NP )_) :_: The_DT purchasing_NN power_NN of_IN a_DT currency_NN 
is_VBZ expressed_VVN using_VVG a_DT basket_NN of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB bought_VVN 
with_IN a_DT given_VVN amount_NN in_IN the_DT home_NN country_NN ._SENT International_JJ comparison_NN

based_VVN on_IN the_DT purchasing_NN power_NN of_IN currencies_NNS rather_RB than_IN on_IN current_JJ
