Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG :_: Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_NN ,_, downward_RB 
minus_CC upward_RB ,_, radiative_JJ flux_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN 
or_CC top_JJ of_IN atmosphere_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN an_DT external_JJ driver_NN of_IN 
climate-change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN 
carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT sun_NN ._SENT For_IN the_DT purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT 
report_NN ,_, radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ further_RBR defined_VVN as_IN the_DT change_NN relative_JJ to_TO the_DT 
year_NN 1750_CD and_CC refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT global_JJ and_CC annual_JJ average_JJ value_NN ._SENT 
Rebound_NN effect_NN :_: Phenomena_NNS whereby_WRB the_DT reduction_NN in_IN energy_NN consumption_NN 
or_CC emissions_NNS (_( relative_JJ to_TO a_DT baseline_NN )_) associated_VVN with_IN the_DT 
implementation_NN of_IN mitigation_NN measures_NNS in_IN a_DT jurisdiction_NN is_VBZ offset_VVN to_TO 
some_DT degree_NN through_IN induced_VVN changes_NNS in_IN consumption_NN ,_, production_NN ,_, 
and_CC prices_NNS within_IN the_DT same_JJ jurisdiction_NN ._SENT The_DT rebound_NN effect_NN is_VBZ most_RBS typically_RB 
ascribed_VVN to_TO technological_JJ energy_NN efficiency_NN (_( EE_NP )_) improvements_NNS ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Leakage_NP ._SENT 
Reducing_VVG Emissions_NNS from_IN Deforestation_NP and_CC Forest_NP Degradation_NP 
(_( REDD_NN )_) :_: An_DT effort_NN to_TO create_VV financial_JJ value_NN for_IN the_DT carbon_NN stored_VVD 
in_IN forests_NNS ,_, offering_VVG incentives_NNS for_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS to_TO reduce_VV 
emissions_NNS from_IN forested_JJ lands_NNS and_CC invest_VV in_IN low-carbon_NN paths_NNS to_TO sustainable_JJ 
development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ therefore_RB a_DT mechanism_NN for_IN mitigation_NN 
that_DT results_NNS from_IN avoiding_VVG deforestation_NN ._SENT REDD+_NP goes_VVZ beyond_IN 
reforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN ,_, and_CC includes_VVZ the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, 
sustainable_JJ management_NN of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN 
forest_NN carbon_NN stocks_NNS ._SENT The_DT concept_NN was_VBD first_RB introduced_VVN in_IN 2005_CD in_IN the_DT 
th_NN Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) in_IN Montreal_NP and_NP 
later_RBR given_VVN greater_JJR recognition_NN in_IN the_DT 13th_JJ Session_NP of_IN the_DT COP_NP in_IN 2007_CD 
at_IN Bali_NP and_CC inclusion_NN in_IN the_DT Bali_NP Action_NP Plan_NP which_WDT called_VVD for_IN “_JJ policy_NN 
approaches_NNS and_CC positive_JJ incentives_NNS on_IN issues_NNS relating_VVG to_TO reducing_VVG 
emissions_NNS to_TO deforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN in_IN developing_VVG 
countries_NNS (_( REDD_NP )_) and_CC the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, sustainable_JJ management_NN 
of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN forest_NN carbon_NN stock_NN in_IN developing_VVG 
countries_NNS ”_JJ ._SENT Since_IN then_RB ,_, support_NN for_IN REDD_NP has_VHZ increased_VVN and_CC has_VHZ 
slowly_RB become_VV a_DT framework_NN for_IN action_NN supported_VVN by_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN 
countries_NNS ._SENT 
Reference_NN scenario_NN :_: See_NP Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ._SENT 
Reforestation_NN :_: Planting_VVG of_IN forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT have_VHP previously_RB 
sustained_JJ forests_NNS but_CC that_WDT have_VHP been_VBN converted_VVN to_TO some_DT other_JJ use_NN ._SENT 
Under_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) and_CC the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, reforestation_NN is_VBZ the_DT direct_JJ humaninduced_NN 
conversion_NN of_IN non-forested_JJ land_NN to_TO forested_JJ land_NN through_RB 
planting_NN ,_, seeding_VVG ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC human-induced_JJ promotion_NN of_IN natural_JJ seed_NN 
sources_NNS ,_, on_IN land_NN that_WDT was_VBD previously_RB forested_VVN but_CC converted_VVN to_TO nonforested_JJ 
land_NN ._SENT For_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, 
reforestation_NN activities_NNS will_MD be_VB limited_VVN to_TO reforestation_NN occurring_VVG on_IN 
those_DT lands_NNS that_WDT did_VVD not_RB contain_VV forest_NN on_IN 31_CD December_NP 1989._CD 
For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC related_JJ terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN afforestation_NN ,_, 
reforestation_NN and_CC deforestation_NN ,_, see_VVP the_DT IPCC_NP Report_NP on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, 
Land-Use_NN Change_NP and_CC Forestry_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB the_DT Report_NP on_IN 
Definitions_NNS and_CC Methodological_JJ Options_NNS to_TO Inventory_JJ Emissions_NNS from_IN 
Direct_NP Human-induced_NP Degradation_NP of_IN Forests_NP and_CC Devegetation_NP of_IN 
Other_JJ Vegetation_NP Types_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2003_CD )_) ._SENT

Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) :_: Scenarios_NNS that_RB 
include_VV time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS of_IN the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC chemically_RB active_JJ gases_NNS ,_, as_RB 
well_RB as_IN land_NN use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN representative_NN 
signifies_VVZ that_IN/that each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ possible_JJ scenarios_NNS 
that_DT would_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT specific_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
term_NN pathway_NN emphasizes_VVZ that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT long-term_JJ concentration_NN 
levels_NNS are_VBP of_IN interest_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB the_DT trajectory_NN taken_VVN over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV 
that_DT outcome_NN (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT 
RCPs_NNS usually_RB refer_VVP to_TO the_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT concentration_NN pathway_NN extending_VVG 
up_RB to_TO 2100_CD ,_, for_IN which_WDT Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS produced_VVD 
corresponding_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT Extended_JJ Concentration_NP Pathways_NP 
(_( ECPs_NNS )_) describe_VVP extensions_NNS of_IN the_DT RCPs_NP from_IN 2100_CD to_TO 2500_CD that_WDT were_VBD 
calculated_JJ using_VVG simple_JJ rules_NNS generated_VVN by_IN stakeholder_NN consultations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC do_VVP not_RB represent_VV fully_RB consistent_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT 
Four_NP RCPs_NP produced_VVD from_IN Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS were_VBD selected_VVN 
from_IN the_DT published_VVN literature_NN and_CC are_VBP used_VVN in_IN the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP Assessment_NP 
as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN predictions_NNS and_CC projections_NNS presented_VVD 
in_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP Chapters_NP 11_CD to_TO 14_CD :_: 
RCP2.6_NP One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN approximately_RB 
W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD before_IN 2100_CD and_CC then_RB declines_NNS (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ 
ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) ;_: 
RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilization_NN pathways_NNS in_IN 
which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ stabilized_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN m_NN –_NP 2_CD 
and_CC 6.0_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD after_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS assuming_VVG constant_JJ 
concentrations_NNS after_IN 2150_CD )_) ;_: 
RCP8.5_NP One_NP high_JJ pathway_NN for_IN which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG reaches_NNS 
greater_JJR than_IN 8.5_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD by_IN 2100_CD and_CC continues_VVZ to_TO rise_VV for_IN some_DT 
amount_NN of_IN time_NN (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS 
after_IN 2100_CD and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) ._SENT 
For_IN further_JJR description_NN of_IN future_JJ scenarios_NNS ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 1.1_CD ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Climate_NN prediction_NN ,_, Climate_NN projection_NN ,_, Climate_NN 
scenario_NN ,_, Shared_JJ socio-economic_JJ pathways_NNS ,_, Socio-economic_JJ scenario_NN ,_, 
SRES_NP scenarios_NNS ,_, and_CC Transformation_NN pathway_NN ._SENT 
Reservoir_NN :_: A_DT component_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, other_JJ than_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
which_WDT has_VHZ the_DT capacity_NN to_TO store_VV ,_, accumulate_VV or_CC release_VV a_DT substance_NN 
of_IN concern_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, carbon_NN ,_, a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) or_CC a_DT 
precursor_NN ._SENT Oceans_NNS ,_, soils_NNS and_CC forests_NNS are_VBP examples_NNS of_IN reservoirs_NNS of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT 
Pool_NN is_VBZ an_DT equivalent_JJ term_NN (_( note_NN that_IN/that the_DT definition_NN of_IN pool_NN often_RB 
includes_VVZ the_DT atmosphere_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT absolute_JJ quantity_NN of_IN the_DT substance_NN of_IN 
concern_NN held_VVD within_IN a_DT reservoir_NN at_IN a_DT specified_JJ time_NN is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT stock_NN ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) ,_, this_DT term_NN 
is_VBZ sometimes_RB used_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO a_DT geological_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) storage_NN 
location_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sequestration_NN ._SENT 
Resilience_NN :_: The_DT capacity_NN of_IN social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ systems_NNS 
to_TO cope_VV with_IN a_DT hazardous_JJ event_NN or_CC trend_NN or_CC disturbance_NN ,_, responding_VVG 
or_CC reorganizing_VVG in_IN ways_NNS that_WDT maintain_VVP their_PP$ essential_JJ function_NN ,_, identity_NN ,_, 
and_CC structure_NN ,_, while_IN also_RB maintaining_VVG the_DT capacity_NN for_IN adaptation_NN ,_, 
learning_NN ,_, and_CC transformation_NN (_( Arctic_NP Council_NP ,_, 2013_CD )_) ._SENT 
Revegetation_NN :_: A_DT direct_JJ human-induced_JJ activity_NN to_TO increase_VV carbon_NN 
stocks_NNS on_IN sites_NNS through_IN the_DT establishment_NN of_IN vegetation_NN that_WDT covers_VVZ a_DT 
minimum_JJ area_NN of_IN 0.05_CD hectares_NNS and_CC does_VVZ not_RB meet_VV the_DT definitions_NNS of_IN 
afforestation_NN and_CC reforestation_NN contained_VVN here_RB (_( UNFCCC_NP ,_, 2002_CD )_) ._SENT 
Risk_NN :_: In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN risk_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT potential_JJ ,_, 
when_WRB the_DT outcome_NN is_VBZ uncertain_JJ ,_, for_IN adverse_JJ consequences_NNS on_IN lives_NNS ,_, 
livelihoods_NNS ,_, health_NN ,_, ecosystems_NNS and_CC species_NNS ,_, economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ 
assets_NNS ,_, services_NNS (_( including_VVG environmental_JJ services_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC infrastructure_NN ._SENT

estimation_NN of_IN risks_NNS ._SENT

likelihood_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC consequences_NNS of_IN a_DT given_VVN risk_NN ._SENT 
Risk_NN perception_NN :_: The_DT subjective_JJ judgment_NN that_IN/that people_NNS make_VVP 
about_IN the_DT characteristics_NNS and_CC severity_NN of_IN a_DT risk_NN ._SENT

when_WRB a_DT countervailing_VVG risk_NN is_VBZ generated_VVN (_( knowingly_RB or_CC inadvertently_RB )_)

Risk_NN transfer_NN :_: The_DT practice_NN of_IN formally_RB or_CC informally_RB shifting_VVG the_DT 
risk_NN of_IN financial_JJ consequences_NNS for_IN particular_JJ negative_JJ events_NNS from_IN 
one_CD party_NN to_TO another_DT ._SENT

based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_RB 
key_JJ driving_NN forces_VVZ (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, rate_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN (_( TC_NP )_) ,_, prices_NNS )_) and_CC 
relationships_NNS ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that scenarios_NNS are_VBP neither_DT predictions_NNS nor_CC forecasts_NNS ,_, 
but_CC are_VBP useful_JJ to_TO provide_VV a_DT view_NN of_IN the_DT implications_NNS of_IN developments_NNS 
and_CC actions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, Emission_NP

example_NN ,_, one_PP chooses_VVZ different_JJ values_NNS for_IN specific_JJ parameters_NNS and_CC reruns_NNS 
a_DT given_VVN model_NN to_TO assess_VV the_DT impact_NN of_IN these_DT changes_NNS on_IN model_NN

Sequestration_NN :_: The_DT uptake_NN (_( i_NP ._SENT e_LS ._SENT ,_, the_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN of_IN concern_NN 
to_TO a_DT reservoir_NN )_) of_IN carbon_NN containing_VVG substances_NNS ,_, in_IN particular_JJ carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, in_IN terrestrial_JJ or_CC marine_JJ reservoirs_NNS ._SENT Biological_JJ sequestration_NN 
includes_VVZ direct_JJ removal_NN of_IN CO2_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN through_RB 
land-use_NN change_NN (_( LUC_NP )_) ,_, afforestation_NN ,_, reforestation_NN ,_, revegetation_NN ,_, carbon_NN 
storage_NN in_IN landfills_NNS ,_, and_CC practices_NNS that_WDT enhance_VVP soil_NN carbon_NN in_IN agriculture_NN 
(_( cropland_NN management_NN ,_, grazing_VVG land_NN management_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN parts_NNS of_IN 
the_DT literature_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB in_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, (_( carbon_NN )_) sequestration_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO 
refer_VV to_TO Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) ._SENT 
Shadow_NN pricing_NN :_: Setting_VVG prices_NNS of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB ,_, or_CC 
are_VBP incompletely_RB ,_, priced_VVN by_IN market_NN forces_NNS or_CC by_IN administrative_JJ regulation_NN ,_, 
at_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN their_PP$ social_JJ marginal_JJ value_NN ._SENT This_DT technique_NN is_VBZ used_VVN 
in_IN cost-benefit_JJ analysis_NN (_( CBA_NP )_) ._SENT 
Shared_VVN socio-economic_JJ pathways_NNS (_( SSPs_NP )_) :_: Currently_RB ,_, the_DT idea_NN of_IN

scenarios_NNS ._SENT An_DT SSP_NP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN a_DT collection_NN of_IN pathways_NNS that_WDT describe_VVP 
alternative_JJ futures_NNS of_IN socio-economic_JJ development_NN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN 
climate_NN policy_NN intervention_NN ._SENT The_DT combination_NN of_IN SSP-based_JJ socio-economic_JJ 
scenarios_NNS and_CC Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathway_NP (_( RCP_NP )_) -_: 
based_VVN climate_NN projections_NNS should_MD provide_VV a_DT useful_JJ integrative_JJ frame_NN 
for_IN climate-impact_NN and_CC policy_NN analysis_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Climate_NN

scenarios_NNS ,_, Stabilization_NP ,_, and_CC Transformation_NN pathway_NN ._SENT 
Short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutant_NN (_( SLCP_NP )_) :_: Pollutant_NN emissions_NNS that_WDT have_VHP 
a_DT warming_NN influence_NN on_IN climate_NN and_CC have_VH a_DT relatively_RB short_JJ lifetime_NN in_IN 
the_DT atmosphere_NN (_( a_DT few_JJ days_NNS to_TO a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT main_JJ SLCPs_NNS are_VBP 
black_JJ carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) (_( ‘soot’_NN )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC some_DT hydroflurorcarbons_NNS 
(_( HFCs_NP )_) some_DT of_IN which_WDT are_VBP regulated_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Some_DT pollutants_NNS of_IN this_DT type_NN ,_, including_VVG CH4_NP ,_, are_VBP also_RB precursors_NNS to_TO the_DT 
formation_NN of_IN tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, a_DT strong_JJ warming_NN agent_NN ._SENT These_DT 
pollutants_NNS are_VBP of_IN interest_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS two_CD reasons_NNS ._SENT First_RB ,_, because_IN they_PP 
are_VBP short-lived_JJ ,_, efforts_NNS to_TO control_VV them_PP will_MD have_VH prompt_JJ effects_NNS on_IN 
global_JJ warming_NN —_NN unlike_IN long-lived_JJ pollutants_NNS that_WDT build_VVP up_RP in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN and_CC respond_VV to_TO changes_NNS in_IN emissions_NNS at_IN a_DT more_RBR sluggish_JJ 
pace_NN ._SENT Second_JJ ,_, many_JJ of_IN these_DT pollutants_NNS also_RB have_VHP adverse_JJ local_JJ impacts_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN on_IN human_JJ health_NN ._SENT 
Sink_NN :_: Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN that_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN ,_, or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP or_CC aerosol_NN from_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Smart_JJ grids_NNS :_: A_DT smart_JJ grid_NN uses_VVZ information_NN and_CC communications_NNS technology_NN

the_DT production_NN ,_, distribution_NN ,_, and_CC use_NN of_IN electricity_NN ._SENT Through_IN automated_VVN 
responses_NNS or_CC the_DT provision_NN of_IN price_NN signals_NNS ,_, this_DT information_NN can_MD then_RB 
be_VB used_VVN to_TO improve_VV the_DT efficiency_NN ,_, reliability_NN ,_, economics_NNS ,_, and_CC sustainability_NN 
of_IN the_DT electricity_NN network_NN ._SENT

or_CC gas_NN back_RB to_TO the_DT utility_NN provider_NN ._SENT

(_( with_IN harmful_JJ damages_NNS expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT positive_JJ number_NN )_) from_IN one_CD 
more_JJR tonne_NN of_IN carbon_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, conditional_JJ 
on_IN a_DT global_JJ emissions_NNS trajectory_NN over_IN time_NN ._SENT

factors_NNS relevant_JJ to_TO understanding_VVG the_DT implications_NNS of_IN climate_NN 
change_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, Emission_NN scenario_NN ,_,

Solar_JJ energy_NN :_: Energy_NN from_IN the_DT sun_NN ._SENT Often_RB the_DT phrase_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO mean_VV 
energy_NN that_WDT is_VBZ captured_VVN from_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN either_CC as_IN heat_NN ,_, as_IN light_NN that_RB 
is_VBZ converted_VVN into_IN chemical_JJ energy_NN by_IN natural_JJ or_CC artificial_JJ photosynthesis_NN ,_, 
or_CC by_IN photovoltaic_JJ panels_NNS and_CC converted_VVN directly_RB into_IN electricity_NN ._SENT 
Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP (_( SRM_NP )_) :_: Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP 
refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT intentional_JJ modification_NN of_IN the_DT earth’s_NN shortwave_NN 
radiative_JJ budget_NN with_IN the_DT aim_NN to_TO reduce_VV climate-change_NN according_VVG to_TO a_DT 
given_VVN metric_JJ (_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, regional_JJ impacts_NNS ,_, 
etc._FW )_) ._SENT Artificial_JJ injection_NN of_IN stratospheric_JJ aerosols_NNS and_CC cloud_VVP brightening_VVG 
are_VBP two_CD examples_NNS of_IN SRM_NP techniques_NNS ._SENT Methods_NNS to_TO modify_VV some_DT fastresponding_NN 
elements_NNS of_IN the_DT longwave_NN radiative_JJ budget_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN cirrus_NN 
clouds_NNS )_) ,_, although_IN not_RB strictly_RB speaking_VVG SRM_NP ,_, can_MD be_VB related_VVN to_TO SRM_NP ._SENT 
SRM_NN techniques_NNS do_VVP not_RB fall_VV within_IN the_DT usual_JJ definitions_NNS of_IN mitigation_NN 
and_CC adaptation_NN (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012_CD ,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP 
(_( CDR_NP )_) and_CC Geoengineering_NP ._SENT 
Source_NN :_: Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN that_WDT releases_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP or_CC aerosol_NN into_IN 
the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Source_NN can_MD also_RB refer_VV to_TO ,_, e_NN ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, an_DT energy_NN source_NN ._SENT 
Spill-over_NN effect_NN :_: The_DT effects_NNS of_IN domestic_JJ or_CC sector_NN mitigation_NN measures_NNS 
on_IN other_JJ countries_NNS or_CC sectors_NNS ._SENT Spill-over_NN effects_NNS can_MD be_VB positive_JJ 
or_CC negative_JJ and_CC include_VV effects_NNS on_IN trade_NN ,_, (_( carbon_NN )_) leakage_NN ,_, transfer_VV of_IN 
innovations_NNS ,_, and_CC diffusion_NN of_IN environmentally_RB sound_JJ technology_NN and_CC 
other_JJ issues_NNS ._SENT

(_( 2001_CD )_) and_CC Chapters_NP 10_CD and_CC 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2007_CD )_) as_IN well_RB as_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP ._SENT The_DT 


following_VVG terms_NNS are_VBP relevant_JJ for_IN a_DT better_JJR understanding_NN of_IN the_DT structure_NN 
and_CC use_NN of_IN the_DT set_NN of_IN SRES_NP scenarios_NNS :_:

Marker_NP Scenario_NP :_: A_DT scenario_NN that_WDT was_VBD originally_RB posted_VVN in_IN draft_NN

(_( e_LS ._SENT g_NN ._SENT ,_, grades_NNS ,_, dimensions_NNS ,_, characteristics_NNS ,_, test_NN methods_NNS ,_, and_NP

Subsidiarity_NN :_: The_DT principle_NN that_IN/that decisions_NNS of_IN government_NN (_( other_JJ things_NNS 
being_VBG equal_JJ )_) are_VBP best_RBS made_VVN and_CC implemented_VVN ,_, if_IN possible_JJ ,_, at_IN the_DT lowest_JJS 
most_RBS decentralized_JJ level_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, closest_JJS to_TO the_DT citizen_NN ._SENT Subsidiarity_NN is_VBZ 
designed_VVN to_TO strengthen_VV accountability_NN and_CC reduce_VV the_DT dangers_NNS of_IN making_VVG 
decisions_NNS in_IN places_NNS remote_JJ from_IN their_PP$ point_NN of_IN application_NN ._SENT The_DT principle_NN 
does_VVZ not_RB necessarily_RB limit_VV or_CC constrain_VV the_DT action_NN of_IN higher_JJR orders_NNS 
of_IN government_NN ,_, but_CC merely_RB counsels_VVZ against_IN the_DT unnecessary_JJ assumption_NN 
of_IN responsibilities_NNS at_IN a_DT higher_JJR level_NN ._SENT

Autonomous_JJ (_( exogenous_JJ )_) technological_JJ change_NN :_: Autonomous_JJ 
(_( exogenous_JJ )_) technological_JJ change_NN is_VBZ imposed_VVN from_IN outside_IN the_DT

(_( i_NP ._SENT e_LS ._SENT ,_, as_IN a_DT variable_NN )_) so_IN that_DT factor_NN productivity_NN or_CC the_DT choice_NN of_IN technologies_NNS 
is_VBZ included_VVN within_IN the_DT model_NN and_CC affects_VVZ energy_NN demand_NN 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC economic_JJ growth_NN ._SENT

Uncertainty_NN :_: A_DT cognitive_JJ state_NN of_IN incomplete_JJ knowledge_NN that_WDT can_MD

is_VBZ known_VVN or_CC even_RB knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD have_VH many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, from_IN

Unconventional_JJ resources_NNS :_: A_DT loose_JJ term_NN to_TO describe_VV fossil_JJ fuel_NN

and_CC mining_NN processes_NNS that_WDT dominated_VVD extraction_NN of_IN coal_NN ,_, gas_NN ,_, and_CC oil_NN 
throughout_IN the_DT 20th_JJ century_NN ._SENT The_DT boundary_NN between_IN conventional_JJ and_NP 
unconventional_JJ resources_NNS is_VBZ not_RB clearly_RB defined_VVN ._SENT Unconventional_JJ oils_NNS 
include_VV oil_NN shales_NNS ,_, tar_NN sands_NNS /_SYM bitumen_NN ,_, heavy_JJ and_CC extra_JJ heavy_JJ crude_NN oils_NNS ,_, 
and_CC deep-sea_NN oil_NN occurrences_NNS ._SENT Unconventional_JJ natural_JJ gas_NN includes_VVZ gas_NN

(_( Rogner_NP ,_, 1997_CD )_) ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) :_: The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP York_NP 
and_CC signed_VVN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 
countries_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ 
the_DT ‘stabilisation_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN 
with_IN the_DT climate_NN system’_NN ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS under_IN 
the_DT principle_NN of_IN ‘common_NN but_CC differentiated_VVN responsibilities’_NN ._SENT Under_IN the_DT 
Convention_NN ,_, Parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_PP aimed_VVD to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD 
levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD The_DT convention_NN entered_VVN in_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 
._SENT In_IN 1997_CD ,_, the_DT UNFCCC_NP adopted_VVD the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT

Wind_NN energy_NN :_: Kinetic_JJ energy_NN from_IN air_NN currents_NNS arising_VVG from_IN uneven_JJ

substation_NN ._SENT

Katharine_NP J_NP ._SENT Mach_NP (_( USA_NP )_) ,_, Michael_NP D_NP ._SENT Mastrandrea_NP (_( USA_NP )_) ,_, T_NN ._SENT Eren_NP Bilir_NP (_( USA_NP )_) 
ANNEX_NN 

Annex_NP II_NP Glossary_NP 
II_NP 
Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN 
A_DT large-scale_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT takes_VVZ place_NN over_IN a_DT few_JJ 
decades_NNS or_CC less_JJR ,_, persists_VVZ (_( or_CC is_VBZ anticipated_VVN to_TO persist_VV )_) for_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT few_JJ 
decades_NNS ,_, and_CC causes_VVZ substantial_JJ disruptions_NNS in_IN human_JJ and_CC natural_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT 
Access_NN to_TO food_NN 
One_CD of_IN the_DT three_CD components_NNS underpinning_VVG food_NN security_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ two_CD 
being_VBG availability_NN and_CC utilization_NN ._SENT Access_NN to_TO food_NN is_VBZ dependent_JJ on_IN (_( 1_LS )_) the_DT 
affordability_NN of_IN food_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, people_NNS have_VHP income_NN or_CC other_JJ resources_NNS to_TO 
exchange_NN for_IN food_NN )_) ;_: (_( 2_LS )_) satisfactory_JJ allocation_NN within_IN the_DT household_NN or_CC 
society_NN ;_: and_CC (_( 3_LS )_) preference_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, it_PP is_VBZ what_WP people_NNS want_VVP to_TO eat_VV ,_, influenced_VVN 
by_IN socio-cultural_JJ norms_NNS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Food_NN security_NN ._SENT 
Acclimatization_NN 
A_DT change_NN in_IN functional_JJ or_CC morphological_JJ traits_NNS occurring_VVG once_RB or_CC repeatedly_RB 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, seasonally_RB )_) during_IN the_DT lifetime_NN of_IN an_DT individual_JJ organism_NN in_IN its_PP$ 
natural_JJ environment_NN ._SENT Through_IN acclimatization_NN the_DT individual_NN maintains_VVZ 
performance_NN across_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT For_IN a_DT clear_JJ 
differentiation_NN between_IN findings_NNS in_IN laboratory_NN and_CC field_NN studies_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN 
acclimation_NN is_VBZ used_VVN in_IN ecophysiology_NN for_IN the_DT respective_JJ phenomena_NNS 
when_WRB observed_VVN in_IN well-defined_JJ experimental_JJ settings_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN 
(_( adaptive_JJ )_) plasticity_NN characterizes_VVZ the_DT generally_RB limited_JJ scope_NN of_IN changes_NNS 
in_IN phenotype_NN that_IN/that an_DT individual_NN can_MD reach_VV through_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN 
acclimatization_NN ._SENT 
Adaptability_NN 
See_VV Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation1_NP 
The_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ._SENT 
In_IN human_JJ systems_NNS ,_, adaptation_NN seeks_VVZ to_TO moderate_VV or_CC avoid_VV harm_NN or_CC exploit_VV 
beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT In_IN some_DT natural_JJ systems_NNS ,_, human_JJ intervention_NN 
may_MD facilitate_VV adjustment_NN to_TO expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ._SENT 
Incremental_JJ adaptation_NN Adaptation_NP actions_NNS where_WRB the_DT central_JJ 
aim_NN is_VBZ to_TO maintain_VV the_DT essence_NN and_CC integrity_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN or_CC process_NN 
at_IN a_DT given_VVN scale.2_NN 
Transformational_JJ adaptation_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT changes_VVZ the_DT 
fundamental_JJ attributes_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ 
effects_NNS ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Autonomous_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, Evolutionary_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, and_NP 
Transformation_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN assessment_NN 
The_DT practice_NN of_IN identifying_VVG options_NNS to_TO adapt_VV to_TO climate-change_NN and_NP 
evaluating_VVG them_PP in_IN terms_NNS of_IN criteria_NNS such_JJ as_IN availability_NN ,_, benefits_NNS ,_, costs_NNS ,_, 
effectiveness_NN ,_, efficiency_NN ,_, and_CC feasibility_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN constraint_NN 
Factors_NNS that_WDT make_VVP it_PP harder_JJR to_TO plan_VV and_CC implement_VV adaptation_NN actions_NNS 
or_CC that_WDT restrict_VVP options_NNS ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN deficit_NN 
The_DT gap_NN between_IN the_DT current_JJ state_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN and_CC a_DT state_NN that_RB 
minimizes_VVZ adverse_JJ impacts_NNS from_IN existing_VVG climate_NN conditions_NNS and_CC 
variability_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN limit_NN 
The_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT an_DT actor’s_JJ objectives_NNS (_( or_CC system_NN needs_NNS )_) cannot_MD be_VB 
secured_VVN from_IN intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ actions_NNS ._SENT 
Hard_JJ adaptation_NN limit_VV No_DT adaptive_JJ actions_NNS are_VBP possible_JJ to_TO avoid_VV 
intolerable_JJ risks_NNS ._SENT 
Soft_JJ adaptation_NN limit_NN Options_NNS are_VBP currently_RB not_RB available_JJ to_TO avoid_VV 
intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ action_NN ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN needs_NNS 
The_DT circumstances_NNS requiring_VVG action_NN to_TO ensure_VV safety_NN of_IN populations_NNS and_CC 
security_NN of_IN assets_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO climate_NN impacts_NNS ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN opportunity_NN 
Factors_NNS that_WDT make_VVP it_PP easier_JJR to_TO plan_VV and_CC implement_VV adaptation_NN actions_NNS ,_, 
that_WDT expand_VVP adaptation_NN options_NNS ,_, or_CC that_WDT provide_VVP ancillary_JJ co-benefits_NNS ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN options_NNS 
The_DT array_NN of_IN strategies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS that_WDT are_VBP available_JJ and_CC appropriate_JJ 
for_IN addressing_VVG adaptation_NN needs_NNS ._SENT They_PP include_VVP a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN actions_NNS 
that_DT can_MD be_VB categorized_VVN as_IN structural_JJ ,_, institutional_JJ ,_, or_CC social_JJ ._SENT 
Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN 
The_DT ability_NN of_IN systems_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, humans_NNS ,_, and_CC other_JJ organisms_NNS to_TO 
adjust_VV to_TO potential_JJ damage_NN ,_, to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO 
respond_VV to_TO consequences.3_NN 
Adaptive_JJ management_NN 
A_DT process_NN of_IN iteratively_RB planning_VVG ,_, implementing_VVG ,_, and_CC modifying_VVG strategies_NNS 
for_IN managing_VVG resources_NNS in_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN uncertainty_NN and_CC change_NN ._SENT Adaptive_JJ 
management_NN involves_VVZ adjusting_VVG approaches_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO observations_NNS 
of_IN their_PP$ effect_NN and_CC changes_NNS in_IN the_DT system_NN brought_VVN on_IN by_IN resulting_VVG 
feedback_NN effects_NNS and_CC other_JJ variables_NNS ._SENT 
Aggregate_JJ impacts_NNS 
Total_JJ impacts_NNS integrated_VVN across_IN sectors_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC regions_NNS ._SENT The_DT aggregation_NN 
of_IN impacts_NNS requires_VVZ knowledge_NN of_IN (_( or_CC assumptions_NNS about_RB )_) the_DT relative_NN 
importance_NN of_IN different_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT Measures_NNS of_IN aggregate_JJ impacts_NNS include_VVP ,_, 
for_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN people_NNS affected_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT total_NN economic_JJ 
costs_NNS ,_, and_CC are_VBP usually_RB bound_VVN by_IN time_NN ,_, place_NN ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC sector_NN ._SENT 
Ancillary_JJ benefits_NNS 
See_NP Co-benefits_NP ._SENT 
Anomaly_NN 
The_DT deviation_NN of_IN a_DT variable_NN from_IN its_PP$ value_NN averaged_VVD over_IN a_DT reference_NN 
period_NN ._SENT 
Reflecting_VVG progress_NN in_IN science_NN ,_, this_DT glossary_NN entry_NN differs_VVZ in_IN breadth_NN and_CC focus_NN from_IN the_DT entry_NN used_VVN in_IN the_DT Fourth_JJ Assessment_NP Report_NP and_CC other_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definition_NN used_VVN in_IN Park_NP et_CC al_NP ._SENT (_( 2012_CD )_) ._SENT 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN previous_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS and_CC the_DT Millennium_NP Ecosystem_NP Assessment_NP (_( MEA_NP ,_, 2005_CD )_) ._SENT 


Anthropogenic_JJ 
Resulting_VVG from_IN or_CC produced_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT 
Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS 
Emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, greenhouse_NN gas_NN precursors_NNS ,_, and_NP 
aerosols_NNS caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT activities_NNS include_VVP the_DT burning_NN 
of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN changes_NNS ,_, livestock_NN production_NN ,_, 
fertilization_NN ,_, waste_NN management_NN ,_, and_CC industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT 
Arid_JJ zone_NN 
Areas_NNS where_WRB vegetation_NN growth_NN is_VBZ severely_RB constrained_VVN due_JJ to_TO limited_JJ 
water_NN availability_NN ._SENT For_IN the_DT most_JJS part_NN ,_, the_DT native_JJ vegetation_NN of_IN arid_JJ zones_NNS 
is_VBZ sparse_JJ ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ high_JJ rainfall_NN variability_NN ,_, with_IN annual_JJ averages_NNS below_RB 
mm_NN ._SENT Crop_NN farming_NN in_IN arid_JJ zones_NNS requires_VVZ irrigation_NN ._SENT 
Atlantic_NP Multi-decadal_NP Oscillation_NP /_SYM Variability_NP (_( AMO_NP /_SYM AMV_NP )_) 
A_DT multi-decadal_JJ (_( 65-_CD to_TO 75-year_NP )_) fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP ,_, in_RB 
which_WDT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS showed_VVD warm_JJ phases_NNS during_IN roughly_RB 
to_TO 1880_CD and_CC 1930_CD to_TO 1960_CD and_CC cool_JJ phases_NNS during_IN 1905_CD to_TO 1925_CD 
and_CC 1970_CD to_TO 1990_CD with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN approximately_RB 0.4_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT See_VV AMO_NP Index_NP 
in_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 2.5_NP ._SENT

Baseline_NN /_SYM reference_NN 
The_DT baseline_NN (_( or_CC reference_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT state_NN against_IN which_WDT change_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN ._SENT 
A_DT baseline_NN period_NN is_VBZ the_DT period_NN relative_NN to_TO which_WDT anomalies_NNS are_VBP computed_VVN ._SENT 
The_DT baseline_JJ concentration_NN of_IN a_DT trace_NN gas_NN is_VBZ that_IN/that measured_VVN at_IN a_DT location_NN 
not_RB influenced_VVN by_IN local_JJ anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT

other_JJ ecosystems_NNS ._SENT Biodiversity_NP includes_VVZ variability_NN at_IN the_DT genetic_JJ ,_, species_NNS ,_, 
and_CC ecosystem_NN levels.4_NN

Biofuel_NP 
A_DT fuel_NN ,_, generally_RB in_IN liquid_JJ form_NN ,_, developed_VVN from_IN organic_JJ matter_NN or_CC 
combustible_JJ oils_NNS produced_VVN by_IN living_VVG or_CC recently_RB living_VVG plants_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS 
of_IN biofuel_NN include_VVP alcohol_NN (_( bioethanol_NN )_) ,_, black_JJ liquor_NN from_IN the_DT papermanufacturing_NN 
process_NN ,_, and_CC soybean_NN oil_NN ._SENT 
First-generation_NN manufactured_VVD biofuel_NN First-generation_NN 
manufactured_VVN biofuel_NN is_VBZ derived_VVN from_IN grains_NNS ,_, oilseeds_NNS ,_, animal_JJ fats_NNS ,_, 
and_CC waste_NN vegetable_NN oils_NNS with_IN mature_JJ conversion_NN technologies_NNS ._SENT 
Second-generation_NN biofuel_NN Second-generation_NN biofuel_NN uses_VVZ nontraditional_JJ

for_IN example_NN ,_, agricultural_JJ and_CC forestry_NN residues_NNS ,_, municipal_JJ solid_JJ 
waste_NN ,_, etc._FW

Biome_NN

organisms_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, on_IN land_NN (_( terrestrial_JJ biosphere_NN )_) ,_, or_CC in_IN the_DT

Carbon_NN cycle_NN 
The_DT term_NN used_VVN to_TO describe_VV the_DT flow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, as_RB 
carbon_NN dioxide_NN )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, ocean_NN ,_, terrestrial_JJ and_CC marine_JJ

global_JJ carbon_NN cycle_NN is_VBZ GtC_NP or_CC equivalently_RB PgC_NP (_( 1015g_NP )_) ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) 
A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, also_RB a_DT by-product_NN of_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS from_IN 
fossil_JJ carbon_NN deposits_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN oil_NN ,_, gas_NN ,_, and_CC coal_NN ,_, of_IN burning_NN biomass_NN ,_, of_IN 
land_NN use_NN changes_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ processes_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, cement_NN production_NN )_) ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT Earth’s_NP 
radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB has_VHZ a_DT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ of_IN 1._CD

Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP (_( CDM_NP )_)

which_WDT investors_NNS (_( governments_NNS or_CC companies_NNS )_) from_IN developed_JJ (_( Annex_NP 
B_LS )_) countries_NNS may_MD finance_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emission_NN reduction_NN or_CC removal_NN 
projects_NNS in_IN developing_VVG (_( Non-Annex_NP B_NP )_) countries_NNS ,_, and_CC receive_VV Certified_NP 
Emission_NN Reduction_NN Units_NNS for_IN doing_VVG so_RB ,_, which_WDT can_MD be_VB credited_VVN towards_IN 
the_DT commitments_NNS of_IN the_DT respective_JJ developed_JJ countries_NNS ._SENT The_DT CDM_NP is_VBZ 
intended_VVN to_TO facilitate_VV the_DT two_CD objectives_NNS of_IN promoting_VVG sustainable_JJ 
development_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS and_CC of_IN helping_VVG industrialized_JJ

Climate_NN 
Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_JJ weather_NN ,_, or_CC 
more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_NP 
variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS 
to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN for_IN averaging_NN 
these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP 
Organization_NN ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN 
is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
Climate-altering_NP pollutants_NNS (_( CAPs_NP )_) 
Gases_NNS and_CC particles_NNS released_VVN from_IN human_JJ activities_NNS that_WDT affect_VVP the_DT 
climate_NN either_CC directly_RB ,_, through_IN mechanisms_NNS such_JJ as_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
from_IN changes_NNS in_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS ,_, or_CC indirectly_RB ,_, by_IN ,_, for_IN 
example_NN ,_, affecting_VVG cloud_NN formation_NN or_CC the_DT lifetime_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS 
in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT CAPs_NNS include_VVP both_CC those_DT pollutants_NNS that_WDT have_VHP a_DT 
warming_NN effect_NN on_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN CO2_NP ,_, and_CC those_DT with_IN cooling_VVG 
effects_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN sulfates_NNS ._SENT 
climate-change_NN 
climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD 
be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_NN 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS ,_, and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ 
period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO 
natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS of_IN 
the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, and_CC persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ 
changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN 
that_IN/that the_DT Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ 
Article_NN 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ climate-change_NN as_RB :_: “_NN a_DT change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ 
attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT 
composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO 
natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVN over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods_NNS ._SENT ”_NP The_NP 
UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN climate-change_NN attributable_JJ 
to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, and_CC climate_NN 
variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN 
commitment_NN and_CC Detection_NP and_CC Attribution_NP ._SENT 
climate-change_NN commitment_NN 
Due_JJ to_TO the_DT thermal_JJ inertia_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC slow_JJ processes_NNS in_IN the_DT 
cryosphere_NN and_CC land_NN surfaces_NNS ,_, the_DT climate_NN would_MD continue_VV to_TO change_VV 
even_RB if_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN were_VBD held_VVN fixed_VVN at_IN today’s_NN values_NNS ._SENT 
Past_JJ change_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ composition_NN leads_VVZ to_TO a_DT committed_JJ climate_NN 
change_NN ,_, which_WDT continues_VVZ for_IN as_RB long_JJ as_IN a_DT radiative_JJ imbalance_NN persists_VVZ 
and_CC until_IN all_DT components_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN have_VHP adjusted_VVN to_TO a_DT new_JJ 
state_NN ._SENT The_DT further_JJR change_NN in_IN temperature_NN after_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN is_VBZ held_VVN constant_JJ is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT constant_JJ composition_NN 
temperature_NN commitment_NN or_CC simply_RB committed_VVN warming_NN or_CC warming_NN 
commitment_NN ._SENT climate-change_NN commitment_NN includes_VVZ other_JJ future_NN 
changes_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN 
events_NNS ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ climate_NN events_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN sea_NN level_NN change_NN ._SENT The_DT constant_JJ 
emission_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD 
result_NN from_IN keeping_VVG anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS constant_JJ and_CC the_DT zero_NN 
emission_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT climate-change_NN commitment_NN when_WRB emissions_NNS 
are_VBP set_VVN to_TO zero_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN extreme_NN (_( Extreme_NP weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN )_)

Climate_NN feedback_NN 
An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN in_IN one_CD climate_NN quantity_NN causes_NNS 
a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB 
leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN 
which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ weakened_VVN by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT 
positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT 
In_IN this_DT Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, a_DT somewhat_RB narrower_JJR definition_NN is_VBZ often_RB 
used_VVN in_IN which_WDT the_DT climate_NN quantity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ perturbed_VVN is_VBZ the_DT global_JJ mean_NN 
surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN turn_NN causes_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT global_JJ 
radiation_NN budget_NN ._SENT In_IN either_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN can_MD either_RB be_VB 
externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN governance_NN 
Purposeful_JJ mechanisms_NNS and_CC measures_NNS aimed_VVN at_IN steering_VVG social_JJ systems_NNS 
towards_IN preventing_VVG ,_, mitigating_VVG ,_, or_CC adapting_VVG to_TO the_DT risks_NNS posed_VVN by_IN climate_NN 
change_VV (_( Jagers_NP and_CC Stripple_NP ,_, 2003_CD )_) ._SENT 
Climate_NN model_NN (_( spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN )_) 
A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, 
chemical_NN ,_, and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS ,_, 
and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, and_CC accounting_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD be_VB represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ;_: 
that_DT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS ,_, a_DT 
spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ 


aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT 
physical_JJ ,_, chemical_NN ,_, or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC 
the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parameterizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT Coupled_VVN 
Atmosphere-Ocean_NP General_NP Circulation_NP Models_NPS (_( AOGCMs_NP )_) provide_VVP a_DT 
representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ near_JJ or_CC at_IN the_DT most_JJS 
comprehensive_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN currently_RB available_JJ ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT 
evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC 
biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC 
simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, 
seasonal_JJ ,_, and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Earth_NP System_NP 
Model_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN prediction_NN 
A_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC climate_NN forecast_NN is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO 
produce_VV (_( starting_VVG from_IN a_DT particular_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN )_) an_DT 
estimate_NN of_IN the_DT actual_JJ evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN in_IN the_DT future_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, 
at_IN seasonal_JJ ,_, interannual_JJ ,_, or_CC decadal_JJ time_NN scales_NNS ._SENT Because_IN the_DT future_NN 
evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN may_MD be_VB highly_RB sensitive_JJ to_TO initial_JJ 
conditions_NNS ,_, such_JJ predictions_NNS are_VBP usually_RB probabilistic_JJ in_IN nature_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Climate_NN projection_NN ,_, Climate_NN scenario_NN ,_, and_CC Predictability_NP ._SENT 
Climate_NN projection_NN 
A_DT climate_NN projection_NN is_VBZ the_DT simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO 
a_DT scenario_NN of_IN future_JJ emission_NN or_CC concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC 
aerosols_NNS ,_, generally_RB derived_VVN using_VVG climate_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS 
are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN predictions_NNS by_IN their_PP$ dependence_NN on_IN the_DT 
emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative-forcing_JJ scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN turn_NN 
based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ 
and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Climate_NN scenario_NN ._SENT 
Climate-resilient_JJ pathways_NNS 
Iterative_JJ processes_NNS for_IN managing_VVG change_NN within_IN complex_JJ systems_NNS in_IN 
order_NN to_TO reduce_VV disruptions_NNS and_CC enhance_VV opportunities_NNS associated_VVN with_IN 
climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN scenario_NN 
A_DT plausible_JJ and_CC often_RB simplified_VVN representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ climate_NN ,_, 
based_VVN on_IN an_DT internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN climatological_JJ relationships_NNS that_RB 
has_VHZ been_VBN constructed_VVN for_IN explicit_JJ use_NN in_IN investigating_VVG the_DT potential_NN 
consequences_NNS of_IN anthropogenic_JJ climate-change_NN ,_, often_RB serving_VVG as_IN input_NN 
to_TO impact_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS often_RB serve_VVP as_IN the_DT raw_JJ material_NN 
for_IN constructing_VVG climate_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, but_CC climate_NN scenarios_NNS usually_RB require_VVP 
additional_JJ information_NN such_JJ as_IN the_DT observed_JJ current_JJ climate_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Emission_NN scenario_NN and_CC Scenario_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
In_IN IPCC_NP reports_NNS ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT 
equilibrium_NN (_( steady_JJ state_NN )_) change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN 
temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ equivalent_NN carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN concentration_NN ._SENT Owing_VVG to_TO computational_JJ constraints_NNS ,_, the_DT 
equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB estimated_VVN 
by_IN running_VVG an_DT atmospheric_JJ general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN coupled_VVN to_TO a_DT 
mixed-layer_NN ocean_NN model_NN ,_, because_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ 
largely_RB determined_VVN by_IN atmospheric_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Efficient_JJ models_NNS can_MD be_VB run_VVN 
to_TO equilibrium_NN with_IN a_DT dynamic_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN 
(_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) –_NP 1_CD )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ 
global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ 
forcing_VVG ._SENT 
The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO doubled_VVN carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
concentration_NN that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN 
evolving_VVG non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN 
the_DT climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG 
history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT 
The_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ 
mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, averaged_VVN over_IN a_DT 20-year_JJ period_NN ,_, centered_VVD 
at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN doubling_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN 
simulation_NN in_IN which_WDT CO2_NP increases_VVZ at_IN 1_CD %_NN yr_NN –_NN 1._CD It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT 
strength_NN and_CC rapidity_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN forcing_VVG ._SENT 
climate-system_NN 
The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ 
components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT 
lithosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS among_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT 
climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ 
dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, 
solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT changing_NN 
composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN variability_NN 
Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ 
statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, 
etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_DT of_IN 
individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ 
processes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC to_TO variations_NNS 
in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN velocity_NN 
The_DT speed_NN at_IN which_WDT isolines_NNS of_IN a_DT specified_JJ climate_NN variable_NN travel_VV across_RP 
landscapes_NNS or_CC seascapes_NNS due_JJ to_TO changing_VVG climate_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, climate_NN

changing_VVG climate_NN (_( km_NN yr_NN –_NP 1_CD )_) and_CC is_VBZ calculated_VVN as_IN the_DT temporal_JJ change_NN 
in_IN temperature_NN (_( °_SYM C_NP yr_NN –_NP 1_CD )_) divided_VVN by_IN the_DT current_JJ spatial_JJ gradient_NN in_IN 
temperature_NN (_( °_SYM C_NP km_NN –_NP 1_CD )_) ._SENT It_PP can_MD be_VB calculated_VVN using_VVG additional_JJ climate_NN 
variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN precipitation_NN or_CC can_MD be_VB based_VVN on_IN the_DT climatic_JJ niche_NN of_IN 
organisms_NNS ._SENT

of_IN a_DT human_JJ or_CC natural_JJ system_NN ._SENT

Convection_NN 
Vertical_JJ motion_NN driven_VVN by_IN buoyancy_NN forces_NNS arising_VVG from_IN static_JJ instability_NN ,_, 
usually_RB caused_VVN by_IN near-surface_NN cooling_NN or_CC increases_NNS in_IN salinity_NN in_IN the_DT 
case_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC near-surface_NN warming_NN or_CC cloud-top_JJ radiative_JJ 
cooling_VVG in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, convection_NN 
gives_VVZ rise_NN to_TO cumulus_NN clouds_NNS and_CC precipitation_NN and_CC is_VBZ effective_JJ at_IN both_DT 
scavenging_VVG and_CC vertically_RB transporting_VVG chemical_NN species_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, 
convection_NN can_MD carry_VV surface_NN waters_NNS to_TO deep_JJ within_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT

Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN 
Detection_NN of_IN change_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN demonstrating_VVG that_DT 
climate_NN or_CC a_DT system_NN affected_VVN by_IN climate_NN has_VHZ changed_VVN in_IN some_DT defined_VVN 
statistical_JJ sense_NN ,_, without_IN providing_VVG a_DT reason_NN for_IN that_DT change_NN ._SENT An_DT identified_VVD 
change_NN is_VBZ detected_VVN in_IN observations_NNS if_IN its_PP$ likelihood_NN of_IN occurrence_NN by_IN 
chance_NN due_JJ to_TO internal_JJ variability_NN alone_RB is_VBZ determined_VVN to_TO be_VB small_JJ ,_, for_IN 
example_NN ,_, <_SYM 10_CD %_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN evaluating_VVG the_DT 
relative_JJ contributions_NNS of_IN multiple_JJ causal_JJ factors_NNS to_TO a_DT change_NN or_CC event_NN 
with_IN an_DT assignment_NN of_IN statistical_JJ confidence_NN (_( Hegerl_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT

(_( e.g._FW ,_, due_JJ to_TO land_VV use_NN change_NN )_) ._SENT

for_IN recovery_NN ._SENT

Discounting_NN 
A_DT mathematical_JJ operation_NN making_VVG monetary_JJ (_( or_CC other_JJ )_) amounts_NNS received_VVD 
or_CC expended_VVN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS (_( years_NNS )_) comparable_JJ across_IN time_NN ._SENT The_DT 
discounter_NN uses_VVZ a_DT fixed_VVN or_CC possibly_RB time-varying_JJ discount_NN rate_NN (_( >_SYM 0_CD )_) from_IN 
year_NN to_TO year_NN that_WDT makes_VVZ future_JJ value_NN worth_NN less_CC today_NN ._SENT

Downscaling_NP 
Downscaling_NP is_VBZ a_DT method_NN that_WDT derives_VVZ local-_NN to_TO regional-scale_VV (_( 10_LS to_TO 
km_NN )_) information_NN from_IN larger-scale_JJ models_NNS or_CC data_NNS analyses_NNS ._SENT Two_CD 
main_JJ methods_NNS exist_VVP :_: dynamical_JJ downscaling_NN and_CC empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ 
downscaling_NN ._SENT The_DT dynamical_JJ method_NN uses_VVZ the_DT output_NN of_IN regional_JJ climate_NN 
models_NNS ,_, global_JJ models_NNS with_IN variable_JJ spatial_JJ resolution_NN ,_, or_CC high-resolution_NN 
global_JJ models_NNS ._SENT The_DT empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ methods_NNS develop_VVP statistical_JJ 
relationships_NNS that_WDT link_VVP the_DT large-scale_JJ atmospheric_JJ variables_NNS with_IN local_NN /_SYM 
regional_JJ climate_NN variables_NNS ._SENT In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT driving_VVG model_NN 
remains_VVZ an_DT important_JJ limitation_NN on_IN quality_NN of_IN the_DT downscaled_JJ information_NN ._SENT 
Drought_NN 
A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB dry_JJ weather_NN long_RB enough_RB to_TO cause_VV a_DT serious_JJ 
hydrological_JJ imbalance_NN ._SENT Drought_NN is_VBZ a_DT relative_JJ term_NN ;_: therefore_RB any_RB 
discussion_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN precipitation_NN deficit_NN must_MD refer_VV to_TO the_DT particular_JJ 
precipitation-related_JJ activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ under_IN discussion_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, 
shortage_NN of_IN precipitation_NN during_IN the_DT growing_VVG season_NN impinges_VVZ on_IN crop_NN 
production_NN or_CC ecosystem_NN function_NN in_IN general_JJ (_( due_JJ to_TO soil_NN moisture_NN 
drought_NN ,_, also_RB termed_VVD agricultural_JJ drought_NN )_) ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT runoff_NN and_CC 
percolation_NN season_NN primarily_RB affects_VVZ water_NN supplies_NNS (_( hydrological_JJ drought_NN )_) ._SENT 
Storage_NN changes_NNS in_IN soil_NN moisture_NN and_CC groundwater_NN are_VBP also_RB affected_VVN 
by_IN increases_NNS in_IN actual_JJ evapotranspiration_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO reductions_NNS in_IN 
precipitation_NN ._SENT A_DT period_NN with_IN an_DT abnormal_JJ precipitation_NN deficit_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN 
as_IN a_DT meteorological_JJ drought_NN ._SENT A_DT megadrought_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB lengthy_JJ and_CC 
pervasive_JJ drought_NN ,_, lasting_VVG much_RB longer_RBR than_IN normal_JJ ,_, usually_RB a_DT decade_NN 
or_CC more_JJR ._SENT For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 2.4_NP ._SENT

Earth_NP System_NP Model_NP (_( ESM_NP )_)

representation_NN of_IN the_DT carbon_NN cycle_NN is_VBZ included_VVN ,_, allowing_VVG for_IN interactive_JJ 
calculation_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP or_CC compatible_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Additional_JJ 
components_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmospheric_JJ chemistry_NN ,_, ice_NN sheets_NNS ,_, dynamic_JJ vegetation_NN ,_,

also_RB Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT

Annex_NP II_NP Glossary_NP 
II_NP 
Ecophysiological_JJ process_NN 
Processes_NNS in_IN which_WDT individual_JJ organisms_NNS respond_VVP continuously_RB to_TO 
environmental_JJ variability_NN or_CC change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN climate-change_NN ,_, generally_RB 
at_IN a_DT microscopic_JJ or_CC sub-organ_JJ scale_NN ._SENT Ecophysiological_JJ mechanisms_NNS 
underpin_VV individual_JJ organisms’_JJ tolerance_NN to_TO environmental_JJ stress_NN ,_, and_NP 
comprise_VV a_DT broad_JJ range_NN of_IN responses_NNS defining_VVG the_DT absolute_JJ tolerances_NNS 
by_IN individuals_NNS of_IN environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT Ecophysiological_JJ responses_NNS 
may_MD scale_VV up_RP to_TO control_VV species’_JJ geographic_JJ ranges_NNS ._SENT 
Ecosystem_NN 
A_DT functional_JJ unit_NN consisting_VVG of_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS ,_, their_PP$ non-living_NN 
environment_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS within_IN and_CC between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT 
components_NNS included_VVD in_IN a_DT given_VVN ecosystem_NN and_CC its_PP$ spatial_JJ boundaries_NNS 
depend_VV on_IN the_DT purpose_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN :_: in_IN some_DT cases_NNS 
they_PP are_VBP relatively_RB sharp_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS they_PP are_VBP diffuse_JJ ._SENT Ecosystem_NN 
boundaries_NNS can_MD change_VV over_IN time_NN ._SENT Ecosystems_NNS are_VBP nested_VVN within_IN other_JJ 
ecosystems_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PP$ scale_NN can_MD range_VV from_IN very_RB small_JJ to_TO the_DT entire_NN 
biosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT current_JJ era_NN ,_, most_JJS ecosystems_NNS either_CC contain_VV people_NNS as_RB 
key_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, or_CC are_VBP influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS in_IN 
their_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT 
Ecosystem_NN approach_NN 
A_DT strategy_NN for_IN the_DT integrated_JJ management_NN of_IN land_NN ,_, water_NN ,_, and_CC living_NN 
resources_NNS that_WDT promotes_VVZ conservation_NN and_CC sustainable_JJ use_NN in_IN an_DT equitable_JJ 
way_NN ._SENT An_DT ecosystem_NN approach_NN is_VBZ based_VVN on_IN the_DT application_NN of_IN scientific_JJ 
methodologies_NNS focused_VVN on_IN levels_NNS of_IN biological_JJ organization_NN ,_, which_WDT 
encompass_VV the_DT essential_JJ structure_NN ,_, processes_NNS ,_, functions_NNS ,_, and_CC interactions_NNS 
of_IN organisms_NNS and_CC their_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT It_PP recognizes_VVZ that_IN/that humans_NNS ,_, with_IN 
their_PP$ cultural_JJ diversity_NN ,_, are_VBP an_DT integral_JJ component_NN of_IN many_JJ ecosystems_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT ecosystem_NN approach_NN requires_VVZ adaptive_JJ management_NN to_TO deal_VV with_IN 
the_DT complex_JJ and_CC dynamic_JJ nature_NN of_IN ecosystems_NNS and_CC the_DT absence_NN of_IN 
complete_JJ knowledge_NN or_CC understanding_NN of_IN their_PP$ functioning_NN ._SENT Priority_NN 
targets_NNS are_VBP conservation_NN of_IN biodiversity_NN and_CC of_IN the_DT ecosystem_NN structure_NN 
and_CC functioning_VVG ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO maintain_VV ecosystem_NN services.8_NN 
Ecosystem-based_JJ adaptation_NN 
The_DT use_NN of_IN biodiversity_NN and_CC ecosystem_NN services_NNS as_IN part_NN of_IN an_DT overall_JJ 
adaptation_NN strategy_NN to_TO help_VV people_NNS to_TO adapt_VV to_TO the_DT adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN 
climate-change_NN ._SENT Ecosystem-based_JJ adaptation_NN uses_VVZ the_DT range_NN of_IN 
opportunities_NNS for_IN the_DT sustainable_JJ management_NN ,_, conservation_NN ,_, and_NP 
restoration_NN of_IN ecosystems_NNS to_TO provide_VV services_NNS that_WDT enable_VVP people_NNS to_TO 
adapt_VV to_TO the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT It_PP aims_VVZ to_TO maintain_VV and_CC increase_VV 
the_DT resilience_NN and_CC reduce_VV the_DT vulnerability_NN of_IN ecosystems_NNS and_CC people_NNS in_IN 
the_DT face_NN of_IN the_DT adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Ecosystem-based_JJ 
adaptation_NN is_VBZ most_RBS appropriately_RB integrated_VVN into_IN broader_JJR adaptation_NN 
and_CC development_NN strategies_NNS (_( CBD_NP ,_, 2009_CD )_) ._SENT 
Ecosystem_NN services_NNS 
Ecological_JJ processes_NNS or_CC functions_NNS having_VHG monetary_JJ or_CC non-monetary_JJ 
value_NN to_TO individuals_NNS or_CC society_NN at_IN large_JJ ._SENT These_DT are_VBP frequently_RB classified_VVN as_RB 
(_( 1_CD )_) supporting_VVG services_NNS such_JJ as_IN productivity_NN or_CC biodiversity_NN maintenance_NN ,_, 
(_( 2_CD )_) provisioning_VVG services_NNS such_JJ as_IN food_NN ,_, fiber_NN ,_, or_CC fish_NN ,_, (_( 3_LS )_) regulating_VVG services_NNS 
such_JJ as_IN climate_NN regulation_NN or_CC carbon_NN sequestration_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 4_LS )_) cultural_JJ 
services_NNS such_JJ as_IN tourism_NN or_CC spiritual_JJ and_CC aesthetic_JJ appreciation_NN ._SENT 
El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) 
The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD initially_RB used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_JJ 
that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG 
the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ since_RB become_VVN identified_VVN with_IN a_DT basin-wide_JJ 
warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP east_RB of_IN the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ 
event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN a_DT global-scale_JJ tropical_JJ and_NP 
subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT 
coupled_VVN atmosphere-ocean_JJ phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ time_NN scales_NNS of_IN 
to_TO about_RB 7_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN difference_NN between_IN 
Tahiti_NP and_CC Darwin_NP or_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT central_JJ and_NP 
eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_JJ trade_NN 
winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS such_PDT that_DT 
the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT trade_NN winds_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT event_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, 
and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ effects_NNS 
throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, 
through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP 
Niña_NP ._SENT For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 2.5_NP ._SENT 
Emergent_JJ risk_NN

system_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT risk_NN caused_VVD when_WRB geographic_JJ shifts_NNS in_IN human_JJ 
population_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO climate-change_NN lead_NN to_TO increased_VVN vulnerability_NN 
and_CC exposure_NN of_IN populations_NNS in_IN the_DT receiving_VVG region_NN ._SENT 
Emission_NN scenario_NN 
A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ development_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN 
substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP potentially_RB radiatively_RB active_JJ (_( e.g._FW ,_, greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN 
of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN driving_JJ forces_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN demographic_JJ and_NP 
socioeconomic_JJ development_NN ,_, technological_JJ change_NN )_) and_CC their_PP$ key_NN 
relationships_NNS ._SENT Concentration_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, derived_VVN from_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, 
are_VBP used_VVN as_IN input_NN to_TO a_DT climate_NN model_NN to_TO compute_VV climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT In_RB 
IPCC_NP (_( 1992_CD )_) a_DT set_NN of_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS was_VBD presented_VVN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD used_VVN 
as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN projections_NNS in_IN IPCC_NP (_( 1996_CD )_) ._SENT These_DT emission_NN 
scenarios_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT IS92_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ 
Report_NN on_IN Emissions_NP Scenarios_NP (_( Nakićenović_NP and_CC Swart_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) emission_NN 
scenarios_NNS ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ SRES_NP scenarios_NNS ,_, were_VBD published_VVN ,_, some_DT of_IN which_WDT 
were_VBD used_VVN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN projections_NNS 
presented_VVN in_IN Chapters_NP 9_CD to_TO 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2001_CD )_) and_CC Chapters_NP 10_CD and_CC 11_CD 
of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2007_CD )_) ._SENT New_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS for_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT four_CD 
Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP ,_, were_VBD developed_VVN for_IN ,_, but_RB 
independently_RB of_IN ,_, the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP assessment_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN 
scenario_NN and_CC Scenario_NN ._SENT 
Ensemble_NN 
A_DT collection_NN of_IN model_NN simulations_NNS characterizing_VVG a_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC 
projection_NN ._SENT Differences_NNS in_IN initial_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC model_NN formulation_NN result_NN 
in_IN different_JJ evolutions_NNS of_IN the_DT modeled_VVN system_NN and_CC may_MD give_VV information_NN 
on_IN uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN model_NN error_NN and_CC error_NN in_IN initial_JJ conditions_NNS 
in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN climate_NN forecasts_NNS and_CC on_IN uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN 
model_NN error_NN and_CC with_IN internally_RB generated_VVN climate_NN variability_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN 
of_IN climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN CBD_NNS (_( 2000_CD )_) ,_, MEA_NP (_( 2005_CD )_) ,_, and_CC the_DT Fourth_JJ Assessment_NP Report_NP ._SENT 


Environmental_JJ migration_NN 
Human_JJ migration_NN involves_VVZ movement_NN over_IN a_DT significant_JJ distance_NN and_CC 
duration_NN ._SENT Environmental_JJ migration_NN refers_VVZ to_TO human_JJ migration_NN where_WRB 
environmental_JJ risks_NNS or_CC environmental_JJ change_NN plays_VVZ a_DT significant_JJ role_NN in_IN 
influencing_VVG the_DT migration_NN decision_NN and_CC destination_NN ._SENT Migration_NN may_MD 
involve_VV distinct_JJ categories_NNS such_JJ as_IN direct_JJ ,_, involuntary_JJ ,_, and_CC temporary_JJ 
displacement_NN due_JJ to_TO weather-related_JJ disasters_NNS ;_: voluntary_JJ relocation_NN as_RB 
settlements_NNS and_CC economies_NNS become_VVP less_RBR viable_JJ ;_: or_CC planned_JJ resettlement_NN 
encouraged_VVN by_IN government_NN actions_NNS or_CC incentives_NNS ._SENT All_DT migration_NN decisions_NNS 
are_VBP multi-causal_JJ ,_, and_CC hence_RB it_PP is_VBZ not_RB meaningful_JJ to_TO describe_VV any_DT migrant_NN 
flow_NN as_IN being_VBG solely_RB for_IN environmental_JJ reasons_NNS ._SENT

Eutrophication_NN 
Over-enrichment_NN of_IN water_NN by_IN nutrients_NNS such_JJ as_IN nitrogen_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ._SENT 
It_PP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT leading_VVG causes_NNS of_IN water_NN quality_NN impairment_NN ._SENT The_DT two_CD most_RBS 
acute_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN eutrophication_NN are_VBP hypoxia_NN (_( or_CC oxygen_NN depletion_NN )_) 
and_CC harmful_JJ algal_JJ blooms_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Dead_NP zones_NNS ._SENT 
Evolutionary_JJ adaptation_NN 
For_IN a_DT population_NN or_CC species_NNS ,_, change_NN in_IN functional_JJ characteristics_NNS as_IN a_DT result_NN 
of_IN selection_NN acting_VVG on_IN heritable_JJ traits_NNS ._SENT The_DT rate_NN of_IN evolutionary_JJ adaptation_NN

and_CC degree_NN of_IN outcrossing_VVG (_( as_RB opposed_VVN to_TO inbreeding_VVG )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Adaptation_NP ._SENT 
Exposure_NN

functions_NNS ,_, services_NNS ,_, and_CC resources_NNS ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, or_CC economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, or_CC

External_JJ forcing_VVG 
External_JJ forcing_JJ refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT forcing_VVG agent_NN outside_IN the_DT climate-system_NN 
causing_VVG a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC 
land_NN use_NN change_NN are_VBP external_JJ forcings_NNS ._SENT Orbital_NN forcing_VVG is_VBZ also_RB an_DT external_JJ 
forcing_VVG as_IN the_DT insolation_NN changes_NNS with_IN orbital_JJ parameters_NNS eccentricity_NN ,_, 
tilt_NN ,_, and_CC precession_NN of_IN the_DT equinox_NN ._SENT 
Externalities_NNS /_SYM external_JJ costs_NNS /_SYM external_JJ benefits_NNS 
Externalities_NNS arise_VVP from_IN a_DT human_JJ activity_NN when_WRB agents_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN 
the_DT activity_NN do_VVP not_RB take_VV full_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT activity’s_NNS impacts_NNS on_IN others’_NN 
production_NN and_CC consumption_NN possibilities_NNS ,_, and_CC no_DT compensation_NN exists_VVZ 
for_IN such_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT When_WRB the_DT impacts_NNS are_VBP negative_JJ ,_, they_PP are_VBP external_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT 
When_WRB the_DT impacts_NNS are_VBP positive_JJ ,_, they_PP are_VBP external_JJ benefits_NNS ._SENT 
Extratropical_JJ cyclone_NN 
A_DT large-scale_JJ (_( of_IN order_NN 1000_CD km_NN )_) storm_NN in_IN the_DT middle_JJ or_CC high_JJ latitudes_NNS 
having_VHG low_JJ central_JJ pressure_NN and_CC fronts_NNS with_IN strong_JJ horizontal_JJ gradients_NNS 
in_IN temperature_NN and_CC humidity_NN ._SENT A_DT major_JJ cause_NN of_IN extreme_JJ wind_NN speeds_NNS 
and_CC heavy_JJ precipitation_NN especially_RB in_IN wintertime_NN ._SENT

Extreme_JJ weather_NN event_NN 
An_DT extreme_JJ weather_NN event_NN is_VBZ an_DT event_NN that_WDT is_VBZ rare_JJ at_IN a_DT particular_JJ place_NN 
and_CC time_NN of_IN year_NN ._SENT Definitions_NNS of_IN rare_JJ vary_VVP ,_, but_CC an_DT extreme_JJ weather_NN event_NN 
would_MD normally_RB be_VB as_RB rare_JJ as_IN or_CC rarer_JJR than_IN the_DT 10th_JJ or_CC 90th_JJ percentile_NN 
of_IN a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN estimated_VVN from_IN observations_NNS ._SENT By_IN 
definition_NN ,_, the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN what_WP is_VBZ called_VVN extreme_JJ weather_NN may_MD vary_VV 
from_IN place_NN to_TO place_VV in_IN an_DT absolute_JJ sense_NN ._SENT When_WRB a_DT pattern_NN of_IN extreme_NN 
weather_NN persists_VVZ for_IN some_DT time_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT season_NN ,_, it_PP may_MD be_VB classed_VVN as_RB 
an_DT extreme_JJ climate_NN event_NN ,_, especially_RB if_IN it_PP yields_VVZ an_DT average_NN or_CC total_VV that_DT 
is_VBZ itself_PP extreme_JJ (_( e.g._FW ,_, drought_NN or_CC heavy_JJ rainfall_NN over_IN a_DT season_NN )_) ._SENT 
Famine_NN 
Scarcity_NN of_IN food_NN over_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN and_CC over_IN a_DT large_JJ geographical_JJ 
area_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT country_NN ,_, or_CC lack_NN of_IN access_NN to_TO food_NN for_IN socioeconomic_JJ ,_, 
political_JJ ,_, or_CC cultural_JJ reasons_NNS ._SENT Famines_NNS may_MD be_VB caused_VVN by_IN climate-related_JJ 
extreme_JJ events_NNS such_JJ as_IN droughts_NNS or_CC floods_NNS and_CC by_IN disease_NN ,_, war_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ 
factors_NNS ._SENT

does_VVZ not_RB include_VV the_DT presence_NN or_CC absence_NN of_IN fuel_NN load_NN ._SENT 
Fitness_NP (_( Darwinian_JJ )_) 
Fitness_NP is_VBZ the_DT relative_JJ capacity_NN of_IN an_DT individual_NN or_CC genotype_NN to_TO both_DT

genotype_NN to_TO the_DT gene_NN pool_NN of_IN the_DT next_JJ generations_NNS ._SENT During_IN evolution_NN ,_,

the_DT functions_NNS become_VVP more_RBR common_JJ over_IN generations_NNS ._SENT

Floods_NNS include_VVP river_NN (_( fluvial_JJ )_) floods_NNS ,_, flash_JJ floods_NNS ,_, urban_JJ floods_NNS ,_, pluvial_JJ

(_( i.e._FW ,_, producing_VVG ,_, processing_NN and_CC packaging_NN ,_, storing_VVG and_CC transporting_VVG ,_,

Geoengineering_NP 
Geoengineering_NP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT broad_JJ set_NN of_IN methods_NNS and_CC technologies_NNS that_RB 
aim_NN to_TO deliberately_RB alter_VV the_DT climate-system_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO alleviate_VV the_DT 
impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Most_RBS ,_, but_CC not_RB all_RB ,_, methods_NNS seek_VVP to_TO either_DT 
(_( 1_LS )_) reduce_VV the_DT amount_NN of_IN absorbed_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN 
(_( Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP )_) or_CC (_( 2_LS )_) increase_VV net_JJ carbon_NN sinks_VVZ from_IN 
the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT scale_NN sufficiently_RB large_JJ to_TO alter_VV climate_NN (_( Carbon_NP 
Dioxide_NN Removal_NN )_) ._SENT Scale_NN and_CC intent_NN are_VBP of_IN central_JJ importance_NN ._SENT Two_CD key_NN 
characteristics_NNS of_IN geoengineering_VVG methods_NNS of_IN particular_JJ concern_NN are_VBP that_DT 
they_PP use_VVP or_CC affect_VVP the_DT climate-system_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmosphere_NN ,_, land_NN ,_, or_CC ocean_NN )_) 
globally_RB or_CC regionally_RB and_CC /_SYM or_CC could_MD have_VH substantive_JJ unintended_JJ effects_NNS 
that_WDT cross_VVP national_JJ boundaries_NNS ._SENT Geoengineering_NP is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN weather_NN 
modification_NN and_CC ecological_JJ engineering_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT boundary_NN can_MD be_VB fuzzy_JJ 
(_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012b_NP ,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT 
Global_JJ change_NN

Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
An_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN ._SENT However_RB ,_, for_IN 
changes_NNS over_IN time_NN ,_, only_JJ anomalies_NNS ,_, as_IN departures_NNS from_IN a_DT climatology_NN ,_, 
are_VBP used_VVN ,_, most_RBS commonly_RB based_VVN on_IN the_DT area-weighted_JJ global_JJ average_NN 
of_IN the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN anomaly_NN and_CC land_NN surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN
