Greenhouse_NN effect_NN 
The_DT infrared_JJ radiative_JJ effect_NN of_IN all_DT infrared-absorbing_VVG constituents_NNS in_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, clouds_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( to_TO a_DT small_JJ extent_NN )_) aerosols_NNS 
absorb_VV terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN and_CC elsewhere_RB 
in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT These_DT substances_NNS emit_VVP infrared_JJ radiation_NN in_IN all_DT 
directions_NNS ,_, but_RB ,_, everything_NN else_RB being_VBG equal_JJ ,_, the_DT net_JJ amount_NN emitted_VVN to_TO 
space_NN is_VBZ normally_RB less_RBR than_IN would_MD have_VH been_VBN emitted_VVN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN 
these_DT absorbers_NNS because_IN of_IN the_DT decline_NN of_IN temperature_NN with_IN altitude_NN 
in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN and_CC the_DT consequent_JJ weakening_NN of_IN emission_NN ._SENT An_DT 
increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS increases_VVZ the_DT 
magnitude_NN of_IN this_DT effect_NN ;_: the_DT difference_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB called_VVN the_DT enhanced_JJ 
greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT The_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentration_NN 
because_IN of_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS contributes_VVZ to_TO an_DT instantaneous_JJ 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC troposphere_NN warm_JJ in_IN 
response_NN to_TO this_DT forcing_VVG ,_, gradually_RB restoring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ balance_NN at_IN 
the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) 
Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP those_DT gaseous_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
both_DT natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN at_IN 
specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVD 
by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP ,_, and_CC clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN 
causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapor_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, 
nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_NN 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT 
number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN 
substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Beside_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP ,_, 
and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN gases_NNS sulfur_NN 
hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS 
(_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT For_IN a_DT list_NN of_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Table_NP 
.SM.1_JJ ._SENT 
Ground-level_NN ozone_NN 
Atmospheric_JJ ozone_NN formed_VVN naturally_RB or_CC from_IN human-emitted_JJ precursors_NNS 
near_IN Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, thus_RB affecting_VVG human_JJ health_NN ,_, agriculture_NN ,_, and_NP 
ecosystems_NNS ._SENT Ozone_NN is_VBZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, but_CC ground-level_NN ozone_NN ,_, unlike_IN 
stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, also_RB directly_RB affects_VVZ organisms_NNS at_IN the_DT surface_NN ._SENT 
Ground-level_NN ozone_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN ,_, 
although_IN much_JJ of_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ well_RB above_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC thus_RB 
does_VVZ not_RB directly_RB expose_VV organisms_NNS at_IN the_DT surface_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Ozone_NN ._SENT 
Groundwater_NP recharge_NN 
The_DT process_NN by_IN which_WDT external_JJ water_NN is_VBZ added_VVN to_TO the_DT zone_NN of_IN saturation_NN 
of_IN an_DT aquifer_NN ,_, either_CC directly_RB into_IN a_DT geologic_JJ formation_NN that_WDT traps_VVZ the_DT 
water_NN or_CC indirectly_RB by_IN way_NN of_IN another_DT formation_NN ._SENT 
Hazard_NN 
The_DT potential_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT natural_JJ or_CC human-induced_JJ physical_JJ event_NN 
or_CC trend_NN or_CC physical_JJ impact_NN that_WDT may_MD cause_VV loss_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, injury_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ 
health_NN impacts_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN damage_NN and_CC loss_NN to_TO property_NN ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, 
livelihoods_NNS ,_, service_NN provision_NN ,_, ecosystems_NNS ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT 
In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN hazard_NN usually_RB refers_VVZ to_TO climate-related_JJ physical_NN 
events_NNS or_CC trends_NNS or_CC their_PP$ physical_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT 
Heat_NN wave_NN

to_TO climate-change_NN ._SENT 
Human_JJ security_NN 
A_DT condition_NN that_WDT is_VBZ met_VVN when_WRB the_DT vital_JJ core_NN of_IN human_JJ lives_NNS is_VBZ protected_VVN ,_, 
and_CC when_WRB people_NNS have_VHP the_DT freedom_NN and_CC capacity_NN to_TO live_VV with_IN dignity_NN ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT vital_JJ core_NN of_IN human_JJ lives_NNS includes_VVZ 
the_DT universal_JJ and_CC culturally_RB specific_JJ ,_, material_JJ and_CC non-material_JJ elements_NNS 
necessary_JJ for_IN people_NNS to_TO act_VV on_IN behalf_NN of_IN their_PP$ interests_NNS and_CC to_TO live_VV with_IN 
dignity_NN ._SENT 
Human_JJ system_NN 
Any_DT system_NN in_IN which_WDT human_JJ organizations_NNS and_CC institutions_NNS play_VVP a_DT major_JJ 
role_NN ._SENT Often_RB ,_, but_CC not_RB always_RB ,_, the_DT term_NN is_VBZ synonymous_JJ with_IN society_NN or_CC 


social_JJ system_NN ._SENT Systems_NNS such_JJ as_IN agricultural_JJ systems_NNS ,_, political_JJ systems_NNS ,_, 
technological_JJ systems_NNS ,_, and_CC economic_JJ systems_NNS are_VBP all_RB human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN 
the_DT sense_NN applied_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT 
Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN 
The_DT cycle_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN evaporates_VVZ from_IN the_DT oceans_NNS and_CC the_DT land_NN 
surface_NN ,_, is_VBZ carried_VVN over_IN the_DT Earth_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN as_IN water_NN 
vapor_NN ,_, condenses_VVZ to_TO form_VV clouds_NNS ,_, precipitates_NNS over_IN ocean_NN and_CC land_NN as_RB 
rain_NN or_CC snow_NN ,_, which_WDT on_IN land_NN can_MD be_VB intercepted_VVN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC vegetation_NN ,_, 
provides_VVZ runoff_NN on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, infiltrates_NNS into_IN soils_NNS ,_, recharges_VVZ 
groundwater_NN ,_, discharges_NNS into_IN streams_NNS ,_, and_CC ultimately_RB ,_, flows_VVZ out_RP into_IN 
the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT it_PP will_MD eventually_RB evaporate_VV again_RB ._SENT The_DT various_JJ 
systems_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN are_VBP usually_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB 
hydrological_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT

Ice_NN cap_NN 
A_DT dome-shaped_JJ ice_NN mass_NN that_WDT is_VBZ considerably_RB smaller_JJR in_IN extent_NN than_IN an_DT 
ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT 
Ice_NN sheet_NN 
A_DT mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN of_IN continental_JJ size_NN that_WDT is_VBZ sufficiently_RB thick_JJ to_TO cover_VV 
most_JJS of_IN the_DT underlying_VVG bed_NN ,_, so_RB that_IN/that its_PP$ shape_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN 
its_PP$ dynamics_NN (_( the_DT flow_NN of_IN the_DT ice_NN as_IN it_PP deforms_VVZ internally_RB and_CC /_SYM or_CC slides_NNS 
at_IN its_PP$ base_NN )_) ._SENT An_DT ice_NN sheet_NN flows_VVZ outward_RB from_IN a_DT high_JJ central_JJ ice_NN plateau_NN 
with_IN a_DT small_JJ average_JJ surface_NN slope_NN ._SENT The_DT margins_NNS usually_RB slope_VVP more_RBR 
steeply_RB ,_, and_CC most_JJS ice_NN is_VBZ discharged_VVN through_IN fast_RB flowing_VVG ice_NN streams_NNS or_CC 
outlet_NN glaciers_NNS ,_, in_IN some_DT cases_NNS into_IN the_DT sea_NN or_CC into_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS floating_JJ 
on_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT There_EX are_VBP only_RB two_CD ice_NN sheets_NNS in_IN the_DT modern_JJ world_NN ,_, one_CD on_IN 
Greenland_NP and_CC one_CD on_IN Antarctica_NP ._SENT During_IN glacial_JJ periods_NNS there_RB were_VBD 
others_NNS ._SENT 
Ice_NN shelf_NN 
A_DT floating_JJ slab_NN of_IN ice_NN of_IN considerable_JJ thickness_NN extending_VVG from_IN the_DT coast_NN 
(_( usually_RB of_IN great_JJ horizontal_JJ extent_NN with_IN a_DT very_RB gently_RB sloping_JJ surface_NN )_) ,_, 
often_RB filling_VVG embayments_NNS in_IN the_DT coastline_NN of_IN an_DT ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT Nearly_RB all_DT ice_NN 
shelves_NNS are_VBP in_IN Antarctica_NP ,_, where_WRB most_JJS of_IN the_DT ice_NN discharged_VVN into_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN flows_NNS via_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS ._SENT 
(_( climate-change_NN )_) Impact_NN assessment_NN

Impacts_NNS (_( Consequences_NP ,_, Outcomes_NP )_) 10_CD 
Effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN impacts_NNS 
is_VBZ used_VVN primarily_RB to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS 
of_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN and_CC climate_NN events_NNS and_CC of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS 
generally_RB refer_VV to_TO effects_NNS on_IN lives_NNS ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, health_NN ,_, ecosystems_NNS ,_, 
economies_NNS ,_, societies_NNS ,_, cultures_NNS ,_, services_NNS ,_, and_CC infrastructure_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT 
interaction_NN of_IN climate_NN changes_NNS or_CC hazardous_JJ climate_NN events_NNS occurring_VVG 
within_IN a_DT specific_JJ time_NN period_NN and_CC the_DT vulnerability_NN of_IN an_DT exposed_JJ society_NN 
or_CC system_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS are_VBP also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN consequences_NNS and_CC outcomes_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN on_IN geophysical_JJ systems_NNS ,_, including_VVG floods_NNS ,_, 
droughts_NNS ,_, and_CC sea_NN level_NN rise_NN ,_, are_VBP a_DT subset_NN of_IN impacts_NNS called_VVD physical_JJ 
impacts_NNS ._SENT 
Income_NN 
The_DT maximum_JJ amount_NN that_IN/that a_DT household_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ unit_NN ,_, can_MD consume_VV 
without_IN reducing_VVG its_PP$ real_JJ net_JJ worth_NN ._SENT Total_JJ income_NN is_VBZ the_DT broadest_JJS measure_NN 
of_IN income_NN and_CC refers_VVZ to_TO regular_JJ receipts_NNS such_JJ as_IN wages_NNS and_CC salaries_NNS ,_, 
income_NN from_IN self-employment_NN ,_, interest_NN and_CC dividends_NNS from_IN invested_VVN 
funds_NNS ,_, pensions_NNS or_CC other_JJ benefits_NNS from_IN social_JJ insurance_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ current_NN 
transfers_NNS receivable.11_JJ 
Indian_NP Ocean_NP Dipole_NP (_( IOD_NP )_) 
Large-scale_JJ mode_NN of_IN interannual_JJ variability_NN of_IN sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN 
in_IN the_DT Indian_NP Ocean_NP ._SENT This_DT pattern_NN manifests_VVZ through_IN a_DT zonal_JJ gradient_NN of_IN 
tropical_JJ sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN one_CD extreme_JJ phase_NN in_IN boreal_JJ 
autumn_NN shows_NNS cooling_VVG off_RP Sumatra_NP and_CC warming_VVG off_RP Somalia_NN in_IN the_DT 
west_RB ,_, combined_VVN with_IN anomalous_JJ easterlies_NNS along_IN the_DT equator_NN ._SENT 
Indigenous_JJ peoples_NNS 
Indigenous_JJ peoples_NNS and_CC nations_NNS are_VBP those_DT that_IN/that ,_, having_VHG a_DT historical_JJ 
continuity_NN with_IN pre-invasion_NN and_CC pre-colonial_JJ societies_NNS that_WDT developed_VVD 
on_IN their_PP$ territories_NNS ,_, consider_VV themselves_PP distinct_JJ from_IN other_JJ sectors_NNS of_IN 
the_DT societies_NNS now_RB prevailing_VVG on_IN those_DT territories_NNS ,_, or_CC parts_NNS of_IN them_PP ._SENT They_PP 
form_NN at_IN present_JJ principally_RB non-dominant_JJ sectors_NNS of_IN society_NN and_CC are_VBP 
often_RB determined_VVN to_TO preserve_VV ,_, develop_VV ,_, and_CC transmit_VV to_TO future_JJ generations_NNS 
their_PP$ ancestral_JJ territories_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PP$ ethnic_JJ identity_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN their_PP$ 
continued_JJ existence_NN as_IN peoples_NNS ,_, in_IN accordance_NN with_IN their_PP$ own_JJ cultural_JJ 
patterns_NNS ,_, social_JJ institutions_NNS ,_, and_CC common_JJ law_NN system.12_NN 
Industrial_NP Revolution_NP 
A_DT period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ industrial_JJ growth_NN with_IN far-reaching_JJ social_JJ and_NP 
economic_JJ consequences_NNS ,_, beginning_VVG in_IN Britain_NP during_IN the_DT second_JJ half_NN of_IN 
the_DT 18th_JJ century_NN and_CC spreading_VVG to_TO Europe_NP and_CC later_RBR to_TO other_JJ countries_NNS 
including_VVG the_DT United_NP States_NPS ._SENT The_DT invention_NN of_IN the_DT steam_NN engine_NN was_VBD an_DT 
important_JJ trigger_NN of_IN this_DT development_NN ._SENT The_DT industrial_JJ revolution_NN marks_NNS 
the_DT beginning_NN of_IN a_DT strong_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS and_CC emission_NN 
of_IN ,_, in_IN particular_JJ ,_, fossil_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN the_DT terms_NNS preindustrial_NN 
and_CC industrial_JJ refer_VVP ,_, somewhat_RB arbitrarily_RB ,_, to_TO the_DT periods_NNS before_IN and_CC after_IN 
,_, respectively_RB ._SENT 
Industrialized_VVN /_SYM developed_VVN /_SYM developing_VVG countries_NNS 
There_EX are_VBP a_DT diversity_NN of_IN approaches_NNS for_IN categorizing_VVG countries_NNS on_IN the_DT 
basis_NN of_IN their_PP$ level_NN of_IN development_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN defining_VVG terms_NNS such_JJ as_RB 
industrialized_JJ ,_, developed_JJ ,_, or_CC developing_VVG ._SENT Several_JJ categorizations_NNS are_VBP 
used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS system_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_RB established_VVN 
convention_NN for_IN the_DT designation_NN of_IN developed_JJ and_CC developing_VVG countries_NNS 
or_CC areas_NNS ._SENT The_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Statistics_NP Division_NP specifies_VVZ developed_VVN and_CC 
developing_VVG regions_NNS based_VVN on_IN common_JJ practice_NN ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, specific_JJ 
countries_NNS are_VBP designated_VVN as_IN least_JJS developed_JJ countries_NNS ,_, landlocked_JJ 
Reflecting_VVG progress_NN in_IN science_NN ,_, this_DT glossary_NN entry_NN differs_VVZ in_IN breadth_NN and_CC focus_NN from_IN the_DT entry_NN used_VVN in_IN the_DT Fourth_JJ Assessment_NP Report_NP and_CC other_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definition_NN used_VVN in_IN OECD_NP (_( 2003_CD )_) ._SENT

Annex_NP II_NP Glossary_NP 
II_NP 
developing_VVG countries_NNS ,_, small_JJ island_NN developing_VVG states_NNS ,_, and_CC transition_NN 
economies_NNS ._SENT Many_JJ countries_NNS appear_VVP in_IN more_JJR than_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT categories_NNS ._SENT 
The_DT World_NP Bank_NP uses_VVZ income_NN as_IN the_DT main_JJ criterion_NN for_IN classifying_VVG 
countries_NNS as_IN low_JJ ,_, lower_RBR middle_JJ ,_, upper_JJ middle_NN ,_, and_CC high_JJ income_NN ._SENT The_DT 
UNDP_JJ aggregates_NNS indicators_NNS for_IN life_NN expectancy_NN ,_, educational_JJ attainment_NN ,_, 
and_CC income_NN into_IN a_DT single_JJ composite_JJ human_JJ development_NN index_NN (_( HDI_NP )_) to_TO 
classify_VV countries_NNS as_IN low_JJ ,_, medium_JJ ,_, high_JJ ,_, or_CC very_RB high_JJ human_JJ development_NN ._SENT 
See_VV Box_NP 1-2_CD ._SENT 
Informal_JJ sector_NN 
Commercial_JJ enterprises_NNS (_( mostly_RB small_JJ )_) that_WDT are_VBP not_RB registered_VVN or_CC that_DT 
otherwise_RB fall_NN outside_IN official_JJ rules_NNS and_CC regulations_NNS ._SENT Among_IN the_DT 
businesses_NNS that_WDT make_VVP up_RP the_DT informal_JJ sector_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ great_JJ diversity_NN in_IN 
the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT goods_NNS or_CC services_NNS produced_VVD ,_, the_DT numbers_NNS employed_VVN ,_, 
the_DT extent_NN of_IN illegality_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT connection_NN to_TO the_DT formal_JJ sector_NN ._SENT 
Many_JJ informal_JJ enterprises_NNS have_VHP some_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN formal-sector_NN 
enterprises_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT people_NNS are_VBP in_IN informal_JJ employment_NN in_IN the_DT formal_JJ 
sector_NN as_IN they_PP lack_VVP legal_JJ protection_NN or_CC employment_NN benefits_NNS ._SENT 
Informal_JJ settlement_NN 
A_DT term_NN given_VVN to_TO settlements_NNS or_CC residential_JJ areas_NNS that_IN/that by_IN at_IN least_JJS one_CD 
criterion_NN fall_NN outside_IN official_JJ rules_NNS and_CC regulations_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS informal_JJ 
settlements_NNS have_VHP poor_JJ housing_NN (_( with_IN widespread_JJ use_NN of_IN temporary_JJ 
materials_NNS )_) and_CC are_VBP developed_VVN on_IN land_NN that_WDT is_VBZ occupied_VVN illegally_RB with_IN 
high_JJ levels_NNS of_IN overcrowding_NN ._SENT In_IN most_JJS such_JJ settlements_NNS ,_, provision_NN for_IN 
safe_JJ water_NN ,_, sanitation_NN ,_, drainage_NN ,_, paved_JJ roads_NNS ,_, and_CC basic_JJ services_NNS is_VBZ 
inadequate_JJ or_CC lacking_JJ ._SENT The_DT term_NN slum_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN for_IN informal_JJ 
settlements_NNS ,_, although_IN it_PP is_VBZ misleading_VVG as_IN many_JJ informal_JJ settlements_NNS 
develop_VV into_IN good_JJ quality_NN residential_JJ areas_NNS ,_, especially_RB where_WRB governments_NNS 
support_VV such_JJ development_NN ._SENT 
Institutions_NNS 
Institutions_NNS are_VBP rules_NNS and_CC norms_NNS held_VVN in_IN common_JJ by_IN social_JJ actors_NNS that_RB 
guide_NN ,_, constrain_VV ,_, and_CC shape_VV human_JJ interaction_NN ._SENT Institutions_NNS can_MD be_VB 
formal_JJ ,_, such_JJ as_IN laws_NNS and_CC policies_NNS ,_, or_CC informal_JJ ,_, such_JJ as_IN norms_NNS and_CC 
conventions_NNS ._SENT Organizations_NNS —_NN such_JJ as_IN parliaments_NNS ,_, regulatory_JJ agencies_NNS ,_, 
private_JJ firms_NNS ,_, and_CC community_NN bodies_NNS —_NN develop_VV and_CC act_VV in_IN response_NN to_TO 
institutional_JJ frameworks_NNS and_CC the_DT incentives_NNS they_PP frame_VVP ._SENT Institutions_NNS can_MD 
guide_NN ,_, constrain_VV ,_, and_CC shape_VV human_JJ interaction_NN through_IN direct_JJ control_NN ,_, 
through_IN incentives_NNS ,_, and_CC through_IN processes_NNS of_IN socialization_NN ._SENT 
Insurance_NN /_SYM reinsurance_NN 
A_DT family_NN of_IN financial_JJ instruments_NNS for_IN sharing_VVG and_CC transferring_VVG risk_NN among_IN 
a_DT pool_NN of_IN at-risk_NN households_NNS ,_, businesses_NNS ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC governments_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Risk_NN transfer_NN ._SENT 
Integrated_JJ assessment_NN 
A_DT method_NN of_IN analysis_NN that_WDT combines_VVZ results_NNS and_CC models_NNS from_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, 
biological_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, and_CC social_JJ sciences_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS among_IN 
these_DT components_NNS ,_, in_IN a_DT consistent_JJ framework_NN to_TO evaluate_VV the_DT status_NN 
and_CC the_DT consequences_NNS of_IN environmental_JJ change_NN and_CC the_DT policy_NN responses_NNS 
to_TO it_PP ._SENT 
Integrated_NP Coastal_NP Zone_NP Management_NP (_( ICZM_NP )_) 
An_DT integrated_JJ approach_NN for_IN sustainably_RB managing_VVG coastal_JJ areas_NNS ,_, taking_VVG 
into_IN account_NN all_DT coastal_JJ habitats_NNS and_CC uses_NNS ._SENT 
Invasive_JJ species_NNS /_SYM Invasive_JJ Alien_NP Species_NP (_( IAS_NP )_) 
A_DT species_NNS introduced_VVN outside_IN its_PP$ natural_JJ past_JJ or_CC present_JJ distribution_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, 
an_DT alien_JJ species_NN )_) that_WDT becomes_VVZ established_VVN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC semi-natural_JJ 
ecosystems_NNS or_CC habitat_NN ,_, is_VBZ an_DT agent_NN of_IN change_NN ,_, and_CC threatens_VVZ native_JJ 
biological_JJ diversity_NN (_( IUCN_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: CBD_NP ,_, 2002_CD )_) ._SENT 
Key_JJ vulnerability_NN ,_, Key_JJ risk_NN ,_, Key_JJ impact_NN 
A_DT vulnerability_NN ,_, risk_NN ,_, or_CC impact_NN relevant_JJ to_TO the_DT definition_NN and_CC elaboration_NN 
of_IN “_JJ dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN (_( DAI_NP )_) with_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN ,_, ”_NN in_IN the_DT terminology_NN of_IN United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP 
on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) Article_NP 2_CD ,_, meriting_VVG particular_JJ attention_NN by_IN 
policy_NN makers_NNS in_IN that_DT context_NN ._SENT 
Key_JJ risks_NNS are_VBP potentially_RB severe_JJ adverse_JJ consequences_NNS for_IN humans_NNS and_CC 
social-ecological_JJ systems_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN climaterelated_JJ 
hazards_NNS with_IN vulnerabilities_NNS of_IN societies_NNS and_CC systems_NNS exposed_VVD ._SENT 
Risks_NNS are_VBP considered_VVN “_JJ key_JJ ”_NN due_JJ to_TO high_JJ hazard_NN or_CC high_JJ vulnerability_NN of_IN 
societies_NNS and_CC systems_NNS exposed_VVN ,_, or_CC both_DT ._SENT 
Vulnerabilities_NNS are_VBP considered_VVN “_JJ key_JJ ”_NN if_IN they_PP have_VHP the_DT potential_NN to_TO combine_VV 
with_IN hazardous_JJ events_NNS or_CC trends_NNS to_TO result_VV in_IN key_JJ risks_NNS ._SENT Vulnerabilities_NNS 
that_WDT have_VHP little_JJ influence_NN on_IN climate-related_JJ risk_NN ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO 
lack_NN of_IN exposure_NN to_TO hazards_NNS ,_, would_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VVN key_JJ ._SENT 
Key_JJ impacts_NNS are_VBP severe_JJ consequences_NNS for_IN humans_NNS and_CC social-ecological_JJ 
systems_NNS ._SENT 
Land_NN grabbing_VVG

has_VHZ been_VBN widely_RB studied_VVN because_IN the_DT radiative_JJ forcings_NNS and_CC boundary_NN

Meridional_JJ Overturning_NP Circulation_NP (_( MOC_NP )_) 
Meridional_JJ (_( north-south_JJ )_) overturning_VVG circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN quantified_VVD 
by_IN zonal_JJ (_( east-west_JJ )_) sums_NNS of_IN mass_JJ transports_NNS in_IN depth_NN or_CC density_NN layers_NNS ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP ,_, away_RB from_IN the_DT subpolar_NN regions_NNS ,_, the_DT MOC_NP (_( which_WDT 
is_VBZ in_IN principle_NN an_DT observable_JJ quantity_NN )_) is_VBZ often_RB identified_VVN with_IN the_DT

interpretation_NN ._SENT It_PP must_MD be_VB borne_VVN in_IN mind_NN that_IN/that the_DT MOC_NP is_VBZ also_RB driven_VVN by_IN 
wind_NN ,_, and_CC can_MD also_RB include_VV shallower_JJR overturning_VVG cells_NNS such_JJ as_IN occur_VVP in_IN the_DT 
upper_JJ ocean_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS and_CC subtropics_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT warm_JJ (_( light_JJ )_) waters_NNS 
moving_VVG poleward_NN are_VBP transformed_VVN to_TO slightly_RB denser_JJR waters_NNS and_CC subducted_VVN 
equatorward_RB at_IN deeper_JJR levels_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Thermohaline_JJ circulation_NN ._SENT

Monsoon_NN

Non-climatic_JJ driver_NN (_( Non-climate_JJ driver_NN )_)

or_CC natural_JJ system_NN ._SENT

North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP (_( NAO_NP )_) 
The_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP Oscillation_NP consists_VVZ of_IN opposing_VVG variations_NNS of_IN surface_NN

fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN the_DT main_JJ westerly_JJ winds_NNS across_IN the_DT Atlantic_NP 
into_IN Europe_NP ,_, and_CC thus_RB to_TO fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT embedded_VVN extratropical_JJ

Ocean_NP acidification_NN

extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_RBR ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ caused_VVN primarily_RB 
by_IN uptake_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, but_CC can_MD also_RB be_VB 
caused_VVN by_IN other_JJ chemical_NN additions_NNS or_CC subtractions_NNS from_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT

remain_VV after_IN adaptation_NN has_VHZ taken_VVN place_NN define_VV the_DT levels_NNS of_IN vulnerability_NN 
(_( Kelly_NP and_CC Adger_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: O’Brien_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2007_CD )_) ._SENT 
Oxygen_NN Minimum_NP Zone_NP (_( OMZ_NP )_) 
The_DT midwater_NN layer_NN (_( 200_CD to_TO 1000_CD m_NN )_) in_IN the_DT open_JJ ocean_NN in_IN which_WDT oxygen_NN 
saturation_NN is_VBZ the_DT lowest_JJS in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT degree_NN of_IN oxygen_NN depletion_NN 
depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT largely_RB bacterial_JJ consumption_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT 
distribution_NN of_IN the_DT OMZs_NP is_VBZ influenced_VVN by_IN large-scale_JJ ocean_NN circulation_NN ._SENT 
In_IN coastal_JJ oceans_NNS ,_, OMZs_NNS extend_VVP to_TO the_DT shelves_NNS and_CC may_MD also_RB affect_VV 
benthic_JJ ecosystems_NNS ._SENT

Ozone_NN 
Ozone_NN ,_, the_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ atmospheric_JJ 
constituent_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN both_CC naturally_RB and_CC by_IN 
photochemical_JJ reactions_NNS involving_VVG gases_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN human_JJ activities_NNS 
(_( smog_NN )_) ._SENT Tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN acts_NNS as_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, 
it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN by_IN the_DT interaction_NN between_IN solar_JJ ultraviolet_JJ radiation_NN and_CC 
molecular_JJ oxygen_NN (_( O2_NP )_) ._SENT Stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN plays_VVZ a_DT dominant_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT 
stratospheric_JJ radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ concentration_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS in_IN the_DT ozone_NN 
layer_NN ._SENT 
Pacific_NP Decadal_NP Oscillation_NP (_( PDO_NP )_) 
The_DT pattern_NN and_CC time_NN series_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ empirical_JJ orthogonal_JJ function_NN 
of_IN sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN over_IN the_DT North_NP Pacific_NP north_NN of_IN 20_CD °_SYM N_NP ._SENT The_DT 
PDO_NP broadened_VVD to_TO cover_VV the_DT whole_JJ Pacific_NP Basin_NP is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT Interdecadal_NP 
Pacific_NP Oscillation_NP (_( IPO_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT PDO_NP and_CC IPO_NN exhibit_NN similar_JJ 
temporal_JJ evolution_NN ._SENT 
Parameterization_NN 
In_IN climate_NN models_NNS ,_, this_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT technique_NN of_IN representing_VVG 
processes_NNS that_WDT cannot_MD be_VB explicitly_RB resolved_VVN at_IN the_DT spatial_JJ or_CC temporal_JJ 
resolution_NN of_IN the_DT model_NN (_( sub-grid_JJ scale_NN processes_NNS )_) by_IN relationships_NNS 
between_IN model-resolved_JJ larger-scale_JJ variables_NNS and_CC the_DT area-_NN or_CC timeaveraged_NN 
effect_NN of_IN such_JJ sub-grid_JJ scale_NN processes_NNS ._SENT 
Particulates_NNS 
Very_RB small_JJ solid_JJ particles_NNS emitted_VVN during_IN the_DT combustion_NN of_IN fossil_JJ and_NP 
biomass_NN fuels_NNS ._SENT Particulates_NNS may_MD consist_VV of_IN a_DT wide_JJ variety_NN of_IN substances_NNS ._SENT 
Of_IN greatest_JJS concern_NN for_IN health_NN are_VBP particulates_NNS of_IN diameter_NN less_JJR than_IN or_CC 
equal_JJ to_TO 10_CD nm_NN ,_, usually_RB designated_VVN as_IN PM10_NP ._SENT 
Pastoralism_NN 
A_DT livelihood_NN strategy_NN based_VVN on_IN moving_VVG livestock_NN to_TO seasonal_JJ pastures_NNS 
primarily_RB in_IN order_NN to_TO convert_VV grasses_NNS ,_, forbs_NNS ,_, tree_NN leaves_NNS ,_, or_CC crop_NN residues_NNS 
into_IN human_JJ food_NN ._SENT The_DT search_NN for_IN feed_NN is_VBZ however_RB not_RB the_DT only_JJ reason_NN 
for_IN mobility_NN ;_: people_NNS and_CC livestock_NN may_MD move_VV to_TO avoid_VV various_JJ natural_NN 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC social_JJ hazards_NNS ,_, to_TO avoid_VV competition_NN with_IN others_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO seek_VV more_RBR 
favorable_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT Pastoralism_NP can_MD also_RB be_VB thought_VVN of_IN as_IN a_DT strategy_NN 
that_WDT is_VBZ shaped_VVN by_IN both_DT social_JJ and_CC ecological_JJ factors_NNS concerning_VVG 
uncertainty_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN precipitation_NN ,_, and_CC low_JJ and_CC unpredictable_JJ 
productivity_NN of_IN terrestrial_JJ ecosystems_NNS ._SENT 
Path_NN dependence_NN

in_IN time_NN constrain_VVP adaptation_NN ,_, mitigation_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ actions_NNS or_CC options_NNS at_IN 
a_DT later_JJR point_NN in_IN time_NN ._SENT 
Permafrost_NN 
Ground_NP (_( soil_NN or_CC rock_NN and_CC included_VVD ice_NN and_CC organic_JJ material_NN )_) that_WDT remains_VVZ 
at_IN or_CC below_IN 0_CD °_SYM C_NP for_IN at_IN least_JJS 2_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._SENT 
Persistent_JJ Organic_NP Pollutants_NP (_( POPs_NP )_) 
Toxic_JJ organic_JJ chemical_NN substances_NNS that_WDT persist_VVP in_IN the_DT environment_NN for_IN 
long_JJ periods_NNS of_IN time_NN ,_, are_VBP transported_VVN and_CC deposited_VVN in_IN locations_NNS distant_JJ 
from_IN their_PP$ sources_NNS of_IN release_NN ,_, bioaccumulate_JJ ,_, and_CC can_MD have_VH adverse_JJ 
effects_NNS on_IN human_JJ health_NN and_CC ecosystems.13_NN 
Phenology_NN 
The_DT relationship_NN between_IN biological_JJ phenomena_NNS that_WDT recur_VVP periodically_RB 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, development_NN stages_NNS ,_, migration_NN )_) and_CC climate_NN and_CC seasonal_JJ changes_NNS ._SENT 
Photochemical_JJ smog_NN 
A_DT mix_NN of_IN oxidizing_VVG air_NN pollutants_NNS produced_VVN by_IN the_DT reaction_NN of_IN sunlight_NN 
with_IN primary_JJ air_NN pollutants_NNS ,_, especially_RB hydrocarbons_NNS ._SENT 
Poverty_NN 
Poverty_NN is_VBZ a_DT complex_JJ concept_NN with_IN several_JJ definitions_NNS stemming_VVG from_IN 
different_JJ schools_NNS of_IN thought_NN ._SENT It_PP can_MD refer_VV to_TO material_JJ circumstances_NNS (_( such_JJ 
as_IN need_NN ,_, pattern_NN of_IN deprivation_NN ,_, or_CC limited_JJ resources_NNS )_) ,_, economic_JJ conditions_NNS 
(_( such_JJ as_IN standard_NN of_IN living_NN ,_, inequality_NN ,_, or_CC economic_JJ position_NN )_) ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_JJ 
social_JJ relationships_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN social_JJ class_NN ,_, dependency_NN ,_, exclusion_NN ,_, lack_VVP of_IN 
basic_JJ security_NN ,_, or_CC lack_NN of_IN entitlement_NN )_) ._SENT 
Poverty_NN trap_NN 
Poverty_NN trap_NN is_VBZ understood_VVN differently_RB across_IN disciplines_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT social_JJ 
sciences_NNS ,_, the_DT concept_NN ,_, primarily_RB employed_VVN at_IN the_DT individual_NN ,_, household_NN ,_, 
or_CC community_NN level_NN ,_, describes_VVZ a_DT situation_NN in_IN which_WDT escaping_VVG poverty_NN 
becomes_VVZ impossible_JJ due_RB to_TO unproductive_JJ or_CC inflexible_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT A_DT 
poverty_NN trap_NN can_MD also_RB be_VB seen_VVN as_IN a_DT critical_JJ minimum_JJ asset_NN threshold_NN ,_, 
below_IN which_WDT families_NNS are_VBP unable_JJ to_TO successfully_RB educate_VV their_PP$ children_NNS ,_, 
build_VV up_RP their_PP$ productive_JJ assets_NNS ,_, and_CC get_VV out_RP of_IN poverty_NN ._SENT Extreme_JJ poverty_NN 
is_VBZ itself_PP a_DT poverty_NN trap_NN ,_, since_IN poor_JJ persons_NNS lack_VVP the_DT means_VVZ to_TO participate_VV 
meaningfully_RB in_IN society_NN ._SENT In_IN economics_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN poverty_NN trap_NN is_VBZ often_RB 
used_VVN at_IN national_JJ scales_NNS ,_, referring_VVG to_TO a_DT self-perpetuating_JJ condition_NN 
where_WRB an_DT economy_NN ,_, caught_VVN in_IN a_DT vicious_JJ cycle_NN ,_, suffers_VVZ from_IN persistent_JJ 
underdevelopment_NN (_( Matsuyama_NP ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT Many_JJ proposed_VVN models_NNS of_IN 
poverty_NN traps_NNS are_VBP found_VVN in_IN the_DT literature_NN ._SENT 
Predictability_NN 
The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT future_JJ states_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN may_MD be_VB predicted_VVN based_VVN on_RP 
knowledge_NN of_IN current_JJ and_CC past_JJ states_NNS of_IN the_DT system_NN ._SENT Because_IN knowledge_NN 
of_IN the_DT climate_NN system’s_NNS past_JJ and_CC current_JJ states_NNS is_VBZ generally_RB imperfect_JJ ,_, 
as_RB are_VBP the_DT models_NNS that_WDT utilize_VVP this_DT knowledge_NN to_TO produce_VV a_DT climate_NN 
prediction_NN ,_, and_CC because_IN the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ inherently_RB nonlinear_JJ and_CC 
chaotic_JJ ,_, predictability_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ inherently_RB limited_VVN ._SENT Even_RB 
with_IN arbitrarily_RB accurate_JJ models_NNS and_CC observations_NNS ,_, there_EX may_MD still_RB be_VB 
limits_NNS to_TO the_DT predictability_NN of_IN such_PDT a_DT nonlinear_JJ system_NN (_( AMS_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT

See_VV Industrial_NP Revolution_NP ._SENT 
Probability_NN Density_NP Function_NP (_( PDF_NP )_) 
A_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN is_VBZ a_DT function_NN that_WDT indicates_VVZ the_DT relative_NN 
chances_NNS of_IN occurrence_NN of_IN different_JJ outcomes_NNS of_IN a_DT variable_NN ._SENT The_DT function_NN 
integrates_VVZ to_TO unity_NN over_IN the_DT domain_NN for_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN and_CC has_VHZ the_DT 
property_NN that_IN/that the_DT integral_NN over_IN a_DT sub-domain_JJ equals_VVZ the_DT probability_NN that_RB 
the_DT outcome_NN of_IN the_DT variable_NN lies_VVZ within_IN that_DT sub-domain_JJ ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, 
the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that a_DT temperature_NN anomaly_NN defined_VVN in_IN a_DT particular_JJ way_NN 
is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN zero_CD is_VBZ obtained_VVN from_IN its_PP$ PDF_NN by_IN integrating_VVG the_DT PDF_NN over_RB 
all_DT possible_JJ temperature_NN anomalies_NNS greater_JJR than_IN zero_CD ._SENT Probability_NN density_NN 
functions_NNS that_WDT describe_VVP two_CD or_CC more_JJR variables_NNS simultaneously_RB are_VBP 
similarly_RB defined_VVN ._SENT 
This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definition_NN in_IN the_DT Stockholm_NP Convention_NP on_IN Persistent_NP Organic_NP Pollutants_NP (_( Secretariat_NP of_IN the_DT Stockholm_NP Convention_NP ,_, 2001_CD )_) ._SENT 


Projection_NN 
A_DT projection_NN is_VBZ a_DT potential_JJ future_JJ evolution_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN or_CC set_VVN of_IN 
quantities_NNS ,_, often_RB computed_VVN with_IN the_DT aid_NN of_IN a_DT model_NN ._SENT Unlike_IN predictions_NNS ,_, 
projections_NNS are_VBP conditional_JJ on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, 
future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD 
not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN prediction_NN and_CC Climate_NN projection_NN ._SENT 
Proxy_NN 
A_DT proxy_JJ climate_NN indicator_NN is_VBZ a_DT record_NN that_WDT is_VBZ interpreted_VVN ,_, using_VVG physical_JJ 
and_CC biophysical_JJ principles_NNS ,_, to_TO represent_VV some_DT combination_NN of_IN climaterelated_JJ 
variations_NNS back_RB in_IN time_NN ._SENT Climate-related_JJ data_NNS derived_VVN in_IN this_DT way_NN 
are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN proxy_JJ data_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN proxies_NNS include_VVP pollen_NN analysis_NN ,_, 
tree_NN ring_NN records_NNS ,_, speleothems_NNS ,_, characteristics_NNS of_IN corals_NNS ,_, and_CC various_JJ data_NNS 
derived_VVN from_IN marine_JJ sediments_NNS and_CC ice_NN cores_NNS ._SENT Proxy_JJ data_NNS can_MD be_VB calibrated_VVN 
to_TO provide_VV quantitative_JJ climate_NN information_NN ._SENT 
Public_JJ good_NN 
A_DT good_NN that_WDT is_VBZ both_DT non-excludable_JJ and_CC non-rivalrous_JJ in_IN that_DT individuals_NNS 
cannot_MD be_VB effectively_RB excluded_VVN from_IN use_NN and_CC where_WRB use_NN by_IN one_CD individual_NN 
does_VVZ not_RB reduce_VV availability_NN to_TO others_NNS ._SENT 
Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_JJ ,_, downward_JJ minus_CC upward_JJ ,_, 
radiative_JJ flux_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN or_CC top_NN of_IN atmosphere_NN 
due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN an_DT external_JJ driver_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT 
change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT 
Sometimes_RB internal_JJ drivers_NNS are_VBP still_RB treated_VVN as_IN forcings_NNS even_RB though_IN they_PP 
result_NN from_IN the_DT alteration_NN in_IN climate_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN aerosol_NN or_CC greenhouse_NN 
gas_NN changes_NNS in_IN paleoclimates_NNS ._SENT The_DT traditional_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ computed_VVN 
with_IN all_DT tropospheric_JJ properties_NNS held_VVD fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ,_, 
and_CC after_IN allowing_VVG for_IN stratospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, if_IN perturbed_VVN ,_, to_TO 
readjust_VV to_TO radiative-dynamical_JJ equilibrium_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ called_VVN 
instantaneous_JJ if_IN no_DT change_NN in_IN stratospheric_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ accounted_VVN 
for_IN ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG once_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS are_VBP accounted_VVN for_IN is_VBZ 
termed_VVN the_DT effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT For_IN the_DT purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ further_RBR defined_VVN as_IN the_DT change_NN relative_JJ to_TO the_DT year_NN 
and_CC ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB noted_VVN ,_, refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT global_JJ and_CC annual_JJ average_NN 
value_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB confused_VVN with_IN cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, 
which_WDT describes_VVZ an_DT unrelated_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT impact_NN of_IN clouds_NNS on_IN the_DT 
radiative_JJ flux_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
Reanalysis_NN 
Reanalyses_NNS are_VBP estimates_NNS of_IN historical_JJ atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN and_CC 
wind_NN or_CC oceanographic_JJ temperature_NN and_CC current_JJ ,_, and_CC other_JJ quantities_NNS ,_, 
created_VVN by_IN processing_VVG past_JJ meteorological_JJ or_CC oceanographic_JJ data_NNS using_VVG 
fixed_VVN state-of-the-art_JJ weather_NN forecasting_NN or_CC ocean_NN circulation_NN models_NNS 
with_IN data_NN assimilation_NN techniques_NNS ._SENT Using_VVG fixed_VVN data_NNS assimilation_NN avoids_VVZ 
effects_NNS from_IN the_DT changing_VVG analysis_NN system_NN that_WDT occur_VVP in_IN operational_JJ 
analyses_NNS ._SENT Although_IN continuity_NN is_VBZ improved_VVN ,_, global_JJ reanalyses_NNS still_RB suffer_VVP 
from_IN changing_VVG coverage_NN and_CC biases_NNS in_IN the_DT observing_VVG systems_NNS ._SENT 
Reasons_NNS for_IN concern_NN 
Elements_NNS of_IN a_DT classification_NN framework_NN ,_, first_RB developed_VVN in_IN the_DT IPCC_NP Third_NP 
Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, which_WDT aims_VVZ to_TO facilitate_VV judgments_NNS about_IN what_WP level_NN 
of_IN climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB “_JJ dangerous_JJ ”_NN (_( in_IN the_DT language_NN of_IN Article_NP 2_CD of_IN 
the_DT UNFCCC_NP )_) by_IN aggregating_VVG impacts_NNS ,_, risks_NNS ,_, and_CC vulnerabilities_NNS ._SENT

Reflexivity_NN 
A_DT system_NN attribute_NN where_WRB cause_NN and_CC effect_NN form_NN a_DT feedback_NN loop_NN ,_, in_RB 
which_WDT the_DT effect_NN changes_VVZ the_DT system_NN itself_PP ._SENT Self-adapting_NN systems_NNS such_JJ 
as_IN societies_NNS are_VBP inherently_RB reflexive_JJ ,_, as_RB are_VBP planned_JJ changes_NNS in_IN complex_NN 
systems_NNS ._SENT Reflexive_JJ decision_NN making_VVG in_IN a_DT social_JJ system_NN has_VHZ the_DT potential_NN 
to_TO change_VV the_DT underpinning_VVG values_NNS that_WDT led_VVD to_TO those_DT decisions_NNS ._SENT Reflexivity_NN 
is_VBZ also_RB an_DT important_JJ aspect_NN of_IN adaptive_JJ management_NN ._SENT 
Reforestation_NN 
Planting_VVG of_IN forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT have_VHP previously_RB contained_VVN forests_NNS but_RB 
that_WDT have_VHP been_VBN converted_VVN to_TO some_DT other_JJ use_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT 
term_NN forest_NN and_CC related_JJ terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN afforestation_NN ,_, reforestation_NN ,_, and_NP 
deforestation_NN ,_, see_VVP the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ Report_NP on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NN

Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) 
Scenarios_NNS that_WDT include_VVP time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS of_IN 
the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC chemically_RB active_JJ 
gases_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN land_NN use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN 
representative_NN signifies_VVZ that_IN/that each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ 
possible_JJ scenarios_NNS that_WDT would_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT specific_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN pathway_NN emphasizes_VVZ that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT longterm_JJ 
concentration_NN levels_NNS are_VBP of_IN interest_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB the_DT trajectory_NN taken_VVN 
over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV that_DT outcome_NN (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT 
RCPs_NNS usually_RB refer_VVP to_TO the_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT concentration_NN pathway_NN extending_VVG 
up_RB to_TO 2100_CD ,_, for_IN which_WDT Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS produced_VVD 
corresponding_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT Extended_JJ Concentration_NP Pathways_NP 
(_( ECPs_NNS )_) describe_VVP extensions_NNS of_IN the_DT RCPs_NP from_IN 2100_CD to_TO 2500_CD that_WDT were_VBD 
calculated_JJ using_VVG simple_JJ rules_NNS generated_VVN by_IN stakeholder_NN consultations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC do_VVP not_RB represent_VV fully_RB consistent_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT 
Four_NP RCPs_NP produced_VVD from_IN Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS were_VBD selected_VVN 
from_IN the_DT published_VVN literature_NN and_CC are_VBP used_VVN in_IN the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP Assessment_NP 
as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN predictions_NNS and_CC projections_NNS in_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP Chapters_NP 
to_TO 14_CD :_: 
RCP2.6_NP One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN approximately_RB 
W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD before_IN 2100_CD and_CC then_RB declines_NNS (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP 
assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT 
RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilization_NN pathways_NNS in_IN 
which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ stabilized_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN m_NN –_NN 2_CD and_CC 
.0_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD after_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS assuming_VVG constant_JJ 
concentrations_NNS after_IN 2150_CD )_) ._SENT

II_NP

greater_JJR than_IN 8.5_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD by_IN 2100_CD and_CC continues_VVZ to_TO rise_VV for_IN some_DT 
amount_NN of_IN time_NN (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS 
after_IN 2100_CD and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) ._SENT 
For_IN further_JJR description_NN of_IN future_JJ scenarios_NNS ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 1.1_NP ._SENT 
Resilience_NN

a_DT hazardous_JJ event_NN or_CC trend_NN or_CC disturbance_NN ,_, responding_VVG or_CC reorganizing_VVG 
in_IN ways_NNS that_WDT maintain_VVP their_PP$ essential_JJ function_NN ,_, identity_NN ,_, and_CC structure_NN ,_, 
while_IN also_RB maintaining_VVG the_DT capacity_NN for_IN adaptation_NN ,_, learning_VVG ,_, and_NP 
transformation.14_NN 
Return_NN period_NN

or_CC intensity_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Return_NN value_NN ._SENT

Risk_NN

where_WRB the_DT outcome_NN is_VBZ uncertain_JJ ,_, recognizing_VVG the_DT diversity_NN of_IN values.15_NN

events_NNS or_CC trends_NNS multiplied_VVN by_IN the_DT impacts_NNS if_IN these_DT events_NNS or_CC trends_NNS 
occur_VV ._SENT Risk_NN results_NNS from_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN vulnerability_NN ,_, exposure_NN ,_, and_NP 
hazard_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN risk_NN is_VBZ used_VVN primarily_RB to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT risks_NNS 
of_IN climate-change_NN impacts_NNS ._SENT

of_IN risks_NNS or_CC to_TO respond_VV to_TO consequences_NNS ._SENT

Runoff_NN 
That_DT part_NN of_IN precipitation_NN that_WDT does_VVZ not_RB evaporate_VV and_CC is_VBZ not_RB transpired_VVN ,_, 
but_CC flows_NNS through_IN the_DT ground_NN or_CC over_IN the_DT ground_NN surface_NN and_CC returns_NNS 
to_TO bodies_NNS of_IN water_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT 
Salt-water_NN intrusion_NN /_SYM encroachment_NN

salt_NN water_NN due_JJ to_TO its_PP$ greater_JJR density_NN ._SENT This_DT usually_RB occurs_VVZ in_IN coastal_JJ and_NP 
estuarine_JJ areas_NNS due_JJ to_TO decreasing_VVG land-based_JJ influence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, from_IN 
reduced_VVN runoff_NN or_CC groundwater_NN recharge_NN ,_, or_CC from_IN excessive_JJ water_NN 
withdrawals_NNS from_IN aquifers_NNS )_) or_CC increasing_VVG marine_JJ influence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, relative_JJ 
sea_NN level_NN rise_NN )_) ._SENT

Sea_NP level_NN change_NN 
Sea_NP level_NN can_MD change_VV ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB due_JJ to_TO (_( 1_LS )_) changes_VVZ in_IN 
the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN basins_NNS ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) a_DT change_NN in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN 
of_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 3_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN 
volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN water_NN density_NN ._SENT Global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN 
level_NN change_NN resulting_VVG from_IN change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN is_VBZ called_VVN 
barystatic_JJ ._SENT The_DT amount_NN of_IN barystatic_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT addition_NN 
or_CC removal_NN of_IN a_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN is_VBZ called_VVN its_PP$ sea_NN level_NN equivalent_NN (_( SLE_NP )_) ._SENT 
Sea_NP level_NN changes_NNS ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB ,_, resulting_VVG from_IN changes_NNS in_IN 
water_NN density_NN are_VBP called_VVN steric_JJ ._SENT Density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN temperature_NN 
changes_NNS only_RB are_VBP called_VVN thermosteric_JJ ,_, while_IN density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN 
salinity_NN changes_NNS are_VBP called_VVN halosteric_JJ ._SENT Barystatic_JJ and_CC steric_JJ sea_NN level_NN 
changes_NNS do_VVP not_RB include_VV the_DT effect_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN ocean_NN 
basins_NNS induced_VVN by_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN mass_NN and_CC its_PP$ distribution_NN ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Relative_JJ sea_NN level_NN and_CC Thermal_JJ expansion_NN ._SENT 
Sea_NP Surface_NP Temperature_NP (_( SST_NP )_) 
The_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT subsurface_JJ bulk_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT 
top_JJ few_JJ meters_NNS of_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, measured_VVN by_IN ships_NNS ,_, buoys_NNS ,_, and_CC drifters_NNS ._SENT 
From_IN ships_NNS ,_, measurements_NNS of_IN water_NN samples_NNS in_IN buckets_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB 
switched_VVN in_IN the_DT 1940s_NNS to_TO samples_NNS from_IN engine_NN intake_NN water_NN ._SENT Satellite_NP 
measurements_NNS of_IN skin_NN temperature_NN (_( uppermost_JJ layer_NN ;_: a_DT fraction_NN of_IN a_DT 
millimeter_NN thick_JJ )_) in_IN the_DT infrared_NN or_CC the_DT top_JJ centimeter_NN or_CC so_RB in_IN the_DT 
microwave_NN are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ,_, but_CC must_MD be_VB adjusted_VVN to_TO be_VB compatible_JJ with_IN 
the_DT bulk_JJ temperature_NN ._SENT 
Semi-arid_JJ zone_NN 
Areas_NNS where_WRB vegetation_NN growth_NN is_VBZ constrained_VVN by_IN limited_JJ water_NN availability_NN ,_, 
often_RB with_IN short_JJ growing_VVG seasons_NNS and_CC high_JJ interannual_JJ variation_NN in_IN 
primary_JJ production_NN ._SENT Annual_JJ precipitation_NN ranges_NNS from_IN 300_CD to_TO 800_CD mm_NN ,_, 
depending_VVG on_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN summer_NN and_CC winter_NN rains_NNS ._SENT 
Sensitivity_NN 
The_DT degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN or_CC species_NN is_VBZ affected_VVN ,_, either_CC adversely_RB or_JJ 
beneficially_RB ,_, by_IN climate_NN variability_NN or_CC change_NN ._SENT The_DT effect_NN may_MD be_VB direct_JJ 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT change_NN in_IN crop_NN yield_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT mean_NN ,_, range_VVP ,_, 
This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definition_NN used_VVN in_IN Arctic_NP Council_NP (_( 2013_CD )_) ._SENT 
This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN Rosa_NP (_( 1998_CD )_) and_CC Rosa_NP (_( 2003_CD )_) ._SENT 


or_CC variability_NN of_IN temperature_NN )_) or_CC indirect_JJ (_( e.g._FW ,_, damages_NNS caused_VVD by_IN an_DT 
increase_NN in_IN the_DT frequency_NN of_IN coastal_JJ flooding_NN due_JJ to_TO sea_NN level_NN rise_NN )_) ._SENT

Social_JJ Cost_NN of_IN Carbon_NP (_( SCC_NP )_)

Social_JJ protection_NN 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN development_NN aid_NN and_CC climate_NN policy_NN ,_, social_JJ protection_NN 
usually_RB describes_VVZ public_JJ and_CC private_JJ initiatives_NNS that_WDT provide_VVP income_NN or_CC 
consumption_NN transfers_NNS to_TO the_DT poor_JJ ,_, protect_VV the_DT vulnerable_JJ against_IN livelihood_NN 
risks_NNS ,_, and_CC enhance_VV the_DT social_JJ status_NN and_CC rights_NNS of_IN the_DT marginalized_VVN ,_, with_IN 
the_DT overall_JJ objective_NN of_IN reducing_VVG the_DT economic_JJ and_CC social_JJ vulnerability_NN of_IN 
poor_JJ ,_, vulnerable_JJ ,_, and_CC marginalized_VVN groups_NNS (_( Devereux_NP and_CC Sabates-Wheeler_NP ,_, 
)_) ._SENT In_IN other_JJ contexts_NNS ,_, social_JJ protection_NN may_MD be_VB used_VVN synonymously_RB 
with_IN social_JJ policy_NN and_CC can_MD be_VB described_VVN as_IN all_DT public_JJ and_CC private_JJ initiatives_NNS 
that_WDT provide_VVP access_NN to_TO services_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN health_NN ,_, education_NN ,_, or_CC housing_NN ,_, or_CC 
income_NN and_CC consumption_NN transfers_NNS to_TO people_NNS ._SENT Social_JJ protection_NN policies_NNS 
protect_VV the_DT poor_JJ and_CC vulnerable_JJ against_IN livelihood_NN risks_NNS and_CC enhance_VV 
the_DT social_JJ status_NN and_CC rights_NNS of_IN the_DT marginalized_VVN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_RB prevent_VV 
vulnerable_JJ people_NNS from_IN falling_VVG into_IN poverty_NN ._SENT

SRES_NP scenarios_NNS 
SRES_NP scenarios_NNS are_VBP emission_NN scenarios_NNS developed_VVN by_IN Nakićenović_NP and_NP 
Swart_NP (_( 2000_CD )_) and_CC used_VVN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT climate_NN 
projections_NNS shown_VVN in_IN Chapters_NP 9_CD to_TO 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2001_CD )_) and_CC Chapters_NP 10_CD 
and_CC 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2007_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT following_VVG terms_NNS are_VBP relevant_JJ for_IN a_DT better_RBR 
understanding_VVG of_IN the_DT structure_NN and_CC use_NN of_IN the_DT set_NN of_IN SRES_NP scenarios_NNS :_: 
Scenario_NN family_NN Scenarios_NP that_WDT have_VHP a_DT similar_JJ demographic_JJ ,_, societal_JJ ,_, 
economic_JJ ,_, and_CC technical_JJ change_NN storyline_NN ._SENT Four_CD scenario_NN families_NNS

Illustrative_JJ scenario_NN A_DT scenario_NN that_WDT is_VBZ illustrative_JJ for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT

groups_NNS are_VBP equally_RB sound_JJ ._SENT

Storm_NN surge_NN

due_JJ to_TO extreme_JJ meteorological_JJ conditions_NNS (_( low_JJ atmospheric_JJ pressure_NN 
and_CC /_SYM or_CC strong_JJ winds_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT storm_NN surge_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN being_VBG the_DT excess_NN 
above_IN the_DT level_NN expected_VVN from_IN the_DT tidal_JJ variation_NN alone_RB at_IN that_DT time_NN and_CC 
place_NN ._SENT 
Storm_NN tracks_NNS

systems_NNS ,_, but_CC now_RB often_RB generalized_VVN to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT main_JJ regions_NNS where_WRB 
the_DT tracks_NNS of_IN extratropical_JJ disturbances_NNS occur_VVP as_IN sequences_NNS of_IN low_JJ 
(_( cyclonic_JJ )_) and_CC high_JJ (_( anticyclonic_JJ )_) pressure_NN systems_NNS ._SENT 
Stratosphere_NN

extending_VVG from_IN about_RB 10_CD km_NN (_( ranging_VVG from_IN 9_CD km_NN at_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS to_TO 
km_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS on_IN average_NN )_) to_TO about_RB 50_CD km_NN altitude_NN ._SENT

Sustainability_NN

the_DT ability_NN of_IN future_JJ generations_NNS to_TO meet_VV their_PP$ own_JJ needs_NNS (_( WCED_NP ,_, 1987_CD )_) ._SENT 
Thermal_JJ expansion_NN 
In_IN connection_NN with_IN sea_NN level_NN ,_, this_DT refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN volume_NN (_( and_CC 
decrease_NN in_IN density_NN )_) that_IN/that results_NNS from_IN warming_NN water_NN ._SENT A_DT warming_NN of_IN the_DT 
ocean_NN leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT expansion_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN volume_NN and_CC hence_RB an_DT increase_NN 
in_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sea_NP level_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Thermocline_NN 
The_DT layer_NN of_IN maximum_JJ vertical_JJ temperature_NN gradient_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, lying_VVG 
between_IN the_DT surface_NN ocean_NN and_CC the_DT abyssal_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT In_IN subtropical_JJ regions_NNS ,_, 
its_PP$ source_NN waters_NNS are_VBP typically_RB surface_NN waters_NNS at_IN higher_JJR latitudes_NNS that_WDT have_VHP 
subducted_VVN and_CC moved_VVN equatorward_NN ._SENT At_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS ,_, it_PP is_VBZ sometimes_RB 
absent_JJ ,_, replaced_VVN by_IN a_DT halocline_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT layer_NN of_IN maximum_JJ vertical_NN 
salinity_NN gradient_NN ._SENT 
Thermohaline_NN circulation_NN (_( THC_NP )_) 
Large-scale_JJ circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN that_WDT transforms_VVZ low-density_NN upper_JJ 
ocean_NN waters_NNS to_TO higher-density_NN intermediate_JJ and_CC deep_JJ waters_NNS and_CC 
returns_VVZ those_DT waters_NNS back_RB to_TO the_DT upper_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT circulation_NN is_VBZ 
asymmetric_JJ ,_, with_IN conversion_NN to_TO dense_JJ waters_NNS in_IN restricted_JJ regions_NNS at_IN 
high_JJ latitudes_NNS and_CC the_DT return_NN to_TO the_DT surface_NN involving_VVG slow_JJ upwelling_NN 
and_CC diffusive_JJ processes_NNS over_IN much_RB larger_JJR geographic_JJ regions_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
THC_NP is_VBZ driven_VVN by_IN high_JJ densities_NNS at_IN or_CC near_IN the_DT surface_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN cold_NN 
temperatures_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC high_JJ salinities_NNS ,_, but_CC despite_IN its_PP$ suggestive_JJ though_RB 
common_JJ name_NN ,_, is_VBZ also_RB driven_VVN by_IN mechanical_JJ forces_NNS such_JJ as_IN wind_NN and_CC 
tides_NNS ._SENT Frequently_RB ,_, the_DT name_NN THC_NP has_VHZ been_VBN used_VVN synonymously_RB with_IN 
Meridional_JJ Overturning_NP Circulation_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Meridional_NP Overturning_NP

of_IN the_DT change_NN are_VBP abated.16_JJ 
Traditional_JJ knowledge_NN

environmental_JJ change_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB incorporates_VVZ other_JJ forms_NNS of_IN knowledge_NN 
and_CC viewpoints_NNS ._SENT Traditional_JJ knowledge_NN is_VBZ generally_RB transmitted_VVN orally_RB 
from_IN generation_NN to_TO generation_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN as_IN a_DT synonym_NN for_IN

Tropical_JJ cyclone_NN 
A_DT strong_JJ ,_, cyclonic-scale_JJ disturbance_NN that_WDT originates_VVZ over_IN tropical_JJ oceans_NNS ._SENT

m_NN s_NNS –_JJ 1._CD Beyond_IN 32_CD m_NN s_NNS –_JJ 1_CD ,_, a_DT tropical_JJ cyclone_NN is_VBZ called_VVN a_DT hurricane_NN ,_, 
typhoon_NN ,_, or_CC cyclone_NN ,_, depending_VVG on_IN geographic_JJ location_NN ._SENT 
Troposphere_NN

altitude_NN at_IN mid-latitudes_NNS (_( ranging_VVG from_IN 9_CD km_NN at_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS to_TO 16_CD km_NN

also_RB Stratosphere_NP ._SENT

Uncertainty_NN

or_CC from_IN disagreement_NN about_IN what_WP is_VBZ known_VVN or_CC even_RB knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD 
have_VHP many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, from_IN imprecision_NN in_IN the_DT data_NNS to_TO ambiguously_RB 
defined_VVN concepts_NNS or_CC terminology_NN ,_, or_CC uncertain_JJ projections_NNS of_IN human_JJ

United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP 
on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) 
The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP York_NP and_CC signed_VVN 
at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP by_IN more_JJR than_IN 150_CD countries_NNS 
and_CC the_DT European_NP Community_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT “_JJ stabilization_NN 
of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_RB 
would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN ._SENT ”_NN It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT Convention_NP ,_, 
Parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_NP (_( all_DT OECD_NP countries_NNS and_CC countries_NNS with_IN 
economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) aim_VVP to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS not_RB 
controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000._CD 
The_DT convention_NN entered_VVN in_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD In_IN 1997_CD ,_, the_DT UNFCCC_NP 
adopted_VVN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
The_DT glossary_NN for_IN the_DT Working_NP Group_NP I_NN contribution_NN to_TO the_DT Fifth_NP Assessment_NP Report_NP defines_VVZ tipping_VVG point_NN in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate_NN :_: “_NN In_IN climate_NN ,_, a_DT hypothesized_VVN critical_JJ threshold_NN 
when_WRB global_JJ or_CC regional_JJ climate_NN changes_NNS from_IN one_CD stable_JJ state_NN to_TO another_DT stable_JJ state_NN ._SENT The_DT tipping_VVG point_NN event_NN may_MD be_VB irreversible_JJ ._SENT ”_NN

of_IN water_NN used_VVN ._SENT 

Annex_NP II_NP Glossary_NP Abrupt_JJ change_NN /_SYM abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN Abrupt_NN change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN that_WDT is_VBZ substantially_RB faster_RBR than_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN the_DT recent_JJ history_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ components_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN ._SENT Abrupt_JJ climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT large-scale_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT takes_VVZ place_NN over_IN a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS or_CC less_JJR ,_, persists_VVZ (_( or_CC is_VBZ anticipated_VVN to_TO persist_VV )_) for_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT few_JJ decades_NNS and_CC causes_VVZ substantial_JJ disruptions_NNS in_IN human_JJ and_CC natural_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Adaptation_NP The_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ._SENT In_IN human_JJ systems_NNS ,_, adaptation_NN seeks_VVZ to_TO moderate_VV or_CC avoid_VV harm_NN or_CC exploit_VV beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT In_IN some_DT natural_JJ systems_NNS ,_, human_JJ intervention_NN may_MD facilitate_VV adjustment_NN to_TO expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects1_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Adaptation_NP deficit_NN The_DT gap_NN between_IN the_DT current_JJ state_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN and_CC a_DT state_NN that_WDT minimizes_VVZ adverse_JJ impacts_NNS from_IN existing_VVG climate_NN conditions_NNS and_CC variability_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Adaptation_NP limit_VVP The_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT an_DT actor’s_JJ objectives_NNS (_( or_CC system_NN needs_NNS )_) cannot_MD be_VB secured_VVN from_IN intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ actions_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Hard_NP adaptation_NN limit_NN No_DT adaptive_JJ actions_NNS are_VBP possible_JJ to_TO avoid_VV intolerable_JJ risks_NNS ._SENT Soft_JJ adaptation_NN limit_NN Options_NNS are_VBP currently_RB not_RB available_JJ to_TO avoid_VV intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ action_NN ._SENT Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN The_DT ability_NN of_IN systems_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, humans_NNS and_CC other_JJ organisms_NNS to_TO adjust_VV to_TO potential_JJ damage_NN ,_, to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO respond_VV to_TO consequences2_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Adverse_JJ side_NN effects_VVZ The_DT negative_JJ effects_NNS that_IN/that a_DT policy_NN or_CC measure_NN aimed_VVN at_IN one_CD objective_NN might_MD have_VH on_IN other_JJ objectives_NNS ,_, irrespective_RB of_IN the_DT net_JJ effect_NN on_IN overall_JJ social_JJ welfare_NN ._SENT Adverse_JJ side_NN effects_NNS are_VBP often_RB subject_JJ to_TO uncertainty_NN and_CC depend_VV on_IN local_JJ circumstances_NNS and_CC implementation_NN practices_NNS ,_, among_IN other_JJ factors_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Co-benefits_NP and_CC Risk_NP ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Afforestation_NP Planting_NP of_IN new_JJ forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT historically_RB have_VHP not_RB contained_VVN forests_NNS ._SENT For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC related_JJ terms_NNS such_JJ as_IN afforestation_NN ,_, reforestation_NN and_CC deforestation_NN ,_, see_VVP the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ Report_NP on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NP Change_NP ,_, and_CC Forestry_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2000b_JJ )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB information_NN provided_VVN by_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP ,_, 2013_CD )_) and_CC the_DT report_NN on_IN Definitions_NP and_CC Methodological_NP Options_NPS to_TO Inventory_JJ Emissions_NNS from_IN Direct_NP Human-induced_NP Degradation_NP of_IN Forests_NP and_CC Devegetation_NP of_IN Other_NP Vegetation_NP Types_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2003_CD )_) ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Agriculture_NP ,_, Forestry_NP and_CC Other_NP Land_NP Use_NP (_( AFOLU_NP and_CC FOLU_NP /_SYM LULUCF_NP )_) AFOLU_NP plays_VVZ a_DT central_JJ role_NN for_IN food_NN security_NN and_CC sustainable_JJ development_NN ._SENT The_DT main_JJ mitigation_NN options_NNS within_IN AFOLU_NP involve_VVP one_CD or_CC more_JJR of_IN three_CD strategies_NNS :_: prevention_NN of_IN emissions_NNS to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN conserving_VVG existing_JJ carbon_NN pools_NNS in_IN soils_NNS or_CC vegetation_NN or_CC by_IN reducing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN methane_NN and_CC nitrous_JJ oxide_NN ;_: sequestration_NN —_NN increasing_VVG the_DT size_NN of_IN existing_VVG carbon_NN pools_NNS and_CC thereby_RB extracting_VVG carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ;_: and_CC substitution_NN —_NN substituting_VVG biological_JJ products_NNS for_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS or_CC energy-intensive_JJ products_NNS ,_, thereby_RB reducing_VVG CO2_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Demand-side_JJ measures_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, reducing_VVG losses_NNS and_CC wastes_NNS of_IN food_NN ,_, changes_NNS in_IN human_JJ diet_NN ,_, or_CC changes_NNS in_IN wood_NN consumption_NN )_) may_MD also_RB play_VV a_DT role_NN ._SENT FOLU_NP (_( Forestry_NP and_CC Other_NP Land_NP Use_NP )_) —_NN also_RB referred_VVD to_TO as_IN LULUCF_NP (_( Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NP Change_NP ,_, and_CC Forestry_NP )_) —_NN is_VBZ the_DT subset_NN of_IN AFOLU_NP emissions_NNS and_CC removals_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) resulting_VVG from_IN direct_JJ human-induced_JJ land_NN use_NN ,_, land-use_NN change_NN ,_, and_CC forestry_NN activities_NNS excluding_VVG agricultural_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Albedo_NP The_DT fraction_NN of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN reflected_VVN by_IN a_DT surface_NN or_CC object_NN ,_, often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Snow-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS have_VHP a_DT high_JJ albedo_NN ,_, the_DT albedo_NN of_IN soils_NNS ranges_NNS from_IN high_JJ to_TO low_JJ and_CC vegetation-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS and_CC scenarios_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO scenarios_NNS that_WDT are_VBP based_VVN on_IN the_DT assumption_NN that_IN/that no_DT mitigation_NN policies_NNS or_CC measures_NNS will_MD be_VB implemented_VVN ,_, as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, ocean_NN ,_, terrestrial_JJ and_CC marine_JJ biosphere_NN and_CC lithosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, This_DT corresponds_VVZ to_TO 3.667_CD GtCO2_NN )_) ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) A_DT process_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT WGI_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Carbon_NP intensity_NN The_DT amount_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) released_VVD per_IN unit_NN of_IN another_DT variable_NN such_JJ as_IN Gross_NP Domestic_NP Product_NP (_( GDP_NP )_) ,_, output_NN energy_NN use_NN or_CC transport_NN ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Carbon_NP price_NN The_DT price_NN for_IN avoided_VVN or_CC released_VVN ._SENT Because_IN virtually_RB all_DT of_IN the_DT carbon_NN in_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS is_VBZ ultimately_RB emitted_VVN as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN is_VBZ variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) climate-change_NN climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS of_IN the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS and_CC persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that the_DT Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ climate-change_NN as_RB :_: ‘a_NN change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVN over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods’_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN climate-change_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN and_CC climate_NN variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Detection_NP and_CC Attribution_NP ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Climate_NN extreme_NN (_( extreme_JJ weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN )_) See_NP Extreme_NP weather_NN event_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Climate_NN feedback_NN An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN in_IN one_CD climate_NN quantity_NN causes_VVZ a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ and_CC the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ weakened_VVN by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT Fifth_NP Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, a_DT somewhat_RB narrower_JJR definition_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN which_WDT the_DT climate_NN quantity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ perturbed_VVN is_VBZ the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN turn_NN causes_VVZ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT global_JJ radiation_NN budget_NN ._SENT In_IN either_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN can_MD either_RB be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Climate_NN finance_VV There_EX is_VBZ no_DT agreed_VVN definition_NN of_IN climate_NN finance_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN climate_NN finance_NN is_VBZ applied_VVN both_CC to_TO the_DT financial_JJ resources_NNS devoted_VVN to_TO addressing_VVG climate-change_NN globally_RB and_CC to_TO financial_JJ flows_NNS to_TO developing_VVG countries_NNS to_TO assist_VV them_PP in_IN addressing_VVG climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT literature_NN includes_VVZ several_JJ concepts_NNS in_IN these_DT categories_NNS ,_, among_IN which_WDT the_DT most_RBS commonly_RB used_VVN include_VVP :_: {_( WGIII_NP }_) Incremental_JJ costs_NNS The_DT cost_NN of_IN capital_NN of_IN the_DT incremental_JJ investment_NN and_CC the_DT change_NN of_IN operating_VVG and_CC maintenance_NN costs_NNS for_IN a_DT mitigation_NN or_CC adaptation_NN project_NN in_IN comparison_NN to_TO a_DT reference_NN project_NN ._SENT It_PP can_MD be_VB calculated_VVN as_IN the_DT difference_NN of_IN the_DT net_JJ present_JJ values_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD projects_NNS ._SENT Incremental_JJ project_NN ._SENT Total_JJ climate_NN finance_VV All_DT financial_JJ flows_NNS whose_WP$ expected_VVN effect_NN is_VBZ to_TO reduce_VV net_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC to_TO enhance_VV resilience_NN to_TO the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate_NN variability_NN and_CC the_DT projected_JJ climate-change_NN ._SENT This_DT covers_VVZ private_JJ and_CC public_JJ of_IN the_DT funds_NNS provided_VVN are_VBP concessional_JJ loans_NNS and_CC grants_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN model_NN (_( spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN )_) A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN ;_: that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT Coupled_VVN Atmosphere_NN –_NN Ocean_NP General_NP Circulation_NP Models_NPS (_( AOGCMs_NP )_) provide_VVP a_DT representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN that_WDT is_VBZ near_JJ or_CC at_IN the_DT most_RBS comprehensive_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT spectrum_NN currently_RB available_JJ ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN and_CC for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, seasonal_JJ and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Climate_NN projection_NN A_DT climate_NN projection_NN is_VBZ the_DT simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO a_DT scenario_NN of_IN future_JJ emission_NN or_CC concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, generally_RB derived_VVN using_VVG climate_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN predictions_NNS by_IN their_PP$ dependence_NN on_IN the_DT emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN turn_NN based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_JJ socio-economic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Climate-resilient_JJ pathways_NNS Iterative_JJ processes_NNS for_IN managing_VVG change_NN within_IN complex_JJ systems_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO reduce_VV disruptions_NNS and_CC enhance_VV opportunities_NNS associated_VVN with_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Climate_NN response_NN See_VV Climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) Climate_NN sensitivity_NN In_IN IPCC_NP reports_NNS ,_, equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN (_( steady_JJ state_NN )_) change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN 


temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ equivalent_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentration_NN ._SENT Owing_VVG to_TO computational_JJ constraints_NNS ,_, the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB estimated_VVN by_IN running_VVG an_DT atmospheric_JJ general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN coupled_VVN to_TO a_DT mixed-layer_NN ocean_NN model_NN ,_, because_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ largely_RB determined_VVN by_IN atmospheric_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Efficient_JJ models_NNS can_MD be_VB run_VVN to_TO equilibrium_NN with_IN a_DT dynamic_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) –_NP 1_CD )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT The_DT effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO doubled_VVN CO2_JJ concentration_NN that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN evolving_VVG non-_NN equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT The_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP )_) is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, averaged_VVN over_IN a_DT 20-year_JJ period_NN ,_, centered_VVN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP doubling_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN response_NN to_TO greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) forcing_VVG ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) climate-system_NN The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC to_TO variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) CO2-equivalent_NP (_( CO2-eq_NP )_) concentration_NN The_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) that_WDT of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ climate-change_NN responses_NNS nor_CC future_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ generally_RB no_DT connection_NN between_IN CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC of_IN each_DT gas_NN ._SENT CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ scale_NN for_IN comparing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ GHGs_NNS but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ climate-change_NN responses_NNS ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ generally_RB no_DT connection_NN between_IN CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC resulting_VVG CO2-equivalent_JJ for_IN example_NN ,_, <_SYM 10_CD %_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN evaluating_VVG the_DT relative_JJ contributions_NNS of_IN multiple_JJ causal_JJ ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Discounting_NP A_NP mathematical_JJ operation_NN making_VVG monetary_JJ (_( or_CC other_JJ )_) amounts_NNS received_VVN or_CC expended_VVN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS (_( years_NNS )_) comparable_JJ across_IN time_NN ._SENT The_DT discounter_NN uses_VVZ a_DT fixed_VVN or_CC possibly_RB time‐varying_JJ discount_NN rate_NN (_( >_SYM 0_CD )_) from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN that_WDT makes_VVZ future_JJ value_NN worth_NN less_CC today_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Drought_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB dry_JJ weather_NN long_RB enough_RB to_TO cause_VV a_DT ,_, II_NP }_) Early_RB warning_VVG system_NN The_DT set_NN of_IN capacities_NNS needed_VVN to_TO generate_VV and_CC disseminate_VV timely_JJ and_CC meaningful_JJ warning_VVG information_NN to_TO {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Ecosystem_NP services_VVZ Ecological_JJ processes_NNS or_CC functions_NNS having_VHG monetary_JJ or_CC non-monetary_JJ value_NN to_TO individuals_NNS or_CC Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD initially_RB used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_NN that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ since_RB become_VVN identified_VVN with_IN a_DT basin-wide_JJ warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP east_RB of_IN the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN a_DT global-scale_JJ tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ time_NN scales_NNS of_IN two_CD to_TO about_RB seven_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN difference_NN between_IN Tahiti_NP and_CC Darwin_NP or_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT central_JJ and_CC eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_VVG trade_NN winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS such_JJ that_IN/that the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT trade_NN winds_NNS ._SENT This_DT event_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT For_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ indices_NN ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 2.5_CD ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Emission_NN scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ development_NN of_IN emissions_NNS which_WDT were_VBD used_VVN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN projections_NNS presented_VVN in_IN Chapters_NP 9_CD to_TO 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP WGI_NP TAR_NP (_(
