III_NP }_) Energy_NP access_NN Access_NP to_TO clean_VV ,_, reliable_JJ and_CC affordable_JJ energy_NN services_NNS for_IN cooking_NN and_CC heating_NN ,_, lighting_NN ,_, communications_NNS and_CC productive_JJ uses_NNS (_( AGECC_NP ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Energy_NP intensity_NN The_DT ratio_NN of_IN energy_NN use_NN to_TO economic_JJ or_CC physical_JJ output_NN ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Energy_NP security_NN The_DT goal_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN country_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT global_JJ community_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ,_, to_TO maintain_VV an_DT adequate_JJ ,_, stable_JJ and_CC predictable_JJ energy_NN supply_NN ._SENT Measures_NNS encompass_VVP safeguarding_VVG the_DT sufficiency_NN of_IN energy_NN resources_NNS to_TO meet_VV national_JJ energy_NN demand_NN at_IN competitive_JJ and_CC stable_JJ prices_NNS and_CC the_DT resilience_NN of_IN the_DT energy_NN supply_NN ;_: enabling_VVG development_NN and_CC deployment_NN of_IN technologies_NNS ;_: building_VVG sufficient_JJ infrastructure_NN to_TO generate_VV ,_, store_VV and_CC transmit_VV energy_NN supplies_NNS and_CC ensuring_VVG enforceable_JJ contracts_NNS of_IN delivery_NN ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Ensemble_NP A_NP collection_NN of_IN model_NN simulations_NNS characterizing_VVG a_DT climate_NN prediction_NN or_CC projection_NN ._SENT Differences_NNS in_IN initial_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC model_NN formulation_NN result_NN in_IN different_JJ evolutions_NNS of_IN the_DT modeled_VVN system_NN and_CC may_MD give_VV information_NN on_IN uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN model_NN error_NN and_CC error_NN in_IN initial_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN climate_NN forecasts_NNS and_CC on_IN uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN model_NN error_NN and_CC with_IN internally_RB generated_VVN climate_NN variability_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN See_VV Climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) Eutrophication_NP Over-enrichment_NP of_IN water_NN by_IN nutrients_NNS such_JJ as_IN nitrogen_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT leading_VVG causes_NNS of_IN water_NN quality_NN impairment_NN ._SENT The_DT two_CD most_RBS acute_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN eutrophication_NN are_VBP hypoxia_NN (_( or_CC oxygen_NN depletion_NN )_) and_CC harmful_JJ algal_JJ blooms_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Exposure_NN The_DT presence_NN of_IN people_NNS ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, species_NNS or_CC ecosystems_NNS ,_, environmental_JJ functions_NNS ,_, services_NNS ,_, and_CC resources_NNS ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, or_CC economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, or_CC cultural_JJ assets_NNS in_IN places_NNS and_CC settings_NNS that_WDT could_MD be_VB adversely_RB affected_VVN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) External_NP forcing_VVG External_NP forcing_VVG refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT forcing_VVG agent_NN outside_IN the_DT climate-system_NN causing_VVG a_DT parameters_NNS eccentricity_NN ,_, tilt_NN and_CC precession_NN of_IN the_DT equinox_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Extreme_NP weather_NN event_NN An_DT extreme_JJ weather_NN event_NN is_VBZ an_DT normally_RB be_VB as_RB rare_JJ as_IN or_CC rarer_JJR than_IN the_DT 10th_JJ or_CC 90th_JJ percentile_NN of_IN a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN estimated_VVN from_IN observations_NNS ._SENT By_IN definition_NN ,_, the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN what_WP is_VBZ called_VVN extreme_JJ weather_NN may_MD vary_VV from_IN place_NN to_TO place_VV in_IN an_DT absolute_JJ sense_NN ._SENT When_WRB a_DT pattern_NN of_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN persists_VVZ for_IN some_DT time_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT season_NN ,_, it_PP may_MD be_VB classed_VVN as_IN an_DT extreme_JJ climate_NN event_NN ,_, WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Feedback_NP See_NP Climate_NN feedback_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Flood_NP The_NP overflowing_VVG of_IN the_DT normal_JJ confines_NNS of_IN a_DT stream_NN or_CC other_JJ body_NN of_IN water_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT accumulation_NN of_IN water_NN over_IN areas_NNS not_RB normally_RB submerged_VVN ._SENT Floods_NNS include_VVP river_NN (_( fluvial_JJ )_) floods_NNS ,_, ,_, development_NN and_CC an_DT active_JJ and_CC healthy_JJ life_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Forest_NP A_NP vegetation_NN type_NN dominated_VVN by_IN trees_NNS ._SENT Many_JJ definitions_NNS }_) Fuel_NN poverty_NN A_DT condition_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT household_NN is_VBZ unable_JJ to_TO guarantee_VV a_DT certain_JJ level_NN of_IN consumption_NN of_IN domestic_JJ energy_NN services_NNS (_( especially_RB heating_VVG )_) or_CC suffers_VVZ disproportionate_JJ expenditure_NN burdens_NNS to_TO meet_VV these_DT needs_NNS ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Geoengineering_NP Geoengineering_NP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT broad_JJ set_NN of_IN methods_NNS and_CC technologies_NNS that_WDT aim_VVP to_TO deliberately_RB alter_VV the_DT climate-system_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO alleviate_VV the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Most_RBS ,_, but_CC not_RB all_RB ,_, methods_NNS seek_VVP to_TO either_DT (_( 1_LS )_) reduce_VV the_DT amount_NN of_IN absorbed_JJ solar_JJ energy_NN in_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP )_) or_CC (_( 2_LS )_) increase_VV net_JJ carbon_NN sinks_NNS from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT scale_NN sufficiently_RB large_JJ to_TO alter_VV climate_NN (_( Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP )_) ._SENT Scale_NN and_CC intent_NN are_VBP of_IN central_JJ importance_NN ._SENT Two_CD key_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN geoengineering_VVG methods_NNS of_IN particular_JJ concern_NN are_VBP that_IN/that they_PP use_VVP or_CC affect_VVP the_DT climate-system_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmosphere_NN ,_, land_NN or_CC ocean_NN )_) globally_RB or_CC regionally_RB and_CC /_SYM or_CC could_MD have_VH substantive_JJ unintended_JJ effects_NNS that_WDT cross_VVP national_JJ boundaries_NNS ._SENT Geoengineering_NP is_VBZ different_JJ from_IN weather_NN modification_NN and_CC ecological_JJ engineering_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT boundary_NN can_MD be_VB fuzzy_JJ (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012b_NP ,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) 


Global_JJ climate_NN model_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN ,_, both_CC abbreviated_VVD as_IN GCM_NP )_) See_VV Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Global_NP Temperature_NP change_VV Potential_JJ (_( GTP_NP )_) An_DT index_NN measuring_VVG the_DT change_NN in_IN global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN at_IN a_DT chosen_VVN point_NN in_IN time_NN following_VVG an_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN substance_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT reference_NN substance_NN ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT Global_NP Temperature_NP change_VV Potential_JJ (_( GTP_NP )_) thus_RB represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG times_NNS these_DT substances_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, their_PP$ effectiveness_NN in_IN causing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG and_CC the_DT response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT The_DT GTP_NP has_VHZ been_VBN defined_VVN in_IN two_CD different_JJ ways_NNS :_: •_NP Fixed_NP GTP_NP :_: based_VVN on_IN a_DT fixed_VVN time_NN horizon_NN in_IN the_DT future_JJ (_( such_JJ as_IN GTP100_NP for_IN a_DT time_NN horizon_NN of_IN 100_CD years_NNS )_) •_JJ Dynamic_NP GTP_NP :_: based_VVN on_IN a_DT target_NN year_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN the_DT year_NN when_WRB global_JJ mean_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ expected_VVN to_TO reach_VV a_DT target_NN level_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN the_DT dynamic_JJ GTP_NP ,_, the_DT time_NN horizon_NN reduces_VVZ over_IN time_NN as_IN the_DT target_NN year_NN is_VBZ approached_VVN and_CC hence_RB the_DT GTP_NP value_NN changes_NNS for_IN emissions_NNS occurring_VVG further_JJR in_IN the_DT future_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP Chapter_NP 8_CD }_) Global_JJ warming_NN Global_JJ warming_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN ,_, observed_VVN or_CC projected_VVN ,_, in_IN global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, as_RB one_CD of_IN the_DT consequences_NNS of_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG caused_VVN by_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) An_DT index_NN measuring_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG following_VVG an_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN substance_NN ,_, accumulated_VVN over_IN a_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT reference_NN substance_NN ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT GWP_NP thus_RB represents_VVZ the_DT combined_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT differing_VVG times_NNS these_DT substances_NNS remain_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ effectiveness_NN in_IN causing_VVG radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT (_( WGI_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Hazard_NP The_DT potential_JJ other_JJ health_NN impacts_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN damage_NN and_CC loss_NN to_TO property_NN ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, service_NN provision_NN ,_, ecosystems_NNS and_CC physical_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Heat_NP wave_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB and_CC uncomfortably_RB hot_JJ weather_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN The_DT cycle_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN evaporates_VVZ from_IN the_DT oceans_NNS and_CC the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, is_VBZ carried_VVN over_IN the_DT Earth_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN as_IN water_NN vapour_NN ,_, condenses_VVZ to_TO form_VV clouds_NNS ,_, precipitates_NNS over_IN ocean_NN and_CC land_NN as_IN rain_NN or_CC snow_NN ,_, which_WDT on_IN land_NN can_MD be_VB intercepted_VVN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC vegetation_NN ,_, provides_VVZ runoff_NN on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, infiltrates_NNS into_IN soils_NNS ,_, recharges_VVZ groundwater_NN ,_, discharges_NNS into_IN streams_NNS and_CC ultimately_RB flows_VVZ out_RP into_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT it_PP will_MD eventually_RB evaporate_VV again_RB ._SENT The_DT various_JJ systems_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN are_VBP usually_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN hydrological_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Impacts_NNS (_( consequences_NNS ,_, outcomes_NNS )_) Effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN impacts_NNS is_VBZ used_VVN primarily_RB to_TO refer_VV to_TO the_DT effects_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS of_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN and_CC climate_NN events_NNS and_CC of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS generally_RB refer_VVP to_TO interaction_NN of_IN climate_NN changes_NNS or_CC hazardous_JJ climate_NN events_NNS occurring_VVG within_IN a_DT specific_JJ time_NN period_NN and_CC the_DT vulnerability_NN of_IN an_DT exposed_VVN society_NN or_CC system_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS are_VBP also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN consequences_NNS and_CC outcomes_NNS ._SENT The_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN on_IN geophysical_JJ systems_NNS ,_, including_VVG floods_NNS ,_, droughts_NNS and_CC sea_NN level_NN rise_NN ,_, are_VBP a_DT subset_NN of_IN impacts_NNS called_VVD physical_JJ impacts_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Indirect_NN emissions_NNS Emissions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP a_DT consequence_NN of_IN the_DT activities_NNS within_IN well-defined_JJ boundaries_NNS of_IN ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, a_DT region_NN ,_, an_DT economic_JJ sector_NN ,_, a_DT company_NN or_CC process_NN ,_, but_CC which_WDT occur_VVP outside_IN the_DT specified_JJ boundaries_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, emissions_NNS are_VBP described_VVN as_IN indirect_JJ if_IN they_PP relate_VVP to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN heat_NN but_CC physically_RB arise_VV outside_IN the_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN the_DT heat_NN user_NN ,_, or_CC to_TO electricity_NN production_NN but_CC physically_RB arise_VV outside_JJ of_IN the_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN the_DT power_NN supply_NN sector_NN ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Industrial_NP Revolution_NP A_DT period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ industrial_JJ growth_NN with_IN far-reaching_JJ social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ consequences_NNS ,_, beginning_VVG in_IN Britain_NP during_IN the_DT second_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT 18th_JJ century_NN and_CC spreading_VVG to_TO Europe_NP and_CC later_RBR to_TO other_JJ countries_NNS including_VVG the_DT United_NP States_NPS ._SENT The_DT invention_NN of_IN the_DT steam_NN engine_NN was_VBD an_DT important_JJ trigger_NN of_IN this_DT development_NN ._SENT The_DT industrial_JJ revolution_NN marks_VVZ the_DT beginning_NN of_IN a_DT strong_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS and_CC emission_NN of_IN ,_, in_IN particular_JJ ,_, fossil_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN the_DT terms_NNS pre-industrial_JJ and_CC industrial_JJ refer_VVP ,_, somewhat_RB arbitrarily_RB ,_, to_TO the_DT periods_NNS before_IN and_CC after_IN 1750_CD ,_, respectively_RB ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Integrated_NP assessment_NN A_DT method_NN of_IN analysis_NN that_WDT combines_VVZ results_NNS and_CC models_NNS from_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, biological_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC social_JJ sciences_NNS and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS among_IN these_DT components_NNS in_IN a_DT consistent_JJ framework_NN to_TO evaluate_VV the_DT status_NN and_CC the_DT consequences_NNS of_IN environmental_JJ change_NN and_CC the_DT policy_NN responses_NNS to_TO it_PP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Integrated_NP models_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Integrated_NP Coastal_NP Zone_NP Management_NP (_( ICZM_NP )_) An_DT integrated_JJ approach_NN for_IN sustainably_RB managing_VVG coastal_JJ areas_NNS ,_, taking_VVG into_IN account_NN all_DT coastal_JJ habitats_NNS and_CC uses_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Integrated_NP models_NNS Integrated_NP models_NNS explore_VVP the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN multiple_JJ sectors_NNS of_IN the_DT economy_NN or_CC components_NNS of_IN particular_JJ systems_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT energy_NN system_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN transformation_NN pathways_NNS ,_, they_PP refer_VVP to_TO models_NNS that_IN/that ,_, at_IN Internal_NP variability_NN See_VV Climate_NN variability_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) 


Irreversibility_NN A_DT perturbed_VVN state_NN of_IN a_DT dynamical_JJ system_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN irreversible_JJ on_IN a_DT given_VVN timescale_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT recovery_NN timescale_NN from_IN this_DT state_NN due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ processes_NNS is_VBZ substantially_RB longer_RBR than_IN the_DT time_NN it_PP takes_VVZ for_IN the_DT system_NN to_TO reach_VV this_DT perturbed_VVN state_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT time_NN scale_NN of_IN interest_NN is_VBZ centennial_NN to_TO millennial_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Tipping_NP point_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) Land_NP use_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN Land_NP use_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT total_NN of_IN arrangements_NNS ,_, activities_NNS and_CC inputs_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ land_NN cover_NN type_NN (_( a_DT set_NN of_IN human_JJ actions_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT term_NN land_NN use_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN the_DT social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ purposes_NNS for_IN which_WDT land_NN is_VBZ managed_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, grazing_NN ,_, timber_NN extraction_NN and_CC conservation_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN urban_JJ settlements_NNS it_PP is_VBZ related_VVN to_TO land_VV uses_NNS within_IN cities_NNS and_CC their_PP$ hinterlands_NNS ._SENT Urban_JJ land_NN use_NN has_VHZ implications_NNS on_IN city_NN management_NN ,_, structure_NN and_CC form_NN and_CC thus_RB on_IN energy_NN demand_NN ,_, greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS and_CC mobility_NN ,_, among_IN other_JJ aspects_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Land-use_NN change_NN (_( LUC_NP )_) Land-use_NN change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT use_NN or_CC management_NN of_IN land_NN by_IN humans_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD lead_VV to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN land_NN cover_NN ._SENT Land_NN cover_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN may_MD have_VH an_DT impact_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN albedo_NN ,_, evapotranspiration_NN ,_, sources_NNS and_CC sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, or_CC other_JJ properties_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN and_CC may_MD thus_RB give_VV rise_NN to_TO radiative_JJ forcing_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC other_JJ impacts_NNS on_IN climate_NN ,_, locally_RB or_CC globally_RB ._SENT See_VV also_RB the_DT IPCC_NP Special_JJ Report_NP on_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NP Change_NP ,_, and_CC Forestry_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2000b_JJ )_) ._SENT Indirect_JJ land-use_NN change_NN (_( iLUC_NN )_) Indirect_NN land-use_NN change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO shifts_NNS in_IN land_NN use_NN induced_VVN by_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT production_NN level_NN of_IN an_DT agricultural_JJ product_NN elsewhere_RB ,_, often_RB mediated_VVN by_IN markets_NNS or_CC driven_VVN by_IN policies_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, if_IN agricultural_JJ land_NN is_VBZ diverted_VVN to_TO fuel_VV production_NN ,_, forest_NN clearance_NN may_MD occur_VV elsewhere_RB to_TO replace_VV the_DT former_JJ agricultural_JJ production_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Agriculture_NP ,_, Forestry_NP and_CC Other_NP Land_NP Use_NP (_( AFOLU_NP )_) ,_, Afforestation_NP ,_, Deforestation_NP and_CC Reforestation_NP ._SENT Leakage_NN Phenomena_NP whereby_WRB the_DT reduction_NN in_IN emissions_NNS (_( relative_JJ to_TO a_DT baseline_NN )_) in_IN a_DT jurisdiction_NN /_SYM sector_NN associated_VVN with_IN the_DT implementation_NN of_IN mitigation_NN policy_NN is_VBZ offset_VVN to_TO some_DT degree_NN by_IN an_DT increase_NN outside_IN the_DT jurisdiction_NN /_SYM sector_NN through_IN induced_VVN changes_NNS in_IN consumption_NN ,_, production_NN ,_, prices_NNS ,_, land_NN use_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC trade_NN across_IN the_DT jurisdictions_NNS /_SYM sectors_NNS ._SENT Leakage_NN can_MD occur_VV at_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN levels_NNS ,_, be_VB it_PP a_DT project_NN ,_, state_NN ,_, province_NN ,_, nation_NN or_CC world_NN region_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) ,_, CO2_NP leakage_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT escape_NN of_IN injected_VVN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT storage_NN location_NN and_CC eventual_JJ release_NN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN other_JJ substances_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN is_VBZ used_VVN more_RBR generically_RB ,_, such_JJ as_IN for_IN methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) leakage_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, from_IN fossil_JJ fuel_NN extraction_NN activities_NNS )_) and_CC hydrofluorocarbon_NP (_( HFC_NP )_) leakage_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, from_IN refrigeration_NN and_CC air-_NN conditioning_NN systems_NNS )_) ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Likelihood_NN The_DT chance_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ outcome_NN occurring_VVG ,_, where_WRB this_DT might_MD be_VB estimated_VVN probabilistically_RB ._SENT Likelihood_NN is_VBZ expressed_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN using_VVG a_DT standard_JJ terminology_NN (_( Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ,_, defined_VVN in_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP Table_NP 1.2_CD and_CC WGII_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 1-1_CD ._SENT See_VV also_RB Confidence_NN and_CC Uncertainty_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Lock-in_NP Lock-in_NP occurs_VVZ when_WRB a_DT market_NN is_VBZ stuck_VVN with_IN a_DT standard_NN even_RB though_IN participants_NNS would_MD be_VB better_JJR off_RP with_IN an_DT alternative_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, lock-in_NN is_VBZ used_VVN more_RBR broadly_RB as_IN path_NN dependence_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT generic_JJ situation_NN where_WRB decisions_NNS ,_, events_NNS or_CC outcomes_NNS at_IN one_CD point_NN in_IN time_NN constrain_VVP adaptation_NN ,_, mitigation_NN or_CC other_JJ actions_NNS or_CC options_NNS at_IN a_DT later_JJR point_NN in_IN time_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Low_NP regrets_VVZ policy_NN A_DT policy_NN that_WDT would_MD generate_VV net_JJ social_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC economic_JJ benefits_NNS under_IN current_JJ climate_NN and_CC a_DT range_NN of_IN future_JJ climate-change_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Marine-based_JJ ice_NN sheet_NN An_DT ice_NN sheet_NN containing_VVG a_DT substantial_JJ region_NN that_WDT rests_VVZ on_IN a_DT bed_NN lying_VVG below_IN sea_NN level_NN and_CC whose_WP$ perimeter_NN is_VBZ in_IN contact_NN with_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT The_DT best_RBS known_JJ example_NN is_VBZ the_DT West_JJ Antarctic_JJ ice_NN sheet_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) Meridional_NP Overturning_NP Circulation_NP (_( MOC_NP )_) Meridional_NP (_( north_RB –_JJ south_NN )_) overturning_VVG circulation_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN quantified_VVN by_IN zonal_JJ (_( east_JJ –_NN west_NN )_) sums_NNS of_IN mass_JJ transports_NNS in_IN depth_NN or_CC density_NN layers_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT North_NP Atlantic_NP ,_, away_RB from_IN the_DT subpolar_NN regions_NNS ,_, the_DT MOC_NP (_( which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN principle_NN an_DT observable_JJ quantity_NN )_) is_VBZ often_RB identified_VVN with_IN the_DT thermohaline_NN circulation_NN (_( THC_NP )_) ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT conceptual_JJ and_CC incomplete_JJ interpretation_NN ._SENT It_PP must_MD be_VB borne_VVN in_IN mind_NN that_IN/that the_DT MOC_NP is_VBZ also_RB driven_VVN by_IN wind_NN and_CC can_MD also_RB include_VV shallower_JJR overturning_VVG cells_NNS such_JJ as_IN occur_VVP in_IN the_DT upper_JJ ocean_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS and_CC subtropics_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT warm_JJ (_( light_JJ )_) waters_NNS moving_VVG poleward_NN are_VBP transformed_VVN to_TO slightly_RB denser_JJR waters_NNS and_CC subducted_VVD equatorward_RB at_IN deeper_JJR levels_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) A_DT human_JJ intervention_NN to_TO reduce_VV the_DT sources_NNS or_CC enhance_VV the_DT sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ._SENT This_DT report_NN also_RB assesses_VVZ human_JJ interventions_NNS to_TO reduce_VV the_DT sources_NNS of_IN other_JJ substances_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) are_VBP sequestered_VVN or_CC stored_VVN than_IN are_VBP released_VVN into_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT {_( SYR_NP Box_NP 2.2_CD ,_, footnote_NN 29_CD }_) Ocean_NP acidification_NN Ocean_NP acidification_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT reduction_NN in_IN the_DT pH_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN over_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_RBR ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ caused_VVN primarily_RB 


by_IN uptake_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, but_CC can_MD also_RB be_VB caused_VVN by_IN other_JJ chemical_NN additions_NNS or_CC subtractions_NNS IPCC_NP ,_, 2011_CD ,_, p_NN ._SENT 37_LS )_) ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Overshoot_NP pathways_NNS Emissions_NNS ,_, concentration_NN or_CC temperature_NN pathways_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT metric_NN of_IN interest_NN temporarily_RB exceeds_VVZ ,_, or_CC overshoots_VVZ the_DT long-term_JJ goal_NN ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Oxygen_NP Minimum_NP Zone_NP (_( OMZ_NP )_) The_DT midwater_NN depletion_NN depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT largely_RB bacterial_JJ consumption_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN and_CC the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT OMZs_NP is_VBZ influenced_VVN by_IN large-scale_JJ Permafrost_NP Ground_NP (_( soil_NN or_CC rock_NN and_CC included_VVD ice_NN and_CC organic_JJ material_NN )_) that_WDT remains_VVZ at_IN or_CC below_IN 0_CD °_SYM C_NP for_IN at_IN least_JJS two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) pH_NN pH_NN is_VBZ a_DT dimensionless_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN water_NN (_( or_CC any_DT solution_NN )_) given_VVN by_IN its_PP$ concentration_NN of_IN hydrogen_NN ions_NNS (_( H+_NP )_) ._SENT pH_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN on_IN a_DT logarithmic_JJ scale_NN where_WRB pH_NN =_SYM –_JJ log10_NN (_( H+_NP )_) ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, a_DT pH_NN decrease_NN of_IN unit_NN corresponds_VVZ to_TO a_DT 10-fold_NN increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN H+_NP ,_, or_CC acidity_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP }_) Poverty_NP Poverty_NP of_IN entitlement_NN )_) ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Pre-industrial_NP See_NP Industrial_NP Revolution_NP ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Private_NP costs_VVZ Private_JJ costs_NNS are_VBP which_WDT aims_VVZ to_TO facilitate_VV judgments_NNS about_IN what_WP level_NN of_IN climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB dangerous_JJ (_( in_IN the_DT language_NN of_IN Article_NP 2_CD of_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) )_) by_IN aggregating_VVG impacts_NNS ,_, risks_NNS and_CC vulnerabilities_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Reducing_VVG Emissions_NNS from_IN Deforestation_NP and_CC Forest_NP Degradation_NP (_( REDD_NP )_) An_DT effort_NN to_TO create_VV financial_JJ value_NN for_IN the_DT carbon_NN stored_VVN in_IN forests_NNS ,_, offering_VVG incentives_NNS for_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS to_TO reduce_VV emissions_NNS from_IN forested_JJ lands_NNS and_CC invest_VV in_IN low-carbon_NN paths_NNS to_TO sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ therefore_RB a_DT mechanism_NN for_IN mitigation_NN that_IN/that results_NNS from_IN avoiding_VVG deforestation_NN ._SENT REDD+_NP goes_VVZ beyond_IN reforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN and_CC includes_VVZ the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, sustainable_JJ management_NN of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN forest_NN carbon_NN stocks_NNS ._SENT The_DT concept_NN was_VBD first_RB introduced_VVN in_IN 2005_CD in_IN the_DT 11th_JJ Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) in_IN Montreal_NP and_CC later_RBR given_VVN greater_JJR recognition_NN in_IN the_DT 13th_JJ Session_NP of_IN the_DT COP_NP in_IN 2007_CD at_IN Bali_NP and_CC inclusion_NN in_IN the_DT Bali_NP Action_NP Plan_NP which_WDT called_VVD for_IN ‘policy_NN approaches_NNS and_CC positive_JJ incentives_NNS on_IN issues_NNS relating_VVG to_TO reducing_VVG emissions_NNS from_IN deforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS (_( REDD_NP )_) and_CC the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, sustainable_JJ management_NN of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN forest_NN carbon_NN stock_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries’_NN ._SENT Since_IN then_RB ,_, support_NN for_IN REDD_NP has_VHZ increased_VVN and_CC has_VHZ slowly_RB become_VVN a_DT framework_NN for_IN action_NN supported_VVN by_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN countries_NNS ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Reforestation_NP Planting_NP of_IN forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT have_VHP previously_RB contained_VVN forests_NNS but_CC that_WDT have_VHP been_VBN converted_VVN to_TO some_DT other_JJ use_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC ,_, 2013_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB the_DT Report_NP on_IN Definitions_NP and_CC Methodological_NP Options_NPS to_TO Inventory_JJ Emissions_NNS from_IN Direct_NP Human-induced_NP Degradation_NP of_IN Forests_NP and_CC Devegetation_NP of_IN Other_NP Vegetation_NP Types_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2003_CD )_) ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) Scenarios_NP that_WDT include_VVP time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS of_IN the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC chemically_RB active_JJ gases_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN land_NN use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN representative_NN signifies_VVZ that_IN/that each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ possible_JJ scenarios_NNS that_WDT would_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT specific_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN pathway_NN emphasizes_VVZ that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT long-term_JJ concentration_NN levels_NNS are_VBP of_IN interest_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB the_DT trajectory_NN taken_VVN over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV that_DT outcome_NN (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT RCPs_NNS usually_RB refer_VVP to_TO the_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT concentration_NN pathway_NN extending_VVG up_RP to_TO 2100_CD ,_, for_IN which_WDT Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS produced_VVD corresponding_JJ emission_NN scenarios_NNS ._SENT Extended_JJ Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( ECPs_NP )_) describe_VVP extensions_NNS of_IN the_DT RCPs_NP from_IN 2100_CD to_TO 2500_CD that_WDT were_VBD 


calculated_JJ using_VVG simple_JJ rules_NNS generated_VVN by_IN stakeholder_NN consultations_NNS and_CC do_VVP not_RB represent_VV fully_RB consistent_JJ scenarios_NNS ._SENT Four_NP RCPs_NP produced_VVD from_IN Integrated_NP Assessment_NP Models_NPS were_VBD selected_VVN from_IN the_DT published_VVN literature_NN and_CC are_VBP used_VVN in_IN the_DT present_JJ IPCC_NP Assessment_NP as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT climate_NN predictions_NNS and_CC projections_NNS presented_VVN in_IN WGI_NP AR5_NP Chapters_NP 11_CD to_TO 14_CD (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2013b_NP )_) :_: RCP2.6_NP One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN approximately_RB W_NP /_SYM m2_NN before_IN 2100_CD and_CC then_RB declines_NNS (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilization_NN pathways_NNS in_IN which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ stabilized_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN /_SYM m2_JJ and_CC 6.0_CD W_NN /_SYM m2_JJ after_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS assuming_VVG constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2150_CD )_) ._SENT RCP8.5_NP One_NP high_JJ pathway_NN for_IN which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG reaches_NNS >_SYM 8.5_CD W_NN /_SYM m2_JJ by_IN 2100_CD and_CC continues_VVZ to_TO rise_VV for_IN some_DT amount_NN of_IN time_NN (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP assuming_VVG constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) ._SENT For_IN further_JJR description_NN of_IN future_JJ scenarios_NNS ,_, see_VVP WGI_NP AR5_NP Box_NP 1.1_CD ._SENT See_VV also_RB van_NP Vuuren_NP et_CC al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2011._CD {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Resilience_NN The_DT capacity_NN of_IN social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ systems_NNS to_TO cope_VV with_IN a_DT hazardous_JJ event_NN or_CC trend_NN or_CC disturbance_NN ,_, responding_VVG or_CC adaptation_NN ,_, learning_NN and_CC transformation5_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Risk_NN The_DT potential_NN for_IN consequences_NNS where_WRB something_NN of_IN value_NN is_VBZ at_IN stake_NN and_CC where_WRB the_DT outcome_NN is_VBZ uncertain_JJ ,_, recognizing_VVG the_DT diversity_NN of_IN values_NNS ._SENT Risk_NN is_VBZ often_RB represented_VVN as_IN probability_NN or_CC services_NNS )_) and_CC infrastructure_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Risk_NN management_NN The_DT plans_NNS ,_, actions_NNS or_CC policies_NNS to_TO reduce_VV the_DT likelihood_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC consequences_NNS of_IN risks_NNS or_CC to_TO respond_VV to_TO consequences_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Sequestration_NN The_DT uptake_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, the_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN of_IN concern_NN to_TO a_DT reservoir_NN )_) of_IN carbon_NN containing_VVG substances_NNS ,_, in_IN particular_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, in_IN terrestrial_JJ or_CC marine_JJ ,_, reforestation_NN ,_, revegetation_NN ,_, carbon_NN storage_NN in_IN landfills_NNS and_CC practices_NNS that_WDT enhance_VVP soil_NN carbon_NN in_IN agriculture_NN (_( cropland_NN management_NN ,_, to_TO Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Capture_NP and_CC Storage_NP (_( CCS_NP )_) ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Sink_NP Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN that_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP or_CC aerosol_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Social_NP cost_NN of_IN carbon_NN The_DT net_JJ present_JJ value_NN of_IN climate_NN damages_NNS (_( with_IN harmful_JJ damages_NNS expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT positive_JJ number_NN )_) from_IN one_CD more_JJR tonne_NN of_IN carbon_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, conditional_JJ on_IN a_DT global_JJ emissions_NNS trajectory_NN over_IN time_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Social_NP costs_NNS See_VV Private_JJ costs_NNS ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP (_( SRM_NP )_) Solar_NP Radiation_NP Management_NP refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT intentional_JJ modification_NN of_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP shortwave_NN radiative_JJ budget_NN with_IN the_DT aim_NN to_TO reduce_VV climate-change_NN according_VVG to_TO a_DT given_VVN metric_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, regional_JJ impacts_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) ._SENT Artificial_JJ injection_NN of_IN stratospheric_JJ aerosols_NNS and_CC cloud_VV brightening_VVG are_VBP two_CD examples_NNS of_IN SRM_NP techniques_NNS ._SENT Methods_NNS to_TO modify_VV some_DT fast-responding_JJ elements_NNS of_IN the_DT long_JJ wave_NN radiative_JJ budget_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN cirrus_NN clouds_NNS )_) ,_, although_IN not_RB strictly_RB speaking_VVG SRM_NP ,_, can_MD be_VB related_VVN to_TO SRM_NP ._SENT SRM_NN techniques_NNS do_VVP not_RB fall_VV within_IN the_DT usual_JJ definitions_NNS of_IN mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2012b_NP ,_, p_NN ._SENT 2_LS )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP Dioxide_NP Removal_NP (_( CDR_NP )_) and_CC Geoengineering_NP ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, III_NP }_) SRES_NP scenarios_NNS SRES_NP scenarios_NNS are_VBP emission_NN scenarios_NNS developed_VVN by_IN IPCC_NP (_( 2000a_NP )_) and_CC used_VVN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT basis_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT climate_NN projections_NNS shown_VVN in_IN Chapters_NP 9_CD to_TO 11_CD of_IN IPCC_NP WGI_NP TAR_NP (_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2001a_NP )_) ,_, Chapters_NP 10_CD Storm_NP surge_NN The_DT temporary_JJ increase_NN ,_, at_IN a_DT particular_JJ locality_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT sea_NN due_JJ to_TO extreme_JJ meteorological_JJ conditions_NNS (_( low_JJ atmospheric_JJ pressure_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC strong_JJ winds_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT storm_NN surge_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN being_VBG the_DT excess_NN above_IN the_DT level_NN expected_VVN from_IN the_DT tidal_JJ variation_NN alone_RB at_IN that_DT time_NN and_CC place_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Structural_NP change_NN Changes_NP ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT relative_JJ share_NN of_IN gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) produced_VVD by_IN the_DT industrial_JJ ,_, agricultural_JJ ,_, or_CC services_NNS sectors_NNS of_IN an_DT economy_NN ,_, ._SENT {_( WGIII_NP }_) Sustainability_NN A_DT dynamic_JJ process_NN that_WDT guarantees_VVZ the_DT persistence_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN an_DT equitable_JJ manner_NN ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definition_NN used_VVN in_IN Arctic_NP Council_NP (_( 2013_CD )_) ._SENT 


Sustainable_JJ development_NN Development_NP that_WDT meets_VVZ the_DT needs_NNS of_IN the_DT present_NN without_IN compromising_VVG the_DT ability_NN of_IN future_JJ generations_NNS to_TO meet_VV their_PP$ own_JJ needs_NNS (_( WCED_NP ,_, 1987_CD )_) ._SENT {_( WGII_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Thermal_NP expansion_NN In_IN connection_NN with_IN sea_NN level_NN ,_, this_DT refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN volume_NN (_( and_CC decrease_NN in_IN density_NN )_) that_IN/that results_NNS from_IN warming_NN water_NN ._SENT A_DT warming_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT expansion_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN volume_NN and_CC hence_RB an_DT increase_NN in_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP }_) Tipping_NP point_VVP A_DT level_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN system_NN properties_NNS beyond_IN which_WDT a_DT system_NN reorganizes_VVZ ,_, often_RB abruptly_RB ,_, and_CC does_VVZ not_RB return_VV to_TO the_DT initial_JJ state_NN even_RB if_IN the_DT drivers_NNS of_IN the_DT change_NN are_VBP abated_VVN ._SENT For_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, it_PP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT critical_JJ threshold_NN when_WRB global_JJ or_CC regional_JJ climate_NN changes_NNS from_IN one_CD stable_JJ state_NN to_TO another_DT stable_JJ state_NN ._SENT The_DT tipping_VVG point_NN event_NN may_MD be_VB irreversible_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Irreversibility_NN ._SENT {_( WGI_NP ,_, II_NP ,_, III_NP }_) Transformation_NN A_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT fundamental_JJ attributes_NNS of_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT {_( WGII_NP }_) Transformation_NN pathway_NN The_DT surface_NN temperature_NN change_NN that_WDT implies_VVZ a_DT set_NN of_IN economic_JJ ,_, technological_JJ and_CC behavioural_JJ changes_NNS ._SENT This_DT can_MD encompass_VV changes_NNS in_IN the_DT way_NN energy_NN and_CC infrastructure_NN are_VBP used_VVN and_CC produced_VVN ,_, natural_JJ resources_NNS are_VBP managed_VVN and_CC institutions_NNS are_VBP set_VVN up_RP and_CC in_IN the_DT pace_NN and_CC direction_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN (_( TC_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP /_SYM reference_NN ,_, Emission_NN scenario_NN ,_, Mitigation_NN scenario_NN ,_, ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD therefore_RB be_VB represented_VVN by_IN quantitative_JJ measures_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN )_) or_CC by_IN qualitative_JJ statements_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, reflecting_VVG the_DT judgment_NN of_IN a_DT team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) (_( see_VV Moss_NP and_CC Schneider_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: Manning_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, .5_CD °_SYM C_NP pathway_NN See_NP Pathways_NP ._SENT .5_CD °_SYM C_NP warmer_NN worlds_NNS Projected_JJ worlds_NNS in_IN which_WDT global_JJ warming_NN has_VHZ reached_VVN and_CC ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB indicated_VVN ,_, been_VBN limited_VVN to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NN above_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ no_DT single_JJ 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP warmer_NN world_NN ,_, and_CC projections_NNS of_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP warmer_NN worlds_NNS look_VVP different_JJ depending_VVG on_IN whether_IN it_PP is_VBZ considered_VVN on_IN a_DT near-term_JJ transient_JJ trajectory_NN or_CC at_IN climate_NN equilibrium_NN after_IN several_JJ millennia_NNS ,_, and_CC ,_, in_IN both_DT cases_NNS ,_, if_IN it_PP occurs_VVZ with_IN or_CC without_IN overshoot_VV ._SENT Within_IN the_DT 21st_JJ century_NN ,_, several_JJ aspects_NNS play_VVP a_DT role_NN for_IN the_DT assessment_NN of_IN risk_NN and_CC potential_JJ impacts_NNS in_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP warmer_NN worlds_NNS :_: the_DT possible_JJ occurrence_NN ,_, magnitude_NN and_CC duration_NN of_IN an_DT overshoot_VVP ;_: the_DT way_NN in_IN which_WDT emissions_NNS reductions_NNS are_VBP achieved_VVN ;_: the_DT ways_NNS in_IN which_WDT policies_NNS might_MD be_VB able_JJ to_TO influence_VV the_DT resilience_NN of_IN human_JJ and_CC natural_JJ systems_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT regional_JJ and_CC sub-regional_JJ risks_NNS ._SENT Beyond_IN the_DT 21st_JJ century_NN ,_, several_JJ elements_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN would_MD continue_VV to_TO change_VV even_RB if_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ temperatures_NNS remain_VVP stable_JJ ,_, including_VVG further_JJR increases_NNS of_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT Agenda_NN for_IN Sustainable_NP Development_NP A_NP UN_NP resolution_NN in_IN September_NP 2015_CD adopting_VVG a_DT plan_NN of_IN action_NN for_IN people_NNS ,_, planet_NN and_CC prosperity_NN in_IN a_DT new_JJ global_JJ development_NN framework_NN anchored_VVN in_IN 17_CD Sustainable_NP Development_NP Goals_NP (_( UN_NP ,_, 2015_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sustainable_JJ Development_NP Goals_NP (_( SDGs_NP )_) ._SENT Acceptability_NN of_IN policy_NN or_CC system_NN change_NN The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT policy_NN or_CC system_NN change_NN is_VBZ evaluated_VVN unfavourably_RB or_CC favourably_RB ,_, or_CC rejected_VVN or_CC supported_VVN ,_, by_IN members_NNS of_IN the_DT general_JJ public_NN (_( public_JJ acceptability_NN )_) or_CC politicians_NNS or_CC governments_NNS (_( political_JJ acceptability_NN )_) ._SENT Acceptability_NN may_MD vary_VV from_IN totally_RB unacceptable_JJ /_SYM fully_RB rejected_VVN to_TO totally_RB acceptable_JJ /_SYM fully_RB supported_VVN ;_: individuals_NNS may_MD differ_VV in_IN how_WRB acceptable_JJ policies_NNS or_CC system_NN changes_NNS are_VBP believed_VVN to_TO be_VB ._SENT Adaptability_NN See_VV Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN In_IN human_JJ systems_NNS ,_, the_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ or_CC expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO moderate_JJ harm_NN or_CC exploit_VV beneficial_JJ opportunities_NNS ._SENT In_IN natural_JJ systems_NNS ,_, the_DT process_NN of_IN adjustment_NN to_TO actual_JJ climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ;_: human_JJ intervention_NN may_MD facilitate_VV adjustment_NN to_TO expected_VVN climate_NN and_CC its_PP$ effects_NNS ._SENT Incremental_JJ adaptation_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT maintains_VVZ the_DT essence_NN and_CC integrity_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN or_CC process_NN at_IN a_DT given_VVN scale_NN ._SENT In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, incremental_JJ adaptation_NN can_MD accrue_VV to_TO result_VV in_IN transformational_JJ adaptation_NN (_( Termeer_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2017_CD ;_: Tàbara_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Transformational_JJ adaptation_NN Adaptation_NN that_WDT changes_VVZ the_DT fundamental_JJ attributes_NNS of_IN a_DT socioecological_JJ system_NN in_IN anticipation_NN of_IN climate-change_NN and_CC its_PP$ impacts_NNS ._SENT Adaptation_NN limits_VVZ The_DT point_NN at_IN which_WDT an_DT actor’s_JJ objectives_NNS (_( or_CC system_NN needs_NNS )_) cannot_MD be_VB secured_VVN from_IN intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ actions_NNS ._SENT •_NP Hard_NP adaptation_NN limit_NN :_: No_DT adaptive_JJ actions_NNS are_VBP possible_JJ to_TO avoid_VV intolerable_JJ risks_NNS ._SENT •_NP Soft_NP adaptation_NN limit_NN :_: Options_NNS are_VBP currently_RB not_RB available_JJ to_TO avoid_VV intolerable_JJ risks_NNS through_IN adaptive_JJ action_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Adaptation_JJ options_NNS ,_, Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN and_CC Maladaptive_JJ actions_NNS (_( Maladaptation_NP )_) ._SENT Adaptation_NN behaviour_NN See_VV Human_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN limits_NNS See_VV Adaptation_NP ._SENT Adaptation_NN options_NNS The_DT array_NN of_IN strategies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS that_WDT are_VBP available_JJ and_CC appropriate_JJ for_IN addressing_VVG adaptation_NN ._SENT They_PP include_VVP a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN actions_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB categorized_VVN as_IN ._SENT Adaptation_NN pathways_NNS See_VV Pathways_NP ._SENT Adaptive_JJ capacity_NN The_DT ability_NN of_IN systems_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, humans_NNS and_CC other_JJ organisms_NNS to_TO adjust_VV to_TO potential_JJ damage_NN ,_, to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO respond_VV to_TO consequences_NNS ._SENT This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN previous_JJ IPCC_NP reports_NNS and_CC the_DT Millennium_NP Ecosystem_NP Assessment_NP (_( MEA_NP ,_, 2005_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Adaptation_NP ,_, Adaptation_NP options_NNS and_CC Maladaptive_JJ actions_NNS (_( Maladaptation_NP )_) ._SENT Adaptive_JJ governance_NN See_NP Governance_NP ._SENT Aerosol_NN A_DT suspension_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT typical_JJ size_NN between_IN a_DT few_JJ nanometres_NNS and_CC 10_CD μm_NN that_WDT reside_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN aerosol_NN ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ both_CC the_DT particles_NNS and_CC the_DT suspending_VVG gas_NN ,_, is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN in_IN its_PP$ plural_JJ form_NN to_TO mean_VV aerosol_NN particles_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_DT natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN several_JJ ways_NNS :_: through_IN both_DT interactions_NNS that_WDT scatter_VVP and_CC /_SYM or_CC absorb_VV radiation_NN and_CC through_IN interactions_NNS with_IN cloud_NN microphysics_NNS and_CC other_JJ cloud_NN properties_NNS ,_, or_CC upon_IN deposition_NN on_IN snow-_NN or_CC ice-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS thereby_RB altering_VVG their_PP$ albedo_NN and_CC contributing_VVG to_TO climate_NN feedback_NN ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ aerosols_NNS ,_, whether_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, originate_VV from_IN two_CD different_JJ pathways_NNS :_: emissions_NNS of_IN primary_JJ particulate_JJ matter_NN (_( PM_NP )_) ,_, and_CC formation_NN of_IN secondary_JJ PM_NP from_IN gaseous_JJ precursors_NNS ._SENT The_DT bulk_NN of_IN aerosols_NNS are_VBP of_IN natural_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Some_DT scientists_NNS use_VVP group_NN labels_NNS that_WDT refer_VVP to_TO the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN ,_, namely_RB :_: sea_NN salt_NN ,_, organic_JJ carbon_NN ,_, black_JJ carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) ,_, mineral_NN species_NNS (_( mainly_RB desert_NN dust_NN )_) ,_, sulphate_NN ,_, nitrate_NN ,_, and_CC ammonium_NN ._SENT These_DT labels_NNS are_VBP ,_, however_RB ,_, imperfect_JJ as_IN aerosols_NNS combine_VVP particles_NNS to_TO create_VV complex_JJ mixtures_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) and_CC Black_NP carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) ._SENT Afforestation_NN Planting_NP of_IN new_JJ forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT historically_RB have_VHP not_RB contained_VVN forests_NNS ._SENT For_IN a_DT the_DT scientific_JJ body_NN of_IN knowledge_NN on_IN a_DT particular_JJ finding_NN is_VBZ assessed_VVN based_VVN on_IN multiple_JJ lines_NNS of_IN evidence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, mechanistic_JJ also_RB Evidence_NN ,_, Confidence_NP ,_, Likelihood_NN and_CC Uncertainty_NN ._SENT Air_NP pollution_NN Degradation_NN of_IN air_NN quality_NN with_IN negative_JJ effects_NNS on_IN human_JJ health_NN or_CC the_DT natural_JJ or_CC built_VVN environment_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT introduction_NN ,_, by_IN natural_JJ processes_NNS or_CC human_JJ activity_NN ,_, into_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN of_IN See_VV also_RB Aerosol_NP and_CC Short-lived_NP climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) ._SENT Albedo_NN The_DT fraction_NN of_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN reflected_VVN by_IN a_DT surface_NN or_CC object_NN ,_, often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Snow-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS have_VHP a_DT high_JJ albedo_NN ,_, the_DT surface_NN albedo_NN of_IN soils_NNS ranges_NNS from_IN high_JJ to_TO low_JJ ,_, and_CC vegetation-covered_JJ surfaces_NNS and_CC the_DT oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT low_JJ albedo_NN ._SENT The_DT Earth’s_NP planetary_JJ albedo_NN changes_NNS mainly_RB through_IN varying_VVG cloudiness_NN and_CC changes_NNS in_IN snow_NN ,_, ice_NN ,_, leaf_NN area_NN and_CC land_NN cover_NN ._SENT Ambient_JJ persuasive_JJ technology_NN Technological_NP systems_NNS and_CC environments_NNS that_WDT are_VBP designed_VVN to_TO change_VV human_JJ cognitive_JJ processing_NN ,_, 


attitudes_NNS and_CC behaviours_NNS without_IN the_DT need_NN for_IN the_DT user’s_JJ conscious_JJ attention_NN ._SENT Anomaly_NN The_DT deviation_NN of_IN a_DT variable_NN from_IN its_PP$ value_NN averaged_VVD over_IN a_DT reference_NN period_NN ._SENT Anthropocene_NP The_DT ‘Anthropocene’_NN is_VBZ a_DT proposed_VVN new_JJ geological_JJ epoch_NN resulting_VVG from_IN significant_JJ human-driven_JJ changes_NNS to_TO the_DT structure_NN and_CC functioning_VVG of_IN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP ,_, including_VVG the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Originally_RB proposed_VVN in_IN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP science_NN community_NN in_IN 2000_CD ,_, the_DT proposed_VVN new_JJ epoch_NN is_VBZ undergoing_VVG a_DT formalization_NN process_NN within_IN the_DT geological_JJ community_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT stratigraphic_JJ evidence_NN that_IN/that human_JJ activities_NNS have_VHP changed_VVN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN forming_VVG geological_JJ deposits_NNS with_IN a_DT signature_NN that_WDT is_VBZ distinct_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT Holocene_JJ ,_, and_CC which_WDT will_MD remain_VV in_IN the_DT geological_JJ record_NN ._SENT Both_CC the_DT stratigraphic_JJ and_CC Earth_NP System_NP approaches_VVZ to_TO defining_VVG the_DT Anthropocene_NP consider_VVP the_DT mid-20th_JJ Century_NN to_TO be_VB the_DT most_RBS appropriate_JJ starting_VVG date_NN ,_, although_IN others_NNS have_VHP been_VBN proposed_VVN and_CC continue_VVP to_TO be_VB discussed_VVN ._SENT The_DT Anthropocene_NP concept_NN has_VHZ been_VBN taken_VVN up_RP by_IN a_DT diversity_NN of_IN disciplines_NNS and_CC the_DT public_NN to_TO denote_VV the_DT substantive_JJ influence_NN humans_NNS have_VHP had_VHN on_IN the_DT state_NN ,_, dynamics_NNS and_CC future_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Holocene_JJ ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ Resulting_NN from_IN or_CC produced_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS Emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, precursors_NNS of_IN GHGs_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT activities_NNS include_VVP the_DT burning_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN and_CC land-use_NN changes_NNS (_( LULUC_NP )_) ,_, livestock_NN production_NN ,_, fertilisation_NN ,_, waste_NN management_NN and_CC industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ and_CC Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS refer_VVP to_TO the_DT withdrawal_NN of_IN GHGs_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN deliberate_JJ human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT include_VVP enhancing_VVG biological_JJ sinks_NNS of_IN CO2_NP and_CC using_VVG chemical_NN engineering_NN to_TO achieve_VV long-term_JJ removal_NN and_CC storage_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) from_IN industrial_JJ and_CC energy-related_JJ sources_NNS ,_, which_WDT alone_RB does_VVZ not_RB remove_VV CO2_NP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, can_MD reduce_VV atmospheric_JJ CO2_NN if_IN it_PP is_VBZ combined_VVN with_IN bioenergy_JJ production_NN (_( BECCS_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, Bioenergy_NN with_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( BECCS_NP )_) and_CC Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) ._SENT Artificial_JJ intelligence_NN (_( AI_NP )_) Computer_NP systems_NNS able_JJ to_TO perform_VV tasks_NNS normally_RB requiring_VVG human_JJ intelligence_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN visual_JJ perception_NN and_CC speech_NN recognition_NN ._SENT Atmosphere_NN The_DT gaseous_JJ envelope_NN surrounding_VVG the_DT earth_NN ,_, divided_VVN into_IN five_CD layers_NNS –_JJ the_DT troposphere_NN which_WDT contains_VVZ half_NN of_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, the_DT mesosphere_NN ,_, the_DT thermosphere_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT exosphere_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT outer_JJ limit_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT dry_JJ atmosphere_NN consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, together_RB with_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN and_CC radiatively_JJ active_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) (_( 0.04_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ the_DT GHG_NP water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, whose_WP$ amounts_NNS are_VBP highly_RB variable_JJ but_CC typically_RB around_IN 1_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN also_RB contains_VVZ clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Troposphere_NP ,_, Stratosphere_NP ,_, Greenhouse_NP gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) and_CC Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT Atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN general_JJ circulation_NN model_NN (_( AOGCM_NP )_) See_VV Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN See_VV Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN ._SENT Baseline_JJ scenario_NN In_IN much_JJ of_IN the_DT literature_NN the_DT term_NN is_VBZ also_RB synonymous_JJ with_IN the_DT term_NN business-as-usual_JJ (_( BAU_NP )_) scenario_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT term_NN BAU_NP has_VHZ fallen_VVN out_RP of_IN favour_NN because_IN the_DT idea_NN of_IN business_NN as_IN usual_JJ in_IN century-long_JJ socio-economic_JJ projections_NNS is_VBZ hard_JJ to_TO fathom_VV ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN transformation_NN pathways_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN baseline_NN scenarios_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO already_RB in_IN force_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC are_VBP legislated_VVN or_CC planned_VVN to_TO be_VB adopted_VVN ._SENT Baseline_NN scenarios_NNS are_VBP not_RB intended_VVN to_TO be_VB predictions_NNS of_IN the_DT future_NN ,_, but_CC rather_RB counterfactual_JJ constructions_NNS that_WDT can_MD serve_VV to_TO highlight_VV the_DT level_NN of_IN emissions_NNS that_WDT would_MD occur_VV without_IN ecosystems_NNS (_( UN_NP ,_, 1992_CD )_) ._SENT Bioenergy_NP Energy_NP derived_VVD from_IN any_DT form_NN of_IN biomass_NN or_CC its_PP$ metabolic_JJ by-products_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Biomass_NP atmosphere_NN only_RB for_IN days_NNS or_CC weeks_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS strongly_RB light-absorbing_VVG component_NN of_IN particulate_JJ matter_NN (_( PM_NP )_) and_CC has_VHZ a_DT warming_NN effect_NN by_IN absorbing_VVG heat_NN into_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC reducing_VVG the_DT albedo_NN when_WRB deposited_VVN on_IN snow_NN or_CC ice_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Aerosol_NP ._SENT Blue_JJ carbon_NN Blue_JJ carbon_NN is_VBZ the_DT carbon_NN captured_VVN by_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS in_IN coastal_JJ (_( e.g._FW ,_, mangroves_NNS ,_, salt_NN marshes_NNS ,_, seagrasses_NNS )_) and_CC marine_JJ ecosystems_NNS ,_, and_CC stored_VVD in_IN biomass_NN and_CC sediments_NNS ._SENT Burden_NN sharing_NN (_( also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Effort_NP sharing_NN )_) In_IN the_DT Business_NN as_IN usual_JJ (_( BAU_NP )_) See_NP Baseline_NP scenario_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN budget_NN This_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO three_CD concepts_NNS in_IN the_DT literature_NN :_: (_( 1_LS )_) budget_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN cycle_NN The_DT term_NN used_VVN to_TO describe_VV the_DT flow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN in_IN biomass_NN ,_, and_CC carbon_NN dissolved_VVN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN as_IN carbonate_NN and_CC bicarbonate_NN )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, hydrosphere_NN ,_, GtC_NP (_( Gigatonne_NP of_IN carbon_NN =_SYM 1_CD GtC_NN =_SYM 1015_CD grams_NNS of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT This_DT corresponds_VVZ to_TO 3.667_CD GtCO2_NN )_) ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, CO2_NP is_VBZ also_RB a_DT by-product_NN of_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN oil_NN ,_, gas_NN and_CC coal_NN )_) ,_, of_IN burning_NN biomass_NN ,_, of_IN land-use_NN changes_NNS (_( LUC_NP )_) and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ processes_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, cement_NN production_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN against_IN which_WDT other_JJ GHGs_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB has_VHZ a_DT global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN (_( GWP_NP )_) of_IN 1._CD See_NP also_RB Greenhouse_NP gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) A_DT process_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT relatively_RB pure_JJ stream_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN industrial_JJ and_CC energy-related_JJ sources_NNS is_VBZ separated_JJ (_( captured_VVN )_) ,_, conditioned_VVN ,_, compressed_VVN and_CC transported_VVN to_TO a_DT storage_NN location_NN for_IN long-term_JJ isolation_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Carbon_NP capture_NN and_CC storage_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN (_( CCU_NP )_) ,_, Bioenergy_NN with_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( BECCS_NP )_) and_CC Uptake_NP ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN (_( CCU_NP )_) A_DT climate-relevant_JJ time_NN horizon_NN ,_, this_DT is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN ,_, utilisation_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCUS_NP )_) ._SENT Only_RB then_RB ,_, and_CC only_RB combined_VVN with_IN CO2_NP recently_RB removed_VVD from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, can_MD CCUS_NP lead_VV to_TO carbon_NN dioxide_NN removal_NN ._SENT CCU_NP is_VBZ sometimes_RB utilisation_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCUS_NP )_) See_NP Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN (_( CCU_NP )_) ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN removal_NN (_( CDR_NP )_) Anthropogenic_JJ activities_NNS removing_VVG CO2_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC durably_RB storing_VVG it_PP in_IN geological_JJ ,_, terrestrial_JJ ,_, or_CC ocean_NN reservoirs_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN products_NNS ._SENT It_PP includes_VVZ existing_JJ and_CC potential_JJ anthropogenic_JJ enhancement_NN of_IN biological_JJ or_CC geochemical_JJ sinks_NNS and_CC direct_JJ air_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN ,_, but_CC excludes_VVZ natural_JJ CO2_NP uptake_NN not_RB directly_RB caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) ,_, GDP_NP )_) ,_, output_NN energy_NN use_NN or_CC transport_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN neutrality_NN See_VV Net_JJ zero_CD CO2_NP emissions_NNS ._SENT Carbon_NN price_NN The_DT price_NN for_IN avoided_VVN or_CC released_VVN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) or_CC CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT This_DT may_MD refer_VV to_TO the_DT rate_NN of_IN a_DT carbon_NN tax_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT price_NN of_IN emission_NN permits_NNS ._SENT In_IN many_JJ models_NNS that_WDT are_VBP used_VVN to_TO assess_VV the_DT economic_JJ costs_NNS of_IN mitigation_NN ,_, carbon_NN prices_NNS are_VBP used_VVN as_IN a_DT proxy_NN to_TO represent_VV the_DT level_NN of_IN effort_NN in_IN mitigation_NN policies_NNS ._SENT Carbon_NN sequestration_NN The_DT process_NN of_IN storing_VVG carbon_NN in_IN a_DT carbon_NN pool_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Blue_JJ carbon_NN ,_, Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) ,_, Uptake_NP and_CC Sink_NP ._SENT Carbon_NN sink_NN See_NP Sink_NP ._SENT Clean_NP Development_NP Mechanism_NP (_( CDM_NP )_) A_DT mechanism_NN defined_VVN under_IN Article_NP 12_CD of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP through_IN which_WDT investors_NNS (_( governments_NNS or_CC companies_NNS )_) from_IN developed_JJ (_( Annex_NP B_NP )_) countries_NNS may_MD finance_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emission_NN reduction_NN or_CC removal_NN projects_NNS in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS (_( Non-Annex_NP B_NP )_) ,_, and_CC receive_VV Certified_NP Emission_NP Reduction_NP Units_NP (_( CERs_NP )_) for_IN doing_VVG so_RB ._SENT The_DT CERs_NNS can_MD be_VB credited_VVN towards_IN the_DT commitments_NNS of_IN the_DT respective_JJ developed_JJ countries_NNS ._SENT The_DT CDM_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN to_TO facilitate_VV the_DT two_CD objectives_NNS of_IN promoting_VVG sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS and_CC of_IN helping_VVG industrialised_VVN countries_NNS to_TO reach_VV their_PP$ emissions_NNS commitments_NNS in_IN a_DT cost-effective_JJ way_NN ._SENT Climate_NN Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT average_JJ weather_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT classical_JJ period_NN for_IN averaging_VVG these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT climate-change_NN climate-change_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS of_IN the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS and_CC persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that the_DT Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NN ,_, defines_VVZ climate-change_NN as_RB :_: ‘a_NN change_NN of_IN climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN that_WDT alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVN over_IN comparable_JJ time_NN periods.’_NN The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN climate-change_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ composition_NN and_CC climate_NN variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN variability_NN ,_, Global_JJ warming_NN ,_, Ocean_NP acidification_NN (_( OA_NN )_) and_CC Detection_NN and_CC attribution_NN ._SENT climate-change_NN commitment_NN climate-change_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT unavoidable_JJ future_JJ climate-change_NN resulting_VVG from_IN inertia_NN in_IN the_DT geophysical_JJ and_CC socio-economic_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT Different_JJ types_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN commitment_NN are_VBP discussed_VVN in_IN the_DT literature_NN (_( see_VV subterms_NNS )_) ._SENT climate-change_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ usually_RB quantified_VVN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT further_JJR change_NN in_IN temperature_NN ,_, but_CC it_PP includes_VVZ other_JJ future_JJ changes_NNS ,_, for_IN example_NN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ,_, in_IN extreme_JJ climate_NN events_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN sea_NN level_NN ._SENT Constant_JJ composition_NN commitment_NN The_DT constant_JJ composition_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT remaining_VVG climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV if_IN atmospheric_JJ composition_NN ,_, and_CC hence_RB radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, were_VBD held_VVN fixed_VVN at_IN a_DT given_VVN value_NN ._SENT It_PP results_VVZ from_IN the_DT thermal_JJ inertia_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC slow_JJ processes_NNS in_IN the_DT cryosphere_NN and_CC land_NN surface_NN ._SENT 


Constant_JJ emissions_NNS commitment_NN The_DT constant_JJ emissions_NNS commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT committed_JJ climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV from_IN keeping_VVG anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS constant_JJ ._SENT Zero_CD emissions_NNS commitment_NN The_DT zero_CD emissions_NNS commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT climate-change_NN commitment_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV from_IN setting_VVG anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS to_TO zero_CD ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ determined_VVN by_IN both_DT inertia_NN in_IN physical_JJ climate-system_NN components_NNS (_( ocean_NN ,_, cryosphere_NN ,_, land_NN surface_NN )_) and_CC carbon_NN cycle_NN inertia_NN ._SENT Feasible_JJ scenario_NN commitment_NN The_DT feasible_JJ scenario_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT climate-change_NN that_WDT corresponds_VVZ to_TO the_DT lowest_JJS emission_NN scenario_NN judged_VVN feasible_JJ ._SENT Infrastructure_NN commitment_NN The_DT infrastructure_NN commitment_NN is_VBZ the_DT climate-change_NN that_WDT would_MD result_VV if_IN existing_VVG greenhouse_NN gas_NN and_CC aerosol_NN emitting_VVG infrastructure_NN were_VBD used_VVN until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN its_PP$ expected_VVN lifetime_NN ._SENT Climate-compatible_JJ development_NN (_( CCD_NN )_) A_DT form_NN of_IN development_NN building_NN on_IN climate_NN strategies_NNS that_WDT embrace_VVP development_NN goals_NNS and_CC development_NN strategies_NNS that_WDT integrate_VVP climate_NN risk_NN management_NN ,_, adaptation_NN and_CC mitigation_NN ._SENT This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN Mitchell_NP and_CC Maxwell_NP (_( 2010_CD )_) ._SENT Climate_NN extreme_NN (_( extreme_JJ weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN )_) The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT value_NN of_IN a_DT weather_NN or_CC climate_NN variable_NN above_IN (_( or_CC below_RB )_) a_DT threshold_NN value_NN near_IN the_DT upper_JJ (_( or_CC lower_VV )_) ends_VVZ of_IN the_DT range_NN of_IN observed_JJ values_NNS of_IN the_DT variable_NN ._SENT For_IN simplicity_NN ,_, both_DT extreme_JJ weather_NN events_NNS and_CC extreme_JJ climate_NN events_NNS are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO collectively_RB as_IN ‘climate_JJ extremes’_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Extreme_NP weather_NN event_NN ._SENT Climate_NN feedback_NN An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN in_IN one_CD climate_NN quantity_NN causes_VVZ a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ and_CC the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ weakened_VVN by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT The_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN can_MD either_RB be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT Climate_NN governance_NN See_NP Governance_NP ._SENT Climate_NN justice_NN See_NP Justice_NP ._SENT Climate_NN model_NN A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_CC biological_JJ properties_NNS of_IN its_PP$ components_NNS ,_, their_PP$ interactions_NNS and_CC feedback_NN processes_NNS ,_, and_CC accounting_NN for_IN some_DT of_IN its_PP$ known_VVN properties_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN can_MD be_VB represented_VVN by_IN models_NNS of_IN varying_VVG complexity_NN ;_: that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, for_IN any_DT one_CD component_NN or_CC combination_NN of_IN components_NNS a_DT spectrum_NN or_CC hierarchy_NN of_IN models_NNS can_MD be_VB identified_VVN ,_, differing_VVG in_IN such_JJ aspects_NNS as_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN spatial_JJ dimensions_NNS ,_, the_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ or_CC biological_JJ processes_NNS are_VBP explicitly_RB represented_VVN ,_, or_CC the_DT level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV and_CC simulate_VV the_DT climate_NN and_CC for_IN operational_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, including_VVG monthly_JJ ,_, seasonal_JJ and_CC interannual_JJ climate_NN predictions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Earth_NP system_NN model_NN (_( ESM_NP )_) ._SENT Climate_NN neutrality_NN Concept_NN of_IN a_DT state_NN in_IN which_WDT human_JJ activities_NNS result_NN in_IN no_DT net_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Achieving_VVG such_PDT a_DT state_NN would_MD require_VV balancing_VVG of_IN residual_JJ emissions_NNS with_IN emission_NN (_( carbon_NN dioxide_NN )_) removal_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN accounting_NN for_IN regional_JJ or_CC local_JJ biogeophysical_JJ effects_NNS of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS that_WDT ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, affect_VV surface_NN albedo_NN or_CC local_JJ climate_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Net_JJ zero_CD CO2_NP emissions_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projection_NN A_DT climate_NN projection_NN is_VBZ the_DT simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN to_TO a_DT scenario_NN of_IN future_JJ emission_NN or_CC concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, generally_RB derived_VVN using_VVG climate_NN models_NNS ._SENT Climate_NN projections_NNS are_VBP distinguished_VVN from_IN climate_NN predictions_NNS by_IN their_PP$ dependence_NN on_IN the_DT emission_NN /_SYM concentration_NN /_SYM radiative_JJ forcing_VVG scenario_NN used_VVN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN turn_NN based_VVN on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_JJ socioeconomic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT Climate-resilient_JJ development_NN pathways_NNS (_( CRDPs_NP )_) Trajectories_NNS that_WDT strengthen_VVP sustainable_JJ development_NN and_CC efforts_NNS to_TO eradicate_VV poverty_NN and_CC reduce_VV inequalities_NNS while_IN promoting_VVG fair_JJ and_CC cross-scalar_JJ adaptation_NN to_TO and_CC resilience_NN in_IN a_DT changing_VVG climate_NN ._SENT They_PP raise_VVP the_DT ethics_NNS ,_, equity_NN and_CC feasibility_NN aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT deep_JJ societal_JJ transformation_NN needed_VVN to_TO drastically_RB reduce_VV emissions_NNS to_TO limit_VV global_JJ warming_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP )_) and_CC achieve_VV desirable_JJ and_CC liveable_JJ futures_NNS and_CC well-being_NN for_IN all_DT ._SENT Climate-resilient_JJ with_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Development_NP pathways_NNS (_( under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ,_, Transformation_NP pathways_NNS (_( under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ,_, and_CC Climate-resilient_JJ development_NN pathways_NNS (_( CRDPs_NP )_) ._SENT Climate_NN sensitivity_NN Climate_NN sensitivity_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN in_IN response_NN to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP concentration_NN or_CC other_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN Refers_NNS to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN (_( steady_JJ state_NN )_) change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentration_NN ._SENT As_IN a_DT true_JJ equilibrium_NN is_VBZ challenging_VVG to_TO define_VV in_IN climate_NN models_NNS with_IN dynamic_JJ oceans_NNS ,_, the_DT equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN is_VBZ often_RB estimated_VVN through_IN experiments_NNS in_IN AOGCMs_NP where_WRB CO2_JJ levels_NNS are_VBP either_RB quadrupled_VVN or_CC doubled_VVN from_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels_NNS and_CC which_WDT are_VBP integrated_VVN for_IN 100-200_CD years_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate_NN sensitivity_NN parameter_NN (_( units_NNS :_: °_SYM C_NP (_( W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) –_NP 1_CD )_) refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT equilibrium_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT annual_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN following_VVG a_DT unit_NN change_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN An_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentration_NN that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN evolving_VVG non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN The_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN ,_, averaged_VVN over_IN a_DT -year_JJ period_NN ,_, centered_VVN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ CO2_NP doubling_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN simulation_NN in_IN which_WDT CO2_NP increases_VVZ at_IN 1_CD %_NN yr-1_NN from_IN preindustrial_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN climate_NN feedbacks_NNS and_CC the_DT timescale_NN of_IN ocean_NN heat_NN uptake_NN ._SENT Climate_NN services_NNS Climate_NN services_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO information_NN and_CC products_NNS that_WDT enhance_VVP users’_JJ agriculture_NN (_( CSA_NP )_) Climate-smart_NP agriculture_NN (_( CSA_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT approach_NN that_WDT helps_VVZ to_TO guide_VV actions_NNS needed_VVN to_TO transform_VV and_CC reorient_VV agricultural_JJ systems_NNS to_TO effectively_RB support_VV development_NN and_CC ensure_VV food_NN security_NN in_IN a_DT changing_VVG climate_NN ._SENT CSA_NP aims_VVZ to_TO tackle_VV three_CD main_JJ objectives_NNS :_: sustainably_RB increasing_VVG agricultural_JJ productivity_NN and_CC incomes_NNS ,_, adapting_VVG and_CC building_VVG resilience_NN to_TO climate-change_NN ,_, and_CC reducing_VVG and_CC /_SYM or_CC removing_VVG greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS ,_, where_WRB possible_JJ (_( FAO_NP ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT climate-system_NN The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, 


the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT lithosphere_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN ._SENT Climate_NN target_NN Climate_NN target_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT temperature_NN limit_NN ,_, concentration_NN level_NN ,_, or_CC emissions_NNS reduction_NN goal_NN used_VVN towards_IN the_DT aim_NN of_IN avoiding_VVG dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, national_JJ climate_NN targets_NNS may_MD aim_VV to_TO reduce_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS by_IN a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN over_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN those_DT under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Climate_NN variability_NN Climate_NN variability_NN refers_VVZ to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_DT of_IN individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC to_TO variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT CO2_JJ equivalent_NN (_( CO2-eq_NP )_) emission_NN The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ integrated_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG or_CC temperature_NN change_NN ,_, over_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, as_IN an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) or_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ._SENT There_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN ways_NNS to_TO compute_VV such_JJ equivalent_NN emissions_NNS and_CC choose_VV appropriate_JJ time_NN horizons_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS typically_RB ,_, the_DT CO2-equivalent_NP emission_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN multiplying_VVG the_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP by_IN its_PP$ global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN (_( GWP_NP )_) for_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN horizon_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN GHGs_NP it_PP is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN summing_VVG the_DT CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN each_DT gas_NN ._SENT CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ scale_NN for_IN comparing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ GHGs_NNS but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ climate-change_NN responses_NNS ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ generally_RB no_DT connection_NN between_IN CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC resulting_VVG CO2-equivalent_JJ concentrations_NNS ._SENT Co-benefits_NP The_DT positive_JJ effects_NNS that_IN/that a_DT policy_NN or_CC measure_NN aimed_VVN at_IN one_CD objective_NN might_MD have_VH on_IN other_JJ objectives_NNS ,_, thereby_RB increasing_VVG the_DT total_JJ benefits_NNS for_IN society_NN or_CC the_DT environment_NN ._SENT Co-benefits_NNS are_VBP often_RB subject_JJ to_TO uncertainty_NN and_CC depend_VV on_IN
