Common_NP but_CC Differentiated_NP Responsibilities_NP and_CC Respective_NP Capabilities_NP (_( CBDR-RC_NP )_) Common_NP but_CC Differentiated_NP Responsibilities_NP and_CC Respective_NP Capabilities_NP (_( CBDR_NP –_NP RC_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT key_JJ principle_NN in_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) that_WDT recognises_VVZ the_DT different_JJ capabilities_NNS and_CC differing_VVG responsibilities_NNS of_IN individual_JJ countries_NNS in_IN tacking_VVG climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT principle_NN of_IN CBDR_NP –_NP RC_NP is_VBZ embedded_VVN in_IN the_DT 1992_CD UNFCCC_NP treaty_NN ._SENT The_DT convention_NN states_NNS :_: “_NN ..._: the_DT global_JJ nature_NN of_IN climate-change_NN calls_VVZ for_IN the_DT widest_JJS possible_JJ cooperation_NN by_IN all_DT countries_NNS and_CC their_PP$ participation_NN in_IN an_DT effective_JJ and_CC appropriate_JJ international_JJ response_NN ,_, in_IN accordance_NN with_IN their_PP$ common_JJ but_CC differentiated_VVN responsibilities_NNS and_CC respective_JJ capabilities_NNS and_CC their_PP$ social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT ”_NN Since_IN then_RB the_DT CBDR-RC_NP principle_NN has_VHZ guided_VVN the_DT UN_NP climate_NN negotiations_NNS ._SENT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) The_DT supreme_JJ body_NN of_IN UN_NP conventions_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, comprising_VVG parties_NNS with_IN a_DT right_NN to_TO vote_VV that_WDT have_VHP ratified_VVN or_CC acceded_VVN to_TO the_DT convention_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ._SENT Confidence_NN The_DT robustness_NN of_IN a_DT finding_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT type_NN ,_, amount_NN ,_, quality_NN and_CC consistency_NN of_IN evidence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, mechanistic_JJ this_DT report_NN ,_, confidence_NN is_VBZ expressed_VVN qualitatively_RB (_( Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV Section_NP 1.6_CD for_IN the_DT list_NN of_IN Decoupling_NN Decoupling_NP (_( in_IN relation_NN to_TO climate-change_NN )_) is_VBZ where_WRB economic_JJ growth_NN is_VBZ no_RB longer_RBR strongly_RB associated_VVN with_IN consumption_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ._SENT Relative_JJ decoupling_NN is_VBZ where_WRB both_DT grow_VV but_CC at_IN different_JJ rates_NNS ._SENT Absolute_JJ decoupling_NN is_VBZ where_WRB economic_JJ growth_NN happens_VVZ but_CC fossil_JJ fuels_NNS decline_NN ._SENT Deforestation_NN Conversion_NN of_IN forest_NN to_TO non-forest_NN ._SENT For_IN a_DT discussion_NN of_IN the_DT term_NN forest_NN and_CC Demand-_NP and_CC supply-side_JJ measures_NNS Demand-side_NP measures_VVZ Policies_NNS and_CC programmes_NNS for_IN influencing_VVG the_DT demand_NN for_IN goods_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC services_NNS demonstrating_VVG that_DT climate_NN or_CC a_DT system_NN affected_VVN by_IN climate_NN has_VHZ changed_VVN in_IN some_DT defined_VVN statistical_JJ sense_NN ,_, without_IN providing_VVG a_DT reason_NN for_IN that_DT change_NN ._SENT An_DT identified_VVN change_NN is_VBZ detected_VVN in_IN observations_NNS if_IN its_PP$ likelihood_NN of_IN occurrence_NN by_IN chance_NN due_JJ to_TO internal_JJ variability_NN alone_RB is_VBZ determined_VVN to_TO be_VB small_JJ ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, <_SYM 10_CD %_NN ._SENT Attribution_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN in_IN disaster_NN preparedness_NN ,_, response_NN ,_, and_CC recovery_NN practices_NNS ,_, with_IN the_DT explicit_JJ purpose_NN of_IN increasing_VVG human_JJ security_NN ,_, well-being_NN ,_, quality_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, and_CC sustainable_JJ development_NN ._SENT Discount_NN rate_NN See_NP Discounting_NP ._SENT Discounting_VVG A_DT mathematical_JJ operation_NN that_WDT aims_VVZ to_TO make_VV monetary_JJ (_( or_CC other_JJ )_) amounts_NNS received_VVN or_CC expended_VVN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS (_( years_NNS )_) comparable_JJ across_IN time_NN ._SENT The_DT discounter_NN uses_VVZ a_DT fixed_VVN or_CC possibly_RB timevarying_JJ discount_NN rate_NN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN that_WDT makes_VVZ future_JJ value_NN worth_NN less_CC today_NN (_( if_IN the_DT discount_NN rate_NN is_VBZ positive_JJ )_) ._SENT The_DT choice_NN of_IN discount_NN rate_NN (_( s_NN )_) is_VBZ debated_VVN as_IN it_PP is_VBZ a_DT judgement_NN based_VVN on_IN hidden_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC explicit_JJ values_NNS ._SENT (_( Internal_NP )_) Displacement_NP Internal_NP displacement_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT forced_VVN movement_NN of_IN people_NNS within_IN the_DT country_NN they_PP live_VVP in_IN ._SENT Internally_RB displaced_VVN persons_NNS (_( IDPs_NP )_) are_VBP ‘Persons_NNS or_CC groups_NNS of_IN persons_NNS who_WP have_VHP been_VBN forced_VVN or_CC obliged_VVN to_TO flee_VV or_CC to_TO leave_VV their_PP$ homes_NNS or_CC places_NNS of_IN habitual_JJ residence_NN ,_, in_IN particular_JJ as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN or_CC in_IN order_NN to_TO avoid_VV the_DT effects_NNS of_IN armed_JJ conflict_NN ,_, situations_NNS of_IN generalized_VVN violence_NN ,_, violations_NNS of_IN human_JJ rights_NNS or_CC natural_JJ or_CC human-made_JJ disasters_NNS ,_, and_CC who_WP have_VHP not_RB crossed_VVN an_DT internationally_RB recognized_VVN State_NP border.’_NP (_( UN_NP ,_, 1998_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Migration_NP ._SENT Disruptive_JJ innovation_NN Disruptive_JJ innovation_NN is_VBZ demand-led_JJ technological_JJ change_NN that_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO significant_JJ system_NN change_NN and_CC is_VBZ characterized_VVN by_IN strong_JJ exponential_JJ growth_NN ._SENT Distributive_JJ equity_NN See_NP Equity_NP ._SENT Distributive_JJ justice_NN See_NP Justice_NP ._SENT Double_JJ dividend_NN The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT revenues_NNS generated_VVN by_IN policy_NN instruments_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN taxes_NNS or_CC auctioned_VVN (_( tradeable_JJ )_) emission_NN permits_NNS can_MD (_( 1_LS )_) contribute_VV to_TO mitigation_NN and_CC (_( distortionary_JJ taxes_NNS ._SENT Downscaling_NP Downscaling_NP is_VBZ a_DT method_NN that_WDT derives_VVZ local-_NN to_TO regional-scale_VV (_( up_RB to_TO 100_CD km_NN )_) information_NN from_IN larger-scale_JJ models_NNS or_CC data_NNS analyses_NNS ._SENT Two_CD main_JJ methods_NNS exist_VVP :_: dynamical_JJ downscaling_NN and_CC empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ downscaling_NN ._SENT The_DT dynamical_JJ method_NN uses_VVZ the_DT output_NN of_IN regional_JJ climate_NN models_NNS ,_, global_JJ models_NNS with_IN variable_JJ spatial_JJ resolution_NN ,_, or_CC high-resolution_NN global_JJ models_NNS ._SENT The_DT empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ methods_NNS are_VBP based_VVN on_IN observations_NNS and_CC develop_VV statistical_JJ relationships_NNS that_WDT link_VVP the_DT large-scale_JJ atmospheric_JJ variables_NNS with_IN local_NN /_SYM regional_JJ climate_NN variables_NNS ._SENT In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT driving_VVG model_NN remains_VVZ an_DT important_JJ limitation_NN on_IN quality_NN of_IN the_DT downscaled_JJ information_NN ._SENT The_DT two_CD methods_NNS can_MD be_VB combined_VVN ,_, e.g._FW ,_, applying_VVG empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ downscaling_NN to_TO the_DT output_NN of_IN a_DT regional_JJ climate_NN model_NN ,_, consisting_VVG of_IN a_DT dynamical_JJ downscaling_NN of_IN a_DT global_JJ climate_NN model_NN ._SENT Drought_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB dry_JJ weather_NN long_RB enough_RB to_TO cause_VV a_DT serious_JJ hydrological_JJ imbalance_NN ._SENT Drought_NN is_VBZ a_DT relative_JJ term_NN ,_, therefore_RB any_DT discussion_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN precipitation_NN deficit_NN must_MD refer_VV to_TO the_DT particular_JJ precipitation-related_JJ activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ under_IN discussion_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, shortage_NN of_IN precipitation_NN during_IN the_DT growing_VVG season_NN impinges_VVZ on_IN crop_NN production_NN or_CC ecosystem_NN function_NN in_IN general_JJ (_( due_JJ to_TO soil_VV moisture_NN drought_NN ,_, also_RB termed_VVD agricultural_JJ drought_NN )_) ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT runoff_NN and_CC percolation_NN season_NN primarily_RB affects_VVZ water_NN supplies_NNS (_( hydrological_JJ drought_NN )_) ._SENT Storage_NN changes_NNS in_IN soil_NN moisture_NN and_CC groundwater_NN are_VBP also_RB affected_VVN by_IN increases_NNS in_IN actual_JJ evapotranspiration_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO reductions_NNS in_IN precipitation_NN ._SENT A_DT period_NN with_IN an_DT abnormal_JJ precipitation_NN deficit_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN a_DT meteorological_JJ drought_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Soil_JJ moisture_NN ._SENT Megadrought_NN A_DT megadrought_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB lengthy_JJ and_CC pervasive_JJ drought_NN ,_, lasting_VVG much_RB longer_RBR than_IN normal_JJ ,_, usually_RB a_DT decade_NN or_CC more_JJR ._SENT Early_JJ warning_NN systems_NNS (_( EWS_NN )_) The_DT set_NN of_IN technical_JJ ,_, communities_NNS and_CC organizations_NNS threatened_VVN by_IN a_DT hazard_NN to_TO prepare_VV to_TO act_VV promptly_RB and_CC appropriately_RB to_TO reduce_VV the_DT possibility_NN of_IN harm_NN or_CC loss_NN ._SENT Dependent_JJ upon_IN context_NN ,_, EWS_NNS may_MD draw_VV upon_IN scientific_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC Indigenous_JJ knowledge_NN ._SENT EWS_NNS are_VBP also_RB considered_VVN for_IN ecological_JJ applications_NNS e.g._FW ,_, conservation_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT organization_NN itself_PP is_VBZ not_RB threatened_VVN by_IN hazard_NN but_CC the_DT ecosystem_NN under_IN conservation_NN is_VBZ (_( an_DT example_NN is_VBZ coral_JJ bleaching_VVG alerts_NNS )_) ,_, in_IN agriculture_NN (_( for_IN example_NN ,_, warnings_NNS of_IN ground_NN frost_NN ,_, hailstorms_NNS )_) and_CC in_IN fisheries_NNS (_( storm_NN and_CC tsunami_NN warnings_NNS )_) ._SENT This_DT glossary_NN entry_NN builds_VVZ from_IN the_DT definitions_NNS used_VVN in_IN UNISDR_NP (_( 2009_CD )_) and_CC IPCC_NP (_( 2012a_NP )_) ._SENT Earth_NP system_NN feedbacks_NNS See_VV Climate_NN feedback_NN ._SENT Earth_NP system_NN model_NN (_( ESM_NP )_) A_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN general_JJ or_CC compatible_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Additional_JJ components_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, atmospheric_JJ chemistry_NN ,_, ice_NN sheets_NNS ,_, dynamic_JJ vegetation_NN ,_, nitrogen_NN cycle_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB urban_JJ or_CC crop_NN models_NNS )_) may_MD be_VB included_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN model_NN ._SENT 


Ecosystem_NN An_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ a_DT functional_JJ unit_NN consisting_VVG of_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS ,_, their_PP$ non-living_JJ environment_NN and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS within_IN and_CC between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT components_NNS included_VVD in_IN a_DT given_VVN ecosystem_NN and_CC its_PP$ spatial_JJ boundaries_NNS depend_VVP on_IN the_DT purpose_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN :_: in_IN some_DT cases_NNS they_PP are_VBP relatively_RB sharp_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS they_PP are_VBP diffuse_JJ ._SENT Ecosystem_NN boundaries_NNS can_MD change_VV over_IN time_NN ._SENT Ecosystems_NNS are_VBP nested_VVN within_IN other_JJ ecosystems_NNS and_CC their_PP$ scale_NN can_MD range_VV from_IN very_RB small_JJ to_TO the_DT entire_JJ biosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT current_JJ era_NN ,_, most_JJS ecosystems_NNS either_CC contain_VV people_NNS as_IN key_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, or_CC are_VBP influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS in_IN their_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Ecosystem_NP services_NNS ._SENT Ecosystem_NN services_NNS Ecological_JJ processes_NNS or_CC functions_NNS having_VHG monetary_JJ or_CC non-monetary_JJ value_NN to_TO individuals_NNS or_CC society_NN at_IN large_JJ ._SENT These_DT are_VBP frequently_RB classified_VVN as_IN (_( 1_LS )_) supporting_JJ services_NNS such_JJ as_IN productivity_NN or_CC biodiversity_NN maintenance_NN ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) provisioning_VVG services_NNS such_JJ as_IN food_NN or_CC fibre_NN ,_, (_( 3_LS )_) regulating_VVG services_NNS such_JJ as_IN climate_NN regulation_NN or_CC carbon_NN sequestration_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 4_LS )_) cultural_JJ services_NNS such_JJ as_IN tourism_NN or_CC spiritual_JJ and_CC aesthetic_JJ appreciation_NN ._SENT Effective_JJ climate_NN sensitivity_NN See_VV Climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT Effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG See_NP Radiative_NP forcing_VVG ._SENT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD initially_RB used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_NN that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ since_RB become_VVN identified_VVN with_IN warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP east_RB of_IN the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN a_DT global-scale_JJ tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN called_VVD the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ time_NN scales_NNS of_IN two_CD to_TO about_RB seven_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN difference_NN between_IN Tahiti_NP and_CC Darwin_NP and_NP /_SYM or_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT central_JJ and_CC eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_VVG trade_NN winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS such_JJ that_IN/that the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT trade_NN winds_NNS ._SENT This_DT phenomenon_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ climatic_JJ effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT Electric_JJ vehicle_NN (_( EV_NP )_) A_DT vehicle_NN whose_WP$ propulsion_NN is_VBZ powered_VVN fully_RB or_CC mostly_RB by_IN electricity_NN ._SENT Battery_NP electric_JJ vehicle_NN (_( BEV_NP )_) A_DT vehicle_NN whose_WP$ propulsion_NN is_VBZ entirely_RB electric_JJ without_IN any_DT internal_JJ combustion_NN engine_NN ._SENT Plug-in_NP hybrid_JJ electric_JJ vehicle_NN (_( PHEV_NP )_) A_DT vehicle_NN whose_WP$ propulsion_NN is_VBZ mostly_RB electric_JJ with_IN batteries_NNS re-charged_VVN from_IN an_DT electric_JJ source_NN but_CC extra_JJ power_NN and_CC distance_NN are_VBP provided_VVN by_IN a_DT hybrid_JJ internal_JJ combustion_NN engine_NN ._SENT Emission_NN pathways_NNS See_VV Pathways_NP ._SENT Emission_NN scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_JJ development_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP radiatively_RB active_JJ (_( e.g._FW ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN driving_JJ forces_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN demographic_JJ and_CC socio-economic_JJ development_NN ,_, technological_JJ change_NN ,_, energy_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN )_) and_CC their_PP$ key_JJ relationships_NNS ._SENT Concentration_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, derived_VVN from_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, are_VBP often_RB used_VVN as_IN input_NN to_TO a_DT climate_NN model_NN to_TO compute_VV climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Baseline_NP scenario_NN ,_, Mitigation_NN scenario_NN ,_, Socio-economic_JJ scenario_NN ,_, Scenario_NP ,_, Transformation_NN pathways_NNS (_( under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ._SENT Emission_NN trajectories_NNS A_DT projected_JJ development_NN in_IN time_NN of_IN the_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) or_CC group_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ,_, aerosols_NNS ,_, and_CC GHG_NP precursors_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Emission_NN pathways_NNS (_( under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ._SENT Emissions_NNS trading_VVG A_DT market-based_JJ instrument_NN aiming_VVG at_IN meeting_VVG a_DT mitigation_NN objective_NN in_IN an_DT efficient_JJ way_NN ._SENT A_DT cap_NN on_IN GHG_NP emissions_NNS is_VBZ divided_VVN in_IN tradeable_JJ emission_NN permits_NNS that_WDT are_VBP allocated_VVN by_IN a_DT combination_NN of_IN auctioning_VVG and_CC handing_VVG out_RP free_JJ allowances_NNS to_TO entities_NNS within_IN the_DT jurisdiction_NN of_IN the_DT trading_NN scheme_NN ._SENT Entities_NNS need_VVP to_TO surrender_VV emission_NN permits_NNS equal_JJ to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN their_PP$ emissions_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, tonnes_NNS of_IN CO2_NP )_) ._SENT An_DT entity_NN may_MD sell_VV excess_JJ permits_NNS to_TO entities_NNS that_WDT can_MD avoid_VV the_DT same_JJ amount_NN of_IN emissions_NNS in_IN a_DT cheaper_JJR way_NN ._SENT Trading_NN schemes_NNS may_MD occur_VV at_IN the_DT intra-company_NN ,_, domestic_JJ ,_, or_CC international_JJ level_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, the_DT flexibility_NN mechanisms_NNS under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_CC the_DT EU-ETS_NNS )_) and_CC may_MD apply_VV to_TO carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, or_CC other_JJ substances_NNS ._SENT Enabling_VVG conditions_NNS Conditions_NNS that_WDT affect_VVP the_DT feasibility_NN of_IN adaptation_NN and_CC mitigation_NN options_NNS ,_, and_CC can_MD accelerate_VV and_CC scale-up_JJ systemic_JJ transitions_NNS that_WDT would_MD limit_VV temperature_NN increase_NN to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP and_CC enhance_VV capacities_NNS of_IN systems_NNS and_CC societies_NNS to_TO adapt_VV to_TO the_DT associated_VVN climate-change_NN ,_, while_IN achieving_VVG sustainable_JJ development_NN ,_, eradicating_VVG poverty_NN and_CC reducing_VVG inequalities_NNS ._SENT Enabling_VVG conditions_NNS include_VVP finance_NN ,_, technological_JJ innovation_NN ,_, strengthening_VVG policy_NN instruments_NNS ,_, institutional_JJ capacity_NN ,_, multilevel_JJ governance_NN ,_, and_CC changes_NNS in_IN human_JJ behaviour_NN and_CC lifestyles_NNS ._SENT They_PP also_RB include_VVP inclusive_JJ processes_NNS ,_, attention_NN to_TO power_NN asymmetries_NNS and_CC unequal_JJ opportunities_NNS for_IN development_NN and_CC reconsideration_NN of_IN values_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Feasibility_NN ._SENT Energy_NN efficiency_NN The_DT ratio_NN of_IN output_NN or_CC useful_JJ energy_NN or_CC energy_NN services_NNS or_CC other_JJ useful_JJ physical_JJ outputs_NNS obtained_VVN from_IN a_DT system_NN ,_, conversion_NN process_NN ,_, transmission_NN or_CC storage_NN activity_NN to_TO the_DT input_NN of_IN energy_NN (_( measured_VVN as_IN kWh_NN kWh-1_NN ,_, tonnes_NNS kWh-1_NN or_CC any_DT other_JJ physical_JJ measure_NN of_IN useful_JJ output_NN like_IN tonne-km_NN transported_VVN )_) ._SENT Energy_NN efficiency_NN is_VBZ often_RB described_VVN by_IN energy_NN intensity_NN ._SENT In_IN economics_NNS ,_, energy_NN intensity_NN describes_VVZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN economic_JJ output_NN to_TO energy_NN input_NN ._SENT Most_RBS commonly_RB energy_NN efficiency_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN as_IN input_NN energy_NN over_IN a_DT physical_JJ or_CC economic_JJ unit_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, kWh_NP USD-1_NP (_( energy_NN intensity_NN )_) ,_, kWh_NN tonne-1_NN ._SENT For_IN buildings_NNS ,_, it_PP is_VBZ often_RB measured_VVN as_IN kWh_NN m-2_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN vehicles_NNS as_IN km_NN liter-1_NN or_CC liter_NN km-1_NN ._SENT Very_RB often_RB in_IN policy_NN ‘energy_NN efficiency’_NN is_VBZ intended_VVN as_IN the_DT measures_NNS to_TO reduce_VV energy_NN demand_NN through_IN technological_JJ options_NNS such_JJ as_IN insulating_VVG buildings_NNS ,_, more_JJR efficient_JJ appliances_NNS ,_, efficient_JJ lighting_NN ,_, efficient_JJ vehicles_NNS ,_, etc._FW Energy_NP security_NN The_DT goal_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN country_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT global_JJ community_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ,_, to_TO maintain_VV an_DT adequate_JJ ,_, stable_JJ and_CC predictable_JJ energy_NN supply_NN ._SENT Measures_NNS encompass_VVP safeguarding_VVG the_DT sufficiency_NN of_IN energy_NN resources_NNS to_TO meet_VV national_JJ energy_NN demand_NN at_IN competitive_JJ and_CC stable_JJ prices_NNS and_CC the_DT resilience_NN of_IN the_DT energy_NN supply_NN ;_: enabling_VVG development_NN and_CC deployment_NN of_IN technologies_NNS ;_: building_VVG sufficient_JJ infrastructure_NN to_TO generate_VV ,_, store_VV and_CC transmit_VV energy_NN supplies_NNS ;_: and_CC ensuring_VVG enforceable_JJ contracts_NNS of_IN delivery_NN ._SENT Enhanced_JJ weathering_NN Enhancing_VVG the_DT removal_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN through_IN dissolution_NN of_IN silicate_NN and_CC carbonate_NN rocks_NNS by_IN grinding_VVG these_DT minerals_NNS to_TO small_JJ particles_NNS and_CC actively_RB applying_VVG them_PP to_TO soils_NNS ,_, coasts_NNS or_CC oceans_NNS ._SENT (_( Model_NN )_) Ensemble_NP A_NP group_NN of_IN parallel_JJ model_NN simulations_NNS characterising_VVG historical_JJ climate_NN conditions_NNS ,_, climate_NN predictions_NNS ,_, or_CC climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT Variation_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS across_IN the_DT ensemble_NN members_NNS may_MD give_VV an_DT estimate_NN of_IN modelling-based_JJ uncertainty_NN ._SENT Ensembles_NNS made_VVN with_IN the_DT same_JJ model_NN but_CC different_JJ initial_JJ conditions_NNS only_RB characterize_VVP the_DT uncertainty_NN associated_VVN with_IN internal_JJ climate_NN variability_NN ,_, whereas_IN multimodel_JJ ensembles_NNS including_VVG simulations_NNS by_IN several_JJ models_NNS also_RB include_VVP the_DT impact_NN of_IN model_NN differences_NNS ._SENT Perturbed_VVN parameter_NN ensembles_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT model_NN parameters_NNS are_VBP varied_VVN in_IN a_DT systematic_JJ 


manner_NN ,_, aim_VVP to_TO assess_VV the_DT uncertainty_NN resulting_VVG from_IN internal_JJ model_NN specifications_NNS within_IN a_DT single_JJ model_NN ._SENT Remaining_VVG sources_NNS of_IN uncertainty_NN unaddressed_JJ with_IN model_NN ensembles_NNS are_VBP related_VVN to_TO systematic_JJ model_NN errors_NNS or_CC biases_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB assessed_VVN from_IN systematic_JJ comparisons_NNS of_IN model_NN simulations_NNS with_IN observations_NNS wherever_WRB available_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN projection_NN ._SENT Equality_NN A_DT principle_NN that_WDT Inequality_NN Uneven_JJ opportunities_NNS and_CC social_JJ positions_NNS ,_, and_CC processes_VVZ of_IN discrimination_NN within_IN a_DT group_NN or_CC society_NN ,_, based_VVN on_IN gender_NN ,_, highest_JJS and_CC lowest_JJS income_NN earners_NNS within_IN a_DT country_NN and_CC between_IN countries_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Equity_NP ,_, Ethics_NP and_CC Fairness_NP ._SENT Equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN See_VV Climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT Equity_NP Equity_NP is_VBZ the_DT principle_NN of_IN fairness_NN in_IN burden_NN sharing_NN and_CC is_VBZ a_DT basis_NN for_IN understanding_VVG how_WRB the_DT impacts_NNS and_CC responses_NNS to_TO climate-change_NN ,_, including_VVG costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS ,_, are_VBP distributed_VVN in_IN and_CC by_IN society_NN in_IN more_JJR or_CC less_JJR equal_JJ ways_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB aligned_VVN with_IN ideas_NNS of_IN equality_NN ,_, fairness_NN and_CC justice_NN and_CC applied_VVN with_IN respect_NN to_TO equity_NN in_IN the_DT responsibility_NN for_IN ,_, and_CC distribution_NN of_IN ,_, climate_NN impacts_NNS and_CC policies_NNS across_IN society_NN ,_, generations_NNS ,_, and_CC gender_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN who_WP participates_VVZ and_CC controls_VVZ the_DT processes_NNS of_IN decision-making_NN ._SENT Distributive_JJ equity_NN Equity_NN in_IN the_DT consequences_NNS ,_, outcomes_NNS ,_, costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS of_IN actions_NNS or_CC policies_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN climate-change_NN or_CC climate_NN policies_NNS for_IN different_JJ people_NNS ,_, places_NNS and_CC countries_NNS ,_, including_VVG equity_NN aspects_NNS of_IN sharing_VVG burdens_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS for_IN mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN ._SENT Gender_NN equity_NN ._SENT General_JJ purpose_NN technologies_NNS (_( GPT_NP )_) General_NP purpose_NN technologies_NNS can_MD be_VB or_CC are_VBP used_VVN pervasively_RB in_IN a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN sectors_NNS )_) averaged_VVD over_IN a_DT 30-year_JJ period_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT 30-year_JJ period_NN centered_VVN on_IN a_DT particular_JJ year_NN or_CC decade_NN ,_, expressed_VVD relative_JJ to_TO Governance_NN capacity_NN See_NP Governance_NP ._SENT Green_JJ infrastructure_NN The_DT interconnected_VVN set_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC constructed_VVN ecological_JJ systems_NNS ,_, green_JJ Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, used_VVN a_DT variety_NN of_IN approximately_RB equivalent_JJ metrics_NNS of_IN GMST_NP change_NN ._SENT 


ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Beside_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT GHGs_NP sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, Methane_NP (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, Nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) and_CC Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT Greenhouse_NN gas_NN removal_NN (_( GGR_NP )_) Withdrawal_NP of_IN a_DT GHG_NP and_NP /_SYM or_CC a_DT precursor_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN a_DT sink_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN removal_NN (_( CDR_NP )_) and_CC Negative_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, at_IN purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT resident_NN and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT taxes_NNS and_CC minus_IN any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD in_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT products_NNS in_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC a_DT geographic_JJ region_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN ,_, normally_RB one_CD year_NN ._SENT GDP_NP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG for_IN depreciation_NN of_IN fabricated_VVN assets_NNS or_CC depletion_NN and_CC degradation_NN of_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Gross_JJ fixed_VVN capital_NN formation_NN (_( GFCF_NP )_) One_CD component_NN of_IN the_DT GDP_NP that_WDT corresponds_VVZ to_TO the_DT total_JJ value_NN of_IN acquisitions_NNS ,_, minus_CC disposals_NNS of_IN fixed_VVN assets_NNS during_IN one_CD year_NN by_IN the_DT business_NN sector_NN ,_, governments_NNS and_CC households_NNS ,_, plus_CC certain_JJ additions_NNS to_TO the_DT value_NN of_IN non-produced_JJ assets_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN subsoil_NN assets_NNS or_CC major_JJ improvements_NNS in_IN the_DT quantity_NN ,_, quality_NN or_CC productivity_NN of_IN land_NN )_) ._SENT Halocarbons_NNS A_DT collective_JJ term_NN for_IN the_DT group_NN of_IN partially_RB halogenated_VVN organic_JJ species_NNS ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ the_DT chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) ,_, hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HCFCs_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, halons_NNS ,_, methyl_NN chloride_NN and_CC methyl_NN bromide_NN ._SENT Many_JJ of_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS have_VHP large_JJ global_JJ warming_NN potentials_NNS ._SENT The_DT chlorine_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN halocarbons_NNS are_VBP also_RB involved_VVN in_IN the_DT depletion_NN of_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT Hazard_VV The_DT potential_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT natural_JJ or_CC human-induced_JJ physical_JJ event_NN or_CC trend_NN that_WDT may_MD cause_VV loss_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, injury_NN ,_, or_CC other_JJ health_NN impacts_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN damage_NN and_CC loss_NN to_TO property_NN ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, service_NN provision_NN ,_, ecosystems_NNS and_CC environmental_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Disaster_NN ,_, Exposure_NP ,_, Risk_NP ,_, and_CC Vulnerability_NP ._SENT Heatwave_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB hot_JJ weather_NN ._SENT Heatwaves_NNS and_CC warm_JJ spells_NNS have_VHP various_JJ and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS overlapping_VVG definitions_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Extreme_NP weather_NN event_NN ._SENT Heating_NN ,_, ventilation_NN ,_, and_CC air_NN conditioning_NN (_( HVAC_NP )_) Heating_NN ,_, ventilation_NN and_CC air_NN conditioning_NN technology_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO control_VV temperature_NN and_CC humidity_NN in_IN an_DT indoor_JJ environment_NN ,_, be_VB it_PP in_IN buildings_NNS or_CC in_IN vehicles_NNS ,_, providing_VVG thermal_JJ comfort_NN and_CC healthy_JJ air_NN quality_NN to_TO the_DT occupants_NNS ._SENT HVAC_NP systems_NNS can_MD be_VB designed_VVN for_IN an_DT isolated_JJ space_NN ,_, an_DT individual_JJ building_NN or_CC a_DT distributed_VVN heating_NN and_CC cooling_VVG network_NN within_IN a_DT building_NN structure_NN or_CC a_DT district_NN heating_NN system_NN ._SENT The_DT latter_NN provides_VVZ economies_NNS of_IN scale_NN and_CC also_RB scope_NN for_IN integration_NN with_IN solar_JJ heat_NN ,_, natural_JJ seasonal_JJ cooling_NN /_SYM heating_NN etc._FW Holocene_JJ The_DT Holocene_JJ is_VBZ the_DT current_JJ interglacial_JJ geological_JJ epoch_NN ,_, the_DT second_NN of_IN two_CD epochs_NNS within_IN the_DT Quaternary_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT preceding_JJ being_VBG the_DT Pleistocene_JJ ._SENT The_DT International_NP Commission_NP on_IN Stratigraphy_NP defines_VVZ the_DT start_NN of_IN the_DT Holocene_JJ at_IN 11_CD ,_, 650_CD years_NNS before_IN 1950._CD See_NP also_RB Anthropocene_NP ._SENT Human_JJ behaviour_NN The_DT way_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT person_NN acts_VVZ in_IN response_NN to_TO a_DT particular_JJ situation_NN or_CC stimulus_NN ._SENT Human_JJ actions_NNS are_VBP relevant_JJ households_NNS ,_, and_CC individual_JJ actions_NNS ._SENT Adaptation_NN behaviour_NN Human_JJ actions_NNS that_IN/that directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB affect_VV the_DT risks_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN impacts_NNS ._SENT Mitigation_NN behaviour_NN Human_JJ actions_NNS that_IN/that directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB influence_VV mitigation_NN ._SENT Human_JJ behavioural_JJ change_NN /_SYM or_CC reduce_VV negative_JJ consequences_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN impacts_NNS ._SENT Human_JJ rights_NNS Rights_NNS that_WDT are_VBP inherent_JJ to_TO all_DT human_JJ beings_NNS ,_, universal_JJ ,_, inalienable_JJ ,_, and_CC indivisible_JJ ,_, typically_RB expressed_VVN and_CC guaranteed_VVN by_IN law_NN ._SENT They_PP include_VVP the_DT right_NN to_TO life_NN ;_: economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, and_CC cultural_JJ rights_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT right_NN to_TO development_NN and_CC self-determination_NN ._SENT Based_VVN upon_IN the_DT definition_NN by_IN the_DT UN_NP Office_NP of_IN the_DT High_NP Commissioner_NP for_IN Human_NP Rights_NPS (_( UNOHCHR_NP ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Procedural_JJ rights_NNS Rights_NNS to_TO a_DT legal_JJ procedure_NN to_TO enforce_VV itself_PP ,_, liberty_NN and_CC happiness_NN ._SENT Human_JJ security_NN A_DT condition_NN that_WDT is_VBZ met_VVN when_WRB the_DT vital_JJ core_NN of_IN human_JJ lives_NNS is_VBZ protected_VVN ,_, and_CC when_WRB people_NNS have_VHP the_DT freedom_NN and_CC capacity_NN to_TO live_VV with_IN dignity_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, the_DT vital_JJ core_NN of_IN of_IN their_PP$ interests_NNS and_CC to_TO live_VV with_IN dignity_NN ._SENT Human_JJ system_NN Any_DT system_NN in_IN which_WDT human_JJ organizations_NNS and_CC institutions_NNS play_VVP a_DT major_JJ role_NN ._SENT Often_RB ,_, but_CC not_RB always_RB ,_, the_DT term_NN is_VBZ synonymous_JJ with_IN society_NN or_CC social_JJ system_NN ._SENT Systems_NNS such_JJ as_IN agricultural_JJ in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN The_DT cycle_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN evaporates_VVZ from_IN the_DT oceans_NNS and_CC the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, is_VBZ carried_VVN over_IN the_DT earth_NN in_IN atmospheric_JJ circulation_NN as_IN water_NN vapour_NN ,_, condenses_VVZ to_TO form_VV clouds_NNS ,_, precipitates_NNS as_IN rain_NN or_CC snow_NN ,_, which_WDT on_IN land_NN can_MD be_VB intercepted_VVN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC vegetation_NN ,_, potentially_RB accumulates_VVZ as_IN snow_NN or_CC ice_NN ,_, provides_VVZ runoff_NN on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, infiltrates_NNS into_IN soils_NNS ,_, recharges_VVZ groundwater_NN ,_, discharges_NNS into_IN streams_NNS ,_, flows_VVZ out_RP into_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ,_, and_CC ultimately_RB evaporates_VVZ again_RB from_IN the_DT ocean_NN or_CC land_NN surface_NN ._SENT The_DT various_JJ systems_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ cycle_NN are_VBP usually_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN hydrological_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT Ice_NN sheet_NN A_DT mass_NN of_IN land_NN ice_NN of_IN continental_JJ size_NN that_WDT is_VBZ sufficiently_RB thick_JJ to_TO cover_VV most_JJS of_IN the_DT underlying_VVG bed_NN ,_, so_RB that_IN/that its_PP$ shape_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN its_PP$ dynamics_NN (_( the_DT flow_NN of_IN the_DT ice_NN as_IN it_PP deforms_VVZ internally_RB and_CC /_SYM or_CC slides_NNS at_IN its_PP$ base_NN )_) ._SENT An_DT ice_NN sheet_NN flows_VVZ outward_RB from_IN a_DT high_JJ central_JJ ice_NN plateau_NN with_IN a_DT small_JJ average_JJ surface_NN slope_NN ._SENT The_DT margins_NNS usually_RB slope_VVP more_RBR steeply_RB ,_, and_CC most_JJS ice_NN is_VBZ discharged_VVN through_IN fast_RB flowing_VVG ice_NN streams_NNS or_CC outlet_NN glaciers_NNS ,_, in_IN some_DT cases_NNS into_IN the_DT sea_NN or_CC into_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS floating_VVG on_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT There_EX are_VBP only_RB two_CD ice_NN sheets_NNS in_IN the_DT modern_JJ world_NN ,_, one_CD on_IN Greenland_NP and_CC one_CD on_IN Antarctica_NP ._SENT During_IN glacial_JJ periods_NNS there_EX were_VBD others_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Glacier_NP ._SENT (_( climate-change_NN )_) Impact_NN assessment_NN The_DT practice_NN of_IN identifying_VVG and_CC evaluating_VVG ,_, in_IN monetary_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC non-monetary_JJ terms_NNS ,_, the_DT effects_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT Impacts_NNS (_( consequences_NNS ,_, outcomes_NNS )_) The_DT consequences_NNS of_IN realized_VVN risks_NNS on_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS ,_, where_WRB risks_NNS result_VVP from_IN the_DT interactions_NNS of_IN climate-related_JJ hazards_NNS (_( including_VVG extreme_JJ weather_NN and_CC climate_NN events_NNS )_) ,_, exposure_NN ,_, and_CC vulnerability_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS generally_RB refer_VVP to_TO effects_NNS on_IN lives_NNS ;_: livelihoods_NNS ;_: health_NN and_CC well-being_NN ;_: ecosystems_NNS and_CC species_NNS ;_: economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ assets_NNS ;_: services_NNS (_( including_VVG 


ecosystem_NN services_NNS )_) ;_: and_CC infrastructure_NN ._SENT Impacts_NNS may_MD be_VB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN consequences_NNS or_CC outcomes_NNS ,_, and_CC can_MD be_VB adverse_JJ or_CC adaptation_NN See_NP Adaptation_NP ._SENT Indigenous_JJ knowledge_NN Indigenous_JJ knowledge_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT understandings_NNS ,_, skills_NNS and_CC philosophies_NNS developed_VVN by_IN builds_VVZ on_IN UNESCO_NP (_( 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Indirect_JJ land-use_NN change_NN (_( iLUC_NN )_) See_VV Land-use_NN change_NN (_( LUC_NP )_) ._SENT Industrial_JJ revolution_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN report_NN ._SENT (_( 1_CD )_) In_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS system_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT established_JJ convention_NN for_IN designation_NN of_IN developed_JJ and_CC developing_VVG models_NNS (_( IAMs_NP )_) integrate_VV knowledge_NN from_IN two_CD or_CC more_JJR domains_NNS into_IN a_DT single_JJ framework_NN ._SENT They_PP are_VBP one_CD of_IN the_DT main_JJ tools_NNS for_IN undertaking_VVG integrated_JJ assessments_NNS ._SENT One_CD class_NN of_IN IAM_NP used_VVN in_IN respect_NN of_IN climate-change_NN mitigation_NN may_MD include_VV representations_NNS of_IN :_: multiple_JJ sectors_NNS of_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN energy_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN ;_: interactions_NNS between_IN sectors_NNS ;_: the_DT economy_NN as_IN a_DT estimate_VV the_DT social_JJ cost_NN of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT Integrated_JJ water_NN resources_NNS management_NN (_( IWRM_NP )_) A_DT process_NN which_WDT promotes_VVZ the_DT coordinated_VVN Iron_NP fertilization_NN See_NP Ocean_NP fertilization_NN ._SENT Irreversibility_NN A_DT perturbed_VVN state_NN of_IN a_DT dynamical_JJ system_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN irreversible_JJ on_IN a_DT given_VVN timescale_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT recovery_NN time_NN scale_NN from_IN this_DT state_NN due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ processes_NNS is_VBZ substantially_RB longer_RBR than_IN the_DT time_NN it_PP that_IN/that people_NNS get_VV what_WP is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO them_PP ,_, setting_VVG out_RP the_DT moral_JJ or_CC legal_JJ principles_NNS of_IN fairness_NN and_CC equity_NN in_IN the_DT way_NN people_NNS are_VBP treated_VVN ,_, often_RB based_VVN on_IN the_DT ethics_NNS and_CC values_NNS of_IN society_NN ._SENT Climate_NN justice_NN Justice_NN that_WDT links_VVZ development_NN and_CC human_JJ rights_NNS to_TO achieve_VV a_DT humancentred_JJ approach_NN to_TO addressing_VVG climate-change_NN ,_, safeguarding_VVG the_DT rights_NNS of_IN the_DT most_RBS vulnerable_JJ people_NNS and_CC sharing_VVG the_DT burdens_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN and_CC its_PP$ impacts_NNS equitably_RB and_CC fairly_RB ._SENT This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ upon_IN the_DT one_CD used_VVN by_IN the_DT Mary_NP Robinson_NP Foundation_NP –_NN Climate_NN Justice_NP (_( MRFCJ_NP ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Distributive_JJ justice_NN Justice_NN in_IN the_DT allocation_NN of_IN ._SENT Social_JJ justice_NN Just_RB or_CC fair_JJ relations_NNS within_IN society_NN that_WDT seek_VVP to_TO address_VV the_DT distribution_NN of_IN wealth_NN ,_, access_NN to_TO resources_NNS ,_, opportunity_NN ,_, and_CC support_VV according_VVG to_TO principles_NNS of_IN justice_NN and_CC fairness_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Equity_NP ,_, Ethics_NP ,_, Fairness_NP ,_, and_CC Human_JJ rights_NNS ._SENT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT international_JJ treaty_NN adopted_VVN in_IN December_NP 1997_CD in_IN Kyoto_NP ,_, Japan_NP ,_, at_IN the_DT Third_NP Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP3_NP )_) to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO those_DT included_VVN in_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT Countries_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Protocol_NP (_( mostly_RB OECD_NP countries_NNS and_CC countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) )_) by_IN at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN (_( 2008_CD –_NN 2012_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP entered_VVD into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005_CD and_CC as_RB of_IN May_NP had_VHD 192_CD Parties_NNS (_( 191_CD States_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Union_NP )_) ._SENT A_DT second_JJ commitment_NN period_NN was_VBD agreed_VVN in_IN December_NP 2012_CD at_IN COP18_NP ,_, known_VVN as_IN the_DT Doha_NP Amendment_NP to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, in_IN which_WDT a_DT new_JJ set_NN of_IN Parties_NNS committed_VVN to_TO reduce_VV GHG_NP emissions_NNS by_IN at_IN least_JJS 18_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS in_IN the_DT period_NN from_IN 2013_CD to_TO 2020._CD However_RB ,_, as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD ,_, the_DT Doha_NP Amendment_NP had_VHD not_RB received_VVN sufficient_JJ ratifications_NNS to_TO enter_VV into_IN force_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) and_CC Paris_NP Agreement_NP ._SENT Land_NN surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN The_DT near-surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN over_IN land_NN ,_, typically_RB measured_VVN at_IN 1.25_CD –_NN 2_CD m_NN above_IN the_DT ground_NN using_VVG standard_JJ meteorological_JJ equipment_NN ._SENT Land_NN use_NN Land_NP use_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT total_NN of_IN arrangements_NNS ,_, activities_NNS and_CC inputs_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN a_DT certain_JJ land_NN cover_NN type_NN (_( a_DT set_NN of_IN human_JJ actions_NNS )_) ._SENT The_DT term_NN land_NN use_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VVN in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN the_DT social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ purposes_NNS for_IN which_WDT land_NN is_VBZ managed_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, grazing_NN ,_, timber_NN extraction_NN ,_, conservation_NN and_CC city_NN dwelling_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN national_JJ ,_, wetland_NP ,_, settlements_NNS ,_, other_JJ ._SENT See_VV also_RB Land-use_JJ change_NN (_( LUC_NP )_) ._SENT Land-use_NN change_NN (_( LUC_NP )_) Land-use_NN change_NN involves_VVZ a_DT change_NN from_IN one_CD land_NN use_NN category_NN to_TO another_DT ._SENT Indirect_JJ land-use_NN change_NN (_( iLUC_NN )_) Refers_NNS to_TO market-mediated_JJ or_CC policy-driven_JJ shifts_NNS in_IN land_NN use_NN that_WDT cannot_MD be_VB directly_RB attributed_VVN to_TO land-use_NN management_NN decisions_NNS of_IN individuals_NNS or_CC groups_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, if_IN agricultural_JJ land_NN is_VBZ diverted_VVN to_TO fuel_VV production_NN ,_, forest_NN clearance_NN may_MD occur_VV elsewhere_RB to_TO replace_VV the_DT former_JJ agricultural_JJ production_NN ._SENT Land_NN use_NN ,_, land-use_NN change_NN and_CC forestry_NN (_( LULUCF_NP )_) In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN national_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) inventories_NNS under_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ,_, LULUCF_NP is_VBZ a_DT GHG_NP inventory_NN sector_NN that_WDT covers_VVZ anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC removals_NNS of_IN GHG_NP from_IN carbon_NN pools_NNS in_IN managed_JJ lands_NNS ,_, excluding_VVG non-CO2_JJ agricultural_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Following_VVG the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP GHG_NP Inventories_NNS ,_, ‘anthropogenic’_JJ land-related_JJ GHG_NP fluxes_NNS are_VBP defined_VVN as_IN all_PDT those_DT occurring_VVG on_IN ‘managed_JJ land’_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, ‘where_RB human_JJ interventions_NNS and_CC practices_NNS have_VHP been_VBN applied_VVN to_TO perform_VV production_NN ,_, ecological_JJ or_CC social_JJ functions’_NN ._SENT Since_IN managed_VVN land_NN may_MD include_VV CO2_NP removals_NNS not_RB considered_VVN as_IN ‘anthropogenic’_NN in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT scientific_JJ literature_NN assessed_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, removals_NNS associated_VVN with_IN CO2_NP fertilization_NN and_CC N_NN deposition_NN )_) ,_, the_DT land-related_JJ net_JJ GHG_NP emission_NN estimates_NNS included_VVD in_IN this_DT report_NN are_VBP not_RB necessarily_RB directly_RB comparable_JJ with_IN LULUCF_NP estimates_NNS in_IN Life_NN cycle_NN assessment_NN (_( LCA_NP )_) Compilation_NN and_CC evaluation_NN of_IN the_DT inputs_NNS ,_, outputs_NNS and_CC the_DT potential_JJ environmental_JJ impacts_NNS of_IN a_DT product_NN or_CC service_NN throughout_IN its_PP$ life_NN cycle_NN ._SENT This_DT definition_NN builds_VVZ from_IN ISO_NP (_( 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Likelihood_NN The_DT chance_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ outcome_NN ,_, Confidence_NN and_CC Uncertainty_NN ._SENT Livelihood_NN The_DT resources_NNS used_VVN and_CC the_DT activities_NNS undertaken_VVN in_IN order_NN to_TO live_VV ._SENT Livelihoods_NNS are_VBP technologies_NNS ,_, investments_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, and_CC behavioural_JJ norms_NNS ,_, is_VBZ determined_VVN or_CC constrained_VVN (_( ‘locked_JJ in’_NN )_) by_IN historic_JJ developments_NNS ._SENT Long-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( LLCF_NP )_) Long-lived_NP climate_NN forcers_NNS refer_VVP to_TO a_DT set_NN of_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS with_IN long_JJ atmospheric_JJ lifetimes_NNS ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS includes_VVZ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) and_CC nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, together_RB with_IN some_DT fluorinated_VVN gases_NNS ._SENT They_PP have_VHP a_DT warming_NN effect_NN on_IN climate_NN ._SENT These_DT compounds_NNS accumulate_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN decadal_JJ to_TO change.’_JJ Lowercase_NP letters_NNS (_( losses_NNS and_CC damages_NNS )_) have_VHP been_VBN taken_VVN to_TO refer_VV broadly_RB to_TO harm_VV from_IN (_( observed_JJ )_) impacts_NNS and_CC (_( Market_NN exchange_NN rate_NN (_( MER_NN )_) The_DT rate_NN at_IN which_WDT a_DT currency_NN of_IN one_CD country_NN can_MD be_VB exchanged_VVN with_IN the_DT currency_NN of_IN another_DT country_NN ._SENT In_IN most_JJS economies_NNS such_JJ rates_NNS evolve_VVP daily_JJ while_NN in_IN others_NNS there_EX are_VBP official_JJ conversion_NN rates_NNS that_WDT are_VBP adjusted_VVN periodically_RB ._SENT See_VV also_RB Purchasing_NP power_NN parity_NN (_( PPP_NP )_) ._SENT Market_NN failure_NN When_WRB private_JJ decisions_NNS are_VBP based_VVN on_IN market_NN prices_NNS that_WDT do_VVP not_RB reflect_VV the_DT real_JJ scarcity_NN of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS but_CC rather_RB reflect_VV market_NN distortions_NNS ,_, they_PP do_VVP not_RB generate_VV an_DT efficient_JJ allocation_NN of_IN resources_NNS but_CC cause_VV welfare_NN losses_NNS ._SENT A_DT market_NN distortion_NN is_VBZ any_DT event_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT market_NN reaches_VVZ a_DT market_NN clearing_NN price_NN that_WDT is_VBZ substantially_RB different_JJ from_IN the_DT price_NN that_IN/that a_DT market_NN would_MD achieve_VV while_IN operating_VVG under_IN conditions_NNS of_IN perfect_JJ competition_NN and_CC state_NN enforcement_NN of_IN legal_JJ contracts_NNS and_CC the_DT ownership_NN of_IN private_JJ property_NN ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN factors_NNS causing_VVG market_NN prices_NNS to_TO deviate_VV from_IN real_JJ economic_JJ scarcity_NN are_VBP environmental_JJ externalities_NNS ,_, public_JJ goods_NNS ,_, monopoly_NN power_NN ,_, information_NN asymmetry_NN ,_, transaction_NN costs_NNS and_CC non-rational_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT Measurement_NN ,_, Reporting_NP and_CC Verification_NP (_( MRV_NP )_) Measurement_NN ‘Processes_NNS of_IN data_NN collection_NN over_IN time_NN ,_, providing_VVG basic_JJ datasets_NNS ,_, including_VVG associated_VVN accuracy_NN and_CC precision_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT range_NN of_IN relevant_JJ variables_NNS ._SENT Possible_JJ data_NNS sources_NNS associated_VVN with_IN all_DT hydrocarbon_NN fuels_NNS ._SENT Significant_JJ emissions_NNS occur_VVP as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN animal_JJ husbandry_NN and_CC agriculture_NN ,_, and_CC their_PP$ management_NN represents_VVZ a_DT major_JJ mitigation_NN option_NN ._SENT Migrant_JJ See_NP Migration_NP ._SENT Migration_NN The_DT International_NP Organization_NP for_IN Migration_NP (_( IOM_NP )_) defines_VVZ migration_NN as_IN ‘The_JJ movement_NN of_IN a_DT person_NN or_CC a_DT group_NN of_IN persons_NNS ,_, either_CC across_IN an_DT international_JJ border_NN ,_, or_CC within_IN a_DT State_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT population_NN movement_NN ,_, encompassing_VVG any_DT kind_NN of_IN movement_NN of_IN people_NNS ,_, whatever_WDT its_PP$ length_NN ,_, composition_NN and_CC causes_NNS ;_: Displacement_NP ._SENT Millennium_NN Development_NP Goals_NP (_( MDGs_NP )_) A_DT set_NN of_IN eight_CD timebound_JJ and_CC measurable_JJ goals_NNS for_IN combating_VVG poverty_NN ,_, hunger_NN ,_, in_IN 2000_CD together_RB with_IN an_DT action_NN plan_NN to_TO reach_VV the_DT goals_NNS by_IN 2015._CD Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) A_DT human_JJ intervention_NN to_TO reduce_VV ._SENT Narratives_NNS Qualitative_JJ descriptions_NNS of_IN plausible_JJ future_JJ world_NN evolutions_NNS ,_, describing_VVG the_DT characteristics_NNS ,_, general_JJ logic_NN and_CC developments_NNS also_RB Scenario_NP ,_, Scenario_NN storyline_NN and_CC Pathways_NP ._SENT Nationally_RB Determined_NP Contributions_NP (_( NDCs_NP )_) A_DT term_NN used_VVN under_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS to_TO achieve_VV ._SENT In_IN the_DT lead_NN up_RB to_TO st_JJ Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS in_IN Paris_NP in_IN 2015_CD ,_, countries_NNS submitted_VVD Intended_NP Nationally_NP Net_JJ negative_JJ emissions_NNS A_DT situation_NN of_IN net_JJ negative_JJ emissions_NNS is_VBZ achieved_VVN when_WRB ,_, as_IN result_NN of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ,_, more_JJR greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP removed_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN than_IN are_VBP emitted_VVN into_IN it_PP ._SENT Where_WRB multiple_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ,_, the_DT quantification_NN of_IN negative_JJ emissions_NNS depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT climate_NN metric_NN chosen_VVN to_TO compare_VV emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ gases_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN global_JJ warming_NN potential_JJ ,_, global_JJ temperature_NN change_NN potential_NN ,_, and_CC others_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Negative_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, Net_JJ zero_NN emissions_NNS and_CC Net_JJ zero_CD CO2_NP emissions_NNS ._SENT Net_JJ zero_VVP CO2_JJ emissions_NNS Net_JJ zero_CD carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emissions_NNS are_VBP achieved_VVN when_WRB anthropogenic_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS are_VBP balanced_VVN globally_RB by_IN anthropogenic_JJ CO2_JJ removals_NNS over_IN a_DT specified_JJ period_NN ._SENT Net_NN zero_CD CO2_NP emissions_NNS are_VBP also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN carbon_NN neutrality_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Net_JJ zero_CD emissions_NNS and_CC Net_JJ negative_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Net_JJ zero_NN emissions_NNS Net_JJ zero_CD emissions_NNS are_VBP achieved_VVN when_WRB anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN are_VBP balanced_VVN by_IN anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS over_IN a_DT specified_JJ period_NN ._SENT Where_WRB multiple_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ,_, the_DT quantification_NN of_IN net_JJ zero_CD emissions_NNS depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT climate_NN metric_NN chosen_VVN to_TO compare_VV emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ gases_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN global_JJ warming_NN potential_JJ ,_, global_JJ temperature_NN change_NN potential_NN ,_, and_CC others_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT chosen_VVN time_NN horizon_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Net_JJ zero_CD CO2_NP emissions_NNS ,_, Negative_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC Net_JJ negative_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT Nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) One_CD of_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) to_TO be_VB mitigated_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT The_DT main_JJ anthropogenic_JJ source_NN of_IN N2O_NP is_VBZ agriculture_NN (_( soil_NN and_CC animal_JJ manure_NN management_NN )_) ,_, but_CC important_JJ contributions_NNS also_RB come_VVP from_IN sewage_NN treatment_NN ,_, fossil_JJ fuel_NN combustion_NN ,_, and_CC chemical_JJ industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT N2O_NP is_VBZ also_RB produced_VVN naturally_RB from_IN a_DT wide_JJ variety_NN of_IN biological_JJ sources_NNS in_IN soil_NN and_CC water_NN ,_, particularly_RB microbial_JJ action_NN in_IN wet_JJ tropical_JJ forests_NNS ._SENT Non-CO2_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC radiative_JJ forcing_VVG Non-CO2_NN emissions_NNS included_VVD in_IN this_DT report_NN are_VBP all_DT anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS other_JJ than_IN CO2_NP that_IN/that result_NN in_IN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT These_DT include_VVP short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, some_DT fluorinated_VVN gases_NNS ,_, ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) precursors_NNS ,_, aerosols_NNS or_CC aerosol_NN precursors_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN black_JJ carbon_NN and_CC sulphur_NN dioxide_NN ,_, respectively_RB ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN long-lived_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) or_CC other_JJ fluorinated_VVN gases_NNS ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG associated_VVN with_IN non-CO2_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC changes_NNS in_IN surface_NN albedo_NN is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_RB non-CO2_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Non-overshoot_NN pathways_NNS See_VV Pathways_NP ._SENT Ocean_NP acidification_NN (_( OA_NP )_) Ocean_NP acidification_NN refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT reduction_NN in_IN the_DT pH_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN over_IN an_DT extended_JJ period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_RBR ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ caused_VVN primarily_RB by_IN uptake_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, but_CC can_MD also_RB be_VB caused_VVN by_IN other_JJ chemical_NN additions_NNS or_CC subtractions_NNS from_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ ocean_NN acidification_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT component_NN of_IN pH_NN reduction_NN that_WDT is_VBZ caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ activity_NN (_( IPCC_NP ,_, ,_, p_NN ._SENT 37_LS )_) ._SENT Ocean_NP fertilization_NN Deliberate_NN increase_NN of_IN nutrient_JJ supply_NN to_TO the_DT near-surface_NN ocean_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO enhance_VV biological_JJ production_NN through_IN which_WDT additional_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN is_VBZ sequestered_VVN ._SENT This_DT can_MD be_VB achieved_VVN by_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN micro-nutrients_NNS or_CC macro-nutrients_NNS ._SENT Ocean_NN fertilization_NN is_VBZ regulated_VVN by_IN the_DT London_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Overshoot_VV See_VV Temperature_NP overshoot_VV ._SENT Overshoot_VV pathways_NNS See_VV Pathways_NP ._SENT Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) Ozone_NN ,_, the_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ atmospheric_JJ constituent_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN both_CC naturally_RB and_CC by_IN photochemical_JJ reactions_NNS involving_VVG gases_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN human_JJ activities_NNS (_( smog_NN )_) ._SENT Tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN acts_NNS as_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, it_PP is_VBZ created_VVN by_IN the_DT interaction_NN between_IN solar_JJ ultraviolet_JJ radiation_NN and_CC molecular_JJ oxygen_NN (_( O2_NP )_) ._SENT Stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN plays_VVZ a_DT dominant_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT stratospheric_JJ radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT Its_PP$ concentration_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS in_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT Paris_NP Agreement_NP The_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP under_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN December_NP 2015_CD in_IN Paris_NP ,_, France_NP ,_, at_IN the_DT 21st_JJ session_NN of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT The_DT agreement_NN ,_, adopted_VVN by_IN 196_CD Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ,_, entered_VVN into_IN force_NN on_IN 4_CD November_NP 2016_CD and_CC as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD had_VHD 195_CD Signatories_NNS and_CC was_VBD ratified_VVN by_IN 177_CD Parties_NNS ._SENT One_CD of_IN the_DT goals_NNS of_IN the_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP is_VBZ ‘Holding_VVG the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT global_JJ average_JJ temperature_NN to_TO well_RB below_IN 2_CD °_SYM C_NN above_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels_NNS and_CC pursuing_VVG efforts_NNS to_TO limit_VV the_DT temperature_NN increase_NN to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NN above_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels’_NN ,_, recognising_VVG that_IN/that this_DT would_MD significantly_RB reduce_VV the_DT risks_NNS and_CC impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Additionally_RB ,_, the_DT Agreement_NN aims_VVZ to_TO strengthen_VV the_DT ability_NN of_IN countries_NNS to_TO deal_VV with_IN the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN to_TO become_VV fully_RB effective_JJ in_IN 2020._CD See_NP also_RB United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_CC Nationally_NP Determined_NP Contributions_NP (_( NDCs_NP )_) ._SENT Participatory_NN governance_NN See_NP Governance_NP ._SENT Pathways_NNS The_DT temporal_JJ evolution_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS towards_IN a_DT future_JJ state_NN ._SENT Pathway_NN concepts_NNS range_VVP from_IN sets_NNS of_IN quantitative_JJ and_CC qualitative_JJ scenarios_NNS or_CC narratives_NNS of_IN potential_JJ futures_NNS to_TO solutionoriented_JJ decision-making_NN processes_VVZ to_TO achieve_VV desirable_JJ societal_JJ goals_NNS ._SENT Pathway_NN approaches_VVZ typically_RB focus_VV on_IN biophysical_JJ ,_, techno-economic_JJ ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC socio-behavioural_JJ trajectories_NNS and_CC involve_VV various_JJ dynamics_NNS ,_, goals_NNS and_CC actors_NNS across_IN different_JJ scales_NNS ._SENT .5_CD °_SYM C_NP pathway_NN A_DT pathway_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC other_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS that_WDT provides_VVZ an_DT approximately_RB one-in-two_JJ to_TO two-in-three_NN chance_NN ,_, given_VVN current_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN response_NN ,_, of_IN global_JJ warming_NN either_CC remaining_VVG below_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP or_CC returning_VVG to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP by_IN around_IN 2100_CD following_VVG an_DT overshoot_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB Temperature_NP overshoot_VV ._SENT Adaptation_NN pathways_NNS A_DT series_NN of_IN adaptation_NN choices_NNS involving_VVG trade-offs_NNS between_IN short-term_JJ and_CC long-term_JJ goals_NNS and_CC values_NNS ._SENT These_DT are_VBP processes_NNS of_IN deliberation_NN to_TO identify_VV solutions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP meaningful_JJ to_TO people_NNS in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN their_PP$ daily_JJ lives_NNS and_CC to_TO avoid_VV potential_JJ maladaptation_NN ._SENT Development_NN pathways_NNS Development_NP pathways_NNS are_VBP trajectories_NNS based_VVN on_IN an_DT array_NN of_IN social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, cultural_JJ ,_, technological_JJ ,_, institutional_JJ and_CC biophysical_JJ features_NNS that_WDT characterise_VVP the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN human_JJ and_CC natural_JJ systems_NNS and_CC outline_VV visions_NNS for_IN the_DT future_NN ,_, at_IN a_DT particular_JJ scale_NN ._SENT Emission_NN pathways_NNS Modelled_VVD trajectories_NNS of_IN global_JJ anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS over_IN the_DT 21st_JJ century_NN are_VBP termed_VVN emission_NN pathways_NNS ._SENT Mitigation_NN pathways_NNS A_DT mitigation_NN pathway_NN is_VBZ a_DT temporal_JJ evolution_NN of_IN a_DT set_NN of_IN mitigation_NN scenario_NN features_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS and_CC socio-economic_JJ development_NN ._SENT Overshoot_VV pathways_NNS Pathways_NNS that_WDT exceed_VVP the_DT stabilization_NN level_NN (_( concentration_NN ,_, forcing_VVG ,_, or_CC temperature_NN )_) before_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN a_DT time_NN horizon_NN of_IN interest_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, before_RB )_) and_CC then_RB decline_NN towards_IN that_DT level_NN by_IN that_DT time_NN ._SENT Once_RB the_DT target_NN level_NN is_VBZ exceeded_VVN ,_, removal_NN by_IN sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS is_VBZ required_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Temperature_NP overshoot_VV ._SENT 


Non-overshoot_NN pathways_NNS Pathways_NNS that_WDT stay_VVP below_IN the_DT stabilization_NN level_NN (_( concentration_NN ,_, forcing_VVG ,_, or_CC temperature_NN )_) during_IN the_DT time_NN horizon_NN of_IN interest_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, until_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) Scenarios_NP that_WDT include_VVP time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS of_IN the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC chemically_RB active_JJ gases_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN land_NN use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN representative_NN signifies_VVZ that_IN/that each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ possible_JJ scenarios_NNS that_WDT would_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT specific_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN pathway_NN emphasizes_VVZ the_DT fact_NN that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT long-term_JJ concentration_NN levels_NNS but_CC also_RB the_DT trajectory_NN taken_VVN over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV that_DT outcome_NN are_VBP of_IN interest_NN (_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT RCPs_NNS were_VBD used_VVN to_TO develop_VV climate_NN projections_NNS in_IN CMIP5_NP ._SENT •_NP RCP2.6_NP :_: One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN approximately_RB 3_CD W_NN m-2_NN and_CC then_RB declines_VVZ to_TO be_VB limited_VVN at_IN 2.6_CD W_NN m-2_NN in_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ Extended_NP Concentration_NP Pathway_NP ,_, or_CC ECP_NP ,_, has_VHZ constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT •_NP RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP :_: Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilization_NN pathways_NNS in_IN which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ limited_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN m-2_NN and_CC 6.0_CD W_NN m-2_NN in_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS have_VHP constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2150_CD )_) ._SENT •_NP RCP8.5_NP :_: One_CD high_JJ pathway_NN which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO >_SYM 8.5_CD W_NP m-2_NN in_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP has_VHZ constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD until_IN and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Coupled_NP Model_NP Intercomparison_NP Project_NP (_( CMIP_NP )_) and_CC Shared_NP Socio-economic_NP Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) ._SENT Shared_VVN Socio-economic_JJ Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) Shared_NP Socio-economic_NP Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) were_VBD developed_VVN to_TO complement_VV the_DT RCPs_NP with_IN varying_VVG socio-economic_JJ challenges_NNS to_TO adaptation_NN and_CC mitigation_NN (_( O’Neill_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2014_CD )_) ._SENT Based_VVN on_IN five_CD narratives_NNS ,_, the_DT SSPs_NNS describe_VVP alternative_JJ socio-economic_JJ futures_NNS in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN climate_NN policy_NN intervention_NN ,_, comprising_VVG sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SSP1_NP )_) ,_, regional_JJ rivalry_NN (_( SSP3_NP )_) ,_, inequality_NN (_( SSP4_NP )_) ,_, fossil_JJ –_NN fuelled_VVD development_NN (_( SSP5_NP )_) and_CC middle-of-the-road_JJ development_NN (_( SSP2_NP )_) (_( O’Neill_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: O’Neill_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, ;_: Riahi_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2017_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT combination_NN of_IN SSP-based_JJ socio-economic_JJ scenarios_NNS and_CC Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathway_NP (_( RCP_NP )_) -based_JJ climate_NN projections_NNS provides_VVZ an_DT integrative_JJ frame_NN for_IN climate-impact_NN and_CC policy_NN analysis_NN ._SENT Transformation_NN pathways_NNS Trajectories_NNS describing_VVG consistent_JJ sets_NNS of_IN possible_JJ futures_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS ,_, atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS ,_, or_CC global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperatures_NNS implied_VVN from_IN mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN actions_NNS associated_VVN with_IN a_DT set_NN of_IN broad_JJ and_CC irreversible_JJ economic_JJ ,_, technological_JJ ,_, societal_JJ and_CC behavioural_JJ changes_NNS ._SENT This_DT can_MD encompass_VV changes_NNS in_IN the_DT way_NN energy_NN and_CC infrastructure_NN are_VBP used_VVN and_CC produced_VVN ,_, natural_JJ resources_NNS are_VBP managed_VVN and_CC institutions_NNS are_VBP set_VVN up_RP and_CC in_IN the_DT pace_NN and_CC direction_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Scenario_NP ,_, Scenario_NN storyline_NN ,_, Emission_NN scenario_NN ,_, Mitigation_NN scenario_NN ,_, Baseline_NP scenario_NN ,_, Stabilization_NP (_( of_IN GHG_NP or_CC CO2-equivalent_NP concentration_NN )_) and_CC Narratives_NP ._SENT Peri-urban_NP areas_NNS Peri-urban_NP areas_NNS are_VBP those_DT parts_NNS of_IN a_DT city_NN that_WDT appear_VVP to_TO be_VB quite_RB rural_JJ but_CC are_VBP in_IN reality_NN strongly_RB linked_VVN functionally_RB to_TO the_DT city_NN in_IN its_PP$ daily_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT Permafrost_NN Ground_NN (_( soil_NN or_CC rock_NN and_CC included_VVD ice_NN and_CC organic_JJ material_NN )_) that_WDT remains_VVZ at_IN or_CC below_IN 0_CD °_SYM C_NP for_IN at_IN least_JJS two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._SENT pH_NN pH_NN is_VBZ a_DT dimensionless_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN a_DT solution_NN given_VVN by_IN its_PP$ concentration_NN of_IN hydrogen_NN ions_NNS (_( [_SYM H+_NP ]_SYM )_) ._SENT pH_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN on_IN a_DT logarithmic_JJ scale_NN where_WRB pH_NN =_SYM -log10_NN [_SYM H+_NP ]_SYM ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, a_DT pH_NN decrease_NN of_IN 1_CD unit_NN corresponds_VVZ to_TO a_DT 10-fold_NN increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN H+_NP ,_, or_CC acidity_NN ._SENT Plug-in_NP hybrid_JJ electric_JJ vehicle_NN (_( PHEV_NP )_) See_NP Electric_NP vehicle_NN (_( EV_NP )_) ._SENT Policies_NNS (_( for_IN climate-change_NN mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN )_) Policies_NNS are_VBP taken_VVN and_CC /_SYM or_CC mandated_VVN by_IN a_DT government_NN –_NN often_RB in_IN conjunction_NN with_IN business_NN and_CC industry_NN within_IN a_DT single_JJ country_NN ,_, or_CC collectively_RB with_IN other_JJ countries_NNS –_JJ to_TO accelerate_VV mitigation_NN and_CC adaptation_NN measures_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN policies_NNS are_VBP support_NN mechanisms_NNS for_IN renewable_JJ energy_NN supplies_NNS ,_, carbon_NN or_CC energy_NN taxes_NNS ,_, fuel_NN efficiency_NN standards_NNS for_IN automobiles_NNS ,_, etc._FW Political_JJ economy_NN The_DT set_NN of_IN interlinked_VVN relationships_NNS between_IN people_NNS ,_, the_DT state_NN ,_, society_NN and_CC markets_NNS as_RB defined_VVN by_IN law_NN ,_, politics_NNS ,_, economics_NNS ,_, customs_NNS and_CC power_NN that_WDT determine_VVP the_DT outcome_NN of_IN trade_NN and_CC transactions_NNS and_CC the_DT distribution_NN of_IN wealth_NN in_IN a_DT country_NN or_CC economy_NN ._SENT Poverty_NP Poverty_NP is_VBZ a_DT complex_JJ concept_NN with_IN several_JJ definitions_NNS stemming_VVG from_IN different_JJ schools_NNS of_IN thought_NN ._SENT It_PP can_MD refer_VV to_TO material_JJ circumstances_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN need_NN ,_, pattern_NN of_IN deprivation_NN or_CC limited_JJ resources_NNS )_) ,_, economic_JJ conditions_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_NN of_IN living_NN ,_, inequality_NN or_CC economic_JJ position_NN )_) and_CC /_SYM or_CC social_JJ relationships_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN social_JJ class_NN ,_, dependency_NN ,_, exclusion_NN ,_, lack_NN of_IN basic_JJ security_NN or_CC lack_NN of_IN entitlement_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Poverty_NN eradication_NN ._SENT Poverty_NN eradication_NN A_DT set_NN of_IN measures_NNS to_TO end_VV poverty_NN in_IN all_PDT its_PP$ forms_NNS everywhere_RB ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sustainable_JJ Development_NP Goals_NP (_( SDGs_NP )_) ._SENT Precursors_NNS Atmospheric_JJ compounds_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) or_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, but_CC that_WDT have_VHP an_DT effect_NN on_IN GHG_NP or_CC aerosol_NN concentrations_NNS by_IN taking_VVG part_NN in_IN physical_JJ or_CC chemical_JJ processes_NNS regulating_VVG their_PP$ production_NN or_CC destruction_NN rates_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Aerosol_NP and_CC Greenhouse_NP gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ._SENT Pre-industrial_JJ The_DT multi-century_NN period_NN prior_RB to_TO the_DT onset_NN of_IN largescale_JJ industrial_JJ activity_NN around_IN 1750._CD The_DT reference_NN period_NN 1850_CD –_NN 1900_CD is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO approximate_VV pre-industrial_JJ global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN (_( GMST_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Industrial_JJ revolution_NN ._SENT Procedural_JJ equity_NN See_NP Equity_NP ._SENT Procedural_JJ justice_NN See_NP Justice_NP ._SENT Procedural_JJ rights_NNS See_VV Human_JJ rights_NNS ._SENT Projection_NN A_DT projection_NN is_VBZ a_DT potential_JJ future_JJ evolution_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN or_CC set_VVN of_IN quantities_NNS ,_, often_RB computed_VVN with_IN the_DT aid_NN of_IN a_DT model_NN ._SENT Unlike_IN predictions_NNS ,_, projections_NNS are_VBP conditional_JJ on_IN assumptions_NNS concerning_VVG ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, future_JJ socio-economic_JJ and_CC technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realized_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Climate_NN projection_NN ,_, Scenario_NP and_CC Pathways_NP ._SENT Purchasing_VVG power_NN parity_NN (_( PPP_NP )_) The_DT purchasing_NN power_NN of_IN a_DT currency_NN is_VBZ expressed_VVN using_VVG a_DT basket_NN of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB bought_VVN with_IN a_DT given_VVN amount_NN in_IN the_DT home_NN country_NN ._SENT International_JJ comparison_NN of_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, gross_JJ domestic_JJ products_NNS (_( GDPs_NP )_) of_IN countries_NNS can_MD be_VB based_VVN on_IN the_DT purchasing_NN power_NN of_IN currencies_NNS rather_RB than_IN on_IN current_JJ exchange_NN rates_NNS ._SENT PPP_NP estimates_NNS tend_VVP to_TO lower_VV the_DT gap_NN between_IN the_DT per_IN capita_NN GDP_NP in_IN industrialized_JJ and_CC developing_VVG countries_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Market_NN exchange_NN rate_NN (_( MER_NN )_) ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG Radiative_NN forcing_VVG is_VBZ the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_JJ ,_, downward_JJ minus_CC upward_JJ ,_, radiative_JJ flux_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m-2_NN )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN or_CC top_NN of_IN atmosphere_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT driver_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT The_DT traditional_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ computed_VVN with_IN all_DT tropospheric_JJ properties_NNS held_VVD fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ,_, and_CC after_IN allowing_VVG for_IN stratospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, if_IN perturbed_VVN ,_, to_TO readjust_VV to_TO radiative-dynamical_JJ equilibrium_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ called_VVN instantaneous_JJ if_IN no_DT change_NN in_IN stratospheric_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ accounted_VVN for_IN ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG once_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS are_VBP accounted_VVN for_IN is_VBZ termed_VVN 


the_DT effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB confused_VVN with_IN cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, which_WDT describes_VVZ an_DT unrelated_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT impact_NN of_IN clouds_NNS on_IN the_DT radiative_JJ flux_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Reasons_NNS for_IN Concern_NN (_( RFCs_NP )_) Elements_NNS of_IN a_DT classification_NN framework_NN ,_, first_RB developed_VVN in_IN the_DT IPCC_NP Third_NP Assessment_NP Report_NP ,_, which_WDT aims_VVZ to_TO facilitate_VV judgments_NNS about_IN what_WP level_NN of_IN climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB dangerous_JJ (_( in_IN the_DT language_NN of_IN Article_NP 2_CD of_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP )_) by_IN aggregating_VVG risks_NNS from_IN various_JJ sectors_NNS ,_, considering_VVG hazards_NNS ,_, exposures_NNS ,_, vulnerabilities_NNS ,_, capacities_NNS to_TO adapt_VV ,_, and_CC the_DT resulting_VVG impacts_NNS ._SENT Reducing_VVG Emissions_NNS from_IN Deforestation_NP and_CC Forest_NP Degradation_NP (_( REDD+_NP )_) An_DT effort_NN to_TO create_VV financial_JJ value_NN for_IN the_DT carbon_NN stored_VVN in_IN forests_NNS ,_, offering_VVG incentives_NNS for_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS to_TO reduce_VV emissions_NNS from_IN forested_JJ lands_NNS and_CC invest_VV in_IN low-carbon_NN paths_NNS to_TO sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ therefore_RB a_DT mechanism_NN for_IN mitigation_NN that_IN/that results_NNS from_IN avoiding_VVG deforestation_NN ._SENT REDD+_NP goes_VVZ beyond_IN deforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN ,_, and_CC includes_VVZ the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, sustainable_JJ management_NN of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN forest_NN carbon_NN stocks_NNS ._SENT The_DT concept_NN was_VBD first_RB introduced_VVN in_IN 2005_CD in_IN the_DT 11th_JJ Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) in_IN Montreal_NP and_CC later_RBR given_VVN greater_JJR recognition_NN in_IN the_DT 13th_JJ Session_NP of_IN the_DT COP_NP in_IN 2007_CD at_IN Bali_NP and_CC inclusion_NN in_IN the_DT Bali_NP Action_NP Plan_NP ,_, which_WDT called_VVD for_IN ‘policy_NN approaches_NNS and_CC positive_JJ incentives_NNS on_IN issues_NNS relating_VVG to_TO reducing_VVG emissions_NNS from_IN deforestation_NN and_CC forest_NN degradation_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries_NNS (_( REDD_NP )_) and_CC the_DT role_NN of_IN conservation_NN ,_, sustainable_JJ management_NN of_IN forests_NNS and_CC enhancement_NN of_IN forest_NN carbon_NN stock_NN in_IN developing_VVG countries.’_NN Since_IN then_RB ,_, support_NN for_IN REDD_NP has_VHZ increased_VVN and_CC has_VHZ slowly_RB become_VVN a_DT framework_NN for_IN action_NN supported_VVN by_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN countries_NNS ._SENT Reference_NN period_NN The_DT period_NN relative_NN to_TO which_WDT anomalies_NNS are_VBP computed_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Anomaly_NP ._SENT Reference_NN scenario_NN See_NP Baseline_NP scenario_NN ._SENT Reforestation_NN Planting_NP of_IN forests_NNS on_IN lands_NNS that_WDT have_VHP previously_RB contained_VVN ._SENT Region_NN A_DT region_NN is_VBZ a_DT relatively_RB large-scale_JJ land_NN or_CC ocean_NN area_NN characterized_VVN by_IN specific_JJ geographical_JJ and_CC climatological_JJ features_NNS ._SENT ._SENT Resilience_NN The_DT capacity_NN of_IN social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ systems_NNS to_TO cope_VV with_IN a_DT hazardous_JJ event_NN or_CC trend_NN or_CC disturbance_NN ,_, also_RB Hazard_NP ,_, Risk_NP and_CC Vulnerability_NP ._SENT Risk_VV The_DT potential_NN for_IN adverse_JJ consequences_NNS where_WRB something_NN of_IN value_NN is_VBZ at_IN stake_NN and_CC where_WRB ._SENT See_VV also_RB Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT Scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ description_NN of_IN how_WRB the_DT future_NN may_MD develop_VV based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_CC (_( whether_IN the_DT interaction_NN is_VBZ uni-_JJ or_CC bi-directional_JJ )_) and_CC confidence_NN as_IN assessed_VVN per_IN IPCC_NP guidelines_NNS ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN Ice_NP found_VVD at_IN the_DT ._SENT Perennial_JJ ice_NN is_VBZ sea_NN ice_NN that_WDT survives_VVZ at_IN least_JJS one_CD summer_NN ._SENT It_PP may_MD be_VB subdivided_VVN into_IN second-year_NN ice_NN and_CC multi-year_NN level_NN can_MD change_VV ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB (_( relative_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN )_) due_JJ to_TO (_( 1_LS )_) a_DT change_NN in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN water_NN density_NN ,_, (_( 3_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN basins_NNS and_CC changes_NNS 


in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP gravitational_JJ and_CC rotational_JJ fields_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( 4_LS )_) local_JJ subsidence_NN or_CC uplift_NN of_IN the_DT land_NN ._SENT Global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN are_VBP called_VVN thermosteric_JJ ,_, while_IN density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN salinity_NN changes_NNS are_VBP called_VVN halosteric_JJ ._SENT Barystatic_JJ and_CC steric_JJ sea_NN level_NN changes_NNS do_VVP not_RB include_VV the_DT effect_NN of_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN ocean_NN basins_NNS induced_VVN by_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN mass_NN and_CC its_PP$ distribution_NN ._SENT Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) The_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT subsurface_JJ bulk_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT top_JJ few_JJ meters_NNS of_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, measured_VVN by_IN ships_NNS ,_, buoys_NNS ,_, and_CC drifters_NNS ._SENT From_IN ships_NNS ,_, measurements_NNS of_IN water_NN samples_NNS in_IN buckets_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB switched_VVN in_IN the_DT 1940s_NNS to_TO samples_NNS from_IN engine_NN intake_NN water_NN ._SENT Satellite_NN measurements_NNS of_IN skin_NN temperature_NN (_( uppermost_JJ layer_NN ;_: a_DT fraction_NN of_IN a_DT millimeter_NN thick_JJ )_) in_IN the_DT infrared_NN or_CC the_DT top_JJ centimeter_NN or_CC so_RB in_IN the_DT microwave_NN are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ,_, but_CC must_MD be_VB adjusted_VVN to_TO be_VB compatible_JJ with_IN the_DT bulk_JJ temperature_NN ._SENT Sendai_NP Framework_NP for_IN Disaster_NN Risk_NP Reduction_NP The_DT Sendai_NP Framework_NP for_IN Disaster_NN Risk_NN Reduction_NP 2015_CD –_NN 2030_CD outlines_VVZ seven_CD clear_JJ targets_NNS and_CC four_CD priorities_NNS for_IN action_NN to_TO prevent_VV new_JJ ,_, and_CC to_TO reduce_VV existing_VVG ,_, disaster_NN risks_NNS ._SENT The_DT voluntary_JJ ,_, non-binding_JJ agreement_NN recognizes_VVZ that_IN/that the_DT State_NP has_VHZ the_DT primary_JJ role_NN to_TO reduce_VV disaster_NN risk_NN but_CC that_DT responsibility_NN should_MD be_VB shared_VVN with_IN other_JJ stakeholders_NNS ,_, including_VVG local_JJ government_NN and_CC the_DT private_JJ sector_NN ._SENT Shared_VVN Socio-economic_JJ Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) See_NP Pathways_NP ._SENT Short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) Short-lived_NP climate_NN forcers_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT
