,_, and_CC are_VBP also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB near-term_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS includes_VVZ methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ also_RB a_DT well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, or_CC their_PP$ precursors_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT halogenated_VVN species_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT These_DT compounds_NNS do_VVP not_RB accumulate_VV in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN decadal_JJ to_TO centennial_NN time_NN scales_NNS ,_, and_CC so_RB their_PP$ effect_NN on_IN climate_NN is_VBZ predominantly_RB in_IN the_DT first_JJ decade_NN after_IN their_PP$ emission_NN ,_, although_IN their_PP$ changes_NNS can_MD still_RB induce_VV long-term_JJ climate_NN effects_NNS such_JJ as_IN sea_NN level_NN change_NN ._SENT Their_PP$ effect_NN can_MD be_VB cooling_VVG or_CC warming_VVG ._SENT A_DT subset_NN of_IN exclusively_RB warming_VVG short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_RB short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutants_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Long-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( LLCF_NP )_) ._SENT Short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutants_NNS (_( SLCP_NP )_) See_VV Short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) ._SENT Sink_VV A_DT reservoir_NN (_( natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ ,_, in_IN soil_NN ,_, ocean_NN ,_, and_CC plants_NNS )_) where_WRB a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN is_VBZ stored_VVN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that UNFCCC_NP Article_NP 1.8_NP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT sink_NN as_IN any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN which_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Uptake_NP ._SENT Small_JJ island_NN developing_VVG states_NNS (_( SIDS_NP )_) Small_JJ island_NN developing_VVG states_NNS (_( SIDS_NP )_) ,_, as_RB recognised_VVN by_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS OHRLLS_NP (_( Office_NP of_IN the_DT High_NP Representative_NP for_IN the_DT Least_NP Developed_NP their_PP$ environment_NN and_CC development_NN at_IN the_DT Rio_NP Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Brazil_NP in_IN 1992._CD Fifty-eight_NN countries_NNS and_CC territories_NNS are_VBP presently_RB the_DT Regional_JJ Commissions_NNS (_( UN-OHRLLS_NP ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT Social_JJ cost_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( SCC_NP )_) The_DT net_JJ present_JJ value_NN of_IN aggregate_JJ climate_NN damages_NNS GDP_NP ,_, employment_NN )_) and_CC on_IN the_DT society_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ._SENT Social-ecological_JJ systems_NNS An_DT integrated_JJ system_NN that_WDT includes_VVZ human_JJ societies_NNS is_VBZ of_IN most_JJS relevance_NN for_IN plant_NN activity_NN ._SENT Solar_JJ radiation_NN management_NN See_NP Solar_NP radiation_NN modification_NN (_( SRM_NP )_) ._SENT Solar_JJ radiation_NN Stabilization_NN (_( of_IN GHG_NP or_CC CO2-equivalent_NP concentration_NN )_) A_DT state_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS of_IN one_CD greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) (_( e.g._FW ,_, carbon_NN dioxide_NN )_) or_CC of_IN a_DT CO2-equivalent_JJ basket_NN of_IN GHGs_NP (_( or_CC a_DT combination_NN of_IN GHGs_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS )_) remains_VVZ constant_JJ over_IN time_NN ._SENT Stranded_VVN assets_NNS Assets_NNS exposed_VVN to_TO devaluations_NNS or_CC conversion_NN to_TO ‘liabilities’_NN because_IN of_IN unanticipated_JJ changes_NNS in_IN their_PP$ initially_RB expected_VVN revenues_NNS due_JJ to_TO innovations_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC evolutions_NNS of_IN the_DT business_NN context_NN ,_, including_VVG changes_NNS in_IN public_JJ regulations_NNS at_IN the_DT domestic_JJ and_CC international_JJ levels_NNS ._SENT Stratosphere_NN The_DT highly_RB stratified_VVN region_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN above_IN the_DT troposphere_NN extending_VVG from_IN about_RB 10_CD km_NN (_( ranging_VVG from_IN 9_CD km_NN at_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS to_TO 16_CD km_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS on_IN average_NN )_) to_TO about_RB 50_CD km_NN altitude_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC Troposphere_NP ._SENT Sub-national_JJ actor_NN Sub-national_JJ actors_NNS include_VVP state_NN /_SYM provincial_JJ ,_, regional_JJ ,_, metropolitan_JJ sub-national_JJ authorities_NNS ,_, local_JJ communities_NNS and_CC indigenous_JJ peoples_NNS ._SENT Substantive_JJ rights_NNS See_VV Human_JJ rights_NNS ._SENT Supply-side_JJ measures_NNS See_VV Demand-_NP and_CC supply-side_JJ measures_NNS ._SENT Surface_NN temperature_NN See_VV Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN (_( GMST_NP )_) ,_, Land_NP surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN (_( GSAT_NP )_) and_CC Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) ._SENT Sustainability_NN A_DT dynamic_JJ process_NN that_WDT guarantees_VVZ the_DT persistence_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC human_JJ systems_NNS in_IN an_DT equitable_JJ manner_NN ._SENT Sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NP )_) Development_NP that_WDT meets_VVZ the_DT needs_NNS of_IN the_DT present_NN without_IN compromising_VVG the_DT ability_NN of_IN future_JJ generations_NNS to_TO meet_VV their_PP$ own_JJ needs_NNS (_( WCED_NP ,_, 1987_CD )_) and_CC balances_VVZ social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ concerns_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sustainable_JJ Development_NP Goals_NP (_( SDGs_NP )_) and_CC Development_NP pathways_NNS (_( under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ._SENT Sustainable_JJ Development_NP Goals_NP (_( SDGs_NP )_) The_DT 17_CD global_JJ goals_NNS for_IN development_NN for_IN all_DT countries_NNS established_VVN by_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS through_IN a_DT participatory_NN process_NN and_CC elaborated_VVN in_IN the_DT 2030_CD Agenda_NN for_IN Sustainable_NP Development_NP ,_, including_VVG ending_VVG poverty_NN and_CC hunger_NN ;_: ensuring_VVG health_NN and_CC well-being_NN ,_, education_NN ,_, gender_NN equality_NN ,_, clean_JJ water_NN and_CC energy_NN ,_, and_CC decent_JJ work_NN ;_: building_VVG and_CC ensuring_VVG resilient_JJ and_CC sustainable_JJ infrastructure_NN ,_, cities_NNS and_CC consumption_NN ;_: reducing_VVG inequalities_NNS ;_: protecting_VVG land_NN and_CC water_NN ecosystems_NNS ;_: promoting_VVG peace_NN ,_, justice_NN and_CC partnerships_NNS ;_: and_CC taking_VVG urgent_JJ action_NN on_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SD_NN )_) ._SENT Technology_NN transfer_VV The_DT exchange_NN of_IN knowledge_NN ,_, hardware_NN and_CC associated_JJ software_NN ,_, money_NN and_CC goods_NNS among_IN stakeholders_NNS ,_, which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO the_DT spread_NN of_IN technology_NN for_IN adaptation_NN or_CC mitigation_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN encompasses_VVZ both_DT diffusion_NN of_IN technologies_NNS and_CC technological_JJ cooperation_NN across_IN and_CC within_IN countries_NNS ._SENT Temperature_NN overshoot_VVP The_DT temporary_JJ exceedance_NN of_IN a_DT specified_JJ level_NN of_IN global_JJ warming_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT Overshoot_VV implies_VVZ a_DT peak_NN followed_VVN by_IN a_DT decline_NN in_IN global_JJ warming_NN ,_, achieved_VVN through_IN anthropogenic_JJ removal_NN of_IN CO2_NP exceeding_VVG remaining_VVG CO2_JJ emissions_NNS globally_RB ._SENT See_VV also_RB Overshoot_NN pathways_NNS and_CC Non-overshoot_NN pathways_NNS (_( both_CC under_IN Pathways_NP )_) ._SENT Tipping_VVG point_NN A_DT level_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN system_NN properties_NNS beyond_IN which_WDT a_DT system_NN reorganizes_VVZ ,_, often_RB abruptly_RB ,_, and_CC does_VVZ not_RB return_VV to_TO the_DT initial_JJ state_NN even_RB if_IN the_DT drivers_NNS of_IN the_DT change_NN are_VBP abated_VVN ._SENT For_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ,_, it_PP refers_VVZ to_TO a_DT critical_JJ threshold_NN when_WRB global_JJ or_CC regional_JJ climate_NN changes_NNS from_IN one_CD stable_JJ state_NN to_TO another_DT stable_JJ state_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Irreversibility_NN ._SENT Transformation_NN A_DT change_NN in_IN adaptation_NN See_NP Adaptation_NP ._SENT Transformative_JJ change_NN A_DT system-wide_JJ change_NN that_WDT requires_VVZ more_JJR than_IN technological_JJ change_NN through_IN consideration_NN of_IN social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ factors_NNS that_WDT ,_, with_IN technology_NN ,_, can_MD bring_VV about_RB rapid_JJ change_NN at_IN scale_NN ._SENT Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN See_VV Climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN to_TO cumulative_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS (_( TCRE_NP )_) The_DT transient_JJ global_JJ average_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN change_NN per_IN unit_NN cumulative_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS ,_, usually_RB 1000_CD GtC_NP ._SENT TCRE_NP combines_VVZ both_DT information_NN on_IN the_DT airborne_JJ fraction_NN of_IN cumulative_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS (_( the_DT fraction_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ CO2_NN emitted_VVD that_IN/that remains_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ determined_VVN by_IN carbon_NN cycle_NN processes_NNS )_) and_CC on_IN the_DT transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( TCR_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN (_( under_IN Climate_NN sensitivity_NN )_) ._SENT Transit-oriented_JJ development_NN (_( TOD_NP )_) An_DT approach_NN to_TO urban_JJ development_NN that_WDT maximizes_VVZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN residential_JJ ,_, business_NN and_CC leisure_NN space_NN within_IN walking_VVG distance_NN of_IN efficient_JJ public_JJ transport_NN ,_, so_RB as_RB to_TO enhance_VV mobility_NN of_IN citizens_NNS ,_, the_DT viability_NN of_IN public_JJ transport_NN and_CC the_DT value_NN of_IN urban_JJ land_NN in_IN mutually_RB supporting_VVG ways_NNS ._SENT Transition_NN The_DT process_NN of_IN changing_VVG from_IN one_CD state_NN or_CC condition_NN to_TO another_DT in_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN ._SENT Transition_NN can_MD be_VB in_IN individuals_NNS ,_, firms_NNS ,_, cities_NNS ,_, regions_NNS and_CC nations_NNS ,_, and_CC can_MD be_VB based_VVN on_IN incremental_JJ or_CC transformative_JJ change_NN ._SENT Tropical_JJ cyclone_NN The_DT general_JJ term_NN for_IN a_DT strong_JJ ,_, cyclonic-scale_JJ disturbance_NN that_WDT originates_VVZ over_IN tropical_JJ oceans_NNS ._SENT Distinguished_VVN from_IN weaker_JJR systems_NNS (_( often_RB named_VVN tropical_JJ disturbances_NNS or_CC depressions_NNS )_) by_IN exceeding_VVG a_DT threshold_NN wind_NN speed_NN ._SENT A_DT tropical_JJ storm_NN is_VBZ a_DT tropical_JJ cyclone_NN with_IN one-minute_JJ average_JJ surface_NN winds_NNS between_IN 18_CD and_CC 32_CD m_NN s-1_NN ._SENT Beyond_IN m_NN s-1_NN ,_, a_DT tropical_JJ cyclone_NN is_VBZ called_VVN a_DT hurricane_NN ,_, typhoon_NN ,_, or_CC cyclone_NN ,_, depending_VVG on_IN geographic_JJ location_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Extratropical_JJ cyclone_NN ._SENT Troposphere_NN The_DT lowest_JJS part_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT surface_NN to_TO about_RB 10_CD km_NN in_IN altitude_NN at_IN mid-latitudes_NNS (_( ranging_VVG from_IN 9_CD km_NN at_IN high_JJ latitudes_NNS to_TO 16_CD km_NN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS on_IN average_NN )_) ,_, where_WRB clouds_NNS and_CC weather_NN phenomena_NNS occur_VVP ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, temperatures_NNS generally_RB decrease_VVP with_IN height_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Atmosphere_NP and_CC Stratosphere_NP ._SENT Uncertainty_NN A_DT state_NN of_IN incomplete_JJ knowledge_NN that_WDT can_MD result_VV from_IN a_DT lack_NN of_IN information_NN or_CC from_IN disagreement_NN about_IN what_WP is_VBZ known_VVN or_CC even_RB knowable_JJ ._SENT It_PP may_MD have_VH many_JJ types_NNS of_IN sources_NNS ,_, from_IN imprecision_NN in_IN the_DT data_NNS to_TO ambiguously_RB defined_VVN concepts_NNS or_CC terminology_NN ,_, incomplete_JJ understanding_NN of_IN critical_JJ processes_NNS ,_, or_CC uncertain_JJ projections_NNS of_IN human_JJ behaviour_NN ._SENT Uncertainty_NN can_MD therefore_RB be_VB represented_VVN by_IN quantitative_JJ measures_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN )_) or_CC by_IN qualitative_JJ statements_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, reflecting_VVG the_DT judgment_NN of_IN a_DT team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) (_( see_VV Moss_NP and_CC Schneider_NP ,_, 2000_CD ;_: IPCC_NP ,_, 2004_CD ;_: Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Confidence_NP and_CC Likelihood_NP ._SENT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) The_DT UNFCCC_NP was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN May_NP 1992_CD and_CC opened_VVD for_IN signature_NN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP ._SENT It_PP entered_VVD into_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994_CD and_CC as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD had_VHD 197_CD Parties_NNS (_( 196_CD States_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Union_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT Convention’s_NP ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT ‘stabilisation_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT climate_NN 


system.’_NN The_DT provisions_NNS of_IN the_DT Convention_NP are_VBP pursued_VVN and_CC implemented_VVN by_IN two_CD treaties_NNS :_: the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_CC the_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_CC Paris_NP Agreement_NP ._SENT Uptake_NN The_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN of_IN concern_NN to_TO a_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP sequestration_NN and_CC Sink_NP ._SENT Vulnerability_NN The_DT propensity_NN or_CC predisposition_NN to_TO be_VB adversely_RB affected_VVN ._SENT Vulnerability_NN encompasses_VVZ a_DT variety_NN of_IN concepts_NNS and_CC elements_NNS including_VVG sensitivity_NN or_CC susceptibility_NN to_TO harm_NN and_CC lack_NN of_IN capacity_NN to_TO cope_VV and_CC adapt_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB Exposure_NP ,_, Hazard_NP and_CC Risk_NP ._SENT Water_NN cycle_NN See_VV Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT Well-being_NN A_DT state_NN of_IN existence_NN that_WDT fulfils_VVZ various_JJ human_JJ needs_NNS ,_, including_VVG material_NN living_VVG conditions_NNS and_CC quality_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT ability_NN to_TO pursue_VV one’s_NN goals_NNS ,_, to_TO thrive_VV ,_, and_CC feel_VVP satisfied_VVN with_IN one’s_JJ life_NN ._SENT Ecosystem_NN well-being_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT ability_NN of_IN ecosystems_NNS to_TO maintain_VV their_PP$ diversity_NN and_CC quality_NN ._SENT Zero_CD emissions_NNS commitment_NN See_VV climate-change_NN commitment_NN ._SENT 
G.1_NP 
GLOSSARY_NN 
Glossary_NN 
G.2_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
Accuracy_NN 
A_DT relative_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT exactness_NN of_IN an_DT emission_NN or_CC removal_NN estimate_NN ._SENT Estimates_NNS should_MD be_VB accurate_JJ in_IN the_DT sense_NN that_IN/that they_PP are_VBP systematically_RB neither_RB over_IN nor_CC under_IN true_JJ emissions_NNS or_CC removals_NNS ,_, so_RB far_RB as_RB can_MD be_VB judged_VVN ._SENT 
Activity_NN 
A_DT practice_NN or_CC ensemble_NN of_IN practices_NNS that_WDT take_VVP place_NN on_IN a_DT delineated_VVN area_NN over_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN ._SENT 
Activity_NN data_NNS 
Data_NNS on_IN the_DT magnitude_NN of_IN a_DT human_JJ activity_NN resulting_VVG in_IN emissions_NNS or_CC removals_NNS taking_VVG place_NN during_IN a_DT given_VVN period_NN of_IN time_NN ._SENT Data_NNS on_IN energy_NN use_NN ,_, metal_NN production_NN ,_, land_NN areas_NNS ,_, management_NN systems_NNS ,_, lime_NN and_CC fertilizer_NN use_NN and_CC waste_NN arisings_NNS are_VBP examples_NNS of_IN activity_NN data_NNS ._SENT 
Agricultural_JJ pond_NN 
An_DT artificial_JJ storage_NN containing_VVG water_NN for_IN agricultural_JJ (_( irrigation_NN )_) or_CC pastoral_JJ (_( stock_NN watering_NN )_) uses_VVZ ._SENT They_PP are_VBP typically_RB unlined_JJ and_CC constructed_VVN using_VVG a_DT combination_NN of_IN earthen_JJ embankments_NNS and_CC the_DT natural_JJ topography_NN on_IN the_DT landscape_NN ._SENT They_PP can_MD range_VV in_IN size_NN from_IN very_RB small_JJ farm_NN dams_NNS (_( <_SYM 50_CD m2_NN )_) to_TO very_RB large_JJ (_( >_SYM 10_CD km2_NN )_) ._SENT 
Allochthonous_JJ 
Material_NN or_CC formation_NN originating_VVG outside_IN the_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT 
Allometric_JJ model_NN 
A_DT formula_NN that_WDT quantitatively_RB describes_VVZ an_DT allometric_JJ relationship_NN ._SENT 
Allometry_NN 
The_DT relative_JJ dimensional_JJ relationships_NNS between_IN body_NN parts_NNS that_WDT grow_VVP at_IN different_JJ rates_NNS ._SENT 
Anaerobic_JJ 
Conditions_NNS in_IN which_WDT oxygen_NN is_VBZ not_RB readily_RB available_JJ ._SENT These_DT conditions_NNS are_VBP important_JJ for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN methane_NN emissions_NNS ._SENT Whenever_WRB organic_JJ material_NN decomposes_VVZ in_IN anaerobic_JJ conditions_NNS (_( in_IN landfills_NNS ,_, flooded_VVD rice_NN fields_NNS ,_, etc._FW )_) methane_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB formed_VVN ._SENT 
Andosol_NP 
A_DT soil_NN developed_VVN in_IN volcanic_JJ ash_NN ._SENT Generally_RB andosols_NNS have_VHP good_JJ drainage_NN and_CC are_VBP prone_JJ to_TO fertility_NN problems_NNS ._SENT 
Approaches_NNS to_TO consistent_JJ representation_NN of_IN lands_NNS 
Approach_NN 1_CD :_: Represents_VVZ land-use_NN area_NN totals_VVZ within_IN a_DT defined_VVN spatial_JJ unit_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ often_RB defined_VVN by_IN political_JJ boundaries_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT country_NN ,_, province_NN or_CC municipality_NN ._SENT 
Approach_NN 2_CD :_: The_DT essential_JJ feature_NN of_IN Approach_NP 2_CD is_VBZ that_IN/that it_PP provides_VVZ an_DT assessment_NN of_IN both_CC the_DT net_JJ losses_NNS or_CC gains_NNS in_IN the_DT area_NN of_IN specific_JJ land-use_NN categories_NNS and_CC what_WP these_DT conversions_NNS represent_VV (_( i.e._FW ,_, changes_NNS both_CC from_IN and_CC to_TO a_DT category_NN )_) ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, Approach_NP 2_CD differs_VVZ from_IN Approach_NP 1_CD in_IN that_WDT it_PP includes_VVZ information_NN on_IN conversions_NNS between_IN categories_NNS ,_, but_CC is_VBZ still_RB only_RB tracking_VVG those_DT changes_NNS without_IN spatially-explicit_JJ location_NN data_NNS ,_, often_RB based_VVN on_IN political_JJ boundaries_NNS (_( i.e._FW ,_, locations_NNS of_IN specific_JJ land-use_NN and_CC land-use_NN conversions_NNS are_VBP not_RB known_VVN )_) ._SENT 
Approach_NN 3_CD :_: The_DT key_JJ defining_VVG characteristic_NN of_IN Approach_NP 3_CD is_VBZ that_IN/that it_PP is_VBZ both_DT spatially_RB and_CC temporally_RB consistent_JJ and_CC explicit_JJ ._SENT Sample-based_JJ ,_, survey-based_JJ and_CC wall-to-wall_JJ methods_NNS can_MD be_VB considered_VVN Approach_NP 3_CD depending_VVG on_IN the_DT design_NN of_IN the_DT sampling_NN /_SYM mapping_VVG program_NN and_CC the_DT way_NN the_DT data_NN is_VBZ processed_VVN and_CC analysed_VVN ._SENT 
Aquaculture_NN pond_NN 
An_DT artificial_JJ storage_NN containing_VVG water_NN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN aquatic_JJ animals_NNS or_CC plants_NNS ._SENT They_PP are_VBP typically_RB unlined_JJ and_CC constructed_VVN using_VVG a_DT combination_NN of_IN earthen_JJ embankments_NNS and_CC the_DT natural_JJ topography_NN on_IN the_DT landscape_NN ._SENT They_PP can_MD range_VV in_IN size_NN from_IN (_( <_SYM 50_CD m2_NN )_) to_TO (_( >_SYM 10_CD km2_NN )_) ._SENT 
Arithmetic_JJ mean_NN 
The_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT values_NNS divided_VVN by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN values_NNS ._SENT 
Auto_NN producer_NN

Autochthonous_JJ 
Material_NN or_CC formation_NN originating_VVG from_IN inside_IN the_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT 
G.3_NP 
Back-casting_NP 
The_DT opposite_NN of_IN forecasting_NN ._SENT Predicting_VVG conditions_NNS in_IN the_DT past_NN from_IN current_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT 
Backflows_NP 
By-product_NN oils_NNS from_IN petrochemical_NN processing_NN of_IN refinery_NN products_NNS which_WDT are_VBP generally_RB returned_VVN to_TO the_DT refinery_NN for_IN further_JJR processing_NN into_IN petroleum_NN products_NNS ._SENT 
Base_NN year_NN 
The_DT starting_VVG year_NN for_IN the_DT inventory_NN ._SENT Currently_RB this_DT is_VBZ typically_RB 1990._CD 
Benthic_JJ chlorophyll_NN 
An_DT indicator_NN of_IN the_DT eutrophication_NN status_NN of_IN a_DT water_NN body_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN microalgae_NNS at_IN the_DT sediment-water_NN interface_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT 
Bias_NN 
A_DT systematic_JJ error_NN of_IN the_DT observation_NN and_CC estimation_NN method_NN ,_, whose_WP$ magnitude_NN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS is_VBZ unknown_JJ ._SENT It_PP can_MD be_VB introduced_VVN by_IN using_VVG measuring_NN equipment_NN that_WDT is_VBZ improperly_RB calibrated_VVN ,_, by_IN selecting_VVG items_NNS from_IN a_DT wrong_JJ population_NN or_CC by_IN favouring_VVG certain_JJ elements_NNS of_IN a_DT population_NN ,_, etc._FW For_IN example_NN :_: Estimating_VVG the_DT total_JJ fugitive_JJ emission_NN from_IN gas_NN transport_NN and_CC distribution_NN using_VVG only_JJ measurements_NNS of_IN leakage_NN from_IN high_RB /_SYM medium_JJ pressure_NN pipelines_NNS can_MD lead_VV to_TO bias_NN if_IN the_DT leakage_NN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR pressure_NN distribution_NN network_NN (_( which_WDT is_VBZ significantly_RB more_RBR difficult_JJ to_TO measure_VV )_) is_VBZ neglected_VVN ._SENT 
Biochar_NP 
For_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, biochar_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN a_DT solid_JJ material_NN generated_VVN by_IN heating_VVG biomass_NN to_TO a_DT temperature_NN in_IN excess_NN of_IN 350_CD °_SYM C_NN under_IN conditions_NNS of_IN controlled_JJ and_CC limited_JJ oxidant_NN concentrations_NNS to_TO prevent_VV combustion_NN ._SENT These_DT processes_NNS can_MD be_VB classified_VVN as_IN either_DT pyrolysis_NN (_( in_IN which_WDT oxidants_NNS are_VBP excluded_VVN )_) ,_, or_CC gasification_NN (_( in_IN which_WDT oxidant_NN concentrations_NNS are_VBP low_JJ enough_RB to_TO generate_VV syngas_NNS )_) ._SENT 
Bioenergy_NP 
Energy_NP derived_VVD from_IN any_DT form_NN of_IN biomass_NN ._SENT 
Biofuels_NP 
Any_DT fuels_NNS derived_VVN from_IN biomass_NN ,_, either_CC deliberately_RB grown_VVN or_CC from_IN waste_NN products_NNS ._SENT Peat_NP is_VBZ not_RB considered_VVN a_DT biofuel_NN in_IN these_DT guidelines_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT length_NN of_IN time_NN required_VVN for_IN peat_NN to_TO re-accumulate_VV after_IN harvest_NN ._SENT 
Biogenic_JJ carbon_NN 
Carbon_NN derived_VVN from_IN biogenic_JJ (_( plant_NN or_CC animal_NN )_) sources_NNS excluding_VVG fossil_JJ carbon_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that peat_NN is_VBZ treated_VVN as_IN a_DT fossil_JJ carbon_NN in_IN these_DT guidelines_NNS as_IN it_PP takes_VVZ so_RB long_JJ to_TO replace_VV harvested_VVN peat_NN ._SENT 
Biological_JJ treatment_NN of_IN waste_NN 
Composting_VVG and_CC anaerobic_JJ digestion_NN of_IN organic_JJ wastes_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN food_NN waste_NN ,_, garden_NN /_SYM park_NN waste_NN and_CC sludge_NN ,_, to_TO reduce_VV volume_NN in_IN the_DT waste_NN material_NN ,_, stabilisation_NN of_IN waste_NN ,_, and_CC destruction_NN of_IN pathogens_NNS in_IN the_DT waste_NN material_NN ._SENT This_DT includes_VVZ mechanical-biological_JJ treatment_NN ._SENT 
Biomass_NN 
(_( 1_LS )_) The_DT total_JJ mass_NN of_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS in_IN a_DT given_VVN area_NN or_CC of_IN a_DT given_VVN species_NNS usually_RB expressed_VVN as_IN dry_JJ weight_NN ._SENT Includes_VVZ above_IN and_CC below_IN ground_NN living_VVG biomass_NN ._SENT 
(_( 2_CD )_) Organic_NP matter_NN consisting_VVG of_IN or_CC recently_RB derived_VVN from_IN living_JJ organisms_NNS (_( especially_RB regarded_VVN as_IN fuel_NN )_) excluding_VVG peat_NN ._SENT Includes_VVZ products_NNS ,_, by-products_NNS and_CC waste_NN derived_VVN from_IN such_JJ material_NN ._SENT 
Blowing_VVG agent_NN (_( for_IN foam_NN production_NN )_) 
A_DT gas_NN ,_, volatile_JJ liquid_NN ,_, or_CC chemical_NN that_WDT generates_VVZ gas_NN during_IN the_DT foaming_VVG process_NN ._SENT The_DT gas_NN creates_VVZ bubbles_NNS or_CC cells_NNS in_IN the_DT plastic_JJ structure_NN of_IN a_DT foam_NN ._SENT 
Bootstrap_NN technique_NN

Canal_NP

Carbon_NN budget_NN

Carbon_NN dioxide_NN equivalent_NN emission_NN 
The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ integrated_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG or_CC temperature_NN change_NN ,_, over_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, as_IN an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) or_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ._SENT There_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN ways_NNS to_TO compute_VV such_JJ equivalent_NN emissions_NNS and_CC choose_VV appropriate_JJ time_NN horizons_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS typically_RB ,_, the_DT CO2-equivalent_NP emission_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN multiplying_VVG the_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP by_IN its_PP$ global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN (_( GWP_NP )_) for_IN a_DT 100-year_JJ time_NN horizon_NN ._SENT

Combined_JJ heat_NN and_CC power_NN (_( CHP_NP )_)

Comparability_NN

Confidence_NN 
The_DT term_NN ‘confidence’_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO represent_VV trust_NN in_IN a_DT measurement_NN or_CC estimate_NN ._SENT Having_VHG confidence_NN in_IN inventory_NN estimates_NNS does_VVZ not_RB make_VV those_DT estimates_NNS more_RBR accurate_JJ or_CC precise_JJ ;_: however_RB ,_, it_PP will_MD eventually_RB help_VV to_TO establish_VV a_DT consensus_NN regarding_VVG whether_IN the_DT data_NNS can_MD be_VB applied_VVN to_TO solve_VV a_DT problem_NN ._SENT This_DT usage_NN of_IN confidence_NN differs_VVZ substantially_RB from_IN the_DT statistical_JJ usage_NN in_IN the_DT term_NN confidence_NN interval_NN ._SENT 
Confidence_NN interval_NN 
A_DT confidence_NN interval_NN (_( CI_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT type_NN of_IN interval_NN estimate_NN ,_, computed_VVN from_IN the_DT statistics_NNS of_IN the_DT observed_VVN /_SYM estimated_JJ data_NNS ,_, that_WDT might_MD contain_VV the_DT true_JJ value_NN of_IN an_DT unknown_JJ population_NN parameter_NN ._SENT The_DT interval_NN has_VHZ an_DT associated_VVN confidence_NN level_NN that_WDT quantifies_VVZ the_DT level_NN of_IN confidence_NN that_IN/that the_DT parameter_NN lies_VVZ in_IN the_DT interval_NN ._SENT Most_RBS commonly_RB ,_, the_DT 95_CD per_IN cent_NN confidence_NN level_NN is_VBZ used_VVN ._SENT 
Consistency_NN 
Consistency_NN means_VVZ that_IN/that an_DT inventory_NN is_VBZ internally_RB consistent_JJ in_IN all_PDT its_PP$ elements_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN years_NNS ._SENT An_DT inventory_NN is_VBZ consistent_JJ if_IN the_DT same_JJ methodologies_NNS are_VBP used_VVN for_IN the_DT base_NN year_NN and_CC all_DT subsequent_JJ years_NNS and_CC if_IN consistent_JJ data_NNS sets_NNS are_VBP used_VVN to_TO estimate_VV emissions_NNS or_CC removals_NNS from_IN sources_NNS or_CC sinks_NNS ._SENT An_DT inventory_NN using_VVG different_JJ methodologies_NNS for_IN different_JJ years_NNS can_MD be_VB considered_VVN to_TO be_VB consistent_JJ if_IN it_PP has_VHZ been_VBN estimated_VVN in_IN a_DT transparent_JJ manner_NN taking_VVG into_IN account_NN the_DT guidance_NN in_IN Volume_NN 1_CD on_IN good_JJ practice_NN in_IN time_NN series_NN consistency_NN ._SENT 
Correlation_NN

Correlation_NN coefficient_NN 
A_DT number_NN lying_VVG between_IN –_JJ 1_CD and_CC +1_NN ,_, which_WDT measures_VVZ the_DT mutual_JJ relationship_NN between_IN two_CD variables_NNS that_WDT are_VBP observed_VVN together_RB ._SENT A_DT value_NN of_IN +1_JJ means_NNS that_IN/that the_DT variables_NNS have_VHP a_DT perfect_JJ linear_JJ relationship_NN ;_: a_DT value_NN of_IN –_NN 1_CD means_VVZ that_IN/that there_EX is_VBZ a_DT perfect_JJ inverse_JJ linear_JJ relation_NN ;_: and_CC a_DT value_NN of_IN 0_CD means_VVZ that_IN/that there_EX is_VBZ no_DT straight_JJ line_NN relation_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT covariance_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD variables_NNS divided_VVN by_IN the_DT product_NN of_IN their_PP$ standard_JJ deviations_NNS ._SENT

Cruise_NP 
(_( When_WRB applied_VVN to_TO aircraft_NNS )_) All_DT aircraft_NN activities_NNS that_WDT take_VVP place_NN at_IN altitudes_NNS above_IN 914_CD metres_NNS (_( 3_CD ,_, 000_CD feet_NNS )_) including_VVG any_DT additional_JJ climb_NN or_CC descent_NN operations_NNS above_IN this_DT altitude_NN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ no_DT upper_JJ limit_NN ._SENT 
Dam_NN 
An_DT artificial_JJ structure_NN that_WDT is_VBZ barrier_NN used_VVN to_TO hold_VV back_JJ water_NN in_IN a_DT reservoir_NN ._SENT Typically_RB constructed_VVN with_IN mineral_NN sediment_NN or_CC concrete_NN ._SENT 
Degassing_VVG emissions_NNS 
Elevated_JJ gas_NN emissions_NNS that_WDT occur_VVP as_IN water_NN is_VBZ released_VVN from_IN a_DT dam_NN and_CC experiences_VVZ sudden_JJ changes_NNS in_IN pressure_NN ,_, temperature_NN and_CC turbulence_NN ._SENT These_DT changes_NNS cause_VVP air-water_NN exchange_NN processes_VVZ to_TO occur_VV at_IN much_RB greater_JJR rates_NNS than_IN in_IN surface_NN waters_NNS as_IN the_DT released_VVN water_NN approaches_VVZ a_DT new_JJ equilibrium_NN with_IN the_DT environment_NN downstream_IN following_VVG Le_NP Chatelier_NP 's_POS principle_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN dams_NNS the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT hydrostatic_JJ pressure_NN before_IN and_CC after_IN water_NN passing_VVG through_IN turbines_NNS affects_VVZ this_DT balance_NN ._SENT 
Also_RB ,_, water_NN released_VVN from_IN dams_NNS is_VBZ typically_RB released_VVN into_IN a_DT stilling_VVG basin_NN designed_VVN to_TO dissipate_VV much_RB of_IN the_DT turbulent_JJ energy_NN of_IN the_DT flow_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO prevent_VV excessive_JJ bank_NN erosion_NN in_IN the_DT natural_JJ river_NN channel_NN downstream_RB ._SENT The_DT increased_VVN water_NN column_NN turbulence_NN greatly_RB increases_VVZ the_DT air-water_NN gas_NN transfer_NN rate_NN for_IN a_DT given_VVN dissolved_VVN gas_NN concentration_NN ._SENT In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, water_NN may_MD be_VB discharged_VVN through_IN needle_NN valves_NNS into_IN the_DT air_NN ,_, which_WDT provides_VVZ very_RB high_JJ air-water_NN contact_NN area_NN leading_VVG to_TO rapid_JJ gas_NN release_NN ._SENT

Displaced_VVN emission_NN

Dissolved_VVN Inorganic_NP Carbon_NP (_( DIC_NP )_)

Ditch_NN

Eddy_NP flux_NN measurement_NN

Emissions_NNS

Energy_NN recovery_NN

Epilimnion_NN

Evaporative_JJ emissions_NNS

Excluded_VVN carbon_NN

Expert_NN judgement_NN 
A_DT carefully_RB considered_VVN ,_, well-documented_VVN qualitative_JJ or_CC quantitative_JJ judgement_NN made_VVN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN unequivocal_JJ observational_JJ evidence_NN by_IN a_DT person_NN or_CC persons_NNS who_WP have_VHP a_DT demonstrable_JJ expertise_NN in_IN the_DT given_VVN field_NN ._SENT 
Feedstock_NN

Glossary_NN 
G.8_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
First_JJ use_NN 
Distinguishes_VVZ first_JJ uses_NNS (_( and_CC related_JJ emissions_NNS )_) from_IN later_JJR non-energy_NN uses_NNS of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, first-use_NN emissions_NNS from_IN lubricants_NNS are_VBP those_DT which_WDT take_VVP place_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN oxidation_NN during_IN use_NN as_IN a_DT lubricant_NN ._SENT Used_VVN lubricants_NNS may_MD be_VB used_VVN subsequently_RB for_IN heat_NN raising_VVG as_IN waste_NN oils_NNS ._SENT 
Flaring_VVG 
All_DT burning_NN of_IN natural_JJ gas_NN /_SYM vapour_NN streams_NNS and_CC hydrocarbon_NN liquids_NNS by_IN flares_NNS as_IN a_DT waste_NN disposal_NN option_NN rather_RB than_IN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN useful_JJ heat_NN or_CC power_NN ._SENT 
Floating_JJ chamber_NN

Flood_NN control_NN 
The_DT operation_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN to_TO reduce_VV peaks_NNS in_IN river_NN discharge_NN ._SENT 
Flow_NN rate_NN 
The_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN or_CC gas_NN passing_VVG through_IN an_DT imaginary_JJ plane_NN at_IN an_DT instant_NN of_IN time_NN [_SYM units_NNS are_VBP length3_JJ time-1_NN ;_: e.g._FW ,_, m3_JJ s-1_JJ ,_, ft3_JJ s-1_NN ,_, ML_NP d-1_NP ,_, Ln_NP min-1_NP ]_SYM ._SENT 
Fluorocarbons_NNS 
Halocarbons_NNS containing_VVG fluorine_NN atoms_NNS ,_, including_VVG chlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( CFCs_NNS )_) ,_, hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HCFCs_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT 
Flux_NN 
(_( 1_LS )_) The_DT rate_NN of_IN flow_NN of_IN any_DT liquid_NN or_CC gas_NN ,_, across_IN a_DT given_VVN area_NN ;_: the_DT amount_NN of_IN this_DT crossing_VVG a_DT given_VVN area_NN in_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN ._SENT E.g._FW ,_, "_'' Flux_NP of_IN CO2_NP absorbed_VVN by_IN forests_NNS "_'' ._SENT 
(_( 2_CD )_) Raw_NP materials_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN limestone_NN ,_, dolomite_NN ,_, lime_NN ,_, and_CC silica_NN sand_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP used_VVN to_TO reduce_VV the_DT heat_NN or_CC other_JJ energy_NN requirements_NNS of_IN thermal_JJ processing_NN of_IN minerals_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN the_DT smelting_VVG of_IN metals_NNS )_) ._SENT Fluxes_NNS also_RB may_MD serve_VV a_DT dual_JJ function_NN as_IN a_DT slagging_JJ agent_NN ._SENT 
Forest_NP Land_NP

Fuel_NN combustion_NN

Fugitive_JJ Emissions_NNS (_( oil_NN and_CC natural_JJ gas_NN systems_NNS )_)

G.9_NP

Good_JJ Practice_NN 
"_'' Good_JJ practice_NN "_'' is_VBZ a_DT key_JJ concept_NN for_IN inventory_NN compilers_NNS to_TO follow_VV in_IN preparing_VVG national_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN inventories_NNS ._SENT The_DT key_JJ concept_NN does_VVZ not_RB change_VV in_IN the_DT 2019_CD Refinement_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN "_`` good_JJ practice_NN "_`` has_VHZ been_VBN defined_VVN ,_, since_IN 2000_CD when_WRB this_DT concept_NN was_VBD introduced2_JJ ,_, as_IN "_`` a_DT set_NN of_IN procedures_NNS intended_VVN to_TO ensure_VV that_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN inventories_NNS are_VBP accurate_JJ in_IN the_DT sense_NN that_IN/that they_PP are_VBP systematically_RB neither_DT over-_NN nor_CC underestimates_VVZ so_RB far_RB as_RB can_MD be_VB judged_VVN ,_, and_CC that_IN/that uncertainties_NNS are_VBP reduced_VVN so_RB far_RB as_RB practicable_JJ "_'' ._SENT This_DT definition_NN has_VHZ gained_VVN general_JJ acceptance_NN amongst_IN countries_NNS as_IN the_DT basis_NN for_IN inventory_NN development_NN and_CC its_PP$ centrality_NN has_VHZ been_VBN retained_VVN for_IN the_DT 2019_CD Refinement_NN ._SENT Certain_JJ terms_NNS in_IN the_DT definition_NN have_VHP been_VBN updated_VVN based_VVN on_IN feedback_NN from_IN the_DT statistics_NNS community_NN ,_, such_JJ that_IN/that this_DT definition_NN can_MD be_VB also_RB understood_VVN as_IN "_`` a_DT set_NN of_IN procedures_NNS intended_VVN to_TO ensure_VV that_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN inventories_NNS are_VBP accurate_JJ in_IN the_DT sense_NN that_IN/that they_PP are_VBP systematically_RB neither_DT over-_NN nor_CC underestimates_VVZ so_RB far_RB as_RB can_MD be_VB judged_VVN ,_, and_CC that_IN/that they_PP are_VBP precise_JJ so_RB far_RB as_RB practicable_JJ "_'' in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN refinement_NN of_IN Chapter_NP 3_CD of_IN Volume_NN 13._CD 
Good_JJ Practice_NN covers_VVZ choice_NN of_IN estimation_NN methods_NNS appropriate_JJ to_TO national_JJ circumstances_NNS ,_, quality_NN assurance_NN and_CC quality_NN control_NN at_IN the_DT national_JJ level_NN ,_, quantification_NN of_IN uncertainties_NNS and_CC data_NNS archiving_VVG and_CC reporting_VVG to_TO promote_VV transparency_NN ._SENT

Hydrocarbon_NN 
Strictly_RB defined_VVN as_IN molecules_NNS containing_VVG only_JJ hydrogen_NN and_CC carbon_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN more_RBR broadly_RB to_TO include_VV any_DT molecules_NNS in_IN petroleum_NN which_WDT may_MD also_RB contain_VV S_NP ,_, N_NP ,_, or_CC O_NP ._SENT An_DT unsaturated_JJ hydrocarbon_NN is_VBZ any_DT hydrocarbon_NN containing_VVG olefinic_JJ ,_, acetylenic_JJ ,_, or_CC aromatic_JJ structures_NNS ._SENT 
Hydrochlorofluorocarbons_NP (_( HCFCs_NP )_) 
Halocarbons_NNS containing_VVG only_JJ hydrogen_NN ,_, chlorine_NN ,_, fluorine_NN and_CC carbon_NN atoms_NNS ._SENT Because_IN HCFCs_NP contain_VVP chlorine_NN ,_, they_PP contribute_VVP to_TO ozone_NN depletion_NN ._SENT They_PP are_VBP also_RB greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
Hydrofluorocarbons_NP (_( HFCs_NP )_) 
Halocarbons_NNS containing_VVG only_JJ hydrogen_NN ,_, fluorine_NN and_CC carbon_NN atoms_NNS ._SENT Because_IN HFCs_NP contain_VVP no_DT chlorine_NN ,_, bromine_NN ,_, or_CC iodine_NN ,_, they_PP do_VVP not_RB deplete_VV the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT Like_IN other_JJ halocarbons_NNS ,_, they_PP are_VBP potent_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
Hydrofluoroethers_NP (_( HFEs_NP )_) 
Chemicals_NNS composed_VVN of_IN hydrogen_NN ,_, fluorine_NN and_CC carbon_NN atoms_NNS ,_, with_IN ether_NN structure_NN ._SENT Because_IN HFEs_NP contain_VVP no_DT chlorine_NN ,_, bromine_NN ,_, or_CC iodine_NN ,_, they_PP do_VVP not_RB deplete_VV the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT Like_IN other_JJ halocarbons_NNS ,_, they_PP are_VBP potent_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
Hypolimnetic_NP 
Pertaining_VVG to_TO the_DT hypolimnion_NN ._SENT 
2_CD The_DT definition_NN was_VBD originally_RB introduced_VVN with_IN the_DT Good_JJ Practice_NN Guidance_NN and_CC Uncertainty_NN Management_NN in_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS published_VVN in_IN 2000._CD 
3_CD In_IN the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS ,_, the_DT term_NN “_NN uncertainty_NN ”_NN was_VBD used_VVN with_IN two_CD meanings_NNS –_JJ a_DT general_JJ one_CD which_WDT is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN both_DT accuracy_NN and_CC precision_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT specific_JJ one_CD only_RB as_IN the_DT inverse_NN of_IN precision_NN ._SENT This_DT definition_NN text_NN of_IN “_JJ good_JJ practice_NN ”_NN which_WDT uses_VVZ the_DT term_NN “_NN precise_JJ ”_NN instead_RB of_IN “_JJ uncertainties_NNS ”_NN overcomes_VVZ inconsistencies_NNS with_IN general_JJ IPCC_NP definition_NN for_IN uncertainty_NN ,_, without_IN changing_VVG the_DT original_JJ concept_NN of_IN “_JJ good_JJ practice_NN ”_NN ._SENT 
Glossary_NN 
G.10_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
Hypolimnion_NN 
The_DT region_NN of_IN colder_JJR water_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN of_IN a_DT thermally_RB stratified_VVN water_NN body_NN ._SENT It_PP lies_VVZ below_IN the_DT metalimnion_NN (_( or_CC thermocline_NN )_) –_NN the_DT region_NN with_IN the_DT strongest_JJS temperature_NN gradient_JJ –_NN and_CC it_PP may_MD contain_VV a_DT weak_JJ temperature_NN gradient_NN ._SENT In_IN many_JJ reservoirs_NNS ,_, the_DT hypolimnion_NN can_MD be_VB anoxic_JJ (_( no_DT oxygen_NN )_) for_IN many_JJ months_NNS each_DT year_NN because_IN vertical_JJ transport_NN of_IN dissolved_VVN gases_NNS from_IN above_RB occurs_VVZ mainly_RB by_IN slow_JJ diffusive_JJ processes_NNS across_IN the_DT metalimnion_NN ._SENT This_DT can_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT accumulation_NN of_IN large_JJ concentrations_NNS of_IN dissolved_VVN CH4_NN released_VVN from_IN the_DT bottom_JJ sediments_NNS ._SENT 
Hypoxia_NN 
Waterbodies_NNS where_WRB dissolved_VVN oxygen_NN has_VHZ become_VVN undersaturated_JJ due_RB to_TO natural_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC anthropogenic_JJ processes_NNS which_WDT have_VHP led_VVN to_TO aerobic_JJ biological_JJ oxygen_NN consumption_NN rates_NNS greater_JJR than_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN re-oxygenation_NN ._SENT 
Hypoxic_JJ 
Depletion_NN of_IN dissolved_VVN oxygen_NN in_IN aquatic_JJ environments_NNS to_TO levels_NNS that_WDT are_VBP detrimental_JJ or_CC fatal_JJ to_TO aerobic_JJ organisms_NNS often_RB caused_VVN by_IN eutrophication_NN ._SENT 
Independence_NN 
Two_CD random_JJ variables_NNS are_VBP independent_JJ if_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT complete_JJ absence_NN of_IN association_NN between_IN how_WRB their_PP$ sample_NN values_NNS vary_VVP ._SENT The_DT most_RBS commonly_RB used_VVN measure_NN of_IN the_DT lack_NN of_IN independence_NN between_IN two_CD random_JJ variables_NNS is_VBZ the_DT correlation_NN coefficient_NN ._SENT 
Inflow_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN water_NN bodies_NNS 
The_DT water_NN that_WDT enters_VVZ a_DT water_NN body_NN (_( e.g._FW pond_NN ,_, lake_NN ,_, reservoir_NN )_) ._SENT In_IN addition_NN to_TO surface_VV flows_NNS (_( streams_NNS ,_, rivers_NNS )_) ,_, inflow_NN may_MD also_RB include_VV precipitation_NN and_CC groundwater_NN inputs_NNS ._SENT 
Irrigation_NN channel_NN

Key_JJ category_NN 
A_DT key_JJ category_NN is_VBZ one_CD that_WDT is_VBZ prioritised_VVN within_IN the_DT national_JJ inventory_NN system_NN because_IN its_PP$ estimate_NN has_VHZ a_DT significant_JJ influence_NN on_IN a_DT country_NN 's_POS total_JJ inventory_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT absolute_JJ level_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC removals_NNS ,_, the_DT trend_NN in_IN emissions_NNS and_CC removals_NNS ,_, or_CC uncertainty_NN in_IN emissions_NNS or_CC removals_NNS ._SENT Whenever_WRB the_DT term_NN key_JJ category_NN is_VBZ used_VVN ,_, it_PP includes_VVZ both_DT source_NN and_CC sink_NN categories_NNS ._SENT

Kilns_NNS

Land_NN cover_NN

Land_NN use_NN 
A_DT broad_JJ classification_NN of_IN land_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT activities_NNS and_CC cover_VV ,_, and_CC in_IN this_DT report_NN refers_VVZ specifically_RB to_TO six_CD general_JJ types_NNS including_VVG Forest_NP Land_NP ,_, Cropland_NP ,_, Grassland_NP ,_, Wetlands_NNS ,_, Settlements_NNS and_CC Other_JJ Land_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that a_DT specific_JJ parcel_NN of_IN land_NN may_MD have_VH more_JJR than_IN one_CD land_NN use_NN ,_, but_CC it_PP is_VBZ generally_RB the_DT predominant_JJ land_NN use_NN that_WDT forms_VVZ the_DT basis_NN for_IN the_DT classification_NN ._SENT The_DT land-uses_NNS may_MD be_VB considered_VVN as_IN top-level_JJ categories_NNS for_IN representing_VVG all_DT land-use_NN areas_NNS ,_, with_IN sub-divisions_NNS describing_VVG specific_JJ circumstances_NNS significant_JJ to_TO emissions_NNS estimation_NN ._SENT 
Landfill_NN gas_NN 
Municipal_JJ solid_JJ waste_NN contains_VVZ significant_JJ portions_NNS of_IN organic_JJ materials_NNS that_WDT produce_VVP a_DT variety_NN of_IN gaseous_JJ products_NNS when_WRB deposited_VVN ,_, compacted_VVN ,_, and_CC covered_VVN in_IN landfills_NNS ._SENT Anaerobic_JJ bacteria_NNS thrive_VVP in_IN the_DT oxygen-free_JJ environment_NN ,_, resulting_VVG in_IN the_DT decomposition_NN of_IN the_DT organic_JJ materials_NNS and_CC the_DT production_NN of_IN primarily_RB carbon_NN dioxide_NN and_CC methane_NN ._SENT Carbon_NN dioxide_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO leach_VV out_RP of_IN the_DT landfill_NN because_IN it_PP is_VBZ soluble_JJ in_IN water_NN ._SENT Methane_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ less_RBR soluble_JJ in_IN water_NN and_CC lighter_JJR than_IN air_NN ,_, is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO migrate_VV directly_RB to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT 
G.11_NP 
Large_JJ dams_NNS 
A_DT dam_NN with_IN a_DT height_NN of_IN 15_CD metres_NNS or_CC greater_JJR from_IN lowest_JJS foundation_NN to_TO crest_VV or_CC a_DT dam_NN between_IN 5_CD metres_NNS and_CC 15_CD metres_NNS impounding_VVG more_JJR than_IN 3_CD million_CD cubic_JJ metres_NNS ._SENT (_( See_VV International_NP Commission_NP On_IN Large_NP Dams_NP Constitution_NP ,_, Page_NP 3_CD )_) 
LTO_NP (_( landing_NN and_CC take-off_NN )_) cycle_NN 
All_DT aircraft_NN activities_NNS that_WDT occur_VVP under_IN 914_CD metres_NNS (_( 3_CD 000_CD feet_NNS )_) including_VVG idling_VVG aircraft_NN engines_NNS ,_, taxi-out_NN ,_, take-off_NN ,_, climb_VV up_RP to_TO 914_CD metres_NNS ,_, descend_VV ,_, approach_NN and_CC taxi-in_NN ._SENT Note_NN :_: some_DT gatherers_NNS of_IN statistics_NNS count_VVP either_DT single_JJ take-off_NN or_CC landing_NN as_IN one_CD cycle_NN ;_: however_RB ,_, it_PP is_VBZ both_DT one_CD take-off_NN and_CC one_CD landing_NN that_WDT together_RB define_VV the_DT LTO_NP cycle_NN ._SENT 
Lubricants_NNS 
Lubricants_NNS are_VBP hydrocarbons_NNS produced_VVN from_IN distillate_NN or_CC residue_NN ,_, and_CC they_PP are_VBP mainly_RB used_VVN to_TO reduce_VV friction_NN between_IN bearing_VVG surfaces_NNS ._SENT This_DT category_NN includes_VVZ all_DT finished_JJ grades_NNS of_IN lubricating_VVG oil_NN ,_, from_IN spindle_NN oil_NN to_TO cylinder_NN oil_NN ,_, and_CC those_DT used_VVN in_IN greases_NNS ,_, including_VVG motor_NN oils_NNS and_CC all_DT grades_NNS of_IN lubricating_VVG oil_NN base_NN stocks_NNS ._SENT 
Managed_JJ land_NN 
Land_VV where_WRB human_JJ interventions_NNS and_CC practices_NNS have_VHP been_VBN applied_VVN to_TO perform_VV production_NN ,_, ecological_JJ or_CC social_JJ functions_NNS ._SENT All_DT land_NN definitions_NNS and_CC classifications_NNS should_MD be_VB specified_VVN at_IN the_DT national_JJ level_NN ,_, described_VVN in_IN a_DT transparent_JJ manner_NN ,_, and_CC be_VB applied_VVN consistently_RB over_IN time_NN ._SENT Therefore_RB ,_, what_WP is_VBZ not_RB defined_VVN as_IN ‘managed_JJ land’_NN by_IN a_DT country_NN should_MD be_VB classified_VVN as_IN unmanaged_JJ ._SENT 
Managed_VVN Land_NP Proxy_NP (_( MLP_NP )_) 
For_IN the_DT AFOLU_NP Sector_NP ,_, anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS and_CC removals_NNS by_IN sinks_NNS are_VBP defined_VVN as_IN all_PDT those_DT occurring_VVG on_IN ‘managed_JJ land’_NN ._SENT This_DT approach_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, the_DT use_NN of_IN managed_JJ land_NN as_IN a_DT proxy_NN for_IN anthropogenic_JJ effects_NNS ,_, was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN the_DT Good_NP Practice_NP Guidance_NP for_IN Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land-Use_NP Change_NP and_CC Forestry_NP (_( 2003_CD )_) and_CC that_IN/that use_NN is_VBZ maintained_VVN in_IN the_DT 2019_CD Refinement_NN ._SENT 
Manure_NN 
Waste_NN materials_NNS produced_VVN by_IN domestic_JJ livestock_NN (_( vegetative_JJ material_NN such_JJ as_IN green_JJ manures_NNS are_VBP considered_VVN to_TO be_VB crop_NN residues_NNS or_CC compost_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT term_NN ‘manure’_NN is_VBZ used_VVN here_RB collectively_RB to_TO include_VV both_DT dung_NN and_CC urine_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, the_DT solids_NNS and_CC the_DT liquids_NNS )_) produced_VVN by_IN livestock_NN ._SENT 
Mean_VV 
The_DT mean_NN is_VBZ a_DT value_NN around_IN which_WDT values_NNS sampled_VVN from_IN a_DT probability_NN distribution_NN tend_VVP to_TO lie_VV ._SENT The_DT sample_NN mean_NN or_CC arithmetic_NN average_NN is_VBZ an_DT estimator_NN for_IN the_DT mean_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ an_DT unbiased_JJ and_CC consistent_JJ estimator_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN mean_NN (_( expected_VVN value_NN )_) and_CC is_VBZ itself_PP a_DT random_JJ variable_NN with_IN its_PP$ own_JJ variance_NN value_NN ._SENT The_DT sample_NN mean_NN is_VBZ the_DT sum_NN of_IN values_NNS divided_VVN by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN values_NNS :_: 
Σ_NN =_SYM niixnx1_JJ (_( xi_NN ,_, where_WRB i_NP =_SYM 1_CD ,_, ..._: ._SENT ,_, n_NN are_VBP items_NNS of_IN a_DT sample_NN )_) ._SENT 
Measurement-based_JJ approach_NN 
The_DT use_NN of_IN direct_JJ measurements_NNS to_TO compute_VV GHG_NP fluxes_NNS from_IN a_DT system_NN ._SENT 
Median_JJ 
The_DT median_NN or_CC population_NN median_NN is_VBZ a_DT value_NN which_WDT divides_VVZ the_DT integral_NN of_IN a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN (_( PDF_NP )_) into_IN two_CD halves_NNS ._SENT For_IN symmetric_JJ PDFs_NNS ,_, it_PP equals_VVZ the_DT mean_NN ._SENT The_DT median_NN is_VBZ the_DT 50th_JJ population_NN percentile_NN ._SENT 
The_DT sample_NN median_NN is_VBZ an_DT estimator_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN median_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT value_NN that_WDT divides_VVZ an_DT ordered_VVN sample_NN into_IN two_CD equal_JJ halves_NNS ._SENT If_IN there_EX are_VBP 2n_NN +_SYM 1_CD observations_NNS ,_, the_DT median_NN is_VBZ taken_VVN as_IN the_DT (_( n_NN +_SYM 1_CD )_) th_NN member_NN of_IN the_DT ordered_VVN sample_NN ._SENT If_IN there_EX are_VBP 2n_JJ ,_, it_PP is_VBZ taken_VVN as_IN being_VBG halfway_JJ between_IN the_DT nth_JJ and_CC (_( n_NN +_SYM 1_CD )_) th_NN ._SENT 
Methanogenic_JJ production_NN 
Production_NN of_IN methane_NN by_IN microorganisms_NNS (_( methanogenic_JJ bacteria_NNS )_) during_IN the_DT decomposition_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN ._SENT 
Glossary_NN 
G.12_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
Mode_NN 
The_DT mode_NN of_IN a_DT distribution_NN is_VBZ the_DT value_NN which_WDT has_VHZ the_DT highest_JJS probability_NN of_IN occurrence_NN ._SENT Distributions_NNS can_MD have_VH one_CD or_CC more_JJR modes_NNS ._SENT In_IN practice_NN ,_, distributions_NNS with_IN only_RB one_CD mode_NN are_VBP usually_RB encountered_VVN ._SENT In_IN this_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT mode_NN or_CC population_NN mode_NN of_IN a_DT PDF_NN is_VBZ the_DT measure_NN of_IN a_DT value_NN around_IN which_WDT values_NNS sampled_VVN from_IN a_DT probability_NN distribution_NN tend_VVP to_TO lie_VV ._SENT 
The_DT sample_NN mode_NN is_VBZ an_DT estimator_NN for_IN the_DT population_NN mode_NN calculated_VVN by_IN subdividing_VVG the_DT sample_NN range_NN into_IN equal_JJ subclasses_NNS ,_, counting_VVG how_WRB many_JJ observations_NNS fall_VVP into_IN each_DT class_NN and_CC selecting_VVG the_DT centre_NN point_NN of_IN the_DT class_NN (_( or_CC classes_NNS )_) with_IN the_DT greatest_JJS number_NN of_IN observations_NNS ._SENT 
Model_NN 
A_DT model_NN is_VBZ a_DT quantitatively-based_JJ or_CC qualitatively-based_JJ abstraction_NN of_IN a_DT real-world_NN situation_NN which_WDT may_MD simplify_VV or_CC neglect_VV certain_JJ features_NNS to_TO better_RBR focus_VV on_IN its_PP$ more_JJR important_JJ elements_NNS ._SENT 
Example_NN :_: the_DT relationship_NN that_IN/that emissions_NNS equal_VVP an_DT emission_NN factor_NN times_NNS an_DT activity_NN level_NN is_VBZ a_DT simple_JJ model_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN ‘model’_NN is_VBZ also_RB often_RB used_VVN in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN a_DT computer_NN software_NN realisation_NN of_IN a_DT model_NN abstraction_NN ._SENT 
Model-based_JJ approach_NN 
The_DT application_NN of_IN (_( typically_RB )_) statistical_JJ or_CC process-based_JJ models_NNS that_WDT employ_VVP indirect_JJ measurements_NNS to_TO infer_VV GHG_NP fluxes_NNS from_IN a_DT system_NN of_IN interest_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT model-based_JJ estimate_NN of_IN a_DT pollutant_NN flux_NN could_MD be_VB computed_VVN as_IN the_DT product_NN of_IN an_DT assumed_VVN concentration_NN and_CC a_DT measured_VVN flow_NN rate_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ measurement-based_JJ estimate_NN would_MD use_VV a_DT measured_VVN concentration_NN and_CC a_DT measured_VVN flow_NN rate_NN ._SENT 
Monte_NP Carlo_NP method_NN 
In_IN these_DT Guidelines_NNS a_DT Monte_NP Carlo_NP method_NN is_VBZ recommended_VVN to_TO analyse_VV the_DT uncertainty_NN of_IN the_DT inventory_NN ._SENT The_DT principle_NN of_IN Monte_NP Carlo_NP analysis_NN is_VBZ to_TO perform_VV the_DT inventory_NN calculation_NN many_JJ times_NNS by_IN computer_NN ,_, each_DT time_NN with_IN the_DT uncertain_JJ emission_NN factors_NNS or_CC model_NN parameters_NNS and_CC activity_NN data_NNS chosen_VVN randomly_RB (_( by_IN the_DT computer_NN )_) within_IN the_DT distribution_NN on_IN uncertainties_NNS specified_VVN initially_RB by_IN the_DT user_NN ._SENT Uncertainties_NNS in_IN emission_NN factors_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC activity_NN data_NNS are_VBP often_RB large_JJ and_CC may_MD not_RB have_VH normal_JJ distributions_NNS ._SENT In_IN this_DT case_NN the_DT conventional_JJ statistical_JJ rules_NNS for_IN combining_VVG uncertainties_NNS become_VVN very_RB approximate_JJ ._SENT Monte_NP Carlo_NP analysis_NN can_MD deal_VV with_IN this_DT situation_NN by_IN generating_VVG an_DT uncertainty_NN distribution_NN for_IN the_DT inventory_NN estimate_NN that_WDT is_VBZ consistent_JJ with_IN the_DT input_NN uncertainty_NN distributions_NNS on_IN the_DT emission_NN factors_NNS ,_, model_NN parameters_NNS and_CC activity_NN data_NNS ._SENT 
Non-energy_NN products_NNS 
Primary_JJ or_CC secondary_JJ fossil_JJ fuels_NNS which_WDT are_VBP used_VVN directly_RB for_IN their_PP$ physical_JJ or_CC diluent_JJ properties_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP :_: lubricants_NNS ,_, paraffin_NN waxes_NNS ,_, bitumen_NN ,_, and_CC white_JJ spirits_NNS and_CC mineral_NN turpentine_NN (_( as_RB solvent_JJ )_) ._SENT 
Non-energy_NN use_NN 
Within_IN the_DT Guidelines_NNS this_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS as_IN Feedstock_NP ,_, Reductant_NP or_CC Non-energy_JJ products_NNS ._SENT However_RB ,_, the_DT use_NN of_IN this_DT term_NN differs_VVZ between_IN countries_NNS and_CC sources_NNS of_IN energy_NN statistics_NNS ._SENT In_IN most_JJS energy_NN statistics_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, of_IN the_DT International_NP Energy_NP Agency_NP (_( IEA_NP )_) ,_, fuel_NN inputs_NNS of_IN reductants_NNS to_TO blast_NN furnaces_NNS are_VBP not_RB included_VVN but_CC accounted_VVN for_IN as_IN inputs_NNS to_TO a_DT fuel_NN conversion_NN activity_NN transforming_VVG coke_NN and_CC other_JJ inputs_NNS to_TO blast_VV furnace_NN gas_NN ._SENT 
Non-marketed_JJ lime_JJ production_NN 
Lime_NP production_NN occurring_VVG at_IN facilities_NNS where_WRB the_DT primary_JJ purpose_NN is_VBZ the_DT production_NN of_IN lime_NN as_IN an_DT intermediate_JJ input_NN :_: such_JJ as_IN plants_NNS that_WDT produce_VVP steel_NN ,_, synthetic_JJ soda_NN ash_NN ,_, calcium_NN carbide_NN ,_, magnesia_NN and_CC magnesium_NN metal_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN copper_NN smelter_NN and_CC sugar_NN mills_NNS ._SENT The_DT lime_NN produced_VVN by_IN these_DT facilities_NNS is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN on_IN site_NN and_CC thus_RB is_VBZ often_RB not_RB reported_VVN in_IN national_JJ statistics_NNS ._SENT Also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB in-house_JJ lime_JJ production_NN ._SENT 
Non-Methane_NN Volatile_NP Organic_NP Compounds_NP (_( NMVOCs_NP )_) 
A_DT class_NN of_IN emissions_NNS which_WDT includes_VVZ a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN specific_JJ organic_JJ chemical_NN substances_NNS ._SENT Non-Methane_NN Volatile_NP Organic_NP Compounds_NP (_( NMVOCs_NP )_) play_VVP a_DT major_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT formation_NN of_IN ozone_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN (_( lower_JJR atmosphere_NN )_) ._SENT Ozone_NN in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ also_RB a_DT major_JJ local_JJ and_CC regional_JJ air_NN pollutant_NN ,_, causing_VVG significant_JJ health_NN and_CC environmental_JJ damage_NN ._SENT Because_IN they_PP contribute_VVP to_TO ozone_NN formation_NN ,_, NMVOCs_NP are_VBP considered_VVN "_`` precursor_NN "_'' greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT NMVOCs_NP ,_, once_RB oxidized_VVN in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, produce_VV carbon_NN dioxide_NN ._SENT

Normal_JJ distribution_NN

∞≤≤∞_NN =_SYM −−xexfx-for_NN ,_, 21_CD )_) (_( 222_LS )_) (_( σμπσ_JJ ._SENT 
Nutrient_JJ loading_NN

Observational_JJ data_NNS

Off-gas_NN 
The_DT exhaust_NN gas_NN from_IN a_DT chemical_NN process_NN (_( combustion_NN or_CC non-combustion_NN )_) ._SENT The_DT off_JJ gas_NN may_MD be_VB vented_VVN to_TO the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, burned_VVN for_IN energy_NN recovery_NN or_CC flared_VVN (_( without_IN energy_NN recovery_NN )_) ,_, or_CC used_VVN as_IN a_DT feedstock_NN for_IN another_DT chemical_NN process_NN ._SENT Secondary_JJ products_NNS may_MD also_RB be_VB recovered_VVN from_IN the_DT off_JJ gas_NN ._SENT 
Open_JJ burning_NN of_IN waste_NN 
The_DT combustion_NN of_IN unwanted_JJ combustible_JJ materials_NNS such_JJ as_IN paper_NN ,_, wood_NN ,_, plastics_NNS ,_, textiles_NNS ,_, rubber_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ debris_NN in_IN the_DT open_JJ or_CC at_IN an_DT open_JJ dump_NN site_NN ,_, where_WRB smoke_NN and_CC other_JJ emissions_NNS are_VBP released_VVN directly_RB into_IN the_DT air_NN without_IN passing_VVG through_IN a_DT chimney_NN or_CC stack_NN ._SENT Open_JJ burning_NN can_MD also_RB include_VV incineration_NN devices_NNS that_WDT do_VVP not_RB control_VV the_DT combustion_NN air_NN to_TO maintain_VV an_DT adequate_JJ temperature_NN and_CC do_VVP not_RB provide_VV sufficient_JJ residence_NN time_NN for_IN complete_JJ combustion_NN ._SENT

Outflow_NN area_NN

Oxic_NP

Oxidation_NN

Oxycline_NP

Ozone-depleting_NN substances_NNS (_( ODS_NP )_) 
A_DT compound_NN that_WDT contributes_VVZ to_TO stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN depletion_NN ._SENT Ozone-depleting_NN substances_NNS (_( ODS_NP )_) include_VVP CFCs_NNS ,_, HCFCs_NP ,_, halons_NNS ,_, methyl_NN bromide_NN ,_, carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN ,_, and_CC methyl_NN chloroform_NN ._SENT ODS_NP are_VBP generally_RB very_RB stable_JJ in_IN the_DT troposphere_NN and_CC only_RB degrade_VV under_IN intense_JJ ultraviolet_JJ light_NN in_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN ._SENT When_WRB they_PP break_VVP down_RB ,_, they_PP release_VVP chlorine_NN or_CC bromine_NN atoms_NNS ,_, which_WDT then_RB deplete_VVP ozone_NN ._SENT

Peat_NP

Glossary_NN 
G.14_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
Peatland_NP 
Peatlands_NNS are_VBP wetland_NN ecosystems_NNS where_WRB soils_NNS are_VBP dominated_VVN by_IN peat_NN ._SENT In_IN peatlands_NNS net_JJ primary_JJ production_NN exceeds_VVZ organic_JJ matter_NN decomposition_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN waterlogged_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO the_DT accumulation_NN of_IN peat_NN ._SENT 
Percentile_NN 
A_DT percentile_NN (_( or_CC a_DT centile_NN )_) is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN used_VVN in_IN statistics_NNS indicating_VVG the_DT value_NN below_IN which_WDT a_DT given_VVN percentage_NN of_IN observations_NNS in_IN a_DT group_NN of_IN observations_NNS fall_VVP ._SENT 
Perfluorocarbons_NP (_( PFCs_NP )_) 
Synthetically_RB produced_VVN halocarbons_NNS containing_VVG only_JJ carbon_NN and_CC fluorine_NN atoms_NNS ._SENT They_PP are_VBP characterized_VVN by_IN extreme_JJ stability_NN ,_, non-flammability_NN ,_, low_JJ toxicity_NN ,_, zero_CD ozone_NN depleting_VVG potential_JJ ,_, and_CC high_JJ global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN ._SENT 
Plant-mediated_JJ emission_NN

Polar_JJ /_SYM boreal_JJ ,_, dry_JJ climate_NN

Ponds_NNS

Pool_NN ,_, carbon_NN and_CC nitrogen_NN 
A_DT reservoir_NN in_IN the_DT Earth_NP system_NN where_WRB elements_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN carbon_NN and_CC nitrogen_NN ,_, reside_VV in_IN various_JJ chemical_NN forms_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN time_NN ._SENT An_DT example_NN is_VBZ carbon_NN and_CC nitrogen_NN pools_NNS in_IN forest_NN biomass_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP composed_VVN of_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN compounds_NNS synthesized_VVN by_IN trees_NNS ._SENT A_DT group_NN of_IN pools_NNS are_VBP linked_VVN in_IN a_DT cycle_NN with_IN flows_NNS among_IN the_DT pools_NNS influenced_VVN by_IN both_DT anthropogenic_JJ and_CC non-anthropogenic_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT 
An_DT example_NN is_VBZ carbon_NN and_CC nitrogen_NN pools_NNS in_IN forest_NN biomass_NN ,_, wood_NN products_NNS ,_, dead_JJ organic_JJ matter_NN ,_, soils_NNS and_CC the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT flows_NNS are_VBP influenced_VVN by_IN non-anthropogenic_JJ drivers_NNS such_JJ as_IN plant_NN production_NN and_CC microbial_JJ decomposition_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN anthropogenic_JJ drivers_NNS such_JJ as_IN fertilization_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ,_, tree_NN harvest_NN and_CC product_NN use_NN ._SENT The_DT units_NNS are_VBP in_IN mass._NP 
Population_NN

Precision_NN 
Closeness_NN of_IN agreement_NN between_IN independent_JJ results_NNS of_IN measurements_NNS obtained_VVN under_IN stipulated_VVN conditions_NNS ._SENT Better_JJR precision_NN means_VVZ less_RBR random_JJ error_NN ._SENT 
Primary_JJ fuels_NNS 
Fuels_NNS which_WDT are_VBP extracted_VVN directly_RB from_IN natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT Examples_NNS are_VBP :_: crude_JJ oil_NN ,_, natural_JJ gas_NN ,_, coals_NNS ,_, etc._FW 
Process-based_JJ modelling_VVG 
A_DT mathematical_JJ modelling_VVG approach_NN based_VVN on_IN a_DT theoretical_JJ understanding_NN of_IN fundamental_JJ ecological_JJ ,_, biological_JJ ,_, chemical_NN ,_, and_CC physical_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT Typically_RB using_VVG differential_JJ equations_NNS to_TO represent_VV the_DT change_NN over_IN time_NN of_IN parameters_NNS of_IN interest_NN ,_, it_PP provides_VVZ a_DT useful_JJ framework_NN to_TO project_VV specific_JJ responses_NNS to_TO altered_JJ environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, a_DT process-based_JJ model_NN might_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO quantify_VV the_DT delivery_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN delivered_VVN from_IN the_DT catchment_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC produced_VVN by_IN primary_JJ production_NN within_IN a_DT reservoir_NN ,_, its_PP$ deposition_NN onto_IN a_DT reservoir_NN 's_POS sediment_NN ,_, the_DT degradation_NN of_IN the_DT organic_JJ matter_NN aerobically_RB to_TO CO2_NP or_CC anaerobically_RB to_TO CH4_NP over_IN time_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT emission_NN of_IN these_DT gases_NNS across_IN the_DT air-water_NN interface_NN ._SENT 
G.15_NP 
Probability_NN 
The_DT probability_NN of_IN an_DT event_NN is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT likelihood_NN that_IN/that the_DT event_NN will_MD occur_VV ._SENT The_DT probability_NN of_IN any_DT event_NN can_MD range_VV from_IN 0_CD to_TO 1._CD The_DT sum_NN of_IN probabilities_NNS of_IN all_DT sample_NN points_NNS in_IN a_DT sample_NN space_NN is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO 1._CD 
Probability_NN density_NN function_NN 
A_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN (_( PDF_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT function_NN ,_, whose_WP$ value_NN at_IN any_DT given_VVN sample_NN (_( or_CC point_NN )_) in_IN the_DT sample_NN space_NN (_( the_DT set_NN of_IN possible_JJ values_NNS taken_VVN by_IN the_DT random_JJ variable_NN )_) can_MD be_VB interpreted_VVN as_IN providing_VVG a_DT relative_JJ likelihood_NN that_IN/that the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT random_JJ variable_NN would_MD equal_VV that_DT sample_NN ._SENT 
Probability_NN distribution_NN 
Statistical_JJ definition_NN :_: A_DT function_NN giving_VVG the_DT probability_NN that_IN/that a_DT random_JJ variable_NN takes_VVZ any_DT given_VVN value_NN or_CC belongs_VVZ to_TO a_DT given_VVN set_NN of_IN values_NNS ._SENT The_DT probability_NN on_IN the_DT whole_JJ set_NN of_IN values_NNS of_IN the_DT random_JJ variable_NN equals_VVZ 1._CD

Quality_NP Assurance_NP 
Quality_NP Assurance_NP (_( QA_NP )_) activities_NNS include_VVP a_DT planned_JJ system_NN of_IN review_NN procedures_NNS conducted_VVN by_IN personnel_NNS not_RB directly_RB involved_VVN in_IN the_DT inventory_NN compilation_NN /_SYM development_NN process_NN to_TO verify_VV that_DT data_NN quality_NN objectives_NNS were_VBD met_VVN ,_, ensure_VVP that_IN/that the_DT inventory_NN represents_VVZ the_DT best_RBS possible_JJ estimate_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC sinks_NNS given_VVN the_DT current_JJ state_NN of_IN scientific_JJ knowledge_NN and_CC data_NNS available_JJ ,_, and_CC support_VV the_DT effectiveness_NN of_IN the_DT quality_NN control_NN (_( QC_NP )_) programme_NN ._SENT 
Quality_NP Control_NP 
Quality_NP Control_NP (_( QC_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT system_NN of_IN routine_JJ technical_JJ activities_NNS ,_, to_TO measure_VV and_CC control_VV the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT inventory_NN as_IN it_PP is_VBZ being_VBG developed_VVN ._SENT The_DT QC_NP system_NN is_VBZ designed_VVN to_TO :_: 
(_( i_NP )_) Provide_VVP routine_JJ and_CC consistent_JJ checks_NNS to_TO ensure_VV data_NNS integrity_NN ,_, correctness_NN ,_, and_CC completeness_NN ;_: 
(_( ii_NP )_) Identify_NP and_CC address_VV errors_NNS and_CC omissions_NNS ;_: 
(_( iii_NP )_) Document_NN and_CC archive_NN inventory_NN material_NN and_CC record_VV all_DT QC_NP activities_NNS ._SENT 
QC_NN activities_NNS include_VVP general_JJ methods_NNS such_JJ as_IN accuracy_NN checks_NNS on_IN data_NN acquisition_NN and_CC calculations_NNS and_CC the_DT use_NN of_IN approved_JJ standardised_VVN procedures_NNS for_IN emission_NN calculations_NNS ,_, measurements_NNS ,_, estimating_VVG uncertainties_NNS ,_, archiving_VVG information_NN and_CC reporting_NN ._SENT More_RBR detailed_JJ QC_NP activities_NNS include_VVP technical_JJ reviews_NNS of_IN source_NN categories_NNS ,_, activity_NN and_CC emission_NN factor_NN data_NNS ,_, and_CC methods_NNS ._SENT 
RAMSAR_NP 
The_DT Convention_NN on_IN Wetlands_NNS ,_, called_VVD the_DT Ramsar_NP Convention_NP ,_, is_VBZ an_DT intergovernmental_JJ treaty_NN that_WDT provides_VVZ the_DT framework_NN for_IN national_JJ action_NN and_CC international_JJ cooperation_NN for_IN the_DT conservation_NN and_CC wise_JJ use_NN of_IN wetlands_NNS and_CC their_PP$ resources_NNS ._SENT 
Removals_NNS 
Removal_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC their_PP$ precursors_NNS from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN by_IN a_DT sink_NN ._SENT 
Reporting_NN 
The_DT process_NN of_IN providing_VVG results_NNS of_IN the_DT inventory_NN as_RB described_VVD in_IN Volume_NN 1_CD Chapter_NP 8._CD 
Reservoir_NN 
(_( 1_LS )_) A_DT component_NN or_CC components_NNS of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN where_WRB a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN is_VBZ stored_VVN ._SENT (_( UNFCCC_NP Article_NP 1.7_CD )_) 
(_( 2_CD )_) Water_NP bodies_NNS regulated_VVN for_IN human_JJ activities_NNS (_( energy_NN production_NN ,_, irrigation_NN ,_, navigation_NN ,_, recreation_NN etc._NN )_) where_WRB substantial_JJ changes_NNS in_IN water_NN area_NN due_JJ to_TO water_VV level_NN regulation_NN may_MD occur_VV ._SENT The_DT water_NN impounded_VVN behind_IN a_DT dam_NN ._SENT

Glossary_NN 
G.16_NP 2019_CD Refinement_NN to_TO the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP Gas_NP Inventories_NNS 
Rice_NN paddies_NNS 
A_DT flooded_VVN parcel_NN of_IN land_NN used_VVN for_IN growing_VVG semiaquatic_JJ rice_NN ._SENT Paddy_NN cultivation_NN should_MD not_RB be_VB confused_VVN with_IN cultivation_NN of_IN deep_JJ water_NN rice_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ grown_VVN in_IN flooded_VVN conditions_NNS with_IN water_NN more_JJR than_IN 50_CD cm_NN (_( 20_CD in_IN )_) deep_RB for_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT month_NN ._SENT 
River_NP emissions_NNS 
GHG_NN emissions_NNS from_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN a_DT normally_RB (_( in_IN a_DT hydraulic_JJ sense_NN )_) flowing_VVG river_NN downstream_JJ of_IN the_DT exceptionally_RB turbulent_JJ region_NN (_( see_VV outflow_NN area_NN )_) immediately_RB downstream_JJ of_IN a_DT dam_NN ._SENT ‘Normal_JJ flow’_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT velocity_NN of_IN the_DT flow_NN being_VBG solely_RB determined_VVN by_IN channel_NN shape_NN and_CC bed_NN slope_NN so_IN that_DT water_NN column_NN turbulence_NN is_VBZ produced_VVN predominantly_RB by_IN natural_JJ shear_NN forces_NNS at_IN the_DT water-river_NN bed_NN interface_NN ._SENT 
Run-of-the-river_NN reservoirs_NNS 
Reservoirs_NNS in_IN hydroelectric_JJ systems_NNS that_WDT harvest_VVP the_DT energy_NN from_IN flowing_VVG water_NN to_TO generate_VV electricity_NN but_CC cannot_MD store_VV more_JJR water_NN than_IN one_CD day_NN 's_POS annual_JJ mean_JJ inflow_NN (_( i.e._FW annual_JJ mean_JJ flow_NN /_SYM 365_CD )_) ._SENT 
Secchi_NP depth_NN 
A_DT practical_JJ measure_NN of_IN aquatic_JJ turbidity_NN (_( versus_FW clarity_NN )_) based_VVN on_IN the_DT depth_NN at_IN which_WDT a_DT standard_JJ Secchi_NP disc_NN (_( created_VVN by_IN Angelo_NP Secchi_NP )_) ceases_VVZ to_TO be_VB visible_JJ from_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT 
Secondary_JJ fuels_NNS

Sink_NN 
Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN which_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN ,_, or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT (_( UNFCCC_NP Article_NP 1.8_CD )_) Notation_NN in_IN the_DT final_JJ stages_NNS of_IN reporting_NN is_VBZ the_DT negative_JJ (_( -_: )_) sign_NN ._SENT 
Soil_NN carbon_NN pool_NN

Source_NN 
Any_DT process_NN or_CC activity_NN which_WDT releases_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, an_DT aerosol_NN or_CC a_DT precursor_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN into_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT (_( UNFCCC_NP Article_NP 1.9_CD )_) Notation_NN in_IN the_DT final_JJ stages_NNS of_IN reporting_NN is_VBZ the_DT positive_JJ (_( +_SYM )_) sign_NN ._SENT 
Spillway_NN 
An_DT engineered_JJ channel_NN used_VVN to_TO pass_VV high_JJ flows_NNS safely_RB past_IN a_DT dam_NN when_WRB the_DT reservoir_NN water_NN level_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR than_IN the_DT crest_NN of_IN the_DT dam_NN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that the_DT maximum_JJ water_NN level_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN is_VBZ frequently_RB higher_JJR than_IN the_DT crest_NN because_IN of_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN gates_NNS that_WDT are_VBP on_RB top_JJ of_IN the_DT crest_NN ._SENT 
Standard_JJ deviation_NN 
The_DT population_NN standard_NN deviation_NN is_VBZ the_DT positive_JJ square_JJ root_NN of_IN the_DT variance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ estimated_VVN by_IN the_DT sample_NN standard_NN deviation_NN that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT positive_JJ square_JJ root_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN variance_NN ._SENT 
Storage_NN volume_NN 
The_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN stored_VVN in_IN a_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT The_DT ‘active’_JJ storage_NN of_IN a_DT reservoir_NN is_VBZ the_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN contained_VVN between_IN the_DT full_JJ supply_NN level_NN (_( the_DT maximum_JJ level_NN at_IN which_WDT water_NN may_MD be_VB stored_VVN indefinitely_RB )_) and_CC the_DT lowest_JJS outlet_NN level_NN ._SENT The_DT ‘dead’_JJ storage_NN is_VBZ the_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN that_WDT is_VBZ below_IN the_DT lowest_JJS outlet_NN and_CC therefore_RB cannot_MD be_VB routinely_RB accessed_VVN for_IN beneficial_JJ use_NN ._SENT The_DT ‘flood_NN control’_NN storage_NN is_VBZ the_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN contained_VVN between_IN the_DT full_JJ supply_NN level_NN and_CC the_DT top_NN of_IN gates_NNS (_( or_CC other_JJ adjustable_JJ structures_NNS )_) located_VVN on_IN top_NN of_IN the_DT spillway_NN and_CC used_VVN to_TO regulate_VV the_DT discharge_NN of_IN floodwaters_NNS ._SENT The_DT total_JJ reservoir_NN storage_NN volume_NN is_VBZ the_DT sum_NN of_IN dead_JJ storage_NN ,_, active_JJ storage_NN ,_, and_CC flood_NN control_NN storage_NN capacities_NNS ._SENT 
Surrogate_JJ data_NNS 
Surrogate_JJ data_NNS or_CC so-called_JJ proxy_JJ data_NNS is_VBZ data_NN that_WDT is_VBZ used_VVN in_IN place_NN of_IN the_DT actual_JJ data_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT specific_JJ data_NN needed_VVN is_VBZ unobtainable_JJ ._SENT Often_RB surrogate_JJ data_NNS is_VBZ needed_VVN to_TO describe_VV changes_NNS in_IN an_DT emission_NN source_NN over_IN time_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN population_NN change_NN may_MD be_VB used_VVN to_TO approximate_VV change_NN in_IN waste_NN arisings_NNS ._SENT 
Survey_NN 
A_DT survey_NN is_VBZ an_DT investigation_NN about_IN the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN a_DT given_VVN population_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN collecting_VVG data_NNS from_IN a_DT sample_NN of_IN that_DT population_NN and_CC estimating_VVG their_PP$ characteristics_NNS through_IN the_DT systematic_JJ use_NN of_IN statistical_JJ methodology_NN ._SENT 
G.17_JJ 
Systematic_JJ and_CC random_JJ errors_NNS 
Systematic_JJ error_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, bias_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT true_JJ ,_, but_CC usually_RB unknown_JJ ,_, value_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN being_VBG estimated_VVN ,_, and_CC the_DT mean_JJ observed_JJ value_NN as_RB would_MD be_VB estimated_VVN by_IN the_DT sample_NN mean_NN of_IN an_DT infinite_JJ set_NN of_IN observations_NNS ._SENT The_DT random_JJ error_NN of_IN an_DT individual_JJ measurement_NN is_VBZ the_DT difference_NN between_IN an_DT individual_JJ measurement_NN and_CC the_DT above_JJ limiting_VVG value_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN mean_NN ._SENT 
Systematic_JJ error_NN

Thin_JJ boundary_NN layer_NN model_NN 
The_DT thin_JJ boundary_NN layer_NN model_NN expresses_VVZ the_DT flux_NN of_IN gas_NN across_IN an_DT air-water_NN interface_NN as_IN the_DT product_NN of_IN a_DT gas_NN transfer_NN velocity_NN and_CC the_DT concentration_NN change_NN across_IN the_DT interface_NN ._SENT It_PP was_VBD originally_RB developed_VVN by_IN Liss_NP and_CC Slater_NP (_( 1974_CD )_) ._SENT 
Tier_NP 
A_DT tier_NN represents_VVZ a_DT level_NN of_IN methodological_JJ complexity_NN ._SENT Usually_RB three_CD tiers_NNS are_VBP provided_VVN ._SENT Tier_NP 1_CD is_VBZ the_DT basic_JJ method_NN ,_, Tier_NP 2_CD intermediate_JJ and_CC Tier_NP 3_CD most_RBS demanding_JJ in_IN terms_NNS of_IN complexity_NN and_CC data_NN requirements_NNS ._SENT Tiers_NNS 2_CD and_CC 3_CD are_VBP sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_RB higher_JJR tier_NN methods_NNS and_CC are_VBP generally_RB considered_VVN to_TO be_VB more_RBR accurate_JJ ._SENT 
Time_NN series_NN 
A_DT time_NN series_NN is_VBZ series_NN of_IN values_NNS which_WDT are_VBP affected_VVN by_IN random_JJ processes_NNS and_CC which_WDT are_VBP observed_VVN at_IN successive_JJ (_( usually_RB equidistant_JJ )_) points_NNS in_IN time_NN ._SENT 
Transparency_NN 
Transparency_NN means_VVZ that_IN/that the_DT assumptions_NNS and_CC methodologies_NNS used_VVN for_IN an_DT inventory_NN should_MD be_VB clearly_RB explained_VVN to_TO facilitate_VV replication_NN and_CC assessment_NN of_IN the_DT inventory_NN by_IN users_NNS of_IN the_DT reported_VVN information_NN ._SENT The_DT transparency_NN of_IN inventories_NNS is_VBZ fundamental_JJ to_TO the_DT success_NN of_IN the_DT process_NN for_IN the_DT communication_NN and_CC consideration_NN of_IN information_NN ._SENT 
Trend_NN 
The_DT trend_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN measures_VVZ its_PP$ change_NN over_IN a_DT time_NN period_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT positive_JJ trend_NN value_NN indicating_VVG growth_NN in_IN the_DT quantity_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT negative_JJ value_NN indicating_VVG a_DT decrease_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ defined_VVN as_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT quantity_NN over_IN the_DT time_NN period_NN ,_, divided_VVN by_IN the_DT initial_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT quantity_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ usually_RB expressed_VVN either_RB as_IN a_DT percentage_NN or_CC a_DT fraction_NN ._SENT 

Trophic_JJ state_NN 
A_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT biological_JJ productivity_NN of_IN a_DT water_NN body_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ usually_RB characterized_VVN by_IN some_DT combination_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS ,_, photosynthetic_JJ pigments_NNS (_( Chl-a_NP )_) and_CC /_SYM or_CC water_NN column_NN optical_JJ properties_NNS ._SENT As_IN the_DT ambient_JJ nutrient_JJ levels_NNS increase_NN ,_, primary_JJ production_NN (_( the_DT algal_JJ population_NN )_) increases_NNS and_CC the_DT water_NN clarity_NN decreases_NNS ._SENT As_IN primary_JJ production_NN increases_NNS ,_, higher_JJR levels_NNS of_IN biological_JJ production_NN are_VBP supported_VVN and_CC the_DT trophic_JJ state_NN increases_NNS ._SENT 
Lakes_NNS or_CC reservoirs_NNS are_VBP usually_RB classified_VVN as_IN being_VBG in_IN one_CD of_IN four_CD possible_JJ trophic_JJ states_NNS :_: oligotrophic_JJ ,_, mesotrophic_JJ ,_, eutrophic_JJ ,_, or_CC hypereutrophic_JJ ._SENT (_( see_VV e.g._FW ,_, Carlson_NP ,_, 1977_CD )_) 
Oligotrophic_JJ :_: an_DT oligotrophic_JJ lake_NN or_CC reservoir_NN is_VBZ characterised_VVN by_IN low_JJ primary_JJ productivity_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN low_JJ nutrient_JJ content_NN ._SENT (_( Chl-a_NP ≤_NN 2.6_CD μg_NN L-1_NP ._SENT )_) 
Mesotrophic_NP :_: mesotrophic_JJ lakes_NNS or_CC reservoirs_NNS are_VBP characterised_VVN with_IN an_DT intermediate_JJ level_NN of_IN productivity_NN (_( 2.6_CD μg_NP L-1_NP <_SYM Chl-a_NP ≤_NN 20_CD μg_NN L-1_NP ._SENT )_) 
Eutrophic_JJ :_: a_DT eutrophic_JJ lake_NN ,_, pond_NN or_CC reservoir_NN with_IN high_JJ biological_JJ productivity_NN ._SENT Due_JJ to_TO excessive_JJ nutrients_NNS ,_, especially_RB nitrogen_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ,_, these_DT water_NN bodies_NNS are_VBP able_JJ to_TO support_VV an_DT abundance_NN of_IN aquatic_JJ plants_NNS ._SENT (_( 20_CD μg_NP L-1_NP <_SYM Chl-a_NP ≤_NN 56_CD μg_NN L-1_NP ._SENT )_) 
Hypereutrophic_NP :_: a_DT hypereutrophic_JJ body_NN of_IN water_NN experiences_VVZ the_DT highest_JJS levels_NNS of_IN biological_JJ productivity_NN ._SENT (_( 56_CD μg_NP L-1_NP <_SYM Chl-a_NP )_) 
Tropical_JJ ,_, dry_JJ climate_NN 
Areas_NNS where_WRB mean_JJ annual_JJ temperature_NN (_( MAT_NP )_) is_VBZ more_JJR than_IN 18_CD oC_NN ,_, with_IN no_RB more_JJR than_IN 7_CD days_NNS of_IN frost_NN ,_, and_CC mean_VV annual_JJ precipitation_NN less_JJR than_IN or_CC equal_JJ to_TO 1000mm_NP ._SENT 
Tropical_JJ ,_, moist_JJ climate_NN

Tropical_JJ montane_JJ climate_NN

Tropical_JJ ,_, wet_JJ climate_NN
