Unbiased_JJ estimator_NN 
An_DT unbiased_JJ estimator_NN is_VBZ a_DT statistic_NN whose_WP$ expected_VVN value_NN equals_VVZ the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT parameter_NN being_VBG estimated_VVN ._SENT Note_NN that_IN/that this_DT term_NN has_VHZ a_DT specific_JJ statistical_JJ meaning_NN and_CC that_IN/that an_DT estimate_NN of_IN a_DT quantity_NN calculated_VVN from_IN an_DT unbiased_JJ estimator_NN may_MD lack_VV bias_NN in_IN the_DT statistical_JJ sense_NN ,_, but_CC may_MD be_VB biased_VVN in_IN the_DT more_RBR general_JJ sense_NN of_IN the_DT word_NN if_IN the_DT sample_NN has_VHZ been_VBN affected_VVN by_IN unknown_JJ systematic_JJ error_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, in_IN statistical_JJ usage_NN ,_, a_DT biased_VVN estimator_NN can_MD be_VB understood_VVN as_IN a_DT deficiency_NN in_IN the_DT statistical_JJ evaluation_NN of_IN the_DT collected_VVN data_NNS ,_, and_CC not_RB in_IN the_DT data_NNS themselves_PP or_CC in_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN their_PP$ measurement_NN or_CC collection_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, the_DT arithmetic_JJ mean_NN (_( average_JJ )_) x_SYM is_VBZ an_DT unbiased_JJ estimator_NN of_IN the_DT expected_VVN value_NN (_( mean_VV )_) ._SENT 
Uncertainty_NN 
Lack_NN of_IN knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT true_JJ value_NN of_IN a_DT variable_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB described_VVN as_IN a_DT probability_NN density_NN function_NN characterizing_VVG the_DT range_NN and_CC likelihood_NN of_IN possible_JJ values_NNS ._SENT Uncertainty_NN depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT analyst’s_JJ state_NN of_IN knowledge_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN turn_NN depends_VVZ on_IN the_DT quality_NN and_CC quantity_NN of_IN applicable_JJ data_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN knowledge_NN of_IN underlying_VVG processes_NNS and_CC inference_NN methods_NNS ._SENT (_( See_VV Volume_NN 1_CD Chapter_NP 3._CD )_) 
Uncertainty_NN analysis_NN 
An_DT uncertainty_NN analysis_NN of_IN a_DT model_NN aims_VVZ to_TO provide_VV quantitative_JJ measures_NNS of_IN the_DT uncertainty_NN of_IN output_NN values_NNS caused_VVN by_IN uncertainties_NNS in_IN the_DT model_NN itself_PP and_CC in_IN its_PP$ input_NN values_NNS ,_, and_CC to_TO examine_VV the_DT relative_JJ importance_NN of_IN these_DT factors_NNS ._SENT 
Validation_NN 
Validation_NN is_VBZ the_DT establishment_NN of_IN sound_JJ approach_NN and_CC foundation_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN emission_NN inventories_NNS ,_, validation_NN involves_VVZ checking_VVG to_TO ensure_VV that_IN/that the_DT inventory_NN has_VHZ been_VBN compiled_VVN correctly_RB in_IN line_NN with_IN reporting_VVG instructions_NNS and_CC guidelines_NNS ._SENT It_PP checks_VVZ the_DT internal_JJ consistency_NN of_IN the_DT inventory_NN ._SENT The_DT legal_JJ use_NN of_IN validation_NN is_VBZ to_TO give_VV an_DT official_JJ confirmation_NN or_CC approval_NN of_IN an_DT act_NN or_CC product_NN ._SENT 
G.19_NP 
Variability_NN 
This_DT refers_VVZ to_TO observed_JJ differences_NNS attributable_JJ to_TO true_JJ heterogeneity_NN or_CC diversity_NN in_IN a_DT population_NN ._SENT Variability_NN derives_VVZ from_IN processes_NNS which_WDT are_VBP either_RB inherently_RB random_JJ or_CC whose_WP$ nature_NN and_CC effects_NNS are_VBP influential_JJ but_CC unknown_JJ ._SENT Variability_NN is_VBZ not_RB usually_RB reducible_JJ by_IN further_JJR measurement_NN or_CC study_NN ,_, but_CC can_MD be_VB characterised_VVN by_IN quantities_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT sample_NN variance_NN ._SENT 
Verification_NN 
Verification_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT collection_NN of_IN activities_NNS and_CC procedures_NNS that_WDT can_MD be_VB followed_VVN during_IN the_DT planning_NN and_CC development_NN ,_, or_CC after_IN completion_NN of_IN an_DT inventory_NN that_WDT can_MD help_VV to_TO establish_VV its_PP$ reliability_NN for_IN the_DT intended_VVN applications_NNS of_IN that_DT inventory_NN ._SENT 
Typically_RB ,_, methods_NNS external_JJ to_TO the_DT inventory_NN are_VBP used_VVN to_TO check_VV the_DT truth_NN of_IN the_DT inventory_NN ,_, including_VVG comparisons_NNS with_IN estimates_NNS made_VVN by_IN other_JJ bodies_NNS or_CC with_IN emission_NN and_CC uptake_NN measurements_NNS determined_VVN from_IN atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS or_CC concentration_NN gradients_NNS of_IN these_DT gases_NNS ._SENT 
Watercourse_NN 
The_DT channel_NN that_IN/that a_DT flowing_JJ body_NN of_IN water_NN follows_VVZ ._SENT 
Water_NN residence_NN time_NN 
The_DT average_JJ amount_NN of_IN time_NN that_IN/that water_NN spends_VVZ in_IN a_DT particular_JJ system_NN (_( lake_NN ,_, reservoir_NN ,_, etc._FW )_) ._SENT Defined_VVN as_IN the_DT volume_NN of_IN the_DT reservoir_NN divided_VVN by_IN the_DT inflow_NN ._SENT 
Water_NN withdrawal_NN 
The_DT controlled_VVN release_NN of_IN water_NN from_IN a_DT dam_NN ._SENT Depending_VVG on_IN the_DT dam’s_NNS design_NN ,_, i.e._FW the_DT number_NN and_CC level_NN of_IN discrete_JJ outlets_NNS ,_, the_DT withdrawn_VVN water_NN may_MD originate_VV solely_RB from_IN specific_JJ regions_NNS of_IN the_DT water_NN column_NN ,_, i.e._FW epilimnion_NN ,_, metalimnion_NN and_CC hypolimnion_NN ._SENT The_DT withdrawal_NN region_NN for_IN a_DT specific_JJ discharge_NN depends_VVZ strongly_RB on_IN the_DT density_NN stratification_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN body_NN ,_, the_DT outlet_NN dimensions_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT reservoir_NN morphology_NN ._SENT 
Wetlands_NNS 
This_DT category_NN includes_VVZ land_NN that_WDT is_VBZ covered_VVN or_CC saturated_VVN by_IN water_NN for_IN all_DT or_CC part_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, peatland_NP )_) and_CC that_DT does_VVZ not_RB fall_VV into_IN the_DT forest_NN land_NN ,_, cropland_NN ,_, grassland_NN or_CC settlements_NNS categories_NNS ._SENT The_DT category_NN can_MD be_VB subdivided_VVN into_IN managed_JJ and_CC unmanaged_JJ according_VVG to_TO national_JJ definitions_NNS ._SENT Wetlands_NNS occur_VVP over_IN all_DT climate_NN zones_NNS and_CC include_VVP reservoirs_NNS and_CC other_JJ constructed_VVN waterbodies_NNS (_( e.g._FW agriculture_NN and_CC aquaculture_NN ponds_NNS ,_, canals_NNS and_CC ditches_NNS and_CC wetlands_NNS constructed_VVN for_IN wastewater_NN treatment_NN )_) as_IN managed_JJ sub-divisions_NNS ._SENT Managed_JJ wetlands_NNS may_MD also_RB include_VV peatlands_NNS ,_, riparian_JJ wetlands_NNS ,_, forested_JJ swamps_NNS ,_, marshes_NNS ,_, playas_NNS ,_, pans_NNS ,_, salt_NN lakes_NNS ,_, brackish_JJ wetlands_NNS ,_, salinas_NNS ,_, and_CC sabkhas_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO coastal_JJ wetlands_NNS ,_, including_VVG mangroves_NNS ,_, saltmarshes_NNS ,_, tidal_JJ marshes_NNS and_CC seagrass_NN ._SENT Unmanaged_JJ wetlands_NNS include_VVP natural_JJ rivers_NNS ,_, lakes_NNS and_CC ponds_NNS and_CC any_DT wetlands_NNS that_WDT have_VHP not_RB been_VBN directly_RB modified_VVN by_IN human_JJ activity_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT Managed_JJ Land_NP replaced-dns_NNS NONE_NONE Annex_NP I_NP :_: Glossary_NN 
This_DT annex_NN should_MD be_VB cited_VVN as_RB :_:

Aerosol_NN A_DT suspension_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN

atmosphere_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS several_JJ hours_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN aerosol_NN ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ 
both_CC the_DT particles_NNS and_CC the_DT suspending_VVG gas_NN ,_, is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN 
in_IN its_PP$ plural_JJ form_NN to_TO mean_VV aerosol_NN particles_NNS ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN either_RB 
natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ origin_NN ._SENT Aerosols_NNS may_MD influence_VV climate_NN in_IN 
several_JJ ways_NNS :_: through_IN both_DT interactions_NNS that_WDT scatter_VVP and_CC /_SYM or_CC absorb_VV 
radiation_NN and_CC through_IN interactions_NNS with_IN cloud_NN microphysics_NNS and_CC other_JJ 
cloud_NN properties_NNS ,_, or_CC upon_IN deposition_NN on_IN snow_NN or_CC ice_NN covered_VVN surfaces_NNS 
thereby_RB altering_VVG their_PP$ albedo_NN and_CC contributing_VVG to_TO climate_NN feedback_NN ._SENT

(_( PM_NP )_) ,_, and_CC formation_NN of_IN secondary_JJ PM_NP from_IN gaseous_JJ precursors_NNS ._SENT The_DT

imperfect_JJ as_IN aerosols_NNS combine_VVP particles_NNS to_TO create_VV complex_JJ mixtures_NNS ._SENT

Agrobiodiversity_NN ‘The_NN variety_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN animals_NNS ,_, plants_NNS 
and_CC micro-organisms_NNS that_WDT are_VBP used_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB for_IN food_NN 
and_CC agriculture_NN ,_, including_VVG crops_NNS ,_, livestock_NN ,_, forestry_NN and_CC fisheries_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP comprises_VVZ the_DT diversity_NN of_IN genetic_JJ resources_NNS (_( varieties_NNS ,_, breeds_NNS )_) 
and_CC species_NNS used_VVN for_IN food_NN ,_, fodder_NN ,_, fibre_NN ,_, fuel_NN and_CC pharmaceuticals_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP also_RB includes_VVZ the_DT diversity_NN of_IN non-harvested_JJ species_NNS that_DT support_NN 
production_NN (_( soil_NN micro-organisms_NNS ,_, predators_NNS ,_, pollinators_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC those_DT 
in_IN the_DT wider_JJR environment_NN that_IN/that support_NN agro-ecosystems_NNS (_( agricultural_JJ ,_,

(_( FAO_NP ,_, 2005_CD )_) ._SENT

units_NNS as_IN agricultural_JJ crops_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_CC animals_NNS ,_, in_IN some_DT form_NN of_IN spatial_JJ 
arrangement_NN or_CC temporal_JJ sequence_NN ._SENT In_IN agroforestry_NN systems_NNS there_RB 
are_VBP both_DT ecological_JJ and_CC economical_JJ interactions_NNS between_IN the_DT 
different_JJ components_NNS ._SENT Agroforestry_NP can_MD also_RB be_VB defined_VVN as_IN a_DT dynamic_JJ ,_,

landscape_NN ,_, diversifies_VVZ and_CC sustains_VVZ production_NN for_IN increased_VVN social_JJ ,_,

(_( FAO_NP ,_, 2015a_NP )_) ._SENT

of_IN substances_NNS (_( gases_NNS ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) which_WDT have_VHP a_DT direct_JJ (_( primary_JJ

Albedo_NN The_DT proportion_NN of_IN sunlight_NN (_( solar_JJ radiation_NN )_) reflected_VVD by_IN 
a_DT surface_NN or_CC object_NN ,_, often_RB expressed_VVN as_IN a_DT percentage_NN ._SENT Clouds_NNS ,_, snow_NN 
and_CC ice_VVP usually_RB have_VH high_JJ albedo_NN ;_: soil_NN surfaces_VVZ cover_VV the_DT albedo_NN range_NN 
from_IN high_JJ to_TO low_JJ ;_: vegetation_NN in_IN the_DT dry_JJ season_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC in_IN arid_JJ zones_NNS 
can_MD have_VH high_JJ albedo_NN ,_, whereas_IN photosynthetically_RB active_JJ vegetation_NN 
and_CC the_DT ocean_NN have_VHP low_JJ albedo_NN ._SENT The_DT Earth’s_NP planetary_JJ albedo_NN changes_NNS 
mainly_RB through_IN varying_VVG cloudiness_NN ,_, snow_NN ,_, ice_NN ,_, leaf_NN area_NN and_CC land_NN 
cover_NN changes_NNS ._SENT

Anthromes_NP ‘Human_NP systems_NNS ,_, with_IN natural_JJ ecosystems_NNS

use_NN ,_, and_CC comprises_VVZ the_DT following_VVG classes_NNS :_: dense_JJ settlements_NNS ,_, villages_NNS ,_,

Anthropocene_NP A_NP proposed_VVD new_JJ geological_JJ epoch_NN resulting_VVG from_IN 
significant_JJ human-driven_JJ changes_NNS to_TO the_DT structure_NN and_CC functioning_VVG of_IN 
the_DT Earth_NP System_NP ,_, including_VVG the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT Originally_RB proposed_VVN 
in_IN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP science_NN community_NN in_IN 2000_CD ,_, the_DT proposed_VVN new_JJ 
epoch_NN is_VBZ undergoing_VVG a_DT formalisation_NN process_NN within_IN the_DT geological_JJ 
community_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT stratigraphic_JJ evidence_NN that_IN/that human_JJ activities_NNS 
have_VHP changed_VVN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN forming_VVG geological_JJ 
deposits_NNS with_IN a_DT signature_NN that_WDT is_VBZ distinct_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT Holocene_JJ ,_, 
and_CC which_WDT will_MD remain_VV in_IN the_DT geological_JJ record_NN ._SENT Both_CC the_DT stratigraphic_JJ 
and_CC Earth_NP System_NP approaches_VVZ to_TO defining_VVG the_DT Anthropocene_NP consider_VV 
the_DT mid-20th_NN century_NN to_TO be_VB the_DT most_RBS appropriate_JJ starting_VVG date_NN ,_, 
although_IN others_NNS have_VHP been_VBN proposed_VVN and_CC continue_VVP to_TO be_VB discussed_VVN ._SENT 
The_DT Anthropocene_NP concept_NN has_VHZ been_VBN taken_VVN up_RP by_IN a_DT diversity_NN of_IN 
disciplines_NNS and_CC the_DT public_NN to_TO denote_VV the_DT substantive_JJ influence_NN humans_NNS 
have_VHP had_VHN on_IN the_DT state_NN ,_, dynamics_NNS and_CC future_NN of_IN the_DT Earth_NP System_NP ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Holocene_JJ ._SENT 
Anthropogenic_JJ Resulting_NN from_IN or_CC produced_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, and_CC Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS ._SENT 
Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS Emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS 
(_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, precursors_NNS of_IN GHGs_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ activities_NNS ._SENT 
These_DT activities_NNS include_VVP the_DT burning_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, land_NN 
use_NN and_CC land-use_NN changes_NNS (_( LUC_NP )_) ,_, livestock_NN production_NN ,_, fertilisation_NN ,_, 
waste_NN management_NN ,_, and_CC industrial_JJ processes_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ ,_, 
and_CC Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS ._SENT 
Anthropogenic_JJ removals_NNS The_DT withdrawal_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN deliberate_JJ human_NN 
activities_NNS ._SENT These_DT include_VVP enhancing_VVG biological_JJ sinks_NNS of_IN CO2_NP and_CC using_VVG 
chemical_JJ engineering_NN to_TO achieve_VV long_JJ term_NN removal_NN and_CC storage_NN ._SENT 
Carbon_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) from_IN industrial_JJ and_CC energy-related_JJ 
sources_NNS ,_, which_WDT alone_RB does_VVZ not_RB remove_VV CO2_NP from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
can_MD help_VV reduce_VV atmospheric_JJ CO2_NN if_IN it_PP is_VBZ combined_VVN with_IN bioenergy_NN 
production_NN (_( BECCS_NP )_) ._SENT [_SYM Note_NN :_: In_IN the_DT 2006_CD IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP 
GHG_NN Inventories_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP used_VVN in_IN reporting_VVG of_IN emissions_NNS to_TO the_DT 
UNFCCC_NP ,_, '_'' anthropogenic’_JJ land-related_JJ GHG_NP fluxes_NNS are_VBP defined_VVN as_IN all_DT 


those_DT occurring_VVG on_RP '_'' managed_VVN land’_NN ,_, i.e._FW ‘where_RB human_JJ interventions_NNS 
and_CC practices_NNS have_VHP been_VBN applied_VVN to_TO perform_VV production_NN ,_, ecological_JJ or_CC 
social_JJ functions’_NN ._SENT However_RB ,_, some_DT removals_NNS (_( e.g._FW removals_NNS associated_VVN 
with_IN CO2_JJ fertilisation_NN and_CC N_NN deposition_NN )_) are_VBP not_RB considered_VVN as_RB 
‘anthropogenic’_NN ,_, or_CC are_VBP referred_VVN to_TO as_IN ‘indirect’_NN anthropogenic_JJ 
effects_NNS ,_, in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT scientific_JJ literature_NN assessed_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN ._SENT As_RB 
a_DT consequence_NN ,_, the_DT land-related_JJ net_JJ GHG_NP emission_NN estimates_VVZ from_IN 
global_JJ models_NNS included_VVN in_IN this_DT report_NN are_VBP not_RB necessarily_RB directly_RB 
comparable_JJ with_IN LULUCF_NP estimates_NNS in_IN national_JJ GHG_NP Inventories_NNS ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, Bioenergy_NN with_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN

(_( CCS_NP )_) and_CC Land_NP use_NN ,_, Land-use_NN change_NN ,_, and_CC Forestry_NP (_( LULUCF_NP )_) ._SENT 
Aridity_NN The_DT state_NN of_IN a_DT long-term_JJ climatic_JJ feature_NN characterised_VVD 
by_IN low_JJ average_JJ precipitation_NN or_CC available_JJ water_NN in_IN a_DT region_NN ._SENT Aridity_NN 
generally_RB arises_VVZ from_IN widespread_JJ persistent_JJ atmospheric_JJ subsidence_NN 
or_CC anticyclonic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, and_CC from_IN more_RBR localised_VVN subsidence_NN 
in_IN the_DT lee_JJ side_NN of_IN mountains_NNS (_( adapted_VVN from_IN Gbeckor-Kove_NP ,_, 1989_CD ;_: 
Türkeş_NP ,_, 1999_CD )_) ._SENT 
Atmosphere_NN The_DT gaseous_JJ envelope_NN surrounding_VVG the_DT Earth_NN ,_, divided_VVN 
into_IN five_CD layers_NNS —_JJ the_DT troposphere_NN which_WDT contains_VVZ half_NN of_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP 
atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT stratosphere_NN ,_, the_DT mesosphere_NN ,_, the_DT thermosphere_NN ,_, 
and_CC the_DT exosphere_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT outer_JJ limit_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT The_DT 
dry_JJ atmosphere_NN consists_VVZ almost_RB entirely_RB of_IN nitrogen_NN (_( 78.1_CD %_NN volume_NN 
mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC oxygen_NN (_( 20.9_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) ,_, together_RB 
with_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN trace_NN gases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN argon_NN (_( 0.93_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG 
ratio_NN )_) ,_, helium_NN and_CC radiatively_JJ active_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) such_JJ 
as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) (_( 0.04_CD %_NN volume_NN mixing_VVG ratio_NN )_) and_CC ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT 
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN contains_VVZ the_DT GHG_NP water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, 
whose_WP$ amounts_NNS are_VBP highly_RB variable_JJ but_CC typically_RB around_IN 1_CD %_NN volume_NN 
mixing_VVG ratio_NN ._SENT The_DT atmosphere_NN also_RB contains_VVZ clouds_NNS and_CC aerosols_NNS ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ,_, Troposphere_NP ,_, Stratosphere_NP ,_, 
Greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ,_, and_CC Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT

Atmospheric_JJ boundary_NN layer_NN The_DT atmospheric_JJ layer_NN adjacent_NN

surface_NN ,_, and_CC possibly_RB by_IN transport_NN of_IN heat_NN and_CC other_JJ variables_NNS across_IN 
that_DT surface_NN (_( AMS_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT lowest_JJS 100_CD m_NN of_IN the_DT boundary_NN layer_NN 
(_( about_RB 10_CD %_NN of_IN the_DT boundary_NN layer_NN thickness_NN )_) ,_, where_WRB mechanical_JJ 
generation_NN of_IN turbulence_NN is_VBZ dominant_JJ ,_, is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT surface_NN boundary_NN

Baseline_JJ scenario_NN In_IN much_JJ of_IN the_DT literature_NN the_DT term_NN is_VBZ also_RB 
synonymous_JJ with_IN the_DT term_NN business-as-usual_JJ (_( BAU_NP )_) scenario_NN ,_, although_IN 
the_DT term_NN BAU_NP has_VHZ fallen_VVN out_RP of_IN favour_NN because_IN the_DT idea_NN of_IN business_NN 
as_RB usual_JJ in_IN century-long_JJ socio-economic_JJ projections_NNS is_VBZ hard_JJ to_TO 
fathom_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN transformation_NN pathways_NNS ,_, the_DT term_NN baseline_NN 
scenarios_NNS refers_VVZ to_TO scenarios_NNS that_WDT are_VBP based_VVN on_IN the_DT assumption_NN that_RB 
no_DT mitigation_NN policies_NNS or_CC measures_NNS will_MD be_VB implemented_VVN beyond_IN 
those_DT that_WDT are_VBP already_RB in_IN force_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC are_VBP legislated_VVN or_CC planned_VVN to_TO 
be_VB adopted_VVN ._SENT Baseline_NN scenarios_NNS are_VBP not_RB intended_VVN to_TO be_VB predictions_NNS 
of_IN the_DT future_NN ,_, but_CC rather_RB counterfactual_JJ constructions_NNS that_WDT can_MD serve_VV 
to_TO highlight_VV the_DT level_NN of_IN emissions_NNS that_WDT would_MD occur_VV without_IN further_RBR 
policy_NN effort_NN ._SENT Typically_RB ,_, baseline_JJ scenarios_NNS are_VBP then_RB compared_VVN to_TO 
mitigation_NN scenarios_NNS that_WDT are_VBP constructed_VVN to_TO meet_VV different_JJ goals_NNS 
for_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS ,_, atmospheric_JJ concentrations_NNS 
or_CC temperature_NN change_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN baseline_NN scenario_NN is_VBZ often_RB used_VVN 
interchangeably_RB with_IN reference_NN scenario_NN and_CC no_DT policy_NN scenario_NN ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Emission_NP scenario_NN ,_, and_CC Mitigation_NP scenario_NN ._SENT 
Biochar_NP Relatively_NP stable_JJ ,_, carbon-rich_JJ material_NN produced_VVN by_IN 
heating_VVG biomass_NN in_IN an_DT oxygen-limited_JJ environment_NN ._SENT Biochar_NP is_VBZ 
distinguished_VVN from_IN charcoal_NN by_IN its_PP$ application_NN :_: biochar_NN is_VBZ used_VVN as_RB 
a_DT soil_NN amendment_NN with_IN the_DT intention_NN to_TO improve_VV soil_NN functions_NNS and_CC 
to_TO reduce_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS from_IN biomass_NN that_WDT would_MD 
otherwise_RB decompose_VVP rapidly_RB (_( IBI_NP ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT 
Biodiversity_NP Biodiversity_NP or_CC biological_JJ diversity_NN means_VVZ the_DT

other_JJ things_NNS ,_, terrestrial_JJ ,_, marine_JJ and_CC other_JJ aquatic_JJ ecosystems_NNS and_CC the_DT

also_RB Ecosystem_NP ,_, and_CC Ecosystem_NP service_NN ._SENT

Biofuel_NP A_NP fuel_NN ,_, generally_RB in_IN liquid_JJ form_NN ,_, produced_VVN from_IN biomass_NN ._SENT

biodiesel_NN from_IN canola_NN or_CC soybeans_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Biomass_NP ,_, and_CC Bioenergy_NP ._SENT

Traditional_JJ biomass_NN 
The_DT combustion_NN of_IN wood_NN ,_, charcoal_NN ,_, agricultural_JJ residues_NNS and_CC /_SYM or_JJ 
animal_JJ dung_NN for_IN cooking_VVG or_CC heating_VVG in_IN open_JJ fires_NNS or_CC in_IN inefficient_JJ 
stoves_NNS as_RB is_VBZ common_JJ in_IN low-income_JJ countries_NNS ._SENT 
Biome_NN '_POS Global-scale_NP zones_NNS ,_, generally_RB defined_VVN by_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN plant_NN 
life_NN that_IN/that they_PP support_VVP in_IN response_NN to_TO average_JJ rainfall_NN and_CC temperature_NN 
patterns_NNS ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, tundra_NN ,_, coral_JJ reefs_NNS or_CC savannas’_JJ (_( IPBES_NP ,_, 2019_CD )_) ._SENT 
Biophysical_JJ effects_NNS The_DT range_NN of_IN physical_JJ processes_NNS through_RB 
which_WDT land_NN affects_VVZ climate_NN ._SENT These_DT processes_NNS include_VVP changes_NNS in_IN 
hydrology_NN (_( e.g._FW water_NN vapor_NN fluxes_NNS at_IN the_DT land_NN /_SYM atmosphere_NN interface_NN )_) ,_, 
heat_NN exchanges_NNS via_IN convective_JJ fluxes_NNS (_( latent_JJ and_CC sensible_JJ )_) ,_, radiation_NN 
(_( solar_JJ and_CC infra-red_JJ ,_, absorbed_VVN and_CC emitted_VVN )_) ,_, and_CC momentum_NN (_( e.g._FW 
affecting_VVG wind_NN speed_NN )_) ._SENT 

Glossary_NN Annex_NN I_PP 
AI_VVP 
Black_JJ carbon_NN (_( BC_NP )_) A_DT relatively_RB pure_JJ form_NN of_IN carbon_NN ,_, also_RB known_VVN 
as_IN soot_NN ,_, arising_VVG from_IN the_DT incomplete_JJ combustion_NN of_IN fossil_JJ fuels_NNS ,_, 
biofuel_NN ,_, and_CC biomass_NN ._SENT It_PP stays_VVZ in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN only_RB for_IN days_NNS or_CC 
weeks_NNS ._SENT Black_JJ carbon_NN is_VBZ a_DT climate_NN forcing_VVG agent_NN with_IN strong_JJ warming_NN 
effect_NN ,_, both_CC in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC when_WRB deposited_VVN on_IN snow_NN or_CC ice_NN ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC Aerosol_NP ._SENT 
Blue_JJ carbon_NN All_DT biologically-driven_JJ carbon_NN fluxes_NNS and_CC storage_NN 
in_IN marine_JJ systems_NNS that_WDT are_VBP amenable_JJ to_TO management_NN can_MD be_VB 
considered_VVN as_IN blue_JJ carbon_NN ._SENT Coastal_JJ blue_JJ carbon_NN focuses_VVZ on_IN rooted_VVN 
vegetation_NN in_IN the_DT coastal_JJ zone_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN tidal_JJ marshes_NNS ,_, mangroves_NNS and_CC 
seagrasses_NNS ._SENT These_DT ecosystems_NNS have_VHP high_JJ carbon_NN burial_NN rates_NNS on_IN a_DT per_FW 
unit_NN area_NN basis_NN and_CC accumulate_VVP carbon_NN in_IN their_PP$ soils_NNS and_CC sediments_NNS ._SENT 
They_PP provide_VVP many_JJ non-climatic_JJ benefits_NNS and_CC can_MD contribute_VV to_TO 
ecosystem-based_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT If_IN degraded_VVN or_CC lost_VVN ,_, coastal_JJ blue_JJ carbon_NN 
ecosystems_NNS are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO release_VV most_JJS of_IN their_PP$ carbon_NN back_RB to_TO the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ current_JJ debate_NN regarding_VVG the_DT application_NN of_IN the_DT 
blue_JJ carbon_NN concept_NN to_TO other_JJ coastal_JJ and_CC non-coastal_JJ processes_NNS and_CC 
ecosystems_NNS ,_, including_VVG the_DT open_JJ ocean_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Ecosystem_NP services_NNS ,_, 
and_CC Carbon_NP sequestration_NN ._SENT

Carbon_NN budget_NN Refers_NNS to_TO three_CD concepts_NNS in_IN the_DT literature_NN :_: 
(_( 1_LS )_) an_DT assessment_NN of_IN carbon_NN cycle_NN sources_NNS and_CC sinks_NNS on_IN a_DT global_JJ 
level_NN ,_, through_IN the_DT synthesis_NN of_IN evidence_NN for_IN fossil-fuel_NN and_CC cement_NN 
emissions_NNS ,_, land-use_NN change_NN emissions_NNS ,_, ocean_NN and_CC land_NN CO2_NN sinks_VVZ ,_, 
and_CC the_DT resulting_VVG atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) growth_NN rate_NN ._SENT 
This_DT is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT global_JJ carbon_NN budget_NN ;_: (_( 2_LS )_) the_DT estimated_JJ 
cumulative_JJ amount_NN of_IN global_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emissions_NNS that_IN/that that_DT is_VBZ 
estimated_VVN to_TO limit_VV global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN to_TO a_DT given_VVN level_NN above_RB 
a_DT reference_NN period_NN ,_, taking_VVG into_IN account_NN global_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
contributions_NNS of_IN other_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC climate_NN forcers_NNS ;_: 
(_( 3_LS )_) the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT carbon_NN budget_NN defined_VVN under_IN (_( 2_LS )_) to_TO the_DT 
regional_JJ ,_, national_JJ ,_, or_CC sub-national_JJ level_NN based_VVN on_IN considerations_NNS of_IN 
equity_NN ,_, costs_NNS or_CC efficiency_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Remaining_VVG carbon_NN budget_NN ._SENT 
Carbon_NN cycle_NN The_DT flow_NN of_IN carbon_NN (_( in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, e.g._FW ,_, as_IN carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, carbon_NN in_IN biomass_NN ,_, and_CC carbon_NN dissolved_VVN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN 
as_IN carbonate_NN and_CC bicarbonate_NN )_) through_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, hydrosphere_NN ,_, 
terrestrial_JJ and_CC marine_JJ biosphere_NN and_CC lithosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, the_DT 
reference_NN unit_NN for_IN the_DT global_JJ carbon_NN cycle_NN is_VBZ GtCO2_NP or_CC GtC_NP (_( one_CD 
Gigatonne_NN =_SYM 1_CD Gt_NP =_SYM 1015_CD grams_NNS ;_: 1GtC_NP corresponds_VVZ to_TO 3.667_CD GtCO2_NN )_) ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) A_DT naturally_RB occurring_VVG gas_NN ,_, CO2_NP is_VBZ also_RB a_DT byproduct_NN 
of_IN burning_VVG fossil_JJ fuels_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN oil_NN ,_, gas_NN and_CC coal_NN )_) ,_, of_IN burning_NN 
biomass_NN ,_, of_IN land-use_NN changes_NNS (_( LUC_NP )_) and_CC of_IN industrial_JJ processes_NNS (_( e.g._FW ,_, 
cement_NN production_NN )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
(_( GHG_NP )_) that_WDT affects_VVZ the_DT Earth’s_NP radiative_JJ balance_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ the_DT reference_NN gas_NN 
against_IN which_WDT other_JJ GHGs_NNS are_VBP measured_VVN and_CC therefore_RB has_VHZ a_DT Global_NP 
Warming_VVG Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) of_IN 1._CD See_NP also_RB Greenhouse_NP gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) ,_, Land_NP 
use_NN ,_, and_CC Land-use_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) A_DT process_NN in_IN 
which_WDT a_DT relatively_RB pure_JJ stream_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN industrial_JJ 
and_CC energy-related_JJ sources_NNS is_VBZ separated_JJ (_( captured_VVN )_) ,_, conditioned_VVN ,_, 
compressed_VVN and_CC transported_VVN to_TO a_DT storage_NN location_NN for_IN long-term_JJ 
isolation_NN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT Sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Carbon_NP 
Capture_NN and_CC Storage_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN 
(_( CCU_NP )_) ,_, Bioenergy_NN with_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( BECCS_NP )_) ,_, 
and_CC Sequestration_NP ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN (_( CCU_NP )_) A_DT process_NN in_IN 
which_WDT carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) is_VBZ captured_VVN and_CC then_RB used_VVN to_TO produce_VV a_DT 
new_JJ product_NN ._SENT If_IN the_DT CO2_NP is_VBZ stored_VVN in_IN a_DT product_NN for_IN a_DT climate-relevant_NN 
time_NN horizon_NN ,_, this_DT is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN ,_, utilisation_NN 
and_CC storage_NN (_( CCUS_NP )_) ._SENT Only_RB then_RB ,_, and_CC only_RB combined_VVN with_IN CO2_NP recently_RB 
removed_VVN from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, can_MD CCUS_NP lead_VV to_TO carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
removal_NN ._SENT CCU_NP is_VBZ sometimes_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_NP 
use_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Carbon_NP dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCS_NP )_) ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN ,_, utilisation_NN and_CC storage_NN (_( CCUS_NP )_) See_NP 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN capture_NN and_CC utilisation_NN (_( CCU_NP )_) ._SENT 
Carbon_NN dioxide_NN removal_NN (_( CDR_NP )_) Anthropogenic_JJ activities_NNS 
removing_VVG carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) from_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC durably_RB 
storing_VVG it_PP in_IN geological_JJ ,_, terrestrial_JJ ,_, or_CC ocean_NN reservoirs_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN products_NNS ._SENT 
It_PP includes_VVZ existing_JJ and_CC potential_JJ anthropogenic_JJ enhancement_NN of_IN 
biological_JJ or_CC geochemical_JJ sinks_NNS and_CC direct_JJ air_NN capture_NN and_CC storage_NN ,_, 
but_CC excludes_VVZ natural_JJ CO2_NP uptake_NN not_RB directly_RB caused_VVN by_IN human_JJ 
activities_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Mitigation_NN (_( of_IN climate-change_NN )_) ,_, Greenhouse_NP gas_NN 
removal_NN (_( GGR_NP )_) ,_, Negative_JJ emission_NN technologies_NNS ,_, and_CC Sink_NP ._SENT 
Carbon_NN intensity_NN The_DT amount_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN

Climate_NN Climate_NN in_IN a_DT narrow_JJ sense_NN is_VBZ usually_RB defined_VVN as_IN the_DT 
average_JJ weather_NN ,_, or_CC more_RBR rigorously_RB ,_, as_IN the_DT statistical_JJ description_NN in_IN 
terms_NNS of_IN the_DT mean_NN and_CC variability_NN of_IN relevant_JJ quantities_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN 


of_IN time_NN ranging_VVG from_IN months_NNS to_TO thousands_NNS or_CC millions_NNS of_IN years_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
classical_JJ period_NN for_IN averaging_VVG these_DT variables_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD years_NNS ,_, as_RB defined_VVN 
by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP ._SENT The_DT relevant_JJ quantities_NNS 
are_VBP most_RBS often_RB surface_VV variables_NNS such_JJ as_IN temperature_NN ,_, precipitation_NN 
and_CC wind_NN ._SENT Climate_NN in_IN a_DT wider_JJR sense_NN is_VBZ the_DT state_NN ,_, including_VVG a_DT statistical_JJ 
description_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT 
climate-change_NN A_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB 
identified_VVN (_( e.g._FW ,_, by_IN using_VVG statistical_JJ tests_NNS )_) by_IN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ and_CC /_SYM 
or_CC the_DT variability_NN of_IN its_PP$ properties_NNS and_CC that_WDT persists_VVZ for_IN an_DT extended_JJ 
period_NN ,_, typically_RB decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ._SENT climate-change_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO 
natural_JJ internal_JJ processes_NNS or_CC external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN modulations_NNS 
of_IN the_DT solar_JJ cycles_NNS ,_, volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS and_CC persistent_JJ anthropogenic_JJ 
changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC in_IN land_NN use_NN ._SENT Note_NN 
that_IN/that the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) ,_, in_IN its_PP$ Article_NP 1_CD ,_, defines_VVZ climate-change_NN as_RB :_: ‘a_NN change_NN of_IN 
climate_NN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB to_TO human_JJ activity_NN 
that_IN/that alters_VVZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ atmosphere_NN and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ 
in_IN addition_NN to_TO natural_JJ climate_NN variability_NN observed_VVD over_RB comparable_JJ 
time_NN periods’_NN ._SENT The_DT UNFCCC_NP thus_RB makes_VVZ a_DT distinction_NN between_IN climate_NN 
change_NN attributable_JJ to_TO human_JJ activities_NNS altering_VVG the_DT atmospheric_JJ 
composition_NN and_CC climate_NN variability_NN attributable_JJ to_TO natural_JJ causes_NNS ._SENT

Climate_NN extreme_NN (_( extreme_JJ weather_NN or_CC climate_NN event_NN )_) The_NP

below_RB )_) a_DT threshold_NN value_NN near_IN the_DT upper_JJ (_( or_CC lower_VV )_) ends_VVZ of_IN the_DT 
range_NN of_IN observed_JJ values_NNS of_IN the_DT variable_NN ._SENT For_IN simplicity_NN ,_, both_DT extreme_NN

Climate_NN feedback_NN An_DT interaction_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT perturbation_NN in_IN 
one_CD climate_NN quantity_NN causes_VVZ a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT second_JJ and_CC the_DT change_NN 
in_IN the_DT second_JJ quantity_NN ultimately_RB leads_VVZ to_TO an_DT additional_JJ change_NN in_IN 
the_DT first_JJ ._SENT A_DT negative_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN 
is_VBZ weakened_VVN by_IN the_DT changes_NNS it_PP causes_VVZ ;_: a_DT positive_JJ feedback_NN is_VBZ one_CD in_IN 
which_WDT the_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN is_VBZ enhanced_VVN ._SENT The_DT initial_JJ perturbation_NN 
can_MD either_RB be_VB externally_RB forced_VVN or_CC arise_VV as_IN part_NN of_IN internal_JJ variability_NN ._SENT

Climate_NN model_NN A_DT numerical_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN

level_NN at_IN which_WDT empirical_JJ parametrizations_NNS are_VBP involved_VVN ._SENT There_EX is_VBZ an_DT 
evolution_NN towards_IN more_JJR complex_JJ models_NNS with_IN interactive_JJ chemistry_NN 
and_CC biology_NN ._SENT Climate_NN models_NNS are_VBP applied_VVN as_IN a_DT research_NN tool_NN to_TO study_VV

Climate_NN projection_NN Simulated_JJ response_NN of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN

technological_JJ developments_NNS that_WDT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB be_VB realised_VVN ._SENT 
Climate-resilient_JJ development_NN pathways_NNS (_( CRDPs_NP )_) 
Trajectories_NNS that_WDT strengthen_VVP sustainable_JJ development_NN and_CC efforts_NNS to_TO

cross-scalar_JJ adaptation_NN to_TO and_CC resilience_NN in_IN a_DT changing_VVG climate_NN ._SENT They_PP 
raise_VV the_DT ethics_NNS ,_, equity_NN ,_, and_CC feasibility_NN aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT deep_RB societal_JJ 
transformation_NN needed_VVD to_TO drastically_RB reduce_VV emissions_NNS to_TO limit_VV global_JJ 
warming_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, to_TO 2_CD °_SYM C_NP )_) and_CC achieve_VV desirable_JJ and_CC liveable_JJ futures_NNS and_CC 
well-being_NN for_IN all_DT ._SENT

Equilibrium_NN climate_NN sensitivity_NN 
An_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN response_NN to_TO 
a_DT doubling_NN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) concentration_NN 
that_WDT is_VBZ evaluated_VVN from_IN model_NN output_NN or_CC observations_NNS for_IN evolving_VVG 
non-equilibrium_NN conditions_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strengths_NNS of_IN the_DT 
climate_NN feedbacks_NNS at_IN a_DT particular_JJ time_NN and_CC may_MD vary_VV with_IN forcing_VVG 
history_NN and_CC climate_NN state_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB may_MD differ_VV from_IN equilibrium_NN 
climate_NN sensitivity_NN ._SENT 
Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN

a_DT 20-year_JJ period_NN ,_, centred_VVN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN 
(_( CO2_NP )_) doubling_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT climate_NN model_NN simulation_NN in_IN which_WDT CO2_NP increases_VVZ 
at_IN 1_CD %_NN yr_NN –_NN 1_CD from_IN pre-industrial_JJ ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN 
climate_NN feedbacks_NNS and_CC the_DT timescale_NN of_IN ocean_NN heat_NN uptake_NN ._SENT

(_( GMST_NP )_) ._SENT

climate-system_NN The_DT system_NN consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: 
the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT lithosphere_NN and_CC 
the_DT biosphere_NN and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN 
evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS 
and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ 
variations_NNS ,_, orbital_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT 
changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land-use_NN change_NN ._SENT 
Climate_NN target_NN A_DT temperature_NN limit_NN ,_, concentration_NN level_NN ,_,

example_NN ,_, national_JJ climate_NN targets_NNS may_MD aim_VV to_TO reduce_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN

those_DT under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT 
Climate_NN variability_NN Variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ 
statistics_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN standard_JJ deviations_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN extremes_NNS ,_, 
etc._FW )_) of_IN the_DT climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_DT 
of_IN individual_JJ weather_NN events_NNS ._SENT Variability_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO natural_JJ 
internal_JJ processes_NNS within_IN the_DT climate-system_NN (_( internal_JJ variability_NN )_) ,_, or_CC 
to_TO variations_NNS in_IN natural_JJ or_CC anthropogenic_JJ external_JJ forcing_JJ (_( external_JJ 
variability_NN )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ._SENT 
CO2_JJ equivalent_NN (_( CO2-eq_NP )_) emission_NN The_DT amount_NN of_IN carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) emission_NN that_WDT would_MD cause_VV the_DT same_JJ integrated_JJ 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG or_CC temperature_NN change_NN ,_, over_IN a_DT given_VVN time_NN horizon_NN ,_, as_RB 
an_DT emitted_VVN amount_NN of_IN a_DT greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) or_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN GHGs_NP ._SENT 
There_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN ways_NNS to_TO compute_VV such_JJ equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS 
and_CC choose_VV appropriate_JJ time_NN horizons_NNS ._SENT Most_RBS typically_RB ,_, the_DT CO2-_NP 
equivalent_JJ emission_NN is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN multiplying_VVG the_DT emission_NN of_IN a_DT GHG_NP 
by_IN its_PP$ Global_JJ Warming_JJ Potential_JJ (_( GWP_NP )_) for_IN a_DT 100_CD year_NN time_NN horizon_NN ._SENT 
For_IN a_DT mix_NN of_IN GHGs_NP it_PP is_VBZ obtained_VVN by_IN summing_VVG the_DT CO2-equivalent_NP 
emissions_NNS of_IN each_DT gas_NN ._SENT CO2-equivalent_JJ emission_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ scale_NN 
for_IN comparing_VVG emissions_NNS of_IN different_JJ GHGs_NNS but_CC does_VVZ not_RB imply_VV 
equivalence_NN of_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ climate-change_NN responses_NNS ._SENT There_RB 
is_VBZ generally_RB no_DT connection_NN between_IN CO2-equivalent_JJ emissions_NNS and_CC 
resulting_VVG CO2-equivalent_JJ concentrations_NNS ._SENT 
CO2_JJ fertilisation_NN The_DT enhancement_NN of_IN plant_NN growth_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN

water_NN availability_NN ._SENT 
Co-benefits_NP The_DT positive_JJ effects_NNS that_IN/that a_DT policy_NN or_CC measure_NN aimed_VVN 
at_IN one_CD objective_NN might_MD have_VH on_IN other_JJ objectives_NNS ,_, thereby_RB increasing_VVG 
the_DT total_JJ benefits_NNS for_IN society_NN or_CC the_DT environment_NN ._SENT Co-benefits_NNS are_VBP 
often_RB subject_JJ to_TO uncertainty_NN and_CC depend_VV on_IN local_JJ circumstances_NNS 
and_CC implementation_NN practices_NNS ,_, among_IN other_JJ factors_NNS ._SENT Co-benefits_NNS are_VBP 
also_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN ancillary_JJ benefits_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB Adverse_JJ side-effects_NNS ,_, 
and_CC Risk_NP ._SENT

Confidence_NN The_DT robustness_NN of_IN a_DT finding_NN based_VVN on_IN the_DT type_NN ,_, 
amount_NN ,_, quality_NN and_CC consistency_NN of_IN evidence_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, mechanistic_JJ 
understanding_NN ,_, theory_NN ,_, data_NNS ,_, models_NNS ,_, expert_NN judgment_NN )_) and_CC on_IN the_DT 
degree_NN of_IN agreement_NN across_IN multiple_JJ lines_NNS of_IN evidence_NN ._SENT In_IN this_DT report_NN ,_, 
confidence_NN is_VBZ expressed_VVN qualitatively_RB (_( Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Likelihood_NP ,_, and_CC Uncertainty_NN ._SENT 
Convection_NN Vertical_JJ motion_NN driven_VVN by_IN buoyancy_NN forces_NNS arising_VVG 
from_IN static_JJ instability_NN ,_, usually_RB caused_VVN by_IN near-surface_NN cooling_VVG or_CC 
increases_NNS in_IN salinity_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN and_CC near-surface_NN warming_NN 
or_CC cloud-top_JJ radiative_JJ cooling_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
atmosphere_NN ,_, convection_NN gives_VVZ rise_NN to_TO cumulus_NN clouds_NNS and_CC precipitation_NN 
and_CC is_VBZ effective_JJ at_IN both_DT scavenging_VVG and_CC vertically_RB transporting_VVG 
chemical_NN species_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, convection_NN can_MD carry_VV surface_NN waters_NNS 
to_TO deep_JJ within_IN the_DT ocean_NN ._SENT 
Coping_VVG capacity_NN The_DT ability_NN of_IN people_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, organisations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC systems_NNS ,_, using_VVG available_JJ skills_NNS ,_, values_NNS ,_, beliefs_NNS ,_, resources_NNS ,_, and_NP

in_IN the_DT short_JJ to_TO medium_JJ term_NN ._SENT (_( UNISDR_NP ,_, 2009_CD ;_: IPCC_NP ,_, 2012a_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Resilience_NP ._SENT 
Cost-benefit_JJ analysis_NN Monetary_NP assessment_NN of_IN all_DT negative_JJ 
and_CC positive_JJ impacts_NNS associated_VVN with_IN a_DT given_VVN action_NN ._SENT Cost-benefit_JJ 
analysis_NN enables_VVZ comparison_NN of_IN different_JJ interventions_NNS ,_, investments_NNS 
or_CC strategies_NNS and_CC reveal_VV how_WRB a_DT given_VVN investment_NN or_CC policy_NN effort_NN pays_VVZ 
off_RB for_IN a_DT particular_JJ person_NN ,_, company_NN or_CC country_NN ._SENT Cost-benefit_JJ analyses_NNS 
representing_VVG society’s_NN point_NN of_IN view_NN are_VBP important_JJ for_IN climate_NN 
change_NN decision_NN making_VVG ,_, but_CC there_EX are_VBP difficulties_NNS in_IN aggregating_VVG 
costs_NNS and_CC benefits_NNS across_IN different_JJ actors_NNS and_CC across_IN timescales_NNS ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Discounting_NP ._SENT 
Cost-effectiveness_NN A_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT cost_NN at_IN which_WDT a_DT policy_NN 
goal_NN or_CC outcome_NN is_VBZ achieved_VVN ._SENT The_DT lower_JJR the_DT cost_NN the_DT greater_JJR the_DT 
cost_NN effectiveness_NN ._SENT 
Coupled_VVN Model_NP Intercomparison_NP Project_NP (_( CMIP_NP )_) A_DT climate_NN 
modelling_VVG activity_NN from_IN the_DT World_NP Climate_NN Research_NP Programme_NP 
(_( WCRP_NP )_) which_WDT coordinates_VVZ and_CC archives_NN climate_NN model_NN simulations_NNS

Downscaling_NP Method_NP that_WDT derives_VVZ local-_NN to_TO regional-scale_VV (_( up_RB to_TO 
km_NN )_) information_NN from_IN larger-scale_JJ models_NNS or_CC data_NNS analyses_NNS ._SENT Two_CD

downscaling_NN ._SENT The_DT dynamical_JJ method_NN uses_VVZ the_DT output_NN of_IN regional_JJ 
climate_NN models_NNS ,_, global_JJ models_NNS with_IN variable_JJ spatial_JJ resolution_NN ,_, or_CC 
high-resolution_NN global_JJ models_NNS ._SENT The_DT empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ methods_NNS [_SYM are_VBP 
based_VVN on_IN observations_NNS and_CC ]_SYM develop_VV statistical_JJ relationships_NNS that_DT link_NN 
the_DT large-scale_JJ atmospheric_JJ variables_NNS with_IN local_NN /_SYM regional_JJ climate_NN 
variables_NNS ._SENT In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT driving_VVG model_NN remains_VVZ an_DT 
important_JJ limitation_NN on_IN quality_NN of_IN the_DT downscaled_JJ information_NN ._SENT The_DT 
two_CD methods_NNS can_MD be_VB combined_VVN ,_, e.g._FW ,_, applying_VVG empirical_JJ /_SYM statistical_JJ 
downscaling_VVG to_TO the_DT output_NN of_IN a_DT regional_JJ climate_NN model_NN ,_, consisting_VVG of_IN 
a_DT dynamical_JJ downscaling_NN of_IN a_DT global_JJ climate_NN model_NN ._SENT

Drought_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN abnormally_RB dry_JJ weather_NN long_RB enough_RB 
to_TO cause_VV a_DT serious_JJ hydrological_JJ imbalance_NN ._SENT Drought_NN is_VBZ a_DT relative_NN 
term_NN ,_, therefore_RB any_DT discussion_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN precipitation_NN deficit_NN 
must_MD refer_VV to_TO the_DT particular_JJ precipitation-related_JJ activity_NN that_WDT is_VBZ 
under_IN discussion_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, shortage_NN of_IN precipitation_NN during_IN the_DT 
growing_VVG season_NN impinges_VVZ on_IN crop_NN production_NN or_CC ecosystem_NN function_NN 
in_IN general_JJ (_( due_JJ to_TO soil_VV moisture_NN drought_NN ,_, also_RB termed_VVD agricultural_JJ 
drought_NN )_) ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT runoff_NN and_CC percolation_NN season_NN primarily_RB 
affects_VVZ water_NN supplies_NNS (_( hydrological_JJ drought_NN )_) ._SENT Storage_NN changes_NNS in_IN 
soil_NN moisture_NN and_CC groundwater_NN are_VBP also_RB affected_VVN by_IN increases_NNS in_IN 
actual_JJ evapotranspiration_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO reductions_NNS in_IN precipitation_NN ._SENT

a_DT meteorological_JJ drought_NN ._SENT

or_CC loss_NN ._SENT Dependent_JJ upon_IN context_NN ,_, EWS_NNS may_MD draw_VV upon_IN scientific_JJ and_CC /_SYM

applications_NNS e.g._FW ,_, conservation_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT organisation_NN itself_PP is_VBZ not_RB

(_( an_DT example_NN is_VBZ coral_JJ bleaching_VVG alerts_NNS )_) ,_, in_IN agriculture_NN (_( for_IN example_NN ,_,

Ecosystem_NN A_DT functional_JJ unit_NN consisting_VVG of_IN living_VVG organisms_NNS ,_, their_PP$ 
non-living_JJ environment_NN and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS within_IN and_CC between_IN 
them_PP ._SENT The_DT components_NNS included_VVD in_IN a_DT given_VVN ecosystem_NN and_CC its_PP$ spatial_JJ 
boundaries_NNS depend_VVP on_IN the_DT purpose_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT ecosystem_NN is_VBZ 
defined_VVN :_: in_IN some_DT cases_NNS they_PP are_VBP relatively_RB sharp_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS they_PP 
are_VBP diffuse_JJ ._SENT Ecosystem_NN boundaries_NNS can_MD change_VV over_IN time_NN ._SENT Ecosystems_NNS

very_RB small_JJ to_TO the_DT entire_JJ biosphere_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT current_JJ era_NN ,_, most_JJS ecosystems_NNS 
either_CC contain_VV people_NNS as_IN key_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, or_CC are_VBP influenced_VVN by_IN the_DT effects_NNS 
of_IN human_JJ activities_NNS in_IN their_PP$ environment_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Ecosystem_NP services_NNS ._SENT

El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) The_DT term_NN El_NP Niño_NP was_VBD 
initially_RB used_VVN to_TO describe_VV a_DT warm-water_NN current_NN that_WDT periodically_RB flows_VVZ 
along_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Ecuador_NP and_CC Peru_NP ,_, disrupting_VVG the_DT local_JJ fishery_NN ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ 
since_IN become_VVN identified_VVN with_IN warming_NN of_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP Ocean_NP 
east_RB of_IN the_DT dateline_NN ._SENT This_DT oceanic_JJ event_NN is_VBZ associated_VVN with_IN a_DT fluctuation_NN 
of_IN a_DT global-scale_JJ tropical_JJ and_CC subtropical_JJ surface_NN pressure_NN pattern_NN 
called_VVN the_DT Southern_NP Oscillation_NP ._SENT This_DT coupled_VVN atmosphere_NN –_NN ocean_NN 
phenomenon_NN ,_, with_IN preferred_JJ time_NN scales_NNS of_IN two_CD to_TO about_RB seven_CD 
years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN the_DT El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP (_( ENSO_NP )_) ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ often_RB 
measured_VVN by_IN the_DT surface_NN pressure_NN anomaly_NN difference_NN between_IN Tahiti_NP 
and_CC Darwin_NP and_NP /_SYM or_CC the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT central_JJ and_NP 
eastern_JJ equatorial_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT During_IN an_DT ENSO_NP event_NN ,_, the_DT prevailing_JJ trade_NN 
winds_NNS weaken_VVP ,_, reducing_VVG upwelling_NN and_CC altering_VVG ocean_NN currents_NNS such_JJ 
that_IN/that the_DT sea_NN surface_NN temperatures_NNS warm_JJ ,_, further_RBR weakening_VVG the_DT trade_NN 
winds_NNS ._SENT This_DT phenomenon_NN has_VHZ a_DT great_JJ impact_NN on_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_, sea_NN surface_NN 
temperature_NN and_CC precipitation_NN patterns_NNS in_IN the_DT tropical_JJ Pacific_NP ._SENT It_PP has_VHZ 
climatic_JJ effects_NNS throughout_IN the_DT Pacific_NP region_NN and_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS 
of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, through_IN global_JJ teleconnections_NNS ._SENT The_DT cold_JJ phase_NN of_IN ENSO_NP 
is_VBZ called_VVN La_NP Niña_NP ._SENT 
Embodied_VVN (_( embedded_VVN )_) [_SYM emissions_NNS ,_, water_NN ,_, land_NN ]_SYM The_DT total_NN 
emissions_NNS [_SYM water_NN use_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ]_SYM generated_VVN [_SYM used_VVN ]_SYM in_IN the_DT production_NN 
of_IN goods_NNS and_CC services_NNS regardless_RB of_IN the_DT location_NN and_CC timing_NN of_IN those_DT 
emissions_NNS [_SYM water_NN use_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ]_SYM in_IN the_DT production_NN process_NN ._SENT This_DT 
includes_VVZ emissions_NNS [_SYM water_NN use_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ]_SYM within_IN the_DT country_NN used_VVD 
to_TO produce_VV goods_NNS or_CC services_NNS for_IN the_DT country’s_JJ own_JJ use_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB 
includes_VVZ the_DT emissions_NNS [_SYM water_NN use_NN ,_, land_NN use_NN ]_SYM related_VVN to_TO the_DT production_NN 
of_IN such_JJ goods_NNS or_CC services_NNS in_IN other_JJ countries_NNS that_WDT are_VBP then_RB consumed_VVN 
in_IN another_DT country_NN through_IN imports_NNS ._SENT Such_JJ emissions_NNS [_SYM water_NN ,_, land_NN ]_SYM 
are_VBP termed_VVN ‘embodied’_JJ or_CC ‘embedded’_JJ emissions_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS 
(_( particularly_RB with_IN water_NN )_) as_IN ‘virtual_JJ water_NN use’_NN (_( David_NP and_CC Caldeira_NP ,_, 
;_: Allan_NP ,_, 2005_CD ;_: MacDonald_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2015_CD )_) ._SENT 
Emission_NN scenario_NN A_DT plausible_JJ representation_NN of_IN the_DT future_NN 
development_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN substances_NNS that_WDT are_VBP radiatively_RB active_JJ 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, aerosols_NNS )_) based_VVN on_IN a_DT coherent_JJ and_NP 
internally_RB consistent_JJ set_NN of_IN assumptions_NNS about_IN driving_JJ forces_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN 
demographic_JJ and_CC socio-economic_JJ development_NN ,_, technological_JJ change_NN ,_, 
energy_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN )_) and_CC their_PP$ key_JJ relationships_NNS ._SENT Concentration_NN 
scenarios_NNS ,_, derived_VVN from_IN emission_NN scenarios_NNS ,_, are_VBP often_RB used_VVN as_RB 
input_NN to_TO a_DT climate_NN model_NN to_TO compute_VV climate_NN projections_NNS ._SENT See_VV also_RB

Energy_NN efficiency_NN The_DT ratio_NN of_IN output_NN or_CC useful_JJ energy_NN or_CC energy_NN

input_NN ._SENT Most_RBS commonly_RB energy_NN efficiency_NN is_VBZ measured_VVN as_IN input_NN energy_NN

for_IN vehicles_NNS as_IN km_NN liter_NN –_NN 1or_JJ liter_NN km_NN –_JJ 1._CD Very_JJ often_RB in_IN policy_NN ‘energy_NN

efficient_JJ appliances_NNS ,_, efficient_JJ lighting_NN ,_, efficient_JJ vehicles_NNS ,_, etc._FW

(_( Model_NN )_) Ensemble_NP A_NP group_NN of_IN parallel_JJ model_NN simulations_NNS

variability_NN ,_, whereas_IN multi-model_JJ ensembles_NNS including_VVG simulations_NNS

Food_NN loss_NN and_CC waste_NN ‘The_NNS decrease_VVP in_IN quantity_NN or_CC quality_NN

Food_NN security_NN A_DT situation_NN that_WDT exists_VVZ when_WRB all_DT people_NNS ,_, at_IN all_DT times_NNS ,_,

privileged_VVN the_DT supply_NN of_IN calories_NNS (_( energy_NN )_) ,_, especially_RB to_TO the_DT hungry_JJ ._SENT

Glacier_NP A_DT perennial_JJ mass_NN of_IN ice_NN ,_, and_CC possibly_RB firn_NN and_CC snow_NN ,_, 
originating_VVG on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN by_IN the_DT recrystallisation_NN of_IN snow_NN and_CC

to_TO as_IN ice_NN sheets_NNS ._SENT

Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN (_( GMST_NP )_) Estimated_JJ

specified_JJ reference_NN period_NN ._SENT When_WRB estimating_VVG changes_NNS in_IN GMST_NP ,_, nearsurface_NN 
air_NN temperature_NN over_IN both_DT land_NN and_CC oceans_NNS are_VBP also_RB used_VVN ._SENT See_VV

temperature_NN ,_, and_CC Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) ._SENT 


Global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN (_( GSAT_NP )_) Global_JJ average_NN

surface_NN temperature_NN (_( GMST_NP )_) ,_, and_CC Land_NP surface_NN air_NN temperature_NN ._SENT 
Global_JJ warming_NN An_DT increase_NN in_IN global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperature_NN 
(_( GMST_NP )_) averaged_VVD over_IN a_DT 30-year_JJ period_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT 30-year_JJ period_NN centred_VVD 
on_IN a_DT particular_JJ year_NN or_CC decade_NN ,_, expressed_VVD relative_JJ to_TO pre-industrial_JJ 
levels_NNS unless_IN otherwise_RB specified_VVN ._SENT For_IN 30-year_JJ periods_NNS that_WDT span_VVP past_JJ 
and_CC future_JJ years_NNS ,_, the_DT current_JJ multi-decadal_JJ warming_NN trend_NN is_VBZ assumed_VVN 
to_TO continue_VV ._SENT See_VV also_RB climate-change_NN ,_, and_CC Climate_NN variability_NN ._SENT 
Governance_NN A_DT comprehensive_JJ and_CC inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN the_DT full_JJ 
range_NN of_IN means_NNS for_IN deciding_VVG ,_, managing_VVG ,_, implementing_VVG and_CC monitoring_VVG 
policies_NNS and_CC measures_NNS ._SENT Whereas_IN government_NN is_VBZ defined_VVN strictly_RB in_IN 
terms_NNS of_IN the_DT nation-state_NN ,_, the_DT more_RBR inclusive_JJ concept_NN of_IN governance_NN 
recognises_VVZ the_DT contributions_NNS of_IN various_JJ levels_NNS of_IN government_NN (_( global_JJ ,_, 
international_JJ ,_, regional_JJ ,_, sub-national_JJ and_CC local_JJ )_) and_CC the_DT contributing_VVG

Greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) Gaseous_NP constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
both_DT natural_JJ and_CC anthropogenic_JJ ,_, that_WDT absorb_VVP and_CC emit_VVP radiation_NN at_IN 
specific_JJ wavelengths_NNS within_IN the_DT spectrum_NN of_IN terrestrial_JJ radiation_NN 
emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN itself_PP ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT 
This_DT property_NN causes_VVZ the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Water_NN vapour_NN (_( H2O_NP )_) ,_, 
carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC ozone_NN 
(_( O3_NP )_) are_VBP the_DT primary_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN ._SENT Moreover_RB ,_, there_RB 
are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN entirely_RB human-made_JJ GHGs_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN the_DT halocarbons_NNS and_CC other_JJ chlorine-_NN and_CC bromine-containing_NN 
substances_NNS ,_, dealt_VVN with_IN under_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT Beside_IN CO2_NP ,_, N2O_NP 
and_CC CH4_NP ,_, the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP deals_NNS with_IN the_DT GHGs_NP sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN 
(_( SF6_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) and_CC perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ._SENT

Carbon_NN dioxide_NN removal_NN (_( CDR_NP )_) ,_, and_CC Negative_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Gross_JJ domestic_JJ product_NN (_( GDP_NP )_) The_DT sum_NN of_IN gross_JJ value_NN added_VVD ,_, 
at_IN purchasers’_JJ prices_NNS ,_, by_IN all_DT resident_NN and_CC non-resident_JJ producers_NNS in_IN 
the_DT economy_NN ,_, plus_CC any_DT taxes_NNS and_CC minus_IN any_DT subsidies_NNS not_RB included_VVD

given_VVN period_NN ,_, normally_RB one_CD year_NN ._SENT GDP_NP is_VBZ calculated_VVN without_IN deducting_VVG 
for_IN depreciation_NN of_IN fabricated_VVN assets_NNS or_CC depletion_NN and_CC degradation_NN of_IN 
natural_JJ resources_NNS ._SENT

Hydrological_JJ cycle_NN The_DT cycle_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN evaporates_VVZ from_IN the_DT

circulation_NN as_IN water_NN vapour_NN ,_, condenses_VVZ to_TO form_VV clouds_NNS ,_, precipitates_NNS 
as_IN rain_NN or_CC snow_NN ,_, which_WDT on_IN land_NN can_MD be_VB intercepted_VVN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC 
vegetation_NN ,_, potentially_RB accumulating_VVG as_IN snow_NN or_CC ice_NN ,_, provides_VVZ runoff_NN 
on_IN the_DT land_NN surface_NN ,_, infiltrates_NNS into_IN soils_NNS ,_, recharges_VVZ groundwater_NN ,_, 
discharges_NNS into_IN streams_NNS ,_, and_CC ultimately_RB ,_, flows_VVZ out_RP into_IN the_DT oceans_NNS

evaporate_VV again_RB ._SENT The_DT various_JJ systems_NNS involved_VVN in_IN the_DT hydrological_JJ 
cycle_NN are_VBP usually_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN hydrological_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT 
Ice_NN sheet_NN An_DT ice_NN body_NN originating_VVG on_IN land_NN that_WDT covers_VVZ an_DT area_NN of_IN 
continental_JJ size_NN ,_, generally_RB defined_VVN as_IN covering_VVG >_SYM 50_CD ,_, 000_CD km2_NN ._SENT An_DT ice_NN 
sheet_NN flows_NNS outward_RB from_IN a_DT high_JJ central_JJ ice_NN plateau_NN with_IN a_DT small_JJ 
average_JJ surface_NN slope_NN ._SENT The_DT margins_NNS usually_RB slope_VVP more_RBR steeply_RB ,_, and_NP 
most_JJS ice_NN is_VBZ discharged_VVN through_IN fast_RB flowing_VVG ice_NN streams_NNS or_CC outlet_NN 
glaciers_NNS ,_, often_RB into_IN the_DT sea_NN or_CC into_IN ice_NN shelves_NNS floating_VVG on_IN the_DT sea_NN ._SENT 
There_EX are_VBP only_RB two_CD ice_NN sheets_NNS in_IN the_DT modern_JJ world_NN ,_, one_CD on_IN Greenland_NP 
and_CC one_CD on_IN Antarctica_NP ._SENT The_DT latter_NN is_VBZ divided_VVN into_IN the_DT East_NP Antarctic_NP Ice_NP

Industrial_JJ revolution_NN A_DT period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ industrial_JJ growth_NN with_IN

of_IN the_DT steam_NN engine_NN was_VBD an_DT important_JJ trigger_NN of_IN this_DT development_NN ._SENT

Industrialised_VVN /_SYM developed_VVN /_SYM developing_VVG countries_NNS There_RB are_VBP

established_VVN convention_NN for_IN designating_VVG of_IN developed_JJ and_CC developing_VVG

developed_VVN and_CC developing_VVG regions_NNS based_VVN on_IN common_JJ practice_NN ._SENT 
In_IN addition_NN ,_, specific_JJ countries_NNS are_VBP designated_VVN as_IN Least_NP Developed_NP

appear_VV in_IN more_JJR than_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT categories_NNS ._SENT (_( 3_LS )_) The_DT World_NP Bank_NP 
uses_VVZ income_NN as_IN the_DT main_JJ criterion_NN for_IN classifying_VVG countries_NNS as_RB

of_IN environmental_JJ change_NN and_CC the_DT policy_NN responses_NNS to_TO it_PP ._SENT See_VV also_RB 
Integrated_JJ assessment_NN model_NN (_( IAM_NP )_) ._SENT 
Integrated_JJ assessment_NN model_NN (_( IAM_NP )_) Models_NNS that_WDT integrate_VV 
knowledge_NN from_IN two_CD or_CC more_JJR domains_NNS into_IN a_DT single_JJ framework_NN ._SENT They_PP 
are_VBP one_CD of_IN the_DT main_JJ tools_NNS for_IN undertaking_VVG integrated_JJ assessments_NNS ._SENT 
One_CD class_NN of_IN IAM_NP used_VVN in_IN respect_NN of_IN climate-change_NN mitigation_NN may_MD 
include_VVP representations_NNS of_IN :_: multiple_JJ sectors_NNS of_IN the_DT economy_NN ,_, such_JJ as_RB

class_NN of_IN model_NN is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO assess_VV linkages_NNS between_IN economic_JJ ,_, social_JJ 
and_CC technological_JJ development_NN and_CC the_DT evolution_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN ._SENT Another_DT class_NN of_IN IAM_NP additionally_RB includes_VVZ representations_NNS of_IN

been_VBN used_VVN to_TO estimate_VV the_DT social_JJ cost_NN of_IN carbon_NN ._SENT

Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP to_TO the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS 
Framework_NN Convention_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) is_VBZ an_DT 
international_JJ treaty_NN adopted_VVN in_IN December_NP 1997_CD in_IN Kyoto_NP ,_, Japan_NP ,_, at_IN 
the_DT Third_NP Session_NP of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP3_NP )_) to_TO the_DT 
UNFCCC_NP ._SENT It_PP contains_VVZ legally_RB binding_JJ commitments_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO 
those_DT included_VVD in_IN the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT Countries_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT 
Protocol_NP (_( mostly_RB OECD_NP countries_NNS and_CC countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN 
transition_NN )_) agreed_VVD to_TO reduce_VV their_PP$ anthropogenic_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
(_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS (_( carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, nitrous_JJ 
oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, hydrofluorocarbons_NNS (_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, perfluorocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) ,_, 
and_CC sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) by_IN at_IN least_JJS 5_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD levels_NNS 
in_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN (_( 2008_CD –_NN 2012_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 
entered_VVN into_IN force_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NP 2005_CD and_CC as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD had_VHD 192_CD 
Parties_NNS (_( 191_CD States_NNS and_CC the_DT European_NP Union_NP )_) ._SENT A_DT second_JJ commitment_NN 
period_NN was_VBD agreed_VVN in_IN December_NP 2012_CD at_IN COP18_NP ,_, known_VVN as_IN the_DT Doha_NP 
Amendment_NN to_TO the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, in_IN which_WDT a_DT new_JJ set_NN of_IN Parties_NNS 
committed_VVN to_TO reduce_VV GHG_NP emissions_NNS by_IN at_IN least_JJS 18_CD %_NN below_IN 1990_CD 
levels_NNS in_IN the_DT period_NN from_IN 2013_CD to_TO 2020._CD However_RB ,_, as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD ,_, the_DT 
Doha_NP Amendment_NP had_VHD not_RB received_VVN sufficient_JJ ratifications_NNS to_TO enter_VV 
into_IN force_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Paris_NP Agreement_NP ._SENT

settlements_NNS and_CC infrastructure_NN that_WDT operate_VVP within_IN that_DT system_NN (_( FAO_NP ,_, 
;_: UNCCD_NP ,_, 1994_CD )_) ._SENT

Land_NN degradation_NN A_DT negative_JJ trend_NN in_IN land_NN condition_NN ,_, caused_VVN by_IN 
direct_JJ or_CC indirect_JJ human-induced_JJ processes_NNS including_VVG anthropogenic_JJ 
climate-change_NN ,_, expressed_VVN as_IN long-term_JJ reduction_NN or_CC loss_NN of_IN at_IN least_JJS

value_NN to_TO humans_NNS ._SENT [_SYM Note_NN :_: This_DT definition_NN applies_VVZ to_TO forest_NN and_CC nonforest_NN

processes_NNS (_( such_JJ as_IN volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS )_) are_VBP not_RB considered_VVN to_TO be_VB 
land_NN degradation_NN ._SENT Reduction_NN of_IN biological_JJ productivity_NN or_CC ecological_JJ 
integrity_NN or_CC value_NN to_TO humans_NNS can_MD constitute_VV degradation_NN ,_, but_CC any_DT one_CD 
of_IN these_DT changes_NNS need_VVP not_RB necessarily_RB be_VB considered_VVN degradation_NN ._SENT ]_SYM

)_) ,_, LULUCF_NP is_VBZ a_DT GHG_NP inventory_NN sector_NN that_WDT covers_VVZ anthropogenic_JJ

perform_VV production_NN ,_, ecological_JJ or_CC social_JJ functions’_NN ._SENT Since_IN managed_VVN

Lock-in_NP A_DT situation_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT future_JJ development_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN ,_, 
including_VVG infrastructure_NN ,_, technologies_NNS ,_, investments_NNS ,_, institutions_NNS ,_, and_NP

Long-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( LLCF_NP )_) A_DT set_NN of_IN well-mixed_JJ 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS with_IN long_JJ atmospheric_JJ lifetimes_NNS ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN 
compounds_NNS includes_VVZ carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) and_CC nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ,_, 
together_RB with_IN some_DT fluorinated_VVN gases_NNS ._SENT They_PP have_VHP a_DT warming_NN effect_NN on_IN 
climate_NN ._SENT These_DT compounds_NNS accumulate_VVP in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN decadal_JJ 
to_TO centennial_NN timescales_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PP$ effect_NN on_IN climate_NN hence_RB persists_VVZ 
for_IN decades_NNS to_TO centuries_NNS after_IN their_PP$ emission_NN ._SENT On_IN timescales_NNS of_IN 
decades_NNS to_TO a_DT century_NN already_RB emitted_VVN emissions_NNS of_IN long-lived_JJ climate_NN 
forcers_NNS can_MD only_RB be_VB abated_VVN by_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN removal_NN (_( GGR_NP )_) ._SENT See_VV 
also_RB Short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) ._SENT 
Loss_NN and_CC Damage_NN ,_, and_CC losses_NNS and_CC damages_NNS Research_NP has_VHZ 
taken_VVN Loss_NN and_CC Damage_NN (_( capitalised_VVD letters_NNS )_) to_TO refer_VV to_TO political_JJ 
debate_NN under_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN 
Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) following_VVG the_DT establishment_NN of_IN the_DT Warsaw_NP 
Mechanism_NN on_IN Loss_NN and_CC Damage_NN in_IN 2013_CD ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ to_TO ‘address_VV loss_NN 
and_CC damage_NN associated_VVN with_IN impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, including_VVG

are_VBP particularly_RB vulnerable_JJ to_TO the_DT adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN climate_NN change.’_NN

broadly_RB to_TO harm_VV from_IN (_( observed_JJ )_) impacts_NNS and_CC (_( projected_JJ )_) risks_NNS 
(_( Mechler_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2018_CD )_) ._SENT 
Maladaptive_JJ actions_NNS (_( Maladaptation_NP )_) Actions_NNS that_WDT may_MD lead_VV 
to_TO increased_VVN risk_NN of_IN adverse_JJ climate-related_JJ outcomes_NNS ,_, including_VVG via_IN 
increased_VVN greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS ,_, increased_VVN vulnerability_NN 
to_TO climate-change_NN ,_, or_CC diminished_JJ welfare_NN ,_, now_RB or_CC in_IN the_DT future_NN ._SENT 
Maladaptation_NP is_VBZ usually_RB an_DT unintended_JJ consequence_NN ._SENT 
Malnutrition_NN Deficiencies_NNS ,_, excesses_NNS ,_, or_CC imbalances_NNS in_IN a_DT person’s_NNS 
intake_NN of_IN energy_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC nutrients_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN malnutrition_NN addresses_NNS 
three_CD broad_JJ groups_NNS of_IN conditions_NNS :_: undernutrition_NN ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ 
wasting_VVG (_( low_JJ weight-for-height_NN )_) ,_, stunting_VVG (_( low_JJ height-for-age_NN )_) 
and_CC underweight_JJ (_( low_JJ weight-for-age_NN )_) ;_: micronutrient-related_JJ 
malnutrition_NN ,_, which_WDT includes_VVZ micronutrient_NN deficiencies_NNS (_( a_DT lack_NN of_IN 
important_JJ vitamins_NNS and_CC minerals_NNS )_) or_CC micronutrient_NN excess_NN ;_: and_CC 
overweight_NN ,_, obesity_NN and_CC diet-related_JJ noncommunicable_JJ diseases_NNS 
(_( such_JJ as_IN heart_NN disease_NN ,_, stroke_NN ,_, diabetes_NN and_CC some_DT cancers_NNS )_) (_( WHO_WP ,_, 
)_) ._SENT Micronutrient_NN deficiencies_NNS are_VBP sometimes_RB termed_VVN ‘hidden_NN 
hunger’_JJ to_TO emphasise_VV that_IN/that people_NNS can_MD be_VB malnourished_JJ in_IN the_DT sense_NN 
of_IN deficient_JJ without_IN being_VBG deficient_JJ in_IN calories_NNS ._SENT Hidden_JJ hunger_NN can_MD 
apply_VV even_RB where_WRB people_NNS are_VBP obese_JJ ._SENT 
Managed_VVN forest_NN Forests_NNS subject_JJ to_TO human_JJ interventions_NNS (_( notably_RB 
silvicultural_JJ management_NN such_JJ as_IN planting_NN ,_, pruning_VVG ,_, thinning_VVG )_) ,_, timber_NN

Market_NN failure_NN When_WRB private_JJ decisions_NNS are_VBP based_VVN on_IN market_NN

that_DT is_VBZ substantially_RB different_JJ from_IN the_DT price_NN that_IN/that a_DT market_NN would_MD

state_NN enforcement_NN of_IN legal_JJ contracts_NNS and_CC the_DT ownership_NN of_IN private_JJ 
property_NN ._SENT Examples_NNS of_IN factors_NNS causing_VVG market_NN prices_NNS to_TO deviate_VV from_IN 
real_JJ economic_JJ scarcity_NN are_VBP environmental_JJ externalities_NNS ,_, public_JJ goods_NNS ,_,

Ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) The_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_,

Paris_NP Agreement_NP The_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP under_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS 
Framework_NN Convention_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( UNFCCC_NP )_) was_VBD adopted_VVN on_RP 
December_NP 2015_CD in_IN Paris_NP ,_, France_NP ,_, at_IN the_DT 21st_JJ session_NN of_IN the_DT Conference_NN 
of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ._SENT The_DT agreement_NN ,_, adopted_VVN by_IN 196_CD 
Parties_NNS to_TO the_DT UNFCCC_NP ,_, entered_VVN into_IN force_NN on_IN 4_CD November_NP 2016_CD and_CC 
as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD had_VHD 195_CD Signatories_NNS and_CC was_VBD ratified_VVN by_IN 177_CD Parties_NNS ._SENT 
One_CD of_IN the_DT goals_NNS of_IN the_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP is_VBZ ‘Holding_VVG the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT 
global_JJ average_JJ temperature_NN to_TO well_RB below_IN 2_CD °_SYM C_NN above_IN pre-industrial_JJ 
levels_NNS and_CC pursuing_VVG efforts_NNS to_TO limit_VV the_DT temperature_NN increase_NN to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP 
above_IN pre-industrial_JJ levels’_NN ,_, recognising_VVG that_IN/that this_DT would_MD significantly_RB 
reduce_VV the_DT risks_NNS and_CC impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT Additionally_RB ,_, the_DT 
Agreement_NN aims_VVZ to_TO strengthen_VV the_DT ability_NN of_IN countries_NNS to_TO deal_VV with_IN 
the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP is_VBZ intended_VVN 
to_TO become_VV fully_RB effective_JJ in_IN 2020._CD See_NP also_RB Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, and_NP 
Nationally_RB Determined_NP Contributions_NP (_( NDCs_NP )_) ._SENT

Pathways_NNS The_DT temporal_JJ evolution_NN of_IN natural_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC human_JJ 
systems_NNS towards_IN a_DT future_JJ state_NN ._SENT Pathway_NN concepts_NNS range_VVP from_IN sets_NNS

futures_NNS to_TO solution-oriented_JJ decision-making_NN processes_VVZ to_TO achieve_VV 
desirable_JJ societal_JJ goals_NNS ._SENT Pathway_NN approaches_VVZ typically_RB focus_VV on_RP 
biophysical_JJ ,_, techno-economic_JJ ,_, and_CC /_SYM or_CC socio-behavioural_JJ trajectories_NNS 
and_CC involve_VV various_JJ dynamics_NNS ,_, goals_NNS ,_, and_CC actors_NNS across_IN different_JJ scales_NNS ._SENT 
.5_CD °_SYM C_NP pathway_NN 
A_DT pathway_NN of_IN emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS and_CC other_JJ climate_NN 
forcers_NNS that_WDT provides_VVZ an_DT approximately_RB one-in-two_JJ to_TO two-in-three_NN 
chance_NN ,_, given_VVN current_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT climate_NN response_NN ,_, of_IN global_JJ 
warming_VVG either_CC remaining_VVG below_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP or_CC returning_VVG to_TO 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP by_IN 
around_IN 2100_CD following_VVG an_DT overshoot_VV ._SENT 
See_VV also_RB Temperature_NP overshoot_VV ._SENT 
Adaptation_NN pathways_NNS 
A_DT series_NN of_IN adaptation_NN choices_NNS involving_VVG trade-offs_NNS between_IN shortterm_JJ 
and_CC long-term_JJ goals_NNS and_CC values_NNS ._SENT These_DT are_VBP processes_NNS of_IN 
deliberation_NN to_TO identify_VV solutions_NNS that_WDT are_VBP meaningful_JJ to_TO people_NNS in_IN 
the_DT context_NN of_IN their_PP$ daily_JJ lives_NNS and_CC to_TO avoid_VV potential_JJ maladaptation_NN ._SENT 
Development_NN pathways_NNS

economic_JJ ,_, cultural_JJ ,_, technological_JJ ,_, institutional_JJ ,_, and_CC biophysical_JJ 
features_NNS that_WDT characterise_VVP the_DT interactions_NNS between_IN human_JJ and_NP 
natural_JJ systems_NNS and_CC outline_VV visions_NNS for_IN the_DT future_NN ,_, at_IN a_DT particular_JJ scale_NN ._SENT 
Mitigation_NN pathways_NNS 
A_DT mitigation_NN pathway_NN is_VBZ a_DT temporal_JJ evolution_NN of_IN a_DT set_NN of_IN mitigation_NN 
scenario_NN features_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN (_( GHG_NP )_) emissions_NNS and_CC 
socio-economic_JJ development_NN ._SENT 
Overshoot_VV pathways_NNS 
Pathways_NNS that_WDT exceed_VVP the_DT stabilisation_NN level_NN (_( concentration_NN ,_, forcing_VVG ,_, 
or_CC temperature_NN )_) before_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN a_DT time_NN horizon_NN of_IN interest_NN 
(_( e.g._FW ,_, before_IN 2100_CD )_) and_CC then_RB decline_NN towards_IN that_DT level_NN by_IN that_DT time_NN ._SENT 
Once_RB the_DT target_NN level_NN is_VBZ exceeded_VVN ,_, removal_NN by_IN sinks_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN 
gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) is_VBZ required_VVN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Temperature_NP overshoot_VV ._SENT 
Non-overshoot_NN pathways_NNS 
Pathways_NNS that_WDT stay_VVP below_IN the_DT stabilisation_NN level_NN (_( concentration_NN ,_, 
forcing_VVG ,_, or_CC temperature_NN )_) during_IN the_DT time_NN horizon_NN of_IN interest_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, 
until_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT 
Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) 
Scenarios_NNS that_WDT include_VVP time_NN series_NN of_IN emissions_NNS and_CC concentrations_NNS 
of_IN the_DT full_JJ suite_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS and_CC 
chemically_RB active_JJ gases_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN land_NN use_NN /_SYM land_NN cover_VV (_( Moss_NP et_NP 
al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2008_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT word_NN representative_NN signifies_VVZ that_IN/that each_DT RCP_NP provides_VVZ 
only_RB one_CD of_IN many_JJ possible_JJ scenarios_NNS that_WDT would_MD lead_VV to_TO the_DT specific_NN 
radiative_JJ forcing_VVG characteristics_NNS ._SENT The_DT term_NN pathway_NN emphasises_VVZ the_DT 
fact_NN that_IN/that not_RB only_RB the_DT long-term_JJ concentration_NN levels_NNS ,_, but_CC also_RB the_DT 
trajectory_NN taken_VVN over_IN time_NN to_TO reach_VV that_DT outcome_NN are_VBP of_IN interest_NN 
(_( Moss_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD )_) ._SENT RCPs_NNS were_VBD used_VVN to_TO develop_VV climate_NN projections_NNS in_IN 
CMIP5_NP ._SENT See_VV also_RB Coupled_NP Model_NP Intercomparison_NP Project_NP (_( CMIP_NP )_) ,_, and_NP 
Shared_VVN Socio-economic_JJ Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) ._SENT 
•_NP RCP2.6_NP :_: One_CD pathway_NN where_WRB radiative_JJ forcing_JJ peaks_NNS at_IN 
approximately_RB 3_CD W_NN m_NN –_NN 2_CD and_CC then_RB declines_VVZ to_TO be_VB limited_VVN at_IN 
.6_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD in_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ Extended_JJ Concentration_NN 
Pathway_NN ,_, or_CC ECP_NP ,_, has_VHZ constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD )_) ._SENT 
•_NP RCP4.5_NP and_CC RCP6.0_NP :_: Two_CD intermediate_JJ stabilisation_NN pathways_NNS in_IN 
which_WDT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ limited_VVN at_IN approximately_RB 4.5_CD W_NN m_NN –_NP 2_CD 
and_CC 6.0_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD in_IN 2100_CD (_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECPs_NNS have_VHP constant_JJ 
concentrations_NNS after_IN 2150_CD )_) ._SENT 
•_NP RCP8.5_NP :_: One_CD high_JJ pathway_NN which_WDT leads_VVZ to_TO >_SYM 8.5_CD W_NP m_NN –_NN 2_CD in_IN 2100_CD 
(_( the_DT corresponding_JJ ECP_NP has_VHZ constant_JJ emissions_NNS after_IN 2100_CD until_IN 
and_CC constant_JJ concentrations_NNS after_IN 2250_CD )_) ._SENT 
Shared_VVN Socio-economic_JJ Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) 
Shared_VVN Socio-economic_JJ Pathways_NP (_( SSPs_NP )_) were_VBD developed_VVN to_TO 
complement_VV the_DT Representative_NP Concentration_NP Pathways_NP (_( RCPs_NP )_) with_IN 
varying_VVG socio-economic_JJ challenges_NNS to_TO adaptation_NN and_CC mitigation_NN 

Glossary_NN Annex_NN I_PP 
AI_VVP 
(_( O’Neill_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2014_CD )_) ._SENT Based_VVN on_IN five_CD narratives_NNS ,_, the_DT SSPs_NNS describe_VVP 
alternative_JJ socio-economic_JJ futures_NNS in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN climate_NN policy_NN 
intervention_NN ,_, comprising_VVG sustainable_JJ development_NN (_( SSP1_NP )_) ,_, regional_JJ 
rivalry_NN (_( SSP3_NP )_) ,_, inequality_NN (_( SSP4_NP )_) ,_, fossil_JJ –_NN fueled_VVD development_NN (_( SSP5_NP )_) ,_, 
and_CC a_DT middle-of-the-road_JJ development_NN (_( SSP2_NP )_) (_( O’Neill_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2017_CD ;_: 
Riahi_NP et_FW al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2017_CD )_) ._SENT The_DT combination_NN of_IN SSP-based_JJ socio-economic_JJ 
scenarios_NNS and_CC RCP-based_JJ climate_NN projections_NNS provides_VVZ an_DT integrative_JJ 
frame_NN for_IN climate-impact_NN and_CC policy_NN analysis_NN ._SENT 
Transformation_NN pathways_NNS

or_CC global_JJ mean_JJ surface_NN temperatures_NNS implied_VVN from_IN mitigation_NN and_CC

economic_JJ ,_, technological_JJ ,_, societal_JJ ,_, and_CC behavioural_JJ changes_NNS ._SENT This_DT can_NN 
encompass_VV changes_NNS in_IN the_DT way_NN energy_NN and_CC infrastructure_NN are_VBP used_VVN 
and_CC produced_VVN ,_, natural_JJ resources_NNS are_VBP managed_VVN and_CC institutions_NNS are_VBP set_VVN 
up_RB and_CC in_IN the_DT pace_NN and_CC direction_NN of_IN technological_JJ change_NN (_( TC_NP )_) ._SENT

pH_NN A_DT dimensionless_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN a_DT solution_NN given_VVN

depends’_NP (_( Whitmee_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2015_CD )_) ._SENT

Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG The_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT net_JJ ,_, downward_JJ minus_NN 
upward_RB ,_, radiative_JJ flux_NN (_( expressed_VVN in_IN W_NP m_NN –_NP 2_CD )_) at_IN the_DT tropopause_NN or_CC 
top_JJ of_IN atmosphere_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN a_DT driver_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, 
the_DT concentration_NN of_IN volcanic_JJ aerosols_NNS or_CC the_DT output_NN of_IN the_DT Sun_NP ._SENT 
The_DT traditional_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ computed_VVN with_IN all_DT tropospheric_NN 
properties_NNS held_VVD fixed_VVN at_IN their_PP$ unperturbed_JJ values_NNS ,_, and_CC after_IN allowing_VVG 
for_IN stratospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, if_IN perturbed_VVN ,_, to_TO readjust_VV to_TO radiativedynamical_JJ 
equilibrium_NN ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ called_VVN instantaneous_JJ if_IN no_DT 


change_NN in_IN stratospheric_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ accounted_VVN for_IN ._SENT The_DT radiative_JJ 
forcing_VVG once_IN rapid_JJ adjustments_NNS are_VBP accounted_VVN for_IN is_VBZ termed_VVN the_DT 
effective_JJ radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ._SENT Radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB confused_VVN with_IN 
cloud_NN radiative_JJ forcing_VVG ,_, which_WDT describes_VVZ an_DT unrelated_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT 
impact_NN of_IN clouds_NNS on_IN the_DT radiative_JJ flux_NN at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ._SENT

Risk_VV The_DT potential_NN for_IN adverse_JJ consequences_NNS for_IN human_JJ or_CC 
ecological_JJ systems_NNS ,_, recognising_VVG the_DT diversity_NN of_IN values_NNS and_CC objectives_NNS 
associated_VVN with_IN such_JJ systems_NNS ._SENT In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, 
risks_NNS can_MD arise_VV from_IN potential_JJ impacts_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN as_IN well_RB as_RB 
human_JJ responses_NNS to_TO climate-change_NN ._SENT Relevant_JJ adverse_JJ consequences_NNS 
include_VV those_DT on_IN lives_NNS ,_, livelihoods_NNS ,_, health_NN and_CC well-being_NN ,_, economic_JJ ,_, 
social_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ assets_NNS and_CC investments_NNS ,_, infrastructure_NN ,_, services_NNS 
(_( including_VVG ecosystem_NN services_NNS )_) ,_, ecosystems_NNS and_CC species_NNS ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN impacts_NNS ,_, risks_NNS result_VVP from_IN dynamic_NN 
interactions_NNS between_IN climate-related_JJ hazards_NNS with_IN the_DT exposure_NN 
and_CC vulnerability_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ human_JJ or_CC ecological_JJ system_NN to_TO the_DT 
hazards_NNS ._SENT Hazards_NNS ,_, exposure_NN and_CC vulnerability_NN may_MD each_RB be_VB subject_JJ 
to_TO uncertainty_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN magnitude_NN and_CC likelihood_NN of_IN occurrence_NN ,_, 
and_CC each_DT may_MD change_VV over_IN time_NN and_CC space_NN due_JJ to_TO socio-economic_JJ 
changes_NNS and_CC human_JJ decision-making_NN (_( see_VV also_RB risk_NN management_NN ,_, 
adaptation_NN ,_, and_CC mitigation_NN )_) ._SENT 
In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN responses_NNS ,_, risks_NNS result_VVP from_IN the_DT 
potential_JJ for_IN such_JJ responses_NNS not_RB achieving_VVG the_DT intended_JJ objective_NN (_( s_NN )_) ,_, 
or_CC from_IN potential_JJ trade-offs_NNS with_IN ,_, or_CC negative_JJ side-effects_NNS on_IN ,_, other_JJ 
societal_JJ objectives_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT Sustainable_NP Development_NP Goals_NP (_( see_VV 
also_RB risk_NN trade-off_NN )_) ._SENT Risks_NNS can_MD arise_VV for_IN example_NN from_IN uncertainty_NN in_IN 
implementation_NN ,_, effectiveness_NN or_CC outcomes_NNS of_IN climate_NN policy_NN ,_, climaterelated_JJ 
investments_NNS ,_, technology_NN development_NN or_CC adoption_NN ,_, and_NP 
system_NN transitions_NNS ._SENT

Sea_NP ice_NN Ice_NP found_VVD at_IN the_DT sea_NN surface_NN that_WDT has_VHZ originated_VVN from_IN 
the_DT freezing_NN of_IN seawater_NN ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN may_MD be_VB discontinuous_JJ pieces_NNS (_( ice_NN

or_CC a_DT motionless_JJ sheet_NN attached_VVN to_TO the_DT coast_NN (_( land-fast_NN ice_NN )_) ._SENT Sea_NP ice_NN

than_IN one_CD year_NN old_JJ is_VBZ called_VVN first-year_JJ ice_NN ._SENT Perennial_JJ ice_NN is_VBZ sea_NN ice_NN that_RB 
survives_VVZ at_IN least_JJS one_CD summer_NN ._SENT It_PP may_MD be_VB subdivided_VVN into_IN second-year_NN 
ice_NN and_CC multi-year_NN ice_NN ,_, where_WRB multi-year_NN ice_NN has_VHZ survived_VVN at_IN least_JJS 
two_CD summers_NNS ._SENT 
Sea_NP level_NN change_NN (_( sea_NN level_JJ rise_NN /_SYM sea_NN level_NN fall_NN )_) Change_VV to_TO 
the_DT height_NN of_IN sea_NN level_NN ,_, both_CC globally_RB and_CC locally_RB (_( relative_JJ sea_NN level_NN 
change_NN )_) due_JJ to_TO (_( 1_LS )_) a_DT change_NN in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT change_NN 
in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT ocean_NN ,_, (_( 2_LS )_) changes_NNS in_IN ocean_NN volume_NN
