shape_NN of_IN the_DT ocean_NN basins_NNS and_CC changes_NNS in_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP gravitational_JJ 
and_CC rotational_JJ fields_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( 4_LS )_) local_JJ subsidence_NN or_CC uplift_NN of_IN the_DT land_NN ._SENT 
Global_JJ mean_JJ sea_NN level_NN change_NN resulting_VVG from_IN change_NN in_IN the_DT mass_NN 
of_IN the_DT ocean_NN is_VBZ called_VVN barystatic_JJ ._SENT The_DT amount_NN of_IN barystatic_JJ sea_NN level_NN

locally_RB ,_, resulting_VVG from_IN changes_NNS in_IN water_NN density_NN are_VBP called_VVN steric_JJ ._SENT 
Density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN temperature_NN changes_NNS only_RB are_VBP called_VVN 
thermosteric_JJ ,_, while_IN density_NN changes_NNS induced_VVN by_IN salinity_NN changes_NNS

Sea_NP surface_NN temperature_NN (_( SST_NP )_) The_DT subsurface_JJ bulk_NN

to_TO be_VB compatible_JJ with_IN the_DT bulk_JJ temperature_NN ._SENT

Short-lived_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS (_( SLCF_NP )_) A_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS that_WDT are_VBP 
primarily_RB composed_VVN of_IN those_DT with_IN short_JJ lifetimes_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
compared_VVN to_TO well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS (_( GHGs_NP )_) ,_, and_CC are_VBP also_RB 
referred_VVN to_TO as_RB near-term_JJ climate_NN forcers_NNS ._SENT This_DT set_NN of_IN compounds_NNS 
includes_VVZ methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ also_RB a_DT well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN ,_, 
as_RB well_RB as_IN ozone_NN (_( O3_NP )_) and_CC aerosols_NNS ,_, or_CC their_PP$ precursors_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT 
halogenated_VVN species_NNS that_WDT are_VBP not_RB well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ._SENT 
These_DT compounds_NNS do_VVP not_RB accumulate_VV in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN decadal_JJ to_TO 
centennial_NN timescales_NNS ,_, and_CC so_RB their_PP$ effect_NN on_IN climate_NN is_VBZ predominantly_RB 
in_IN the_DT first_JJ decade_NN after_IN their_PP$ emission_NN ,_, although_IN their_PP$ changes_NNS can_MD still_RB 
induce_VV long-term_JJ climate_NN effects_NNS such_JJ as_IN sea_NN level_NN change_NN ._SENT Their_PP$ effect_NN 
can_MD be_VB cooling_VVG or_CC warming_VVG ._SENT A_DT subset_NN of_IN exclusively_RB warming_VVG shortlived_JJ 
climate_NN forcers_NNS is_VBZ referred_VVN to_TO as_RB short-lived_JJ climate_NN pollutants_NNS ._SENT

from_IN the_DT same_JJ area_NN of_IN land_NN while_IN decreasing_VVG negative_JJ environmental_JJ 
impacts_NNS of_IN agricultural_JJ production_NN and_CC increasing_VVG the_DT provision_NN of_IN 
environmental_JJ services_NNS (_( CGIAR_NP ,_, 2019_CD )_) ._SENT [_SYM Note_NN :_: this_DT definition_NN is_VBZ based_VVN 
on_IN the_DT concept_NN of_IN meeting_NN demand_NN from_IN a_DT finite_JJ land_NN area_NN ,_, but_CC it_PP 
is_VBZ scale-dependent_JJ ._SENT Sustainable_JJ intensification_NN at_IN a_DT given_VVN scale_NN (_( e.g._FW ,_, 
global_JJ or_CC national_JJ )_) may_MD require_VV a_DT decrease_NN in_IN production_NN intensity_NN 
at_IN smaller_JJR scales_NNS and_CC in_IN particular_JJ places_NNS (_( often_RB associated_VVN with_IN 
previous_JJ ,_, unsustainable_JJ ,_, intensification_NN )_) to_TO achieve_VV sustainability_NN 
(_( Garnett_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2013_CD )_) ._SENT ]_SYM 

Glossary_NN Annex_NN I_PP

Sustainable_JJ land_NN management_NN The_DT stewardship_NN and_CC use_VV of_IN

changing_VVG human_JJ needs_NNS ,_, while_IN simultaneously_RB ensuring_VVG the_DT long-term_JJ

environmental_JJ functions_NNS (_( Adapted_VVN from_IN WOCAT_NP ,_, undated_JJ )_) ._SENT

Temperature_NN overshoot_VVP The_DT temporary_JJ exceedance_NN of_IN a_DT 
specified_JJ level_NN of_IN global_JJ warming_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN 1.5_CD °_SYM C_NP ._SENT Overshoot_VV implies_VVZ

Tier_NN In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN the_DT IPCC_NP Guidelines_NPS for_IN National_NP Greenhouse_NP 
Gas_NN Inventories_NNS ,_, a_DT tier_NN represents_VVZ a_DT level_NN of_IN methodological_JJ complexity_NN ._SENT 
Usually_RB three_CD tiers_NNS are_VBP provided_VVN ._SENT Tier_NP 1_CD is_VBZ the_DT basic_JJ method_NN ,_, Tier_NP 2_CD

(_( IPCC_NP ,_, 2019_CD )_) ._SENT 
Tipping_VVG point_NN A_DT level_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN system_NN properties_NNS beyond_RB

or_CC regional_JJ climate_NN changes_NNS from_IN one_CD stable_JJ state_NN to_TO another_DT stable_NN

Transient_JJ climate_NN response_NN to_TO cumulative_JJ CO2_NP emissions_NNS

Tropical_JJ cyclone_NN The_DT general_JJ term_NN for_IN a_DT strong_JJ ,_, cyclonic-scale_JJ

weaker_JJR systems_NNS (_( often_RB named_VVN tropical_JJ disturbances_NNS or_CC depressions_NNS )_) 
by_IN exceeding_VVG a_DT threshold_NN wind_NN speed_NN ._SENT A_DT tropical_JJ storm_NN is_VBZ a_DT tropical_JJ

m_NN s_NNS –_JJ 1._CD Beyond_IN 32_CD m_NN s_NNS –_JJ 1_CD ,_, a_DT tropical_JJ cyclone_NN is_VBZ called_VVN a_DT hurricane_NN ,_,

Troposphere_NN The_DT lowest_JJS part_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT surface_NN

weather_NN phenomena_NNS occur_VVP ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, temperatures_NNS generally_RB 
decrease_NN with_IN height_NN ._SENT See_VV also_RB Atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC Stratosphere_NP ._SENT 
Uncertainty_NN A_DT state_NN of_IN incomplete_JJ knowledge_NN that_WDT can_MD result_VV 
from_IN a_DT lack_NN of_IN information_NN or_CC from_IN disagreement_NN about_IN what_WP is_VBZ

from_IN imprecision_NN in_IN the_DT data_NNS to_TO ambiguously_RB defined_VVN concepts_NNS or_CC

of_IN a_DT team_NN of_IN experts_NNS )_) (_( see_VV IPCC_NP ,_, 2004_CD ;_: Mastrandrea_NP et_NP al_NP ._SENT ,_, 2010_CD ;_: Moss_NP 
and_CC Schneider_NP ,_, 2000_CD )_) ._SENT See_VV also_RB Confidence_NN ,_, and_CC Likelihood_NP ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Convention_NP to_TO Combat_NP Desertification_NP 
(_( UNCCD_NNS )_) A_DT legally_RB binding_JJ international_JJ agreement_NN linking_VVG 
environment_NN and_CC development_NN to_TO sustainable_JJ land_NN management_NN ,_, 
established_VVN in_IN 1994._CD The_DT Convention’s_NP objective_NN is_VBZ ‘to_NN combat_NN 
desertification_NN and_CC mitigate_VV the_DT effects_NNS of_IN drought_NN in_IN countries_NNS 
experiencing_VVG drought_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC desertification’_NN ._SENT The_DT Convention_NN 
specifically_RB addresses_VVZ the_DT arid_JJ ,_, semi-arid_JJ and_CC dry_JJ sub-humid_JJ areas_NNS ,_, 
known_VVN as_IN the_DT drylands_NNS ,_, and_CC has_VHZ a_DT particular_JJ focus_NN on_IN Africa_NP ._SENT As_RB of_IN 
October_NP 2018_CD ,_, the_DT UNCCD_NN had_VHD 197_CD Parties_NNS ._SENT 
United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) The_DT UNFCCC_NP was_VBD adopted_VVN in_IN May_NP 1992_CD and_CC opened_VVD for_IN 
signature_NN at_IN the_DT 1992_CD Earth_NP Summit_NP in_IN Rio_NP de_NP Janeiro_NP ._SENT It_PP entered_VVD into_IN 
force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994_CD and_CC as_RB of_IN May_NP 2018_CD had_VHD 197_CD Parties_NNS (_( 196_CD States_NNS 
and_CC the_DT European_NP Union_NP )_) ._SENT The_DT Convention’s_NP ultimate_JJ objective_NN is_VBZ the_DT 
‘stabilisation_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gas_NN concentrations_NNS in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN 
with_IN the_DT climate_NN system’_NN ._SENT The_DT provisions_NNS of_IN the_DT Convention_NN are_VBP 
pursued_VVN and_CC implemented_VVN by_IN two_CD treaties_NNS :_: the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_NP 
the_DT Paris_NP Agreement_NP ._SENT

About_IN IUCN_NP 
IUCN_NP ,_, International_NP Union_NP for_IN Conservation_NP of_IN Nature_NP ,_, helps_VVZ the_DT world_NN find_VV pragmatic_JJ 
solutions_NNS to_TO our_PP$ most_RBS pressing_JJ environment_NN and_CC development_NN challenges_NNS ._SENT It_PP supports_VVZ 
scientific_JJ research_NN ,_, manages_VVZ field_NN projects_NNS all_RB over_IN the_DT world_NN and_CC brings_VVZ governments_NNS ,_, 
non-government_NN organizations_NNS ,_, United_NP Nations_NPS agencies_NNS ,_, companies_NNS and_CC local_JJ 
communities_NNS together_RB to_TO develop_VV and_CC implement_VV policy_NN ,_, laws_NNS and_CC best_JJS practice_NN ._SENT 
IUCN_NP is_VBZ the_DT world’s_NN oldest_JJS and_CC largest_JJS global_JJ environmental_JJ network_NN -_: a_DT democratic_JJ 
membership_NN union_NN with_IN more_JJR than_IN 1_CD ,_, 000_CD government_NN and_CC NGO_NP member_NN organizations_NNS ,_, 
and_CC almost_RB 12_CD ,_, 000_CD volunteer_NN scientists_NNS in_IN more_JJR than_IN 160_CD countries_NNS ._SENT 
IUCN’s_NP work_NN is_VBZ supported_VVN by_IN more_JJR than_IN 1_CD ,_, 100_CD professional_JJ staff_NN in_IN 60_CD offices_NNS and_CC 
hundreds_NNS of_IN partners_NNS in_IN public_NN ,_, NGO_NP and_CC private_JJ sectors_NNS around_IN the_DT world_NN ._SENT The_DT Union’s_NP 
headquarters_NNS are_VBP located_VVN in_IN Gland_NP ,_, near_IN Geneva_NP ,_, Switzerland_NP ._SENT 
replaced-dns_NNS NONE_NONE

._SENT Abatement_NN :_: Abatement_NN is_VBZ the_DT word_NN which_WDT is_VBZ used_VVN to_TO denote_VV the_DT result_NN 
of_IN decreased_VVN Greenhouse_NP Gases_NPS Emission_NP ._SENT This_DT can_MD also_RB be_VB taken_VVN as_IN an_DT 
activity_NN to_TO lessen_VV the_DT effects_NNS of_IN Greenhouse_NP Effect_NP ._SENT 
._SENT Aboveground_JJ Biomass_NP :_: All_DT living_VVG biomass_NN above_IN the_DT soil_NN including_VVG the_DT 
stem_NN ,_, stump_NN ,_, branches_NNS ,_, bark_NN ,_, seeds_NNS and_CC foliage_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN aboveground_NN

._SENT Absolute_JJ Humidity_NN :_: The_DT quantity_NN of_IN water_NN vapour_NN in_IN a_DT given_VVN volume_NN of_IN 
air_NN expressed_VVD by_IN mass_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN absolute_JJ humidity_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Absolute_JJ Risk_NN :_: A_DT quantitative_JJ or_CC qualitative_JJ prediction_NN of_IN the_DT likelihood_NN 
and_CC significance_NN of_IN a_DT given_VVN impact_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN absolute_JJ risk_NN ._SENT In_IN the_DT 
Voluntary_JJ Carbon_NP Standard_NP (_( VCS_NP )_) ,_, the_DT level_NN of_IN absolute_JJ risk_NN can_MD be_VB 
calculated_VVN using_VVG the_DT ‘likelihood_NN ×_NP significance’_NN methodology_NN ._SENT The_DT 
calculated_JJ risk_NN can_MD then_RB be_VB converted_VVN into_IN a_DT risk_NN classification_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Accelerated_VVN Erosion_NN :_: Erosion_NN is_VBZ a_DT natural_JJ phenomenon_NN which_WDT results_VVZ 
in_IN soil_NN losses_NNS and_CC water_NN quality_NN degradation_NN ._SENT Accelerated_VVN erosion_NN is_VBZ 
generally_RB caused_VVN by_IN activities_NNS that_WDT disturb_VVP or_CC expose_VVP the_DT soil_NN to_TO the_DT 
erosive_JJ forces_NNS of_IN gravity_NN and_CC rainwater_NN ._SENT Climatic_JJ or_CC weather_NN conditions_NNS 
combined_VVN with_IN human_JJ activity_NN can_MD accentuate_VV soil_NN erosion_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, 
severe_JJ and_CC intense_JJ storm_NN events_NNS may_MD increase_VV the_DT rate_NN of_IN accelerated_VVN 
erosion_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Acceptable_JJ Risk_NN :_: The_DT level_NN of_IN potential_JJ losses_NNS that_IN/that a_DT society_NN or_CC 
community_NN considers_VVZ acceptable_JJ given_VVN existing_JJ social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, 
political_JJ ,_, cultural_JJ ,_, technical_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_RB 
acceptable_JJ risk_NN ._SENT The_DT term_NN “_NN acceptable_JJ risk_NN ”_NN describes_VVZ the_DT likelihood_NN of_IN 
an_DT event_NN whose_WP$ probability_NN of_IN occurrence_NN is_VBZ small_JJ ,_, whose_WP$ consequences_NNS 
are_VBP so_RB slight_JJ ,_, or_CC whose_WP$ benefits_NNS (_( perceived_VVN or_CC real_JJ )_) are_VBP so_RB great_JJ ,_, that_RB 
individuals_NNS or_CC groups_NNS in_IN society_NN are_VBP willing_JJ to_TO take_VV or_CC be_VB subjected_VVN to_TO the_DT 
risk_NN that_IN/that the_DT event_NN might_MD occur_VV ._SENT The_DT concept_NN of_IN acceptable_JJ risk_NN evolved_VVD 
partly_RB from_IN the_DT realization_NN that_IN/that absolute_JJ safety_NN is_VBZ generally_RB an_DT unachievable_JJ 
goal_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN/that even_RB very_RB low_JJ exposures_NNS to_TO certain_JJ toxic_JJ substances_NNS may_MD 
confer_VV some_DT level_NN of_IN risk_NN ._SENT The_DT notion_NN of_IN virtual_JJ safety_NN corresponding_JJ to_TO 
an_DT acceptable_JJ level_NN of_IN risk_NN emerged_VVN as_IN a_DT risk_NN management_NN objective_NN in_IN 

cases_NNS where_WRB such_JJ exposures_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB completely_RB or_CC cost-effectively_RB 
eliminated_VVN ._SENT 
._SENT Acclimatization_NN :_: The_DT process_NN of_IN an_DT individual_JJ organism_NN adjusting_VVG to_TO a_DT 
gradual_JJ change_NN in_IN its_PP$ environment_NN (_( such_JJ as_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN temperature_NN ,_, 
humidity_NN ,_, photoperiod_NN or_CC pH_NN )_) allowing_VVG it_PP to_TO maintain_VV performance_NN across_RP 
a_DT range_NN of_IN environmental_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN acclimatization_NN ._SENT 
Acclimatization_NN occurs_VVZ in_IN a_DT short_JJ period_NN of_IN time_NN (_( days_NNS to_TO weeks_NNS )_) ,_, and_NP 
within_IN the_DT organism’s_NNS lifetime_NN (_( compare_VV to_TO adaptation_NN )_) ._SENT This_DT may_MD be_VB a_DT 
discrete_JJ occurrence_NN or_CC may_MD instead_RB represent_VV part_NN of_IN a_DT periodic_JJ cycle_NN ,_, 
such_JJ as_IN a_DT mammal_NN shedding_VVG heavy_JJ winter_NN fur_NN in_IN favor_NN of_IN a_DT lighter_NN 
summer_NN coat_NN ._SENT Organisms_NNS can_MD adjust_VV their_PP$ morphological_JJ ,_, behavioural_JJ ,_, 
physical_JJ and_CC /_SYM or_CC biochemical_JJ traits_NNS in_IN response_NN to_TO changes_NNS in_IN their_PP$ 
environment_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Adaptability_NN :_: The_DT ability_NN of_IN a_DT system_NN to_TO adjust_VV to_TO Climate_NN 
Change_NN (_( including_VVG climate_NN variability_NN and_CC extremes_NNS )_) to_TO moderate_VV 
potential_JJ damages_NNS ,_, to_TO take_VV advantage_NN of_IN opportunities_NNS or_CC to_TO cope_VV with_IN 
the_DT consequences_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN adaptability_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Adaptation_NN :_: Adjustment_NN in_IN natural_JJ or_CC human_JJ systems_NNS to_TO a_DT new_JJ or_CC 
changing_VVG environment_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN adaptation_NN ._SENT Adaptation_NN is_VBZ a_DT process_NN 
by_IN which_WDT individuals_NNS ,_, communities_NNS and_CC countries_NNS seek_VVP to_TO cope_VV with_IN the_DT 
consequences_NNS of_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT ‘Adaptation_NN is_VBZ not_RB coping’_JJ ,_, it_PP is_VBZ about_RB 
the_DT capacity_NN to_TO shift_VV strategies_NNS as_IN conditions_NNS change_NN and_CC to_TO develop_VV 
systems_NNS that_WDT are_VBP resilient_JJ and_CC sufficiently_RB flexible_JJ to_TO respond_VV to_TO change_VV ._SENT It_PP 
may_MD be_VB planned_VVN or_CC autonomous_JJ ._SENT Various_JJ types_NNS of_IN adaptation_NN can_MD be_VB 
distinguished_JJ ,_, including_VVG anticipatory_JJ and_CC reactive_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, private_JJ and_NP 
public_JJ adaptation_NN ,_, and_CC autonomous_JJ and_CC planned_JJ adaptation_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Adaptation_NN Assessment_NP :_: The_DT practice_NN of_IN identifying_VVG options_NNS to_TO adapt_VV 
to_TO climate-change_NN effects_NNS and_CC evaluating_VVG them_PP in_IN terms_NNS of_IN criteria_NNS such_JJ as_RB 
availability_NN ,_, benefits_NNS ,_, costs_NNS ,_, effectiveness_NN ,_, efficiency_NN and_CC feasibility_NN is_VBZ known_VVN 
as_IN adaptation_NN assessment_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Adaptation_NN Baseline_NN :_: Any_DT datum_NN (_( baseline_NN or_CC reference_NN )_) against_IN which_WDT

future_JJ set_NN of_IN conditions_NNS excluding_VVG the_DT driving_VVG factor_NN of_IN interest_NN ._SENT

._SENT Adaptation_NN Deficit_NN :_: Failure_NN to_TO adapt_VV adequately_RB to_TO existing_VVG climate_NN risks_NNS

unless_IN a_DT serious_JJ adaptation_NN program_NN is_VBZ implemented_VVN ._SENT

._SENT Adaptation_NN Policy_NP Framework_NP (_( APF_NP )_) :_: Structural_JJ process_NN for_IN

._SENT Aerosols_NNS :_: A_DT collection_NN of_IN airborne_JJ solid_JJ or_CC liquid_JJ particles_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT

._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ :_: It_PP is_VBZ related_VVN to_TO the_DT influence_NN of_IN human_JJ beings_NNS or_CC their_PP$

activities_NNS that_WDT change_VVP the_DT environment_NN ._SENT In_IN some_DT cases_NNS the_DT chain_NN of_IN 
causality_NN of_IN human_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT climate_NN is_VBZ direct_JJ and_CC unambiguous_JJ 
(_( for_IN e.g._FW the_DT effects_NNS of_IN irrigation_NN on_IN local_JJ humidity_NN )_) ;_: while_IN in_IN other_JJ 
instances_VVZ it_PP is_VBZ less_RBR clear_JJ ._SENT 
._SENT Anthropogenic_JJ Emissions_NNS :_: Emissions_NNS of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS ,_, greenhouse_NN

energy_NN ,_, deforestation_NN ,_, and_CC land_NN use_NN changes_NNS that_WDT result_VVP in_IN net_JJ increase_NN in_IN

processes_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN anthropogenic_JJ source_NN ._SENT

._SENT Appropriate_JJ Technology_NP (_( AT_NP )_) :_: Technology_NN that_WDT is_VBZ designed_VVN with_IN

known_VVN as_IN appropriate_JJ technology_NN ._SENT With_IN environmental_JJ and_CC ethical_JJ goals_NNS

are_VBP easier_JJR to_TO maintain_VV and_CC have_VHP less_JJR impacts_NNS on_IN the_DT environment_NN

._SENT Assigned_JJ Amounts_NNS :_: Under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ,_, the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN 
greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS that_IN/that each_DT Annex_NP B_NP country_NN has_VHZ agreed_VVN that_IN/that its_PP$ 
emissions_NNS will_MD not_RB exceed_VV in_IN the_DT first_JJ commitment_NN period_NN (_( 2008_CD to_TO 2012_CD )_) 
is_VBZ the_DT assigned_JJ amount_NN ._SENT This_DT is_VBZ calculated_VVN by_IN multiplying_VVG the_DT country’s_NNS 
total_JJ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS in_IN 1990_CD by_IN five_CD (_( for_IN the_DT percentage_NN it_PP 
agreed_VVN to_TO as_RB listed_VVN in_IN Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP (_( e.g._FW 92_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT 
European_NP Union_NP and_CC 93_CD %_NN for_IN the_DT USA_NP )_) ._SENT 
._SENT Atmosphere_NN :_: The_DT gaseous_JJ envelop_VV surrounding_VVG the_DT Earth_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_RB

._SENT Black_NP Carbon_NP (_( BC_NP )_) :_: A_DT climate_NN forcing_VVG agent_NN formed_VVN through_IN the_DT

atmosphere_NN and_CC by_IN reducing_VVG albedo_NN ,_, the_DT ability_NN to_TO reflect_VV sunlight_NN ,_, when_WRB 

deposited_VVN on_IN snow_NN and_CC ice_NN ._SENT BC_NP remains_VVZ in_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN for_IN only_RB a_DT 
few_JJ weeks_NNS ._SENT

._SENT Carbon_NP Leakage_NP :_: The_DT part_NN of_IN emissions_NNS reductions_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP

of_IN better_JJR terms_NNS of_IN trade_NN ._SENT

carbon_NN sequestration_NN on_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN forested_JJ land_NN ._SENT

._SENT Chlorofluorocarbons_NNS :_: Greenhouse_NN gases_NNS covered_VVN under_IN the_DT 1987_CD

._SENT Climate_NN Risk_NN :_: The_DT likelihood_NN that_IN/that the_DT harmful_JJ effects_NNS will_MD happen_VV is_VBZ 
known_VVN as_IN climate_NN risk_NN or_CC it_PP is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT probability_NN of_IN harm_NN to_TO life_NN ,_,

Risk_NN is_VBZ estimated_VVN by_IN combining_VVG the_DT probability_NN of_IN events_NNS and_CC the_DT

hazards_NNS with_IN the_DT properties_NNS of_IN the_DT exposed_VVN systems_NNS i.e._FW their_PP$ sensitivity_NN 
or_CC social_JJ vulnerability_NN ._SENT Risk_NN can_MD also_RB be_VB considered_VVN as_IN the_DT combination_NN 
of_IN an_DT event_NN ,_, its_PP$ likelihood_NN and_CC its_PP$ consequences_NN i.e._FW risk_NN equals_VVZ the_DT 
probability_NN of_IN climate_NN hazard_NN multiplied_VVN by_IN a_DT given_VVN system’s_NN vulnerability_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Climate_NN Sensitivity_NN :_: A_DT measure_NN of_IN how_WRB responsive_JJ the_DT temperature_NN of_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG is_VBZ known_VVN as_RB

._SENT Climate_NN Shift_NN :_: An_DT abrupt_JJ shift_NN or_CC jump_NN in_IN mean_JJ values_NNS signaling_VVG a_DT change_NN

to_TO a_DT change_NN in_IN El_NP Niño-Southern_NP Oscillation_NP behaviour_NN ._SENT 

._SENT climate-system_NN :_: The_DT climate-system_NN is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB complex_JJ system_NN 
consisting_VVG of_IN five_CD major_JJ components_NNS :_: the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, the_DT hydrosphere_NN ,_, 
the_DT cryosphere_NN ,_, the_DT land_NN surface_NN and_CC the_DT biosphere_NN and_CC the_DT interactions_NNS 
between_IN them_PP ._SENT The_DT climate-system_NN evolves_VVZ in_IN time_NN under_IN the_DT influence_NN 
of_IN its_PP$ own_JJ internal_JJ dynamics_NNS and_CC because_IN of_IN external_JJ forcing_VVG such_JJ as_RB 
volcanic_JJ eruptions_NNS ,_, solar_JJ variations_NNS and_CC anthropogenic_JJ forcing_VVG such_JJ as_RB 
the_DT changing_VVG composition_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN use_NN change_NN ._SENT

._SENT Climate_NN Variability_NN :_: Variations_NNS in_IN the_DT mean_JJ state_NN and_CC other_JJ statistics_NNS

climate_NN on_IN all_DT spatial_JJ and_CC temporal_JJ scales_NNS beyond_IN that_IN/that of_IN individual_NN

._SENT Climate_NN Variation_NN :_: Change_VV in_IN the_DT statistical_JJ properties_NNS of_IN the_DT climate_NN 
system_NN when_WRB considered_VVN over_IN periods_NNS of_IN decades_NNS or_CC longer_JJR ,_, regardless_RB 
of_IN cause_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN climate_NN variation_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Climatology_NN (_( Climate_NN Science_NN )_) :_: The_DT study_NN of_IN climate_NN ,_, scientifically_RB

._SENT Cloud_NP Albedo_NP Effect_NP or_CC Twomey_NP Effect_NP :_: A_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG induced_VVN 
by_IN an_DT increase_NN in_IN anthropogenic_JJ aerosols_NNS which_WDT cause_VVP an_DT initial_JJ increase_NN 
in_IN droplet_NN concentration_NN and_CC a_DT decrease_NN in_IN droplet_NN size_NN for_IN fixed_VVN liquid_NN 
water_NN content_NN leading_VVG to_TO an_DT increase_NN of_IN cloud_NN albedo_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN cloud_NN 
albedo_NN effect_NN or_CC “_JJ Twomey_NP effect_NN ._SENT ”_NN 
._SENT Cloud_NP Lifetime_NP Effect_NP or_CC Albrecht_NP Effect_NP :_: A_DT radiative_JJ forcing_VVG 
induced_VVN by_IN an_DT increase_NN in_IN anthropogenic_JJ aerosols_NNS which_WDT cause_VVP a_DT 
decrease_NN in_IN droplet_NN size_NN ,_, reducing_VVG the_DT precipitation_NN efficiency_NN ,_, thereby_RB 
modifying_VVG the_DT liquid_JJ water_NN content_NN ,_, cloud_NN thickness_NN and_CC cloud_NN lifetime_NN is_VBZ 
known_VVN as_IN “_JJ cloud_NN lifetime_NN effect_NN ”_NN or_CC “_JJ Albrecht_NP affect_NN ._SENT ”_NN

._SENT Conservation_NN of_IN Natural_NP Resources_NPS :_: The_DT wise_JJ use_NN of_IN the_DT earth’s_NNS

._SENT Coping_VVG Capacity_NN :_: The_DT ability_NN of_IN people_NNS ,_, organizations_NNS and_CC systems_NNS ,_,

._SENT Disaster_NN :_: A_DT serious_JJ disruption_NN of_IN the_DT functioning_NN of_IN a_DT community_NN or_CC a_DT 
society_NN causing_VVG widespread_JJ human_NN ,_, material_NN ,_, economic_JJ or_CC 
environmental_JJ losses_NNS which_WDT exceed_VVP the_DT ability_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ community_NN 
or_CC society_NN to_TO cope_VV using_VVG its_PP$ own_JJ resources_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN disaster_NN ._SENT 
Disasters_NNS are_VBP often_RB described_VVN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT combination_NN of_IN :_: the_DT 
exposure_NN to_TO a_DT hazard_NN ;_: the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN vulnerability_NN that_WDT are_VBP present_JJ ;_: 
and_CC insufficient_JJ capacity_NN or_CC measures_VVZ to_TO reduce_VV or_CC cope_VV with_IN the_DT 
potential_JJ negative_JJ consequences_NNS ._SENT Disaster_NN impacts_NNS may_MD include_VV loss_NN of_IN 
life_NN ,_, injury_NN ,_, disease_NN and_CC other_JJ negative_JJ effects_NNS on_IN human_JJ physical_JJ ,_, mental_JJ 
and_CC social_JJ well-being_NN together_RB with_IN damage_NN to_TO property_NN ,_, destruction_NN of_IN 
assets_NNS ,_, loss_NN of_IN services_NNS ,_, social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ disruption_NN and_CC 
environmental_JJ degradation_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Disaster_NN Risk_NN :_: The_DT potential_JJ disaster_NN losses_NNS ,_, in_IN lives_NNS ,_, health_NN status_NN ,_,

community_NN or_CC a_DT society_NN over_IN some_DT specified_JJ future_JJ time_NN period_NN is_VBZ known_VVN 
as_IN disaster_NN risk_NN ._SENT The_DT definition_NN of_IN disaster_NN risk_NN reflects_VVZ the_DT concept_NN of_IN 
disasters_NNS as_IN the_DT outcome_NN of_IN continuously_RB present_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN risk_NN ._SENT 
Disaster_NN risk_NN comprises_VVZ different_JJ types_NNS of_IN potential_JJ losses_NNS which_WDT are_VBP 

often_RB difficult_JJ to_TO quantify_VV ._SENT Nevertheless_RB ,_, with_IN knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT prevailing_JJ 
hazards_NNS and_CC the_DT patterns_NNS of_IN population_NN and_CC socio-economic_JJ 
development_NN ,_, disaster_NN risks_NNS can_MD be_VB assessed_VVN and_CC mapped_VVN in_IN broad_JJ terms_NNS 
at_IN least_JJS ._SENT 
._SENT Disaster_NN Risk_NP Management_NP :_: The_DT systematic_JJ process_NN of_IN using_VVG

._SENT Drought_NN :_: The_DT phenomenon_NN that_WDT exists_VVZ when_WRB precipitation_NN has_VHZ been_VBN

._SENT Energy_NP Tax_NP :_: An_DT energy_NN tax_NN is_VBZ a_DT levy_NN on_IN the_DT energy_NN content_NN of_IN fuels_NNS 
reduces_VVZ demand_NN for_IN energy_NN and_CC so_RB reduces_VVZ carbon_NN dioxide_NN emissions_NNS

._SENT Forest_NP Degradation_NP :_: Changes_NNS within_IN the_DT forest_NN which_WDT negatively_RB

._SENT Global_NP Warming_NP :_: The_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN observed_VVD or_CC projected_VVD in_RP

forcing_VVG caused_VVN by_IN anthropogenic_JJ emissions_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN global_JJ warming_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Global_NP Warming_NP Potential_JJ :_: An_DT index_NN ,_, describing_VVG the_DT radiative_JJ 
characteristics_NNS of_IN well-mixed_JJ greenhouse_NN gases_NNS that_WDT represents_VVZ the_DT

atmosphere_NN and_CC their_PP$ relative_JJ effectiveness_NN in_IN absorbing_VVG outgoing_JJ 
infrared_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN global_JJ warming_NN potential_NN ._SENT This_DT index_NN 
approximates_VVZ the_DT time-integrated_JJ warming_NN effect_NN of_IN a_DT unit_NN mass_NN of_IN a_DT 
given_VVN greenhouse_NN gas_NN in_IN today’s_NN atmosphere_NN ,_, relative_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN ._SENT

._SENT Greenhouse_NN Effect_NNS :_: Greenhouse_NN gases_VVZ effectively_RB absorb_VV thermal_JJ 
infrared_JJ radiation_NN ,_, emitted_VVN by_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN 
itself_PP due_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ gases_NNS ,_, and_CC by_IN clouds_NNS ._SENT Atmospheric_JJ radiation_NN is_VBZ 
emitted_VVN to_TO all_DT sides_NNS ,_, including_VVG downward_RB to_TO the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN ._SENT Thus_RB ,_, 
greenhouse_NN gases_NNS trap_NN heat_NN within_IN the_DT surface-troposphere_NN system_NN ._SENT This_DT 
is_VBZ called_VVN the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT Thermal_JJ infrared_JJ radiation_NN in_IN the_DT 
troposphere_NN is_VBZ strongly_RB coupled_VVN to_TO the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN at_IN 
the_DT altitude_NN at_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ emitted_VVN ._SENT In_IN the_DT troposphere_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN 
generally_RB decreases_NNS with_IN height_NN ._SENT Effectively_RB ,_, infrared_JJ radiation_NN emitted_VVN to_TO 
space_NN originates_VVZ from_IN an_DT altitude_NN with_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN on_IN average_JJ ,_, 
–_NP 190C_NP ,_, in_IN balance_NN with_IN the_DT net_JJ incoming_JJ solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT 
Earth’s_NP surface_NN is_VBZ kept_VVN at_IN a_DT much_RB higher_JJR temperature_NN of_IN on_IN average_JJ ,_, 
+140C_NN ._SENT An_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN greenhouse_NN gases_NNS leads_VVZ to_TO 
an_DT increased_VVN infrared_JJ opacity_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB to_TO an_DT 
effective_JJ radiation_NN into_IN space_NN from_IN a_DT higher_JJR altitude_NN at_IN a_DT lower_JJR 
temperature_NN ._SENT This_DT causes_VVZ a_DT radioactive_JJ forcing_VVG that_IN/that leads_NNS to_TO an_DT 
enhancement_NN of_IN the_DT greenhouse_NN effect_NN ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ enhanced_JJ 
greenhouse_NN effect_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Greenhouse_NN Gases_NNS :_: The_DT atmospheric_JJ gases_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN causing_VVG 
global_JJ warming_NN and_CC climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT major_JJ GHGs_NNS are_VBP carbon_NN 
dioxide_NN (_( CO2_NP )_) ,_, methane_NN (_( CH4_NP )_) and_CC nitrous_JJ oxide_NN (_( N2O_NP )_) ._SENT Less_JJR

(_( HFCs_NP )_) ,_, periflurocarbons_NNS (_( PFCs_NP )_) and_CC sulphur_NN hexafluoride_NN (_( SF6_NP )_) ._SENT

._SENT Hybrid_NN :_: It_PP is_VBZ used_VVN here_RB to_TO refer_VV to_TO approaches_NNS that_WDT apply_VVP uniform_JJ and_NP

._SENT Hydro_NP Meteorological_NP Hazard_NP :_: Process_NN or_CC phenomenon_NN of_IN

._SENT Hydrofluorocarbons_NP (_( HFC5_NP )_) :_: Among_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB 
curbed_VVN under_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT They_PP are_VBP produced_VVN commercially_RB as_RB

Potentials_NNS range_VVP from_IN 1_CD ,_, 300_CD to_TO 11_CD ,_, 700._CD 
._SENT Hydrological_JJ Cycle_NP :_: The_DT process_NN of_IN evaporation_NN ,_, vertical_JJ and_NP 
horizontal_JJ transport_NN of_IN vapor_NN ,_, condensation_NN ,_, precipitation_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT flow_NN 
of_IN water_NN from_IN continents_NNS to_TO oceans_NNS is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN hydrological_JJ cycle_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ 
a_DT major_JJ factor_NN in_IN determining_VVG climate_NN through_IN its_PP$ influence_NN on_IN surface_NN 
vegetation_NN ,_, the_DT clouds_NNS ,_, snow_NN and_CC ice_NN ,_, and_CC soil_NN moisture_NN ._SENT The_DT hydrologic_JJ 
cycle_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN 25_CD to_TO 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT mid-latitudes’_JJ heat_NN 
transport_NN from_IN the_DT equatorial_NN to_TO polar_JJ regions_NNS ._SENT

._SENT ILO_NP Convention_NP 169_CD :_: ILO_NP Convention_NP 169_CD is_VBZ a_DT legally_RB binding_JJ

._SENT Interaction_NP Effect_NP :_: The_DT result_NN or_CC consequence_NN of_IN the_DT interaction_NN of_IN

costs_NNS of_IN production_NN and_CC the_DT prices_NNS of_IN output_NN ,_, thus_RB reducing_VVG the_DT real_JJ 
return_NN to_TO labor_NN and_CC capital_NN ._SENT

._SENT Land_NP Degradation_NP :_: The_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Convention_NP to_TO Combat_NP 
Desertification_NN defines_VVZ land_NN degradation_NN as_IN a_DT reduction_NN or_CC loss_NN in_IN arid_JJ ,_,

productivity_NN and_CC complexity_NN of_IN rain-fed_JJ cropland_NN ,_, irrigated_VVN cropland_NN ,_, or_CC 
range_NN ,_, pasture_NN ,_, forest_NN and_CC woodlands_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN land_NN uses_NNS or_CC from_IN a_DT

human_JJ activities_NNS and_CC habitation_NN patterns_NNS such_JJ as_IN :_: (_( i_NP )_) soil_NN erosion_NN caused_VVD 
by_IN wind_NN and_CC /_SYM or_CC water_NN ;_: (_( ii_NP )_) deterioration_NN of_IN the_DT physical_JJ ,_, chemical_JJ and_NP 
biological_JJ or_CC economic_JJ properties_NNS of_IN soil_NN ;_: and_CC (_( iii_NNS )_) long-term_JJ loss_NN of_IN 
natural_JJ vegetation_NN ._SENT Land_NN degradation_NN is_VBZ a_DT concept_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT value_NN of_IN 
the_DT biophysical_JJ environment_NN is_VBZ affected_VVN by_IN one_CD or_CC more_JJR combination_NN of_IN 
human-induced_JJ processes_NNS acting_VVG upon_IN the_DT land_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ viewed_VVN as_IN any_DT change_NN 
or_CC disturbance_NN to_TO the_DT land_NN perceived_VVN to_TO be_VB deleterious_JJ or_CC undesirable_JJ ._SENT 
._SENT Land_NP Pollution_NP :_: Land_NN pollution_NN is_VBZ the_DT degradation_NN of_IN Earth’s_NP land_NN

._SENT Land_NP Use_NP Planning_NP :_: The_DT process_NN undertaken_VVN by_IN public_JJ authorities_NNS to_TO

planning_NN ._SENT Land-use_NN planning_NN can_MD help_VV to_TO mitigate_VV disasters_NNS and_CC reduce_VV

._SENT Land_NP Use_NP ,_, Land_NP Use_NP Change_NP and_CC Forestry_NP (_( LULUCF_NP )_) :_: Land_NN use_NN ,_,

._SENT Landslide_NN :_: A_DT mass_NN of_IN material_NN that_WDT has_VHZ slipped_VVN downhill_RB by_IN gravity_NN ,_,

._SENT Leakage_NN :_: The_DT part_NN of_IN emissions_NNS reductions_NNS in_IN Annex_NP B_NP countries_NNS that_RB 
may_MD be_VB offset_VVN by_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT emission_NN in_IN the_DT non-constrained_JJ

by_IN lower_JJR demand_NN for_IN these_DT energies_NNS ;_: and_CC (_( iii_NN )_) changes_NNS in_IN incomes_NNS (_( thus_RB in_IN

to_TO the_DT situation_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT carbon_NN sequestration_NN activity_NN (_( e.g._FW tree_NN

of_IN the_DT initial_JJ activity_NN ._SENT

affects_VVZ the_DT degradation_NN of_IN the_DT ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT

._SENT Mitigation_NN :_: In_IN the_DT context_NN of_IN climate-change_NN ,_, mitigation_NN is_VBZ a_DT human_NN

._SENT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP :_: The_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP on_IN substances_NNS that_RB

subsequently_RB adjusted_VVN and_CC amended_VVN in_IN London_NP (_( 1990_CD )_) ,_, Copenhagen_NP 
(_( 1992_CD )_) ,_, Vienna_NP (_( 1995_CD )_) ,_, Montreal_NP (_( 1997_CD )_) ,_, and_CC Beijing_NP (_( 1999_CD )_) ._SENT It_PP

nongovernmental_JJ organizations_NNS and_CC individual_JJ stakeholders_NNS ._SENT 
._SENT National_NP Communication_NP :_: A_DT document_NN submitted_VVN in_IN accordance_NN with_IN

._SENT Natural_JJ Disaster_NN :_: A_DT natural_JJ disaster_NN is_VBZ the_DT effect_NN of_IN a_DT natural_JJ hazard_NN 
(_( e.g._FW flood_NN ,_, tornado_NN ,_, hurricane_NN ,_, volcanic_JJ eruption_NN ,_, earthquake_NN or_CC

vulnerability_NN ._SENT ”_NN A_DT natural_JJ hazard_NN will_MD hence_RB never_RB result_VV in_IN a_DT natural_NN 
disaster_NN in_IN areas_NNS without_IN vulnerability_NN (_( e.g._FW strong_JJ earthquakes_NNS in_IN 
uninhabited_JJ areas_NNS )_) ._SENT

._SENT Natural_NP Hazard_NP :_: Natural_JJ process_NN or_CC phenomenon_NN that_WDT may_MD cause_VV loss_NN

._SENT Offset_VVN :_: A_DT carbon_NN offset_VVN is_VBZ a_DT reduction_NN in_IN emissions_NNS of_IN carbon_NN or_CC

._SENT Ozone_NN :_: The_DT triatomic_JJ form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN (_( O3_NP )_) is_VBZ a_DT gaseous_JJ atmospheric_JJ

._SENT Ozone_NN Layer_NP :_: The_DT stratosphere_NN contains_VVZ a_DT layer_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT 
concentration_NN of_IN ozone_NN is_VBZ greatest_JJS ;_: this_DT is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN ozone_NN layer_NN ._SENT The_DT 
layer_NN extends_VVZ from_IN about_RB 12_CD to_TO 40_CD km_NN ._SENT The_DT ozone_NN concentration_NN reaches_VVZ 
a_DT maximum_NN between_IN about_RB 20_CD and_CC 25_CD km_NN ._SENT This_DT layer_NN is_VBZ being_VBG depleted_VVN 
by_IN human_JJ emissions_NNS of_IN chlorine_NN and_CC bromine_NN compounds_NNS ._SENT Every_DT year_NN ,_, 
during_IN the_DT Southern_NP Hemisphere_NP spring_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB strong_JJ depletion_NN of_IN the_DT 
ozone_NN layer_NN takes_VVZ place_NN over_IN the_DT Antarctic_JJ region_NN also_RB caused_VVD by_IN 
human-made_JJ chlorine_NN and_CC bromine_NN compounds_NNS in_IN combination_NN with_IN the_DT 
specific_JJ meteorological_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN that_DT region_NN ._SENT This_DT phenomenon_NN is_VBZ 
called_VVN the_DT ozone_NN hole_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Ozone_NN Layer_NP Depletion_NP :_: Ozone_NN depletion_NN describes_VVZ two_CD distinct_JJ but_NN 
related_JJ observations_NNS :_: a_DT slow_JJ ,_, steady_JJ decline_NN of_IN about_RB four_CD per_IN cent_NN per_IN 
decade_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN ozone_NN in_IN Earth’s_NP stratosphere_NN (_( the_DT ozone_NN 
layer_NN )_) since_IN the_DT late_JJ 1970s_NNS and_CC a_DT much_RB larger_JJR but_CC seasonal_JJ decrease_NN in_IN 
stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN over_IN Earth’s_NP polar_JJ regions_NNS during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ._SENT 
The_DT latter_JJ phenomenon_NN is_VBZ commonly_RB referred_VVN to_TO as_IN the_DT ozone_NN hole_NN ._SENT In_RB 
addition_NN to_TO this_DT well-known_JJ stratospheric_JJ ozone_NN depletion_NN there_RB are_VBP also_RB 
tropospheric_JJ ozone_NN depletion_NN events_NNS which_WDT occur_VVP near_IN the_DT surface_NN in_IN 
Polar_JJ Regions_NNS during_IN spring_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Ozone_NN Pollution_NN :_: Ozone_NN pollution_NN is_VBZ a_DT form_NN of_IN pollution_NN which_WDT is_VBZ 
characterized_VVN by_IN high_JJ concentrations_NNS of_IN ozone_NN ,_, a_DT form_NN of_IN oxygen_NN ,_, at_IN 
ground_NN level_NN ._SENT Exposure_NN to_TO ozone_NN can_MD cause_VV serious_JJ health_NN problems_NNS in_IN

regions_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ._SENT

._SENT Parameterization_NN :_: In_IN climate_NN models_NNS ,_, this_DT term_NN refers_VVZ to_TO the_DT technique_NN

spatial_JJ or_CC temporal_JJ resolution_NN of_IN the_DT model_NN (_( sub-grid_JJ scale_NN processes_NNS )_)

sub-grid-scale_JJ processes_NNS and_CC the_DT larger_JJR scale_NN flow_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Parts_NNS Per_IN Billion_NP (_( ppb_NN )_) :_: Represents_VVZ the_DT concentration_NN of_IN something_NN in_IN 
water_NN or_CC soil_NN ._SENT One_CD ppb_NN represents_VVZ one_CD microgram_NN of_IN something_NN per_IN liter_NN 
of_IN water_NN (_( ug_NN /_SYM l_NN )_) or_CC one_CD microgram_NN of_IN something_NN per_IN kilogram_NN of_IN soil_NN 
(_( ug_NN /_SYM kg_NN )_) ._SENT 
._SENT Parts_NNS Per_IN Million_NP (_( ppm_NN )_) :_: This_DT is_VBZ a_DT way_NN of_IN expressing_VVG very_RB dilute_VV 
concentrations_NNS of_IN substances_NNS ._SENT Just_RB as_RB per_IN cent_NN means_VVZ out_RP of_IN a_DT hundred_CD ,_, 
so_RB parts_NNS per_IN million_CD or_CC ppm_NN means_VVZ out_RP of_IN a_DT million_CD ._SENT Usually_RB describes_VVZ the_DT 
concentration_NN of_IN something_NN in_IN water_NN or_CC soil_NN ._SENT One_CD ppm_NN is_VBZ equivalent_JJ to_TO 
one_CD milligram_NN of_IN something_NN per_IN liter_NN of_IN water_NN (_( mg_NN /_SYM l_NN )_) or_CC one_CD milligram_NN of_IN 
something_NN per_IN kilogram_NN soil_NN (_( mg_NN /_SYM kg_NN )_) ._SENT

._SENT Perfluorocarbons_NP (_( PFCs_NP )_) :_: It_PP is_VBZ among_IN the_DT six_CD greenhouse_NN gases_NNS to_TO be_VB

._SENT Precipitation_NN :_: Precipitation_NN is_VBZ any_DT product_NN of_IN the_DT condensation_NN of_IN

that_DT can_MD lead_VV to_TO air_VV becoming_VVG saturated_JJ :_: cooling_VVG the_DT air_NN or_CC adding_VVG water_NN 
vapor_NN to_TO the_DT air_NN ._SENT

._SENT Rainfall_NN :_: Rain_NN is_VBZ liquid_JJ precipitation_NN ,_, as_RB opposed_VVN to_TO non-liquid_JJ kinds_NNS of_IN

point_NN of_IN water_NN near_IN and_CC above_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP surface_NN 
._SENT Rapid_JJ Climate_NN Change_NP :_: The_DT non-linearity_JJ of_IN the_DT climate-system_NN may_MD

rapidly_RB changing_VVG and_CC forcing_VVG of_IN a_DT non-linear_JJ system_NN ._SENT

._SENT Region_NN :_: A_DT region_NN is_VBZ a_DT territory_NN characterized_VVN by_IN specific_JJ geographical_JJ 
and_CC climatological_JJ features_NNS ._SENT The_DT climate_NN of_IN a_DT region_NN is_VBZ affected_VVN by_IN

._SENT Residual_JJ Risk_NN :_: The_DT risk_NN that_WDT remains_VVZ in_IN unmanaged_JJ form_NN ,_, even_RB when_WRB

system_NN is_VBZ capable_JJ of_IN organizing_VVG itself_PP to_TO increase_VV its_PP$ capacity_NN for_IN learning_VVG

exposed_VVN to_TO hazards_NNS to_TO resist_VV ,_, absorb_VV ,_, accommodate_VV to_TO and_CC recover_VV from_IN

changing_VVG state_NN ._SENT

._SENT Response_NP Time_NP :_: The_DT response_NN time_NN or_CC adjustment_NN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT time_NN

processes_NNS or_CC feedbacks_NNS ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ very_RB different_JJ for_IN various_JJ components_NNS of_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT The_DT response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT troposphere_NN is_VBZ relatively_RB 
short_RB ,_, from_IN days_NNS to_TO weeks_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN comes_VVZ into_IN 
equilibrium_NN on_IN a_DT time_NN scale_NN of_IN typically_RB a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ._SENT Due_JJ to_TO their_PP$ large_JJ 
heat_NN capacity_NN the_DT oceans_NNS have_VHP a_DT much_RB longer_JJR response_NN time_NN ,_, typically_RB 
decades_NNS but_CC up_RB to_TO centuries_NNS or_CC millennia_NNS ._SENT The_DT response_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT strongly_RB 
coupled_VVN surface_NN troposphere_NN system_NN is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, slow_RB compared_VVN to_TO 
that_DT of_IN the_DT stratosphere_NN and_CC mainly_RB determined_VVN by_IN the_DT oceans_NNS ._SENT The_DT 
biosphere_NN may_MD respond_VV fast_RB (_( e.g._FW to_TO droughts_NNS )_) but_CC also_RB very_RB slowly_RB to_TO 
imposed_VVN changes_NNS ._SENT

equals_VVZ the_DT probability_NN of_IN climate_NN hazard_NN multiplied_VVN by_IN a_DT given_VVN system’s_NNS

._SENT Risk_NP Assessment_NP :_: A_DT methodology_NN to_TO determine_VV the_DT nature_NN and_CC extent_NN

._SENT Risk_NP Management_NP :_: The_DT systematic_JJ approach_NN and_CC practice_NN of_IN

._SENT Risk_NN Transfer_NN :_: The_DT process_NN of_IN formally_RB or_CC informally_RB shifting_VVG the_DT

and_CC re-insurance_NN contracts_NNS ,_, catastrophe_NN bonds_NNS ,_, contingent_JJ credit_NN

investor_NN contributions_NNS ,_, interest_NN rates_NNS and_CC past_JJ savings_NNS respectively_RB ._SENT

._SENT Sensitivity_NN :_: The_DT degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN is_VBZ affected_VVN ,_, either_CC adversely_RB

to_TO sea-level_NN rise_NN )_) ._SENT 
._SENT Sequestration_NN :_: The_DT process_NN of_IN increasing_VVG the_DT carbon_NN content_NN of_IN a_DT

approaches_NNS include_VVP separation_NN and_CC disposal_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN from_IN flue_NN

oil_NN and_CC gas_NN reservoirs_NNS ,_, coal_NN seams_NNS and_CC saline_JJ aquifers_NNS ._SENT 
._SENT Shock_NN :_: Shocks_NNS are_VBP sudden_JJ ,_, unexpected_JJ or_CC unpredictable_JJ events_NNS that_RB 
have_VHP impacts_NNS on_IN livelihood_NN security_NN are_VBP known_VVN as_IN shock_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Silviculture_NN :_: Development_NN and_CC care_NN of_IN forests_NNS or_CC the_DT art_NN of_IN producing_VVG 
and_CC tending_VVG a_DT forest_NN by_IN manipulating_VVG its_PP$ establishment_NN ,_, composition_NN and_CC 
growth_NN to_TO best_JJS fulfill_VVP the_DT objectives_NNS of_IN the_DT owner_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN silviculture_NN ._SENT 
Silviculture_NN is_VBZ the_DT science_NN ,_, art_NN and_CC practice_NN of_IN caring_VVG for_IN forests_NNS with_IN 
respect_NN to_TO human_JJ objectives_NNS ._SENT This_DT may_MD or_CC may_MD not_RB include_VV timber_NN 
production_NN ._SENT The_DT name_NN comes_VVZ from_IN the_DT Latin_JJ silvi-_NN (_( forest_NN )_) +_SYM culture_NN (_( as_IN 
in_IN growing_VVG )_) ._SENT 
._SENT Sink_NN :_: Any_DT process_NN ,_, activity_NN or_CC mechanism_NN that_WDT removes_VVZ a_DT greenhouse_NN

._SENT Snow_NN :_: Snow_NP is_VBZ a_DT type_NN of_IN precipitation_NN within_IN the_DT Earth’s_NP atmosphere_NN in_IN

._SENT Technological_JJ Hazard_NP :_: A_DT hazard_NN originating_VVG from_IN technological_JJ or_CC

technological_JJ hazards_NNS include_VVP industrial_JJ pollution_NN ,_, nuclear_JJ radiation_NN ,_, toxic_JJ 
wastes_NNS ,_, dam_NN failures_NNS ,_, transport_NN accidents_NNS ,_, factory_NN explosions_NNS ,_, fires_NNS and_CC

of_IN the_DT impacts_NNS of_IN a_DT natural_JJ hazard_NN event_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Technological_JJ Potential_JJ :_: The_DT amount_NN by_IN which_WDT it_PP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO reduce_VV

._SENT Temperature_NN :_: Temperature_NN is_VBZ a_DT physical_JJ property_NN of_IN matter_NN that_RB

._SENT United_NP Nations_NPS Framework_NP Convention_NP on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP 
(_( UNFCCC_NP )_) :_: The_DT Convention_NN was_VBD adopted_VVN on_IN 9_CD May_NP 1992_CD in_IN New_NP

at_IN a_DT level_NN that_WDT would_MD prevent_VV dangerous_JJ anthropogenic_JJ interference_NN with_IN 
the_DT climate-system_NN ._SENT ”_NN It_PP contains_VVZ commitments_NNS for_IN all_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT Under_IN the_DT 
Convention_NN ,_, Parties_NNS included_VVD in_IN Annex_NP I_PP aim_VVP to_TO return_VV greenhouse_NN gas_NN 
emissions_NNS not_RB controlled_VVN by_IN the_DT Montreal_NP Protocol_NP to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT 
year_NN 2000._CD The_DT Convention_NN entered_VVN into_IN force_NN in_IN March_NP 1994._CD See_VV also_RB 
Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP and_CC Conference_NP of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) ._SENT 
._SENT UN_NP REDD_NP Programme_NP :_: The_DT UN-REDD_NP Programme_NP is_VBZ the_DT United_NP

._SENT Voluntary_JJ Carbon_NP Offset_NP Mechanism_NP :_: These_DT mechanisms_NNS are_VBP based_VVN 
on_IN the_DT notion_NN that_IN/that greenhouse_NN gases_NNS produce_VVP the_DT same_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT 
climate_NN wherever_WRB they_PP are_VBP emitted_VVN from_IN and_CC that_IN/that if_IN in_IN certain_JJ conditions_NNS it_PP 
proves_VVZ impossible_JJ to_TO reduce_VV emissions_NNS linked_VVN to_TO one’s_JJ own_JJ activities_NNS ,_, in_RB 
theory_NN enabling_VVG emissions_NNS to_TO be_VB cut_VVN elsewhere_RB will_MD have_VH the_DT same_JJ end_NN 
result_NN ._SENT For_IN example_NN ,_, companies_NNS buy_VVP a_DT “_JJ CO2_NP credit_NN ”_NN by_IN financing_VVG a_DT project_NN 
in_IN a_DT developing_VVG country_NN (_( or_CC an_DT emerging_VVG economy_NN )_) that_WDT will_MD allow_VV the_DT 
same_JJ amount_NN of_IN CO2_NP to_TO be_VB saved_VVN ;_: or_CC else_RB they_PP go_VVP onto_IN the_DT market_NN and_CC 
buy_VV carbon_NN credits_NNS generated_VVN by_IN actions_NNS that_WDT enabled_VVD emissions_NNS to_TO be_VB 
avoided_VVN or_CC credits_NNS resulting_VVG from_IN quota_NN surpluses_NNS ._SENT Industries_NPS can_MD ,_, 
however_RB ,_, help_VVP to_TO reduce_VV global_JJ greenhouse_NN emissions_NNS by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT 
voluntary_JJ carbon_NN offset_VVN mechanism_NN ._SENT 

._SENT Voluntary_JJ Carbon_NP Standard_NP :_: The_DT Voluntary_NP Carbon_NP Standard_NP (_( VCS_NP )_)

._SENT Voluntary_JJ Commitments_NNS :_: A_DT draft_NN article_NN considered_VVN during_IN the_DT

._SENT Voluntary_JJ Emission_NP Reduction_NP :_: Voluntary_JJ Emission_NN Reductions_NNS or_CC

usually_RB created_VVN by_IN projects_NNS which_WDT have_VHP been_VBN verified_VVN outside_IN of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP 
Protocol_NP ._SENT One_CD VER_NN is_VBZ equivalent_JJ to_TO one_CD metric_JJ ton_NN of_IN CO2_JJ emissions_NNS ._SENT 
Through_IN these_DT schemes_NNS ,_, industries_NNS and_CC individuals_NNS voluntarily_RB 
compensate_VV for_IN their_PP$ emissions_NNS or_CC provide_VV an_DT additional_JJ contribution_NN to_TO 
mitigating_JJ Climate_NN Change_NP ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerability_NN :_: Vulnerability_NN is_VBZ a_DT set_NN of_IN conditions_NNS and_CC processes_NNS 
resulting_VVG from_IN physical_JJ ,_, social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, and_CC environmental_JJ factors_NNS ,_, 
which_WDT increase_NN the_DT likelihood_NN that_IN/that a_DT community_NN will_MD negatively_RB affected_VVN 
by_IN a_DT climate_NN hazard_NN or_CC change_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ a_DT combination_NN of_IN exposure_NN to_TO 
climatic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, how_WRB sensitive_JJ the_DT community_NN is_VBZ to_TO those_DT conditions_NNS ,_, 
and_CC the_DT capacity_NN to_TO adapt_VV to_TO those_DT changes_NNS ,_, geographical_JJ ,_, climatic_JJ ,_, 
social_JJ ,_, economic_JJ ,_, physical_JJ ,_, environmental_JJ ,_, development_NN related_VVN ._SENT The_DT 
degree_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN is_VBZ susceptible_JJ to_TO or_CC unable_JJ to_TO cope_VV with_IN 
adverse_JJ effects_NNS of_IN Climate_NN Change_NP ,_, including_VVG climate_NN variability_NN and_NP 
extremes_NNS ._SENT Vulnerability_NN is_VBZ a_DT function_NN of_IN the_DT character_NN ,_, magnitude_NN and_CC rate_NN 
of_IN climate_NN variation_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT system_NN is_VBZ exposed_VVN ,_, its_PP$ sensitivity_NN ,_, and_CC its_PP$ 
adaptive_JJ capacity_NN ._SENT It_PP is_VBZ dependent_JJ on_IN a_DT wide_JJ variety_NN of_IN institutional_JJ ,_, 
economic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ factors_NNS ,_, not_RB all_DT of_IN which_WDT are_VBP linked_VVN directly_RB 
with_IN the_DT climate_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerability_NN Assessment_NP :_: Vulnerability_NN Assessment_NP identifies_VVZ who_WP and_NP 
what_WP is_VBZ exposed_VVN and_CC sensitive_JJ to_TO change_VV is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN vulnerability_NN 
assessment_NN ._SENT A_DT vulnerability_NN assessment_NN starts_VVZ by_IN considering_VVG the_DT factors_NNS 
that_WDT make_VVP people_NNS or_CC the_DT environment_NN susceptible_JJ to_TO harm_VV ,_, i.e._FW access_VV to_TO 

natural_JJ and_CC financial_JJ resources_NNS ;_: ability_NN to_TO self-protect_NN ;_: support_NN networks_NNS 
and_CC so_RB on_IN ._SENT Assessment_NN of_IN vulnerability_NN to_TO Climate_NN Change_VV mainly_RB 
involves_VVZ research_NN into_IN the_DT exposure_NN ,_, sensitivity_NN and_CC adaptive_JJ capacity_NN 
levels_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ impact_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, 
rising_VVG frequency_NN of_IN floods_NNS ._SENT The_DT governing_VVG factors_NNS of_IN vulnerability_NN 
assessment_NN studies_NNS mainly_RB include_VVP scale_NN of_IN assessment_NN ,_, the_DT kind_NN of_IN 
impact_NN or_CC hazard_NN being_VBG considered_VVN and_CC the_DT target_NN group_NN or_CC system_NN being_VBG 
assessed_VVD ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerability_NN Context_NN :_: Assessing_VVG local_JJ context_NN during_IN livelihood_NN analysis_NN 
is_VBZ vulnerability_NN context_NN ._SENT The_DT poor_JJ are_VBP constantly_RB insecure_JJ but_CC there_EX are_VBP 
certain_JJ factors_NNS and_CC trends_NNS that_WDT can_MD make_VV their_PP$ insecurity_NN much_RB deeper_RBR ._SENT 
Vulnerability_NN assessment_NN involves_VVZ an_DT analysis_NN of_IN factors_NNS and_CC long-term_JJ 
trends_NNS ._SENT Many_JJ of_IN these_DT factors_NNS come_VVN from_IN several_JJ levels_NNS away_RB from_IN the_DT 
immediate_JJ environment_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerability_NN to_TO Climate_NN Change_NP :_: The_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN a_DT system_NN 
which_WDT cause_VVP it_PP to_TO suffer_VV a_DT definite_JJ degradation_NN (_( incapability_NN to_TO perform_VV 
the_DT designated_VVN mission_NN )_) as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN having_VHG been_VBN subjected_VVN to_TO a_DT certain_JJ 
level_NN of_IN effects_NNS in_IN an_DT unnatural_JJ (_( manmade_JJ )_) hostile_JJ environment_NN is_VBZ known_VVN 
as_IN vulnerability_NN to_TO climate-change_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerable_JJ :_: Liable_JJ to_TO injury_NN ;_: subject_JJ to_TO be_VB affected_VVN injuriously_RB is_VBZ known_VVN 
as_IN vulnerable_JJ or_CC exposed_VVN to_TO the_DT possibility_NN of_IN being_VBG attacked_VVN or_CC harmed_VVN ,_, 
either_CC physically_RB or_CC emotionally_RB ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerable_JJ Communities_NPS :_: People_NNS with_IN special_JJ needs_NNS include_VVP 
members_NNS of_IN the_DT community_NN with_IN little_JJ or_CC no_DT ability_NN to_TO successfully_RB 
address_VV ,_, implement_VV or_CC be_VB fully_RB responsible_JJ for_IN their_PP$ own_JJ emergency_NN 
preparedness_NN ,_, response_NN or_CC recovery_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN vulnerable_JJ 
communities_NNS ._SENT This_DT includes_VVZ people_NNS whose_WP$ life_NN circumstances_NNS leave_VVP them_PP 
unable_JJ or_CC unwilling_JJ to_TO follow_VV emergency_NN instruction_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN anyone_NN 
unable_JJ or_CC unwilling_JJ to_TO fully_RB access_VV or_CC use_VV preparedness_NN and_CC responsive_JJ 
services_NNS ._SENT 
._SENT Vulnerable_JJ Groups_NNS :_: The_DT definition_NN of_IN vulnerable_JJ groups_NNS varies_VVZ between_IN 
countries_NNS ,_, but_CC amongst_IN the_DT most_RBS important_JJ defining_VVG characteristics_NNS are_VBP 
age_NN ,_, sex_NN ,_, ethnicity_NN and_CC location_NN ._SENT But_CC also_RB important_JJ are_VBP people_NNS with_IN 
disabilities_NNS and_CC stigmatized_VVN illnesses_NNS such_JJ as_IN mental_JJ ill-health_NN ._SENT In_IN areas_NNS 
facing_VVG war_NN or_CC civil_JJ conflicts_NNS displaced_VVN people_NNS and_CC refugees_NNS form_VVP an_DT 
important_JJ vulnerable_JJ group_NN ._SENT 

W_NP 
._SENT Water_NN :_: Water_NN is_VBZ a_DT chemical_JJ substance_NN with_IN the_DT chemical_NN formula_NN H2O_NP ._SENT 
Its_PP$ molecule_NN contains_VVZ one_CD oxygen_NN and_CC two_CD hydrogen_NN atoms_NNS connected_VVN 
by_IN covalent_JJ bonds_NNS ._SENT Water_NN is_VBZ a_DT liquid_NN at_IN ambient_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PP often_RB 
co-exists_NNS on_IN Earth_NN with_IN its_PP$ solid_JJ state_NN ,_, ice_NN and_CC gaseous_JJ state_NN (_( water_NN 
vapor_NN )_) ._SENT 
._SENT Water_NP Borne_NP Disease_NP :_: Waterborne_JJ diseases_NNS are_VBP caused_VVN by_IN 
pathogenic_JJ microorganisms_NNS which_WDT are_VBP directly_RB transmitted_VVN when_WRB 
contaminated_JJ fresh_JJ water_NN is_VBZ consumed_VVN ._SENT Contaminated_JJ fresh_JJ water_NN used_VVD 
in_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN food_NN can_MD be_VB the_DT source_NN of_IN food_NN borne_VVN disease_NN 
through_IN consumption_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ microorganisms_NNS ._SENT 
._SENT Water_NP Pollution_NP :_: The_DT contamination_NN of_IN water_NN bodies_NNS (_( e.g._FW lakes_NNS ,_, rivers_NNS ,_, 
oceans_NNS and_CC groundwater_NN )_) is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN water_NN pollution_NN ._SENT Water_NN pollution_NN 
occurs_VVZ when_WRB pollutants_NNS are_VBP discharged_VVN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB into_IN water_NN 
bodies_NNS without_IN adequate_JJ treatment_NN to_TO remove_VV harmful_JJ compounds_NNS ._SENT 
._SENT Water_NP Stress_NP :_: A_DT country_NN is_VBZ water-stressed_VVN if_IN the_DT available_JJ freshwater_NN 
supply_NN relative_JJ to_TO water_NN withdrawals_NNS acts_VVZ as_IN an_DT important_JJ constraint_NN on_IN 
development_NN ._SENT Withdrawals_NNS exceeding_VVG 20_CD %_NN of_IN renewable_JJ water_NN supply_NN 
has_VHZ been_VBN used_VVN as_IN an_DT indicator_NN of_IN water_NN stress_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Water_NP Use_NP Efficiency_NP :_: Carbon_NN gain_NN in_IN photosynthesis_NN per_IN unit_NN water_NN 
lost_VVN in_IN evapotranspiration_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN water_NN use_NN efficiency_NN ._SENT It_PP can_MD be_VB 
expressed_VVN on_IN a_DT short-term_JJ basis_NN as_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN photosynthetic_JJ carbon_NN 
gain_NN per_IN unit_NN transpirational_JJ water_NN loss_NN ,_, or_CC on_IN a_DT seasonal_JJ basis_NN as_IN the_DT 
ratio_NN of_IN net_JJ primary_JJ production_NN or_CC agricultural_JJ yield_NN to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN 
available_JJ water_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Weather_NN :_: The_DT behavior_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN on_IN a_DT day-to-day_JJ basis_NN in_IN a_DT 
relatively_RB local_JJ area_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN weather_NN ._SENT A_DT description_NN of_IN the_DT weather_NN 
would_MD include_VV daily_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, relative_JJ humidity_NN ,_, sunshine_NN ,_, wind_NN and_CC 
rainfall_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Weather_NN Forecast_NNS :_: The_DT application_NN of_IN science_NN and_CC technology_NN to_TO 
predict_VV the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN or_CC a_DT future_JJ time_NN and_CC a_DT given_VVN location_NN 
is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN weather_NN forecast_NN ._SENT Human_JJ beings_NNS have_VHP attempted_VVN to_TO predict_VV 

the_DT weather_NN informally_RB for_IN millennia_NNS ,_, and_CC formally_RB since_IN at_IN least_JJS the_DT 
nineteenth_JJ century_NN ._SENT Weather_NN forecasts_NNS are_VBP made_VVN by_IN collecting_VVG 
quantitative_JJ data_NNS about_IN the_DT current_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC using_VVG 
scientific_JJ understanding_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ processes_NNS to_TO project_VV how_WRB the_DT 
atmosphere_NN will_MD evolve_VV ._SENT 
._SENT Wind_NN :_: Wind_NN is_VBZ the_DT flow_NN of_IN gases_NNS on_IN a_DT large_JJ scale_NN ._SENT On_IN Earth_NP ,_, wind_NN 
consists_VVZ of_IN the_DT bulk_JJ movement_NN of_IN air_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Wind_NN Erosion_NN :_: Erosion_NN is_VBZ the_DT process_NN of_IN weathering_NN and_CC transport_VV of_IN 
solids_NNS (_( sediment_NN ,_, soil_NN ,_, rock_NN and_CC other_JJ particles_NNS )_) in_IN the_DT natural_NN 
environment_NN or_CC their_PP$ source_NN and_CC deposits_NNS them_PP elsewhere_RB ._SENT When_WRB it_PP 
occurs_VVZ due_JJ to_TO transport_VV by_IN wind_NN is_VBZ called_VVN wind_NN erosion_NN ._SENT 
._SENT Winter_NN :_: Winter_NN is_VBZ the_DT coldest_JJS season_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN in_IN temperate_JJ climates_NNS ,_, 
between_IN autumn_NN and_CC spring_NN ._SENT At_IN the_DT winter_NN solstice_NN ,_, the_DT days_NNS are_VBP shortest_JJS 
and_CC the_DT nights_NNS are_VBP longest_JJS ,_, with_IN days_NNS lengthening_VVG as_IN the_DT season_NN progresses_VVZ 
after_IN the_DT solstice_NN ._SENT 
._SENT WRE_NP Profiles_NP :_: The_DT carbon_NN dioxide_NN concentration_NN profiles_NNS leading_VVG to_TO 
stabilization_NN defined_VVN by_IN Wigley_NP ,_, Richels_NP ,_, and_CC Edmonds_NP (_( 1996_CD )_) whose_WP$ 
initials_NNS provide_VVP the_DT acronym_NN is_VBZ known_VVN as_IN WRE_NP profiles_NNS ._SENT For_IN any_DT given_VVN 
stabilization_NN level_NN ,_, these_DT profiles_NNS span_VVP a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN possibilities_NNS ._SENT 

Z_NP 
._SENT Zoning_NN :_: Zoning_NN is_VBZ a_DT device_NN of_IN land_NN use_NN planning_NN used_VVN by_IN local_JJ 
governments_NNS in_IN most_JJS developed_JJ countries_NNS ._SENT The_DT word_NN is_VBZ derived_VVN from_IN the_DT 
practice_NN of_IN designating_VVG permitted_VVN uses_NNS of_IN land_NN based_VVN on_IN mapped_VVN zones_NNS 
which_WDT separate_JJ one_CD set_NN of_IN land_NN uses_NNS from_IN another_DT ._SENT Zoning_NN may_MD be_VB 
use-based_JJ (_( regulating_VVG the_DT uses_NNS to_TO which_WDT land_NN may_MD be_VB put_VVN )_) or_CC it_PP may_MD 
regulate_VV building_NN height_NN ,_, lot_NN coverage_NN and_CC similar_JJ characteristics_NNS or_CC some_DT 
combination_NN of_IN these_DT ._SENT

I_PP )_) The_DT Players_NNS 



Ad_FW hoc_FW Group_NP on_IN Article_NP 13_CD (_( AG13_NP )_) -_: A_DT subsidiary_NN body_NN (_( committee_NN )_) created_VVN by_IN COP-1_NP to_TO explore_VV how_WRB to_TO help_VV governments_NNS overcome_VV difficulties_NNS they_PP may_MD experience_VV in_IN meeting_VVG their_PP$ commitments_NNS ._SENT 

Ad_FW hoc_FW Group_NP on_IN the_DT Berlin_NP Mandate_NP (_( AGBM_NP )_) -_: A_DT subsidiary_NN body_NN created_VVN by_IN COP-1_NP to_TO conduct_VV the_DT talks_NNS that_WDT led_VVD to_TO the_DT adoption_NN of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ;_: the_DT AGBM_NP concluded_VVD its_PP$ final_JJ meeting_NN on_IN 30_CD November_NP 1997._CD 

Annex_NP I_NP Parties_NP -_: The_DT industrialized_JJ countries_NNS listed_VVN in_IN this_DT annex_NN to_TO the_DT Convention_NP are_VBP trying_VVG to_TO return_VV their_PP$ greenhouse_NN gas_NN emissions_NNS to_TO 1990_CD levels_NNS by_IN the_DT year_NN 2000_CD as_IN per_IN Article_NP 4.2_CD (_( a_DT )_) and_CC (_( b_LS )_) ._SENT They_PP have_VHP also_RB accepted_VVN emission_NN targets_NNS for_IN the_DT period_NN 2008-12_CD as_IN per_IN Article_NP 3_CD and_CC Annex_NP B_NP of_IN the_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP ._SENT They_PP include_VVP the_DT 24_CD original_JJ OECD_NP members_NNS ,_, the_DT European_NP Union_NP ,_, and_CC 14_CD countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN (_( Croatia_NP ,_, Liechtenstein_NP ,_, Monaco_NP and_CC Slovenia_NP joined_VVD at_IN COP-3_NP ,_, and_CC the_DT Czech_NP Republic_NP and_CC Slovakia_NP replaced_VVD Czechoslovakia_NP )_) ._SENT

AOSIS_NN -_: The_DT Alliance_NP of_IN Small_NP Island_NP States_NPS is_VBZ an_DT ad_FW hoc_FW coalition_NN of_IN low-lying_JJ and_CC island_NN countries_NNS ._SENT These_DT countries_NNS are_VBP particularly_RB vulnerable_JJ to_TO sea-level_NN rise_NN and_CC share_NN common_JJ positions_NNS on_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT 42_CD members_NNS and_CC observers_NNS are_VBP American_NP Samoa_NP ,_, Antigua_NP and_CC Barbuda_NP ,_, Bahamas_NP ,_, Barbados_NP ,_, Belize_NP ,_, Cape_NP Verde_NP ,_, Comoros_NP ,_, Cook_NP Islands_NP ,_, Cuba_NP ,_, Cyprus_NP ,_, Dominica_NP ,_, Federated_NP States_NPS of_IN Micronesia_NP ,_, Fiji_NP ,_, Grenada_NP ,_, Guam_NP ,_, Guinea-Bissau_NP ,_, Guyana_NP ,_, Jamaica_NP ,_, Kiribati_NP ,_, Maldives_NP ,_, Malta_NP ,_, Marshall_NP Islands_NP ,_, Mauritius_NP ,_, Nauru_NP ,_, Netherlands_NP Antilles_NP ,_, Niue_NP ,_, Palau_NP ,_, Papua_NP New_NP Guinea_NP ,_, Samoa_NP ,_, Sao_NP Tome_NP and_CC Principe_NP ,_, Seychelles_NP ,_, Singapore_NP ,_, Solomon_NP Islands_NP ,_, St._NP Kitts_NP &_CC Nevis_NP ,_, St._NP Lucia_NP ,_, St._NP Vincent_NP and_CC the_DT Grenadines_NP ,_, Suriname_NP ,_, Tonga_NP ,_, Trinidad_NP and_CC Tobago_NP ,_, Tuvalu_NP ,_, US_NP Virgin_NP Islands_NPS ,_, and_CC Vanuatu_NP ._SENT 

Bureau_NP -_: Responsible_NP for_IN directing_VVG the_DT work_NN of_IN the_DT COP_NP ._SENT Its_PP$ 10_CD members_NNS are_VBP delegates_NNS elected_VVN by_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT five_CD regional_JJ groups_NNS and_CC they_PP include_VVP the_DT COP_NP President_NP ,_, six_CD Vice_NP Presidents_NPS ,_, the_DT Chairs_NNS of_IN SBI_NP and_CC SBSTA_NP ,_, and_CC a_DT rapporteur_NN ._SENT In_IN addition_NN ,_, each_DT subsidiary_NN body_NN also_RB has_VHZ its_PP$ own_JJ Bureau_NP ._SENT 

Chair_NN (_( or_CC chairman_NN etc._FW )_) -_: The_DT participating_VVG governments_NNS elect_VV a_DT Chair_NN for_IN the_DT subsidiary_NN bodies_NNS from_IN amongst_IN the_DT delegates_NNS ._SENT Different_JJ Chairs_NNS may_MD be_VB elected_VVN for_IN other_JJ informal_JJ groups_NNS ._SENT The_DT Chair_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN facilitating_VVG progress_NN towards_IN an_DT agreement_NN and_CC serves_VVZ during_IN the_DT inter-sessional_JJ period_NN until_IN the_DT start_NN of_IN the_DT next_JJ COP_NP ._SENT 

Committee_NN of_IN the_DT Whole_NP -_: Often_RB created_VVN by_IN a_DT COP_NP to_TO facilitate_VV the_DT process_NN of_IN negotiating_VVG text_NN ._SENT When_WRB the_DT Committee_NP finishes_VVZ its_PP$ work_NN it_PP turns_VVZ the_DT text_NN over_IN to_TO the_DT COP_NN which_WDT finalizes_VVZ and_CC then_RB formally_RB adopts_VVZ it_PP during_IN a_DT plenary_JJ session_NN ._SENT 

Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NP (_( COP_NP )_) -_: The_DT COP_NP is_VBZ the_DT supreme_JJ body_NN of_IN the_DT Convention_NN ._SENT It_PP currently_RB meets_VVZ once_RB a_DT year_NN to_TO review_VV the_DT Convention_NN 's_POS progress_NN ._SENT The_DT word_NN "_`` conference_NN "_'' is_VBZ not_RB used_VVN here_RB in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN "_`` meeting_NN "_'' but_CC rather_RB of_IN "_`` association_NN "_'' ,_, which_WDT explains_VVZ the_DT seemingly_RB redundant_JJ expression_NN "_'' fourth_JJ session_NN of_IN the_DT Conference_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS "_'' ._SENT 

COP_NN /_SYM MOP_NP -_: The_DT Kyoto_NP Protocol_NP 's_POS supreme_JJ body_NN will_MD be_VB the_DT COP_NP ,_, which_WDT will_MD serve_VV as_IN the_DT Protocol_NP 's_POS meeting_NN of_IN the_DT Parties_NNS ._SENT The_DT sessions_NNS of_IN the_DT COP_NP and_CC the_DT COP_NN /_SYM MOP_NP will_MD be_VB held_VVN during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ._SENT This_DT will_MD improve_VV cost-effectiveness_NN and_CC coordination_NN with_IN the_DT Convention_NN ._SENT 

countries_NNS with_IN economies_NNS in_IN transition_NN (_( EIT_NP )_) -_: Those_DT Central_JJ and_CC East_JJ European_JJ countries_NNS and_CC former_JJ republics_NNS of_IN the_DT Soviet_NP Union_NP that_WDT are_VBP in_IN transition_NN to_TO a_DT market_NN economy_NN ._SENT 

European_NP Union_NP (_( EU_NP )_) -_: As_IN a_DT regional_JJ economic_JJ integration_NN organization_NN ,_, the_DT European_NP Union_NP can_MD be_VB and_CC is_VBZ a_DT Party_NN to_TO the_DT Convention_NN ;_: however_RB ,_, it_PP does_VVZ not_RB have_VH a_DT separate_JJ vote_NN from_IN its_PP$ members_NNS ._SENT The_DT EU_NP can_MD also_RB be_VB a_DT Party_NN to_TO the_DT Protocol_NP ._SENT Because_IN it_PP signed_VVD the_DT Convention_NN when_WRB it_PP was_VBD known_VVN as_IN the_DT EEC_NN ,_, it_PP retains_VVZ this_DT name_NN for_IN all_DT formal_JJ Convention-related_JJ purposes_NNS ._SENT Its_PP$ members_NNS are_VBP Austria_NP ,_, Belgium_NP ,_, Denmark_NP ,_, Finland_NP ,_, France_NP ,_, Germany_NP ,_, Greece_NP ,_, Ireland_NP ,_, Italy_NP ,_, Luxembourg_NP ,_, the_DT Netherlands_NP ,_, Portugal_NP ,_, Spain_NP ,_, Sweden_NP ,_, and_CC the_DT UK_NP ._SENT 

friends_NNS of_IN the_DT chair_NN -_: Delegates_NNS who_WP are_VBP called_VVN upon_RP by_IN the_DT Chair_NN (_( who_WP takes_VVZ into_IN account_NN the_DT need_NN for_IN a_DT political_JJ balance_NN among_IN various_JJ interests_NNS )_) to_TO assist_VV in_IN carrying_VVG out_RP specific_JJ tasks_NNS ._SENT 

Group_NN of_IN 77_CD and_CC China_NP -_: The_DT G-77_JJ was_VBD founded_VVN in_IN 1967_CD under_IN the_DT auspices_NNS of_IN the_DT United_NP Nations_NPS Conference_NP for_IN Trade_NP and_CC Development_NP (_( UNCTAD_NP )_) ._SENT It_PP seeks_VVZ to_TO harmonize_VV the_DT negotiating_VVG positions_NNS of_IN its_PP$ 132_CD developing-country_JJ members_NNS ._SENT 

Global_NP Environment_NP Facility_NP (_( GEF_NP )_) -_: The_DT multi-billion-dollar_NN GEF_NN was_VBD established_VVN by_IN the_DT World_NP Bank_NP ,_, the_DT UN_NP Development_NP Programme_NP ,_, and_CC the_DT UN_NP Environment_NP Programme_NP in_IN 1990._CD It_PP operates_VVZ the_DT Convention_NP 's_POS "_`` financial_JJ mechanism_NN "_'' on_IN an_DT interim_JJ basis_NN and_CC funds_NNS developing_VVG country_NN projects_NNS that_WDT have_VHP global_JJ climate-change_NN benefits_NNS ._SENT 

Intergovernmental_NP Negotiating_NP Committee_NP (_( INC_NP )_) -_: The_DT INC_NP met_VVD during_IN five_CD sessions_NNS between_IN February_NP 1991_CD and_CC May_NP 1992_CD to_TO draft_VV the_DT Convention_NN ;_: it_PP met_VVD six_CD more_JJR times_NNS to_TO prepare_VV for_IN COP-1_NP before_IN completing_VVG its_PP$ work_NN in_IN February_NP 1995._CD 

Intergovernmental_JJ Panel_NN on_IN Climate_NN Change_NP (_( IPCC_NP )_) -_: The_DT IPCC_NP was_VBD established_VVN in_IN 1988_CD by_IN the_DT World_NP Meteorological_NP Organization_NP and_CC the_DT UN_NP Environment_NP Programme_NP ._SENT It_PP conducts_VVZ rigorous_JJ surveys_NNS of_IN the_DT world-wide_JJ technical_JJ and_CC scientific_JJ literature_NN and_CC publishes_VVZ assessment_NN reports_NNS that_WDT are_VBP widely_RB recognized_VVN as_IN the_DT most_RBS credible_JJ existing_JJ sources_NNS of_IN information_NN on_IN climate-change_NN ._SENT The_DT IPCC_NP also_RB works_VVZ on_IN methodologies_NNS and_CC responds_VVZ to_TO specific_JJ requests_NNS from_IN the_DT Convention_NN 's_POS subsidiary_NN bodies_NNS ._SENT

national_JJ delegation_NN -_: One_CD or_CC more_JJR officials_NNS who_WP are_VBP empowered_VVN to_TO represent_VV and_CC negotiate_VV on_IN behalf_NN of_IN their_PP$ government_NN ._SENT 

non-governmental_JJ organizations_NNS (_( NGOs_NP )_) -_: Many_JJ relevant_JJ NGOs_NP attend_VVP the_DT climate_NN talks_NNS as_IN observers_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO interact_VV with_IN delegates_NNS and_CC the_DT press_NN and_CC provide_VV information_NN ._SENT NGOs_NNS must_MD be_VB non-profit_JJ and_CC can_MD include_VV environmental_JJ groups_NNS ,_, research_NN institutions_NNS ,_, business_NN groups_NNS ,_, and_CC associations_NNS of_IN urban_JJ and_CC local_JJ governments_NNS ._SENT
